column1: Li and Zhu 2008 - Generalized Stochastic Workflow net-based quantitative analysis of business process performance.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence in the text

Time performance measure,Generic performance dimension that the paper proposes to quantify in business processes and that motivates the whole study.,“…the quantitative analysis of the time performance measure is pivotal to guarantee the validity of process model and to improve its quality.” (Abstract)
Time performance indices,Indicators that up to now were mainly obtained by simulation
column2: the paper proposes an analytical alternative.,"“…there is still no powerful and convenient quantitative method to compute the time performance indices of business process, which are often obtained by simulation yet [2].” (Introduction)  "

column1: Time constraints,One of the three kinds of dynamic information that have to be analysed in BPA.,"“In general, there are three types of dynamic running process information need to be collected and analyzed, which are the time constraints, the utilization efficiency of the resources and the time performance [2].” (Introduction)  "
Utilization efficiency of the resources,Another of the three classical BPA dimensions mentioned
column2: used to position the paper with regard to related work.,Same sentence as above.

column1: Mean flow time / Average flow time / Mean throughout time (T),Main quantitative indicator computed with the proposed method
column2: equals the expected total sojourn time of a workflow instance.,"“One of the important time performance measures of business process model is its mean flow time T, that is, the mean throughout time of all workflow instances.” (Section III)  "

column1: Throughput time,Alternative name used for the same concept of mean flow time.,"“…to compute the throughput time of workflow.” (Introduction, citing related work)  "

Average token number (N),Variable needed in Little’s Rule to obtain the mean flow time.,"“It can be calculated according to the Little rule [10],  ，where  N  is the average token number of the Petri net system in its stabile state.” (Section III)  "

Mean arrival rate / Mean number of tokens entering the net per unit time (λ or  μ̄ ),Second variable required by Little’s Rule together with  N.,“λ  is the mean number of tokens entering into the net system in every unit time.” (Section III)
Sojourning / Residence time of a marking (mi),Expected time a token spends in a tangible marking
column2: used to obtain the mean flow time.,"“…the mean residence time of Mi is denoted as  mi , then: …” (Equation 1, Section II)  "

column1: Kandil and El-Deeb 2016 - Exploration of application migration to cloud environment.pdf
Metric,How it is used / What it represents in the paper,Evidence excerpt from the text
Total Throughput (bytes),"Amount of data (in bytes) received from the server during the whole test window
column2: compared across on-premise, private and public cloud to evaluate data-transfer capability.","""Total Throughput (bytes): Displays the amount of data received from the server.""  "

column1: Average Throughput (bytes/second),Average rate of data received from the server each second
column2: used to judge sustained bandwidth under load across the three deployment options.,"""Average Throughput (bytes / second): Displays the amount of data received from the server at any given second.""  "

column1: Total Hits,Total number of HTTP/URL requests issued by virtual users during a scenario
column2: used as an overall workload/intensity indicator.,"""Total Hits: Displays the number of requests sent to the server during the load test.""  "

column1: Average Hits per second,Average request rate (hits-per-second)
column2: evaluates how many requests the system can serve continuously.,"""Average Hits per second: Displays the number of requests per second sent to the server during the load test.""  "

column1: Average Transaction Response Time,Mean end-to-end time (in seconds) to complete a business transaction
column2: primary latency metric checked before and after migration.,"""Average Transaction Response Time: Displays the average time to perform transactions during each second of the load test.""  "

column1: CPU used by this session,CPU consumption (in 10-ms units) of a database session during user calls
column2: gauges processing overhead after migration.,"""CPU used by this session: is the amount of CPU time (in 10s of milliseconds) used by a session between when a user call started and ended""  "

column1: DB time,Total elapsed time (in micro-seconds) spent executing database user calls
column2: measures overall database workload.,"""DB time:  is the amount of elapsed time (in microseconds) spent performing Database user-level calls.""  "

column1: Bytes received via SQL*Net from client,Network traffic (bytes) flowing from client to database
column2: helps verify communication cost changes in cloud.,"""Bytes received via SQL*Net from client: is the total number of bytes received from the client over SQL*Net.""  "

column1: Bytes sent via SQL*Net to client,Network traffic (bytes) flowing from database back to client
column2: complements the previous metric for full traffic picture.,"""Bytes sent via SQL*Net to client: is the total number of bytes sent to the client from the foreground processes"""

column1: Venero et al. 2019 - Towards a metamodel for supporting decisions in knowledge-intensive processes.pdf
Metric,Usage_in_Text,Evidence_in_Text

Metric (generic),Conceito geral de medida quantificável usada para acompanhar o cumprimento de objetivos e detectar desvios.,"""A metric is a quantifiable measure used to track and assess the status of an objective... The metrics help the detection of deviations and unexpected process evolution, and give a view of the achieved progress in reaching an objective."""
Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Exemplo de métrica utilizada para avaliar desempenho de objetivos do processo.,"""...such as key performance indicators (KPI) or key risk indicators (KRI)."""
Key Risk Indicator (KRI),Exemplo de métrica utilizada para avaliar riscos associados à execução do processo.,"""...such as key performance indicators (KPI) or key risk indicators (KRI)."""
Body Temperature,Indicador clínico usado para avaliar o estado do paciente
column2: valores fora da faixa disparam regra de desvio.,"""...the data value for the attribute “temperature” inside the item “Vitals Signs” in the Artifact Physical Examination, has a violation of the Data Rule: Normal body temperature rate →36.5◦C – 37.5◦C."""

column1: Vital Signs,"Conjunto de indicadores (temperatura, pressão, etc.) que compõem o status do caso e são monitorados para detectar mudanças.","""Case Status →Vital Signs and Main Complaints"" / ""item “Vitals Signs” in the Artifact Physical Examination"""
Fluid Intake and Output,Métrica clínica de balanço hídrico solicitada para monitorar evolução do paciente por 24 h.,"""...she wants to monitor fluid intake and output during the next 24 hours."""
Panfilov et al. 2021 - Digital Ecosystem-Based KPI-Driven Railway Communication Network Reporting System.pdf
medidor,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Conceito-guarda-chuva para controlar desempenho do sistema de comunicação ferroviária e guiar todo o desenho do reporting,Título: “Digital Ecosystem-Based KPI-Driven Railway Communication Network Reporting System”
KPIs Operacionais,Acompanham desempenho em tempo quase real das operações da rede de comunicação,“...process for operational and analytical KPIs in the Railway Communication Network.”
KPIs Analíticos,Sustentam análises históricas/estratégicas e relatórios agregados,“...process for operational and analytical KPIs in the Railway Communication Network.”

Contagem de Incidentes,Número de incidentes na rede usado como KPI principal para teste do protótipo,"“KPIs data ... included all incidents, occurred in the railway communication network in a week period.”"

Indicadores Compostos,Indicadores derivados a partir de KPIs básicos para comparação com melhores práticas,“The KPI and other indicators can be used for generating composite indicators to be used in performance benchmarking with the best in industry...”

Indicadores Calculados,KPIs gerados por cálculo (métricas derivadas) usados nos relatórios do Data Mart,“It includes calculated indicators for reporting purposes. This layer receives calculations of indicators used in numerous reports.”
Benchmarking de Desempenho,Comparação dos indicadores da empresa com os melhores do setor,“...composite indicators to be used in performance benchmarking with the best in industry...”
Retorno sobre Investimento (ROI),Indicador financeiro para verificar retorno das iniciativas,“...besides verifying the return on investments [16].”
Defasagem Temporal / Time Lag,Mede a rapidez de disponibilização dos dados
column2: menor atraso implica melhor performance,“A delay of even minutes in the decision-making process causes significant financial losses for the company...”

column1: Alta Disponibilidade,Indicador de disponibilidade contínua do Data Lake e do ecossistema,[5] referência citada no texto: “Ensure High Availability of Data Lake”
Confiabilidade,Indicador de confiabilidade da rede ferroviária,[4] referência citada no texto: “Reliability Optimization of a Railway Network.”
Risco e Resiliência,Indicadores que avaliam capacidade da rede de resistir e recuperar-se de falhas,[8] referência citada no texto: “A Risk and Resilience Assessment Approach for Railway Networks”
Escalabilidade Horizontal,Mede capacidade de crescer adicionando nós ao sistema,“...scalable design for the ecosystem.”
Tolerância a Falhas,Indicador de capacidade do sistema continuar operando após falhas de nós,"“The solution provides a robust, fault-tolerant, reliable, and scalable design for the ecosystem.”"
Velásquez et al. 2024 - A Systematic Literature Review of the Analysis of Costs and Other Dimensions in Process Mining and Related Disciplines.pdf
Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência no texto
Cost,"Dimensão principal de desempenho
column2: base para diversos métodos de análise, visualização, estimativa e previsão.","“Three main dimensions can be identified: time, cost, and quality.”  "

column1: Time,Dimensão principal de desempenho
column2: frequentemente analisada em conjunto com custos e recursos.,"“Three main dimensions can be identified: time, cost, and quality.”  "

column1: Quality,"Dimensão de desempenho utilizada, por exemplo, no Devil’s Quadrangle, e em estudos de Trade-off com custos.","“Three main dimensions can be identified: time, cost, and quality.”  "

Flexibility,"Dimensão de desempenho considerada em conjunto com custo, tempo e qualidade no Devil’s Quadrangle.","“The devil’s quadrangle (DQ) depicts the process performance according to four dimensions: time, cost, quality and flexibility [76].”  "
Resource utilization,Indicador ligado à dimensão ‘resources’
column2: mede uso de recursos e pode ser relacionado a custos.,“TD-ABC is a costing strategy that calculates costs by estimating the cost of every resource and their utilization time during each activity of a process [16].”

column1: Efficiency,Dimensão/indicador incomum citado em conjunto com custos e tempo.,"“One of the uncommon dimensions is efficiency, which was utilized jointly with cost and time dimensions [80].”  "

Productivity,Dimensão/indicador incomum citado em conjunto com custos e qualidade.,"“The second uncommon dimension included in the literature is productivity, which was used in conjunction with the cost and quality dimensions [81].”  "
Sum of costs,Métrica derivada usada para visualizar custos agregados por atividade ou processo.,"“showing metrics, such as the sum … costs, per activity.”  "
Average cost,Métrica derivada usada para comparar desempenho médio de atividades ou processos.,"“showing metrics, such as the … average … costs, per activity.”  "
Minimum cost,Métrica derivada usada para identificar execução mais barata de uma atividade.,"“showing metrics, such as the … min … costs, per activity.”  "
Maximum cost,Métrica derivada usada para identificar execução mais cara de uma atividade.,"“showing metrics, such as the … max costs, per activity.”  "
Aggregated cost,Valor total de custos acumulados exibido em modelos de processo.,“visualization of either aggregated … costs in a process model”
Remaining cost,Valor de custos ainda não incorridos (custos a realizar) exibido em modelos.,“visualization of either … remaining costs in a process model”
Cost estimation,Previsão de custos futuros a partir de logs ou modelos.,“cost reporting and cost prediction”
Cost-benefit,Indicador que relaciona custo e benefício para apoiar decisões de melhoria.,“a reference process model to obtain the cost-benefit of an improvement process is built [33]”
column2: “a cost-benefit analysis strategy … [54].”

column1: Cost of Quality (CoQ),"Métrica que quantifica custos associados à qualidade (falhas, prevenção, etc.).",“Cost of quality tradeoffs in manufacturing process … [68].”
Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE),"Indicador de desempenho de equipamentos que combina disponibilidade, desempenho e qualidade
column2: usado em estudos de melhoria de processos.",“New approach towards formulation of the overall equipment effectiveness [55].”

column1: Coefficient of Variation (CV),Indicador estatístico usado em controle de processo para monitorar variação relativa.,“side sensitive synthetic coefficient of variation chart [41].”
Love and Holt 2000 - Construction business performance measurement - The SPM alternative.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto (entre aspas)

Eficiência,Exemplo de indicador financeiro ‘tradicional’ focado em resultados de curto-prazo.,"“traditional (bottom-line) performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”"

Return on Capital Employed (ROCE),Indicador financeiro citado como métrica usada de forma ‘míope’.,"“traditional (bottom-line) performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”"

Lucratividade / Profit,"Outro indicador financeiro tradicional, orientado ao ‘bottom-line’.","“traditional (bottom-line) performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”"
Liquidez,Parte do conjunto de índices contábeis usados de forma restrita.,"“Tends to focus on monetary aspects (e.g. productivity, output, efficiency, profit, liquidity, asset structure).”"
Estrutura de ativos (Asset structure),Elemento avaliado em análises financeiras convencionais.,"“...profit, liquidity, asset structure).”"

Produtividade,Citada tanto como métrica financeira tradicional quanto como determinante de sucesso competitivo.,"“productivity, output, efficiency…” / “determinants of competitive success, embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation…”"
Output,Medida de volume físico/financeiro usada de forma limitada nos sistemas tradicionais.,"“monetary aspects (e.g. productivity, output, efficiency, profit, liquidity, asset structure).”"
Custo real por unidade (Real unit cost),Indicador de resultado estratégico para medir competitividade.,"“financial performance, and real unit cost.”"
Captura de mercado (Market capture),Mede extensão de mercado atingido
column2: indicador de resultado.,"“extent of targeted market capture, financial performance, and real unit cost.”"

column1: Custo da não-qualidade (Costs of poor quality),Usado para evidenciar perdas e justificar ações de melhoria.,“give an indication of the costs of poor quality
Rework (métrica de retrabalho),Exemplo de indicador operacional rastreado para benchmarking.,“the propagation of rework benchmark metrics for construction”
Satisfação do cliente,Dimensão ‘intangible/soft’ recomendada para medir desempenho e fidelização.,"“customer satisfaction (Berry et al., 1994)” / “…relations with customers… all being critical…”"
Satisfação do empregado,Indicador humano essencial num sistema de performance abrangente.,"“employee satisfaction (House and Price, 1991)” / “…relations with employees…”"
Sucesso do negócio (Business success),Medida ampla de performance estratégica.,"“business success (Chakravarthy, 1988).”"
Qualidade,Determinante de sucesso competitivo a ser medido continuamente.,"“determinants of competitive success, embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation…”"
Flexibilidade,Outro determinante de sucesso competitivo citado como métrica necessária.,Idem acima.
Inovação,Determinante de competitividade a ser mensurado no SPM.,Idem acima.
Contribuição social,Indicador ético/ambiental sugerido no SPM.,"“…determinants of competitive success, embracing … social contribution.”"
Balanced Scorecard,Framework que combina indicadores financeiros e ‘business drivers’.,"“the balanced scorecard (Kaplan and Norton, 1996)
Performance Measurement Matrix,Estrutura proposta na literatura para integrar métricas múltiplas.,"“the performance measurement matrix (Keegan et al., 1989)
Performance Pyramid,Outra estrutura de medição multidimensional citada como alternativa.,"“the performance pyramid (Lynch and Cross, 1991)
Prêmio Malcolm Baldrige,Modelo de avaliação que enfatiza satisfação do cliente e resultados de negócio.,"“‘Baldrige’ Award (Anon, 1999).”"
Benchmarking (comparative measures),Processo de coletar métricas de referência para comparação externa.,“extract comparative measures through benchmarking

Monitoramento de progresso,Método prático usado por organizações de construção para medir avanço de obra.,"“Construction organizations use a variety of methods to measure their performance. For example, progress monitoring is commonplace.”"

Tabelas de ranking (‘league tables’),"Comparação pública baseada em faturamento, nº de empregados, lucros, etc.","“refer to league tables … to contrast such characteristics as turnover, number of employees, pre- and post-tax profits, and overall ranking in the industry.”"
Faturamento (Turnover),Indicador utilizado em ‘league tables’ para posicionar empresas.,Idem acima.
Número de empregados,Outro indicador de ranking setorial.,Idem acima.
Lucro antes de impostos (Pre-tax profit),Métrica financeira usada nas tabelas de classificação.,Idem acima.
Lucro após impostos (Post-tax profit),Métrica financeira usada nas tabelas de classificação.,Idem acima.
Ranking geral,"Posição comparativa da empresa no setor, usada como indicador de performance.",Idem acima.
Pesquisa de clientes / empregados,Ferramenta longitudinal para rastrear satisfação no SPM.,“e.g. client and employee surveys”
Capacidade competitiva,Medida sistêmica que reflete a aptidão da empresa perante o mercado.,"“measures of competitive ability, productivity and quality.”"
Kaschek et al. 2007 - An e-Process selection model.pdf
Medidor,Domínio/Tipo,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho textual resumido)
Mental Rotation Task (adapt. Jansen & Kellner, 2015),Habilidade espacial – rotação mental,Medir a capacidade de girar representações 2-D/3-D
column2: preditor específico de desempenho matemático,“This task measures the ability to rotate mental representations… Results revealed… mental rotation predicted mathematical performance.”

column2: analisa e sintetiza estímulos espaciais

column1: MABC-2 – Movement Assessment Battery for Children-2 (global),Habilidade motora geral,Bateria para identificar coordenação motora fina e grossa,"“This battery aims to identify the movement ability of children… Manual Dexterity, Aiming and Catching, and Balance.”"

Manual Dexterity (fator MABC-2),Motricidade fina,Preditor positivo de desempenho matemático,"“After controlling for the block design, mental rotation and manual dexterity predicted mathematical performance.”"

Throwing a Beanbag,Subteste Aiming & Catching,Arremessar saquinho em alvo,Descrito nos itens do MABC-2 (idade 4-6).

column2: não acrescentou poder explicativo no modelo,"Itens descritos: “One Leg Stand, Walking with Heels Up…”"

Visual Motor Integration – Beery VMI,Integração visuo-motora,"Usada para prever desempenho matemático em Mix et al., 2016",“Visual motor integration… assessed following Beery & Beery's design (2010).”

Map Reading (Liben & Downs),Habilidade espacial – escalonamento,Ligada ao desempenho matemático em estudo revisado,“Map reading… was assessed by measuring the ability to map differently sized representations…”

Perspective Taking (Frick et al.),Rotação espacial egocêntrica,Associada à matemática em estudos longitudinais,“Perspective taking… ability to visualize objects from the vantage point of an imaginary observer…”

Raven's Matrices,Inteligência fluida não-verbal,"Incluído como medida de habilidade espacial em Hawes et al., 2019",“Spatial abilities… 2D mental rotation and raven's matrices… predicted math achievement.”
Mental Number Line Representation,Representação numérica,"Mediador entre rotação e cálculo em Gunderson et al., 2012

Motor Coordination tasks (balance, jumping laterally, shifting platform),Motricidade grossa,"Baixa coordenação ligada a menor desempenho acadêmico (Lopes et al., 2013)","“Children… with low scores in motor coordination (such as balance, jumping laterally, or shifting platform) have a lower probability of obtaining academic achievement…”"
Wetzstein et al. 2010 - Cross-organizational process monitoring based on service choreographies.pdf
PerformanceMetric,UsageInText,Evidence (exact fragment of the paper)

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Generic performance measure used by BAM to evaluate business processes,"""...business activity monitoring (BAM) technology enables continuous, near real-time event-based monitoring of business processes based on key business metrics, also known as key performance indicators (KPI) [11]."""
Key business metric,Generic term for quantitative performance measures monitored by BAM,Same sentence as above – immediately before “also known as key performance indicators (KPI)”

Process metric,Generic term for performance measures derived from events in a process or choreography,"""...we distinguish between resource events and complex events for calculation of process metrics using complex event processing technology."" "

Order fulfilment lead time,Concrete metric suggested for the purchase-order scenario: time between Receive PO in the Reseller and completion of the Customer’s While loop,"""Consider, for example, the metric order fulfilment lead time which could be measured in our scenario from the start of the activity Receive PO in the reseller process until the While Loop completes in the customer process."" "

Order processing duration,Concrete metric: time between Receive PO and Receive Shipment Acknowledgment,"""Consider, for example, the calculation of the order processing duration between the activity Receive PO and Receive Shipment Acknowledgment in our scenario."" "

CustomerAOrderFulfillmentTime,Derived/complex event that carries the value of the order-fulfilment metric for a given customer,"""...we define a complex event CustomerAOrderFulfillmentTime which contains the corresponding metric value in the attribute metricValue..."" "
metricValue (attribute),Data field inside complex events that stores a computed performance value,Same fragment as above – “…contains the corresponding metric value in the attribute metricValue…”

Service-level parameter (SLP),Generic performance measure that can be specified from complex events for SLA purposes,"""One could for example specify service level parameters and service level objectives based on complex events which contain corresponding metric values."" "
Service-level objective (SLO),Target value or threshold for a service-level parameter
column2: can be defined using complex events,Same sentence as above – “…service level parameters and service level objectives…”

column1: Availability,Concrete QoS metric cited as typical SLA target between consumer and provider,"""…agree on certain service QoS, typically technical characteristics such as availability and response time [6]."" "
Response time,Concrete QoS metric cited as typical SLA target between consumer and provider,"Same sentence as above – “…such as availability and response time [6]."""
Khan et al. 2023 - Semantic Representation of Key Performance Indicators Categories for Prioritization.pdf
KPI,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
customer satisfaction,Exemplo de métrica crítica que pode ser monitorada pela organização,"“could include metrics such as customer satisfaction, employee engagement, and financial performance.”"
employee engagement,Exemplo de métrica crítica que pode ser monitorada,"“could include metrics such as customer satisfaction, employee engagement, and financial performance.”"
financial performance,Exemplo de métrica crítica que pode ser monitorada,"“could include metrics such as customer satisfaction, employee engagement, and financial performance.”"
sell price,Ilustra dependência direta de outro KPI (product cost),"“For example, the sell price is directly related to the product cost.”"
product cost,KPI que influencia diretamente o sell price,"“For example, the sell price is directly related to the product cost.”"
production target,Exemplo de indicador de curto-prazo,"“Short term indicators … e.g., production target for tomorrow”"
product quality,Exemplo de indicador de longo-prazo,"“Long term indicators … e.g., product quality”"
delivery time,Usado como exemplo de indicador quantitativo e dependente,"“the delivery time depends on the employ efficiency”  /  “e.g., delivery time”"
production cost per unit,Exemplo de KPI de custo,"“these indicators allow you to evaluate … e.g., production cost per unit”"
minimum delivery time,Exemplo de KPI de tempo,"“Time indicators … e.g., minimum delivery time”"
percentage downtime,Exemplo de KPI de produtividade,"“Productivity indicator … e.g., percentage downtime”"
number of errors occurred,Exemplo de KPI de qualidade,"“Quality indicators … e.g., the number of errors occurred”"
annual growth,Exemplo de KPI de alto nível,"“High level indicators … e.g., annual growth”"
investment,Exemplo de KPI independente,"“Independent indicators … e.g., investment”"
employee efficiency,Exemplo de variável da qual outros KPIs dependem,“the delivery time depends on the employ efficiency”
machine efficiency,Exemplo de métrica acompanhada em tempo real para avaliar desempenho,“assess worker and machine efficiency”
employee progress,Exemplo de KPI de baixo nível,"“Low-level indicators … e.g., employee progress”"

metric,how_it_is_used,evidence

Recall,Quality metric in Process Discovery used (with precision & generalization) to balance model accuracy,"“PD algorithms should deliver high-quality and comprehensible models … while balancing three main metrics: recall, precision, and generalization [10,13].”"
Precision,1) Quality metric in Process Discovery
column2: 2) Quality metric in Conformance Checking to monitor correct behaviour,"“…balancing three main metrics: recall, precision, and generalization …”
column3: “– Precision is responsible for monitoring and assessing a correct and related event logging behavior in the discovery process …”"

column1: Generalization,Quality metric in both Process Discovery and Conformance Checking to avoid over-/under-fitting and accept new similar events,"“…balancing three main metrics: recall, precision, and generalization …”
column2: “– Generalization provides the ability to find the main features … and accept new similar events (e.g., avoiding overfitting concept).”"

column1: Fitness,Conformance metric that measures how much the model can reproduce the recorded behaviour,"“– Fitness aims to look at the discovered model’s event log behavior … (usually, a value of 0 means the absence of capacity … while a value of 1 means perfect fitness).”"
Simplicity,Conformance metric that expresses the desire for the simplest adequate model,“– Simplicity is the ability to provide a model as simple as possible.”

Medidor de Performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual (trecho entre aspas)
KPI (Key Performance Indicators),Servem para tornar um processo de negócio (BP) mensurável
column2: a ausência de KPIs indica que as atividades não podem ser consideradas um BP único.,"“First, these are measurable targets (KPI). The lack of generated key performance indicators indicates that these activities are not interrelated and cannot be combined into one BP.”"

column1: Profit (Lucro),Compõe o conjunto de critérios para caracterizar o resultado final de um BP.,"“The system of criteria must be formed to characterize the final result of the BP (profit, revenue, EBITDA (profit before interest on loans, income tax, and depreciation), costs, project timing, etc.).”"
Revenue (Receita),Integra o conjunto de critérios de resultado final de um BP.,Idem à citação anterior.
EBITDA,Indicador financeiro incluído nos critérios de desempenho do BP.,Idem à citação anterior.
Costs (Custos),Parte do conjunto de indicadores de desempenho avaliados em um BP.,Idem à citação anterior.
Project timing (Prazo de projeto),Usado como indicador para avaliar o sucesso do BP e monitorar cronogramas.,Idem à citação anterior.

Added value (Valor agregado),"Indicador de criação de valor pelo BP, tanto direta (operacional) quanto indiretamente.","“Second, this is a specific added value. BPs create a basis for the owner of the enterprise to make a profit.”"
System performance (Desempenho do sistema),Mede ganho de desempenho após adoção da plataforma SAP S/4HANA.,“The technology platform increased system performance and increased the speed of processes.”
Speed of processes (Velocidade dos processos),Indicador de eficiência operacional após modernização de plataforma digital.,Idem à citação anterior.
Consumption coefficient (Coeficiente de consumo),Medido para avaliar eficiência de uso de material
column2: reduzido com o sistema QMET.,“reduction of consumption coefficient by eliminating unnecessary movement of metal …”

column1: Warehouse capacity (Capacidade do armazém),Usado para avaliar eficiência logística
column2: aumentou após implantação do QMET.,"“in general, warehouse capacity and turnover increased.”"

column1: Turnover (Giro de estoque),Outro indicador logístico mencionado como melhorado pelo QMET.,Idem à citação anterior.

RTO – Recovery Time Objective,Indicador de tempo de recuperação usado em BIA para mensurar exigências de retomada de processos.,“Subjective assessments of RTO (recovery time) requirements are possible—either too optimistic or too pessimistic.”

Risk measure R (expectation of damage/income),Mede quantitativamente o risco como valor esperado de dano ou ganho.,“The mathematical expectation of the corresponding damage (or expected income in speculative risk models) is taken as the risk measure R.”

Weighting correction coefficient Wi,"Fator de ajuste que pondera duração e importância do risco, derivando medida de performance do risco.",“We propose a weighting correction factor (Wi)… which allows us to take into account the duration and importance of identified risk factors…”

Delivery Speed,Factor investigated for its impact on customer satisfaction,“Handfield and Pannesi (1992) examine the impact of delivery speed and reliability on customer satisfaction…”
Delivery Reliability (DR),Core KPI for meeting promised dates
column2: repeatedly contrasted with other indicators,“…Delivery Reliability (DR) … is the capability to deliver goods on or before the promised scheduled due date.”

column1: Delivery Dependability,Alternative term for DR emphasising keeping promises,“Leong et al. (1994) … delivery dependability refers to the ability of a company to meet delivery schedules or promises.”
Perceived Relative Reliability,Method suggested by White (1996) to quantify DR,"“He presents several methods for measuring DR, such as perceived relative reliability…”  "
Percentage of On-Time Deliveries,Simple ratio-based DR metric (White 1996),“…or the percentage of on-time deliveries.”

Perfect Order Fulfilment (7 R’s),SCOR reliability KPI checking all ‘right’ conditions,"“The Supply Chain Operation Reference (SCOR) model provides KPIs for reliability measures such as Perfect order fulfillment, only considering the delivery as per 7 R's principle…”  "

On-Time Delivery,Traditional customer-service KPI listed among others,"“…performance measurement metrics like on-time delivery, delivery at request date, delivery to commit date, and order fill lead time serve as KPIs for the customer service levels (Stewart 1995
column2: Gunasekaran et al. 2004).”  "

column1: Delivery at Request Date,Customer-facing punctuality KPI,(same quotation as above)
Delivery to Commit Date,Measures adherence to supplier commitment,(same quotation as above)
Order Fill Lead Time,Speed metric from order entry to fulfilment,(same quotation as above)

Alpha Service Level,Probability all demand is met immediately from stock,“Alpha measures the likelihood of fulfilling all customer orders from available stock within a set time frame (Tempelmeier 2000).”
Beta Service Level,Proportion of total demand filled immediately,“Beta measures the percentage of total demand promptly fulfilled from available stock.”
Gamma Service Level,Service level combining backorders and waiting time,“Gamma considers the number of backorders and the waiting times for those backordered demands…”
Supplier DR at Order,One of Forslund & Mattsson’s four DR categories,“…They classify DR into four categories: Supplier DR at Order…”
Supplier DR after Order Confirmation,Second Forslund & Mattsson category,"(same quotation, continues) “Supplier DR after order confirmation…”  "
Supplier DR vs Confirmed Delivery Date,Third Forslund & Mattsson category,(same quotation) “Supplier DR vs. confirmed delivery date…”
Supplier DR at Delivery vs Wished Delivery Date,Fourth Forslund & Mattsson category,(same quotation) “…and Supplier DR at delivery vs. wished delivery date.”

Commitment Quality (CQ),New overarching metric proposed by the authors to measure delivery promises,"“Therefore, this paper introduces the term Commitment Measurement (CQ) and develops a CQ matrix that can be used to measure the quality of delivery commitments.”  "
First Commit Date (FCD) Adherence,Sub-metric within CQ referencing earliest promise,“The FCD is the first date committed to the customer.”
Last Commit Date (LCD) Adherence,Sub-metric within CQ referencing latest promise,“The LCD is the most recent date committed…”
Best Commit Date (BCD) Adherence,Sub-metric within CQ referencing earliest among changes,“…the BCD is the earliest date among the committed dates…”
Available-to-Promise (ATP),Key order-management metric enabling high-level commitment accuracy,“…the Available to Promise is vital for a high-level order management system.”

column1: Draheim 2011 - On the Design of IT Key Performance Indicators.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),"Apresentados como medidas formais, utilizadas para monitorar o desempenho dos processos e alimentar o ciclo PDCA.",“∙Key performance indicators. The key performance indicators are measurable ﬁgures about deﬁned business processes.”

Steering parameters,Acordos de meta mensuráveis que compõem a interface de controle entre função de steering e execução de processos.,"“The steering parameters are target agreements between stakeholders… A steering parameter is a well-defined, measurable figure of a defined business process.”  "

Informal performance reports,Relatórios não estruturados que complementam KPIs na avaliação de desempenho.,“∙Informal performance reports. The performance reports are further information about the performance of the enterprise that cannot be defined as measurable figures…”

Total Cost of Ownership (TCO),"Indicador financeiro usado para estimar todos os custos (hardware, software, rollout, operação) de um ativo de TI num horizonte de vida útil.","“If information system products have to be selected, eventually, total cost of ownership (TCO) must be addressed.”  "

Direct costs,Componente do TCO constituído de despesas orçamentadas e mensuráveis.,"“Formally, e.g., by the Gartner Group, there is a distinction between so-called direct and indirect costs. Direct costs are budgeted expenses…”  "
Indirect costs,Outro componente do TCO
column2: despesas não-orçamentadas normalmente ligadas a riscos ou custos ocultos.,“Indirect costs are unbudgeted expenses. They can stem from technological risks or from expenses hidden in overlooked cost units…”

column1: Probabilistic costs,"Custos incertos (ex.: falhas, ameaças de segurança) que devem ser estimados e tratados separadamente no modelo proposto.",“All probabilistic costs – usually indirect costs of uncertain malfunction events – are considered separately from the total cost of ownership.”

Return on Investment (ROI),"Razão entre lucro esperado e capital investido, utilizada para avaliar benefícios financeiros de iniciativas de TI.","“Return on investment (ROI) is the widely used term in profit/loss calculations. Formally, it is the ratio of expected profit to needed capital.”  "

Total Economic Impact (TEI),"Método (Forrester) que agrega TCO, valor de negócio e opções criadas para mensurar benefícios de TI.",“An example of an approach that addresses the real beneﬁts of an IT investment is Forrester Research’s Total Economic Impact (TEI) method…”

Profit,Elemento de benefício usado em cálculos de ROI e na parte ‘Total Benefit of Ownership’.,"“…which considers total costs of ownership, the business value and the options that are created by IT in evaluating it.” (contexto de lucro e valor de negócio)  "

Cost savings,"Benefício mensurável resultante de otimizações de processos ou de TI, compondo o retorno direto.","“Cost savings and profit together make up a kind of direct, absolute return on investment…”  "

Quality of Service (QoS),"Indicador qualitativo agrupador de confiabilidade, desempenho etc., mostrado no modelo de ‘Total Impact’.",Figura 3: “Quality of Service” listado como elemento no diagrama de Total Impact of IT Ownership.

Availability,"Requisito de desempenho que afeta custos (p. ex., custos de downtime) e compõe a análise de impacto.","“For example, with respect to availability you have to estimate the costs of system downtime…”  "

Scalability,Critério de desempenho considerado na seleção de produtos e na análise de impacto total.,"“Several objectives must be met to make a successful and stable system: performance, scalability, availability, security, maintainability.”  "

Performance,"Meta geral (tempo de resposta, throughput) citada como objetivo técnico fundamental.","idem: “Several objectives must be met to make a successful and stable system: performance, scalability…”  "

Security,Objetivo técnico cujo risco (invasões) gera custos probabilísticos incluídos na avaliação.,“…with respect to security you have to estimate the costs of the case that somebody infringes your system.”
Maintainability,Objetivo técnico listado entre os critérios para estabilidade e custo de sistemas.,"“…performance, scalability, availability, security, maintainability.”  "
System downtime costs,Exemplo concreto de custo indireto/probabilístico decorrente de baixa disponibilidade.,“you have to estimate the costs of system downtime”
Time savings,"Benefício implícito em otimizações de processos, associado a cost savings.","“Often, the impacts are directly measurable in terms of cost savings or time savings.”  "

Deviation of costs,Medida estatística sugerida como resultado ideal da análise de TCO considerando incerteza.,"“ideally, the outcome of the total cost of ownership analysis is actually deviation of costs.”"

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Indicador‐chave de performance citado como base para monitoramento e avaliação do negócio em vários pontos do processo de BI.,“…express them as target values of various KPIs.”
Valores-alvo de KPI,Metas numéricas que representam o resultado desejado para cada KPI e que serão comparadas com os resultados reais.,“…target values of various KPIs.”
Valores projetados de KPI,Projeções (forecast) usadas para acompanhar o progresso esperado e gerar alertas quando houver divergência.,“…projected KPI values…”
Valores estimados de KPI,Estimativas agregadas na camada Projection para representar o estado futuro do negócio.,“It is comprised of estimated values of various KPIs…”
Valores reais de KPI (cálculo periódico),Cálculo periódico dos KPIs para comparar com valores projetados ou-alvo.,"“…periodic computation of relevant KPIs, comparison with the projected values…”  "

Valores de confiança (confidence values) dos KPIs,Métrica de probabilidade/certeza associada à possibilidade de alcançar as metas de KPI.,“There are also confidence values associated with the KPIs those signify the possibility of achieving the target values…”
Impacto desejado,Medida de desempenho que representa o resultado pretendido de uma decisão ou ação.,“What was the desired outcome/impact?”
Impacto estimado,Previsão do efeito de uma ação
column2: registrado como parte da experiência organizacional.,“The estimated impact of implementing the actions.”

column1: Impacto real,Métrica capturada posteriormente para avaliar a efetividade da decisão tomada.,“The actual impact of the decisions as captured later.”

Orçamento (Budget),"Medidor financeiro incluído no repositório de dados de referência, usado como contexto de desempenho.","“…master data, policy, business rules, budget etc. form the data repository.”"

Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência (trecho do artigo)
Weighted sum of agents’ contributions,Indicador direto da qualidade do processo
column2: soma ponderada dos atributos dos agentes pelos pesos das tarefas,“the weighted sum of agents’ contributions to tasks constitute an indicator of the quality of a business process”

column1: vil  (valor acrescentado por agente na tarefa),Mede o desempenho de um agente em uma tarefa individual
column2: base para métricas agregadas,“vil is the value added by agent i to task l” (Eq. 1 e 2)

column1: V  (matriz de valores acrescentados),Agrega todos os vil
column2: usada nos algoritmos de otimização,“the value-added matrix V=[vil]m×s”

column1: v'_{il}  (valor acrescentado ajustado),vil multiplicado por xl e ql (ou por E[xl])
column2: métrica usada pelo Algoritmo Húngaro para buscar a melhor atribuição,“Equation (4) can be rewritten … where v'_{il}=xl ql vil”

column1: u(Z)  (valor total acrescentado / ganho),Função-objetivo a ser maximizada
column2: soma dos valores acrescentados a todas as tarefas segundo a atribuição Z,"“we define the total value added by agents to a process, denoted by u(Z)”"

column1: E[u]  (valor esperado de u),Métrica de desempenho esperada em processos estocásticos (Markovianos ou simulados),“the expected value of the objective function is calculated by” Eq. (7)
Gain (u(Z), max gain, min gain),Medida prática usada nas simulações para comparar diferentes atribuições,“The gain is calculated for the current assignments … line 21” e “max gain←0”
Cost of task  (cost_il),Custo de executar a tarefa l pelo agente i
column2: minimizado no Algoritmo Húngaro,“C=[cost_il] … represents the cost of assigning task l to agent i”

column1: Cost intervals,"Medidor monetário: intervalo [custo mínimo, custo máximo] por tarefa","“cost intervals, in which the cost of a task is expressed by its lower and upper limits”"

Average cost,Custo médio de uma tarefa ponderado pela probabilidade de caminhos alternativos,"“average cost in which, an average cost is assigned to each task together with the probability of alternative paths”"
Overall cost,Soma dos custos de todas as tarefas
column2: desempenho financeiro global do processo,“costs are aggregated in an additive manner to the overall cost of the entire process”

column1: Minimum cost assignment,Resultado de desempenho que minimiza o custo total
column2: também usado indiretamente para maximizar ganho quando se converte custos em valores,“finds a minimum cost assignment of the tasks to the agents”

column1: Execution time,Desempenho empírico dos algoritmos (tempo de execução em segundos),“Execution time for the largest problem size with 96 tasks … is under 100 seconds.”
Run-time complexity,Desempenho teórico dos algoritmos
column2: número de operações em função do tamanho do problema,"“The complexity of the algorithm is O((τc+τnc)!τ4nc/τnc!), where …”"

column1: Number of feasible solutions,Indicador do tamanho do espaço de busca
column2: usado para avaliar a dificuldade do problema,“number of feasible solutions for each size is also given” (Table I)

Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Overall Job Performance,Usado como critério global para avaliar a relação entre traços de personalidade e resultados no trabalho.,"""Emotional stability was also found to be a generalizable predictor when overall work performance was the criterion...""  "

Task Performance,Componente específico de desempenho citado na literatura sobre correlação com personalidade.,"""...the job performance is described by the task performance and creativity which are not standardized.""  "
Creativity,Indicador adicional incluído nos estudos de desempenho junto com task performance.,"""...job performance is described by the task performance and creativity...""  "
Leadership,Resultado de desempenho fortemente associado ao traço Extroversão.,"""...it has been one of the most consistent personality predictors of leadership (Blickle et al., 2015).""  "
Productivity,Objetivo a ser aumentado na análise e redesign de processos.,"""...studying ways to make improvements to one or many steps to increase productivity...""  "
Cost Reduction,Meta de desempenho considerada na avaliação de processos.,"""...make improvements to one or many steps to ... reduce costs...""  "
Time Management,Indicador de melhoria esperado em processos analisados.,"""...make improvements to one or many steps to ... improve time management...""  "
Efficiency / Work Efficiency,Medida de quão bem as tarefas são executadas
column2: usada na correlação traço-tarefa e no cálculo do fit.,"""...performing more efficiently when working according to a schedule or project plan...""  "

column1: Job Satisfaction,Resultado ligado ao grau de congruência entre personalidade e ambiente ocupacional.,"""An employee’s satisfaction with a job, as well as effectiveness, depend[s] on the degree to which the individual‘s personality matches his or her occupational environment.""  "

Counterproductive Behaviors,Indicador negativo de performance relacionado a traços como antagonismo ou (inversamente) conscienciosidade.,"""...antagonism is associated with counterproductive behaviors...""  "

Organizational Citizenship Behaviors,Indicador positivo de performance vinculado a traços como conscienciosidade e amabilidade.,"""Conscientiousness, on the other hand, is associated with counterproductive behaviors (negatively) and organizational behaviors (positively).""  "

Quality Measure (Process Quality),Personalidade-cargo é tratada como medida de qualidade do processo.,"""Taking into consideration personality-process role fit, as a process of the quality measure.""  "

Fit Function (Degree of Matching),Métrica proposta pelo framework para quantificar o quanto um perfil atende aos requisitos de uma função no processo.,"""...fit function (FF) gives the value of the degree of matching the profile P to the role R..."""

Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência extraída do texto

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Mede a efetividade do processo e serve de base para avaliação de desempenho em várias fases do ciclo BPM,“determining KPIs and Targets: identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and targets that will be measured to evaluate the effectiveness of the process.”

Targets (metas),Valores-meta associados aos KPIs que serão comparados aos resultados reais,"“determining KPIs and Targets…”, “setting new KPIs and targets that reflect the desired improvement in performance.”"

Performance Indicator (PI),Indicadores que integram o Performance Measurement System (PMS) para quantificar o grau de sucesso dos objetivos,“It consists of a set of performance indicators (PI) that indicate the degree of success with which the objectives have been achieved.”

Quality,Dimensão usada para avaliar a qualidade de tarefas/processos dentro do sistema de medição de desempenho,"“Among the most important dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”"
Time,Dimensão empregada para medir duração/tempo de execução dos processos,"“Among the most important dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”"
Cost,Dimensão de avaliação de custos envolvidos nos processos,"“Among the most important dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”"
Flexibility,Dimensão que indica a capacidade do processo de adaptar-se a mudanças,"“Among the most important dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”"
Efficiency,Resultado esperado após otimização
column2: usada como critério de melhoria e decisão baseada em dados,“Increased efficiency includes optimizing business processes… leading to more optimized and successful decision making that is based on data and analytics.”

column1: Degree of infrastructure integration,Mede o nível de integração da infraestrutura nas diferentes estratégias de Big Data,“Fig. 4. Degree of infrastructure integration of the four presented Big Data strategies.”
Volume,Característica/medida do tamanho dos dados
column2: impacta capacidade de armazenar e processar,“Volume - The main characteristic of big data is its enormous size.”

column1: Velocity,Mede a rapidez de geração/necessidade de processamento dos dados,"“Velocity - Nowadays, information is often created in or near real time. This also requires that the data be processed… at the same speed.”"
Variety,Indica a diversidade de formatos/fontes dos dados,“Variety - Big data is varied in nature. They come from multiple sources and can be in different formats.”
Veracity,Avalia confiabilidade/qualidade dos dados,“Veracity - Big data is not always good quality… High data reliability is essential to the success of many companies and organizations.”
Value,Mede o benefício/retorno gerado pelos dados após análise,“Value - Big data is only valuable if it is useful for business. The goal is to turn vast amounts of data into meaningful information…”

Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (trechos do texto original)
rms size (root-mean-square size),Medida primária extraída das simulações para caracterizar o tamanho do pulso de radiação no campo próximo e longe
column2: usada como entrada para o ajuste da equação do modo Gauss-Hermite.,“The easiest quantities to extract from the results of FEL simulations are the rms sizes of the radiation pulse in the near and far field.”

column1: Divergence,"Utilizada, junto com o tamanho do feixe, para dimensionar aperturas, alvos e a linha de transporte óptico.",“In particular the divergence and beam size determine the design of apertures and target sizes.”
Rayleigh length  (zr),Parâmetro fundamental do modo Gauss-Hermite que descreve a divergência
column2: extraído para cada ‘spike’ e usado como medidor efetivo de abertura angular.,“Each spike is analyzed and the effective source position and Rayleigh length are extracted.”

column1: Waist size  (w0),Parâmetro da Eq.(1)
column2: indica o diâmetro mínimo do feixe e entra no cálculo da divergência.,"“Although Eq. 1 has three unknown parameter – the waist size w0, the waist position z0 and Rayleigh length zr – the system is fully deterministic …”"

column1: Waist position  (z0) / effective source position,Posição longitudinal do ponto-fonte
column2: distribuída estatisticamente para caracterizar onde o feixe ‘nasce’.,“The effective waist position is in average 38 m within the undulator … has a rms fluctuation of 4.8 m.”

column1: Coherence area  (Ac),Integral da função de coerência complexa
column2: quantifica a área transversal útil onde fase e amplitude são correlacionadas.,"“The coherence area, as defined in Eq. 4, is 0.071 mm2, about five times larger than the spot size Σ.”"

column1: Spot size  (Σ),Área efetiva do feixe
column2: comparada a Ac para julgar a suficiência da coerência transversal.,“about five times larger than the spot size Σ.”

column1: Complex coherence factor  (µ12),Versão normalizada da intensidade mútua
column2: mapeada para avaliar correlação de fase entre dois pontos.,“It is referred to also as the complex coherence factor.”

column1: Mutual coherence function  (Γ12),Função estatística básica de coerência
column2: fundamento para definir µ12 e Ac.,“Mathematically it is expressed by the mutual coherence function [9]: Γ12(τ) = …”

column1: Number of spikes in the pulse,Indicador do conteúdo modal longitudinal
column2: ~200 ‘spikes’ identificados para análise estatística.,“SASE Simulations … yield a radiation pulse with about 200 spikes at the undulator exit.”

column1: Peak power of spikes,Critério (>20 % do pico máximo) para selecionar quais ‘spikes’ entram no cálculo das métricas.,“only spikes are considered which have a peak power of at least 20 % of the maximum power in the pulse.”
rms fluctuation (σ),Desvio-padrão usado para quantificar variações shot-to-shot de zr e z0.,“has a rms fluctuation of 4.8 m”
column2: “The rms variation is 4 m.”

column1: Average / mean values,Valor médio empregado para resumir estatísticas de zr e z0.,“The average Rayleight length of 32 m …”
Ratio  Ac/Σ,Métrica derivada para julgar se a coerência cobre totalmente o feixe (“muito maior que um” indica boa coerência).,“For that the ratio between Ac and Σ must be much larger than one.”

column2: objective is to keep it low when using EII,"""…enabling the creation and querying of customized virtual database schemas over a set of distributed and heterogeneous data sources with a low TCO (Total Cost of Ownership).""  "

column1: Number of tables in FROM clause (#Tables),Complexity / scalability metric
column2: defines the notion of “mega query”,"""…queries with possible a 1,000 tables in their FROM clause.""  "

column1: Number of source tables after unfolding,Derived complexity metric produced when target-table mappings are expanded
column2: drives optimizer workload,"""…after unfolding, the query references over 1,000 source tables from more than 80 different databases.""  "

column1: Number of databases involved (#Databases),Another size/complexity indicator of a query
column2: impacts optimisation and federation cost,"""…more than 300 databases… within each region… roughly 80 partitions… 10 different databases [for warehouses].""  "

column1: Database size (GB),Volume metric that conditions I/O and transfer costs,"""…300 databases of up to 100 GB each containing source data about archive boxes.""  "
Panda et al. 2014 - e-government procurement implementation in India - two comparative case studies from the field.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho citado do texto)
Project Success (PS),Variável dependente utilizada para avaliar o resultado dos projetos de E-GP em cada estágio de evolução
column2: é função dos 11 CSFs.,"“PS = ƒ (TMS, PIS, BCPM, BPR, TS, SA, SI, CM, PM, TE, AS)”"

column1: Tempo de ciclo de licitação (dias),Indicador de eficiência: compara a duração média do processo de compra antes e depois do E-GP.,“Tender cycle time reduced from average 90-135 days to 32 days.”
Economia percentual (%),Mede a redução de custo obtida com E-GP em relação ao modo manual.,"“report savings of up to 25% over the procurement carried out through traditional manual mode [31, 22].”"
Economia absoluta (R$ ou Cr),Apura o valor total poupado pelas compras eletrônicas.,“Cost savings to a tune of Rs 22000 Crore.”

Participação de fornecedores (média de proponentes por licitação),Avalia o aumento da competitividade e do acesso ao mercado.,“Supplier participation increased from an average of 3 per tender in conventional mode to 4.5 in e-Procurement mode.”
Número de fornecedores registrados,Mede o alcance da plataforma junto ao mercado fornecedor.,“No of suppliers registered on E-GP portal: 60000”
Número de órgãos usuários,Mede a adoção institucional da solução.,"“No of dept using: 27 Dept, 43 PSU & Corporations, 20 Universities and 135 Urban Local Bodies”"
Total de licitações processadas,Expressa o volume operacional do sistema.,“Total tenders: 308253 Nos” (GoAP)
column2: “Total tenders: 1327 … 5727 … 7763” (GePNIC)

column1: Valor total das licitações processadas,Indica a relevância econômica das compras realizadas pela plataforma.,“Total value: Rs. 351529 Crore” (GoAP)
column2: “amounting Rs. 2128.19 Crore… Rs. 11902 Crore… Rs. 4410.80 Crore” (GePNIC)

column1: Taxa/fee de transação por licitante,"Compara o custo de participação no E-GP com a taxa do processo manual, servindo como medidor de atratividade econômica.",“Transaction fee payable by a bidder is lesser than tender fee charged in the manual tender system.”

Participação das compras públicas no orçamento/PIB,Mede a importância macroeconômica do gasto público e reforça o potencial de impacto do E-GP.,"“goods / services which constitutes 30% of Indian Union Budget or 3.4% to 5.7% of Indian GDP [19, 10].”"
Di Salle et al. 2024 - Waste Management Through Digital Twins and Business Process Modeling.pdf
Medidor de Performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Custo total de limpeza (€10-13 bilhões),Usado como métrica econômica para dimensionar o problema de lixo abandonado na UE e justificar iniciativas de redução de custos,“the Clean Europe Network estimates that the total cost of cleaning up litter on the land throughout the EU is in the range of €10-13 billion”

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),"Proposto para monitorar continuamente resultados, avaliar eficácia dos processos e incentivar participação de cidadãos e autoridades",“Proper key performance indicators (KPIs) and publicly accessible dashboards must be designed.”
Dashboard público,Ferramenta de visualização de indicadores/KPIs para transparência e incentivo à participação,“and publicly accessible dashboards must be designed.”

Ranks da gamificação,Métrica de desempenho lúdica para recompensar cidadãos e administrações pela identificação/remoção de lixo,“Citizens will be rewarded for reporting and removing waste… Administrations will compete on their ability to keep areas clean based on citizens’ reports.”

Índices derivados dos dados coletados,Usados pelas administrações para demonstrar impacto de ações e alinhamento com os SDGs,"“Further, the indexes derived from the collected data could be used by administrations to demonstrate the impact of actions regarding littering management”"

Capacidade da administração de manter áreas limpas,Indicador de desempenho comparativo entre administrações baseado em relatos de cidadãos,“Administrations will compete on their ability to keep areas clean based on citizens’ reports.”

Custo de desempenho (performance costs),Avaliado em estudos anteriores via gêmeo digital para balancear custos e qualidade do serviço,"“analyze the performance costs and the service quality in some countries [3,6]”"

Qualidade do serviço,Métrica analisada por gêmeos digitais e utilizada como KPI inovador em trabalhos relacionados,“to analyze the performance costs and the service quality” / “presents an innovative key performance indicator to measure service quality.”

Benchmark (comparativo),Referência de desempenho para implantação de sistemas similares em outros municípios,“The digital twin provides benchmarks for implementing similar systems in other municipalities”

Alta frequência de locais com lixo (‘hot area’)," ""Indicador espacial-temporal usado por decisores para direcionar ações de fiscalização""","“For instance, a hot area with a high frequency of abandoned sites may be targeted by local police, etc.”"
Eggers et al. 2021 - No Longer Out of Sight, No Longer Out of Mind - How ... ss Mining-Induced Transparency to Achieve Increased Process Awareness.pdf
Medidor_de_Performance,Como_e_usado,Evidencia_no_texto
OTD – On-Time Delivery,Métrico padronizado para monitorar subprocessos nas divisões
column2: base para comparação de desempenho e gatilho para melhorias,"“Standardized monitoring of OTD within divisions”
column3: “they tried to substantiate the claims with key performance indicators (KPIs), such as the rate of on-time delivery (OTD)”"

column1: KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) – genérico,Indicadores usados pela gestão para avaliar processos
column2: processo de mineração padroniza o cálculo e a disponibilização,“inconsistent process KPI reporting”
column3: “management introduced process mining … to monitor the firm’s processes and standardize process reporting”

column1: Taxa de Automação,Indicador definido pela equipe de especialistas da DistriCorp para avaliar eficiência de processos de compra e armazenagem,"“KPIs, such as automation rates and OTD”"
Tempo de Throughput do Armazém,Medido para avaliar eficiência do armazém
column2: estagnação motivou adoção de process mining,"“warehouse throughput times had been optimized to the limit, but we did not know why we were still losing time before shipping orders”"

column1: Preço – Número de Mudanças de Preço,Usado pela divisão de vendas da ManuCorp para identificar alterações desnecessárias que causavam atrasos,"“sales department became aware of their high rates of unnecessary price changes, which caused subsequent production delays”"

Confiabilidade do Fornecedor / Pontualidade de Entrega,Indicador de desempenho de fornecedores analisado pelo setor de compras para otimizar cooperação inter-organizacional,“procurement analysed the reliability of their suppliers”
column2: “some suppliers ‘deliver the goods a few days early… this has an impact on our warehouse process’”

column1: Taxa de Retrabalho (Rework Rate),Indicador derivado de dados de sensores na produção para identificar causas de retrabalho na pintura,“production department analysed sensor data … to find the root causes for high rework rates in the paint shop”

Número de Workflows no Processo de Change Management,Usado para medir complexidade/variação do processo e orientar simplificação,"“they carried out 3,000 different workflows to process change requests”"
Volume de Ligações de Clientes,Indicador de interação com o cliente
column2: correlação com documentos enviados e satisfação,“a high volume of customer calls occurred once a year after information documents had been sent out to customers”

column1: Nível de Satisfação do Cliente,Medido por pesquisas e combinado com mineração de processos para ajustar canais de autoatendimento,“enriched their process mining analyses with customer survey data on satisfaction with the self-service channels”

Taxa de Adoção de Canais de Autoatendimento,Usada pelo departamento de TIC para avaliar uso de portais on-line e identificar lacunas na jornada do cliente,“ICT department explored why customers were not adopting the self-service channels they provided”

Alerta de Atraso de Confirmação de Pedido,Funcionalidade de controle que mede atrasos entre data-limite de entrega e recebimento de confirmação do fornecedor,"“employees were now alerted that ‘the delivery date is due, but we have not received any order confirmation from the supplier’”"
Pika et al. 2017 - Mining Resource Profiles from Event Logs.pdf
Indicador,Categoria/Tipo,Descrição resumida,Evidência (trecho do texto original)

Distinct Activities,Skills (RBI 1.1),Número de atividades distintas completadas por um recurso em um intervalo de tempo,"“…RBI 1.1 Distinct activities: The number of distinct activities completed by a given resource, r, during a given timeslot…”  "

Case Types,Skills (RBI 1.2),Frações de casos de um determinado tipo em que o recurso participou,"“…RBI 1.2 Case types: The fraction of cases with a given value … in which a given resource, r, was involved …”  "

Activity Frequency,Skills (RBI 1.3),Fração de execuções de uma atividade por um recurso em relação a todas as suas execuções,"“…RBI 1.3 Activity frequency: The fraction of completions of a given activity, a, by a given resource, r…”  "

Activity Completions,Utilisation (RBI 2.1),Número de instâncias de atividades completadas por um recurso,“…RBI 2.1 Activity completions: The number of activity instances completed by a given resource…”

Case Completions Number,Utilisation (RBI 2.2),Número de casos concluídos em que o recurso atuou,“…RBI 2.2 Number of case completions: The number of cases completed … in which a given resource was involved.”

Case Completions Fraction,Utilisation (RBI 2.3),Fração de casos concluídos em que o recurso atuou sobre o total concluído,“…RBI 2.3 Fraction of case completions: The fraction of cases completed … with respect to the total number of cases completed…”

Average Workload,Utilisation (RBI 2.4),Número médio de tarefas simultâneas em execução pelo recurso,“…RBI 2.4 Average workload: The average number of activities started by a given resource but not completed at a moment in time.”

Multitasking,Preferences (RBI 3.1),Fração do tempo ativo em que o recurso executa mais de uma tarefa,“…RBI 3.1 Multi-tasking: The fraction of active time during which a given resource is involved in more than one activity…”

New Attribute Values,Preferences (RBI 3.2),Contagem de tarefas concluídas com valores inéditos de um atributo (propensão a risco),“…RBI 3.2 New attribute values: The number of times a resource completed a task … with an attribute value never seen before…”

Activity Reassignments,Preferences (RBI 3.3),Número de vezes que uma tarefa iniciada por um recurso é concluída por outro,“…RBI 3.3 Activity reassignments: The number of times when an activity started by a given resource … was later completed by a different resource.”

In-Time Activities,Productivity (RBI 4.1),Fração de atividades concluídas dentro de um limite de duração,"“…RBI 4.1 Activity outcomes: … For activity duration, the RBI can be formalised as follows: InTime Activities…”  "

Satisfactory Cases,Productivity (RBI 4.2),Fração de casos com feedback acima de um limiar em que o recurso atuou,"“…RBI 4.2 Case outcomes: … For the attribute feedback, the RBI can be formalised as follows: Satisfactory Cases…”  "

Average Activity Duration,Productivity (RBI 4.3),Duração média de uma atividade específica executada pelo recurso,“…RBI 4.3 Average duration of a given activity: The average duration of instances of a given activity completed … by a given resource.”

Average Case Duration,Productivity (RBI 4.4),Duração média dos casos concluídos em que o recurso atuou,“…RBI 4.4 Average case duration: The average duration of cases completed … in which a given resource was involved.”

Average Customer Feedback,Productivity (RBI 4.5),Média das avaliações de clientes para casos do recurso,“…RBI 4.5 Average customer feedback: The average customer feedback for cases completed … in which a given resource was involved.”

Interactions Between Resources,Collaboration (RBI 5.1),Número de casos onde dois recursos específicos trabalharam juntos,“…RBI 5.1 Interactions between two given resources: The number of cases completed … in which two given resources were involved.”

Social Position,Collaboration (RBI 5.2),Fração de colegas que trabalharam em casos junto com o recurso (centralidade social),“…RBI 5.2 Social position: The fraction of resources involved in the same cases with a given resource …”
Delegations,Collaboration (RBI 5.3),Número de vezes que o recurso delegou tarefas a outro,"“…RBI 5.3 Delegations: The number of times when a resource, r, assigns a task to another resource…”  "
Case Duration,Outcome (Regressão),Tempo total de execução do caso (variável dependente),“…we ﬁrst looked at the case perspective and checked … the case duration (dependent variable).”

# Resources in Case,Explanatory (Regressão),Quantidade de recursos envolvidos em um caso,“…relationship between the number of employees involved in a case (independent variable) and the case duration …”
Task Duration,Outcome (Regressão),Tempo de execução da tarefa (variável dependente),“…checked the relationship between … the task duration (dependent variable) and the experience …”

Resource Experience,Explanatory (Regressão),Dias de experiência do empregado até a execução da tarefa,“…experience was estimated as the number of days the employee had been employed … at the time of task completion.”

Tasks Completed per Week,Explanatory (Regressão/Time),Quantidade de tarefas realizadas na semana,“…checked how the number of tasks completed by an employee during a week (independent variable) affected the average duration…”
Average Task Duration per Week,Outcome (Regressão/Time),Duração média das tarefas na semana,“…and the average duration of the tasks (dependent variable) for employees R5 and R7.”

Average Workload (weekly),Explanatory (Regressão/Time),Carga de trabalho média no intervalo analisado,“…a user may look at the average duration of a task … and deﬁne the average resource workload as independent variable.”
R² (Coefficient of Determination),Métrica estatística,Percentual de variância explicada no modelo de regressão,“…we discovered … a weak relationship … (R² is 0.24)…
column2: “…strong for employee R5 (R² is 0.79)…”

column1: p-value,Métrica estatística,Nível de signiﬁcância do teste de regressão,"“…R² is 0.24, p-value < .001 …”

Productivity Score (DEA),Eficiência,Índice 0-1 de produtividade do recurso em relação à fronteira eficiente,"“…The resulting productivity scores range from zero to one, with one being the maximum possible productivity.”  "
Observed Revenue Output,DEA Output,Valor de saída observado (somatório ponderado pelas complexidades),“…division of the observed revenue output of an employee by the optimal revenue output…”
Optimal Revenue Output,DEA Output,Saída ótima calculada pela DEA (fronteira eficiente),“…learned from data the optimal revenue output (i.e. the estimated efﬁcient frontier…)”

Output Cost (Complexity Weight),Parâmetro DEA,"Peso/custo atribuído às tarefas segundo a complexidade (alta=5, média=3, baixa=1)","“…assigned the level of complexity … which we used to assign output costs (either ﬁve, three, or one, respectively).”  "

Average Productivity Trend,Análise temporal,Linha de tendência usada para avaliar evolução dos indicadores,“…time series charts accompanied by trend lines can give many insights into the dynamics of resource behaviour…”
Outliers Detectados,Análise temporal,Pontos fora da distribuição esperada dos indicadores,“…we use automatic techniques … such as the detection of outliers…”
Change Points,Análise temporal,Momentos em que a distribuição dos valores de um indicador muda,“…and change points [Ross and Adams 2012]…”
Kang and Han 2008 - A Business Activity Monitoring System Supporting Real-Time Business Performance Management.pdf
Performance Measure,How it is used in the text,Evidence (exact excerpt from the paper)
Monthly of Supply (MOS),Key KPI that indicates daily sales‐operation efficiency and inventory adequacy
column2: calculated and refreshed every minute
column3: shown on dashboard by region.,“the ‘Monthly of Supply (MOS)’ KPI showing the level of the current sales inventory is important because this KPI indicates the daily operational efficiency of sales and the properness of sales inventory.”

column1: Present Sales Inventory,Numerator used in the MOS formula
column2: also displayed as current inventory level of each region.,“MOS = Present Sales Inventory / Average Sales by Month” and “the current inventories of each region are presented by vertical bar chart.”

column1: Average Sales by Month,Denominator used in the MOS formula to normalise inventory level.,“MOS = Present Sales Inventory / Average Sales by Month”

MOS Level (Normal/Boundary/Abnormal),"Traffic-light classification that drives the colour of gauges on the dashboard (green < 3.5, yellow 3.5-4.0, red > 4.0).","“If the MOS value is less than 3.5, then the indicator is presented in green… if the value is more than 3.5 and less than 4.0, then the indicator is presented in yellow… if the value is more than 4.0, then the indicator is presented in red.”  "
Number of Equipment Problems,Overall count of problems being handled in the BPM-driven process
column2: listed for drill-down analysis.,"“on the right below part, all equipment problems executed on the BPM system are displayed by the list.”  "

column1: Number of Equipment Problems by Department,"Break-down of problems (press, body, paint, assembly, engine) shown as a pie chart.","“On the left upper part, the numbers of equipment problems by department such as press, body, paint, assembly, and engine shop are displayed by the pie chart.”  "

Number of Equipment Problems by Plant,Break-down of problems per manufacturing plant shown as a bar chart.,"“On the left below part, the numbers of equipment problems by plant are presented by the vertical bar chart.”  "
Number of In-Process Problems by Activity,Counts outstanding items at each of the five activities of the equipment-problem process
column2: displayed as a bar chart.,"“On the middle upper part, the numbers of the in-process problems of each activity are presented by the vertical bar chart.”  "

column1: Number of Delay Activities,Activities still open 48 h after start
column2: highlighted as issues.,“An uncompleted activity within 48 hours after the start time is categorized as a delay activity” and “the delay activities are presented by the list.”

column1: Number of Alert Processes,Processes not finished by planned end date
column2: listed for immediate attention.,“a process that is not completed until the planed finished date is classified to an alert process” and “the alert processes are presented by the list.”

Process cycle time,Time,Aggregate time of the recruiting process from vacancy identification to hire
column2: used to evaluate efficiency.,"""process cycle time of the recruiting process can be shortened significantly through business process controlling..."" (Abstract)
column3: ""period of time between identifying and filling an open position (Hirzel 2008)"" (Sec 3.1)"

column1: Time-to-hire,Time,Standard KPI for recruiting speed

column1: Time to post job ad,Time,Measures speed of moving from vacancy approval to advertisement.,"""time span between identifying an open position and posting a job ad"" (Sec 3.1)"

Time to first interview,Time,Measures promptness of applicant processing up to first interview.,"""time between identifying a vacancy and holding the first job interviews in recent years"" (Measurement model, Table 4)"
Internal applicant-tracking time,Time,Portion of cycle time consumed by internal processing steps.,"""time spent on the internal applicant tracking process"" (Sec 3.1)"
Total process cost,Cost,Overall monetary resources spent per vacancy filled.,"""process cost … aggregate cost incurred in hiring a new employee"" (Sec 3.1)"

Wagner 2017 - Introduction to information and process modeling for simulation.pdf
Metric,Description of Use,Evidence in the Text
Percentage of lost sales,Main performance indicator that the simulation aims to compute for the inventory-management example
column2: defined as (total ordered – total sold) / total ordered.,"“The purpose of the simulation is to compute the percentage of lost sales, which is an important performance indicator.”  – and –  “compute the percentage of lost sales … as the difference between the total number of ordered items and the total number of sold items divided by the total number of ordered items”."

column1: Lost sales (absolute number),Derived measure representing the quantity of demand that could not be satisfied (difference between ordered amount and stock on hand).,"“If an order quantity is greater than the current stock level, the difference counts as a lost sale.”"
Total number of ordered items,Component measure used in the formula for the percentage of lost sales
column2: also useful on its own as a demand metric.,“…difference between the total number of ordered items and the total number of sold items divided by the total number of ordered items”.

column1: Total number of sold items,Component measure used in the formula for the percentage of lost sales
column2: also useful on its own as a sales metric.,“…difference between the total number of ordered items and the total number of sold items divided by the total number of ordered items”.

column1: Difference (total ordered – total sold),Represents the count of lost sales
column2: appears in the numerator of the percentage-of-lost-sales metric and can be monitored directly.,“…as the difference between the total number of ordered items and the total number of sold items…”

Lamghari et al. 2018 - A set of indicators for BPM life cycle improvement.pdf
Indicador,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Relevance,Métrica de design usada para verificar se o processo representa o negócio correto,“…defining the Business of the company (Relevance)… ”
Correctness,Métrica de design para checar a sintaxe/semântica correta do modelo,“…that leads to check the syntax of the process (Correctness).”
Clarity,Métrica de design para garantir que o processo seja facilmente entendido,“…become easy to understand the language representing the process (Clarity).”
Completeness,Métrica de design que garante que todas as partes do processo estejam modeladas,“…we can complete the process throughout its implementation (Completeness)….”
Consistency,Métrica de design que compara o modelo com a realidade para evitar contradições,“…focus on representing it relatively to reality (Consistency)….”
Operation time,Métrica de análise
column2: soma de setup time + run time,“Operation time  =  Setup time + Run time”

column1: Setup time,Componente de Operation time
column2: tempo de troca entre atividades,“Setup time ( the length of time required to changeover from one process/activity to another)”

column1: Run time,Componente de Operation time
column2: tempo em que a atividade está em execução,“…Run Time (is when a process is running…)”

column1: Cycle time,Métrica de análise/execução
column2: tempo médio entre saídas sucessivas,“Cycle Time : is the average successive time between completions of successive units.”

column1: Throughput rate,"Métrica de análise
column2: 1 / cycle time, mede unidades por tempo",“Throughput rate: The number of flow units … per unit time… 1 / cycle time”

column1: Throughput time,Tempo médio que uma unidade percorre todo o processo,“Average time for a unit to move through the system…”
