Pourmirza et al. 2019 - BPMS-RA - A Novel Reference Architecture for Business Process Management Systems.pdf
Metric,Usage in text,Evidence snippet

Duration,Indicator used in post-execution analysis to evaluate how long process instances take,"“it can produce valuable insights regarding the duration, costs, and quality of previously executed process instances by using some KPIs.” (Sec 3.7)  "

Costs,Indicator used in post-execution analysis to evaluate monetary efficiency of process instances,"“it can produce valuable insights regarding the duration, costs, and quality of previously executed process instances by using some KPIs.” (Sec 3.7)  "

Quality,Indicator used in post-execution analysis to evaluate outcome quality of process instances,"“it can produce valuable insights regarding the duration, costs, and quality of previously executed process instances by using some KPIs.” (Sec 3.7)  "
KPIs (Key Performance Indicators),Aggregated/derived set of metrics applied to judge past process executions,“…by using some KPIs.” (Sec 3.7)

Response time,Specific constraint used to judge system-level performance,"“Performance is the degree to which a system accomplishes its designated functions within given constraints, such as response time, computation power and memory usage…” (Sec 4.2)  "

Computation power,Resource-oriented constraint considered when assessing performance,"“Performance is … within given constraints, such as response time, computation power and memory usage…” (Sec 4.2)  "
Memory usage,Resource-oriented constraint considered when assessing performance,"“Performance is … within given constraints, such as response time, computation power and memory usage…” (Sec 4.2)  "
Performance (general),Overall indicator shown in dashboards to inform managers about process health,“…which may include a set of dashboards to show the performance of the processes.” (Sec 3.5)
Availability,Runtime metric expressing how often the system is operational and accessible,“Availability is the degree to which a system is operational and accessible when required…” (Sec 4.2)

Latency,Derived timing metric mentioned when discussing trade-off between modularity and speed,“…a less modular decomposition may result in a better performing systems since all the required resources are accessible with less latency.” (Sec 7.2)

Bottlenecks,Derived indicator detected via simulation/optimization to highlight performance weaknesses,“…help process designers … by detecting bottlenecks and weaknesses in the designed processes before they are actually operationalized.” (Sec 3.2)

column1: van der Aalst 2012 - Process Mining - Overview and Opportunities.pdf
metric,how_it_is_used_in_the_text,evidence_in_the_text

Bottleneck,identification of process parts where flow is delayed by analysing timestamps or replay results,“by using timestamps in the event log one can extend the model to show bottlenecks …” (Sec. 3)
column2: “Simply measure the time difference … to add average/expected waiting times to the model. This way it is possible to identify the main bottlenecks” (Sec. 5)

column1: Service level,evaluation of performance targets reached by the process after enriching the model with timing information,“…extend the model to show … service levels …” (Sec. 3)
Throughput time,"measurement of total time a case needs from start to finish, obtained from timestamps",“…extend the model to show … throughput times.” (Sec. 3)
Waiting time,"time between causally related activities, computed during replay to detect delays",“Simply measure the time difference between causally related events …” (Sec. 5)
Average waiting time,mean of waiting-time samples added to model to visualise delays,“compute basic statistics such as averages …” (Sec. 5)
Variance of waiting time,dispersion measure for waiting times used in performance analysis,"“…compute basic statistics such as averages, variances …” (Sec. 5)"
Confidence intervals,statistical reliability indicator for timing metrics,“…compute basic statistics such as … confidence intervals.” (Sec. 5)
Flow time,"overall time spent in the process or in a fragment, calculated from timestamps","“performance-related information, that is, flow times and bottlenecks can be discovered.” (Sec. 7.1)"
Service time,time a resource spends on an activity
column2: analysed together with workload,"“…analyse resource performance (e.g., the relation between workload and service times).” (Sec. 5)"

column1: Workload,"amount of work allocated to a resource, correlated with service time",“…relation between workload and service times.” (Sec. 5)
Completion time (predicted),estimated remaining time of running cases using discovered model with timing info,“…completion time of a partially handled customer order can be predicted …” (Sec. 5)
Fitness,degree to which the model can reproduce the log behaviour
column2: quantitative scale 0–1,“A model with good fitness allows for most of the behaviour seen in the event log.” (Sec. 4)
column3: example value “fitness … 0.98876214.” (Sec. 7.3)

column1: Simplicity,model quality criterion favouring minimal yet sufficient structure,"“Obviously, the simplest model that can explain the behaviour seen in the log is the best model.” (Sec. 4)"
Precision,measure penalising models that allow for ‘too much’ behaviour (underfitting),“A model is precise if it does not allow for ‘too much’ behaviour.” (Sec. 4)

Generalisation,measure penalising models that restrict behaviour only to seen examples (overfitting),“A model should also generalise and not restrict behaviour to just the examples seen in the log.” (Sec. 4)

Fraction of cases replayed completely,simple conformance indicator based on proportion of traces that can be parsed from start to end,“simply count the fraction of cases that can be ‘parsed completely’ …” (Sec. 4.3)

Number of borrowed tokens,token-based penalty during replay used to quantify deviations,"“…continue replaying … and record the problem. In the end, the number of ‘borrowed tokens’ … indicate the fitness level.” (Sec. 4.3)"
Number of tokens left behind,tokens not consumed after replay
column2: together with borrowed tokens forms a deviation score,“…and the number of ‘tokens left behind’ … indicate the fitness level.” (Sec. 4.3)

column1: Cost-based fitness,fitness value obtained by minimising costs of mismatches in alignment,"“conformance checking using cost-based fitness analysis.” (Ref. Adriansyah et al. 2011, cited in Sec. 4.3)"
Average time spent in place,mean sojourn time in a model place obtained during replay,“The average time spent in this place is 7.84 days.” (Sec. 7.3)

Elapsed time between activities,mean time difference between two specific activities,“On average 202.73 days pass in-between the completion of activity ‘OZ02 Voorbereiden’ … and … ‘OZ16 Uitspraak’.” (Sec. 7.3)

Alignment cost / moves on log or model,quantitative indication of deviations shown in optimal alignments,"examples γ₂ and γ₃ list moves like (d,–) or (–,b) used to diagnose non-conformance (Sec. 4.3)"
Lee 2014 - Performance evaluation of CPA firms in Taiwan from the perspective of industry-specific client groups.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho do artigo)
Overall Technical Efficiency (CCR score),Calculado via modelo CCR-DEA para classificar as firmas
column2: comparado entre grupos
column3: usado como variável independente (CCREF) nos modelos de regressão que testam sua influência sobre receita operacional e receita total.,“…the average overall technical efficiency (CCR score) is 0.740…”
column4: “…Overall technical efficiency and pure technical efficiency served as the independent variables of the model…”

column1: Pure Technical Efficiency (BCC score),Obtido pelo modelo BCC-DEA
column2: separa eficiência pura da de escala
column3: utilizado como variável independente (BCCEF) nas regressões.,“…the average pure technical efficiency (BCC score) is 0.802…”
column4: “…pure technical efficiency (BCC score)… served as the independent variables of the model.”

column1: Scale Efficiency,Razão CCR/BCC
column2: indica se o problema é técnico ou de escala
column3: analisada para orientar aumento ou redução de porte.,"“…the average scale efficiency is 0.927, indicating that the inefficient firms should…consider reduction or expansion of the scale of operation.”"

column1: Returns to Scale (RTS),"Classifica cada firma em CRS, IRS ou DRS
column2: ajuda a decidir se a escala deve ser ajustada.",“The returns to scale (RTS) under the BCC model show that … 24 firms are in the stage of constant returns to scale (CRTS)
column3: … ﬁve firms are in decreasing returns to scale (DRTS)
column4: … seventeen firms are in increasing returns to scale (IRTS).”

column1: Improvement Percentage of Output and Input Items,Mede quanto cada saída deve ser aumentada e cada entrada reduzida para tornar a firma eficiente
column2: usado para priorizar ações de melhoria.,"“Assessment of the average improvement percentage of output and input reveals that the most urgent output that needs to be improved is the operating revenue from the lodging, food and beverages industry (O3)… The most urgent input that should be improved is … the operating assets cost (I2) which should be slightly reduced by 5.1 %.”"

column1: Contribution Degree of Output and Input Items to Operating Efficiency,Percentual de participação de cada variável na eficiência
column2: compara firmas eficientes e ineficientes para identificar clientes–alvo e inputs críticos.,“Table 6 shows the contribution degree of output and input makes to operating efficiency… the average percentages of contribution degree of the operating revenue from the transport and storage (O4)… rank as the top three for operating efficiency.”

column1: Operating Revenue (PR),Usado como variável dependente de desempenho financeiro nos modelos de regressão
column2: também decomposto por indústria (O1–O6) como saídas da DEA.,"“PR is the operating revenue, including: revenue from attestation, taxation, management consulting…”
column3: “Model 1: The relation between operating revenue and CCR score”"

column1: Total Revenue (TR),Outra medida financeira dependente nos modelos de regressão para verificar impacto da eficiência.,"“TR is the total revenue, including: operating revenue, revenue from interest and rent, and other non-operating revenue.”
column2: “Model 2: The relation between total revenue and CCR score”"

column1: Operating Efficiency (conceito geral),"Indicador agregado que sintetiza CCR, BCC e escala
column2: base para todas as análises comparativas do artigo.",“…This paper explores the operating efficiency of certified public accounting (CPA) firms…”
column3: “…the operating efficiency of CPA firms is positively correlated with operating revenue and total revenue.”

Company performance,Overall outcome variable affected by innovative capability
column2: comprises several kinds of results,"""Company performance consists of financial [35][51][22][1] and non-financial [10[[18][27] performances"""

column1: Superior performance,Targeted competitive outcome enabled by innovative capability,"""The innovative capability is a unique resource that enable companies to deliver a superior performance."""

Financial performance,Subset of company performance frequently tested against innovation,"""Various studies have shown a positive relationship between innovative capability and company performance including financial performance [8][14]"""
Non-financial performance,Complementary subset of company performance,"""Company performance consists of financial ... and non-financial [...] performances"""
Return on Assets (ROA),Specific accounting indicator of financial results used in prior studies,"""including financial performance [8][14] and ROA [44]"""
Annual sales growth rate,Planned survey indicator to capture sales increase during last three years,"""1. The company experienced an annual sales growth rate over the past three years"" (Table 3)"
Growth rate of new products,Planned survey indicator for increase in introduced products,"""2. The company experienced a growth rate of new products over the past three years"" (Table 3)"
Growth rate of innovation performance,Planned survey indicator for improvement in innovation output,"""3. The company is experiencing a growth rate of innovation performance"" (Table 3)"
Growth in product performance,Planned survey indicator for better product results,"""4. The company is experiencing growth in product performance"" (Table 3)"
Revenue increase,Observed case-study result showing higher income,"""the company experienced increased revenue, products and services in the last three years"" (Company 1)"
Product and service growth,Observed improvement in volume and scope of offerings,"""The company experienced high levels of sales, products and services over the past three years"" (Company 5)"
Innovation performance (increase),Observed rise in innovation outcomes,"""The performance of innovation, products and services also increased"" (Company 1)"
15 % performance growth,Concrete quantitative outcome reported by a focal firm,"""the company experienced 15% performance growth"" (Company 2)"
Customer Satisfaction Index,Metric used to monitor and manage performance against client expectations,"""the company measures this through the customer satisfaction index"" (Company 4)"
Key Performance Indicators (KPI),Operational metrics derived from customer ratings and internal goals,"""company measures Key Performance Indicators (KPI) based on customer ratings"" (Company 2)"
Service level,Performance indicator focusing on fulfilment quality,"""For reactive market orientation, the company measures the service level."" (Company 5)"
Performance Management Development (PMD),Framework that consolidates and tracks KPIs for appraisal,"""incorporated into performance management development (PMD) to be measured."" (Company 4)"
Verenich et al. 2019 - Survey and Cross-benchmark Comparison of Remaining Time Prediction Methods in Business Process Monitoring.pdf
Metric,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual
Accuracy,Indicador geral de quão corretas são as predições
column2: utilizado em conjunto com Earliness para avaliar cada método.,"“Two measures commonly employed to assess a predictive process monitoring technique are accuracy and earliness [14,24,47].” (Seção 6.2.2)  "

column1: Earliness,Mede o quão cedo a predição é fornecida ao longo da execução do caso.,Mesmo excerto acima + explicação: “A common approach to measure the earliness of the predictions is to evaluate the accuracy of the models after each arrived event or at fixed time intervals.” (Seção 6.2.2)

MAE (Mean Absolute Error),Erro absoluto médio adotado como métrica-principal de precisão das predições de tempo restante.,“we use MAE to measure the error in predicting the remaining time.” (Seção 6.2.2)
RMSE (Root Mean Square Error),"Métrica de erro candidata, descartada por ser muito sensível a outliers.",“RMSE would be very sensitive to such outliers.” (Seção 6.2.2)
MAPE (Mean Percentage Error),"Métrica de erro candidata, descartada porque valores próximos de zero distorcem o resultado.",“MAPE would be skewed in such situations.” (Seção 6.2.2)
Weighted average MAE,MAE médio ponderado pela frequência relativa dos prefixos de cada tamanho
column2: usado nas Tabelas 10.,“The averages are weighted by the relative frequency of prefixes with that prefix...” (Seção 6.3)

column1: Standard deviation (of MAE),Desvio-padrão reportado juntamente com o MAE para indicar variabilidade.,“Prediction accuracy… together with its standard deviation.” (Seção 6.3)
Mean ranking,"Ranking médio dos métodos ao longo de todos os datasets, utilizado para comparação agregada.",“we plot their mean rankings achieved across all datasets in Figure 8.” (Seção 6.3)

Average normalized MAE,"MAE dividido pela duração média dos casos de cada log, permitindo comparação em escala comum.","“for each log, we divide the average MAE values… by the mean case duration… The results… are illustrated in the boxplots in Figure 9.” (Seção 6.3)  "

Std. dev. of normalized MAE,"Desvio-padrão do MAE normalizado, exibido para mostrar dispersão dos erros entre logs.",Figura 9(b): “Standard deviation of normalized MAE (b) across case lifetime.” (Seção 6.3)

medidor_de_performance,uso_no_texto,evidencias

Average time spent by transactions on the user chain (problem wait time),Usado para medir o tempo médio que cada problema (transação) permanece enfileirado antes de ser atendido,“GPSS routinely provided the average time spent by transactions on this user chain … Each of these quantities represented a performance measure of high interest to the systems analysts.”

Average length of the user chain (average queue length),Usado para estimar o tamanho médio da fila de problemas à espera de atendimento,“… plus the average … lengths of the chain. Each of these quantities represented a performance measure of high interest to the systems analysts.”

Maximum length of the user chain (maximum queue length),Usado para avaliar o maior número de problemas simultaneamente em fila,“… plus the … maximum lengths of the chain. Each of these quantities represented a performance measure of high interest to the systems analysts.”

Average number of busy technicians,Usado para comparar resultados do modelo com observações reais de utilização da mão-de-obra de suporte,"“… compared with actual observations of systems performance (e.g., average number of busy technicians …).”  "

Average number of problems queued awaiting attention,Usado para validar o modelo confrontando a fila média simulada com a real,"“… compared with actual observations of systems performance (e.g., … average number of problems queued awaiting attention).”  "
Average problem wait time,Usado pelo gerenciamento para decidir o nível de pessoal necessário em diferentes cenários de estações de trabalho,“405 Workstations … Average problem wait time (minutes) …”
Average waiting queue,Também usado pelo gerenciamento nos cenários de planejamento como indicador de tamanho médio de fila,“405 Workstations … Average waiting queue …”

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),"Indicadores definidos na fase de desenho dos processos para monitorar desempenho, localizar gargalos e promover melhorias.","“thanks to the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), deﬁned during the early designing of the process, increase the performance to getting an overall improvement of the process (e.g. removing bottlenecks).”  "
Preventive Maintenance (PM) Completion Rate,Exemplo de indicador ‘leading’ para acompanhar se as atividades de manutenção preventiva estão sendo concluídas
column2: usado para prever aumento ou redução de demandas de manutenção corretiva.,"“An example Preventive Maintenance (PM) Completion Rate: a low completion rate for PM would generate an increasing in asset maintenance work while a high completion rate means that asset preventive maintenance request is correctly being completed and, probably, future corrective maintenance requests will be reduced.”  "

column1: Outage Schedule Compliance,"Outro indicador ‘leading’
column2: mede aderência ao cronograma de paradas programadas, sinalizando possíveis riscos e quedas de desempenho futuras.","“Another example is the Outage Schedule Compliance an important metric to track future maintenance work because it allows to measure deferred asset maintenance, resulting in an increased risks and likelihood that asset performance will decrease at a future time…”  "

column1: Return On Asset (ROA),Indicador financeiro citado como resultado esperado da melhoria da gestão de ativos.,“…thus extending asset life-cycle and obtaining a higher Return On Asset.”

O1 Number of internal maintenance personnel / Total internal employees,Indicador organizacional sobre a proporção de pessoal de manutenção interno em relação ao total de empregados.,“O1 Number of internal maintenance personnel / Total internal employees” (Tabela III)

O2 Number of indirect maintenance personnel / Number of internal maintenance personnel,Indicador organizacional que mede a relação entre pessoal de manutenção indireto e direto.,“O2 Number of indirect maintenance personnel / Number of internal maintenance personnel” (Tabela III)

O3 Number of indirect maintenance personnel / Number of direct maintenance personnel,Outro indicador organizacional para avaliar equilíbrio entre funções indiretas e diretas na manutenção.,“O3 Number of indirect maintenance personnel / Number of direct maintenance personnel” (Tabela III)
O16 Corrective maintenance man-hours / Total maintenance man-hours,Indica a fração de horas de manutenção corretiva sobre o total

Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência extraída do artigo

column1: Tempo total de processamento,Utilizado no cálculo da taxa de processamento (“event processing rate”).,“…and the total time to process these explicit events was measured.”
Número de eventos explícitos gerados,Define a carga de entrada e compõe o cálculo da taxa
column2: 20 000 eventos foram gerados em cada experimento.,"“In all experiments, 20,000 explicit events were generated, and the total time to process these explicit events was measured.”"

column1: Porcentagem de eventos relevantes,Variável de carga avaliada nos cenários Standby/Noisy/Filtered/Complex
column2: impacta diretamente a taxa de processamento.,“We observe that the percentage of relevant events has significant performance implications.”

column1: Número de mundos possíveis (2^rs),Usado como medida da complexidade do problema
column2: variado para testar escalabilidade.,“the number of possible worlds was always calculated as 2^rs … we tested the scalability of our algorithm as the number of possible worlds increases.”

column1: Tamanho da amostra (m),Quantidade de amostras geradas pelo algoritmo de amostragem para estimar probabilidades.,"“m independent samples… given a sample of size m, a confidence interval for the approximation can be computed.”"

Fórmula do tamanho de amostra ((Zα σ̂ / β)^2),Indica quantas amostras são necessárias para atingir precisão β com confiança α.,"“one would need  ( Z_α  σ̂ /  β )^2  samples, where  Z_α is the 2α quantile of the normal distribution, and σ̂ is the sample standard deviation.”"
Nível de confiança (α),"Parâmetro estatístico fixado em 0,05 em todos os experimentos.","“In all experiments, the confidence (α) was set to 0.05.”"
Largura do intervalo de confiança (β),"Parâmetro de precisão variado (0,05
column4: 0,2) para estudar o impacto na performance.","“We tested several settings of the confidence width β (0.05, 0.1, 0.15, and 0.2).”"

column1: Desvio-padrão da amostra (σ̂),Usado na fórmula que determina o tamanho da amostra necessária.,“…and σ̂ is the sample standard deviation.”

True interval (intervalo real observado),Medida de acurácia: tamanho de intervalo que contém 95 % das amostras.,“We define the true interval to be the size of an interval such that only 5% of samples are outside the interval.”
Expected interval (intervalo esperado β),Intervalo teórico desejado
column2: comparado ao true interval para validar a precisão.,“results show the true interval to be significantly smaller than the expected interval.”

column1: Média do true interval,Estatística de resumo apresentada para avaliar precisão do algoritmo.,“Table 5 summarises the results … Avg Min Max”

Valor máximo do true interval,Estatística de variação na Tabela 5.,Coluna “Max” da Tabela 5.

column2: expressa em notação assintótica.,“The overall complexity of Algorithm 1 is  O( … ).”

column2: r = number of registered RFCs,“The PPI is calculated as the function (c/r)*100 where c is the number of cancelled RFC and r is the number of registered RFC” (Table A1)

column1: PPI-005,Average time of RFC analysis,Aggregated time (average),Average of the duration of activity “Analyse RFC”,“The PPI is defined as the average of the duration of activity Analyse RFC” (Table A6)

PPI-007,Number of RFCs per type of change,Aggregated count – grouped,Number of registered RFCs grouped by ‘type of change’ property,“The PPI is defined as the number of registered RFCs grouped by type of change of RFC” (Table A10)

PPI-008,Number of RFCs per project,Aggregated count – grouped,Sum of number of times data object RFC becomes registered grouped by ‘project’ property,“The PPI is defined as the sum of the number of times dataObject RFC becomes registered grouped by project of RFC” (Table A11)

PPI-009,Average lifetime of an RFC,Aggregated time (average),Average duration between event “Receive RFC” and completion of process “RFC management”,“The PPI is defined as the average of the duration between time instants when event Receive RFC is triggered and when process RFC management becomes completed” (Table A12)
