column1: Receita (Revenue),Componente do cálculo de Lucro e objetivo de crescimento para gerentes de loja,“Revenue − Costs − Stolen * 50” e “store managers … focused on increasing revenues”
Custos Operacionais Totais (Costs),Componente do cálculo do Lucro,“Revenue − Costs − Stolen * 50”
Itens Roubados (Stolen),Quantidade de itens furtados
column2: entra na fórmula do Lucro ponderado por 50,“Stolen * 50 (the third is a number of items).”

column1: Quantidade de Itens Vendidos,Indicador de desempenho de vendas monitorado pelos gerentes,“store managers … focused on increasing revenues and the number of items sold in their stores.”
Fluxo de Clientes (Traffic flow),Driver de demanda usado para explicar receitas e necessidade de pessoal,“demand side depended on local advertising and word of mouth that stimulated traffic flow.”
Investimento em Publicidade,Variável de decisão considerada para alocação de recursos com impacto nas receitas,“should a manager invest more in advertising in order to improve revenues”
Investimento em Treinamento,Variável de decisão comparada ao investimento em publicidade para avaliar impacto nas receitas,“or would an investment in training have more of an impact?”

Investimento no Negócio Online,Novo KPI criado na 3ª iteração para monitorar custos e riscos da iniciativa de e-commerce,“there is also a new KPI used to monitor the investment made in the online business and its impact on the costs.”
Número de Consignadores,Driver de oferta que influencia o volume de produtos disponíveis,“the supply side of the business depended on the number of consigners available”
Volume de Produtos Consignados,"Mede a quantidade de itens que cada consignador traz, impactando estoque e vendas",“the amount of product they brought to each store”
Velocidade de Exposição de Produtos,"Tempo para preparar e expor produtos, afetando rapidez das vendas",“the speed at which these products could be displayed.”
Produtos Corretamente Expostos (Stock displayed),Fator determinante para geração de receita nas lojas,“Revenue was driven by ensuring that stock was properly displayed”
Popescu and Popescu 2014 - Theoretical contributions concerning performance-The way to achieve excellence.pdf
medidor_de_performance,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto
Percentual do custo total de caixa influenciado pela área de Compras,Usado para demonstrar o impacto da função de compras no custo total
column2: serve como indicador de abrangência da influência do procurement,"""Procurement influences more than 50 percent of a company’s total cash cost"""

column1: Percentual de economia obtida em grupos de commodities ou categorias,Usado como resultado-chave do PEP para medir ganho direto de custo,"""PEP can achieve savings up to 70 percent of important commodity or category groups"""
Custos totais (Total cost),Meta de redução no gerenciamento estratégico de commodities
column2: indicador de custo global,"""reduce total cost"""

column1: Custos gerais (Overall costs),Foco do PEP para avaliar performance financeira global,"""the focus is on overall costs and company value"""
Valor da empresa (Company value),Indicador de criação de valor que complementa a análise de custos,"""the focus is on overall costs and company value"""
Lacunas de performance (Performance gaps),Usado para medir a distância em relação aos benchmarks e determinar potencial de melhoria,"""enables a company to gauge its performance gaps"""
Gastos com commodities, fornecedores e recursos (Spend),Base para avaliação de onde o dinheiro é empregado
column2: entrada para análises de oportunidade,"""consider how much they spend on commodities, suppliers, and resources"""

column1: Custos unitários (Unit costs),Foco da primeira etapa de PEP
column2: indicador para gestão de commodities,"""The initial step – managing commodities strategically – focuses on unit costs"""

column1: Custos de processo (Process costs),Foco da segunda etapa
column2: mede eficiência dos processos de compras,"""The second step – optimizing purchasing organization processes – deals with process costs"""

column1: Melhoria quantitativa e qualitativa da cadeia de suprimentos,Indicadores de desempenho de fornecedores avaliados em termos quantitativos e qualitativos,"""Strategic supplier management improves the supply chain in both quantitative and qualitative terms"""

Programas de redução de custos (Cost-saving programs),Indicador de sucesso da área de compras em reduzir base de custos,"""If purchasing consistently pushed through large cost-saving programs and communicated its achievements in driving down the cost base"""
Impacto nos negócios (Business impact),Parâmetro de segmentação de commodities na matriz de portfólio,"""Each commodity or category is then assessed in terms of business impact"""
Desafio do mercado de suprimentos (Supply market challenge),Outro parâmetro da matriz de segmentação
column2: mede dificuldade do mercado,"""assessed in terms of business impact and supply market challenge"""

column1: Competitividade,Usado como resultado final – empresas que completam as três etapas tornam-se mais competitivas,"""Companies that work through all three steps tend to be more competitive than their counterparts"""
Kanalici et al. 2009 - Integration of a simulation platform into a business process management tool.pdf
Not valid csv text, check the article
Wetzstein et al. 2008 - Towards management of sla-aware business processes based on key performance indicators.pdf
Metric,Usage / Purpose,Textual Evidence
Key Performance Indicator (KPI),"Principal business‐level measure used throughout the paper
column2: acts as abstraction for individual metrics and is the object that is modelled, transformed and monitored.","“Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) enables continuous, real-time performance measurement of business processes based on key performance indicators (KPI).”"

column1: Business Metric (Key Business Metric),Generic term for any performance measure
column2: KPIs are defined as a subset of key business metrics.,"“…BAM technology enables continuous, real-time monitoring of processes based on key business metrics, also known as key performance indicators (KPI).”"

column1: Deadline Adherence,Template KPI that measures the percentage of business objects (e.g. orders) finished on time.,Figure 2 – ‘Deadline Adherence   %100 … Number Business Objects finished on time / Number of all Business Objects finished’

Process Duration,Template KPI that measures average processing time of business objects (or of a process instance).,Figure 2 – ‘Process Duration … Σ(finish date – start date) / Number of all Business Objects finished’
Percentage of Purchase Orders Delivered Successfully and on Time,Concrete example KPI derived from the Deadline Adherence template
column2: later formalised in the running example.,"“…e.g., ‘percentage of purchase orders which were delivered successfully and on time’.”"

column1: Percentage of Purchase Orders Processed in Time (target > 90 % over last 3 months),Concrete KPI used to illustrate target values and analysis period.,"“…‘percentage of purchase orders processed in time in the last 3 months should be greater than 90%’, the analysis period being 3 months and the target value 90%.”"

Number of Purchase Orders Processed Successfully and in Time,Instance/aggregate metric used in example to build the ‘percentage’ KPI.,“…e.g. ‘number of purchase orders processed successfully and in time’.”

Return on Investment (ROI),Mentioned KPI that is explicitly declared out-of-scope but nevertheless a performance indicator referenced by the authors.,"“Other KPIs, e.g. financial metrics such as Return on Investment (ROI) are … out of the scope of this paper.”"
SCOR Supply Chain Metrics,Industry standard set of KPIs cited as source of concrete indicators for analysis.,"“Our analysis of concrete KPIs, such as SCOR Supply Chain Metrics [SCOR07] …”"

Instance Metric,Derived metric type that calculates a measure for a single process instance (e.g. duration or a state test).,“An instance metric calculates metrics for one single process instance of a process model.”

Duration Metric,Specialisation of instance metric that measures elapsed time between two execution events.,“The duration metric measures the time between two activities by simply subtracting the ‘timestamp’ attribute values of two execution events.”

State Metric,Specialisation of instance metric that evaluates a logical condition on the state of the process instance at a given execution event.,“A state metric references an execution event and specifies a logical expression which formulates a condition on the state of the process instance at that point in time.”
Aggregate Metric,"Derived metric type that aggregates values of instance metrics using operators such as sum, average, min, max
column2: produces the value actually shown for a KPI over an analysis period.","“Aggregate metrics aggregate values of instance metrics using operators ‘max’, ‘min’, ‘average’, and ‘sum’. They thus evaluate the performance of a process in a certain analysis period.”"

column1: Khodadadi and Lazarova-Molnar 2025 - Multi-flow Process Mining for Comprehensive Simulation Model Discovery.pdf
Performance_Metric,Usage_in_Text,Evidence_in_Text
Time / Duration,Primary dimension in traditional process mining
column2: used to define sequence and length of activities and to compute timed-transition distributions.,“… time which involves the sequence and duration of activities from start to finish
column3: ”  |  “Calculate the temporal occurrence or the duration by the difference between consecutive events in the process flow.”

column1: Cost,Considered as an additional dimension whose variation can be captured by MFPM for multi-objective analysis.,"“… cost, representing financial resources consumed at each step of the process
Energy consumption / Electricity usage,"Core dimension in MFPM
column2: analysed to discover energy-oriented process flow, to compute energy rates per activity, and to detect inefficiencies (e.g., machines idle but still consuming power).","“… energy, detailing amount of energy required or consumed during process activities
column3: ”  |  “MFPM can uncover instances where a machine remains idle but still consumes power.”  |  “In the energy-oriented model, we prioritise energy efficiency, specifically electricity usage…”"

column1: Energy efficiency,KPI derived from energy consumption
column2: prioritised in the energy-oriented model for decision support.,"“In the energy-oriented model, we prioritise energy efficiency, specifically electricity usage…”"

column1: Waste generation / Waste volume,Dimension captured by MFPM
column2: used to build waste-oriented process flow and evaluated as KPI in the case study.,"“… waste generation , concerning the creation of waste materials as a result of process operations
column3: ”  |  “… the waste-oriented model focuses on the volume of waste as a KPI.”"

column1: Carbon footprint / Greenhouse-gas emissions,Additional sustainability dimension that MFPM can track for holistic optimisation.,“… carbon footprint measuring the total amount of greenhouse gases emitted directly or indirectly by the process.”
Throughput,Production-line KPI measured in the case study to evaluate performance.,“We measure KPIs such as throughput … for the production line.”
Output,Second production-line KPI measured together with throughput.,“We measure KPIs such as throughput and output for the production line.”
Average energy-consumption rate,Derived metric
column2: computed by aggregating energy used and dividing by activity duration to parameterise transitions.,"“… calculate the energy consumed, and the duration until the next event, allowing us to compute the average energy consumption rate for each activity.”"

column1: Average rate of change per unit time (non-time dimensions),Derived metric for dimensions like waste
column2: used when a fixed rate is applicable to immediate transitions.,“Track changes in dimension value … Calculate the average rate of change per unit of time for each related activity.”

column1: Karagiannis et al. 2007 - Business-oriented IT management - developing e-business applications with E-BPMS.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Usado como elemento de ligação entre a estratégia e o monitoramento
column2: compõe o ‘key performance indicator set’ para medir o atingimento dos objetivos.,"“The modeling classes <Success Factor>, <Goal> and <KPI> (Key Performance Indicator) are the linkage to the E-Strategy Model.” / “Selecting the right key performance indicator set is a crucial aspect.”  "

column1: Basic KPI,Versão elementar de KPI utilizada como dado de entrada para cálculos ou agregações.,Figura 2 – na legenda do metamodelo aparecem as classes «Basic KPI».
Aggregated KPI,Métrica derivada obtida por regras de agregação de vários Basic KPIs.,Figura 2 – na legenda do metamodelo aparecem as classes «Agreggated KPI».

Success Factor,Item estratégico monitorado por KPIs para verificar se os fatores críticos de sucesso estão sendo atingidos.,"“This model type uses the Balanced Scorecard … to support the definition of perspectives, success factors, goals, indicators and initiatives …” / “The modeling classes <Success Factor>, <Goal> and <KPI> … are the linkage to the E-Strategy Model.”  "
Goal,Objetivo quantificado que será avaliado por KPIs e comparado com Target Value e As-Is Value.,Mesmo trecho citado acima (uso de Balanced Scorecard) + presença da classe «Goal» na Figura 2.
Target Value,Valor-meta a ser alcançado por um indicador.,Figura 2 mostra a classe «Target Value» ligada a KPI no metamodelo.
As-Is Value,"Valor real medido de um indicador, comparado ao Target Value.",Figura 2 mostra a classe «As-Is Value» ligada a KPI no metamodelo.
Availability,Métrica técnica de TI usada para avaliar serviços
column2: citada como exemplo de indicador técnico.,"“Mostly technical metrics are used such as availability, throughput and response time …”  "

column1: Throughput,Métrica técnica que mede volume/processamento
column2: usada como exemplo de indicador técnico.,Mesmo trecho citado acima.

column1: Response time,Métrica técnica que mede tempo de resposta
column2: usada como exemplo de indicador técnico.,Mesmo trecho citado acima.

column1: Business Metrics,Indicadores de negócio utilizados para alinhar TI aos objetivos de negócio.,“…IT service management is enhanced with business metrics.” / “business-oriented management of the IT must … use business indicators to communicate the results.”

Technical Metrics,"Indicadores de natureza técnica (ex.: availability, throughput, response time) usados tradicionalmente na TI.","“Especially regarding the IT services, mostly technical metrics are used …”"
Danesh et al. 2011 - A framework for process management in service oriented virtual organizations.pdf
Medidor,Uso_no_texto,Evidência_no_texto

Measurable Organizational Values (MOVs),Indicadores de nível estratégico usados para medir a efetividade da gestão do SOVO e servir de alvo para o planejamento de valor.,"""...os critérios indicando o sucesso de SOVO a este nível são Measureable Organizational Values (MOVs)...""
column2: ""The opportunity discovery results in a set of business values that will be further discussed as Measurable Organizational Values (MOVs)...""  "

column1: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Categoria geral de medidores
column2: o texto propõe identificar diferentes KPIs para SOVO e dividi-los em camadas.,"""...identificar as diferentes categorias de Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for SOVO.""  "

column1: Service Layer KPIs,KPIs de nível operacional usados para avaliar o desempenho dos serviços de cada parceiro.,"""...estas camadas podem ser interpretadas como 1) Service Layer KPIs...""
column2: """"The service layer KPI boundaries are set in this phase...""""""  "

column1: Collaboration Performance,KPIs de nível intermediário que medem a eficácia/eficiência da interação entre parceiros.,"""The mid-level performance indicator is Collaboration Performance which is used to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of the independent partners’ interaction.""  "

Performance of the Management Approach (via MOVs),Indicadores de nível superior que avaliam a abordagem de gestão do SOVO.,"""...the performance of the management approach. ... these ... are measureable organizational values (MOVs).""  "
Balanced Scorecard (BSC),Estrutura de relacionamento de métricas financeiras e não financeiras
column2: liga as três camadas de KPI.,"""Balances Score Card (BSC) can be used to establish the links among these three layers.""  "

column1: Service Level Agreement (SLA),"Documento que consolida metas de serviço, KPIs e responsabilidades
column2: serve como base para monitoramento.","""...projected in the Service Layer Agreement (SLA). The SLA describes the Service, documents service level targets...""  "

column1: Service Level Requirement (SLR),"Especifica requisitos e métricas de desempenho de um serviço, definindo limites de KPI.","""The service level requirement (SLR) is a set of specifications and requirements for a service...""  "

Operational Level Agreement (OLA),"Acordo operacional que define suporte e metas internas, influenciando KPIs de serviço.","""Operational level agreements (OLA). OLA is an agreement on operational support...""  "

Value Target Planning,Processo que define metas de nível de serviço baseadas nos MOVs.,"""The value target planning focuses on overall service level targets based on measurable organizational values...""  "

Service Collaboration Requirement,Define métricas quantitativas de inter-dependência dos serviços derivadas do Collaboration Performance.,"""The service collaboration requirement specifies service interdependencies and their quantitative measurements derived from the collaboration performance...""  "

Business Activity Monitoring (BAM),Módulo que monitora infraestrutura e desempenho dos serviços para suportar gestão de SLA.,"""The Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) module monitors the infrastructure, and the performance of the services to facilitate the SLA management.""  "

Performance Coaching,Processo para avaliação e feedback contínuo visando melhorar o desempenho segundo metas definidas.,"""Performance coaching includes the efforts taken for performance appraisal, and providing appropriate feedbacks to partners in order to improve their performance based on the specified objectives and performance targets.""  "

Benefit Sharing,Mecanismo que distribui recompensas segundo o desempenho medido.,"""The benefit sharing component aligns VO partner benefits ... It uses performance as the criteria for assessing rewards or sharing benefits..."""
Ding et al. 2006 - Applying simulation in a supply chain transformation case.pdf
Performance Measure,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal extraída do texto
Operational efficiency,Objetivo geral de transformação da cadeia de suprimentos e resultado esperado das ações,“... helping clients improve their operational efficiency and reduce costs.”

Costs (general),Redução de custos é meta explícita e critério de avaliação das alternativas,“… improve their operational efficiency and reduce costs.” / “Financial results show that simulation has addressed the key issues …”
Forecasting accuracy,Apontada como alvo de melhorias em projetos de transformação,“… clients usually take transformation actions to improve their forecasting accuracy …”
Warehousing costs,Custo específico citado como alvo de redução,“… reduce warehousing costs …”
On-time delivery (generic),Indicador de serviço citado como problema recorrente e meta de desempenho,“… improve on-time delivery …”
Profitability,Meta financeira de curto/médio/longo prazo das iniciativas,“… all transformation initiatives are finally expected to help increase profitability …”
Customer service level,Indicador de qualidade percebida
column2: mencionado como impactado por estoque e lead time,“… a periodic review … may help … improve its customer service level …”

column1: Order cycle time,Exemplo de métrica de serviço ao cliente,"“… service level measures such as order cycle time, on-time delivery rate, etc.”"
On-time delivery rate,Métrica de confiabilidade
column2: citada no rol de service level measures,"“… service level measures such as order cycle time, on-time delivery rate, etc.”"

column1: Inventory carrying cost,Custo resultante de manter estoque
column2: usado para justificar otimização,“… help reduce its inventory carrying cost …”

column1: Sourcing time of raw materials,Tempo de aquisição usado como razão para manter estoque,“Inventory could help reduce the sourcing time of various raw materials …”
Economies of scale,Benefício de custo potencial associado a níveis de estoque/produção,“… may help an enterprise achieve economies of scale by way of volume discounts …”
Order-to-delivery cycle time (ODM),Lead time específico que gera atrasos e cancelamentos,“… due to the long order-to-delivery cycle time at the ODM side.”

Inventory position,Variável operacional monitorada no controle de estoque,“… the inventory position of raw materials is reviewed periodically. Whenever the inventory position drops below a preset base stock level …”
Order fulfillment cycle time,Primeira métrica formal definida na seção 3.2.4
column2: indica ‘responsiveness’,"“The first performance measure is order fulfillment cycle time, representing a supply chain’s responsiveness.”"

column1: On-time delivery rate (formal),Segunda métrica formal
column2: indica ‘reliability’,“The second performance measure is on time delivery rate representing a supply chain’s reliability.”

column1: Average raw material inventory level / Average raw material stock level,Terceira métrica formal
column2: indicador de ‘cost’
column3: é detalhada com fórmula,"“The third measure is the average raw material inventory level, an indicator to supply chain cost.”  /  fórmula logo abaixo"

column1: Supply-chain responsiveness,Atributo agregado avaliado via ‘order fulfillment cycle time’,“… representing a supply chain’s responsiveness.”
Supply-chain reliability,Atributo agregado avaliado via ‘on time delivery rate’,“… representing a supply chain’s reliability.”
Supply-chain cost,Atributo agregado avaliado via ‘average raw material inventory level’,“… an indicator to supply chain cost.”
Cuzzocrea et al. 2018 - A Predictive Learning Framework for Monitoring Aggregated Performance Indicators over Business Process Events.pdf
metric_id,description/type,definition / how it is used in the text,evidence (exact excerpt)

µ_I,single–instance performance metric (generic),function that assigns a numerical performance value to one process instance,“A p-instance metric for P is a function µ_I : I_P → ℝ≥0 that maps any p-instance ι of P to a performance value.”

σ_I,violation index for µ_I (generic),measures deviation of µ_I from a requirement,“A violation index for a p-instance metric µ_I is a function σ_I : ℝ≥0 → ℝ that expresses how much a performance value deviates from some predefined performance requirements.”
ϕ,S-PPI (generic),"pair ⟨µ_I , σ_I⟩ defining a single-instance indicator","“A single-instance process performance indicator (S-PPI) … is a pair ϕ = ⟨µ_I , σ_I⟩.”  "

µ_CS_I,Customer-Satisfaction metric (single instance),CS level (1–12 scale) assigned to one ticket,"“Each p-instance … is eventually assigned a Customer Satisfaction (CS) level, denoted as µ_CS_I(ι).”  "
σ_CS≥8,violation index for CS metric,σ_CS≥8(x)=8−x (positive when CS<8),“Denoting as σ_CS≥8 a violation index that returns σ_CS≥8(x)=8−x for any real performance value x …”
ϕ_CS≥8,S-PPI ‘CS≥8’,"ϕ_CS≥8 = ⟨µ_CS_I , σ_CS≥8⟩","“… we can redefine ϕ_CS≥8 as follows: ϕ_CS≥8 =⟨µ_CS_I , σ_CS≥8⟩.”  "
µ_A,aggregate metric (generic),function µ_A : 2^{I_P} → ℝ≥0 combining several instances,“An aggregate metric over ϕ is a function of the form µ_A : 2 I_P → ℝ≥0 …”
σ_A,violation index for µ_A (generic),σ_A : ℝ≥0 → ℝ applied to µ_A value,"“Formally, an aggregate PPI (short A-PPI) is a pair Φ = ⟨µ_A , σ_A⟩ …”  "
Φ,A-PPI (generic),"pair ⟨µ_A , σ_A⟩ evaluated on windows of instances",same sentence as above

µ_CSViol#_A,aggregate metric ‘# CS violations’,counts p-instances that violate ϕ_CS≥8 inside a set,“… let µ_CSViol#_A be the aggregate metric that maps any set X … to the number of p-instances of X that are positive w.r.t. ϕ_CS≥8.”
σ_CSViol#≤5_A,violation index for µ_CSViol#_A,σ_CSViol#≤5_A(x)=x−5 (positive when more than 5 violations),“… assuming that σ_CSViol#≤5_A(x)=x−5 for any aggregate performance value x.”
Φ_CSViol#≤5,A-PPI ‘≤5 CS violations per week’,"Φ_CSViol#≤5 = ⟨µ_CSViol#_A , σ_CSViol#≤5_A⟩","“… we can define Φ_CSViol#≤5 =⟨µ_CSViol#_A , σ_CSViol#≤5_A⟩.”  "
ω,event aggregation measure (generic),ω : 2^E → ℝ≥0 computes a numeric summary for a set of events,“An event aggregation measure … is a function of the form ω : 2E → ℝ≥0 …”
Ctx,multidimensional event aggregation measure,"Ctx(s)=⟨ω1(s),…,ωv(s)⟩ stores several aggregated context values","“… a ‘multidimensional’ event aggregation measure Ctx(·)=⟨ω1(·), … , ωv(·)⟩ …”  "
ω_startCount,derived event measure – number of p-instances started in a slot,specialisation of ω for counting starts,"“… workload measures, such as: the total number of p-instances started in s …”  "
ω_eventEntity,derived event measure – number of events for a given entity,another specialisation of ω,“… and the number of events of s that refer to a given process/organisation entity.”
Y,target time series of aggregate performance,stores µ_A value for every slot,"“… Y =⟨y0, y1, …⟩ — where yi is the value taken on slot si by some chosen aggregate metric µ_A …”  "
X,auxiliary context time series,stores Ctx values for every slot,"“… an auxiliary time series X =⟨x0, x1, …⟩, which is exploited to better predict future values of the target one Y …”  "
Precision (P),evaluation metric for predictions,P = TP / (TP+FP) used to assess classification,"“we measured the classical precision (P), recall (R), and f-measure (F) measures.”  "
Recall (R),evaluation metric for predictions,R = TP / (TP+FN),same sentence as above
F-measure (F),harmonic mean of P and R,F = 2PR/(P+R),same sentence as above
g-mean (G),evaluation metric for imbalanced data,geometric mean of class-wise accuracies,“… we also computed the g-mean (G) measure [12].”
Pertsas and Constantopoulos 2017 - Scholarly Ontology - modelling scholarly practices.pdf

Effectiveness,Apontado como uma dimensão de avaliação para medir o desempenho de bibliotecas digitais.,“...key aspects modelled as evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence...”

Performance measurement,Descrito como uma dimensão de avaliação específica para aferir desempenho em bibliotecas digitais.,“...evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence...”

Service quality,Usado como dimensão para avaliar a qualidade percebida de serviços em bibliotecas digitais.,“...evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence...”

Outcomes assessment,Apresentado como métrica para verificar resultados obtidos por bibliotecas digitais.,“...evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence...”

Technical excellence,Métrica utilizada para avaliar a excelência técnica de bibliotecas digitais.,“...evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence...”
Koetter and Kochanowski 2013 - A model-driven approach for event-based business process monitoring.pdf
name,type,usage / description,evidence in text
Parameter timestamp,Parameter (Timestamp),Automatically added (or modelled) in every measuring point to record the point in time when the measurement is taken
column2: used later to calculate durations and timing goals.,"""As each measurement occurs at a speciﬁc time, each measuring point has to have a parameter timestamp of type Timestamp, which is either modeled explicitly or added to the generated ProGoalML automatically."" "

column1: Parameter RequestID,Parameter (ID),Unique identifier that allows all measurements that belong to the same support-request instance to be correlated.,"""First, the support request is opened and the request is given a RequestID , a parameter of type ID, measured in a measuring point called MP1."" "
Parameter Resolved,Parameter (Boolean),Indicates whether the support request has been solved at a given level
column2: later used in KPI and goal calculations (e.g. to filter unresolved tickets).,"""In the ﬁrst level support process, the parameter Resolved marks if the request has been resolved at this stage."" "

column1: Parameter TotalCost,Parameter (Double / Currency),Captures the cumulative cost of handling the support request
column2: used to derive the Cost_second_level KPI.,"""The total cost TotalCost of the process is also available at MP2."" "

column1: Parameter Level,Parameter (Enumeration / Integer),Stores the support level that handled the request
column2: later used to build the derived KPI Resolved_Level.,"""CASE WHEN (MP4.Level=""1"") THEN ""1"" WHEN (MP4.Resolved) THEN ""2"" ELSE ""Other"" END AS Resolved_Level"" "

column1: Duration_secondlevel,KPI (instance based),Measures how long the second-level support phase lasts for a single request (MP3.timestamp – MP2.timestamp)
column2: feeds aggregated KPIs.,"""First of all, the duration of the second level is measured as Duration_secondlevel. This is derived from MP3.timestamp - MP2.timestamp, aggregated over a certain time."" "

column1: Kauffman et al. 2018 - A metrics suite of cloud computing adoption readiness.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence / citação do texto

Perceived compatibility,Categoria-mãe para avaliar se a solução em nuvem ‘casa’ com os sistemas e valores existentes da firma,"“Perceived compatibility. Risk with degree that cloud technology fits with potential adopter’s organizational values, practices and needs.”"
Network access,Indicador de compatibilidade
column2: risco de a rede suportar o serviço sem latência ou falhas,"“To assess expected compatibility, we use network access … Cloud computing requires high-quality network access and minimal latency (Vouk 2008).”"

column1: Virtualization preparedness,Indicador de compatibilidade
column2: mede experiência prévia da firma com virtualização,“… and virtualization preparedness. Experience with virtualization will also reduce the expected costs and uncertainties associated with cloud migration (Jamshidi et al. 2013).”

column1: Expected service quality,Sub-categoria geral para medir riscos ligados à qualidade de serviço esperada,“Expected service quality is critical for boosting senior management’s view of firm-level IS success.”
Security,"Mede riscos de confidencialidade, falhas ou violações","“The indicators of security risks include contractual loopholes, confidentiality, information security, and service outages.”"
Availability,Percentual de tempo em que o serviço fica acessível,"“Clients expect high availability, based on the percentage of time they can access the services (Garg et al. 2013).”"
Scalability,Capacidade de o serviço escalar com o crescimento da demanda,“Scalability measures clients’ needs for services that scale to the organization’s demand (Venters and Whitley 2012).”

Executive support,Apoio da alta gestão como condição de prontidão,"“Executive support is critical for creating a supportive climate, with adequate resources and opportunities for cloud adoption (Low et al. 2011).”"
Organizational innovativeness,Grau em que a organização procura e aceita inovações,“Organizational innovativeness affects a firm’s intention to adopt new ITs (Barczak et al. 2007).”
Perceived strategic value of the cloud,Percepção de vantagem competitiva gerada pela nuvem,“…and perceptions of strategic value and competitive advantage matter too (Hsu et al. 2014).”

Absorptive capacity for the cloud,Capacidade de adquirir e aplicar conhecimento externo sobre nuvem,“We assessed external and internal knowledge acquisition and dissemination for organizational absorptive capacity (Liao et al. 2003).”
Vendor management capacity,Habilidade contratual e relacional para gerir provedores de nuvem,“…contractual and relational governance for vendor management capacity (Poppo and Zenger 2002).”

Vendor’s service terms,"Avalia flexibilidade de tarifas (pay-per-use, assinatura etc.)","“Vendor service terms: Organization’s risk and uncertainty with whether the vendor will offer flexibility (usage-based fees, subscription fees, and hybrid pricing).”"

Estimated cost-benefit,Cálculo de custos totais vs. benefícios tangíveis/intangíveis,"“Estimated cost-benefit: Uncertainty about total cost of cloud services, including contract costs, expenses of operational processes and systems adjustment, and hidden costs for IT interoperability …”"
Experience with cloud contracts,Experiência prévia da firma em negociar cláusulas e saídas,"“…organization’s experience with cloud contracts, especially how to achieve contract flexibility…”"

Ability to leverage cloud market maturity,Avalia se o mercado é maduro o suficiente para reduzir riscos,“Ability to leverage cloud market maturity: Whether risk arises … with the lack of maturity and stability with vendors in the cloud services market.”

Stability of available market supply,Risco associado à falta de provedores alternativos,“Stability of available market supply: Uncertainty of senior management about whether alternative cloud vendors are available.”

Vendor financial stability assessment,Cheque de solvência do provedor para evitar riscos de continuidade,"“Vendor financial stability assessment: Whether the vendor is known to be financially stable, so that no major risks have to be borne by firm with cloud adoption.”"

Vendor technical capacity assessment,Avalia sofisticação técnica do provedor para entregar SLAs,“Vendor technical capacity assessment: Whether there is uncertainty associated with the vendor’s technical sophistication to deliver effective and reliable cloud services.”

Technology uncertainty,Incerteza sobre evolução de padrões e interoperabilidade,"“…Technology uncertainty: Tech standards, new technologies, and other issues related to interoperability affect organizational perceptions …”"
Pressure from competitors,Pressão competitiva para adoção gera risco/opção de perda,“…pressure from competitors: actions of competing firms and their cloud strategies create uncertainties …”

Pressure from alliances,Necessidade de co-adoção em redes e parcerias,“…pressure from alliances: other uncertainties arise when organisation become involved in multi-firm alliances that require co-adoption …”

Regulatory considerations for the firm,"Riscos regulatórios (privacidade, soberania de dados)",“Regulatory considerations for the firm: Create risk and uncertainty … related to how vendors must handle and protect client data …”
Weighted Methods per Class (WMC),Métrica de engenharia de software para produtividade/qualidade,"“Chidamber and Kemerer (1994) proposed a six-dimension model, including weighted methods per class …”"
Depth of Inheritance Tree (DIT),Mede profundidade de herança em OO
column2: relaciona-se a esforço de manutenção,same citação anterior

column1: Number of Children (NOC),Conta subclasses
column2: usada em planejamento de projeto OO,same citação anterior

column1: Coupling Between Object Classes (CBO),Mede acoplamento
column2: indicador de complexidade,same citação anterior

column1: Response For a Class (RFC),Conta métodos potencialmente executáveis
column2: impacto em testes,same citação anterior

column1: Lack of Cohesion in Methods (LCOM),Mede coesão
column2: usado para prever retrabalho,same citação anterior

column1: Organizational learning and growth (BSC),Perspectiva do Balanced Scorecard que direciona inovação e capacitação,“It integrates quantitative financial outcome measures and qualitative non-financial performance drivers. It also assumes there is a causal chain … starting from measures of organizational learning and growth …”
Internal business processes (BSC),Outro pilar do Balanced Scorecard,same trecho acima
Client perspective (BSC),Foco em satisfação/valor para o cliente,same trecho acima
Financial performance (BSC),Perspectiva financeira do Balanced Scorecard,same trecho acima

Intangible capabilities / performance drivers,Uso de métricas não financeiras para avaliar capacidade de inovação,“ … and simplify financial risks based on a set of numerical measures.” (referindo-se ao BSC e métricas intangíveis)

Economic Value Added (EVA),Métrica financeira que subtrai custo do capital do lucro operacional,“EVA is the difference between accounting earnings and the cost of capital used to generate the earnings (Stern et al. 1996).”

Value-at-Risk (VaR),Mede perda máxima esperada a um nível de confiança,“VaR represents the worst expected loss over a given time horizon under normal market conditions at a given level of confidence.”

Net Present Value (NPV),Exemplo de métrica quantitativa usada em análise de investimento de TI,"“… quantitative method of valuation via net present value (NPV) analysis, where many different assessments …”"
ROI (Return on Investment),Indicador de retorno percentual usado em vários casos (JetBlue 140 % etc.),"“JetBlue reported a 140 % ROI, with 8 months to pay-back of its investment.”"
Payback period,Tempo necessário para recuperar o investimento,same citação JetBlue
Cost savings,Benefício econômico direto citado em estudos de caso,"“an annual saving of US$72,916 in advertising production cost”"
Revenue growth,Métrica de resultado financeiro pós-adoção,“the firm reported a 38 % gain in global sales revenues for the prior year.”
Service quality (global),Indicador agregado de qualidade de serviço em nuvem,“Expected service quality is critical for boosting senior management’s view of firm-level IS success…”
Cloud Readiness Index,Índice macro de prontidão de países
column2: inspiração para abordagem micro,“… developed a country-level cloud readiness index to assess the national penetration of cloud computing …”

column1: Lauras et al. 2011 - A business process oriented method to design supply chain performance measurement systems.pdf
Performance Metric,Usage / Context in the text,Evidence (exact quotation or figure reference)
Number of units by plant,Result indicator that measures the total production activity,“product flows are followed-up both in term of number of units by plant (measure of the total activity)”
Stock-out rate,Result indicator that measures service quality delivered to customers,“product flows are followed-up … and the stock out rate (measure of the service quality)”
Cost of the activity,Determinant (and ambition P.V.) used to follow the absolute manufacturing cost,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Cost of the activity”
Relative cost deviation,Ambition point-of-view KPI comparing real cost vs. target cost,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Relative cost deviation”
Productivity,Reality point-of-view KPI
column2: also determinant (units/day) to assess process efficiency,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Productivity”
column3: text: “criteria … productivity in made units/day”

column1: Sub-contracting rate,Determinant and facility P.V. KPI that tracks external capacity used,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Subcontracting rate”
column2: text: “effective costs for adjusting resources (sub-contracting …)”

column1: Complete orders delivered on time,Reality P.V. KPI that measures service reliability,“criteria … complete orders delivered on time … associated with the determinant ‘adaptability of the resources’ ”
Obsolete units / total units,Reality P.V. KPI that measures inventory obsolescence,“criteria … obsolete units/total units”
Returned units / total units,Reality P.V. KPI that measures quality seen by customer (returns),“criteria … returned units/total units”
Cp inventory rotation,Determinant KPI measuring rotation of components stock,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Cp inventory rotation”
Cp rotation deviation,Ambition P.V. KPI comparing actual vs. target component rotation,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Cp rotation deviation”
FP inventory rotation,Determinant KPI measuring rotation of finished-product stock,Figure 9 – KPI list under “FP inventory rotation”
FP rotation deviation,Ambition P.V. KPI comparing actual vs. target FP rotation,Figure 9 – KPI list under “FP rotation deviation”

Utilisation rate (hours used / hours available),Facility P.V. KPI that evaluates capacity use of technical means,“technical resources … indicators measure the efficiency of the means (hours effectively used/hours available …)”
Temporary employment,Facility P.V. KPI that tracks extra human resources hired,“human resources … track the need for extra resources … (temporary employees …)”
Obsolescence rate,Result / reality KPI measuring aging inventory losses,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Obsolescence rate”
Break-down rate,Facility P.V. KPI evaluating technical reliability of equipment,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Breakdown rate”
Cycle time,Determinant KPI measuring overall manufacturing lead time,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Cycle time”
column2: text: “total cycle time”

column1: Cycle time deviation,Ambition P.V. KPI comparing actual vs. target lead time,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Cycle time deviation”
Scrap rate,Reality / facility KPI measuring internal non-quality losses,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Scrap rate”
Non-quality rate,Facility P.V. KPI measuring defective output,Figure 9 – KPI list under “Non-Quality rate”

Service level,Strategic objective used as control for activities (linked to stock-out & on-time),"“The objectives are to minimise the costs on the one hand, and to maximise the service level on the other hand.”"
Costs,Strategic objective / control variable for ambition analysis,same quotation as above

Inventory rotation of final products,Determinant measuring process duration (storage efficiency),“measures of the process duration (inventory rotation of the final products and elementary components …)”
Inventory rotation of elementary components,Determinant measuring process duration in raw/component stage,same quotation as above
Profitability,Shareholder KPI category in SCOR dashboard,"“shareholders (profitability, return on investments)”"
Return on investments,Shareholder KPI category in SCOR dashboard,same quotation as above
Flexibility,Customer-oriented KPI category in SCOR dashboard,"“customers (service, flexibility, effectiveness-swiftness)”"
Effectiveness-swiftness,Customer-oriented KPI category in SCOR dashboard,same quotation as above
Efficiency,Internal-process KPI category in SCOR dashboard,“internal processes (costs and efficiencies)”
Quiroz-Flores et al. 2022 - Integrated BPM-TPM Maintenance Model to reduce over-time order rate in heavy-duty sector SMEs - A Research in Peru.pdf
Indicador,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Out-of-Time Order Rate (OTR),#late orders / #total orders x 100 – mede a % de pedidos entregues fora do prazo
column2: principal KPI a ser reduzido,“...reduzir o current rate of orders delivered out of time of 4.78 %... After the implementation through a pilot plan ... a reduction of 0.72 % was obtained.” (Resumo) / “Indicator Table – Out of time order rate (OTR)… The calculation of orders that were not delivered within the time agreed by the customer per month.”

column1: Percentage of Non-Conforming Clients (PCI),NCI / CE x 100 – monitora a % de clientes que se declaram insatisfeitos,“Indicator Table – Percentage of non-conforming clients (PCI) … NCI is the number of non-conforming clients and CE is the number of clients surveyed.”
Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF),Operation time / #failures – tempo médio de operação entre falhas
column2: usado para avaliar confiabilidade da frota,“Indicator Table – Mean time between failures (MTBF)… The average time a truck operates between failures.” / “the frequency of MTBF failures increased to every 37.28 hours”

column1: Mean Time To Repair (MTTR),Time spent on repairs / #reparations – tempo médio para reparar e recolocar o caminhão em serviço,“Indicator Table – Mean Time to Repair (MTTR)… Time spent to repair a failure and return the truck to its optimum condition.” / “the repair time (MTTR) decreased to 6.8 hours.”
Availability Index (Ai),MTBF / (MTBF + MTTR) x 100 – disponibilidade efetiva da frota
column2: utilizado para medir capacidade de atendimento,“Indicator Table – Availability Index (Ai)… calculated using MTBF and MTTR.” / “truck availability from 73.15 % to 81.25 %.”

column1: Truck Availability (derivado de Ai),% de caminhões disponíveis para receber pedidos
column2: impacta capacidade e nível de serviço,“an increase of 8.1 % in the availability of units in the company.”

column1: Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) / Total Equipment Effectiveness,% global de efetividade do equipamento
column2: citado como resultado de estudos de TPM,“applying TPM its percentage of total equipment effectiveness increased from 54.23 % to 66.90 %.”

column1: Call Waiting Time,Tempo que o cliente espera para confirmação do pedido
column2: usado como métrica de processo logístico,"“the call waiting time, which obtained a reduction of 82.98 %...”  "

column1: Operating Costs,Custo operacional mensal/anual relacionado a atrasos
column2: usado para quantificar impacto financeiro,"“operating costs of around S/ 88,800.73 … the company would be saving S/ 6,285.41 per month in operating costs.”  "

column1: Penalty Costs,Multas pagas por entregas fora do prazo
column2: métrica financeira associada ao OTR,"“penalties of S/ 7016.66 for such late delivery” / “decrease in penalty costs … savings of S/ 5,960.61 per year.”"

column1: Pepino et al. 2015 - A simulation model for analyzing the nurse workload in a university hospital ward.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Key Performance Indicators (KPI),Conjunto de indicadores que o modelo analisa para avaliar e prever o comportamento do sistema após modificações.,“…study its responses to further modifications by then analyzing the Key Performance Indicators (KPI) (Torri et al. 2015).”

Patient assistance timing,"Tempo total de assistência prestada ao paciente, calculado pelo modelo para comparar diferentes cenários.",“…which allowed the calculation of patient assistance timing as well as the efficiency of personnel use depending on the patient autonomy.”

Efficiency of personnel use,"Mede o grau de utilização/eficácia da força de trabalho de enfermagem e apoio, calculado a partir do tempo gasto com pacientes versus tempo disponível.",“…patient assistance timing as well as the efficiency of personnel use depending on the patient autonomy.”
% Nurse Utilization,Percentual de tempo em que os enfermeiros estão ocupados
column2: reportado como resultado do modelo e comparado com o caso real.,“At the end of the simulation the model reports: • % nurse use
column3: ” / “% Nurse 57% … the result conforms to the real case”

column1: % Support Staff Utilization,Percentual de tempo em que a equipe de apoio está ocupada
column2: também reportado para avaliação de capacidade.,“At the end of the simulation the model reports: • % support personnel use
column3: ” / “% Support staff 70% … the result conforms to the real case”

column1: Assistance in minutes to patient per day,Tempo médio diário de assistência direta ao paciente em minutos
column2: gerado como saída principal do modelo.,“At the end of the simulation the model reports: • Assistance in minutes to patient per day.”

column1: Residual Nursing Activities,Número de atividades de enfermagem que não puderam ser concluídas dentro do turno
column2: indica sobrecarga.,“Residual Nursing Activities 3 – The nursing staff is within the limit…”

column1: Residual Support Personnel Activities,Número de atividades de pessoal de apoio pendentes
column2: sinaliza insuficiência de recursos.,“Residual Support Personnel Activities 83 – The support staff are not sufficient…”

column1: Average Days of Hospitalization,Duração média de internação (LOS)
column2: usada para validar o modelo e como indicador de eficiência do fluxo de pacientes.,“Average Days of Hospitalization 8 days – The result conforms to the real case” / “Mean hospitalization time”

column1: Average Bedside Time (min.) per autonomy grade,Tempo médio à beira-leito segmentado pelos níveis de autonomia (A–D)
column2: permite analisar impacto da dependência do paciente na carga de trabalho.,Tabela 4 “Average Bedside Time (min.) versus autonomy grade”

column1: Occupational Index,Índice de ocupação de leitos (leitos ocupados ÷ leitos disponíveis)
column2: configurável para testar diferentes cargas de pacientes.,“Occupational index (N beds occupied / N beds available )”

column1: Discharge value,"Número de pacientes com alta por dia
column2: definido como entrada e usado para gerar tokens na simulação, influenciando o fluxo e a carga de trabalho.",“Discharge value (number of patients discharged from the ward per day)”

column1: Nurse workload points (RAFAELA),Pontuação atribuída à intensidade de cuidados segundo o método RAFAELA
column2: serve para dimensionar carga de trabalho e necessidades de pessoal.,“The evaluation of the nurse working load by assigning points to the intensity of the cure… is at the basis of the RAFAELA method.”

column1: Case mix / Complexity index,Índice de complexidade que orienta a quantidade de recursos de enfermagem necessária segundo a norma italiana (GU29).,“…evaluation of the case mix index value…”
Kregel et al. 2022 - Business Process Management Culture in Public Administration and Its Determinants.pdf
Operational performance
column2: Resultado operacional associado a cultura organizacional e práticas de TQM
column3: “The relationships between organizational culture, total quality management practices and operational performance.” (Baird et al. 2011, citado)

column1: Efficiency
column2: Meta de reformas e digitalização do setor público, usada para avaliar resultados
column3: “stakeholders of public administration expect … more efficient encounters” e “managerial reforms … targeted at ‘increase … efficiency, responsiveness and accountability of public managers’”.

column1: Performance measurement
column2: Prática de mensuração sistemática usada para responsabilização e melhoria
column3: “These targets include management of results, a higher importance of performance measurement, and the question of managerial autonomy (Bezes and Jeannot 2018).”

column1: Djedović et al. 2016 - Optimization of the Business Processes via automatic integration with the Document Management System.pdf
PerformanceMeasure,UsageInText,TextEvidence

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),General performance framework used to identify bottlenecks and follow‐up improvements,“The model that is created enables monitoring of defined Key Performance Indicators in the identification process of the bottlenecks in the process.”
Time (general),One of the three main KPIs analysed for every process and activity,"“Performances can be analyzed in three KPIs: time, price and the number of instances.”  "
Process Execution Time,Total time of a single process instance
column2: basis for optimisation and cost calculation,“The execution time of the process for a single instance can be calculated as the sum of the time execution of all the activities in the process.”

column1: Activity Duration,Time taken by each individual activity
column2: summed to obtain process time,“…sum of the time execution of all the activities in the process.”

column1: Execution Time of ‘Collection of Documents’,Specific activity-level measure used to locate the main bottleneck,“Fig. 5. also shows that Collection of the documents activity has the longest execution time of more than one day.”
Cost / Price (general),Second main KPI used together with time for performance evaluation,"“Performances can be analyzed in three KPIs: time, price and the number of instances.”  "
Lee 2013 - An integrated model of team motivation and worker skills for a computer-based project management simulation.pdf
Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência no texto

Pearson Product-Moment Correlation Coefficient,Mede o grau de correlação entre o perfil de habilidades do trabalhador (ou da equipe) e o perfil de habilidades exigido pela tarefa.,“A popular model that measures this correlation is the Pearson Product-Moment Correlation Coefficient … giving a value from −1 … to +1.”
Normalized Pearson Coefficient,Valor do Pearson convertido para uma escala de 0 a 100 %
column2: usado diretamente como índice de eficiência da equipe.,"“I normalized the Pearson Coefficients to between 0 and 100% … Based on this evaluation, resource B seems the most suitable …”  "

column1: Efficiency Index,"Índice usado para ajustar o tempo real da tarefa
column2: quanto maior, menor o tempo para completar a tarefa.",“The efficiency index (normalized Pearson Coefficient) reflects the team’s effectiveness which is inversely proportional to the time taken to complete the task.”

column1: Soma dos escores de habilidade,Tentativa de medir adequação tarefa-recurso somando todos os escores de habilidade.,"“A simple approach is to compute the sum … across the different skills for both, the task and resources.”  "
Média dos escores de habilidade,Tentativa de medir adequação tarefa-recurso pela média dos escores de habilidade.,“A simple approach is to compute the sum and average across the different skills …”

Absolute Difference,Diferença absoluta entre escores da tarefa e do recurso para avaliar adequação.,“…all three resources are found suitable for the task based on the absolute differences between the task and resource skills.”
Team Ratio,Razão entre número de funcionários alocados e número recomendado
column2: afeta a eficácia da equipe.,“The effect of team size is represented by a ratio of the number of staff assigned to a particular task against the recommended number of staff for that task.”

column1: Team Efficiency,Produto do Efficiency Index pelo Team Ratio
column2: usado para calcular tempo real da tarefa.,“The overall effectiveness of the team is computed as a product of the efficiency index and the team ratio.”

column1: Standard Task Time,Tempo padrão previsto para executar uma tarefa antes de ajustes de eficiência.,“Each task has a standard task time and a recommended number of staff that can be assigned.”

Actual Task Time,Tempo efetivo para concluir a tarefa após ajustes de eficiência e tamanho da equipe.,"“if the efficiency index is 95% and the standard task time is 5 minutes, the actual time taken … is 5.26 minutes (5/95%).”  "
Skill Level (S),Nível de habilidade atual de um trabalhador
column2: varia com aprendizagem e esquecimento.,"“S is the skill level of worker, Smax is a theoretical maximum level of skill…”  "

column1: Maximum Skill (Smax),Valor máximo teórico que a habilidade pode atingir
column2: parâmetro do modelo de aprendizagem.,“Smax is a theoretical maximum level of skill.”

column1: Remnant Skill (SR),Parte remanescente da habilidade adquirida anteriormente
column2: usada nas fórmulas de melhoria/decadência.,“SR is the remnants of workers skill which was gained by performing the task in the past.”

column1: Skill Improvement,Medida (função exponencial crescente) do ganho de habilidade com prática.,“they suggest skill improvement (or learning) can be measured as an increasing function … represented by an exponential function.”
Motivation Level,Percentual que representa o moral da equipe
column2: influencia qualidade e outros resultados.,“Motivation level should be kept as high as possible.” / “motivation levels influence project quality.”

column1: Project Cost (%),Percentual do orçamento gasto
column2: >100 % indica estouro de custos.,"“Project cost should be kept as low as possible: 100% is on budget, above which is cost overrun.”  "

column1: Project Schedule (%),Percentual do cronograma
column2: >100 % indica atraso.,"“Project schedule should be as low as possible, 100% is on schedule, anything above that is considered project delay.”  "

column1: Project Quality (%),Percentual que representa quão bem a qualidade atende às expectativas
column2: <100 % não atende.,"“Quality should be kept as high as possible, 100% is meeting expectation, below that is not meeting customer’s expectation.”"

column1: Lohrmann and Reichert 2016 - Effective application of process improvement patterns to business processes.pdf
Total Hiring Cost
column2: Avalia impacto anual do processo sobre o orçamento
column3: “generating and managing about 29,000 applications per year would thus result in 11.6 m Euros total cost”

column1: Manual Processing Effort (min/instância, FTE)
column2: Usado para estimar capacidade e potencial de economia
column3: “manual effort … about 5 minutes per routing… 90 routings/day ⇒ 0.7 FTEs”

column1: Ketykó et al. 2022 - What averages do not tell - predicting real life processes with sequential deep learning.pdf
metric,how_it_is_used,evidence_in_text

Damerau-Levenshtein distance (DL),Usado como medida primária para avaliar a qualidade da predição de sufixos comparando a sequência prevista com a sequência real.,“we use Damerau-Levenstein distance (DL)” (Sec. 4.1 Evaluation Measures)
Damerau-Levenshtein Similarity (DLS),É a versão normalizada e invertida do DL
column2: é o valor efetivamente reportado como métrica de desempenho das arquiteturas.,“We normalise it and take the inverse of it to end up with Damerau-Levenstein Similarity (DLS) score.” (Sec. 4.1)

column1: Absolute Error (AE),Erro absoluto entre o tempo restante real e o tempo restante previsto calculado para cada sufixo.,“we compute the absolute error between the ground truth remaining time and the predicted remaining time for each predicted and ground truth suffixes.” (Sec. 4.1)
Mean Absolute Error (MAE),Média dos erros absolutos calculados
column2: utilizada como métrica de desempenho para a tarefa de tempo restante.,"“Next, we average these numbers for evaluation instances, and report Mean Absolute Error (MAE).” (Sec. 4.1)"

column1: Categorical Cross-Entropy Loss,Função de perda empregada para aprender/predizer variáveis categóricas (rótulos de atividade)
column2: também passível de ser usada como métrica.,“Learning for the categorical features is via the categorical cross-entropy loss (i.e. … ): Lcross-entropy = −a(i) · log ˆa(i).” (Sec. 3.3)

column1: Squared Error (SE),Função de perda usada para aprender/predizer variáveis contínuas (tempos)
column2: também pode ser reportada como métrica.,“Learning for the continuous features is via the squared error … : Lsquared error = (ˆt(i) − t(i))^2.” (Sec. 3.3)

column1: Weighted Sum of Losses,"Combinação ponderada do cross-entropy e do squared error, utilizada como métrica global de otimização do modelo.",“The final loss is a weighted sum of the individual losses.” (Sec. 3.3)
Edison et al. 2015 - Lean startup - why large software companies should care.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (excerpt from the paper)
Net Promoter Score (NPS),Primary indicator of product acceptance and user experience
column2: together with #Users it drives management’s go/kill decisions and is compared with competitors’ thresholds.,"“The top management always relied on two measures: net promotor score (NPS) and the amount of users… In game, they don’t even release if NPS is low, so they killed it before release.”  "

column1: # Users / Amount of Users,Growth and traction metric
column2: paired with NPS for deciding whether to continue or stop an internal–startup project.,“We trust NPS and the amount of users. …these two measures are enough to decide whether to stop the process or to continue.”

column1: Release Frequency / Speed of Development,Measures development performance
column2: internal-startup team shows ≈6-7× faster cycle (monthly vs yearly releases) than the rest of the company.,"“We have a monthly release minimum. So the speed of development we have is actually six, seven times faster than pretty much any other team in the company.”  "

column1: Time-to-Release Target,"Used as contractual milestone for funding tranches—e.g., 6 months to ship iOS/Android MVP, 3 months for Windows Phone version.",“We were given a time slot… six months and we had to get iPhone and Android versions out… the next period was three months and we had to get the Windows phone out.”
Time between Pivots,Lean-startup efficiency metric
column2: minimising it is said to keep startups from bankruptcy.,"“Pivot is common to any startup, since it will help the startup from bankruptcy if time between pivots is minimised [24].”  "

column1: Failure Rate (% of start-ups that fail),Risk metric invoked to justify cautious investment in corporate venturing (≈90 % expected failure).,"“If you check just the statistics, 90 % fail… ‘Why would you invest, when you know the likelihood of failure is 90 %?’ ”  "
Klessascheck et al. 2025 - SOPA - a framework for sustainability-oriented process analysis and re-design in business process management.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Impacto ambiental (geral) / Custo ambiental,Medida central para avaliar o quanto um processo de negócio afeta a sustentabilidade ambiental
column2: serve de base para todos os cálculos do SOPA.,“SOPA allows process stakeholders to assess the environmental impact of a business process holistically”

column1: Emissões de carbono,Citada como um dos indicadores tradicionais usados isoladamente para medir impacto ambiental.,"“…concentrate on a limited set of measures … (e.g., carbon emissions and energy consumption (Fritsch et al. 2022))”  "
Emissões de gases de efeito estufa (GHG),"Indicador usado em abordagens prévias (p.ex., Wesumperuma et al.) para avaliar processos.",“…focus on greenhouse gas emissions and labor cost.”
Consumo de energia,Outro indicador tradicional limitado para avaliar impacto ambiental de processos.,“…limited set of measures … carbon emissions and energy consumption…”

Uso/pegada de água,Indicador adicional citado em trabalhos relacionados para medir impacto de processos.,"“…environmental impact in terms of greenhouse gas emissions, water usage and energy consumption…”  "
Uso do solo,Categoria de impacto contemplada por LCA que processos podem afetar.,"“…dimensions … land use, aquatic acidification…”  "
Acidificação aquática,Categoria de impacto contemplada por LCA.,"“…land use, aquatic acidification, or other substances toxic to humans…”  "
Degradação da camada de ozono,Indicador de LCIA usado para medir impacto ambiental.,“impact categories … degree of ozone layer depletion…”
Ecotoxicidade,Categoria de LCIA para avaliar toxicidade sobre ecossistemas.,"“…impact categories … ecotoxicity, human toxicity, climate change…”  "
Toxicidade humana,Categoria de LCIA para medir efeitos sobre a saúde humana.,“…impact categories … human toxicity…”
Contribuição para mudança climática,Categoria de LCIA
column2: avalia emissões que aquecem o clima.,“…impact categories … climate change”

column1: Consumo de recursos (resource usage),Usado em simulação para estimar insumos necessários ao processo.,“…performance report … provides … resource usage of the current process design”

Custo do processo (financeiro),Dimensão clássica de desempenho a ser otimizada em BPM.,"“re-design objectives commonly include improvement of process performance among the dimensions of time, cost, quality, and flexibility”  "
Tempo / Throughput time,Medidor de rapidez do processo
column2: obtido por simulação ou logs.,"“…probable throughput time, process costs and resource usage…”  "

column1: Qualidade,Dimensão tradicional de desempenho considerada em re-design.,"“…dimensions of time, cost, quality, and flexibility”  "
Flexibilidade,Outra dimensão clássica de avaliação de processos.,"“…time, cost, quality, and flexibility”  "

Score único agregado de LCA,Resultado ponderado/normalizado que expressa o impacto ambiental total em unidade sem dimensão.,"“…aggregate them into a single score, expressing in a unit-less manner the overall environmental impact of the considered system.”  "
Environmental Activity Instance Cost,Custo ambiental de uma execução individual de atividade
column2: calculado pela soma dos custos dos drivers concretos.,"“For each instance, the environmental cost can be calculated … activity_instance_cost (a,Q)= Σ cost(q)”  "

column1: Environmental Process Instance Cost,Custo ambiental de uma instância completa do processo
column2: soma dos custos das atividades da instância.,"“process_instance_cost (t)= Σ activity_instance_cost (a,Q)”  "

column1: Average Environmental Activity Cost,Média do custo ambiental de uma atividade ao longo de todas as instâncias do processo.,"“the average environmental cost of a specific activity across all process instances can be calculated … average_activity_cost(a,T)= …”  "
Average Environmental Process Instance Cost,Média do custo ambiental por instância de processo
column2: usada para comparar cenários.,“Average Environmental Process Instance Cost 7.00×10⁻⁴ … 3.48×10⁻⁴ … 2.44×10⁻⁴”

column1: Percentual de redução de impacto,Métrica derivada usada para comparar cenários de re-design quanto à diminuição do impacto.,“would incur an overall impact reduction of 50.18 %. … would reduce the environmental impact by 65.08 % per process instance”

column1: Emissão de CO₂ / Pegada de Carbono (Carbon footprint),Indicador-chave para medir impacto ambiental da TI e de processos de negócio,“CO₂ emission (carbon footprint) is used as a parameter to measure if information technology is applied in a sustainable manner”

column1: Participação de energia renovável,Usada como meta de sustentabilidade em smart grids e relatórios corporativos,“…introduction of the smart grid to increase the share of renewable energy…”

column1: Economia de material (Material savings),Indicador de redução de insumos físicos obtida via substituição por produtos/serviços virtuais,“The main goals of green IT are energy and material savings as well as simultaneously increased efficiency”

Palmer and Caldwell 2011 - Improving computer-mediated information alignment in production organizations.pdf
PerformanceMeasure,Usage_in_Text,Evidence_from_Text

Group task performance,Referenced as a key outcome that teams aim to improve and that is affected by information alignment and group dynamics.,"""The prevalence of work teams in organizations highlights the need to understand the factors that influence group task performance (Whitney 1994)."""
Acceptable output to customers (team output),Defined as one formal way organizations judge performance
column2: used as a baseline for evaluating team success.,"""Sundstrom et al. (1990) define performance measures as the acceptable output to customers within or outside the organization who receive team products, services, information, decisions, or performance events..."""

column1: Effectiveness,Used as a derivative/secondary metric that tracks progress toward goals and performance measures.,"""These goals are identified as performance measures and the team’s progress toward that metric is called effectiveness. Effectiveness is defined as the capability of, or success in, achieving a given goal."""

Goal attainment,"Treated as a performance benchmark—if goals are met, performance is considered good.","""In pursuit of goal attainment, it is understood that group members should be motivated to improve their performance plans because ... more efficient work methods contribute to improved group performance (Weldon et al., 1991)."""
Productivity,General indicator of organizational or team performance
column2: often linked to information alignment and IT implementation.,"""The author witnessed the difference in meeting contract deadlines and productivity during the transition to becoming paperless...""
column3: ""To coordinate over time and distance, a technological intervention is required... overload in this case occurs when an email is not viewed or not viewed in time due to an excess in demands."" (productivity loss example)"

column1: Meeting contract deadlines,Specific schedule-based measure of production performance cited as being influenced by information systems alignment.,"""The author witnessed the difference in meeting contract deadlines and productivity during the transition to becoming paperless..."""

Vertical and lateral performance measures (Performance alignment),Describes aligning metrics across hierarchy and across functions to ensure consistent performance evaluation.,"""Performance alignment is the vertical and lateral alignment of project, team, department, business segment, global sector, and organization performance measures."""

Scheduling alignment (resource sharing over time),Treated as a performance-related metric that looks at effective allocation of resources across time and units.,"""Scheduling alignment is a lateral analysis of how resources are shared across units and over time."""
Situation Awareness (SA),Proposed as a primary indicator of organizational performance
column2: poor SA equates to poor performance.,"""Accurate measures of situation awareness (SA) should be primary indicators of organization performance, but many traditional measures of SA disrupt the flow of work (Gorman et al. 2007)."""

column1: Team productivity (coordination space),Presented as an emergent metric arising from how well distributed teams coordinate information over time and distance.,"""Fiore et al. (2003) discussed improved team productivity as a coordination space of team interaction over time and distance."""

Output performance measure / Organization output,Used in evaluation tables to correlate information alignment with tangible production results.,"""The Information Evaluation table qualitatively evaluates each information artifact against the organization’s performance measures in addition to another table that evaluates the organization performance measures against the actual organization output productivity."""
Monthly Output,Concrete numeric metric in the case study
column2: serves as the dependent variable representing production performance.,"""The “Monthly Output” column corresponds to the Production Performance from the evaluation tables that follow the information overlap table."""

column1: 3M and P delays (Machine, Method, Material, People),Operational performance metric capturing categories of delays affecting a refurbishment line
column2: used in ANOVA example.,"""The column “3M and P” was the indicator of the quantity of types of delays a rocket motor refurbishment line in a month. The column stands for machine, method, material, or people delays."""

column1: Variance of organization’s output,Statistical performance measure the model aims to predict based on information-alignment factors.,"""Once the alignment analysis is complete ... The significant factors will provide a model that can predict some of the variance of an organization’s output affected by information alignment."""

Threshold of 'good' vs 'bad' information alignment,Conceptual performance boundary used to judge when alignment is sufficient to sustain desired organizational output.,"""The future of information alignment research will be to determine the threshold of information alignment and how much of an organization’s output is affected within the levels of “good” and “bad” information alignment."""
Kang et al. 2012 - A framework for measuring and managing value achievement in business processes.pdf
Medidor,Como é utilizado no texto,Evidência literal do texto

Current change request processing speed (PI/KPI),Indicador de performance usado para avaliar a ‘Timeliness of change request’. É calculado a partir de três métricas básicas e depois combinado por uma função de composição.,“The PI ‘Current change request processing speed’ can be transformed to one measure from the composition function after being measured by 3 metrics.”

Average cycle time – ACT (métrica),Uma das três métricas que alimentam o KPI ‘Current change request processing speed’.,"“the variables Timeliness of change request (CRT), Average cycle time (ACT), Standard deviation (SD), FaultRate, and PMSatisfaction are declared”  "

Standard deviation – SD (métrica),Segunda métrica que compõe o KPI ‘Current change request processing speed’.,"idem: “... Average cycle time (ACT), Standard deviation (SD), FaultRate ... are declared”  "
FaultRate (métrica),Terceira métrica que compõe o KPI ‘Current change request processing speed’.,"idem: “... Standard deviation (SD), FaultRate, and PMSatisfaction are declared”  "

PM-Satisfaction – PMSatisfaction (PI),Indicador obtido por julgamento subjectivo do gerente de projecto e usado na função de composição que produz o valor de Timeliness of change request.,"“in the case of PMSatisfaction, instead of being assigned to a subprocess, the project manager determines its value by a subjective evaluation.”  "

Timeliness of change request – CRT (Value/PI),"Valor composto que representa a ‘Timeliness of processing change request’. É calculado pela função CCRT a partir de ACT, SD, FaultRate e PMSatisfaction.","“Finally, the measured value of Value T is determined by replacing these four values ... of the composition function CCRT.”  "

CRTAchievement (Indicador de realização),"Variável derivada que mede a distância entre os valores actuais e as metas (δ(Vi)) para cada métrica e, somando-as, mostra o grau de alcance do CRT.",“variable CRTAchievement for Value achievement of CRT is declared and its value is defined as shown in Fig. 10.”
AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate (KPI),Sub-valor de OnTimeDelivery
column2: mede quão exacta é a data prometida (ATP) ao cliente.,“The subvalue OnTimeDelivery was subsequently broken down into subvalues AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate and GuaranteedQuickDelivery. The KPIs ... AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate can be calculated as shown in Fig. 15.”

column1: GuaranteedQuickDelivery (KPI),Outro sub-valor de OnTimeDelivery
column2: indica a percentagem de encomendas entregues antes ou na data garantida.,idem: “... subvalues AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate and GuaranteedQuickDelivery. The KPIs GuaranteedQuickDelivery ...”

column1: OnTimeDelivery (PI de alto nível),Sub-valor de CustomerSatisfaction. É composto pelos KPIs AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate e GuaranteedQuickDelivery por meio da função C5.1.,“The composition function used was defined in Fig. 15 as C5.1.” / “We decomposed the Value CustomerSatisfaction into the subvalues OnTimeDelivery ...”
OnTimeCommunication (PI),"Outro sub-valor de CustomerSatisfaction
column2: associado à comunicação pontual com o cliente (nenhum KPI detalhado, mas tratado como indicador).",“We decomposed the Value CustomerSatisfaction into the subvalues OnTimeDelivery ... and OnTimeCommunication.”

column1: ASN Adherence (métrica/PI operacional),Actividade de medição inserida no processo para recolher dados que alimentam o KPI GuaranteedQuickDelivery.,"“... re-define its business process with the two measuring and evaluating activities, i.e. Evaluate ASN Adherence and Evaluate ATP Date Adherence, which measure GuaranteedQuickDelivery ...”  "

ATP Date Adherence (métrica/PI operacional),Actividade de medição que avalia o cumprimento da data ATP e fornece dados para o KPI AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate.,"idem: “... Evaluate ASN Adherence and Evaluate ATP Date Adherence, which measure GuaranteedQuickDelivery and AccuracyOfDeliveryEstim, respectively”  "
CustomerSatisfaction (Value/PI de topo),Valor estratégico ligado à cadeia de processos
column2: seu progresso é monitorizado através dos sub-valores OnTimeDelivery e OnTimeCommunication.,“We decomposed the Value CustomerSatisfaction into the subvalues OnTimeDelivery ... and OnTimeCommunication.”

column1: CustomerBenefit (Value/PI),Valor estratégico adicional declarado pela organização
column2: não detalhado mas citado como alvo de monitorização.,“A-Homeshopping has chosen CustomerSatisfaction and CustomerBenefit as business Values to pursue.”
