Digital Economy and Society Index (DESI),Índice que monitora o desempenho digital geral e o progresso dos países da UE em competitividade digital
column2: usado para ilustrar a evolução da digitalização na UE.,“Digital Economy and Society Index (DESI) – an index monitoring the ‘… overall digital performance and … progress of EU countries in their digital competitiveness’. … the DESI Overall Index has increased from 33.7 % to 52.3 % in the European Union [2].”

column1: DESI Overall Index (%),"Valor percentual do DESI citado como indicador concreto da evolução (de 33,7 % para 52,3 %).",“…the DESI Overall Index has increased from 33.7 % to 52.3 % in the European Union [2].”

Produtividade,Usada para apontar que os ganhos de produtividade na administração permanecem parcialmente inexplorados em comparação com a produção.,“Historically productivity gains in administration remained comparatively untapped compared to production …”

Percentual de desperdício (30 % de desperdício administrativo),Indicador de ineficiência em processos administrativos.,“Schlendrian im Büro - Studie belegt 30 Prozent Verschwendung in der Administration”

Return on Investment (ROI),Métrica financeira usada para comparar retornos entre IPA e RPA.,"“research by Flechsig (2021) indicates that the ROI of IPA generally exceeds that of RPA, as the potential benefits of broader application outweigh.”  "
Economia de custos,Resultado esperado da aplicação de IPA (redução de custos operacionais).,"“IPA provides faster and error-free task execution, increasing the potential for cost savings.”  "
Custos de implementação e operação,Fator de performance financeira considerado na avaliação do ROI.,“it’s essential to factor in the increased implementation and operational costs of IPA.”

Eficiência,Indicador de desempenho de processos citado para mostrar que automação pode amplificar eficiência (ou ineficiência).,“The first rule … is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency.”
Taxa de erros (execução sem erros),Qualidade/precisão como métrica de performance resultante do uso de IPA.,“IPA provides faster and error-free task execution …”
Velocidade/tempo de execução,Mede rapidez do processamento após automação inteligente.,“provides faster … task execution …”

Satisfação no trabalho,"Indicador qualitativo de bem-estar/engajamento dos funcionários, citado como benefício de IPA.","“Simultaneously, it empowers workforce to focus on more challenging tasks, enhancing job satisfaction.”"
Van Looy and Van Den Bergh 2018 - The Effect of Organization Size and Sector on Adopting Business Process Management.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal no texto

Desempenho organizacional,Apresentado como resultado (variável dependente) que pode ser influenciado pelo ajuste entre capacidades de BPM e contexto organizacional.,"“Lifecycle theories … assume that higher maturity eventually leads to higher operational performance, while lower BPM maturity relates to lower financial and non-financial performance (Skrinjar et al. 2008).”  "
Desempenho operacional,Tipo específico de desempenho organizacional ao qual a maturidade em BPM pode conduzir.,“… higher maturity eventually leads to higher operational performance …”
Desempenho financeiro,Indicador de desempenho organizacional que pode diminuir quando a maturidade é baixa.,“… lower BPM maturity relates to lower financial … performance (Skrinjar et al. 2008).”

Desempenho não-financeiro,Indicador complementar de desempenho organizacional igualmente afetado pela maturidade em BPM.,“… lower BPM maturity relates to lower … non-financial performance (Skrinjar et al. 2008).”

Resultados de desempenho,Resultado final referenciado no modelo de contingência (seta pontilhada).,"“We note that Fig. 1 mentions the performance outcomes with a dotted line, because this variable is not analyzed in our work.”  "
Desempenho de processo,Capacidade (área 4) que agrupa diversos indicadores para medir o desempenho dos processos.,Tabela 1: “4. Process performance (11 items)”
Medição de desempenho regular,Item de capacidade usado para avaliar se a organização monitora regularmente o desempenho dos processos.,"Tabela 1, linha de itens: “Regular performance measurement”  "
Sistema de medição de desempenho,Infra-estrutura formal citada como item de capacidade para capturar e acompanhar indicadores.,Tabela 1: “Performance measurement system”
Indicadores-chave de desempenho (KPIs),Listados como item que avalia a existência de métricas formais para processos.,"Tabela 1, capacidade 2: “Key performance indicators”  "
Métricas de processo,Indicador quantitativo específico que faz parte da medição de desempenho.,Tabela 1: “Process metrics”
Comunicação de desempenho regular,Item que verifica se os resultados de desempenho são comunicados periodicamente.,Tabela 1: “Regular performance communication”
Sistema de relatórios,Mecanismo citado para divulgar e analisar resultados de desempenho.,Tabela 1: “Reporting system”
Utilização de recursos de entrada,Mede quão eficientemente os recursos são usados nos processos.,Tabela 1: “Input resource utilization”
Alocação de recursos,Avalia a distribuição de recursos em função do desempenho do processo.,Tabela 1: “Resources allocation”
Benchmarking,Comparação do desempenho com padrões externos para melhoria contínua.,Tabela 1: “Benchmarking”
Registro de eventos inesperados,Indicador de controle que monitora variações de desempenho anormais.,Tabela 1: “Registration of unexpected events”
Controle de processo,Item que avalia mecanismos de monitoramento e ajuste do desempenho dos processos.,Tabela 1: “Process control”
Alinhamento estratégico,"Embora seja item de ‘Process performance’, é usado como métrica de quão bem os processos atendem aos objetivos estratégicos.",Tabela 1: “Strategic alignment”
Palanisamy et al. 2018 - Preserving Privacy and Quality of Service in Complex Event Processing through Event Reordering.pdf
Metric,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Utility,"Métrica principal de desempenho: maximizada pelo algoritmo (Fase 1) e usada na avaliação para comparar estratégias
column2: combina ganhos com padrões públicos e penalidades por privados, falsos-positivos e falsos-negativos (Eq. 2).","“We define a formal utility metric … (Equ. 2)”
column3: “The problem is now to find an event reordering strategy, maximizing the utility…”
column4: “Fig. 10f shows the change in utility achieved for varying ε”  "

column1: Quality of Service (QoS),Objetivo funcional a ser preservado
column2: medido indiretamente via Utility e via quantidade de padrões públicos verdadeiros mantidos.,“while maximizing QoS by preserving as many public patterns as possible”
column3: “If a CEP system falsely detects … the QoS will degenerate.”

column1: Number of matched public patterns,Componente positivo da Utility
column2: contar acertos verdadeiros de padrões públicos.,Eq. 2: “Σ#of matched public Patterns”

column1: Number of matched false positives,Componente negativo da Utility
column2: também usado em gráficos (Fig. 10e).,Eq. 2: “−2* Σ#of matched false positives”
column3: “Fig. 10e … false positives and false negatives introduced”

column1: Number of matched private patterns,Componente negativo da Utility
column2: indica vazamentos de privacidade.,Eq. 2: “− Σ#of matched private patterns”

column1: Total number of private patterns revealed,"Mede perda de privacidade na avaliação (Fig. 10g, 11a).",“Fig. 10g … Total Number of private patterns revealed”
column2: “Fig. 11a … number of private patterns revealed”

column1: False positives & false negatives (count),"Utilizados para quantificar impacto na QoS (Fig. 10e, 11b).",“Fig. 10e … # of false positives and false negatives introduced”
column2: “Fig. 11b … # of false-positives and false negatives”

column1: Precision (of attack),Avalia eficácia do adversário em ataques estatísticos (Fig. 10a).,“we evaluate the precision … (correctly identified private patterns divided by …)”
column2: “Fig. 10a … Precision of Attack”

column1: Recall (of attack),Avalia cobertura do adversário em ataques estatísticos (Fig. 10b).,“and recall (correctly identified private patterns divided by total number of concealed private patterns)”
column2: “Fig. 10b … Recall of Attacks”

column1: Reordering Indicator (RI),Probabilidade calculada pelo adversário para detectar reordenação
column2: usado para decidir se um padrão privado foi revelado.,“the adversary calculates the reorder indicator (RI) for each private pattern individually.”

column1: Σ|x(ei)| (sum of event shifts),Função-objetivo da ILP da Fase 2
column2: minimizada para não alterar muito a distribuição temporal.,Eq. 4: “minimize Σ|x(ei)|”
column3: “Minimizing the sum of time distances keeps the difference between the modified inter-arrival distribution … small”

column1: Processing latency per window,Mede custo computacional das abordagens (Fig. 10i).,“Fig. 10i shows the results… Latency per window (ms)”
column2: “we processed 5000 windows and calculated the average processing latency”

column1: Forwarding delay,Tempo que eventos são retidos antes de envio
column2: avaliado quanto ao impacto na Utility (Fig. 10h).,“there is a trade-off between delay and QoS”
column3: “Fig. 10h … Utility with increasing forwarding delay”

column1: Pádua and Jabbour 2015 - Promotion and evolution of sustainability perfo ... rocess management - From a literature review to a pentagonal proposal.pdf

Economic Performance (TBL component),One of the three core sustainability dimensions whose improvement is tracked by an SPMS.,"“companies that construct their business model … have a better performance in the economic dimension…” (Hall & Wagner, 2012)."
Environmental Performance (TBL component),Tracked to evaluate ecological impact
column2: includes specific measures such as gas emissions and energy use.,"“…evaluating business processes from an environmental sustainability perspective…” (Sarkis et al., 2006)."

column1: Social Performance (TBL component),Monitored alongside economic and environmental results to complete the TBL view.,“…management of potentially conflicting relationships among the three dimensions of TBL.”
Sustainability Indicators,Generic term for quantitative/qualitative measures that make up an SPMS
column2: selected to monitor progress toward goals.,"“The main focus of research has been on the choice of proper performance indicators.” (Searcy, 2011)"

column1: Stakeholder Satisfaction,Proposed as a key measurement linked to process architecture when designing an SPMS.,"“…associate the indicators in process architecture with the strategic objectives and satisfaction measures for all stakeholders…” (Burlton, 2010)."

Product/Service Lead Time,Cited as a performance effect of BPM programmes and therefore a measurable indicator.,"“the most reported effects … are as follows: reduction in product or service lead time to the client” (Kohlbacher, 2010)."
Customer Satisfaction,Identified as an outcome that improves with BPM and can be measured for performance.,"“improvement in customer satisfaction” (Kohlbacher, 2010)."
Product Quality,Listed as an indicator that improves with BPM implementation.,"“improvement in product quality” (Kohlbacher, 2010)."
Cost Cuts / Process Cost,Reduction of costs highlighted as a performance result and therefore an indicator for SPMS.,"“cost cuts” (Kohlbacher, 2010)
column2: “execution time, cost and process quality” (Kujansivu & Lönnqvist, 2008)."

column1: Financial Performance,Improvement in overall financial results presented as a measurable benefit of BPM.,"“improvement in the organization’s financial performance” (Kohlbacher, 2010)."

Execution Time,Process-level metric suggested for inclusion in performance measurement.,"“…significant impact of process standardization on general performance, considering execution time…” (Kujansivu & Lönnqvist, 2008)."
Process Quality,Quality of process outputs proposed as a measurable indicator within BPM initiatives.,"“…impact of process standardization on … process quality.” (Kujansivu & Lönnqvist, 2008)."
Gas Emissions,Environmental indicator for business processes
column2: reduction used to gauge sustainability performance.,"“reduced gas emissions in processes, software, hardware and infrastructure (environmental dimension)” (Nowak et al., 2011)."

column1: Energy Consumption,Indicator whose optimisation is recommended when redesigning processes for sustainability.,"“…valorization of human factors and optimization of energy consumption.” (Nowak et al., 2011)."
Competitiveness,Named as an economic-dimension indicator tied to sustainable process performance.,"“…organization competitiveness (economic dimension).” (Nowak et al., 2011)."

Environmental Capital,Domain against which business impacts are measured in Chee Tahir & Darton’s method.,"“The method considers the impact on capital that resides in three domains: environmental, economic and human and social capital…” (Chee Tahir & Darton, 2010)."
Economic Capital,Second capital domain used for quantifying sustainability performance in the cited method.,Same citation as above.
Human & Social Capital,Third capital domain forming part of the sustainability indicator set in the process analysis method.,Same citation as above.

Traceability of Measures through Value Chain,Presented as a requirement to follow indicator performance back through preceding processes.,"“determine the traceability of measures throughout the value chain” (discussion of Burlton, 2010 in the paper)."

Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (trecho entre aspas)
Accuracy,Avaliar desempenho global dos modelos de classificação em cada esquema e época,"“Accuracy (95% CI) 77.9% …”, “Accuracy (95% CI) 84.6% …”, “Accuracy (95% CI) 81.6% …”"
Sensitivity (True Positive Rate),Medir a capacidade de detectar corretamente a classe positiva em cada cenário,"“Admission (24.3%) Sensitivity 30.2% …”, “ICU … Sensitivity 45.8% …”"
Specificity,Medir a capacidade de identificar corretamente a classe negativa (discharge) no esquema binário,“Discharge (75.7%) Specificity 93.4% …”
Positive Predictive Value (PPV),Proporção de predições positivas que são corretas no esquema binário,“PPV 60.0% … 74.8% …”
Negative Predictive Value (NPV),Proporção de predições negativas que são corretas no esquema binário,“NPV 80.4% … 89.1% …”
Precision,Usado como PPV para cada classe no problema multiclasse,"“Precision 55.4% … 45.1% … 56.9% … 47.5% …”, “The term ‘precision’ is used for C2 and C3 …”"
False Positive Rate (FPR),Percentual de falsos positivos controlado/relatado nos resultados,"“while controlling false positive rates (1.4%, 1.0%, 4.3%, and 1.4%) …”"

Area Under the Curve (AUC),Meta-métrica de desempenho global baseada na curva ROC para cada classe,"“with AUC values of 0.97, 0.95, 0.89, and 0.84 …”, “paired t-tests … mean difference in the AUC values …”"
Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC),Ferramenta gráfica para mostrar relação TPR×FPR
column2: base do AUC,“We provide the receiver operating characteristic curves for the five classes … (Fig. 5)”

column1: Odds Ratio,Medida de associação na análise bivariada entre variáveis categóricas e admissão,“odds ratio (95% CI) … 4.4 (4.3–4.6) …”
Hedge’s g,Medida de tamanho de efeito para variáveis contínuas em grandes amostras,“ we computed … Hedge’s g … respirations … 0.22 …”

Chi-square statistic (χ²),Usado como critério de seleção de atributos e para medir dependência entre variáveis,“A chi-square statistic-based filter method is designed and applied as a feature selection mechanism …”

Medidor,Como é usado no estudo,Evidência literal no texto
Overall performance of process-oriented thinking,"Medida dependente geral do sucesso da tarefa
column2: calculada como a média dos três indicadores inferiores (activities, roles, goals), resultando num valor entre 0 e 1.","“The first dependent measure, overall performance of process-oriented thinking, related to the general success of participants in performing the task. We calculated this measure as the mean of three inferior performance measures that represent the other dependent variables, activities, roles, and goals.”  "

column1: Performance with regard to activities,Avalia o sucesso na serialização das 12 atividades pré-definidas
column2: compara-se a solução do participante ao processo de referência usando ‘conformance testing’
column3: gera pontuação de 0 a 1.,“We measured the resulting performance with regard to activities … by comparing the results obtained to a best-practice process… This procedure results in performance scores ranging from zero to one.”

column1: Desvios em relação ao processo de referência (activities),Indicador derivado que quantifica as diferenças entre a sequência do participante e o best-practice
column2: utilizado dentro do cálculo de ‘performance with regard to activities’.,“We calculated deviations between the solution of the participants and the best-practice solution by using a conformance testing technique…”

column1: Fitness do processo (activities),Métrica do conformance testing que verifica o quanto o processo observado se ajusta ao fluxo de controle do modelo de referência.,“…to measure whether the fitness of the observed process … complies with the control flow specified by the process (the best-practice process model).”

Performance with regard to roles,"Média de três critérios (i, ii, iii) gerando valor entre 0 e 1 para avaliar como os papéis foram atribuídos.","“We determined performance with regard to roles by calculating the mean of the three criteria. Therefore, we defined this variable between zero and one.”  "
(i) Número de papéis corretamente atribuídos,"Conta quantas atribuições coincidem com o best-practice (1 ponto) ou segunda melhor opção (0,5 ponto)
column2: dividido por 12 atividades.","“For roles being assigned exactly in the way as in the best-practice solution, participants were credited one point
column3: for roles being assigned in the second-best way, participants were credited 0.5 points. We then divided the sum by 12…”  "

column1: (ii) Percentual de papéis usados,"Calculado como 1 menos a percentagem de papéis utilizados em relação ao máximo possível (5)
column2: quanto menor o nº de papéis, melhor.","“We computed the second criterion as one minus the percentage of the roles used compared to the maximum number available (i.e., compared to a maximum of five roles).”  "

column1: (iii) Número de interfaces entre papéis,"Calculado como 1 menos (interfaces efetivas ÷ 11), onde 11 é o máximo possível em 12 atividades.","“…here, we divided the number of interfaces between the roles by 11, which is the maximum number of interfaces that can result from a process with 12 activities.”  "
Performance with regard to goals,"Média de três critérios (iv, v, vi) para avaliar definição/atribuição de metas
column2: resultado entre 0 e 1.","“…we then combined the three criteria into the measure performance with regard to goals by calculating the mean, which again results in a metric measure ranging from zero to one.”  "

column1: (iv) Percentual de atividades com metas,Proporção de atividades às quais foi atribuída pelo menos uma meta.,“We determined the percentage of activities that were linked to goals.”
(v) Percentual de metas lógicas,Verifica quantas metas atribuídas fazem sentido lógico dentro do processo.,"“In addition, we checked how many of the assigned goals were logical…”  "
(vi) Contradição com metas genéricas,"Checa se as metas atribuídas contradizem os objetivos genéricos de tempo, custo e qualidade
column2: penaliza contradições.","“…finally, we checked if the goals assigned contradicted the generic process goals of ‘time, costs, and quality’ (Lee and Dale (1998)).”"

Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Quality,"Categoria geral de medição de desempenho do processo, ligada a atributos como satisfação do cliente ou número de reclamações.","""It can be classified and implemented as Quality, Cost or Cycle Time. The quality can be expressed e.g., by a low number of complaints or a high customer satisfaction."""
Cost,Categoria geral que mede as despesas necessárias para executar o processo.,"""Cost represents the expenses a business process requires for instance for its execution."""

Cycle Time,Categoria geral de tempo que define a duração de processamento de uma instância ou parte do processo.,"""Cycle time presents a time based measure and defines the processing duration of a business process instance, or part of it."""

Working Time,Sub-tipo de Cycle Time que corresponde ao tempo efetivo de execução de uma instância por um papel organizacional.,"""Working time represents the actual time a business process instance is being executed by a role."""
Waiting Time,Sub-tipo de Cycle Time que corresponde ao tempo que a instância fica aguardando processamento.,"""Waiting time shows the time the process instance is waiting for further processing."""
Low Number of Complaints / Number of Complaints,Indicador de qualidade
column2: número reduzido de reclamações é usado para avaliar o processo.,"""The quality can be expressed e.g., by a low number of complaints…"""

column1: High Customer Satisfaction / Customer Satisfaction,Indicador de qualidade
column2: alto nível de satisfação do cliente avalia o processo.,"""…or a high customer satisfaction."""

column1: Average Processing Costs per Month,Mede o custo médio mensal
column2: limite definido de 15 € para cumprir o objetivo de baixo custo.,"""The goal low processing costs is fulfilled, when the Average Processing Costs per Month are under 15 Euros."""

column1: Average Percentage of Complaints per Month,Mede a porcentagem média mensal de reclamações
column2: limite definido de 5 % para cumprir o objetivo de alta satisfação.,"""…if the Average Percentage of Complaints per Month is less than five percent."""

column1: Processing Duration,Expressa a duração total que o processo deve levar
column2: associada à meta de processo curto.,"""…indicates that the process duration has to be less than four days."""

column1: Sub-Cycle Time,Divisão do Cycle Time em dois sub-tempos para controlar partes do processo.,"""…cycle time is split up into two sub-cycle times and indicates that the process duration has to be less than four days."""
Cycle Time of Assertion of the Claim (1 day),Meta de tempo para a atividade 'Assertion of the Claim'.,"""…assertion of the claim has to fulfil its tasks within a cycle time of one day…"""
Cycle Time of Compensation of the Claim (3 days),Meta de tempo para a atividade 'Compensation of the Claim'.,"""…and compensation of the claim within three days."""
Del-Río-Ortega et al. 2013 - On the definition and design-time analysis of process performance indicators.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho literal ou parafraseado que aparece no artigo)
Time Measure,Mede a duração entre dois instantes de tempo de um elemento do processo,“Time Measure. It measures the duration of time between two time instants.”

Linear Time Measure,Mede o tempo entre a primeira ocorrência da condição ‘from’ e a última ocorrência da condição ‘to’,“Linear (…) in which the measure is defined taking into account the first occurrence of the time instant condition from and the last occurrence of the time instant condition to.”

Cyclic Time Measure,Mede o tempo somando/aglomerando as durações de cada iteração de um laço,“Cyclic (…) in which the measure is defined by aggregating the values for the time between the pairs of the time-instant conditions of each iteration.”
Count Measure,Conta o número de vezes que algo acontece no processo,“Count Measure. It measures the number of times something happens.”
Condition Measure,Retorna verdadeiro/falso conforme uma condição de estado ou de dado é satisfeita,“Condition Measure. It is a boolean value that measures the fulfilment of a certain condition…”
Data Measure,Lê um valor (ou parte dele) em um objeto de dados do processo,“Data Measure. It measures the value of a certain part of a dataObject.”

Aggregated Measure,"Agrupa valores de medidas de instância única aplicando função de agregação (sum, avg, etc.)",“Aggregated Measure. It is defined by aggregating one of the previous measures in several process instances using an aggregation function such as sum or average.”
Derived Measure,Calcula-se aplicando uma função matemática sobre outras medidas,“Derived Measure. It is defined as a mathematical function over one or more measure definitions.”
DerivedSingleInstanceMeasure,Medida derivada calculada a partir de medidas de instância única,OCL Constraint 2: “DerivedSingleInstanceMeasures are calculated by using single-instance measures …”
DerivedMultiInstanceMeasure,Medida derivada calculada a partir de medidas multi-instância,OCL Constraint 3: “DerivedMultiInstanceMeasures are calculated by using multi-instance measures …”
PPI1 – RFCs cancelled from RFCs registered,Percentual de RFCs canceladas sobre o total registrado,Tabela 1: “PPI1 RFCs cancelled from RFCs registered – Target 4 % (weekly)”
PPI2 – Average time of committee decision,Tempo médio (em dias úteis) gasto pelo comitê para decidir uma RFC,Tabela 1: “PPI2 Average time of committee decision – Target 1 working day (weekly)”
PPI3 – Corrective RFCs from approved RFCs,Percentual de RFCs corretivas sobre o total de RFCs aprovadas,Tabela 1: “PPI3 Corrective RFCs from approved RFCs – Target 2 % (weekly)”

PPI4 – Perfective and adaptive RFCs from approved RFCs,Percentual de RFCs perfectivas/adaptativas sobre o total aprovado,Tabela 1: “PPI4 Perfective and adaptive RFCs from approved RFCs – Target 4 % (weekly)”
PPI5 – Average time of RFC analysis,Tempo médio para analisar uma RFC,Tabela 1: “PPI5 Average time of RFC analysis – Target 2 working days (weekly)”
PPI6 – Number of RFCs under analysis,Quantidade simultânea de RFCs em análise,Tabela 1: “PPI6 Number of RFCs under analysis – Target 2 RFCs (weekly)”
PPI7 – Number of RFCs per type of change,Quantidade de RFCs agrupadas por tipo de mudança,Tabela 1: “PPI7 Number of RFCs per type of change – 20 corrective…(monthly)”
PPI8 – Number of RFCs per project,Quantidade de RFCs agrupadas por projeto,Tabela 1: “PPI8 Number of RFCs per project – 50 for project rr.hh … (monthly)”
PPI9 – Average lifetime of a RFC,Tempo médio de vida de uma RFC (recebida até encerrada),Tabela 1: “PPI9 Average lifetime of a RFC – Target 3 working days (monthly)”
Weinzierl et al. 2020 - From predictive to prescriptive process monitori ... next best actions instead of calculating the next most likely events.pdf
Metric,Usage in the text,Evidence extracted from the paper
Throughput time,KPI to be optimised
column2: basis for deciding whether to search for an alternative suffix
column3: indicator in final evaluation,“recommends next best actions to optimise towards the KPI throughput time”
column4: “if the complete process instance … takes longer than the (KPI based) temporal threshold … we aim to find a better alternative”

column1: Total throughput time,Calculated for every candidate suffix and minimised when selecting the best one,"“Finally, the total throughput time for 𝑝𝑖 could be 10 hours …”
column2: “the suffix with the lowest total throughput time is selected”  "

column1: Average time over all process instances,Used to build the temporal threshold against which every running case is checked,“(KPI based) temporal threshold (average time over all process instances of ℰ)”

Temporal threshold,Benchmark value that triggers the search for a better suffix and is used in usefulness evaluation,“if the complete process instance … takes longer than the (KPI based) temporal threshold …”
column2: “would be less than the given temporal threshold at 8 hours”

column1: Percentage of process instances that comply with the temporal threshold,Measure of “usefulness” during the intermediate evaluation,“we evaluated the usefulness through the percentage of process instances that could comply with the temporal threshold for different prefix lengths”

Average Levenshtein distance,Measure of “quality” during the evaluation (lower values indicate higher similarity to ground-truth trace),"“we evaluated the quality through the average Levenshtein distance … the lower the value, the more similar two strings are”  "

Levenshtein distance (distance metric),Underlying string/sequence similarity metric from which the average is computed,“…Levenshtein distance which is a metric to determine the distance between two strings or sequences”

Probability of next events,Performance figure produced by the baseline approach used for comparison,“As a baseline we used the technique from Tax et al. [8] for calculating the probability of next events.”
Predictive quality,General performance measure for learned LSTM models mentioned as a desirable property,“LSTMs can learn predictive models with a good predictive quality on different data sets [12]”
Cost function,Metric suggested in related work to decide whether an alarm/intervention is worthwhile,“they suggest a cost function for determining whether an intervention is reasonable or not.”
Lapa et al. 2014 - A comparative analysis of open source business intelligence platforms.pdf

Sales,Indicador de negócio que pode ser medido e melhorado com o uso de BI,"“metrics that matter most to their businesses, such as sales …”"
Profits,Indicador de rentabilidade a ser monitorado pelas plataformas de BI,"“metrics that matter most to their businesses, such as … profits …”"
Costs,Métrica financeira a ser reduzida ou otimizada através de BI,"“metrics that matter most to their businesses, such as … costs …”"
Quality defects,Indicador de qualidade de produtos/processos controlado por BI,"“metrics that matter most to their businesses, such as … quality defects …”"
Safety incidents,Métrica operacional de segurança acompanhada via BI,"“metrics that matter most to their businesses, such as … safety incidents …”"
Customer satisfaction,Indicador de satisfação do cliente monitorado em BI,"“metrics that matter most to their businesses, such as … customer satisfaction …”"
On-time delivery,Indicador logístico de pontualidade acompanhado em BI,"“metrics that matter most to their businesses, such as … on-time delivery …”"
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Conjunto de indicadores chave usados em scorecards para acompanhamento estratégico,“Scorecards (KPI - key performance indicators)”
Efficiency,Nível de eficiência operacional mensurado via KPIs/BI,“measure levels of efficiency and satisfaction”
Profitability,Indicador de lucratividade que BI ajuda a melhorar,"“enhance their performance, efficiency and profitability levels”"
Speed,Critério de desempenho considerado na avaliação de plataformas BI,"“criteria such as speed, usability, reliability, robustness …”"
Usability,Métrica de facilidade de uso adotada para comparar plataformas,"“criteria such as speed, usability, reliability, robustness …”"
Reliability,Indicador de confiabilidade incluído na avaliação de ferramentas,"“criteria such as speed, usability, reliability, robustness …”"
Robustness,Métrica de robustez usada para julgar desempenho das plataformas,"“criteria such as speed, usability, reliability, robustness …”"
Investment/Return (ROI),Relação entre investimento e retorno citada como possível métrica de avaliação,"“criteria such as … relationship investment/return, etc.”"
Cost reduction,Benefício/métrica de desempenho alcançada com BI,"“it enables cost reduction, and secondly, it increases revenue”"
Revenue increase,Benefício/métrica financeira resultante do uso de BI,"“it enables cost reduction, and secondly, it increases revenue”"
Koetter and Kochanowski 2012 - Goal-oriented model-driven business process monitoring using ProGoalML.pdf
Time (process execution time)
column2: KPI calculado em cada instância do processo para medir a duração desde a entrada até a decisão do sinistro.
column3: “The first KPI is the process execution time measured in seconds starting from the moment the claim has been entered, calculated from both timestamp values using the function  Time := (Decide Claim.Timestamp − Enter Claim.Timestamp) /1000 .0”

column1: Time_SLA
column2: Meta/Goal derivada do KPI “Time”
column3: valida se o tempo de execução está abaixo de 60 s.
column4: “A goal named Time SLA is defined, mandating the execution time to be below 60 seconds:  Time SLA := Time <60.0”

column1: Wannes and Ghannouchi 2019 - KPI-Based Approach for Business Process Improvement.pdf
KPI,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Number of tasks associated with a user story,Mede o tamanho/carga de trabalho de uma User Story,“Number of tasks associated with a user story.”
Number of tasks completed in a user story,Mede o progresso de conclusão de uma User Story,“Number of tasks completed in a user story.”
Estimated number of hours for a task,Usado para planejar esforço e servir de base para comparação com o real,“Estimated number of hours for a task.”
Actual number of hours of a task,Avalia o esforço real gasto e permite comparar com a estimativa,“The actual number of hours of a task.”

Number of user stories completed vs total in sprint backlog,Avalia a taxa de conclusão do Sprint,“Number of user stories completed at the end of  the sprint compared to the total number of user stories in the sprint backlog.”

Number of user stories not started vs total in sprint backlog,Verifica itens não iniciados e possíveis riscos ao Sprint,“Number of user stories not started at the end of the sprint compared to the total number of user stories in the sprint backlog.”
Number of tasks performed vs tasks planned (previous day),Controla o progresso diário no Daily Scrum,“Number of tasks performed compared to the tasks planned for the previous day.”

Number of outstanding and unfinished tasks (previous day),Identifica trabalho em atraso que precisa ser tratado,“Number of outstanding and unfinished tasks in relation to the tasks of the day previous.”
Number of problems encountered (previous day),Detecta impedimentos surgidos no dia anterior,“Number of problems encountered in completing the tasks of the pre vious day.”
Global Process KPI,Mede o desempenho global de todo o processo,“Global Process KPI: measures the overall performance of a business process.”
Event KPI,Mede o desempenho de um evento específico,“Event KPI:  measures the performance of an event.”
Lane KPI,Mede o desempenho de uma lane (responsável/função) no processo,“Lane KPI: measures the performance of a lane.”
Activity KPI,Mede o desempenho de uma atividade individual,“Activity KPI: measures the performance of an Activity.”
Sub Process KPI,Mede o desempenho de um subprocesso,“Sub Process KPI: measures the performance of a Sub Process.”
Task KPI,Mede o desempenho de uma tarefa,“Task KPI: measures the performance of a Task.”
Project KPI,Avalia o desempenho geral de um projeto,"“The evaluation of each project is done through KPIs, the types of KPIs are:  - Project KPI …”  "
Sprint KPI,Avalia especificamente cada Sprint,"“The evaluation of each project is done through KPIs, the types of KPIs are:  - … Sprint KPI …”  "
User Story KPI,Avalia User Stories individualmente,"“The evaluation of each project is done through KPIs, the types of KPIs are:  - … User Story KPI …”  "

“Process-performance indicator (generic reward)”
column2: “Used as the numeric reward that the RL/Bandit tries to optimise when comparing two process variants.”
column3: “The options or arms are modeled as two distinct versions of a business process in AB-BPM, and the reward is some process performance indicator.” (Sect. 2.5)

column1: “Customer-experience measure”

metric,usage_in_text,evidence

Latency,General benchmark/KPI for CEP engines and evaluated as key index in high-frequency scenarios,"“Mendes et al. proposed a framework for benchmarking CEP engines [8], which include latency, throughput, accuracy, etc.” and “evaluation metrics such as latency and throughput are key performance indices.”"

Throughput,General benchmark/KPI for CEP engines and evaluated as key index in high-frequency scenarios,"“Mendes et al. proposed a framework for benchmarking CEP engines [8], which include latency, throughput, accuracy, etc.” and “evaluation metrics such as latency and throughput are key performance indices.”"

Accuracy,Used both as CEP-engine benchmark and as application-specific KPI,"“Mendes et al. proposed a framework for benchmarking CEP engines [8], which include latency, throughput, accuracy, etc.” and “a more suitable benchmarks should include application specific performance: accuracy, electricity bills …”"

Electricity bills,Application-specific KPI to evaluate economic benefit of EMS,"“…a more suitable benchmarks should include application specific performance: accuracy, electricity bills or potentially with the integration of point of sale systems, revenue analysis.”"
Revenue,Derived economic KPI obtainable through integration with POS systems,“…a more suitable benchmarks should include application specific performance: … revenue analysis.”
Maximum Contracted Demand (MCD),Key energy KPI to be minimized
column2: determines penalties and guides control actions,"“We illustrate the effectiveness … in the context of minimizing the maximum contracted demand (MCD [10]) contracts…” and “A MCD contract is an agreement … on the maximum demand load … if the consumers use more than the agreed load, they are charged a high penalty.”"

column1: Energy consumption,Primary physical KPI that the EMS monitors and tries to reduce without harming operations,"“Sensors networks (SN) … weave a picture of store operation from energy consumption.” and “switching off the refrigerator would minimize energy consumption, but …”"

Electricity cost,Financial KPI linked to consumption and MCD control,“The consumers reduce their electricity cost if they use their electricity more effectively under the agreed maximum demand load …”

Overload probability,Derived predictive KPI triggering proactive alerts/actions,"Rule examples: “If overload probability is high, alert store manager …” and “If overload probability is high and oden cooker is on … then alert to switch off the oden cooker.”"

Voltage,Raw electrical measurement collected per circuit for monitoring/modeling,"“Each iMeter can measure … voltage, current, power factor, real power, apparent power and energy … for the store and for each appliance.”"
Current,Raw electrical measurement collected per circuit for monitoring/modeling,same sentence as above
Power factor,Raw electrical measurement collected per circuit for monitoring/modeling,same sentence as above
Real power,Raw electrical measurement collected per circuit for monitoring/modeling,same sentence as above
Apparent power,Raw electrical measurement collected per circuit for monitoring/modeling,same sentence as above
Energy (kWh),Raw cumulative consumption metric recorded per circuit/store,same sentence as above

Cycle time,Time-indicator,Given as the common operationalisation of the time dimension.,"“As for time, a common indicator is the cycle time, i.e., the time for handling a process instance end-to-end [23].”  "
Cost,Performance dimension (Devil’s Quadrangle),Named as one of the four key performance dimensions for evaluating processes.,"“… dimensions time, cost, quality, and flexibility [22].”  "
Turnover,Cost-related indicator,Cited as a typical indicator for the cost dimension.,"“Typical cost indicators are turnover, yield, or revenue.”  "
Yield,Cost-related indicator,Cited as a typical indicator for the cost dimension.,"“Typical cost indicators are turnover, yield, or revenue.”  "
Revenue,Cost-related indicator,Cited as a typical indicator for the cost dimension.,"“Typical cost indicators are turnover, yield, or revenue.”  "
Quality,Performance dimension (Devil’s Quadrangle),Named as one of the four key performance dimensions
column2: later split into internal and external quality.,"“… dimensions time, cost, quality, and flexibility [22]. … Quality splits into internal and external quality …”  "

column1: Internal quality,Sub-dimension of Quality,Mentioned as a branch of the quality dimension.,“Quality splits into internal and external quality …”
External quality,Sub-dimension of Quality,Mentioned as a branch of the quality dimension.,“Quality splits into internal and external quality …”
Error rate,Quality-indicator (internal quality),Given as a metric for internal quality.,“… can be measured in terms of error rates …”
Customer satisfaction,Quality-indicator (external quality),Given as a metric for external quality.,“… can be measured in terms of … customer satisfaction …”
Flexibility,Performance dimension (Devil’s Quadrangle),Named as one of the four key performance dimensions.,"“… dimensions time, cost, quality, and flexibility [22].”  "
Waiting time,Flexibility-indicator,Suggested operationalisation of the flexibility dimension.,“Flexibility can be measured via waiting … times [24].”
Set-up time,Flexibility-indicator,Suggested operationalisation of the flexibility dimension.,“Flexibility can be measured via … set-up times [24].”

Contribution margin,Financial performance measure,Used in formula that converts demand and price into operating cash flow.,“… operating cash flow results from the demand … as well as from a contribution margin …”
Operating cash outflows (Operating outflows),Financial performance measure,Treated as value-based substitute for ‘cost’
column2: affects operating cash flow and NPV.,“… value-based substitute for cost – as dimensions of the Devil’s Quadrangle …”
column3: “The operating outflows …”

column1: Investment outflows,Financial performance measure,Represent project-related cash expenditures
column2: directly enter NPV calculation.,“… split into investment outflows … for implementing the respective project …”

column1: Net Present Value (NPV),Aggregate value measure,Objective function used to rank BPM roadmaps.,“… value contribution of a BPM roadmap is measured in terms of its  NPV …”
Demand,Operational/business performance variable,"Drives operating cash flow in combination with quality, time and price.",“… demand … depends on quality and time …”
column2: “… periodic operating cash flow results from the demand …”

column1: Price,Operational/business performance variable,Part of revenue component in operating cash flow formula.,"“… contribution margin, which in turn depends on the price of the process output …”  "
Cash flow,Financial performance indicator,Primary quantity for value-based management
column2: discounted to compute NPV.,“The company value is determined based on future cash flows [33].”

column1: Risk-adjusted interest rate,Discounting/risk measure,Captures time value of money and risk attitude in NPV calculation.,"“… using a risk-adjusted interest rate  אݖ …”
column2: “… consider risks, and incorporate the time value of money.”"

Postponed surgeries due to incomplete documentation,Process-related KPI that grows when there are non-conformities
column2: monitored to check if missing documents delay operations.,“(1) Postponed surgeries due to incomplete documentation 0 %” (Table 1).

column1: Validated drug prescriptions against drugs prescribed,Process-related KPI
column2: measures the percentage of prescriptions that were correctly validated by clinicians.,“(2) Validated drugs prescriptions against drugs prescribed 98 %” (Table 1).

column1: Adverse reactions with respect to administrations,Process-related KPI to evaluate medication safety by comparing adverse events to total drug administrations.,“(3) Adverse reactions with respect to administrations 0 %” (Table 1).
Average length of stay,Outcome-based KPI for medium/long-term monitoring of hospital efficiency.,“(4) Average length of stay 4.30 days” (Table 1).
Mean medical assistance time per patient,Outcome-based KPI showing how much direct care time each patient receives.,"“(5) Mean medical assistance time per patient 309,48 min/day” (Table 1)."

Mean time between sanitary acceptance and hospitalization,Outcome-based KPI that detects delays between admission decision and actual ward entry.,"“(6) Mean time between sanitary acceptance and hospitalization 6,25 days” (Table 1)."
Mean time between hospitalization and surgery,Outcome-based KPI to monitor scheduling efficiency of surgical procedures.,"“(7) Mean time between hospitalization and surgery 1,04 days” (Table 1)."
Turnover rate,Outcome-based KPI that reflects bed/ patient flow efficiency inside the clinic.,"“(8) Turnover rate 19,14” (Table 1)."
Risk Priority Number (RPN),Central metric of the H-FMEA analysis
column2: prioritises each potential failure mode.,“The RPN was determined for each identified risk. This number is calculated by multiplying three factors…” (Sec. 4).

column1: Severity (S),Component of RPN
column2: measures gravity of potential patient injury.,“…Severity of the injury or damage that the patient may suffer (S)… ” (Sec. 4).

column1: Likelihood / Occurrence (O),Component of RPN
column2: measures probability that the failure mode occurs.,“…Likelihood or probability that the event happens (O)… ” (Sec. 4).

column1: Detection capability (D),Component of RPN
column2: reflects ease of detecting the error before harm occurs.,“…capability of Detection (D) i.e. the ease or difficulty of detecting the error before it causes damage.” (Sec. 4).

column1: Status code 0 – Communication error,Operational indicator captured during execution monitoring
column2: shows failures in data exchange between ERP and BPMS.,“code 0 represents a communication error between the software and the BPMS server…” (Sec. 6).

column1: Status code 1 – Correct execution,Operational indicator
column2: confirms that a task or process instance followed the model without deviations.,“code 1 represents the correct execution of the single process instance…” (Sec. 6).

column1: Status code 100 – Operational non-conformity,Operational indicator
column2: signals tasks executed out of order or against company procedures.,“code 100 represents discrepancies concerning the company’s operating policies.” (Sec. 6).

column1: Distribution of status codes per task,Derived indicator used to locate process bottlenecks and phases most affected by errors.,“…histogram… groups them by single task in the drug administration process.” (Fig. 5 description).

Status-code-100 distribution by task,Derived indicator to focus attention on sub-processes with greatest procedural errors.,“…histogram … shows the distribution of status code 100… focus attention on the sub-processes most affected by procedural errors.” (Fig. 6 description).

Varma et al. 2024 - Supply Chain Flexibility - Unravelling the Research Trajectory Through Citation Path Analysis.pdf
Performance Metric,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (citação ou referência no texto)

Supply Chain Performance (SCP),"Principal indicador-guarda-chuva para avaliar efeitos da flexibilidade, tecnologias digitais, circular economy, etc.","“...reducing uncertainty and improve the SC performance of a firm (Singh et al., 2021).” /  “SCF significantly fosters BDA-based proposed models … to enhance SCP (Cheng et al., 2022).”"

Market Performance,"Avaliar impacto de diferentes tipos de flexibilidade (volume, mercado, lançamento de produto).","“Market and financial performance are substantially impacted by volume flexibility, market flexibility, and product launch flexibility.” (Vickery et al., 1999)"
Financial Performance,Usado para medir resultados econômicos da SC
column2: aparece ligado a fluxos financeiros e scorecards.,"“financial flows in addition to material flow and information flow to improve the financial performance of an organization.” (More & Babu, 2009)"

column1: Business Performance,Relaciona flexibilidade/lean a melhoria de competitividade e resultados globais do negócio.,"“lean technology ... can lead to enhancement in responsiveness of the company as well as an improved business performance (Abdelilah et al., 2023).”"
Operational Performance,"Indicador de desempenho interno
column2: melhorado via redução de incerteza, SD modelling, etc.","“...framework for reducing uncertainty and improving operating performance in soap manufacturing.” (Singh et al., 2019)"

column1: Organizational Performance,"Mede resultados gerais da firma
column2: afetado por flexibilidade, cultura e relacionamento com fornecedores.","“Organizational culture and supplier relationships ... significantly improve organizational performance (Chirra & Kumar, 2020).”"

column1: Firm Performance,"Usado em estudos de adoção de AI-IoT, CE, dynamic capabilities.","“organizational flexibility fully mediates with AI and IoT, directly influencing the performance of firms.” (Nayal et al., 2022b)"
Sustainable Performance,"Resultados ambientais/econômicos
column2: dependente de BDA, CE e SSC flexibility.","“BDA did not directly impact sustainable performance
column3: it motivated people to ... CE increased the SSC flexibility.” (Cheng et al., 2022)"

column1: Environmental Impact / Green Performance,Métrica ambiental incluída em ‘flexible green SCM’.,"“lack of attention paid to flexible and green SCM in emerging economies.” (Dhillon et al., 2023)"
Customer Responsiveness,Tempo/qualidade de resposta ao cliente
column2: aumenta com SCF.,"“empirical evidence for the positive effects of the SCF on responsiveness to customers.” (Jafari et al., 2022)"

column1: Customer Satisfaction / Service Levels,Resultado de SCF diminuindo rupturas e variabilidade.,"“Flexible supply chains have the capability to mitigate supply disruptions ... while maintaining the same customer service levels.” (De la Gala-Velásquez et al., 2023)"
Inventory Levels,Usado como métrica operacional
column2: reduzidos com SCF.,"“Additionally, it optimizes inventory levels, which results in the firm having a competitive edge.”"

column1: Lead Time,Mede rapidez
column2: SCF reduz lead times.,"“Research consistently affirms that a flexible supply chain enhances operational agility, reducing lead times...”"

column1: Cost / Cost Minimization,Indicador financeiro direto
column2: flexibilidade reduz penalidades e custos.,"“ensuring a minimum penalty in cost, time, and effort of performance (Song et al., 2022).”"

column1: Competitive Advantage,"Resultado estratégico obtido via SCF, blockchain, etc.","“...impact of blockchain technology and information technology on SCF, consequently impacting an organization’s competitive advantage.” (Elrefae & Nuseir, 2022)"

Key Management Ratios,Conjunto de rácios financeiros/operacionais usados por More & Babu para avaliar dinâmica entre flexibilidade e desempenho.,"“analysis of the dynamics between supply chain flexibility and key management ratios.” (More & Babu, 2009)"

Flexibility Scorecard / Balanced Scorecard,Ferramenta métrica específica para medir SCF em múltiplas perspectivas.,"“More and Babu (2012) proposed a flexibility scorecard, using a balanced scorecard approach, to assess an organization’s flexibility.”"

DEA Efficiency Score,Benchmarking de performance/eficiência aplicado a SCF.,"“Data Envelopment Analysis (DEA) approach is introduced as a benchmarking tool to be competitive by building enough flexibility in SCs...” (More & Babu, 2012)"
Viontita et al. 2022 - Determining Business Process Improvement Prioriti ... rabaya City Office for Population Administration & Civil Registration.pdf
Indicador,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Time (aspecto tempo),Medir desempenho dos processos
column2: calculado como duração total ou % de solicitações concluídas dentro do alvo (7 dias)
column3: utilizado nos critérios de saúde e na composição de PPIs/KPPIs,"“In general, there are four commonly used process performance measure including time…”
column4: “percentage of applications completed on time according to the target (in this case the target time is 7 days)”  "

column1: Cost (aspecto custo),Mencionado como um dos quatro grandes indicadores clássicos de desempenho de processo,"“including time, cost, quality, and flexibility [1]”  "
Quality (aspecto qualidade),Medir precisão/defeitos
column2: % de solicitações sem defeito
column3: número de defeitos usado na saúde do processo,“percentage of non-defect applications (performance value from quality aspect)”

column1: Flexibility (aspecto flexibilidade),"Listado como medida de processo usada em literatura, mas não aplicado no caso","“including time, cost, quality, and flexibility [1]”  "

KPI – Key Performance Indicator,Citado como instrumento genérico de mensuração de desempenho usado em organizações,"“Many frameworks used in performance measurement such as the Balanced Scorecard (BSC), Key Performance Indicators (KPI)….”  "

PPI – Process Performance Indicator,Indicadores para medir atividades ou pontos de decisão individuais do processo,“25 business process performance measurement indicators (ID Code: PPI) that measure the performance of activities or decision points”

KPPI – Key Process Performance Indicator,Indicadores de ponta-a-ponta (end-to-end) do processo completo,“4 key business process performance measurement indicators (ID Code: KPPI) which measure performance in general from the beginning to the end”

column1: Percentage of Invalid Birth Certificate Applications,PPI de qualidade
column2: % de solicitações inválidas,Tabela IV

column1: Number of application defects,Métrica de qualidade usada para avaliar saúde do processo,"“Number of application defects in Surabaya COPACR service business process, obtained from … This data is used as one aspect (quality aspect)”  "
Implementation time (end-to-end),Tempo total de execução medido via timestamps
column2: utilizado na saúde (aspecto tempo),“Data on implementation time from the beginning to the end of the process (end to end process) … used as one aspect (time aspect)”

column1: Total number of applications,Usado para medir importância estratégica de cada processo,“total application data for each business process… used to determine the value of the strategic importance aspect”

Average number of applications,Limite de corte para classificar importância estratégica,“average number of applications is 14525 applications. This data is used to determine the limit value of the strategic importance.”
Target time per activity,Meta de duração de cada atividade
column2: serve de referência para PPIs,“The target time per activity from each service is obtained from the Time column in the SOP…”

Kraus et al. 2024 - Data-driven assessment of business process resilience.pdf
measure,usage_in_text,evidence_from_text
Lead time,"Base temporal measure of a single case, aggregated later
column2: used as example of output feature that can serve as PPI.","“…output features, such as the number of completed cases or average lead time during a period.”"

column1: Average lead time,Primary Process Performance Indicator (PPI) adopted in all resilience scenarios and experiments.,"“In the running example … the average lead time as a PPI, i.e., FP = {l_t} …”"
Number of completed cases,Alternative output feature that can be selected as a PPI (throughput).,"“…output features, such as the number of completed cases or average lead time during a period.”"
Number of case arrivals (arrival rate),Input feature
column2: also interpreted as disruption source (↑arr_c) whose sudden increase is analysed.,"“…input or in-system features, such as the numbers of case arrivals…”  and  “…a peak in case arrivals…”"

column1: Number of active cases,In-system feature
column2: used both as disruption source (↑act_c) and as additional explanatory variable.,“…disruptions involving increases in the numbers of case arrivals and active cases…”

column1: Number of available resources,In-system feature
column2: decrease (↓avl_r) is treated as disruption type affecting performance.,“…disruptions … and decreases in the available resources…”

column1: Time-to-impact,Derived resilience measure quantifying how long after a disruption the PPI first exceeds the acceptable level.,"“Time-to-impact (TI[D,P]) captures the time between a disruption D … and the next moment t1 at which process performance P first goes beyond its acceptable performance level P*.”"

Recovery time,Derived resilience measure expressing how long the PPI needs to return to acceptable level after initial impact.,"“Recovery time (RT[D,P]) captures the time it takes for PPI P to return to its acceptable performance level P* … after the initial impact at t1.”"

Maximal performance deviation,Derived resilience measure denoting the largest negative deflection of the PPI during recovery.,"“Maximal performance deviation (MPD[D,P]) captures the largest (negative) deflection of PPI P from its acceptable performance level P* during the recovery period…”"

Cumulative performance loss,Derived resilience measure aggregating total performance loss incurred during recovery.,"“Cumulative performance loss (CPL[D,P]) aggregates the total performance loss of P incurred during the recovery period…”"

column2: computed per category
column3: appears in formula (2) and in Tables 3 and 4.,"""The performance of information extraction (IE) system is measured using three factors: Precision, Recall and F-measure…"" (Section 4.1)  "

column1: Leite and Quadros 2024 - Lean applications across the healthcare ecosystem - Value creation, destruction and a research agenda.pdf
Performance_Measure,Usage_Context,Text_Evidence
Waiting time,Indicator of service speed and patient flow
column2: used to evaluate lean impact on delays,“A 94 % reduction was found by Bhat et al. (2014) in the waiting time of patients in the queue for elective surgical procedures”

column1: Waiting time,Measured again after other lean projects,“The waiting time was reduced by about 56 %” (Wang et al. 2015)
Waiting time,Measured in dental clinic improvement,"“One-hour reduction in the waiting time, improved patient satisfaction by 21 %” (Robinson et al. 2016)  "
Waiting time,Target metric in ED review & negative‐result studies,“Reduce waiting times for patients in care … Lack of evidence of the impact” (Tlapa et al. 2020)
Queue length / Patient queue,Used to quantify overcrowding and delays,“94 % reduction in the waiting time of patients in the queue for elective surgical procedures” (Bhat et al. 2014)
Turnaround/Cycle time,Imaging-department failure analysis,“Improved workflow by eliminating the causes of failure … impact on the cost and quality of services” (Taner et al. 2011)
Cancellations rate,Measure of surgical-schedule reliability,“A 70 % reduction in the cancellations” (Paim et al. 2016)
Scheduling/completed appointments,Capacity-planning metric,“An increase of 97 % in the level of scheduling appointments” (Paim et al. 2016)
Patient satisfaction,Outcome/quality measure for service users,“Improved patient satisfaction by 21 % and reduced negative comments by 24 %” (Robinson et al. 2016)
Patient safety,Clinical outcome and risk metric,“Positive impact on patient safety … the risk of being exposed to more radiation has also been minimized” (Taner et al. 2011)

Quality of care,Overall service quality index,“Lean healthcare ensured VMMC's respectable position in the top 1 % of all hospitals in the U.S. in terms of both quality of patient care and system efficiency”
Quality improvement results,Composite measure in Six Sigma study,"“The results of quality improvement were only moderate, failed and lacked team commitment” (Gowen et al. 2012)  "
Process efficiency,Core lean outcome
column2: often paired with cost,“Little or no impact on process efficiency” (Kelendar et al. 2020)

column1: System efficiency,High-level organisational KPI,“Top 1 % … in terms of both quality of patient care and system efficiency” (VMMC example)
Productivity,Resource-use metric in outpatient care study,“Little impact on efficiency and productivity after lean implementation” (Rathi et al. 2021)
Cost reduction,Financial performance indicator,"“Need strategies … reducing costs, and reducing waste” (Alkhaldi & Abdallah 2020)  "
Waste reduction,Primary lean metric for non-value activities,“This system aimed to increase efficiency in the production stages by reducing waste and creating value” (Introduction)
Throughput / Number of procedures,Used to show capacity growth,“An increase in the number of scheduled procedures in the units” (Paim et al. 2016)
Accessibility,Equity/availability metric,"“Improvements have led to higher performance in quality, but not efficiency or accessibility” (Alkhaldi & Abdallah 2020)  "
Employee/Staff engagement,Workforce performance indicator,"“High improvement clinics reported higher baseline levels of teamwork, workforce engagement …” (Hung et al. 2019)  "
Employee/Staff satisfaction,HR outcome linked to lean,“Improved … employee satisfaction and short-term absenteeism” (Simons et al. 2017)
Absenteeism,Derived HR performance measure,“Improved … employee satisfaction and short-term absenteeism” (Simons et al. 2017)
Burnout/Stress,Negative HR performance indicator,“The team presented higher levels of burnout and workplace perceptions as stressful” (Hung et al. 2018)
Capacity–Demand balance,Operational KPI highlighting bottlenecks,“Imbalance between capacity and demand” listed under barriers (Table 4)
Benchmarking/Performance measurement,Meta-indicator of KPI systems,“There is no consensus on the dimensions of performance measurement and benchmarking in the lean healthcare” (Reponen et al. 2021)
Damij et al. 2015 - Healthcare process analysis and improvement at the department of abdominal surgery, university medical centre Ljubljana.pdf
Performance Measure,How it is used / defined in the text,Evidence (trechos do artigo)
Cycle Time (Flow Time),Tempo total que a unidade de fluxo permanece no processo
column2: utilizado para analisar desempenho dos departamentos.,“the average flow time or cycle time (T) is the average of flow times (cycle times) across all flow units that exit the process during a specific time span” e a Tabela 3 intitulada “Department Min Cycle Time Avg Cycle Time Max Cycle Time”.

column1: Average Cycle Time,"Valor médio de Cycle Time
column2: calculado via simulação (p.ex. 12,05 dias) e usado em outras métricas (fluxo, eficiência).",“the average cycle time in the Department is 12.05 days” (Seção 2.3.1).

column1: Minimum Cycle Time,Menor Cycle Time observado
column2: apresentado para mostrar variabilidade do processo.,"Tabela 3 coluna “Min Cycle Time” (ex.: 7,93 d)."

column1: Maximum Cycle Time,Maior Cycle Time observado
column2: mostra pior caso de duração.,"Tabela 3 coluna “Max Cycle Time” (ex.: 15,04 d)."

column1: Average Wait (Waiting Time),Tempo médio em que a unidade fica em filas
column2: usado para identificar gargalos.,"Tabela 3 coluna “Avg Wait” (ex.: 10,85 d)."

column1: Average Work (Processing Time),Tempo médio efetivamente gasto em atividades de trabalho (sem espera).,"Tabela 3 coluna “Avg Work” (ex.: 1,36 d ou 2,74 h, conforme departamento)."
Inventory / Average Inventory (I),Número médio de unidades dentro dos limites do processo
column2: base para Little’s Law.,“we know that the average inventory is 75
column3: this is the number of patients in the Department at any point of time.”

column1: Flow Rate / Average Flow Rate / Throughput (R),Número médio de unidades que entram/saem do processo por unidade de tempo
column2: calculado com a Lei de Little.,“average r = 75 / 12.05 = 6.22 patients/day … 6 patients per day enter the process and the same number of patients leaves it.”

column1: Theoretical Cycle Time,Tempo mínimo necessário sem qualquer espera
column2: usado no cálculo da eficiência.,“The simulation results show that the average theoretical cycle time is equal to 1.36 days.”

column1: Cycle Time Efficiency,Razão entre Theoretical Cycle Time e Average Cycle Time
column2: indica proporção de espera.,“cycle time efficiency = 1.36/12.05 = 11.29 % … patient waiting time is 88.71 % of the average cycle time.”

column1: Capacity Utilization (Resource Utilization),Grau em que cada pool de recursos é efetivamente usado
column2: apresentado para cada recurso.,“Capacity utilization measures the degree to which resources are effectively utilized by a process.” e Tabela 4 “Resource Utilization” (ex.: Administrator 58.71 %).

column1: Process Capacity,"Capacidade total do processo, dependente dos recursos disponíveis.",“The capacity of a process depends on the process resources that perform its activities.”
Unit Load,Tempo total de trabalho que um recurso gasta para processar uma unidade
column2: parte da análise de capacidade.,“The unit load of a resource is the sum of the times of the activities performed by a certain resource unit in processing a flow unit through the whole process.”

column1: Estrada-Torres et al. 2019 - Measuring Performance in Knowledge-intensive Processes.pdf
Indicador,Tipo,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual

Average time spent in solving an incident,Exemplo de Lag PPI,"Mede o tempo total, por instância de processo, desde o recebimento do incidente até sua resolução final.","“it is calculated as the total time from the moment when an incident is received, to the final resolution of the incident (successful or not)” (Sec. 3.2, exemplo de PPI)."

Cycle time ≤ 3 working days,Lag PPI associado a meta estratégica,"Define o objetivo de tempo de ciclo máximo para o processo de incident management, alinhado à satisfação do cliente.","“its cycle time should be less than 3 working days” (Sec. 5, início do exemplo de lead/lag)."

Double-check with customer within 24 h,Lead PPI proposto,"Ação que deve ser realizada pelos participantes para garantir informação completa e, assim, atingir o lag PPI de ciclo de 3 dias.",“…double-checking the incident with the customer within the first 24 hours could be a lead PPI…” (Sec. 5).

Average work time spent per ticket (Work Time AVG),Lag PPI existente,"Quantifica o esforço (tempo de trabalho efetivo) gasto por técnicos em cada ticket, permitindo identificar clientes mais custosos.",“every member of the technical teams reports how much time he or she has spent working on a ticket.” (Sec. 6.2).

Average duration of tickets (Duration AVG),Lag PPI existente,"Mede o tempo total entre abertura e fechamento de cada ticket, incluindo tempos de espera.",“this measures the time from a ticket opening to its closure.” (Sec. 6.2).

First contact resolution ratio (First Cont. Res %),Lag PPI existente,Percentual de tickets resolvidos no primeiro contato com a equipe de suporte.,“measures the ratio of tickets that were solved directly in the first contact with the support teams.” (Sec. 6.2).

Total tickets opened (Total Tickets),Lag PPI existente,"Conta o número total de tickets abertos por cliente em determinado período, apoiando alocação de recursos.","“measures the total amount of tickets opened for each client, given a period of time.” (Sec. 6.2)."
Average amount of interlocutors per case (Interlocutor AVG),Lead PPI proposto,Conta quantos agentes distintos participaram de atos comunicativos em cada ticket
column2: indica complexidade e custo.,“denotes how many agents executed Communicative Acts during a Communicative Interaction.” (Sec. 6.3).

column1: Average amount of messages exchanged per case (Messages Exch AVG),Lead PPI proposto,Número médio de mensagens trocadas por ticket
column2: pode indicar problemas complexos ou demorados.,“counting the number of messages exchanged during each ticket resolution.” (Sec. 6.3).

column1: Average message size per case (Message Size AVG),Lead PPI proposto,Tamanho médio (em caracteres) das mensagens
column2: mensagens maiores podem demandar mais tempo de análise.,“messageSize is defined as the count of characters contained in a message.” (Sec. 6.3).

column1: Incoming customer phone-call ratio (Phone Call Ratio),Lead PPI proposto,Proporção de mensagens recebidas por áudio (ligações) em relação ao total
column2: canal telefônico afeta tempo e custo.,“audio... messages by phone calls made by customers… This indicator may help managers to identify clients who use the audio channel most.” (Sec. 6.3).

column1: Redução percentual do tempo de processo,Mede o ganho obtido após a reengenharia.,“Process time has been declined by 43.74%.”
KPI semanal 1-26 / 28-52,Planilha proposta para monitorar indicadores ao longo do ano.,"Conteúdo do indicador descrito: “Measurement for Week 1-26 and 28-Week 52, KPI Graphic.”  "
Consistência do OTR,Verifica a estabilidade do indicador de entrega no prazo
column2: parte do painel de KPI.,“(3) Consistency of On Time Release (OTR)” listado como item do indicador de desempenho.

column1: Variabilidade da diferença de Lead Time,"Analisa a dispersão dos tempos de liberação, ajudando a identificar causas de variação.",“(4) the Lead Time Variability of Difference” listado no desenho da ferramenta de indicadores.
Pedrinaci and Domingue 2009 - Ontology-based metrics computation for business process analysis.pdf
Metric,Usage in text,Evidence from the article

Balanced Scorecard measures,Generic set of performance measures covering four perspectives used to give managers an overall view of the business,“the Balanced Scorecard is a popular ‘set of measures that gives top managers a fast but comprehensive view of the business’ [10]”
Fill rate by order,Supply-Chain specific KPI used to evaluate how many orders are completely fulfilled,“Supply-Chain Council defines … metrics such as ‘fill rate by order’…”
Total order fulfilment lead time,Supply-Chain specific KPI measuring end-to-end delivery time,“…or ‘total order fulfilment lead time’ [18]…”
Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Generic label for critical business metrics,"“…which represent what is often referred to as Key Performance Indicators in the literature [10, 3].”  "
Return of Investment (ROI),Financial KPI highlighted as crucial for most businesses,“…the so-called Return of Investment which is certainly crucial for most businesses…”
Process instance cost,Function Metric suggested as typical example for BPM analysis,“…typical Function Metrics one could think of such as ‘Process Instance cost’…”
Process instance execution time,Function Metric computing duration of a single process instance,“Process Instance Execution Time is a Function Metric which takes as input one Process Instance.”

Business Activity Realisation execution time,Function Metric that returns the duration of any Business Activity Realisation (BAR),Listing 1 heading: “Function Metric for computing the execution time of Business Activity Realisations”
Average execution time of a process,Aggregation Metric used for overall performance of a given process,“defining metrics such as the ‘average execution time of process X’…”
Average execution time of closed BARs,Aggregation Metric that averages execution time over all finished BARs,Listing 1 instance: “#_AvgClosedBARsExecutionTime”
Maximum execution time of BARs,Aggregation Metric retrieving the longest duration among BARs,“…we have defined the … maximum ‘execution time for Business Activity Realisations’.”
Minimum execution time of BARs,Aggregation Metric retrieving the shortest duration among BARs,“…we have defined the … minimum ‘execution time for Business Activity Realisations’.”
Average cost per process,Aggregation Metric for mean cost of process executions,“…metrics such as … ‘maximum of the average cost per process’.”
Maximum of the average cost per process,Derived KPI combining two aggregations (max over averaged costs),“…or even the ‘maximum of the average cost per process’.”

Ratio success-failure for a Business Activity,Derived Function Metric dividing number of successes by number of failures,“…the ‘ratio success-failure for a Business Activity’ can just be defined on a one-off basis…”
Number of failures,Function/Aggregation Metric counting failed executions,“…two other metrics for computing respectively the ‘number of failures’…”
Number of successes,Function/Aggregation Metric counting successful executions,“…and the ‘number of successes’ for the given Business Activity.”

Count of BARs in a given state,"Aggregation Metric counting Business Activity Realisations that meet a state filter (e.g. Completed, Running)",“…metrics that count all the Business Activity Realisations in some particular state…”
Count of Process Instances performing a particular process,Aggregation Metric for workload monitoring,"“…the Process Instances performing a particular Process, etc.”  "
Standard deviation of a metric,Statistical Aggregation Metric available in the framework,"“…basic statistic operations, i.e., … standard-deviation, …”  "
Variance of a metric,Statistical Aggregation Metric available in the framework,"“…basic statistic operations, i.e., … variance.”  "
Mean (average) of a metric,Generic aggregation construct supported for many metrics,"“…statistical operations, i.e., … mean…”  "
Maximum of a metric,Aggregation construct to retrieve highest value,"“…statistical operations, i.e., … max…”  "
Minimum of a metric,Aggregation construct to retrieve lowest value,"“…statistical operations, i.e., … min…”  "
Sum of a metric,Aggregation construct to sum a set of values,"“…statistical operations, i.e., count, sum, prod…”  "
Product of a metric,Aggregation construct multiplying a set of values,"“…statistical operations, i.e., … prod…”  "
Range of a metric,Statistical Aggregation reporting spread (max-min),"“…basic statistic operations, i.e., … range…”  "
Mode of a metric,Statistical Aggregation reporting most frequent value,"“…basic statistic operations, i.e., … mode…”  "

Smallest deviation from agreed deadline,Timeliness KPI important in logistics domain,“…the smallest deviation with respect to the agreed deadline is not as relevant for a software company as it is within the logistics domain.”
Evolution of customer satisfaction,Time-series or trend metric for monitoring satisfaction over time,“…like the ‘evolution of customer satisfaction in the last year’.”
Kellner and Fiege 2009 - Viewpoints in complex event processing - industrial experience report.pdf
Metric,Usage in the text,Evidence (literal excerpt)
Utilization rate,Key Performance Indicator (KPI) for machinery
column2: falling below a threshold (50 %) is used to detect a maintenance-window situation,“…opportunity to schedule a maintenance interval … if the utilization of the machinery will drop below 50 %.”

column1: Average utilization (1-hour),"Concrete definition of the KPI
column2: objective is 100 %, threshold 50 %",“The KPI is the average utilization over a one hour time window of the machinery at process step ‘Molding’. For simplicity we assume that an objective of 100 % utilization has been specified. The threshold for the situation is an average utilization of 50 %…”

column1: Number of produced items during last hour,Lower-level metric used to derive the utilization KPI,“The next lower-level metric is automatically indicated by this derivation rule: Number of produced items during the last hour.”
Downtime of machinery,Negative KPI
column2: directly correlates with revenue and is to be minimised,"“…the manufacturer’s revenue depends directly on the produced items, therefore the revenue is directly correlated to the downtime of the machinery.”"

column1: Revenue per month,Business objective/financial KPI (target value 100 000 $) influencing CEP design,“…the objective ‘Revenue per month of $100000’ has the internal influencer ‘machinery’.”
Data freshness,Quality/temporal KPI
column2: part of value–time curve for judging CEP benefit,“Hackathorn investigates … the relationship of ‘data freshness to business value’ using a value-time curve…”

column1: Decision latency,Performance KPI to be reduced by CEP for higher business value,“…benefits achieved by shortening the decision latency for interpretation of events.”
Timeliness,Quality attribute for underlying event data
column2: determines infrastructure requirements,"“…determine quality attributes like timeliness, auditability, idem potency, frequency, etc. of underlying events.”"

column1: Auditability,Quality attribute/KPI for traceability and non-repudiability of detected situations,“…the exact definition of the situation and occurrences have to be recorded for non-repudiability reasons.”
Idempotency,Quality attribute for event delivery/processing
column2: affects system design,"“…quality attributes like timeliness, auditability, idem potency, frequency, etc. of underlying events.”"

column1: Frequency,Quality attribute indicating how often base events occur or are sampled,"“…quality attributes like timeliness, auditability, idem potency, frequency, etc. of underlying events.”"
