Palavras por minuto (WPM),"velocidade de digitação usada para comparar desempenho de datilógrafos, tecladistas ou após treinamento","Book 1924
column2: Droege & Hill 1961 encontraram mais WPM em máquinas elétricas
column3: West 1969 analisou WPM por 30 min
column4: Emmons & Hirsch 1982 comparam 35-, 64-, 84-, 104-mm teclados vs WPM  "

column1: Taxa / número de erros,percentual ou contagem de erros para avaliar precisão,Klemmer & Lockhead 1959: 1 600-4 300 erros/dia
column2: Diehl & Seibel 1962 contam ‘net words per minute’
column3: West 1969 erros por minuto
column4: Kinkead & Gonzalez 1969: força × erros
column5: Emmons & Hirsch 1982: erros ↑ em teclas de menor resistência

column1: Tempo de reação,tempo entre estímulo luminoso e pressão da(s) tecla(s),Ratz & Ritchie 1961
column2: Seibel 1962 (5-finger chord)
column3: Lachnit & Pieper 1990: 5-choice tasks

column1: Tempo entre teclas / tempo de digrama,intervalo entre duas teclas sucessivas para avaliar cadência,Fox & Stansfield 1964 mediram 115 tempos de digram
column2: Soechting & Flanders 1992 analisam sobreposição de movimentos

column1: Frequência de toques (toques/hora ou /dia),volume de produção mecânica,Klemmer & Lockhead 1959: 56 000-83 000 toques/dia
column2: Oxenburgh et al 1985: 1 500-2 000 manipulações/h citadas por Hammer 1934

column1: Toques por segundo (k/s),taxa instantânea de produção,Kroemer 1964: até 3 k/s em K-teclado
column2: Guggenbuehl & Krueger 1990 apontam 3-5 Hz como ‘programa motor’

column1: Duração de digitação contínua,tempo suportado até fadiga,Kroemer 1965 mediu tempo até parar por dor
column2: Rodbard & Weiss 1977: 35 s-7 min sob isquemia

column1: Frequência cardíaca,bpm comparado repouso-trabalho,Schroetter 1925: +13-17 bpm
column2: Kroemer 1965 monitorou FC durante testes

column1: Consumo de oxigênio / ventilação,custo metabólico do trabalho,Schroetter 1925: +61-107 % resp.
column2: 275-507 cc O₂ /min

column1: EMG (eletromiografia),atividade muscular para estimar carga e fadiga,Lundervold 1951/58
column2: Zipp et al 1983⇢ escolha de ângulos
column3: Hagberg & Sundelin 1986
column4: Martin et al 1998 correlacionam EMG-força

column1: Fadiga muscular (frequência ou RMS EMG),indicador fisiológico de sobre-uso,Ayoub et al 1975: queda na frequência EMG
column2: Baecher-Burd et al 1994 discutem uso para pausas

column1: Pressão no túnel do carpo,proxy de risco CTS durante tarefas,Armstrong et al 1991: medição piloto
column2: Rempel & Horie 1994a: ↑ pressão com extensão
column3: Rempel & Horie 1994b: ↑ com apoio de punho

column1: Força de pico no dedo / força de impacto,carga mecânica real na tecla,"Rempel et al 1992: força aplicada 2,5-3,9× força de acionamento
column2: Armstrong et al 1994: 9–10 % MVC  "

column1: Força de acionamento da tecla (Make Force),parâmetro de projeto relacionado a desempenho/erro,"Kinkead & Gonzalez 1969 (0,9-5,3 oz)
column2: Snyder 1983 recomenda 0,5-0,6 N
column3: Akagi 1992: 36, 43, 71 g comparados  "

column1: Deslocamento da tecla (Key travel),distância percorrida como feedback/tato,"ANSI/HFS-100-1988: 1,5-6 mm
column2: Rempel et al 1992: 3,5–6,5 mm  "

column1: Força-deslocamento (curva de toque),"‘snap’, ‘break-away’ analisados vs. desempenho",Clare 1976 mostra boa x má curva
column2: Rosch 1984 compara 3 teclados
column3: Olacsi & Beaton 1997 metrologia

column1: Percepção / preferência de usuário,escore subjetivo de conforto ou agrado,Galitz 1965/66 – 21° preferido
column2: Kinkead & Gonzalez 1969 50 % não bate com desempenho
column3: Emmons & Hirsch 1982 preferências vs erros

column1: Sintomas de dor / desconforto (questionários),indicador epidemiológico de desempenho humano,Sauter et al 1991: 900 VDT users
column2: Low 1990 61 % relatam dor
column3: Bernard et al 1992 41 % com sintomas

column1: Incidência / prevalência de CTD,número de casos por população,Oxenburgh et al 1985: 4 800 casos/Telecom
column2: Silverstein et al 1987 risco × repetição/força

column1: Strain Index,índice calculado de risco biomecânico,Moore & Garg 1995 apresentam método para análise de tarefas
Grip strength / força de preensão,capacidade máxima para avaliar fadiga ou risco,Duncan & Ferguson 1976: ↑ força pós-fisioterapia
column2: Seror 1987 usa aesthesiometer + força

column1: Ângulo de desvio ulnar / extensão do punho,medida postural ligada a risco,Grandjean et al 1983 mediram posturas
column2: Rempel et al 1994 mostraram –13° → –1° com teclado negativo

column1: Frequência respiratória,parâmetro fisiológico de esforço,Schroetter 1925: +61–107 % durante datilografia
Tempo de aprendizagem / horas para retomar velocidade,medida de adoção de novo teclado,Strong 1956: 100 h para recuperar WPM no Dvorak
column2: Sidorsky 1974: <5 h em alpha-dot

column1: Tempo de apontamento / posicionamento do cursor,desempenho com outros dispositivos,Card et al 1978: mouse > joystick > keys
column2: Goodwin 1975 light-gun vs keyboard

column1: Variabilidade de desempenho,mudanças intra-sessão ou entre operadores,West 1969: estabilidade ↑ com habilidade
column2: Klemmer 1971 resume variância entre indivíduos

column1: Kohlbacher and Gruenwald 2011 - Process orientation - Conceptualization and measurement.pdf
Medidor/Indicador,Sigla (quando existente),Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho do artigo)

Indicadores de desempenho de processos,PPM_DEF,Verificar se existem indicadores (métricas) que capturam o desempenho de cada processo de negócio.,“Process performance indicators are metrics capturing the performance of a business process.”

Derivação dos indicadores de desempenho de processos,PPM_DRV,Avaliar se os indicadores de desempenho de processos são derivados das metas corporativas e/ou requisitos dos clientes.,“captures whether process performance indicators are derived from enterprise goals and/or from (internal) customer requirements.”

Coleta contínua de dados de desempenho do processo,PPM_COLL,Checar se os dados necessários aos indicadores são coletados de forma contínua.,“captures whether process performance data are collected continuously.”

Apresentação de métricas aos executores do processo,PPM_PRES,"Garantir que os trabalhadores do processo recebam periodicamente as métricas de desempenho, possibilitando reação rápida a desvios.",“captures whether process metrics are presented periodically to process performers (e.g. awareness and motivation).”

Ações acionadas pelos indicadores de desempenho,PPM_ACT,Verificar se indicadores ruins efetivamente geram ações de melhoria.,“captures whether improvement actions are actually initiated if poor process performance is encountered.”

Benchmarking de processos,BENCHM,Utilizar métricas de desempenho para comparar processos internos com práticas de referência (best practices).,“Process benchmarking uses business processes as comparison units and aims to identify best operating practices.”

Custeio baseado em atividades (Activity-Based Costing),ABCOST,"Medir o custo dos processos de forma transversal, alinhado ao fluxo de atividades do processo.",“Activity-based costing captures costs horizontally in line with business processes.”

Sistemas de incentivos alinhados ao processo,INC_SYS,Usar métricas de desempenho do processo como base de sistemas de recompensa e reconhecimento.,“captures whether the organization has implemented reward systems (incentive systems) that emphasize the needs of business processes.”
Krenn et al. 2017 - Stakeholder-centered Process Implementation - Assessing S-BPM Tool Support.pdf
Metric,Usage in the text (o que o medidor avalia / como é aplicado),Evidência literal do texto
Throughput,Quantidade de processos executados por unidade de tempo
column2: usado como KPI para comparar motores BPMN 2.0,"“thereby, throughput (i.e. processes executed/time unit) was used as KPI for the selected execution  engines”"

column1: Latency,Tempo de resposta de um motor de execução
column2: incluído como KPI na 2ª iteração de benchmark,“The set of KPIs was enriched by  latency  and utilization”

column1: Utilization,Grau de utilização de recursos do motor de execução
column2: incluído como KPI,“The set of KPIs was enriched by latency and  utilization ”

column1: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) – genérico,Conjunto de indicadores-chave definidos para avaliar desempenho dos motores e processos,“Defining expressive  Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)”
Performance measurement,Avaliação de desempenho de processos para benchmarking entre municípios,“performance measurement and benchmarking across and within domain systems can be performed”

Process performance reports,Relatórios que consolidam métricas de desempenho dos processos após execução/simulação,“the Process Analytical Reporting component provides the necessary  process performance reports ”
Runtime performance,Desempenho do sistema em tempo de execução
column2: usado como KPI principal do estudo,"“Hence,  runtime  performance  was one of the KPIs.”"

column1: Effectiveness,Eficácia da transformação de modelos em especificações executáveis
column2: critério de avaliação qualitativa,“as it affects the  effectiveness  and efficiency of implementing stakeholder process models.”

column1: Efficiency,Relação esforço/resultado na implementação de modelos
column2: critério de avaliação,idem à citação anterior

column1: Time spent,Tempo dedicado a cada atividade pelos participantes
column2: registrado no diário como medida de esforço,“we were interested in the time … they  spent  to complete the activity.”

column1: Cognitive effort,Esforço mental declarado pelos participantes para cada atividade
column2: registrado no diário,idem à citação anterior (“… and cognitive effort they spent …”).

column1: Turnaround time,Duração total de um projeto PBL (ciclo completo do processo) – serve como métrica de prazo,“The  turnaround time  for a project is a study year (winter and summer term in Austria).”
Performance stress test,Teste de estresse de desempenho que exercita todos os elementos BPMN Core
column2: avalia limite de capacidade,“The initial test was a  performance stress test  with a workload including all elements of the BPMN 2.0 Core3 …”

column1: Load test,Teste de carga para avaliar desempenho sob trabalho contínuo,"“The second iteration involved additional systems …  load , soak, and spike tests …”"
Soak test,Teste de resistência (longa duração) para verificar estabilidade,idem à citação anterior
Spike test,Teste de picos de carga para medir reação a aumentos súbitos,idem à citação anterior
Keramati et al. 2011 - Improving business processes with business proces ... and business process execution language - An action research approach.pdf
Not valid csv text, check the article
Kabirian and Olafsson 2007 - Allocation of simulation runs for simulation optimization.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Number of simulation runs,"Principal métrica de eficiência
column2: utilizada para comparar algoritmos, para definir critério de parada (ótimo alcançado ou 1000 simulações).","“it is therefore reasonable to measure the efficiency of a SO algorithm in terms of the number of simulation runs required” / “in terms of the number of evaluations (simulation runs) needed, the APS algorithm converges much faster…” / “if a method fails to find a point within optimum neighborhood in the first 1000 simulation runs, it is stopped.”  "

column1: Simulation run time,Representa o custo computacional de avaliar a função-objetivo
column2: motiva reduzir número de execuções.,“the simulation run time for the proposed candidates” / “running a simulation model for real systems is usually computationally time-consuming”

column1: Time to propose new solutions,Parte 1 do tempo total
column2: usado para justificar maior ‘overhead’ de processamento.,“The time required to propose new candidate solution(s)” / “this translates into more computational burden for what we referred to above as the first part”

column1: Overall computational time,Soma dos dois tempos anteriores
column2: objetivo é minimizá-lo.,“the total computational time in each iteration can be divided into two parts” / “this strategy … usually leads to less overall time for SO methods”

column1: Objective function value (estimada),Variável a ser minimizada
column2: avaliada via simulação ou rede neural.,“the problem goal is to minimize an expected objective function” / “objective function(s) of these candidate solution(s) are evaluated”

column1: Best found objective function value,Acompanha a convergência de cada método depois de cada simulação.,“the best found objective function after each simulation run for the trials of the observations of each objective function was averaged.”
Average best found objective function value,Agrega resultados de várias repetições/observações antes de plotar curvas.,idem citação anterior
Logarithmic average best found objective function value,Transformação usada nos gráficos comparativos para melhor visualização.,“The y-axes show logarithmic values of these averages.”
Space Score,Indicador baseado na área do partição
column2: maior área ⇒ maior probabilidade de exploração.,“The space score is motivated by the fourth principle … The higher the area of a partition … the higher this criterion would be.”

column1: Meta-model Score,Indicador baseado na qualidade prevista da função-objetivo pelo modelo neuronal.,“The meta-model score is based on these approximated objective functions. The better the approximated objective function … the higher this criterion would be.”
Quality Score,Indicador baseado na qualidade das simulações vizinhas
column2: direciona exploração local.,“the quality score for a partition is the representation of the quality of the estimated objective function of simulated points surrounding the partition.”

column1: Total Score,"Combinação ponderada (Space, Meta-model, Quality) usada para sortear a partição promessa.",“These three criteria are combined into a single indicator called total score for each partition and the total scores … determines the probability…”

Criterion coefficients,Pesos que modulam a importância de cada critério e são adaptados a cada iteração.,"“we use a criterion coefficient for each of the three criteria, which are changed between each iteration based on the effectiveness…”  "
Mean Squared Error (MSE) da rede neural,Métrica usada para treinar/ajustar o meta-modelo.,"“objective … least mean squared error objective (see Ma and Khorasani, 2003).”  "
Area of partition,Variável base para o Space Score
column2: indica tamanho da região não explorada.,“The space score is defined by comparing the area of each partition with the area of the biggest partition in AL”

column1: Saturation Indicator,Verifica se já há simulações demais em uma vizinhança
column2: controla exploração local.,“saturation indicator equals to 1 if the total number of simulated points within the circle-shape neighborhood … is less than an allowed upper bound”

column1: Membership Indicator,Mede pertinência fuzzy de um ponto a cada partição
column2: compõe o Quality Score.,“M as the ‘Membership Indicator’ is the fuzzy membership of the corresponding point to each partition …”

column1: Belongingness Indicator,Compara pertencimento de ponto entre partições vizinhas
column2: compõe o Quality Score.,“B as the ‘Belongingness Indicator’ compares the belongingness of each point to the partition … and the corresponding immediate neighbor partition.”

column1: Wetzstein et al. 2009 - Monitoring and Analyzing Influential Factors of Business Process Performance.pdf
Shipment Delivery Time
column2: PPM considered highly influential on KPI
column3: Sec VI-B, Run 1: “average shipment delivery time is high …”

column1: Supplier 1 Delivery Time
column2: PPM representing external supplier performance
column3: Sec VI-B, Run 1: “supplier 1 has in average a higher than expected supplier delivery time”

column1: Availability Warehouse Web Service
column2: QoS metric analysed in second experiment
column3: Sec VI-B, Run 2: “the warehouse Web service … unavailable with probability 15%”

column1: Availability Shipment Web Service
column2: QoS metric analysed exclusively in second tree
column3: Sec VI-B, Run 2: “availability of the shipment and warehouse Web services have an impact on the KPI value”

column1: Louwerse and Rothkrantz 2014 - Intraday stock forecasting.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
SIGN,Medida de erro/desempenho para avaliar e selecionar estruturas de RNA
column2: também analisada em função de diferentes thresholds.,"""The results of the experiment show a great variety with respect to the Error/performance measure SIGN, MAE and RMSE."" / ""Figure 4: SIGN performance for ING forecasting in relation to the applied threshold."" / ""…the SIGN performance measure is more indicative of a stock forecaster’s trading performance than the traditional performance measures.""  "

column1: MAE (Mean Absolute Error),Métrica tradicional de erro utilizada em conjunto com SIGN e RMSE para comparar configurações de RNA.,"""The results of the experiment show a great variety with respect to the Error/performance measure SIGN, MAE and RMSE.""  "

RMSE (Root Mean Square Error),Outra métrica tradicional de erro usada juntamente com SIGN e MAE para avaliar as RNAs.,"""The results of the experiment show a great variety with respect to the Error/performance measure SIGN, MAE and RMSE.""  "
Compound Return / Total Return,Métrica principal de desempenho em simulação de trading
column2: calculada como fração do investimento inicial e usada para comparar TA/ANN com estratégias-referência.,"""At the end of each trading simulation, the obtained compound return is used as the resulting performance measure."" / ""The total return is the compound return and provided as a fraction of the original investment.""  "

column1: Return per Trade,"Métrica derivada que expressa a qualidade média de cada operação
column2: obtida pela raiz n-ésima do compound return, onde n = #trades.","""The return/trade is the return per trade, calculated from the total return and number of trades by taking the n-th root of the total return.""  "

column1: Number of Trades (# trades),Conta a quantidade de posições abertas/fechadas durante a simulação
column2: usada para normalizar outros indicadores.,"""Furthermore, the number of trades is listed under # trades. This corresponds to the number of stock positions held during the period.""  "

column1: Average Duration of Stock Positions,Mede o tempo médio (holding period) de cada posição
column2: relatado na tabela de resultados.,"""Finally, the average duration of stock positions is listed. This is the amount of time a stock was in possession (the time between buying and selling a stock).""  "

column1: Return on Investment (ROI),Objetivo geral de avaliação do modelo em termos de rentabilidade.,"""The objective is to obtain a performance measure of the stock forecasting model in terms of obtained return on investment.""  "

Profit Percentage,Indicador derivado (ex.: 21% profit) usado na discussão dos melhores modelos.,"""The best performing TA/ANN models obtained compound returns of 121% (21% profit) for ING, 153% for Fortis and 125% for Ahold."""
Ehm et al. 2024 - The Bullwhip Effect in End-to-End Supply Chains - The ... of Reach-Based Replenishment Policies with a Long Cycle Time Supplier.pdf
Metric,How it is used / defined in the article,Evidence (exact or paraphrased quotation from the text)

Bullwhip Effect (BWE),"Indicator of amplification of demand / order variability along the supply chain, central performance problem analysed","""The bullwhip effect (BWE)… refers to the increasing order variability of the SC upward, posing significant pressure on the upstream suppliers"""
Order variability,Numerical expression of demand signal volatility that constitutes the BWE,same sentence as above

Amplification (BWE component),Quantitative component used to describe the magnitude of the BWE in the results section,"""the three components of BWE, namely amplification, oscillation and phase lag, are reinforced"""
Oscillation (BWE component),Second component describing the wave-like pattern of inventory / orders,same quotation as above
Phase lag (BWE component),Third component measuring delay between demand change and supply reaction,same quotation as above

Stock reach (weeks of supply),"Inventory coverage measure = current stock ÷ demand, basic trigger in Kanban/VMI","""Stock Reach, defined by the current stock level over the stock demand in a period"""
Minimum stock reach,Lower limit
column2: crossing it triggers a replenishment order,"""A replenishment order is triggered automatically if the inventory level falls below the minimum reach target"""

column1: Maximum stock reach,Upper limit to avoid over-stock situations,"""The maximum and minimum stock reach are either mutually agreed upon between supplier and customer"""

Target reach level (TR),Pre-agreed reach value the supplier tries to keep in VMI,"""the supplier replenishes the inventory to maintain a pre-agreed target reach level (TR), for instance, a ten-week reach"""
Desired stock level (DS or DSi),Absolute inventory target used in the simulation
column2: calculated as demand × TR,"""the desired inventory level (DSi) is simply a multiple of both"""

column1: Safety stock level,Extra inventory kept to protect availability during disruption,"""the traditional concept of maintaining customer service level during disruption is to increase the safety stock level"""
Customer service level,Service performance objective maintained via safety stock,same quotation as above
Inventory level,General stock quantity monitored to control over/under-stock and trigger orders,"Numerous mentions, e.g. ""the desired inventory level is 600 units"""
Stock-out,Extreme VMI violation where inventory is exhausted,"""Typical VMI violations can be grouped into three categories … and stockouts"""
Under-stock,VMI violation when inventory falls below the minimum zone,same quotation as above
Over-stock,VMI violation when inventory exceeds the maximum zone,same quotation as above

Forecast accuracy,"Quality metric for demand information, tied to customer responsibility","""assign some responsibilities to the customers (when the forecast accuracy is below the agreed forecast accuracy)"""
Work-in-progress (WIP),Amount of material in process that JIT tries to minimise,"""to minimize the work-in-progress and product cycle time of the OEM"""
Product / production cycle time,Time to manufacture
column2: long value (> 3 months) is a critical constraint,"""with a long production lead time of more than three months"""

column1: Lot size,Batch quantity
column2: JIT aims at reducing it for efficiency,"""reducing lot sizes"""

column1: Rework,Volume of items needing reprocessing
column2: lean goal is to minimise it,"""minimizing rework and waste"""

column1: Waste,Material or time loss
column2: another lean performance indicator,same quotation as above

column1: Process yield,Percentage of good output
column2: JIT seeks to increase it,"""increasing process yield"""

column1: Production level,Rate of output
column2: mismatch with demand indicates inefficiency,"""a mismatch between production levels and reduced customer satisfaction"""

column1: Production capacity (C),"Maximum feasible output, used as a constraint in the simulation model","""Assuming a maximum feasible production capacity (C)"""
Back-order delay,Waiting time for deferred deliveries
column2: sensitive to allocation decisions,"""Service levels and back-order delays are sensitive to the optimal allocation for each product"""

column1: Inventory scrap risk,Likelihood/value of obsolete stock caused by demand drops,"""excessive inventory builds up… leads to a higher risk of inventory scrap"""
Line-down incidence,Occurrences of involuntary production halts at OEM
column2: ultimate failure indicator,"""bringing many major automobile producers into the production line down situation"""

column1: Node criticality,Importance of a node/component
column2: higher value raises disruption severity,"""The severity of a SC disruption is positively correlated with … node criticality"""

column1: Supply-chain density,Cohesiveness metric influencing disruption impact,"""The SC density refers to the cohesiveness of the SC network"""
Supply-chain complexity,Degree of inter-connectedness
column2: another structural risk / performance factor,"""the complexity refers to the inter-connectedness and inter-dependencies in the network"""

column1: Demand variance,Statistical variability of demand
column2: its growth causes VMI violations,"""These VMI violations often happen when demand variance grows"""

column1: Pittaras et al. 2023 - Content-based and Knowledge-enriched Representations for Classification Across Modalities - A Survey.pdf
metric,abbreviation(s) in text,how it is used / what it measures,evidence (exact snippet from the survey)

Accuracy,ACC,overall proportion of correct classifications,"Evaluation measures ACC,PR, RE,F1,AUC, and(m)AP refer to accuracy, precision, recall, F1-measure, area under curve and (mean) average precision, respectively.  "

Precision,P / PR,positive predictive value of the classifier,"Evaluation measures ACC,PR, RE,F1,AUC, and(m)AP refer to accuracy, precision, recall, F1-measure, area under curve and (mean) average precision, respectively.  "

Recall,R / RE,sensitivity / true-positive rate,"Evaluation measures ACC,PR, RE,F1,AUC, and(m)AP refer to accuracy, precision, recall, F1-measure, area under curve and (mean) average precision, respectively.  "

F1-measure,F1,harmonic mean of precision and recall,"Evaluation measures ACC,PR, RE,F1,AUC, and(m)AP refer to accuracy, precision, recall, F1-measure, area under curve and (mean) average precision, respectively.  "

Area Under Curve,AUC,area under the ROC curve (global ranking quality),"Evaluation measures ACC,PR, RE,F1,AUC, and(m)AP refer to accuracy, precision, recall, F1-measure, area under curve and (mean) average precision, respectively.  "
Average Precision,AP,area-under-PR-curve for a single task,[Lee and Ellis 2010] … MC-SL kSVM AP (Table 1)

mean Average Precision,mAP,mean of AP over all classes,"Evaluation measures ACC,PR, RE,F1,AUC, and(m)AP refer to accuracy, precision, recall, F1-measure, area under curve and (mean) average precision, respectively.  "
Pepino et al. 2018 - Simulation model for analysis and management of the no-show in outpatient clinic.pdf
Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência textual
Lead-time,Tempo médio de espera
column2: indicador principal ligado ao “no-show” e à percepção de qualidade
column3: serve para definir limites de gestão como Twmax,“the lead-time for outpatient services is one of the most relevant problems …”
column4: “Samorani et al. [7] proved that the ‘lead-time’ and the ‘no-show’ are strictly related”
column5: “Twmax (Max Wait Time in day): maximum lead-time threshold beyond which the no-show phenomenon begins.”

column1: Max Lead-time (Twmax),Limite de espera a partir do qual se assume aumento de no-show
column2: parâmetro de configuração do modelo,“Twmax (Max Wait Time in day): maximum lead-time threshold beyond which the no-show phenomenon begins.”

column1: Lead-time trend,Evolução temporal do lead-time usada para validar o modelo e comparar cenários,"“The lead-time trend is similar in the two models …”
column2: Figuras 4, 5.  "

column1: No-show,Número ou percentagem de pacientes que não comparecem
column2: usado como meta de redução e na conta de lucro,“One of the critical aspects … is the so-called ‘no-show’”
column3: “the no-show ranges from 40 % to 30 %”.

column1: Nnoshow,Número absoluto de no-shows resultante da simulação
column2: utilizado nos cálculos de receita,“Nnoshow : 4595-2759 = 1836.”

column1: Booking drop out (Dpre),Abandono da marcação na ligação inicial
column2: KPI principal,“Dpre (Drop out a booking): patients who phoned and waived bookings due to the high lead-time.”

column1: Visit drop out / No-show (Dpost),Desistência após ter marcado
column2: KPI principal,“Dpost (Drop out a visit): patients who booked and waived visit due to the high lead-time.”

column1: Dextra (Drop out extra-time),Pacientes que desistem na sala de espera por excesso de overbooking,“D extra (Drop out extra time in waiting room): 82”.
Nxtime,Quantidade de consultas realizadas fora do horário previsto devido a overbooking
column2: KPI,“Nxtime: visits extra time due to overbooking or visits out of time …”.

column1: Npre,Número de consultas efetivamente realizadas
column2: KPI e base para cálculo de lucro,“Npre: visits regularly performed.”

column1: Número de medical visits,Capacidade semanal ou total anual de consultas que podem ser ofertadas
column2: usado para dimensionar cenários,“number of medical visits a week: Np = 96”
column3: “maximum number of medical visits payable is equal to 4595.”

column1: Número de calls (Ntel),Demanda semanal de ligações
column2: variável de entrada nos experimentos,“Number of week calls to the switchboard: Ntel = 200.”

column1: Overbooking level (Novb),Quantidade adicional de marcações além dos slots

column1: Eardley et al. 2008 - A model for improving the role of IT in BPR.pdf
Performance_Measure,How_it_is_used_in_the_text,Evidence_snippet_from_the_article

Organisational performance,Primary outcome variable whose improvement is sought through BPR and business-process orientation,“The results show that business process orientation leads to better non-financial performance and indirectly to better financial performance.”
Non-financial performance,Component of organisational performance that is directly improved by business-process orientation,“business process orientation leads to better non-financial performance …”
Financial performance,Component of organisational performance that is indirectly improved via non-financial gains,“…and indirectly to better financial performance.”

Cost,"Listed as a critical, contemporary metric and target for ‘dramatic improvements’ from BPR","“…dramatic improvements in critical, contemporary measures of performance, such as cost, quality, service and speed.”"
Quality,Same group of critical measures expected to improve after BPR,"“…dramatic improvements in critical, contemporary measures of performance, such as cost, quality, service and speed.”"
Service,Key performance criterion
column2: also referenced as ‘service levels’,“dramatic improvements in … service…” and “better service levels”

column1: Speed,Time-related performance metric highlighted in BPR definitions,“…dramatic improvements in … speed.”
Lead times,Operational time measure that BPR aims to shorten,“This is intended to shorten lead times and reduce bureaucracy…”
Bureaucracy,Negative performance aspect that BPR seeks to reduce,“…shorten lead times and reduce bureaucracy…”
Response times,Specific time measure improved through EDI example,“…dramatic improvements in the error rate and response times were required…”
Error rate,Quality/reliability measure improved in HMSO case,“…dramatic improvements in the error rate and response times were required…”
Customer satisfaction,Outcome metric linked to service improvements,“…increased customer satisfaction and reduced costs per unit.”
Cost per unit,Efficiency metric in HMSO example,“…increased customer satisfaction and reduced costs per unit.”
Competitiveness,Strategic outcome expected from lower costs and better service,“…opportunity to improve competitiveness and increase market share.”
Market share,High-level performance result tied to competitiveness,“…opportunity to improve competitiveness and increase market share.”

Profitability,Financial outcome monitored via multiple billing systems example,“…each organisational unit had created its own system in order to understand its individual contribution to the company’s revenues and profitability.”

Activity-based costing,Explicit analytical performance measure recommended before/after BPR,“…appropriate metrics (e.g. activity based costing or cycle time analysis) should be applied before and after a BPR implementation…”
Cycle time,Time-based analytical metric suggested for evaluating BPR results,“…appropriate metrics (e.g. activity based costing or cycle time analysis)….”
Benchmarking,Method to set objective performance levels for comparison,“…preferable for a company to set objective performance levels by benchmarking…”
Key performance factor (KPF),Strategic performance focus used to select processes for BPR,“…similar to key performance factor or key result area analysis…”
Key result area (KRA),Related strategic performance focus guiding process selection,“…similar to key performance factor or key result area analysis…”
Risk management,Named as an organisational performance driver pushing firms toward IT support,"“…globalisation, time to market, risk management, service and cost would tend to push organisations…”"
Time to market,Speed-to-launch metric listed among forces encouraging IT-enabled BPR,"“…globalisation, time to market, risk management, service and cost would tend to push organisations…”"

Reach,Extent of external connectivity used as qualitative performance dimension of BPR type,"“…greater the possible ‘reach’ and ‘range’ of an organisation, the more successful its BPR programmes will be…”"
Range,Scope of process integration
column2: treated as performance dimension in BPR typology,"“…greater the possible ‘reach’ and ‘range’ of an organisation, the more successful its BPR programmes will be…”"

column1: Balanced scorecard,Referenced as a structured set of financial and non-financial measures for assessing organisational performance,“…a more detailed specification of organisational performance based on the balanced scorecard concept that includes non-financial performance measures has been used.”
Yim and Choi 2005 - Strategic decision making support model on RTE approach from the BPM.pdf
Metric,Usage in the text,Textual evidence
Competitive edge,Main high–level result that RTE is expected to maximise,"RTE is “a management system that maximizes competitive edge by continuously removing delay factors…""
Corporate competitiveness,Overall performance result that the proposed model aims to strengthen,…continuously strengthen corporate competitiveness in an era of unbridled competition…""  "
Organizational effectiveness,End–result expected from good use of organizational memory and learning,…OM is a mean to bring about organizational effectiveness however the impact level is high or low.

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Formal performance indicators that must be linked to operational measures and monitored,…relationship with KPI (Key Performance Indicator) related to operational measures is defined.

Operational measures,Concrete indicators watched in real time and linked to business processes,…all the events were identified at actual operation level and such events and information were reflect to decision making.
Business-performance-measurement metrics,Generic term for numerical measures tied to decision variables,…define the relationship between those factors and management performance measurement metrics.

Value driver tree,Structured set of metrics used to connect financial and operational KPIs,…value driver tree is defined from the KPI perspective and drivers that have an impact on corporate values are analysed…

Financial drivers,Upper-level metrics in the value-driver tree that influence corporate value,…drivers that have an impact on corporate values are analysed starting from financial drivers to operational drivers…
Operational drivers,Lower-level metrics in the value-driver tree that are monitored and controlled,…analysed starting from financial drivers to operational drivers…
KPI pool,Repository/list of KPIs maintained to manage cause-and-effect links,…KPIs is under management by identifying KPI pool.
ROI (Return on Investment),Outcome metric suggested for future research to evaluate benefits,…future research is needed on analysis on ROI of “operational measures” in RTE…
Corporate values,High-level financial metric connected to drivers and KPIs,…drivers that have an impact on corporate values are analysed…
Inventory,Specific operational metric that can be reduced through real-time information,…plays a role in decreasing incidental corporate capacity and inventory.
Corporate capacity (incidental),Resource-usage metric whose reduction is a desired outcome,…plays a role in decreasing incidental corporate capacity and inventory.

column2: utilizado para construir o teto diagonal de FLOPs do nó,“…we characterize the data volume and floating-point operations at node-level…”

column1: FLOPs por nó GPU,Valor concreto para calcular teto (“GPU FLOPS = perform 69 PFLOPS @ 38.8 TFLOPS”),Legenda da Fig. 7a: “GPU FLOPS = perform 69 PFLOPS @ 38.8 TFLOPS”
Eficiência de nó,Distância do ponto empírico ao teto de FLOPs/bytes
column2: usada para indicar oportunidade de otimização,“One can improve the node efficiency of Task E to improve workflow makespan.”

column1: Bytes do nó (CPU/GPU Bytes),Movimentação de dados local
column2: usado nos tetos diagonais de bytes do nó,“Node FLOPs ceiling … and Number of tasks / Bytesnode / Peak node GB/s as shown in Equation 1”

column1: Bytes via PCIe,Movimentação host⇄GPU
column2: determina teto diagonal “PCIe Bytes”,“each GPU is connected to the CPU via PCIe 4.0 at 25 GB/s… the theoretical node PCIe bandwidth is 4×25 = 100 GB/s”

column1: Bytes via HBM,Movimentação em memória de alta largura
column2: empregado no caso CosmoFlow para teto HBM,“each sample requires 6.4 GB HBM data movement … the diagonal HBM makespan ceiling … = 4.2 s.”

column1: Bytes da rede do sistema,Volume MPI ou tráfego externo
column2: define teto horizontal de rede,“we leverage the NIC performance to set the ceilings … 100 GB/s/direction in total.”

column1: Bytes do sistema de arquivos,Volume lido/escrito no FS
column2: forma teto horizontal de I/O,"“Therefore, one can get 5.6 TB/s … for the system internal (loading data from file system) bandwidth ceiling.”"

column1: Largura de banda de nó (Peak node GB/s),Constante usada para normalizar Bytes do nó nos tetos,“Peak node-performance constraints (… Peak node GB/s)”
Peak node TFLOPS,Constante para normalizar FLOPs nos tetos de computação,“node peak TFLOPS is the aggregated peak performance of the four GPUs”
Largura de banda do sistema (Peak sys GB/s),Usada em Eq.(1) para limitar TPS por I/O global,“System ceilings (horizontal): … each compute group via 100 GB/s … 5.6 TB/s”
Largura de banda externa do sistema,Limita workflows dependentes de armazenamento externo (ex.: LCLS),“…one can never meet the target due to the limited external data transfer speed.”
Parede de paralelismo do sistema,Máx. de tarefas paralelas = nodos disponíveis / nodos por tarefa
column2: exibida como linha vertical,"“we introduce a vertical task parallelism wall, which is defined as the available number of nodes divided by the required number of nodes per task.”"

column1: Volume de comunicação,Usado no BGW para posicionar teto de rede,"“The communication volume is constant… Thus, the system network ceiling … can then be derived from the ratio of the communication volume…”"
Taxa de transferência (GB/s),"Valores concretos (1 GB/s, 0.2 GB/s, 25 GB/s) usados para avaliar cenário bom/ruim",“Good Days means … average rate of 1 GB/s … Bad Days … decreases to 0.2 GB/s.”
Target makespan,Objetivo de latência a ser alcançado
column2: traça linha pontilhada no gráfico,“The target makespan of LCLS was ten minutes in the year 2020.”

column1: Target throughput,Objetivo de produtividade
column2: usado para classificar quadrantes do gráfico,"“Thus, according to the target makespan and throughput, the attainable performance area is divided into four zones…”"

column1: HBM makespan,Tempo mínimo limitado por banda HBM
column2: calculado para CosmoFlow,“…HBM makespan ceiling can be calculated … = 4.2 s.”

column1: PCIe makespan,Tempo mínimo limitado por banda PCIe
column2: calculado para CosmoFlow,“the PCIe makespan ceiling of 0.8 s (80 GB / 100 GB/s)”

column1: Tempo de aplicação / Time cost,Valor medido de fim-a-fim para cada workflow
column2: pontos empíricos nos gráficos,“The ‘Good Days’ … workﬂow can ﬁnish in 17 minutes … the ‘Bad Days’ … needs 85 minutes”

column1: Overhead de Bash/Python,Tempo não-computacional
column2: identificado como limitador no GPTune,“Spawn … achieves a higher throughput than RCI because it reduces the bash and I/O time … projected performance … by reducing the Python overhead.”

column1: Epochs por segundo,Forma de throughput no benchmark CosmoFlow
column2: relaciona instâncias ao rendimento,“…and report the performance as the number of epochs per second.”

column1: Dubinsky et al. 2023 - Detecting cross-case associations in an event log - toward a pattern-based detection.pdf
metric,usage_in_text,evidence_in_text

Precision,Avaliar a exatidão da detecção (taxa de verdadeiros positivos sobre predições). É calculada nos experimentos de logs simulados e apresentados nas Tabelas 5 e 6.,"“First, as these are controlled experiments with a known (simulated) ground truth, we wanted to test the performance of the approach in terms of precision, recall, and F1.” (Seção 5.1.1) / Tabela 5 e 6 mostram valores de Precision."
Recall,Avaliar a cobertura da detecção (taxa de verdadeiros positivos sobre totais reais). Usada nos mesmos experimentos e tabelas.,Mesmo trecho anterior
column2: Tabelas 5 e 6 trazem os valores de Recall.

column1: F1,Medida harmônica que combina Precision e Recall para achar configuração ótima (ex. valor máximo em X = 0.5).,“we hence expect the F1 measure to indicate an optimal value of this parameter.” (Seção 5.1.1) / Valores em Tabelas 5 e 6.
Execution time,Mede o tempo de execução dos algoritmos para avaliar escalabilidade
column2: reportado em minutos nas Tabelas 5 e 6 e comentado no texto.,“scalability to large logs might be an issue and result in long execution times… we measured the execution times…” (Seção 5.1.1) / Coluna “Avg execution time” das Tabelas 5 e 6.

column1: Mean Time Between Cases (MTBC),Usado como referência para definir parâmetros timeframe_size e iteration_size dos algoritmos (proporcional ao MTBC) e discutir capacidade de captura dos casos divididos.,“timeframe size = F*MTBC” e “The MTBC in the simulated logs is approximately 50 min.” (Seção 5.1.1).
Mean case duration,Comparar caminhos ‘rápidos’ e ‘lentos’ e justificar motivação para split-case
column2: diferença nas durações médias dos casos abaixo/acima do limiar.,“mean case duration of 71.7 days… mean case duration of 100.1 days.” (Seção 5.1.2).

column1: Median duration,Usado no detector de time-drift: calcula-se mediana da duração de atividades em sub-logs e picos indicam drift.,“time drift focuses on the median time duration of activities.” (Seção 4.1) / Gráficos de Fig. 4 e 12 mostram median duration plots.

p-value,Valor de significância estatística para confirmar ou não um concept-drift no plugin de detecção.,“The p-value for the statistical tests performed by the concept drift detection function was 0.1.” (Seção 5.2.1).
Standard deviation (2 σ),Critério para marcar desvios excepcionais entre sub-logs na busca de time-drift
column2: diferença > 2 desvios-padrão indica drift.,"“exceptional deviations (over two standard deviations [4]) between following sublogs are considered as indicating a time drift.” (Listagem 3, Seção 4.2)."

column1: Sub-log size,Tamanho da partição usada para calcular median duration
column2: definido como |log|/50 nos experimentos.,“The sub-log size for the time drift function was the log size divided by 50.” (Seção 5.2.1).

column1: Li and Zhu 2008 - Generalized Stochastic Workflow net-based quantitative analysis of business process performance.pdf
Performance measure,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal (trecho do artigo)
Time performance (desempenho temporal),Categoria geral de medidas temporais avaliadas no artigo
column2: objetivo central da análise quantitativa.,“the quantitative analysis of the time performance measure is pivotal to guarantee the validity of process model” (Resumo)

column1: Mean flow time T (tb. mean throughput / throughout / average flow time),Principal indicador calculado
column2: tempo médio que um caso do processo permanece no sistema.,"“One of the important time performance measures of business process model is its mean flow time T, that is, the mean throughout time of all workflow instances.” (Seção III)"

column1: Average token number N,Variável necessária para aplicar a lei de Little no cálculo de T.,“T can be calculated according to the Little rule … N is the average token number of the Petri net system in its stabile state.” (Seção III)
Mean arrival rate λ (/g81),Número médio de tokens que entram no sistema por unidade de tempo
column2: usado em T = N/λ.,“… λ is the mean number of tokens entering into the net system in every unit time.” (Seção III)

column1: Mean sojourning time mi,Tempo médio que o processo de marcação permanece em cada marca tangível Mi
column2: entra na fórmula de π_i e depois em T.,“the mean residence time of Mi is denoted as mi” (Seção II)

column1: Residence time of markings,Distinção conceitual entre marcações tangíveis (tempo ≠ 0) e vanishing (tempo = 0)
column2: base para calcular mi.,"“There are two types of marking. One is the tangible marking, which indicates that in this state the net system will stay for a non-zero period of time…” (Seção II)"

column1: Stability probability π_i,Probabilidade de o sistema estar em cada marca tangível no regime estacionário
column2: utilizada na expressão final de T.,“Supposing that there are s tangible markings … the stability probability of Mi in the marking process is π_i such that …” (Seção II)

column1: Ratio y_i (frequência de visita à marca Mi),Frequência com que a EMC visita cada marcação
column2: primeiro passo para obter π_i.,"“yi is the ratio that the marking process passes the marking Mi, which can be calculated out by the limiting probability calculation formula of the discrete time stochastic process:” (Seção II, Eq. 2)"

column1: Mean firing speed λ_t (/g540),Velocidade média de disparo das transições exponenciais
column2: parâmetro básico da GSWN e insumo para calcular tempos de sojourn.,"“The mean firing speeds of all exponential transitions form a set: λ = {λE1,…,λEn}.” (Definição 2, Seção II)"

column1: One-pass probability / Random switch probability p,"Probabilidade de escolha de ramos em transições em conflito
column2: influencia o tempo médio do fluxo, logo é um medidor derivado de performance de confiabilidade/eficiência.","“S is a set of random switches, which is composed of all enabled and conflicting transitions endued with some probability distribution.” (Definição 2, Seção II)"

column1: Kandil and El-Deeb 2016 - Exploration of application migration to cloud environment.pdf
Performance Measure,Description / How it is used in the text,Evidence excerpt from the paper
Total Throughput (bytes),Amount of data received from the server during a load test
column2: used to compare data transfer for each scenario/on-premise vs. clouds,“Total Throughput (bytes): Displays the amount of data received from the server.”

column1: Total Hits,Number of HTTP requests sent to the server during the load test
column2: used to show workload volume for every scenario,“Total Hits: Displays the number of requests sent to the server during the load test.”

column1: Average Transaction Response Time,Mean time needed to complete a transaction (seconds) during each second of the load test
column2: primary latency indicator,“Average Transaction Response Time: Displays the average time to perform transactions during each second of the load test.”

column1: Average Throughput (bytes/second),Rate of data received from the server per second
column2: throughput efficiency indicator,“Average Throughput (bytes / second): Displays the amount of data received from the server at any given second.”

column1: Average Hits per second,Number of server requests generated each second
column2: request-rate indicator,“Average Hits per second: Displays the number of requests per second sent to the server during the load test.”

column1: CPU used by this session,CPU time consumed by a database session (in 10-millisecond units)
column2: measures processing cost for a query/transaction,“CPU used by this session: is the amount of CPU time (in 10s of milliseconds) used by a session between when a user call started and ended.”

column1: DB time,Elapsed time (in microseconds) spent executing database user-level calls
column2: end-to-end database latency metric,“DB time:  is the amount of elapsed time (in microseconds) spent performing Database user-level calls.”

column1: Bytes received via SQL*Net from client,Total bytes the database server receives from the client over SQL*Net
column2: measures inbound network traffic,“Bytes received via SQL*Net from client: is the total number of bytes received from the client over SQL*Net.”

column1: Bytes sent via SQL*Net to client,Total bytes the database server sends to the client over SQL*Net
column2: measures outbound network traffic,“Bytes sent via SQL*Net to client: is the total number of bytes sent to the client from the foreground processes.”

column1: Average Response Time (derived),Same metric reported in result tables (‘AVG RESPONSE TIME’) as the latency per scenario
column2: derived form of Average Transaction Response Time,Tables 1-3 header column “AVG RESPONSE TIME” and discussion: “Figure 5 shows that Sc#1 on public cloud has least Average response time 0.45 seconds …”

column1: Average Throughput (derived),Reported in tables as ‘AVG THROUGHPUT’
column2: numeric instance of Average Throughput (bytes/second),Tables 1-3 header column “AVG THROUGHPUT”

column1: Average Hits per Second (derived),Reported in tables as ‘AVG HITS PER SECOND’
column2: numeric instance of Average Hits per second,Tables 1-3 header column “AVG HITS PER SECOND”

column1: Venero et al. 2019 - Towards a metamodel for supporting decisions in knowledge-intensive processes.pdf
Medidor,Como_é_usado_no_texto,Evidência_no_texto
Métrica (Metric),"Elemento genérico de medição para acompanhar e avaliar o status de um objetivo dentro do metamodelo
column2: serve para detectar desvios, evolução inesperada e progresso.","“A metric is a quantifiable measure used to track and assess the status of an objective… The metrics help the detection of deviations and unexpected process evolution, and give a view of the achieved progress in reaching an objective.”  "

column1: Indicador-chave de Desempenho (KPI),Exemplo de métrica
column2: é citado como medida-tipo para avaliar o alcance dos objetivos.,“…such as key performance indicators (KPI) or key risk indicators (KRI).”

column1: Indicador-chave de Risco (KRI),Outro exemplo de métrica
column2: indicado como possível medida para monitorar riscos sobre objetivos.,“…such as key performance indicators (KPI) or key risk indicators (KRI).”

column1: Período de Avaliação (Evaluation period),Parâmetro temporal associado a cada métrica para indicar quando ela deve ser medida e analisada.,"“Metrics are measured during or after execution, an evaluation period has to be defined.”  "

Marco / Milestone,"Usado como ponto de controle para verificar se um objetivo (e, em consequência, a estratégia) foi atingido.",“The achievement of an objective is a necessary milestone to make progress toward its respective goal.”

Status do Caso,"Conjunto de valores críticos (por exemplo, de atributos) que funcionam como referência para avaliar o andamento do processo.",“The status of a case can be seen as a set of critical values related to attributes of the artifacts…”
Faixa de Temperatura Corporal Normal (36.5 °C – 37.5 °C),Regra/métrica clínica usada para identificar desvio (febre) no paciente e disparar ações.,“Normal body temperature rate → 36.5 ◦C – 37.5 ◦C.”
Temperatura Corporal do Paciente,Valor concreto medido continuamente e comparado com a faixa normal
column2: serve para avaliar evolução do tratamento.,“…event is created…with the issue IS001: High value for body temperature… monitor patient’s temperature.”

column1: Sinais Vitais (Vital Signs),Conjunto de medições (incluindo temperatura) que compõe o status do paciente e serve de critério para decisões.,“The system signalizes that the data value for the attribute ‘temperature’ inside the item ‘Vitals Signs’…”

Ingestão e Excreção de Fluidos,Quantidade de líquido ingerido/expelido a ser monitorada em 24 h como indicador de evolução clínica.,“…she wants to monitor fluid intake and output during the next 24 hours.”
Panfilov et al. 2021 - Digital Ecosystem-Based KPI-Driven Railway Communication Network Reporting System.pdf
Not valid csv text, check the article
Velásquez et al. 2024 - A Systematic Literature Review of the Analysis of Costs and Other Dimensions in Process Mining and Related Disciplines.pdf
Performance Indicator,How it is used (according to the article),Evidence in the text
Cost,"Core performance dimension analysed alone or jointly with other dimensions to discover, monitor and improve processes","“Three main dimensions can be identified: time, cost, and quality.”"

Time,"Core performance dimension, frequently combined with Cost for trade-off studies and prediction","“insights … could emerge when analysing it jointly with other dimensions, such as time and resources”"
Quality,"Core performance dimension, often combined with Cost inside the Devil’s Quadrangle","“DQ depicts the process performance according to four dimensions: time, cost, quality and flexibility”"

Resources / Resource utilisation,Considered together with Cost to study allocation decisions and TD-ABC calculations,“resources could be allocated while considering the costs associated to these allocations”
Flexibility,"Fourth dimension of the Devil’s Quadrangle, analysed together with Cost","“DQ depicts the process performance according to four dimensions: time, cost, quality and flexibility”"

Efficiency,Occasionally analysed together with Cost and Time for parallel-dimension visualisation,"“One of the uncommon dimensions is efficiency, which was utilised jointly with cost and time dimensions”"

Productivity,Occasionally analysed together with Cost and Quality in multidimensional improvement studies,"“The second uncommon dimension included … is productivity, which was used in conjunction with the cost and quality dimensions”"
Sum of costs per activity,Metric derived from cost-annotated event logs to visualise/assess activity performance,"“showing metrics, such as the sum … costs, per activity”"
Average cost per activity,Derived metric for activity-level performance comparison,"“showing metrics, such as the … average … costs, per activity”"
Minimum cost per activity,Derived metric for identifying cheapest activity execution,"“showing metrics, such as the … min … costs, per activity”"
Maximum cost per activity,Derived metric for identifying most expensive activity execution,"“showing metrics, such as the … max costs, per activity”"
Aggregated costs,Process-level metric obtained from cost models for visualisation and reporting,“visualisation of either aggregated … costs in a process model”
Remaining costs,Process-level metric indicating costs still to be incurred in running cases,“visualisation of either … remaining costs in a process model”
Activity cost,Basic metric in ABC / TD-ABC
column2: individual cost assigned to each activity,“activity costs can be described either as a fixed amount or one that depends on variables such as the type of resource or the activity duration”

column1: Hourly cost rate,Rate-based metric for allocating costs in project-based industries,reference [30]: “Calculating hourly cost rates in project-based industries”

Capacity cost rate,Rate used in TD-ABC to convert resource time into money for each activity,“TD-ABC … calculates costs by estimating the cost of every resource and their utilisation time during each activity of a process”

Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE),Composite KPI (availability × performance × quality) extended with cost awareness for manufacturing,reference [55]: “New approach towards formulation of the overall equipment effectiveness”
Cost-benefit indicator,Ratio/analysis used to find optimal benefit or justify improvement projects,“a cost-benefit analysis strategy that uses performance indicators to find the optimal benefit”
Love and Holt 2000 - Construction business performance measurement - The SPM alternative.pdf
Medidor,Como_e_usado_no_texto,Evidencia_no_texto
Eficiência,Exemplo de medida financeira tradicional utilizada em BPM na construção.,"“…performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”  "
Retorno sobre o Capital Empregado,"Idem, citado como indicador ‘bottom-line’.","“…performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”  "
Rentabilidade / Profitability,Outra medida financeira tradicional focada no lucro.,"“…performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”  "
Lucro (profit),Indicador ‘bottom-line’ associado a curto-prazismo.,"“Fortoo long, construction organizations have focused on short-termism. That is, the ‘bottom line’.”  "
Liquidez,Exemplo de indicador financeiro focado apenas no resultado monetário.,"“…tends to focus on monetary aspects (e.g. productivity, output, efficiency, profit, liquidity, asset structure).”  "

Estrutura de Ativos,Outro indicador contábil listado entre as métricas ‘bottom-line’.,"“…tends to focus on monetary aspects (e.g. productivity, output, efficiency, profit, liquidity, asset structure).”  "

Produtividade,Aparece como driver de desempenho e como métrica de comparação com concorrentes.,"“…lack strategic focus and fail to provide data on quality, responsiveness and flexibility…” / “embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation, and social contribution.”  "
Qualidade,Apontada como dimensão crítica ignorada pelas métricas tradicionais.,"“…fail to provide data on quality, responsiveness and flexibility.”  "
Capacidade de Resposta / Responsiveness,Dimensão de desempenho que deveria ser medida mas é negligenciada.,"“…fail to provide data on quality, responsiveness and flexibility.”  "
Flexibilidade,Outra dimensão ‘suave’ recomendada para medição.,"“…fail to provide data on quality, responsiveness and flexibility.”  "
Satisfação do Cliente,Indicador específico sugerido na literatura para complementar finanças.,"“For example, customer satisfaction (Berry et al., 1994)…”  "
Satisfação do Empregado,Indicador ‘people factor’ que impacta o desempenho organizacional.,"“…employee satisfaction (House and Price, 1991)…”  "
Sucesso do Negócio,Resultado composto que pode ser medido estrategicamente.,"“…and business success (Chakravarthy, 1988).”  "

Desenvolvimento de Empregados,Parte dos aspetos ‘soft’ a serem incluídos no SPM.,"“…concentration upon softer issues (e.g. client satisfaction, technology take-up, environmental impact, employee development).”  "
Impacto Ambiental,Indicador ‘stakeholder’ recomendado no SPM.,"“…concentration upon softer issues (e.g. client satisfaction, technology take-up, environmental impact, employee development).”  "

Adoção de Tecnologia (technology take-up),Indicador sugerido para captar a capacidade de inovação do negócio.,"“…concentration upon softer issues (e.g. client satisfaction, technology take-up, environmental impact, employee development).”  "
Capacidade Competitiva,Parte das métricas determinantes de sucesso competitivo.,"“…reflected in measures of competitive ability, productivity and quality.”  "
Inovação,Determinante de sucesso competitivo a ser medido.,"“…embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation, and social contribution.”  "
Contribuição Social,Indicador relativo à responsabilidade social do negócio.,"“…embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation, and social contribution.”  "
Custo Real Unitário,Métrica de resultado financeiro operacional.,"“…financial performance, and real unit cost.”  "
Captura de Mercado Alvo,Indicador de eficácia estratégica.,"“…extent of targeted market capture, financial performance, and real unit cost.”  "

Performance Financeira (Financial performance),Categoria de resultados a monitorar juntamente com métricas não-financeiras.,"“…extent of targeted market capture, financial performance, and real unit cost.”  "
Benchmarking,Método de extração de medidas comparativas entre empresas.,“…extract comparative measures through benchmarking

Progress Monitoring,Exemplo prático de medição utilizado rotineiramente em obras.,"“Construction organizations use a variety of methods to measure their performance. For example, progress monitoring is commonplace.”  "

Tabelas de Classificação (League tables),Ferramenta setorial de comparação de indicadores estratégicos.,"“…may refer to league tables … to contrast such characteristics as turnover, number of employees, pre- and post-tax profits, and overall ranking in the industry.”  "

Volume de Negócios / Turnover,Indicador presente nas league tables para comparação entre empresas.,"“…to contrast such characteristics as turnover, number of employees, pre- and post-tax profits, and overall ranking…”  "
Número de Empregados,Outro item das league tables usado como métrica comparativa.,"“…turnover, number of employees, pre- and post-tax profits…”  "
Lucros Pré e Pós-Imposto,Indicador financeiro comparado nas league tables.,"“…turnover, number of employees, pre- and post-tax profits…”  "
Classificação Geral (Overall ranking),Resultado composto que resume o desempenho competitivo.,"“…turnover, number of employees, pre- and post-tax profits, and overall ranking in the industry.”  "
Métricas de Retrabalho (Rework benchmark metrics),Exemplo de indicador de eficiência de processos proposto em pesquisa.,“…the propagation of rework benchmark metrics for construction.”

Matriz de Medição de Performance (Performance Measurement Matrix),Framework alternativo que integra métricas financeiras e drivers de negócio.,"“…the performance measurement matrix (Keegan et al., 1989)
Pirâmide de Performance (Performance Pyramid),Outro framework de BPM ampliado citado como referência.,"“…the performance pyramid (Lynch and Cross, 1991)
Balanced Scorecard,Sistema integrado de medição que equilibra finanças e stakeholders.,"“…the balanced scorecard (Kaplan and Norton, 1996)
Prêmio Malcolm Baldrige,Modelo de avaliação que enfatiza satisfação do cliente e resultados de negócio.,"“…and the ‘Baldrige’ Award (Anon, 1999).”"

Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence excerpt

Key Business Metrics / Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Named as the general class of measures on which BAM solutions focus to evaluate the performance of business processes.,"“...business activity monitoring (BAM) technology enables continuous, near real-time event-based monitoring of business processes based on key business metrics, also known as key performance indicators (KPI) [11].”  "

Order Fulfilment Lead Time,Presented as a concrete business-level metric that can be calculated across several partners by correlating events from two different process activities.,"“Consider, for example, the metric order fulfilment lead time which could be measured in our scenario from the start of the activity Receive PO in the reseller process until the While Loop completes in the customer process.”  "

Order Processing Duration,Another example metric created by subtracting timestamps of two events belonging to different partners.,“...calculation of the order processing duration between the activity Receive PO and Receive Shipment Acknowledgment in our scenario.”
CustomerAOrderFulfillmentTime (derived metric),Implemented as a complex event whose payload contains the calculated ‘metricValue’
column2: serves as the concrete runtime artefact that carries the order-fulfilment metric for a specific customer instance.,Listing 3 – eventAggregation statement creating ‘CustomerAOrderFulfillmentTime’ with ‘abs(b.timestamp – a.timestamp) AS metricValue’.

column1: Service Level Parameters (SLPs),Suggested as measurable quantities that can be derived from complex events and used inside SLAs.,“One could for example specify service level parameters and service level objectives based on complex events which contain corresponding metric values.”

Availability (QoS),Cited as a typical technical performance measure negotiated in cross-organizational Service Level Agreements.,"“...service QoS, typically technical characteristics such as availability and response time [6].”  "

Response Time (QoS),Listed together with availability as a standard performance indicator in SLAs.,"“...service QoS, typically technical characteristics such as availability and response time [6].”  "
metricValue (generic derived value),Attribute that stores the numeric result of a complex-event calculation
column2: represents a generic performance measure transport mechanism.,Listing 3 – ‘SELECT abs(b.timestamp - a.timestamp) AS metricValue ...’

Performance Measure,How it is used in the paper,Evidence in the text (exact or abridged quotation)
Cost (performance dimension),One of the four core dimensions of the Devil’s Quadrangle against which each process’ actual vs. target performance is assessed
column2: serves as input to calculate the PNI and NPNI.,"“A popular framework is the Devil’s Quadrangle that comprises flexibility, time, cost, and quality…”"

column1: Time (performance dimension),Another core Devil’s Quadrangle dimension
column2: actual vs. target lead-time values feed the PNI and NPNI calculations.,ibid.

column1: Quality (performance dimension),Devil’s Quadrangle dimension
column2: actual vs. target error-rate values feed the PNI and NPNI calculations.,ibid.

column1: Flexibility (performance dimension),Mentioned as part of the Devil’s Quadrangle
column2: not explicitly modelled because its effects can be covered by other dimensions such as time.,"“…the Devil’s Quadrangle that comprises flexibility, time, cost, and quality… Flexibility can be covered via other dimensions such as time.”"

column1: Process costs per execution,Chosen single indicator for the cost dimension when computing the PNI.,"“In the cost dimension, we choose the process costs per execution…”"
Lead-time,Chosen single indicator for the time dimension when computing the PNI.,"“As for time, we choose the lead-time, covering the total time for the completion of a process instance end-to-end.”"
Error rate,Chosen single indicator for the quality dimension when computing the PNI.,"“As for quality, we use the error rate because it has the same polarity as process costs and lead-time.”"

Net Present Value (NPV),Cited as an example of an integrated performance indicator used in earlier prioritisation approaches.,"“…merged into integrated performance indicators (e.g., net present value or stakeholder service gap perception).”"
Stakeholder service-gap perception,Example of an integrated performance indicator used in prior work.,ibid.
Value contribution of a process,Example integrated indicator
column2: used in related work to quantify overall process performance.,“Examples for integrated performance indicators are the value contribution of a process…”

column1: Return on Process Transformation,Example integrated indicator from prior studies for valuating process change.,ibid.
Aggregated cash-flow deviation from a threshold,Example integrated indicator mentioned in literature review.,ibid.
Business value score,Example integrated indicator employed by other prioritisation methods.,ibid.
Individual need for improvement index (original term in literature),Named as precursor
column2: refers to an integrated indicator that quantifies how urgently a single process should be improved.,ibid.

column1: Process Need for Improvement Index (PNI),Key indicator designed in this paper
column2: quantifies the stand-alone need for improvement of each process and serves as the node weight in the PPR.,"“Thus, each process i features a PNIᵢ, which takes values from [0
column3: 1]… the PPR adjusts it by network effects.”"

column1: Network-adjusted Process Need for Improvement Index (NPNI),Outcome of the ProcessPageRank algorithm
column2: used for the final ranking of processes.,“…the PPR ranks the processes… according to their network-adjusted need for improvement index (NPNI).”

column1: Amount of Executions (AE),"Although not a performance dimension itself, it scales the performance gap when computing PNI and therefore functions as a performance-relevant measure.",“…we multiply the difference between the actual and target states with the amount of executions AEᵢ.”

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),"Indicadores mensuráveis necessários para identificar, monitorar e ajustar BPs
column2: ausência de KPIs impede a agregação de atividades em um único processo.","“First, these are measurable targets (KPI). The lack of generated key performance indicators indicates that these activities are not interrelated and cannot be combined into one BP.”  "

column1: Lucro (Profit),Parte do conjunto de critérios que caracterizam o resultado final do BP
column2: base para medir criação de valor e impacto de riscos.,"“…a system of criteria must be formed to characterize the final result of the BP (profit, revenue, EBITDA …).”  "

Metric,Uso_no_texto,Evidencia_no_texto
AUC,Principal métrica de desempenho
column2: avalia a capacidade do modelo de distinguir entre pacientes com e sem sepse.,"""The major performance indicator is the AUC score, which assesses a model’s ability to distinguish between sepsis and non-sepsis patients."""

column1: Accuracy,Avalia a capacidade geral do modelo de classificar corretamente todos os pacientes.,"""The ability of a model to correctly identify patients is measured by its accuracy."""
Sensitivity,Avalia a capacidade do modelo identificar corretamente pacientes COM sepse.,"""Sensitivity assesses a model’s ability to accurately identify patients with sepsis."""
Specificity,Avalia a capacidade do modelo identificar corretamente pacientes SEM sepse.,"""whereas specificity assesses a model’s ability to correctly identify patients who do not have sepsis."""
Likelihood Ratio Positive (LHR+),Relação que indica quanto um resultado de teste positivo aumenta a probabilidade de doença
column2: usada para avaliar o poder diagnóstico.,"""The likelihood ratio is the ratio of the likelihood of a specific test result in people with the disease to the likelihood in people without the disease [40].""  e  ""LHR+ = sensitivity / (1−specificity)"""

column1: Likelihood Ratio Negative (LHR-),Relação que indica quanto um resultado de teste negativo diminui a probabilidade de doença
column2: usada para avaliar o poder diagnóstico.,"""LHR− = (1−sensitivity)/specificity"""

column1: Positive Predictive Value (PPV),Métrica mencionada como alternativa tradicional para expressar probabilidade de diagnóstico
column2: não utilizada no estudo devido à dependência da prevalência.,"""numerous studies on sepsis prediction employed alternate metrics such as positive predictive value and negative predictive value to present the probability of diagnosis."""

column1: Negative Predictive Value (NPV),Métrica mencionada como alternativa tradicional para expressar probabilidade de diagnóstico
column2: não utilizada no estudo devido à dependência da prevalência.,"""...the prevalence of sepsis in the population substantially influences both positive predictive value and negative predictive value [41]."""

column1: Standard Deviation (SD),"Medida derivada usada para quantificar a variabilidade dos valores de AUC em múltiplas execuções, indicando robustez do modelo.","""which includes four statistical indicators with the best value, worst value, aver-age value, and standard deviation in AUC, being denoted as “Best”, “Worst”, “Mean”, and “SD”, respectively."""

column1: CQDD_S_XCD,"Versão de CQ calculada Por Remessa, medida no Due Date e usando a data-referência XCD (First/Last/Best Commit).","""…cálculo do CQ… utilizando a abordagem shipment medida at Due Date com uma referência (XCD) conforme a equação (4)."""

CQDDD_S_XCD,"Versão de CQ calculada Por Remessa, medida no momento da entrega (Delivery) e usando XCD.","""…per shipment at Delivery dentro de uma data-referência (XCD)… A fórmula é dada na equação (5)."""
CQDD_V_XCD,"Versão de CQ calculada Por Volume entregue, medida no Due Date dentro de um período e usando XCD.","""…considera todo o pedido… O cálculo é realizado usando a equação (6)."""

column1: On-time delivery,KPI de nível de serviço ao cliente

Percentage of on-time deliveries,Indicador simples de DR baseado na fração de entregas pontuais.,"""…White (1996)… ou a percentage of on-time deliveries."""

Alpha service level,Probabilidade de suprir todos os pedidos a partir do estoque disponível em determinado prazo.,"""Alpha mede a probabilidade de atender todos os pedidos de clientes a partir do estoque disponível dentro de um período…"""

Supplier DR after order confirmation,Categoria que avalia confiabilidade após a confirmação do pedido.,"""…Supplier DR after order confirmation…"""

Supplier DR at delivery vs. wished delivery date,Categoria que compara a data real de entrega com a data desejada pelo cliente.,"""…Supplier DR at delivery vs. wished delivery date."""

Commit Quality Matrix (CQM),Framework proposto que reúne todas as dimensões de medição de CQ e permite escolher o indicador adequado.,"""…apresenta-se a CQ matrix… que consolida todos os aspectos discutidos em vários níveis e fornece um resumo abrangente."""
