Measure,How the paper uses or defines the measure (purpose / semantics),Evidence extracted from the text
tb_arrFC,First case arrival time of a batch – marks the moment the earliest case of the batch reached the queue.,“Each batch has a first case arrival time tb
column2: arrFC … derived from to
column3: start of the first observation …” (Sect. 4)

column1: tb_arrLC,Last case arrival time of a batch – moment the last case of the batch reached the queue.,"“… and a last case arrival time tb
column2: arrLC, derived from to
column3: start from the last observation in b.” (Sect. 4)"

column1: tb_depFC,First case departure time of a batch – moment the first case in the batch leaves the activity.,“… each batch also has a first case departure time tb
column2: depFC … derived from to
column3: end of the first observation …” (Sect. 4)

column1: tb_depLC,Last case departure time of a batch – moment the last case in the batch leaves the activity.,"“… and a last case departure time tb
column2: depLC, derived from to
column3: end of the last observation in b.” (Sect. 4)"

column1: Wo,Case waiting time – time a case waits in front of the next processing step.,“We define Wo as the case waiting time or the time a case is pending before the next processing step.” (Sect. 4)
Wi_min,Minimum waiting time inside one specific batch – lower bound of the batching window.,"“On batch-level, we will also define Wi
column2: min and Wi
column3: max, expressing the minimum and maximum Wo of observations within batch i, respectively.” (Sect. 4)"

column1: Wi_max,Maximum waiting time inside one specific batch – upper bound of the batching window.,Same sentence as above (Sect. 4).
Wo2b,Waiting time of cases that are batched (segment perspective).,“… we additionally define Wo2b as the waiting time of a batched case …” (Sect. 4)
Wo<b,Waiting time of cases that are NOT batched (segment perspective).,“… and Wo<b as the waiting time of a non-batched case.” (Sect. 4)

IBIA,Intra-Batch Inter-Arrival Time – time between arrivals of successive cases inside the same batch.,"“We define IBIA as the intra-batch case interarrival time, expressing the amount of time that lapses between the arrival of two successive cases within a batch.” (Sect. 4)"

IA,(Global) Case Inter-Arrival Time – time between any two consecutive cases in the segment.,"“Where IBIA measures arrival in a batch, the case interarrival time IA measures the time between two cases considering all segment observations.” (Sect. 4)"
IA2b,Inter-arrival time considering only batched cases (segment perspective).,“… we additionally define IA2b … expressing the interarrival time of batched cases …” (Sect. 4)
IA<b,Inter-arrival time considering only non-batched cases (segment perspective).,"“… and IA<b, expressing the interarrival time of … non-batched cases …” (Sect. 4)"

BI,Batch Interval – time lapse between two consecutive batches (segment perspective).,“We define the batch interval BI as the time lapse between two successive moments or periods of batching … BIi = tbi+1
column2: depFC – tbi
column3: depLC.” (Sect. 4)

column1: k,Batch size – number of observations (cases) grouped together in one batch.,“The batch size k expresses the amount of observations in batch b.” (Sect. 4)

BF,Batching Frequency – fraction of observations that belong to any batch within the segment.,"“… BF as the batching frequency or percentage, expressing the fraction of observations that are part of a batch out of the total amount of observations within a segment.” (Sect. 4)"

μ_X (e.g., Wo2b),Average/mean value of any measure X computed over the segment (paper uses the prefix ).,"Tables 1–2 list “k, BI, Wo2b, IA …” showing that the mean of each raw measure is itself used as a performance indicator. (Sect. 6, Tables 1–2)"

σ_X (e.g., Wo2b),Standard deviation of any measure X over the segment (paper uses the prefix ).,"Tables 1–2 list “k, BI, Wo2b, IA …” indicating the spread/variability of each performance measure and using it in the analysis. (Sect. 6, discussion around Tables 1–2)"
Shahzad and Johannesson 2009 - An evaluation of process warehousing approaches for business process analysis.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência extraída do texto
Indicadores (genéricos),Usados para medir e reconhecer resultados da execução do processo de negócio.,“…para ‘recognition of the business process execution results using indicators’ [11].”

Indicadores de performance críticos,Acesso quase em tempo-real aos valores críticos de desempenho dos processos.,“The process data store provides nearly real-time access to critical performance indicators of business processes.”
Indicadores-chave de performance (KPI),Especificam objetivos individuais
column2: para cada KPI são registrados meta (target) e desempenho real (actual).,“Individual goals are specified by key performance indicators and for each indicator target and actual performance [23].”

column1: Análise de atividades,"Mede quais atividades foram executadas, falharam ou não foram iniciadas.","“activity analysis, this analysis answers questions like which activities are executed, which are failed, which activities are not executed, etc.”"

Análise de fluxos de entidades informacionais,Avalia que informações circulam entre elementos do processo e quais elementos participam desses fluxos.,"“flows of informational entities , this analysis answers questions like what information flows between elements of a process and which elements are involved in the flows”"

Análise de subprocessos,Verifica como o processo é decomposto e como os subprocessos colaboram para um objetivo único.,"“subprocess analysis, this analysis answers questions like how a process is decomposed and collectively how the subprocess work together to achieve a single goal.”"

Análise da ordem de execução,Determina em que sequência (série ou paralelo) os elementos do processo são executados.,"“execution order analysis, this analysis answers questions like which elements can be executed in series or in parallel etc.”"

Análise de tempo de ciclo (cycle-time),"Mede o tempo consumido por cada processo, registrando horário de início e fim.","“cycle-time analysis, the analysis answers questions related to the amount of time consumed by each process, start time and stop time of a process.”"
Análise de comportamento anômalo,Detecta anomalias na execução de um processo.,"“anomalous behavior analysis, this analysis answers questions like anomalies in execution of a process”"

Análise de caminho (path analysis),Identifica qual caminho é seguido em fluxos paralelos diante de um evento.,"“path analysis, this analysis answers questions like which path is followed in parallel flows against an event”"

Análise de prazos / deadlocks,Conta quantas vezes ocorreram deadlocks ou violações de prazo na execução do processo.,"“deadline analysis, this analysis answers questions like how many time deadlocks were occurred during process execution.”"
Análise de recursos,Verifica quais recursos estão disponíveis ou foram consumidos.,"“resource analysis : this analysis answers questions like which resources are available, consumed etc.”"

Análise de unidades organizacionais,Relaciona processos às unidades organizacionais envolvidas.,"“organizational unit analysis,  this analysis answers questions like the processes associated with an organizational unit etc.”"

Análise de participantes,Quantifica participantes associados a um processo e vice-versa.,"“participant analysis,  this analysis answers questions like amount of participants associated with a process and the number of processes associated with a participants”"

Análise de softwares/serviços,Identifica softwares ou serviços que suportam o processo e seus papéis.,"“software or service analysis,  this analysis answers questions like the software associated with a process and the role of each software in a process.”"

Análise de entradas,Mede a quantidade de entradas necessárias para disparar o processo.,"“input analysis,  the analysis answers questions related to, the amount of input required to trigger a process etc.”"
Análise de consumo,Mede os recursos consumidos durante a execução do processo.,"“consumption analysis,  this analysis answers questions related to, the resources consumed during a process execution”"

Análise de saídas,Conta quantas vezes o processo foi executado com sucesso ou quais saídas foram geradas.,"“output analysis,  this analysis answers questions like the number of times a process was successfully executed etc.”"
Análise de alcance de metas,Avalia em que medida o objetivo do modelo de processo foi atingido.,“This perspective represents the extent to which the goal of a process model is achieved.”
Draheim 2011 - On the Design of IT Key Performance Indicators.pdf
indicador,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),"Medida formal, quantitativa, utilizada para monitorar objetivos de processos definidos e apoiar o controle do sistema de gestão.","""The key performance indicators are measurable figures about defined business processes.""  "

Performance Indicators (generic),Conjunto de métricas escolhidas para tornar transparente o desempenho dos serviços de TI e que precisam ser negociadas entre as partes interessadas.,"""The selection of appropriate performance indicators and their negotiation among stakeholders are important components in establishing transparency in IT service management.""  "
Steering Parameters,Parâmetros-alvo negociados entre função de controle e de execução
column2: representam cifras mensuráveis ligadas a processos de negócio e são usados para conduzir (steering) o desempenho.,"""A steering parameter is a well-defined, measurable figure of a defined business process.""  "

column1: Informal Target Agreements,Objetivos não mensuráveis formalmente que complementam os parâmetros de steering
column2: usados para cobrir aspectos que não cabem em métricas rígidas.,"""Informal target agreements are further target agreements that cannot be defined as measurable figures in terms of defined business processes.""  "

column1: Additional Business Improvement Activities,Atividades de melhoria que influenciam resultado mas não são expressas como métricas
column2: funcionam como forma indireta de medir progresso.,"""The business improvement activities are all kinds of activities other than target agreements that are intended to improve the efficiency or effectiveness of the enterprise.""  "

column1: Informal Performance Reports,Relatórios qualitativos usados para avaliar conquistas quando não há métricas quantitativas disponíveis.,"""The performance reports are further information about the performance of the enterprise that cannot be defined as measurable figures in terms of defined business processes.""  "
Return on Investment (ROI),Indicador financeiro que relaciona lucro esperado ao capital necessário
column2: utilizado para avaliar benefício econômico de investimentos em TI.,"""Return on investment (ROI) is the widely used term in profit/loss calculations. Formally, it is the ratio of expected profit to needed capital.""  "

column1: Total Cost of Ownership (TCO),"Cálculo do custo total (hardware, software, rollout, operação) durante o ciclo de vida do sistema
column2: usado para comparar alternativas de TI.","""Eventually, total cost of ownership (TCO) [16] must be addressed.""  "

column1: Direct Costs,Custos orçados explícitos incluídos no TCO
column2: servem como componente mensurável de desempenho financeiro.,"""Direct costs are budgeted expenses...""  "

column1: Indirect Costs,"Custos não orçados (ex.: treinamento, suporte, downtime) que afetam o TCO e a performance geral.","""Indirect costs are unbudgeted expenses. ... Typical examples of indirect costs are expenses for end user training and support.""  "
Probabilistic Costs,"Custos estimados associados a eventos de risco (falhas, ameaças de segurança)
column2: considerados separadamente para avaliar impacto total.","""All probabilistic costs – usually indirect costs of uncertain malfunction events but also all other probabilistic costs – are considered separately from the total cost of ownership.""  "

column1: Total Economic Impact (TEI),"Método que combina TCO, valor de negócio e opções geradas para medir impacto econômico total de um investimento de TI.","""An example of an approach that addresses the real benefits of an IT investment is Forrester Research’s Total Economic Impact (TEI) method [17]...""  "
Total Benefit of Ownership,Indicador composto de lucro e economias de custo atribuíveis ao ativo de TI
column2: utilizado junto ao TCO para análise completa.,"""Furthermore, the total benefit of ownership is made of assessable profit and cost savings...""  "

column1: Profit,Parcela de benefício mensurável usada no cálculo de ROI e Total Benefit.,"""assessable profit...""  "
Cost Savings,Reduções de despesa atribuídas à TI
column2: usadas como parte do benefício mensurável.,"""Cost savings and profit together make up a kind of direct, absolute return on investment...""  "

column1: Quality of Service (QoS),"Categoria de métricas (disponibilidade, desempenho, etc.) usada para avaliar impacto do ativo de TI sobre o serviço.","""Quality of Service Availability Scalability Security (figura 3).""  "

Performance,Objetivo técnico fundamental (velocidade/resposta) que deve ser medido para garantir estabilidade do sistema.,"""Several objectives must be met to make a successful and stable system: performance, scalability, availability, security, maintainability.""  "
Availability,Métrica de tempo de serviço
column2: custos de downtime são usados para quantificar seu impacto.,"""with respect to availability you have to estimate the costs of system downtime""  "

column1: Scalability,"Capacidade de crescer com demanda
column2: citada como critério de objetivo e, portanto, potencial KPI.","""Several objectives must be met to make a successful and stable system: performance, scalability, availability, security, maintainability.""  "

column1: Security,"Objetivo técnico que pode ser quantificado (incidentes, violações) e cuja falta gera custos probabilísticos.","""with respect to security you have to estimate the costs of the case that somebody infringes your system.""  "
Maintainability,Capacidade de manutenção do sistema
column2: listada como objetivo-chave a ser medido.,"""Several objectives must be met to make a successful and stable system: performance, scalability, availability, security, maintainability.""  "

column1: System Downtime Costs,Custo associado a indisponibilidade
column2: usado como métrica para calcular impacto de disponibilidade.,"""with respect to availability you have to estimate the costs of system downtime"""

medidor,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto

KPIs,"Indicadores-chave de performance usados de forma geral para medir e acompanhar o negócio no RAP (análise, acompanhamento e projeções).",“…express them as target values of various KPIs.” | “…periodic computation of relevant KPIs…” | “…estimated values of various KPIs…”

Target KPI values,Valores-alvo que traduzem o impacto pretendido de uma decisão e servem como referência futura.,"“Estimating the impact of the decision on the business, express them as target values of various KPIs.”"

Projected KPI values / Estimated KPI values,Valores projetados dos KPIs que compõem a visão de futuro mantida no módulo Projection.,“The Projection retains the overall view… It is comprised of estimated values of various KPIs…”
Actual KPI values,Valores reais coletados posteriormente para comparação com projeções ou metas.,“The actual impact of the decisions as captured later.”

KPI mismatch (diferença entre real e projetado),Medida comparativa usada para detectar desvios e acionar alarmes.,“…comparison with the projected values and generating alarm if they mismatch substantially.”
Alarms,Sinalizadores de performance disparados quando a diferença entre valores reais e projetados ultrapassa determinado limiar.,“…generating alarm if they mismatch substantially.”

Confidence values associated with KPIs,Métricas de confiança que indicam a probabilidade de atingir os valores-alvo dos KPIs.,“There are also confidence values associated with the KPIs those signify the possibility of achieving the target values of the respective KPIs.”
Estimated impact of decision,"Medida antecipada dos efeitos de uma ação proposta, usada para avaliar alternativas.",“The estimated impact of implementing the actions.”
Actual impact of decision,"Medida observada dos efeitos reais após a execução da ação, armazenada como experiência organizacional.",“The actual impact of the decisions as captured later.”

Financial indicators,Apontados como medidas de desempenho dominantes porém insuficientes quando utilizados isoladamente,"“…too many financial indicators, lack of systematically measured process results etc.”"
Process results (process indicators),Indicados como informação que deve ser medida de forma sistemática para avaliar desempenho de processos,“…lack of systematically measured process results…”
Market reaction time,Utilizado como métrica-alvo cujo encurtamento aumenta a competitividade,“…reduce market reaction time to environmental changes.”

Process performance measurement,Descrito como sistema/métrica para controlar e melhorar processos,“Process performance measurement systems integrate aspects for identification of process goals and relevant indicators…”
Long-term goals,Usados como medidores qualitativos que precisam ser ligados a indicadores de curto prazo,“Integration of long-term goals with short term indicators”
Short-term indicators,Complementam as metas de longo prazo para permitir acompanhamento tático,“Integration of long-term goals with short term indicators”
Market share,Indicador estratégico de posição competitiva exibido no exemplo de monitoramento,“Market share 43 %” (Figura 6)
Cycle time / Durchlaufzeit,Medidor operacional de rapidez de processo mostrado em exemplos práticos,“Cycle time” e “Durchlaufzeit” (Figuras 4 e 6)
Contract-issuing cycle time,Exemplo específico de cycle time aplicado ao processo de emissão de contratos,“Contract issuing Cycle time” (Figura 6)
Number of complaints (# complaints),Indicador tático de qualidade apresentado no drill-down de processos,“# complaints” (Figura 4)
Number of orders (# orders),Indicador de volume usado em correlação com reclamações no exemplo,“# orders” (Figura 4)
Customer satisfaction,Meta/indicador estratégico ilustrado no exemplo de desdobramento,“Achieving customer satisfaction (strategic goal)” (Figura 4)
Key Performance Indicators (KPI),Termo genérico para os medidores críticos rastreados no sistema,“KPI …” (Figura 4) – além de várias referências a ‘performance indicators’ no texto

Performance measurements,Indicador genérico utilizado para fundamentar decisões organizacionais baseadas em dados.,"""All of these enables implementing performance measurements within the organization, which in effect can lead to decision making based on data rather than people's opinion.""  "

Personality-process role fit (quality measure),"Utilizado como métrica de qualidade do processo, relacionando personalidade do executante e papel no processo.","""Taking into consideration personality - process role fit, as a process of the quality measure.""  "

Fit function – degree of matching,Função numérica calculada pelo framework que expressa o grau de adequação de um perfil a um papel/tarefa.,"""The output fit function (FF) gives the value of the degree of matching the profile P to the role R.""  "
Classificação do perfil,Derivado da fit function
column2: agrupa perfis em classes que indicam nível de aderência às tarefas.,"""…classification of the employee profile into one of the classes determining the degree of matching to the tasks or their group…""  "

column1: Efficiency and performance of the task,Indicador usado para modelar a relação entre perfil de personalidade e execução da tarefa.,"""…capturing the relationship of the personality profile to the efficiency and performance of the task.""  "

Job performance (overall),Medida geral de desempenho ocupacional investigada na literatura citada.,"""The relationship between personality and job performance has been a frequently studied research topic over the past century…""  "

Task performance,Subcomponente específico de job performance usado em estudos de correlação.,"""…however, the job performance is described by the task performance and creativity which are not standardized.""  "
Creativity,Indicador de desempenho associado a task performance nos estudos clássicos.,"""…job performance is described by the task performance and creativity which are not standardized.""  "
Work productivity,Meta de melhoria mencionada na análise de tarefas do exemplo.,"""…studying ways to make improvements to one or many steps to increase productivity…""  "
Cost reduction,Indicador de desempenho operacional citado no exemplo de tarefa.,"""…increase productivity, reduce costs, improve time management…""  "
Time management,Outro indicador de desempenho operacional citado no exemplo de tarefa.,"""…increase productivity, reduce costs, improve time management…""  "
Counterproductive behaviors,Medida negativa de desempenho organizacional associada a traços de personalidade.,"""…if antagonism is associated with counterproductive behaviors…""  "

column1: Total service quality,Fitness para seleção de serviços em nuvem
column2: soma das qualidades individuais.,“The fitness function is equal to the total service quality.”

column1: Continual efficiency (multitasking coefficient),Coeficiente usado na função fitness para medir eficiência contínua via multitasking.,"“…coefficients are: cost, continual efficiency being reflected through multitasking…”  "
Balance of allocated tasks coefficient,Mede quão equilibrada está a distribuição de tarefas entre recursos.,“…coefficient of balance of allocated tasks…”

Distribution success coefficient,Avalia sucesso da distribuição de tarefas aos participantes.,"“…coefficient, which shows how successful the distribution of tasks among participants in the process is.”  "
Total delay,Soma dos tempos de espera
column2: reportado para configuração otimizada e atual.,“The total delay in the process for the optimal model is 3719.6 minutes.”

column1: Fitness function value,Valor agregado que combina métricas (espera + custo)
column2: usado para comparação de soluções.,“…value of the fitness function is 37478.”

column1: Execution time of task,Tempo necessário para cada atividade
column2: parâmetro de entrada da simulação.,“…information about the duration of certain tasks in the process…”

column1: Bottlenecks (tasks held up),Indicador qualitativo de congestionamento
column2: objetivo é reduzi-los via redesign.,“…reduce the amount of tasks that get held up by process bottlenecks.”

column1: Püchel et al. 2024 - On the Pivotal Role of Data in Sustainability Transformations - Challenges and Opportunities.pdf
Metric,Usage/Context,Evidence in Text
Key-Performance Indicators (KPIs),Generic performance measures requested by NFRD/CSRD for sustainability disclosure
column2: basis for internal monitoring and comparison.,"“the NFRD required key-performance indicators (KPIs), the CSRD requires very detailed information…”"

column1: ESG Indicators,"Triple set (Environmental, Social, Governance) used throughout the paper as umbrella performance construct for corporate sustainability.","“information on their environmental, social, and governance (ESG) impacts, policies and processes…”"

CO₂ Emissions / Green-house-Gas Emissions,"Major environmental metric used for regulatory reporting, internal learning, spend- vs. activity-based carbon accounting and carbon-corrected cost.",“the data may indicate developments in the company’s emission of environmentally harmful substances or CO₂”
column2: “spend-based carbon reporting … activity-based reporting … assigns carbon emissions”

column1: Energy Consumption,Measured through smart-metering and used as feedback/nudge in process-science case
column2: also general indicator in Green IS literature.,“data was collected on energy consumption and displayed to the users”

column1: Water Resources Consumption,Part of ESRS E-metrics under CSRD.,"“For environmental matters (E), the ESRS include issues related to climate change, water resources…”"
Circular-Economy Indicators,"Required by ESRS for ‘E’
column2: measure material loops, recycling etc.",“…environmental matters (E) … circular economy…”

column1: Pollution / Contamination Levels,ESRS sub-topic
column2: measures emissions of harmful substances.,"“…environmental matters (E), the ESRS include … contamination …”"

column1: Biodiversity Metrics,ESRS environmental topic
column2: evaluates impact on ecosystems.,“…environmental matters (E) … biodiversity.”

column1: Occupational Health & Safety Incidents,Social metric for internal learning and disclosure.,“the data may indicate changes in occupational health and safety incidents”
Gender Distribution among Employees,Social diversity metric disclosed and used for internal analysis.,“the data may indicate … gender distribution among employees”
Social-Audit Results of Suppliers,Supplier-level governance/social metric for value-chain due-diligence.,“…or results of social audits with suppliers.”
Carbon Footprint,Overall aggregate of CO₂e used in spend- and activity-based reporting and LCA.,“Spend-based carbon reporting calculates a company’s environmental impact …”
Spend-Based Carbon Metric,Calculates emissions by multiplying ﬁnancial spend with emission factors
column2: criticised for counter-intuitive results.,"“Many companies currently rely on spend-based carbon reporting, a method that calculates a company’s environmental impact based on ﬁnancial expenditure…”"

column1: Activity-Based Carbon Metric,Assigns emissions to concrete operational activities across product life-cycle
column2: proposed as superior.,“Activity-based reporting (ABR) assigns carbon emissions based on speciﬁc activities within a product or service’s lifecycle.”

column1: Life-Cycle-Assessment (LCA) Emission Data,Granular emission factors per life-cycle stage used as input for ABR.,“Life Cycle Assessment data especially plays a crucial role in providing such details by quantifying the carbon emissions of a product or service throughout its lifecycle.”
Planetary-Boundaries Status,Macro-level performance yard-stick that frames urgency of sustainability transformation.,“with six out of nine planetary boundaries already crossed…”

SDG Progress Indicators,Benchmark corporate contributions to UN Sustainable Development Goals.,“aims at … transformation … that aligns with the principles of the 2015 United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDGs).”
Danov and Gotseva 2024 - Study of Basic Concepts in the Context of Process Management and Strategies Based on Big Data.pdf
Metric,Usage in text,Evidence (trecho do artigo)

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Identificado e definido nas fases de identificação e redesign do BPM para medir e avaliar a eficácia e a melhoria de performance de um processo.,“determining KPIs and Targets: identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and targets that will be measured to evaluate the effectiveness of the process.” / “setting new KPIs and targets: Setting new KPIs and targets that reflect the desired improvement in performance.”
Target,Meta quantitativa associada aos KPIs
column2: estabelecida nas mesmas fases para comparar resultados alcançados com o objetivo esperado.,Mesmas passagens: “KPIs and Targets …”

column1: Performance Indicator (PI),"Elementos que compõem o Performance Measurement System (PMS)
column2: quantificam o grau de sucesso no alcance dos objetivos, podendo ser indicadores individuais ou agregados.",“PMS … consists of a set of performance indicators (PI) that indicate the degree of success with which the objectives have been achieved.”

column1: Quality,Dimensão fundamental dos PIs usada para avaliar a qualidade do resultado do processo.,"“Among the most important dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”"
Time,"Dimensão dos PIs utilizada para medir duração, pontualidade ou velocidade de execução do processo.",Mesmo trecho acima.
Cost,Dimensão dos PIs que mensura o consumo de recursos financeiros do processo.,Mesmo trecho acima.
Flexibility,Dimensão dos PIs que avalia a capacidade de adaptação ou resposta do processo a mudanças.,Mesmo trecho acima.
Efficiency,"Resultado desejado após integração de Big Data, relacionado à otimização e melhor desempenho operacional.",“Increased efficiency includes optimizing business processes …”

Effectiveness,Critério de avaliação usado em conjunto com KPIs e PIs para julgar se o processo atinge os objetivos propostos.,“determin­ing KPIs and Targets … to evaluate the effectiveness of the process.” / “Performance indicators can be: individual that determine the effectiveness of individual tasks or processes …”
Syamsiyah and Leemans 2020 - Process discovery using in-database minimum self distance abstractions.pdf
metric,how_it_is_used,evidence_in_the_text
Absolute time (ms),tempo total de execução de cada técnica sobre cada log
column2: comparado entre DB e Trad (Fig. 5),“Figure 5 shows the results in absolute time…”

column1: Relative time (normalised),"tempo relativo em que o Trad é tomado como 1 e o DB é escalonado (Fig. 6) para comparar fases (loading, abstraction, etc.)","“…Figure 6 shows the results in relative time: for each log, the runtime of Trad has been taken as 1, while scaling the time of DB.”"
Phase-specific time,"tempo gasto em cada fase do processo (loading, abstraction, mining, visualisation, DB-overhead)
column2: mostrado em barras empilhadas (Fig. 6)","“It is also important to note … Figure 6, the mining and visualisation time of the two approaches are similar … the abstraction phase in DB takes longer than in Trad.”"

column1: Main-memory usage (GB),medida de memória necessária para processar cada log
column2: usada para demonstrar limitação do Trad e vantagem do DB,“the Xerox(jun) log required 4 GB and the Xerox(nov) log required 14 GB of memory … all logs were successfully processed by DB using only 2 GB of main memory”

column1: Processing time per event (ms),tempo médio para inserir um evento e actualizar DF/MSD via trigger
column2: usado para avaliar a função de ‘update’,"“On average, the time needed for inserting one event and updating the corresponding abstractions was 1,2 ms.”"

column1: Throughput (events/s),métrica derivada: eventos que podem ser tratados por segundo (inverso do tempo por evento),"“In other words, in one second the database can typically handle around 833 events.”"
Fitness,"medida de qualidade do modelo (0–1)
column2: calculada em validação cruzada, apresentada na coluna ‘f’ da Tabela 1",“… measuring fitness [20] … Table 1 shows the results.”

column1: ETC-Precision,precisão do modelo segundo a métrica ETC
column2: valores na coluna ‘p’ da Tabela 1,“… measuring … ETC-precision [15] … Table 1 shows the results.”

column1: Simplicity,tamanho/complexidade do modelo
column2: valores na coluna ‘s’ da Tabela 1,“… measuring … simplicity. Table 1 shows the results.”

column1: Pareto-optimality,"critério qualitativo indicando se um modelo é simultaneamente não dominado em fitness, precisão e simplicidade",“IMfw obtained (on average) pareto-optimal results for 6 logs …”

Soundness,"propriedade formal (modelo livre de deadlocks/livelocks) garantida pela abordagem, usada como métrica de correção","“First, by its use of process trees, the IMw framework guarantees to return a sound model …”"
Saha et al. 2024 - Forecasting the Impact of Anomalous Events on Business Process Performance.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence in the text

cycle time,Defined as a KPI to capture the total time for complete execution of a process.,“…different KPIs such as the cycle time (the time for the complete execution of the process) or cost of execution are defined…”
cost of execution,Business-level KPI to monitor monetary efficiency of the process.,“…different KPIs such as the cycle time … or cost of execution are defined…”

average number of orders processed per hour,Illustrative KPI treated as a time-series signal for forecasting.,“Business KPIs such as the average number of orders processed per hour are measured periodically…”
lost orders,Effect on business outcome used as example of KPI degradation.,“…lost orders in an order processing system…”
delivery delay,Illustrative KPI consequence due to anomalies (delay to goods delivery).,“…or delays to the goods delivery…”
Page views,Example of application-level KPI studied for root-cause analysis.,"“…monitoring tools that provide KPIs of applications (Page views, Search calls, and the number of users)…”  "
Search calls,"Same as above, application-level KPI.",(same sentence as above)
number of users,"Same as above, application-level KPI.",(same sentence as above)
quality (category),General performance perspective for grouping KPIs.,"“…different performance perspectives such as cost, time, and quality [11].”  "
availability,QoS metric monitored together with process KPIs.,“…quality of service (QoS) metrics (availability or response time of a process engine)…”
response time of process engine,QoS metric considered alongside business KPIs.,(same sentence as above)
SALES DOCUMENTS THROUGHPUT,Throughput KPI for the ‘Create Order’ step
column2: used in real dataset and forecasting experiments.,“The KPI SALES DOCUMENTS THROUGHPUT records the throughput of the Create Order step…”

column1: SD BILLING THROUGHPUT,Throughput KPI for the ‘Post Goods Issue’ step
column2: used in experiments.,“…while the KPI SD BILLING THROUGHPUT records the throughput of the Post Goods Issue step.”

column1: Correction Failures,KPI counting failures in ‘Correct Order’ step (simulated dataset).,“The KPIs Correction Failures … record the number of failures in the Correct Order … respectively.”
Goods Issue Creation Failure,Failure-count KPI for ‘Post Goods Issue’ step.,(same sentence block)
Invoice Creation Failures,Failure-count KPI for ‘Create Invoice’ step.,(same sentence block)
Number of corrected sales orders,Throughput KPI for ‘Correct Order’ step.,“…Number of corrected sales orders… measure the throughput of the Correct Order … steps respectively.”
Number of invoices created,Throughput KPI for ‘Create Invoice’ step.,(same sentence block)
Number of invoices to create,Backlog/throughput KPI for ‘Post Goods Issue’ step.,(same sentence block)
Number of open sales order,Backlog KPI for ‘Create Sales Order’ step.,(same sentence block)
Number of outbound deliveries created,Throughput KPI for ‘Create Outbound Delivery’ step.,(same sentence block)
Number of valid sales orders,Throughput KPI for ‘Validate Order’ step.,(same sentence block)
Outbound Delivery Creation Failures,Failure-count KPI for ‘Create Outbound Delivery’ step.,(same sentence block)
Outbound Shipping,Throughput KPI for ‘Outbound Shipping’ step.,(same sentence block)
Outbound Shipping Failures,Failure-count KPI for ‘Outbound Shipping’ step.,(same sentence block)
Validation Failures,Failure-count KPI for ‘Validate Order’ step.,(same sentence block)
latency,Generic IT metric captured by observability tools
column2: part of multivariate input.,"“…capture common signals such as latency, error, and traffic.”  "

column1: error (count/rate),Generic IT metric
column2: forms anomaly signal series.,(same sentence as above)

column1: traffic,Generic IT metric
column2: forms part of multivariate forecasting input.,(same sentence as above)

column1: Disk Space utilization / low disk space,Infrastructure metric whose anomaly (‘low disk space’) is illustrated as impacting invoices processed.,“The effect of low disk space on invoices processed per day is shown in Figure 2.”
Batch Job Error,IT anomaly metric present in SO and simulated datasets
column2: studied in causal/forecasting experiments.,Listed under SO data and simulated data characteristics.

column1: qRFC Error,"IT anomaly metric in SO data, analysed for impact on KPI.",Listed under SO data and forecasting experiment figures.
ABAP Instance not available,IT anomaly metric in simulated dataset.,Listed under simulated data IT metrics.
drivingDifficultyIndex (source/destination),Environmental (weather-derived) metric in simulated dataset.,Listed under simulated data weather metrics.
snow1Hour (source/destination),Weather metric (snowfall in last hour) used as external regressor.,Listed under simulated data weather metrics.
visibility (source/destination),Weather metric included in multivariate series.,Listed under simulated data weather metrics.
windSpeed (source/destination),Weather metric included in multivariate series.,Listed under simulated data weather metrics.
Xu et al. 2013 - Design of an ultra-compact stripline BPM receiver using microtca for LCLS-II at SLAC.pdf
Performance Metric,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal no texto
Beam Energy,Parâmetro de projeto para caracterizar o feixe eletrônico do LCLS,Table 1: Beam Energy 13.4 GeV
Beam Current,Parâmetro de projeto associado à intensidade do feixe,Table 1: Beam Current 3.4 kV
Undulator Period,Parâmetro que define a estrutura do ondulador,Table 1: Undulator Period 3 cm
Undulator Parameter (K),Parâmetro que caracteriza o campo magnético do ondulador,Table 1: Undulator Parameter 3.5
Undulator Length,Comprimento total do ondulador usado para ganho FEL,Table 1: Undulator Length 130 m
Radiation Wavelength,"Comprimento de onda alvo do FEL, base para vários cálculos",Table 1: Radiation Wavelength 1.5 Å

rms Radiation Size,Usado para estimar tamanho do feixe na fonte e no detector,“The easiest quantities to extract from the results of FEL simulations are the rms sizes of the radiation pulse in the near and far field.”
Divergence,Determina abertura angular do feixe e dimensiona aperturas/óptica,“in particular the divergence and beam size determine the design of apertures and target sizes.”
Rayleigh Length (zr),Medidor da divergência
column2: extraído para cada pico e comparado,“The average Rayleigh length of 32 m is actually larger than the steady-state case.”

column1: Waist Size (w0),Parâmetro do modo fundamental ajustado à radiação,“Although Eq. 1 has three unknown parameter – the waist size w0 …”
Waist Position (z0) / Source Position,Local efetivo da cintura
column2: define ponto fonte do feixe,“The effective waist position is in average 38 m within the undulator …”

column1: Spot Size (Σ),Área real do feixe usada para comparar com a área de coerência,“about five times larger than the spot size Σ.”
Coherence Area (Ac),Área onde amplitude & fase permanecem correlacionadas
column2: usada para avaliar coerência,"“The coherence area, as defined in Eq. 4, is 0.071 mm2 …”"

column1: Complex Coherence Factor (µ12),Indicador local (0–1) do grau de coerência espacial,“The resulting distribution for µ12 is shown in Fig. 3.”
Mutual Intensity (J12),Função estatística base que gera µ12 e Ac,“The mutual intensity function becomes then the mutual intensity J12 ≡ Γ12(0).”
Número de Spikes (≈200),Caracteriza a estrutura longitudinal do pulso SASE,“SASE Simulations … yield a radiation pulse with about 200 spikes at the undulator exit.”
Pico de Potência ≥20 %,Critério de seleção dos spikes analisados,“only spikes are considered which have a peak power of at least 20 % of the maximum power in the pulse.”
Valor Médio,Média estatística de zr e z0 para descrever desempenho típico,“The average Rayleigh length … 32 m …” / “The effective waist position is in average 38 m …”
RMS Fluctuation,Desvio-padrão usado como medida de estabilidade shot-to-shot,“and has a rms fluctuation of 4.8 m.” / “The rms variation is 4 m.”
Razão Ac/Σ,Índice derivado que indica se coerência cobre todo o feixe,“about five times larger than the spot size Σ … indicates sufficient transverse coherence.”
Vukšic et al. 2017 - Social business process management - Croatian IT company case study.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Process Performance Index (PPI),Índice agregado (10-50 pontos) empregado para medir o nível de maturidade em BPM da organização.,“In this research Process Performance Index (PPI) has been used… describes three levels of BPM maturity.”
Pontuação média de PPI (46),Valor obtido pela empresa-caso
column2: posiciona a organização no nível máximo (“process management mastery”).,“The average PPI is 46 – almost the highest on the PPI scale that runs from 10 to 50.”

column1: Nível de maturidade “Process management mastery”,Classificação decorrente do valor do PPI
column2: indica o estágio mais avançado de maturidade BPM.,“…(3) process management mastery (PPI from 41 to 50).” / “The average PPI is 46….”

column1: PPI – Alignment with Strategy,Fator crítico avaliado em escala 1-5 para verificar o quanto os processos estão alinhados à estratégia.,“The PPI score on ‘alignment with strategy’ success factor is 5…”
PPI – Holistic Approach,Fator que mede se a melhoria é conduzida por uma perspectiva de processo.,“The score on ‘holistic approach’ is 5.”
PPI – Process Awareness by Management and Employees,Avalia o grau de consciência dos colaboradores e gestores sobre BPM.,“…‘process awareness by management and employees’… score … is 4.”
PPI – Portfolio of Process Management Initiatives,Mede a existência de portfólio e repositório de processos.,“The score on ‘portfolio of process management initiatives’ is 5…”

PPI – Process Improvement Methodology,Avalia o uso de metodologias padrão (ex.: BPMN) para modelagem e melhoria.,"“…‘process improvement methodology’ is 5, BPMN diagrams and Oracle Process Modeler software are used….”  "
PPI – Process Metrics,Avalia definição e uso de métricas de desempenho de processos.,“Process performance indicators and metrics are defined… the score on ‘process metrics’ is 4.”
PPI – Customer Focus,Mede a orientação ao cliente nos esforços de análise e desenho de processos.,“…‘customer focus’ success factor is 5.”
PPI – Process Management,"Verifica a existência de owners, responsabilidades e monitoramento contínuo.",“… score on ‘process management’ factor is 3.”
PPI – Information Systems,Avalia reconhecimento e uso de SI para suportar processos.,“The observed company has the highest PPI score ‑ 5 on the ‘information systems’ factor.”
PPI – Change Management,Mede a forma como questões humanas e culturais são tratadas durante mudanças.,“…(the score on ‘change management’ factor is 5).”

Process Performance Indicators & Metrics (genérico),Indicadores específicos usados para medir desempenho de processos.,"“Process performance indicators and metrics are defined, but process measurement system is still not fully implemented.”  "

Organizational Culture Assessment Instrument (OCAI),Instrumento utilizado para mensurar o tipo de cultura organizacional (pontuação 0-100 por tipo).,“…Organizational Culture Assessment Instrument (OCAI)… has been used for assessing the current organizational culture…”
OCAI – Clan Culture (38/100),Pontuação que indica a cultura dominante da empresa-caso.,“OCAI results showed clan culture to be dominant (with the score of 38 from 100)….”
OCAI – Adhocracy Culture (30/100),Pontuação que indica o segundo tipo de cultura mais presente.,“…adhocracy is at the second place with the average score of 30 from 100 points.”
OCAI – Market Culture (13/100),Pontuação que indica o tipo de cultura menos presente na empresa-caso.,“…market culture with the average score of 13 from 100 points.”
OCAI – Hierarchy Culture (implícito),"Tipo previsto pelo instrumento
column2: mencionado indiretamente como uma das quatro categorias, ainda que sem pontuação específica na empresa-caso.","“…Respondents divide 100 points between 4 statements… being: (1) clan, (2) adhocracy, (3) market and (4) hierarchy.”"

MÉTRICO,COMO É USADO NO TEXTO,EVIDÊNCIA TEXTUAL (entre aspas)
Response time (incl. “real-time / near-real-time / fast OLAP query response time / real-time response”),Avaliar rapidez da resposta de consultas/ações de BI,“Fast OLAP query response time.”
column2: “Operational BI … need for near real-time BI”
column3: “Real-time response”

column1: Maximal response time,Meta de SLA que não deve ser ultrapassada,“service level objectives like maximal response time …”
Latency (incl. “low latency” / “reduce latency”),Medir atraso entre chegada do dado e disponibilização para análise,“Low latency”
column2: “reduce latency”
column3: “reduce the latency between when the transaction data is acquired and when that data is available for analysis”

column1: Dieu et al. 2009 - 1,000 tables under the form.pdf
metric,como é usado no texto,evidência literal (trecho abreviado)
Total Cost of Ownership (TCO),métrica de custo utilizada para justificar o uso de EII
column2: o objetivo é manter TCO baixo,“…habilita a criação e consulta de esquemas virtuais … com um baixo TCO (Total Cost of Ownership).”

column1: Data Processing Set (dps),principal métrica de performance
column2: nº de linhas trazidas dos data sources para executar a parte de assembly da consulta
column3: objetivo do otimizador é minimizá-la,“introduzimos a noção de data processing set … como o número de linhas que são lidas…  Nosso objetivo de otimização é encontrar um plano … que tenha o menor dps(P(Q)).”

column1: dps(P(Q),SQi) (dps de subquery),versão derivada da métrica aplicada a cada subconsulta individual
column2: soma dessas dps gera o dps total,"“definimos o data processing set de uma subquery SQi … Se N é o número de subqueries… ∑ dps(P(Q),SQi) = dps(P(Q)).”"

column1: Número de tabelas na cláusula FROM,usado para caracterizar “mega queries”
column2: influencia diretamente custo de otimização e execução,“Mega queries … referenciam … centenas a milhares de tabelas na cláusula FROM.”

column1: Número de bases de dados/fontes,indica grau de distribuição e impacto na execução (ex.: 80 bancos diferentes),“…depois do desdobramento a consulta referencia mais de 1 000 tabelas de mais de 80 bancos de dados diferentes.”
Tempo de execução da consulta,resultado percebido pelo usuário
column2: mega queries otimizadas retornam em dezenas de segundos a poucos minutos,“83 % das mega queries … puderam ser processadas num intervalo de 20 s a 2 min.”

column1: Tempo de otimização,tempo gasto pelo otimizador
column2: melhoria de horas para segundos/minutos depois das técnicas propostas,“em implementação anterior … o otimizador levava horas … Depois das mudanças ele se torna escalável.”

column1: Pior caso de complexidade temporal,indicador analítico da eficiência dos estágios do otimizador (linear ou polinomial),“estágios são concebidos para garantir uma baixa complexidade de tempo no pior caso (linear ou polinomial).”
Consumo de memória,meta de projeto
column2: transformações ‘in-place’ para manter uso de memória baixo,"“(ii) baixo consumo de memória, em particular favorecer transformações ‘in place’ para evitar clonagem de planos…”"

column1: Volume de transferência de dados,considerado fator de custo dominante
column2: minimizado indiretamente ao minimizar dps,“transferência de dados se mostra um fator de custo dominante … portanto é imperativo limitá-la.”

column1: Nº de valores distintos no atributo de junção,usado para decidir se vale a pena aplicar semi-join/bind join (afeta redução de dps),“…eficácia da redução semi-join depende do número de valores distintos retornados por SQ1.A…”
Fator de fan-out (junção),estimativa de multiplicação de registros
column2: critério para escolher bind join,"“…e do número de registros retornados por cada SQ2$… comparado à cardinalidade de SQ2 (i.e., fator de fan-out).”"

column1: Classificação small/big/unknown,rótulo baseado em cardinalidade estimada
column2: guia a criação de semi-joins e bind joins,"“Assumimos que … sabemos se o número de registros … é ‘small’, ‘big’ ou ‘unknown’.”"

column1: Requisitos de atualidade (intraday/intrahour/intraminute),medidor de frescor dos dados exigido pelo negócio
column2: condiciona necessidade de acesso direto às fontes,"“Estudos reportam requisitos de dados oportunos de: intraday (46 %), intrahour (25 %), intraminute (7 %).”"

column1: Panda et al. 2014 - e-government procurement implementation in India - two comparative case studies from the field.pdf
Medidor_de_Performance,Como_e_utilizado,Evidencia_no_Texto

column1: Chance de fracasso do projeto (%),Indicador de risco
column2: usado para enfatizar a necessidade de gestão adequada,"“E-GP project like any other e-Governance project has 70% chances of failure [18, 35]”"

Participação no PIB (%),Mede o peso das compras governamentais na economia do país,"“or 3.4% to 5.7% of Indian GDP [19, 10]”"

column2: compara antes e depois da adoção do E-GP,“Tender cycle time reduced from average 90-135 days to 32 days.”

column1: Economia de custos (valor absoluto),Mede valor monetário poupado graças ao E-GP,“Cost savings to a tune of Rs 22000 Crore.”

column2: compara número médio de proponentes por licitação,“Supplier participation increased from an average of 3 per tender in conventional mode to 4.5 in e-Procurement mode.”

column1: Número total de fornecedores registrados,Indicador de adoção pelo mercado fornecedor,“No of suppliers registered on E-GP portal: 60000”
Número de órgãos compradores usando o sistema,Indicador de penetração no setor público,"“27 Dept, 43 PSU & Corporations, 20 Universities and 135 Urban Local Bodies”"
Número total de licitações processadas (GoAP),Volume operacional do sistema,“Total tenders: 308253 Nos”

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Indicador de desempenho utilizado no nível estratégico
column2: ponto de partida para derivar requisitos não-funcionais e BLAs.,"“KPI2BLA : apoia o mapeamento de metas estratégicas organizacionais, representadas por Indicadores Chave de Desempenho (KPI)”"

column1: KQI (Key Quality Indicator),Indicador de qualidade utilizado em algumas abordagens de monitoramento para avaliar processos.,“Essa abordagem usa regras baseada em métricas de indicadores chave (KPI e Key Quality Indicator (KQI)) para monitorar processos.”
QoS (Quality of Service),Conjunto de atributos técnicos que especificam requisitos não-funcionais nos SLAs
column2: base para o monitoramento de serviços.,"“SLAs são definidos em termos de atributos de QoS, que representam os requisitos não funcionais propriamente ditos.”"

column1: SLA (Service Level Agreement),Acordo no nível de serviço que estabelece e mede os atributos de QoS dos serviços web.,"“Em SOA, um Acordo de Nível de Serviço (SLA) é uma forma de especificar sistematicamente condições exatas em que serviços web devem ser entregues e executados.”"
SLO (Service Level Objective),Meta individual de um atributo de QoS dentro de um SLA
column2: unidade atômica de medição utilizada pelo monitor.,“Atributos e níveis de QoS de um SLA são comumente chamados de Objetivos de Nível de Serviço (SLO).”

column1: BLA (Business Level Agreement),Acordo no nível de processo que expressa requisitos não-funcionais de negócio e é monitorado indiretamente via SLAs.,“Um BLA pode ser associado a um subprocesso e ser posteriormente mapeado hierarquicamente para um conjunto de SLAs.”

Tempo de resposta,Atributo de QoS usado como medidor principal no estudo de caso (BLA e SLA de tempo de resposta).,“assume-se que área de negócio considere crítico o tempo de resposta da atividade Aprovar Pagamento … um BLA … com meta de até 60 segundos”

Disponibilidade,Exemplo de atributo de QoS citado como requisito não-funcional que pode ser monitorado.,"“Outros tipos de requisitos não funcionais … são relacionados a segurança, disponibilidade, paralelismo, custo, entre outros”"

Segurança,Atributo de QoS monitorado em um dos SLAs do estudo de caso e citado como requisito não-funcional geral.,"“O SLA de segurança tem meta de retorno ‘TRUE’ (ou seja, o serviço precisa ser seguro), com um máximo de três tentativas.”"

Throughput,Atributo de QoS listado como exemplo possível de medição dentro do esquema canônico.,"“QoSAttribute – tipo do requisito não funcional a ser monitorado, tais como, tempo de resposta, disponibilidade, throughput etc

Desempenho,Característica geral monitorada por KPIs/BAM para avaliar processos e operações de negócio.,“BAM refere-se ao acesso em tempo real a indicadores críticos de desempenho de negócio para melhorar a viabilidade de operações comerciais.”
Custo,Exemplo de requisito não-funcional citado que pode ser alvo de medição.,"“Outros tipos de requisitos não funcionais … paralelismo, custo, entre outros”"

Paralelismo,Exemplo de requisito não-funcional citado que pode ser alvo de medição.,"“Outros tipos de requisitos não funcionais … são relacionados a segurança, disponibilidade, paralelismo, custo, entre outros”"

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Indicadores-chave que devem ser continuamente monitorados para avaliar a eficácia dos processos de remoção de resíduos,“Proper key performance indicators (KPIs) and publicly accessible dashboards must be designed.”

Ranks (pontuações da gamificação),Classificações usadas para incentivar cidadãos e administrações a participar e competir pela limpeza,“Citizens will be rewarded … providing a dashboard … to visualize the ranks generated by the gamification logic.”

Índices derivados dos dados coletados,Métricas sintetizadas a partir dos relatos de lixo para demonstrar o impacto de ações e apoiar relatórios de SDGs,"“Further, the indexes derived from the collected data could be used by administrations to demonstrate the impact of actions regarding littering management, as well as in the context of the SDGs.”"

Capacidade de manter as áreas limpas,Métrica comparativa entre administrações baseada nos relatos de cidadãos,“Administrations will compete on their ability to keep areas clean based on citizens’ reports.”

Frequência de locais com lixo abandonado,Indicador operacional para identificar ‘hot areas’ e orientar ações de fiscalização,"“For instance, a hot area with a high frequency of abandoned sites may be targeted by local police.”"

Qualidade do Serviço,KPI específico citado em estudos de gêmeos digitais para equilibrar custo e nível de serviço na coleta de resíduos,“support the decision-making activities to find a compromise between costs and quality of services using smart waste bins … presents an innovative key performance indicator to measure service quality.”

Custo de Desempenho / Custos Operacionais,Medição dos gastos envolvidos na limpeza ou na operação dos processos de coleta e descarte,“analyze the performance costs and the service quality in some countries”

Custo de Limpeza,"Valor financeiro total gasto para remover o lixo, usado como referência de impacto econômico",“the total cost of cleaning up litter on the land throughout the EU is in the range of €10-13 billion”
Benchmarks,Referências quantitativas produzidas pelo gêmeo digital para comparar diferentes municípios,“The digital twin provides benchmarks for implementing similar systems in other municipalities”
Eggers et al. 2021 - No Longer Out of Sight, No Longer Out of Mind - How ... ss Mining-Induced Transparency to Achieve Increased Process Awareness.pdf
Metric,Usage in the text,Evidence (excerpt from the article)

On-time Delivery (OTD),"Standard KPI adopted at ManuCorp and DistriCorp to monitor sub-processes (e.g., local warehousing / sales) and to compare performance across divisions or departments.","“…every division was now required to use process mining to monitor their sub-processes, such as local warehousing and sales processes, in terms of OTD.”"

Automation Rate,Chosen by DistriCorp’s expert team as one of the standard KPIs for procurement and warehousing processes.,"“The expert team decided on KPIs, such as automation rates and OTD, and standardized process mining analyses to be implemented on the ﬁrm’s core business processes…”"

Warehouse Throughput Time,Initial performance indicator whose stagnation triggered DistriCorp’s process-mining project and is subsequently monitored for efficiency gains.,"“…warehouse throughput times had been optimized to the limit, but we did not know why we were still losing time before shipping orders.”"

Unnecessary Price-Change Rate,Used by ManuCorp’s sales department after process-mining analysis to identify and reduce non-value-adding price changes that delayed production.,"“…sales department became aware of their high rates of unnecessary price changes, which caused subsequent production delays…”"

Rework Rate,Measured at AutoCorp (paint-shop defects) and at PensionCorp (pension-claim rework) to identify inefficiencies.,AutoCorp: “…sensor data from assembly to ﬁnd the root causes for high rework rates in the paint shop.”  PensionCorp: “…they regularly required more time than promised to the customer… due to unnecessary rework.”

Workflow-Variant Count,"Change-management team at AutoCorp counted number of different workflows (3,000) executed for change requests to standardise the process.","“…revealed through process mining that they carried out 3,000 different workﬂows to process change requests.”"

Customer-Call Volume,PensionCorp measured peaks in inbound calls to detect unclear customer documents and adjust communication.,“…process analysis revealed that a high volume of customer calls occurred once a year after information documents had been sent out to customers.”

Compliance Metric,PensionCorp detected compliance problems in the pension-registration sub-process and used findings for improvement.,"“…after an initial analysis of the pension registration sub-process, the team found compliance problems and inefficient communication patterns.”"

Supplier Delivery Reliability,DistriCorp evaluated suppliers on early / late deliveries to improve cross-organizational cooperation.,“…analyzed the reliability of their suppliers and found out that some suppliers ‘deliver the goods a few days early…’”

Late-Delivery Incident Alert,Control-function metric at DistriCorp that warns purchasers when delivery date is due without confirmation.,"“…employees were now alerted that ‘the delivery date is due, but we have not received any order conﬁrmation from the supplier…’”"

Self-Service Adoption Rate,PensionCorp’s ICT department analysed customer usage of online self-service channels to discover unmet needs.,"“…ICT department explored why customers were not adopting the self-service channels they provided, such as online forms and websites.”"

Customer-Satisfaction Score (survey),Linked by PensionCorp with process-mining data to explain low adoption of documents / self-service and drive changes.,“…they enriched their process mining analyses with customer survey data on satisfaction with the self-service channels…”

Medidor,Categoria,Uso/descrição no texto,Evidência (trecho literal ou paráfrase da passagem)

Distinct Activities (RBI 1.1),Skills,Número de atividades distintas completadas por um recurso em um intervalo de tempo.,"“RBI 1.1 Distinct activities: The number of distinct activities completed by a given resource, r, during a given timeslot…”"

Case Types (RBI 1.2),Skills,Fração de casos de um tipo (‘case type’) completados em que o recurso participou.,"“RBI 1.2 Case types: The fraction of cases with a given value, p, of case attribute case type… in which a given resource, r, was involved …”"

Activity Frequency (RBI 1.3),Skills,Frequência relativa de uma atividade específica executada por um recurso.,"“RBI 1.3 Activity frequency: The fraction of completions of a given activity, a, by a given resource, r …”"

Activity Completions (RBI 2.1),Utilisation,Número absoluto de instâncias de atividades concluídas pelo recurso.,“RBI 2.1 Activity completions: The number of activity instances completed by a given resource during a given time slot.”

Number of Case Completions (RBI 2.2),Utilisation,Quantidade de casos finalizados nos quais o recurso esteve envolvido.,“RBI 2.2 Number of case completions: The number of cases completed during a given time slot in which a given resource was involved.”

Fraction of Case Completions (RBI 2.3),Utilisation,Proporção de todos os casos concluídos nos quais o recurso participou.,“RBI 2.3 Fraction of case completions: The fraction of cases completed … with respect to the total number of cases completed during the time slot.”

Average Workload (RBI 2.4),Utilisation,Média de tarefas simultâneas abertas para o recurso.,“RBI 2.4 Average workload: The average number of activities started by a given resource but not completed at a moment in time.”

Multitasking (RBI 3.1),Preferences,Proporção do tempo ativo em que o recurso tinha mais de uma tarefa em paralelo.,“RBI 3.1 Multi-tasking: The fraction of active time during which a given resource is involved in more than one activity …”

New Attribute Values (RBI 3.2),Preferences,Número de vezes que o recurso completou tarefas com valores de atributo nunca vistos (propensão a risco).,“RBI 3.2 New attribute values: The number of times a resource completed a task … with an attribute value never seen before … This RBI reflects the resource’s propensity to execute new and hence risky tasks.”

Activity Reassignments (RBI 3.3),Preferences,Quantidade de vezes que uma tarefa iniciada por um recurso foi finalizada por outro.,“RBI 3.3 Activity reassignments: The number of times when an activity started by a given resource … was later completed by a different resource.”

Activity Outcomes / In-Time Activities (RBI 4.1),Productivity,Percentual de atividades concluídas dentro de um limite de duração (exemplo de outcome).,"“RBI 4.1 Activity outcomes: The fraction of activities completed with a given outcome (e.g. duration)… For activity duration, the RBI can be formalised as follows: InTime Activities …”"

Case Outcomes / Satisfactory Cases (RBI 4.2),Productivity,Percentual de casos com outcome satisfatório (ex.: feedback do cliente) em que o recurso atuou.,“RBI 4.2 Case outcomes: The fraction of cases completed … with a given outcome (e.g. customer feedback) in which a given resource was involved …”

Average Activity Duration (RBI 4.3),Productivity,Tempo médio das instâncias de uma atividade executadas pelo recurso.,“RBI 4.3 Average duration of a given activity: The average duration of instances of a given activity completed … by a given resource.”

Average Case Duration (RBI 4.4),Productivity,Duração média dos casos concluídos nos quais o recurso esteve envolvido.,“RBI 4.4 Average case duration: The average duration of cases completed … in which a given resource was involved.”

Average Customer Feedback (RBI 4.5),Productivity,Média das avaliações de clientes para casos nos quais o recurso participou.,“RBI 4.5 Average customer feedback: The average customer feedback for cases completed … in which a given resource was involved.”

Interactions Between Resources (RBI 5.1),Collaboration,Número de casos em que dois recursos específicos trabalharam juntos.,“RBI 5.1 Interactions between two given resources: The number of cases … in which two given resources were involved.”

Social Position (RBI 5.2),Collaboration,Fração de outros recursos com quem o recurso compartilhou casos dentro do período.,“RBI 5.2 Social position: The fraction of resources involved in the same cases with a given resource … with respect to the total number of resources active during the time slot.”
Delegations (RBI 5.3),Collaboration,Número de vezes que o recurso atribuiu uma tarefa a outro.,"“RBI 5.3 Delegations: The number of times when a resource, r, assigns a task to another resource …”"

Productivity Score via DEA,Productivity (global),Índice 0-1 calculado com DEA comparando outputs custeados e fronteira eficiente.,"“We calculated weekly productivity scores… The resulting productivity scores range from zero to one, with one being the maximum possible productivity.”"
Task Duration,Outcome (tarefa),Tempo individual de execução de cada tarefa
column2: usado como variável dependente em regressões.,“We then looked at the task perspective and checked the relationship between the duration of a task (dependent variable) and the experience …”

column1: Case Duration,Outcome (caso),Tempo total de processamento de um caso
column2: usado em indicadores e regressões.,“…checked the relationship between the number of employees involved in a case … and the case duration (dependent variable).”

column1: Number of Employees Involved in a Case,Contexto/Colaboração,Contado para avaliar influência sobre duração do caso.,“relationship between the number of employees involved in a case (independent variable) and the case duration …”

Experience (dias empregado),Input/Recurso,Dias de experiência do empregado usados como variável independente.,“Experience was estimated as the number of days the employee had been employed by the company at the time of task completion.”

Number of Tasks Completed per Week,Utilisation,Usado em regressão para avaliar impacto sobre duração média das tarefas.,“…checked how the number of tasks completed by an employee during a week (independent variable) affected the average duration of the tasks …”

Active Cases (input DEA),Input,Quantidade de casos ativos considerada como insumo opcional na análise DEA.,“the number of cases active during a given time slot (it should be considered as input if the number of active cases varies…)”

Working Hours (input DEA),Input,Horas de trabalho do recurso consideradas como insumo quando variáveis.,“the amount of time a resource works on a process during a given time slot … should be considered as an input if it varies …”
