Alcance_do_objetivo_(Goal_Reachability),Critério principal para avaliar se uma configuração de fluxo ou modelo de processo garante que o processo atinja sempre o estado-meta pretendido.,“identify configurations that assure the enacted process can always reach its goal” / “A process whose design ensures its goal will always be achieved … is termed valid”
Validade_do_Modelo,Usado como medida de desempenho de modelos de processo
column2: um modelo é considerado válido quando assegura o alcance do objetivo.,"“we consider only valid process models, i.e. those that ensure goal reachability”  "

column1: Erros_Lógicos_(Logical_Errors),Métrica negativa: quantidade/tipologia de falhas lógicas em modelos de processo.,"“splitting and merging structures are major sources of logical errors in process models (e.g., deadlocks and lack of synchronization [2][7][9])”  "
Deadlocks,Tipo específico de erro lógico monitorado como indicador de mau desempenho do modelo.,idem: “deadlocks” dentro da citação acima
Falta_de_Sincronização,Outro tipo específico de erro lógico monitorado como indicador de mau desempenho do modelo.,idem: “lack of synchronization” dentro da citação acima
Completude_do_Conjunto_de_Padrões,Avalia se os padrões de fluxo cobrem todos os comportamentos possíveis.,“no way exists yet to assure that a particular set of patterns is complete and non-redundant”
Não-Redundância_do_Conjunto_de_Padrões,Mede a ausência de sobreposição desnecessária entre padrões de fluxo.,mesma citação da linha anterior: “complete and non-redundant”

Sucesso_do_Processo,Definido como a capacidade de conduzir a sequência de estados instáveis a um estado estável (meta).,"“A successful process is a sequence of unstable states of the domain, leading to a stable state, which reflects the process goal.”  "

Progresso_Contínuo,Verifica se a configuração de controle permite que o processo sempre avance até a conclusão.,“combinations allowing goal reachability are marked… preventing a process from reaching its goal”
Qualidade_dos_Modelos_Projetados,Medida global de desempenho derivada
column2: espera-se que a abordagem melhore a qualidade dos modelos.,“may lead to an improved quality of designed processes.”

column1: Expressividade_da_Notação,Avalia se a notação usada consegue representar e distinguir adequadamente os diferentes comportamentos de processo.,“the available notation … usually not expressive enough for representing and distinguishing the different cases of possible process behaviors.”
Carmo et al. 2017 - An analysis of strategic goals and non-functional requirements in business process management.pdf
medidor,como_usado,evidencia_no_texto
Key Performance Indicator (KPI),representa quantitativamente metas estratégicas
column2: usado para monitorar o progresso e o sucesso de metas
column3: frequentemente vinculado a atividades de processos de negócio e medido em tempo-real,"“Most organizations represent strategic goals via KPI. KPIs can model quantitative indicators, which are measurable and useful for monitoring the progress and success of strategic goals.”"

column1: Balanced Scorecard (BSC),método/coleção de indicadores que pode agregar KPIs para avaliar desempenho estratégico,“Other techniques to model strategic goals are: … Balanced Scorecard (BSC) … although all these techniques are applicable to strategic goal modeling”

Business Activity Monitoring (BAM),ferramenta/abordagem que usa indicadores (KPIs) para monitorar em tempo real a execução de processos,“Most organizations represent strategic goals via KPI … Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) … useful for monitoring the progress and success of strategic goals”

Complex Event Processing (CEP),mecanismo de captura de eventos que alimenta KPIs para avaliar desempenho de processos,"“The notation used to model processes is BPMN, which is extended to express logic for both: processing complex events and evaluating related KPIs.”"

Metric (genérica),qualquer medida quantitativa influenciada pelo processo que afeta KPIs,"“Metrics varying during process execution can influence KPIs, and IT services can influence these metrics (e.g., ‘processing time’, ‘results accuracy’, ‘services availability’ etc.).”"
Processing time,"métrica operacional que influencia KPIs e, portanto, o desempenho do processo","“Metrics varying during process execution can influence KPIs … e.g., ‘processing time’ …”"
Results accuracy,métrica de qualidade que influencia KPIs do processo,"“Metrics varying during process execution can influence KPIs … e.g., ‘results accuracy’ …”"
Services availability,métrica de disponibilidade que influencia KPIs do processo,"“Metrics varying during process execution can influence KPIs … e.g., ‘services availability’ …”"

Order approval time,exemplo de KPI ligado a meta de negócio e limite de tempo de processo,"“Business analysts interpret the combination of KPIs and their target values as goals (e.g., ‘order approval time up to three days’).”"
Customer satisfaction,exemplo de meta estratégica que pode ser monitorada por KPI,“Examples of strategic goals are: ‘increasing customer satisfaction to 99% by 2020’ …”
Project execution time,exemplo de meta estratégica cuja redução pode ser mensurada por KPI,“Examples of strategic goals are: … ‘reducing project execution time by 25% over the next two years’.”
Target value,valor esperado de um KPI usado como limite de desempenho,"“KPIs are specified based on business goals matched with expected values, which are transformed into targets …”"
Deviation (acima/abaixo do alvo),variação do KPI em relação ao alvo que indica desempenho bom ou ruim,“… including delimitations of deviations below and above the expected value.”

Real-time KPI scores,medição on-line dos KPIs ligada à execução das atividades do processo,“This paper proposes a BPMN extension that incorporates BAM concepts which aims to represent KPIs’ real-time scores for process activities.”

Four predefined KPIs (BPSim),conjunto fixo de indicadores utilizados para avaliar desempenho em simulação de processos,“The method allows testing of process designs and quantified measurement of variations in operational performance through four pre-defined KPIs.”
Candiello et al. 2012 - Quality and impact monitoring for local eGovernment services.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal (trecho do artigo)

Perceived quality / Customer satisfaction,Avaliar o grau de satisfação dos cidadãos em relação aos serviços on-line (G2C).,"“perceived quality and effective impact of services (G2C layer)” (Seção 1, pág. 113)"

Impact indicators (social-economic),Mensurar os efeitos dos serviços de e-Government em indicadores sociais e econômicos da comunidade.,"“a positive impact of the offered services towards specific innovation indicators” (Seção 1, pág. 114)  e  “we extended the framework in order to include also data about the measurable effects that online services have on local communities.” (Seção 3.1, pág. 120)"
Static process metrics,Avaliar a complexidade intrínseca dos processos de back-office
column2: usadas para comparar/optimizar processos.,"“static metrics like cyclomatic or similar complexity measures” (Seção 3.2, pág. 121)"

column1: Cyclomatic complexity (exemplo de métrica estática),Mede a complexidade estrutural de um processo XPDL.,"“static process metrics, like cyclomatic … complexity measures” (Seção 3.2, pág. 121)"
Dynamic process indicators,Medição em tempo real da execução de processos
column2: compõem a ‘efetividade’ do serviço.,"“dynamic process effectiveness measures, mainly time of transactions and successful completion of inspected processes” (Seção 3.2, pág. 121)"

column1: Time of transactions,Tempo gasto em cada fase do processo
column2: usado para detectar atrasos que afetam o cidadão.,Mesmo trecho acima: “mainly time of transactions …”

column1: Successful completion rate,Percentual de processos concluídos com sucesso
column2: avalia qualidade do serviço.,Mesmo trecho acima: “… and successful completion of inspected processes”

column1: Número de execuções do processo,Indicador quantitativo para avaliar carga e relevância do processo.,"“Quantitative indicators (like the number of times a process is executed …)” (Seção 3.2, pág. 121)"
Número de funcionários alocados,Indica recursos humanos consumidos por processo
column2: auxilia análise de eficiência.,"“… or the number of staff members assigned to it” (Seção 3.2, pág. 121)"

column1: Technical QoS measures (responsiveness, scalability),Monitorar desempenho do portal e capacidade de escalar sob carga.,"“technical measures should be used to monitor the responsiveness and scalability of software implementations and deployment systems.” (Findings, pág. 113)"
Responsiveness (tempo de resposta),Tempo para o sistema responder ao usuário
column2: parte de performance.,Mesmo trecho acima.

column1: Scalability,Capacidade de manter desempenho com aumento de carga de usuários/processos.,Mesmo trecho acima.

System / Network / Software level KPIs,Conjunto de indicadores técnicos coletados pelo eMon para operação e manutenção.,"“system-, network- and software-level key performance indicators.” (Seção 3, pág. 118)"

Log statistics (erros, exceções),Contagem e classificação de erros para gestão de operação.,"“operation area, to maintain information about the state of the services… log4j … information at various levels of severity that the loggers can transmit” (Seção 3.3, pág. 122)"

Execution monitoring (response time via JAMon),Mede tempos de execução e identifica gargalos de performance.,"“performance area, to maintain information about the performance in production… the OS tool Jamon was identified.” (Seção 3.3, pág. 122)"

Application scalability indicator,Verifica se a aplicação mantém desempenho quando cresce o número de usuários.,Mesmo parágrafo: “… identify possible execution bottlenecks and to verify services scalability …”
Usage statistics (hits, views),Quantificar acessos aos portais
column2: analisar padrões de uso.,"“collect information about users accessing the portals: hits, views …” (Seção 3.3, pág. 122)"

column1: User profiling (robots/worms, search keywords),Diferenciar tipos de visitantes e origens de tráfego para segurança e otimização.,"“… robots and worm accesses, search keywords to reach the sites” (Seção 3.3, pág. 122)"
Kang and Han 2008 - A Business Activity Monitoring System Supporting Real-Time Business Performance Management.pdf
Performance_Measure,How_It_Is_Used_In_Text,Evidence_In_Text

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Generic performance measures that BAM must capture and present in real-time to support business performance management.,“Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) which provides real-time access to key performance indicators is one of core elements for the real-time performance management.”
Monthly of Supply (MOS),Chosen KPI to monitor sales inventory efficiency
column2: calculated continuously and shown on dashboards by region with color-coded status.,"“‘Monthly of Supply (MOS)’ KPI showing the level of the current sales inventory is important … In the BAM system, MOS is selected as a KPI for real-time performance measurement.”"

column1: Present Sales Inventory,Numerator used in the MOS formula that represents current stock level.,“MOS is the ratio of the present sales inventory with the average sales by month as follows: MOS = Present Sales Inventory / Average Sales by Month”
Average Sales by Month,Denominator used in the MOS formula
column2: represents demand pace.,“MOS is the ratio of the present sales inventory with the average sales by month as follows: MOS = Present Sales Inventory / Average Sales by Month”

column1: MOS Category (Normal / Boundary / Abnormal),Derived indicator that classifies MOS values into three colored bands to ease interpretation.,"“In order to intuitively show the status of MOS, MOS level is displayed by one of three categories (normal-boundary-abnormal).”"
Number of Equipment Problems by Department,Monitors distribution of equipment issues across functional areas
column2: presented as a pie chart.,"“On the left upper part, the numbers of equipment problems by department such as press, body, paint, assembly, and engine shop are displayed by the pie chart.”"

column1: Number of Equipment Problems by Plant,Tracks quantity of problems at each manufacturing site
column2: shown as a bar chart.,"“On the left below part, the numbers of equipment problems by plant are presented by the vertical bar chart.”"

column1: Number of In-Process Problems per Activity,Shows workload/state of each step in the equipment problem management process
column2: displayed as a bar chart.,"“On the middle upper part, the numbers of the in-process problems of each activity are presented by the vertical bar chart.”"

column1: Number of Delayed Activities,Flags activities still open 48 h after start
column2: listed on dashboard for corrective action.,“An uncompleted activity within 48 hours after the start time is categorized as a delay activity.”

column1: Number of Alert Processes,Counts processes that exceed their planned finish date
column2: listed for management attention.,“…and a process that is not completed until the planed finished date is classified to an alert process.”

column1: Total Time for Execution of Equipment Problem Management Process,Overall cycle time of the process
column2: targeted for reduction through real-time monitoring.,"“By using this dashboard, … and the total time for execution of this process can be reduced.”"

column1: Laumer et al. 2015 - The impact of business process management and appli ... acking systems on recruiting process performance - an empirical study.pdf
Performance_measure,Usage_description,Evidence_text_excerpt
Process time,"Used to assess efficiency of recruiting process
column2: includes time-to-hire, time to publish a job ad, time to first interview, cycle time of each step.","“Process time is defined as the period of time between identifying and filling an open position… also widely known as time-to-hire. The cycle times of single process steps include the time span between identifying an open position and posting a job ad, the time span between posting a job ad and receiving the first applications, and the time spent on the internal applicant-tracking process.”"

column1: Process cost,"Total monetary expenditure for recruiting
column2: expressed as cost-per-hire, cost per application, costs of managing applications, cost of job ads, etc.",“Process cost … is defined as the aggregate cost incurred in hiring a new employee. … companies frequently trace the cost of and calculate the cost advantage of online job ads compared to offline job ads … estimate and trace the cost structures for the internal applicant-tracking process as well as the single cost for every tracked application.”

column1: Process quality,"Measures how well the process delivers desirable candidates and information
column2: includes overall quality of hired candidates, quality ratio YoY, quality of applicant data.",“Process quality typically refers both to the quality of the applicant as well as to how satisfied stakeholders are with the newly hired candidate and with the entire recruiting process… indicators of process quality is an increase in the quality of applicant data.”

column1: Stakeholder satisfaction,"Degree to which different stakeholder groups (hiring managers, HR managers, applicants, top management) are pleased with recruiting.","“The final quality-related performance dimension is stakeholder satisfaction with the overall recruiting process. Stakeholders include company employees, applicants, operating departments, HR executives and top management.”"
Cost-per-hire,Specific derivative of Process cost
column2: average cost to fill one vacancy.,Mentioned under process cost dimension: “… sometimes referred to as cost-per-hire.”

column1: Cost per application,Derivative cost metric for each application processed.,“… as well as the single cost for every tracked application.”
Costs of managing applications,Sub-cost element tracking internal handling expenses.,“… trace the cost structures for the internal applicant tracking process …”
Cost of job ads (online vs offline),Used to compare channel efficiency and reduce expenses.,"“… calculate the cost advantage of online job ads compared to offline job ads (e.g., in newspapers).”"
Time-to-hire,Key cycle-time KPI from vacancy identification to filled position.,Same sentence as Process time definition above.
Time from vacancy to job-ad posting,Granular cycle-time KPI.,Same sentence as Process time definition above.

Time from job-ad to hiring decision,Granular cycle-time KPI.,“… time span between posting a job ad and receiving the first applications …” and “… reduced the time between posting a job ad and making the final hiring decision …” (measurement items).
Time to first interview,Granular cycle-time KPI.,Measurement item: “We have reduced the time between identifying a vacancy and holding the first job interviews…”
Talent-on-time,ATS/BP controlling KPI measuring timely delivery of suitable candidates.,“Such key performance indicators include ‘talent-on-time’ …”
Brand strength,KPI for employer branding effectiveness.,"“… key performance indicators include ‘talent-on-time’, ‘brand strength’ …”"
Offer acceptance,KPI tracking proportion of accepted job offers.,“… key performance indicators include … ‘offer acceptance’ …”
Quality of new hires,Outcome KPI for selection effectiveness.,“… key performance indicators include … ‘quality of new hires’.”

Number of job-ad page visits,Web-analytics KPI to monitor attraction step.,“… the number of the job ad page visits and the number of online applications filled out completely by applicants can be monitored.”
Number of complete online applications,Web-analytics KPI for conversion in online channel.,Same sentence as above.
Average views per completed application,Efficiency KPI per media channel.,“… helps the company to calculate the average number of views needed per filled-out application for each media channel.”

Number of visitors to career website,Marketing KPI used in case study to evidence improvements.,“The company was able to realize value potential in personnel marketing. The number of visitors to the career website … increased significantly…”
Impressions per job ad,Reach KPI demonstrating marketing effectiveness.,“… and the impressions per job ad increased significantly.”
Cost of open positions unfilled,Opportunity cost KPI tracked in controlling.,“Companies might gather information on the cost of open positions not filled …”
Cost of each individual process step,Granular cost-tracking KPI for controlling.,“… as well as on the cost of each individual process step.”
Candidate experience index,Qualitative KPI collected during process to guide improvements.,“… companies might also evaluate the candidate experience at individual process steps.”

Reasons for offer rejection,Diagnostic metric to reduce sunk costs and improve satisfaction.,“… might also ask candidates for reasons why they rejected a contract offer as a basis for making changes … to decrease process cost as fewer candidates turn down offers …”

Indicadores financeiros,"avaliar desempenho social e fontes de financiamento em fase de 'Adjustment, measuring'",“Several types of financial indicators and statistical methods can be expedient.”
Métodos estatísticos,medir o desempenho da sociedade e apoiar avaliação de fontes de recursos,“Several types of financial indicators and statistical methods can be expedient.”
KRAFT-index,instrumento sugerido para monitorar impacto/ desempenho na fase de implementação e avaliação,Figura 1: “KRAFT-index” aparece como método possível
column2: mais adiante: “KRAFT-index” citado entre métricas.

column1: CCI-index,índice citado como métrica de performance durante implementação/ avaliação,Figura 1: lista “CCI-index” como método de suporte/medição.
PMT,utilizado como métrica de performance e monitoramento na fase de impacto social,Figura 1 inclui “PMT” entre métodos de avaliação.
SROI analysis,mede retorno social sobre o investimento
column2: avalia impacto de inovação social,Figura 1: “SROI analysis” listado em ‘Social impact’.

column1: IRIS,padrão de reporte de impacto
column2: serve para medir desempenho de projetos sociais,Figura 1: “IRIS” listado sob ‘Social impact’.

column1: SRS,Social Reporting Standard
column2: métrica de desempenho/impacto social,Figura 1: “SRS” listado como ferramenta de ‘Social impact’.

column1: Coeficiente de Concordância de Kendall (W),mede concordância entre rankings dos avaliadores
column2: usado para avaliar consistência dos pesos dos fatores de sucesso,“Kendall’s coefficient of concordance was calculated… W is equal to 1 in the case of full agreement.”

column1: Valor da distribuição qui-quadrado (χ²),teste de significância associado a W
column2: avalia se concordância é estatisticamente diferente de zero,“The W significance test is necessary… value of χ2 distribution (Formula 6) and its comparison to the threshold.”

column1: Consistency Ratio (CR),mede consistência das comparações paritárias no AHP
column2: usado para validar matriz de julgamento,"“The consistency ratio is appropriate… If the value of CR converges to zero, the consistency is presumable.”  "

column1: Consistency Index (CI),componente do cálculo do CR no AHP
column2: indica inconsistência interna,Fórmula 3: “CR = CI / RI” — CI aparece como parte do medidor.

column1: Random Index (RI),denominador do CR
column2: valor empírico usado para avaliar consistência,Fórmula 3 menciona “RI” como parte do cálculo da consistência.

column1: Vetores de pesos (w),resultados numéricos que expressam a importância relativa dos fatores
column2: usados para ranquear desempenho dos fatores de sucesso,“Table 2 illustrates the weight vectors… The ranking of factors… is determined based on the calculated weight vectors.”

column1: Análise de sensibilidade/estabilidade,avaliar impacto de fatores duros e robustez dos resultados
column2: citada como forma de medir influência dos fatores,“Most of the hard factors can be measured… with different types of analysis such as sensitivity analysis.”

column1: Lamghari et al. 2018 - A set of indicators for BPM life cycle improvement.pdf
Indicador,Como o texto indica que ele é utilizado,Evidência no texto

Relevance,"Métrica de design usada para verificar se o processo modelado está alinhado com o negócio da empresa, passo inicial da lógica (Relevance → Correctness → …).",“We start by defining the Business of the company (Relevance)… we propose the order of priority as … (Relevance Æ Correctness Æ …)”

Correctness,Métrica de design que confirma a sintaxe correta do processo antes de outras avaliações.,"“…that leads to check the syntax of the process (Correctness). Once this Correctness is verified, it become easy to understand the language…”  "
Clarity,Métrica de design que assegura que o diagrama seja compreensível.,“…it become easy to understand the language representing the process (Clarity).”
Completeness,Métrica de design que garante que todas as partes do processo estejam especificadas.,“…we can complete the process throughout its implementation (Completeness)…”
Consistency,Métrica de design usada para checar se o processo é coerente com a realidade representada.,"“…then, we focus on representing it relatively to reality (Consistency)…”  "
Operation time,Métrica de análise calculada como Setup time + Run time para avaliar a duração de uma operação.,“Operation time : Setup time + Run time”
Setup time,Tempo necessário para trocar de uma atividade para outra
column2: componente do Operation time.,“Setup time (the length of time required to change-over from one process/activity to another)”

column1: Run time,Período em que a atividade está em execução
column2: componente do Operation time.,“Run Time (is when a process is running …)”

column1: Cycle time,"Tempo médio sucessivo entre saídas de unidades
column2: usado em várias fases (análise, execução, KPI).",“Cycle Time : is the average successive time between completions of successive units.”

column1: Throughput time,Tempo médio de um item atravessar todo o processo (flow time).,“Throughput time : Average time for a unit to move through the system …”
Throughput rate,Unidades processadas por unidade de tempo
column2: calculado como 1 / Cycle time.,“Throughput rate : 1 / cycle time”

column1: Efficiency / Process Cycle Efficiency,Percentual de tempo de valor agregado sobre o ciclo total
column2: mede desperdício.,“Process Cycle Efficiency: This is a measure of how much waste is present in your process.”

column1: Productivity,Relação entre saída produzida e recursos utilizados.,“Productivity: the ratio between the amount produced and amount of resources used in production.”
Utilization,Percentual de tempo em que um recurso está ativo versus disponível.,“Utilization : Is the ratio of the time that a resource is activated relative to the time that it is available …”
Capacity,Taxa máxima de produção de um recurso ou processo.,“Capacity : maximum output of a process or resource measured in units/time.”
System uptime,Métrica tecnológica que mede a disponibilidade do sistema na fase de execução.,“System Uptime   According to the company's measures”
Network uptime,Mede a disponibilidade da rede que suporta o processo.,“Network Uptime   According to the company's measures”
Support-application uptime,Verifica a disponibilidade de aplicações de suporte.,“Support application Uptime  According to the company's measures”

Melhoria nos processos de negócio,Indicador de sucesso pós-implementação do ERP,"“...once they are implemented successfully, significant improvement in business processes...”  "
Comunicação e interação usuários-clientes,Indicador de sucesso pós-implementação do ERP,“...significant improvement in ... communication and interaction between users and customers...”
Planejamento de produção,Indicador de sucesso pós-implementação do ERP,“...In addition to better production scheduling ...”
Redução dos custos de manufatura,Indicador de sucesso pós-implementação do ERP,“...and reduction in manufacturing costs.”
Redução do tempo de ciclo de documentos,Indicador de sucesso pós-implementação do ERP,“...management can observe reduction of cycle times of documents ...”

Confirmação,Fator que influencia a utilidade percebida,“...perceived usefulness is affected by confirmation ...”

medidor_de_performance,como_e_usado_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto
Fitness,mede o quanto o modelo reproduz o comportamento real
column2: utilizado para avaliar modelos descobertos e na checagem de conformidade
column3: valor varia de 0 a 1,"""A model with good fitness allows for most of the behavior seen in the event log... A model has perfect fitness if all traces in the log can be replayed by the model from beginning to end.""  "

column1: Cost-based Fitness,variante de fitness que leva em conta custos diferentes para desvios durante a checagem de conformidade,"""Conformance checking using cost-based fitness analysis.""  "

Proporção de casos que encaixam,"percentual de casos do log que podem ser executados completamente pelo modelo, usado como medida simples de conformidade","""for example, one can quantify differences (e.g., “80% of the observed cases are possible according to the model”)""  "
Tokens emprestados (‘borrowed tokens’),nº de tokens adicionados para forçar a execução de transições durante o replay
column2: usado para calcular fitness,"""Simply “borrow tokens,” force the transition to fire anyway, and record the problem. In the end, the number of “borrowed tokens” and the number of “tokens left behind” indicate the fitness level.""  "

column1: Tokens restantes (‘tokens left behind’),nº de tokens que sobram sem ser consumidos no final do replay
column2: também compõe o cálculo de fitness,idem citação anterior

column1: Simplicidade,princípio de que o modelo mais simples que explica o log é preferível
column2: usada na avaliação de qualidade de modelos,"""Obviously, the simplest model that can explain the behavior seen in the log is the best model.""  "

column1: Precisão,mede se o modelo permite ‘comportamento em excesso’
column2: utilizada para detectar underfitting,"""A model is precise if it does not allow for “too much” behavior. Clearly, the “flower model” lacks precision.""  "

column1: Generalização,avalia se o modelo não é excessivamente específico aos exemplos do log
column2: usada para evitar overfitting,"""A model should also generalize and not restrict behavior to just the examples seen in the log.""  "

column1: Média (average),estatística aplicada aos tempos entre eventos para identificar gargalos e desempenho,"""compute basic statistics such as averages, variances, and confidence intervals.""  "
Variância,estatística de dispersão usada conjuntamente à média sobre tempos entre eventos,mesma citação acima
Intervalo de confiança,estimativa de precisão estatística sobre médias/variações de tempo,mesma citação acima

Diferença de tempo entre eventos,medida direta de desempenho temporal entre atividades causais,"""Simply measure the time difference between causally related events ... identify the main bottlenecks.""  "
Tempo de espera (waiting time),tempo que o caso permanece entre atividades
column2: usado para localizar gargalos,mesma citação acima

column1: Tempo de processamento/throughput time,duração total do caso
column2: usada para análises de desempenho e extensão do modelo,"""extend the model to show bottlenecks, service levels, and throughput times.""  "

column1: Nível de serviço (service level),indicador derivado de tempos (p.ex. prazos cumpridos) adicionado ao modelo durante a realimentação,mesma citação acima
Gargalos (bottlenecks),locais no processo com maiores tempos de espera
column2: identificados via análise de timestamps,mesma citação acima

column1: Tempo de serviço (service time),duração de execução atribuída a recursos
column2: correlacionado com carga de trabalho,"""analyze resource performance (e.g., the relation between workload and service times).""  "

column1: Carga de trabalho (workload),volume de casos/atividades atribuídos a um recurso
column2: correlacionado com tempo de serviço,mesma citação acima

column1: Fluxo de trabalho/flow time,tempo de fluxo usado por ferramentas comerciais para relatórios de desempenho,"""All systems take the timestamps in the event log into account to be able to provide performance-related information, that is, flow times and bottlenecks.""  "

Frequência de eventos/atividades,contagem usada no Heuristic Miner para construir o grafo de dependências e descobrir o ‘backbone’ do processo,"""The algorithm first builds a dependency graph based on the frequencies of activities and the number of times one activity is followed by another activity.""  "
Fitness numérico exemplo (0.98876214),valor concreto de fitness usado como evidência de boa conformidade em estudo de caso,"""The fitness of the model and log at the event level is 0.98876214."""
Satyal et al. 2017 - AB-BPM - Performance-driven instance routing for business process improvement.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence from the paper

Process Performance Indicator (PPI),Generic label for any performance measure on which the routing algorithm bases its decisions.,“The routing decision is guided by the observed results for registered performance metrics of each version at runtime.”
User satisfaction,"Chosen PPI in the synthetic experiment
column2: calculated from cost, completion time and outcome
column3: used as the reward fed to the routing algorithm.","“As PPI we simulate the user satisfaction, here calculated as a combination of cost, completion time, and result of the process execution.”"

column1: Cost,Component of user-satisfaction calculation and compared directly between versions (median / mean cost).,Table 2 ‘Cost model of the activities’
column2: Table 4 ‘Median cost’ column.

column1: Completion time / Duration / Execution time,"Core performance metric
column2: shorter times are treated as better results, drive user satisfaction and rewards
column3: also reported as mean and median values.","“The basic rationale is, the shorter and cheaper, the better.”  – and Table 4 ‘Median duration’ / ‘Mean duration’."

column1: Turnaround time,Illustrative metric for process-improvement motivation (loan approval case).,“The EB improved their loan approval process by cutting its turnaround time down from one week to a few hours.”

Revenue,Example of a business-level performance metric in traditional web A/B tests.,"“…draw conclusions about the effectiveness of one version over the other, for instance in the form of increased revenue from higher click-through rates.”"
Click-through rate,Concrete web-analytics indicator mentioned when explaining classical A/B testing.,“…increased revenue from higher click-through rates.”

Cumulative satisfaction score,Aggregate of user-satisfaction rewards used to compare alternative routing algorithms during algorithm selection.,“We have found that LinUCB produced the highest cumulative satisfaction score throughout the experiments.”
Reward,"Scalar value supplied to the multi-armed-bandit algorithm
column2: derived from the chosen PPI (e.g., user satisfaction or duration).",“The reward for routing algorithm can be designed to use a PPI like user satisfaction.”

column1: Mean duration,Derived statistic used to compare versions after A/B tests.,Table 4 ‘Mean duration’ and Table 7 ‘Mean duration’ columns.
Median duration,Derived statistic used to compare versions
column2: basis for deciding the better process version.,Table 4 ‘Median duration’ and Table 7 ‘Median duration’ columns.

column1: Median user satisfaction,Derived statistic reported to characterise performance of each version.,Table 4 ‘Median user satisfaction’ column.
Median cost,Derived statistic reported to compare monetary performance between versions.,Table 4 ‘Median cost’ column.
Time to complete a process instance,Target metric in real-world evaluation
column2: lower values mean better performance.,“Better performance here is equated to shorter time to complete a process instance.”

Search performance,"Avaliar o impacto dos clusters de processos sobre a recuperação de informação
column2: o método ""significantly boosted search performance"".",“…where from it could find process clusters that significantly boosted search performance.” (Abstract)

column1: Degree of similarity,Mede quão parecidos são processos ou peças de informação auxiliares
column2: usado para mostrar que conteúdos não-processo são mais similares dentro dos clusters.,“…we empirically prove that the degree of similarity of ancillary non-process information pieces is higher within process clusters.” (Contributions)

column1: θ (similarity score),"Função quantitativa de similaridade entre conteúdos (passos, listas, tabelas, documentos)
column2: base para decidir se dois elementos são considerados equivalentes.","Ex.: “θ(si,sj) represent the similarity score of two single contents (strings)…”, “di is similar to dj, denoted by di≈dj, if θdd(di,dj) ≥ φ.” (Sec. 4.3.1/4.3.2)  "

column1: Precision,Mede a proporção de ligações PD–PF corretas dentre as geradas pelo algoritmo de ligação.,"“We have manually verified the validity of the matches… precision to be 48%...”, “Exact string comparison… we get 100% precision.” (Sec. 5.1, Tabela 1)  "
Recall,"Mede a proporção de ligações corretas recuperadas
column2: citado como métrica esperada, mas não calculada por falta do total de verdade-terreno.","“Since we do not know how many PDs had PFs in the collection for sure, recall cannot be calculated.” (Sec. 5.1)  "

column1: Candidate matches,Contagem de pares PD–PF cujo score ultrapassa o limiar mínimo
column2: indicador da amplitude da busca de correspondências.,"“Here, candidate matches refers to the number of PD-PF matches that were above minimum threshold to be considered candidates for links.” (Sec. 5.1)  "

column1: %Match,Percentual de passos coincidentes entre PD e PF na normalização automática.,Tabela 2 cabeçalho: “%Match (Name) … %Match (Name+Role)” (Sec. 5.2)
Average similarity,Média dos valores θ calculada dentro dos clusters ou sobre todo o conjunto
column2: usada para mostrar benefício dos clusters.,Tabela 3 colunas “Avg. in Cluster” e “Avg. Overall” (Sec. 5.4)

column1: Similarity boost (%),Percentual de aumento da similaridade média dentro do cluster em comparação com o geral
column2: mede ganho obtido pelos clusters.,Tabela 3 coluna “Similarity Boost (in %)” (Sec. 5.4)

column1: Number of pair-wise similar processes,Contagem de pares de documentos cuja similaridade excede o limiar
column2: estatística para qualificar o agrupamento.,“Number of pair-wise similar processes = 266” (Sec. 5.3)

column1: Number of clusters found,Total de grupos de processos similares obtidos pelo algoritmo de fecho transitivo.,“Number of clusters found = 23” (Sec. 5.3)
Range of cluster sizes,Tamanho mínimo e máximo dos clusters
column2: caracteriza a distribuição dos grupos gerados.,"“Range of cluster sizes = (2, 21)” (Sec. 5.3)"

Flight on-time rate,Example of an operational performance measure

Number of Customers,One of several restaurant KPIs listed for real-time monitoring,"""There are a number of performance measures for monitoring a restaurant business, for example, Number of Customers ..."""
Seat Utilization,Restaurant KPI defined as the percentage of tables occupied by guests

Medidor ou Modelo,Tipo/Nível,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal do texto

Global Reporting Initiative (GRI),Modelo organizacional – indicadores operacionalizados,"Exemplo de modelo com indicadores já padronizados, permitindo benchmarking setorial","""For instance, The Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) [4] offers a voluntary reporting framework that contains goals and operationalized indicators with respect to environmental but also economic and social sustainability…"""

Composite Sustainable Development Index (ICSD),Modelo organizacional – indicadores operacionalizados,"Índice composto por três sub-índices econômicos, ambientais e sociais","""…the Composite Sustainable Development Index (I_CSD) [10] which is composed of the economic sub-index (IS,1), the environmental sub-index (IS,2) and the social sub-index (IS,3)."""
Economic sub-index (IS,1),Indicador organizacional derivado,"Parte do ICSD, mensura pilar econômico","""…composed of the economic sub-index (IS,1)…"""
Environmental sub-index (IS,2),Indicador organizacional derivado,"Parte do ICSD, mensura pilar ambiental","""…the environmental sub-index (IS,2)…"""
Social sub-index (IS,3),Indicador organizacional derivado,"Parte do ICSD, mensura pilar social","""…and the social sub-index (IS,3)."""

Balanced Score Card (BSC),Modelo organizacional – indicadores não-operacionalizados,Framework de quatro perspectivas que pode ser estendido para sustentabilidade,"""For instance, the Balanced Score Card (BSC) provides four perspectives…"""

Sustainability Balanced Scorecard (SBSC),Modelo organizacional – indicadores não-operacionalizados,Versão da BSC que integra objetivos ambientais estratégicos,"""…possible to develop a variant, the Sustainability BSC (SBSC), that integrates strategically relevant environmental goals [12]."""

column2: indicadores definidos pela própria empresa,"""Similarly, ISO 14001:2015 [7] provides a framework for environmental management in organizations."""

column1: Framework de emissão de carbono de Ghose et al. CO₂ por instância de processo,Indicador de processo – operacionalizado,"Mede emissões de carbono de cada execução do processo, podendo ter meta zero","""…can be measured in CO2 per process instance with a target value of zero…"""

gCO₂eq/kWh,Indicador de processo – operacionalizado,Unidade para quantificar emissões relacionadas ao consumo de energia,"""…grams of CO2 equivalent per kilowatt hour of generation, [gCO2eq/kWh] [3]"""

Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE),Indicador de processo – não-operacionalizado no texto,Listada como KPI verde para data centers/processos,"""…list of ‘Green KPIs’ at the business process level (e.g. Power Usage Effectiveness…"""

Data Center Infrastructure Efficiency (DCiE),Indicador de processo – não-operacionalizado no texto,KPI verde para eficiência de infraestrutura de data center,"""…Power Usage Effectiveness, Data Center Infrastructure Efficiency…"""

Data Center Energy Productivity (DCeP),Indicador de processo – não-operacionalizado no texto,KPI verde para produtividade energética de data centers,"""…Data Center Energy Productivity) without any operationalization of the measurements."""

‘Green KPIs’ (genérico),Conjunto de indicadores de processo – não-operacionalizado,Categoria geral de indicadores ambientais para processos,"""…presents a list of ‘Green KPIs’ at the business process level…"""

Sustainability (como dimensão de otimização),Indicador/conceito de processo – não-operacionalizado,Utilizado como critério qualitativo de otimização de processos,"""…business processes should be optimized in light of ‘sustainability’. """

Lookman et al. 2022 - Do Market Orientation and Supply Chain Relationship Matter in Building Innovative Capability in Trucking Business.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Financial performance,Componente da variável “company performance” e resultado ligado à capacidade de inovação,“Company performance consists of financial [35][51][22][1] …”
Non-financial performance,Outro componente da variável “company performance”,“Company performance consists of … and non-financial [10[18][27] performances”
Return on Assets (ROA),Métrico financeiro específico citado como positivamente relacionado à capacidade de inovação,“…including financial performance [8][14] and ROA [44]”
Firm performance,Medida genérica de desempenho utilizada em estudos anteriores e no modelo conceitual,“Previous research also shows a positive relationship with firm performance [47][40][56][6]”

Innovation performance,Usado como indicador de desempenho (taxa de crescimento) e como resultado dos casos,“3. The company is experiencing a growth rate of innovation performance” / “growth of innovation performance”
Annual sales growth rate,Indicador objetivo de desempenho avaliado nos últimos três anos,“1. The company experienced an annual sales growth rate over the past three years”
Growth rate of new products,Mede o aumento de novos produtos lançados,“2. The company experienced a growth rate of new products over the past three years”
Growth in product performance,Indicador de melhoria de desempenho de produto,“4. The company is experiencing growth in product performance”
Revenue growth,Usado nos resultados dos casos para indicar melhor performance financeira,"“company experienced increased revenue, products and services in the last three years”  "
Sales of products and services,Utilizado para evidenciar aumento de vendas e serviço,“performance has increased sales of products and services over the last three years”
Product and service innovation growth,Resultado associado à capacidade de inovação,“growth of product and service innovation is also on the rise”
Product and service performance,Outro resultado observado nos casos,“growth in product and service performance.”
Overall performance growth,Expressão de melhoria global (ex.: +15%),"“company experienced 15% performance growth, even though it was affected by the pandemic”"
Verenich et al. 2019 - Survey and Cross-benchmark Comparison of Remaining Time Prediction Methods in Business Process Monitoring.pdf
Earliness,Indica quão cedo (em que prefixo) a previsão atinge o nível desejado
column2: complementa a accuracy.,"“Indeed, in order to be useful, a prediction should be accurate and should be made early on ...”  "

column1: Mean Absolute Error (MAE),Erro médio absoluto usado como métrica principal de precisão nos experimentos.,"“Hence, we use MAE to measure the error in predicting the remaining time.”  "

Root Mean Square Error (RMSE),"Apresentado como alternativa para avaliar erro contínuo, embora não utilizado nos testes finais.",“Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) … where RMSE would be very sensitive to such outliers.”
Mean Percentage Error (MAPE),Outra métrica citada para erro contínuo
column2: descartada por ser instável quando o tempo restante é próximo de zero.,“Mean Percentage Error (MAPE) … the remaining time can be very close to zero … thus MAPE would be skewed in such situations.”

column1: Prediction Error,Valor absoluto da diferença entre valor real e previsto
column2: base para MAE e RMSE.,“MAE is defined as the arithmetic mean of the prediction errors …”

column1: Weighted MAE,MAE médio ponderado pela frequência relativa dos prefixos de mesmo tamanho
column2: usado na Tabela 10.,“The averages are weighted by the relative frequency of prefixes with that prefix …”

column1: Standard Deviation,Dispersão da métrica (ex.: MAE)
column2: apresentada juntamente com a média para indicar variabilidade.,"“Table 10 reports the prediction accuracy, averaged … together with its standard deviation.”  "

column1: Coefficient of Variation (CV),Mede heterogeneidade do comprimento e duração dos casos
column2: usado para caracterizar logs e explicar desempenho.,“average case length … and its coefficient of variation (CV) …”

column1: Normalized MAE,MAE dividido pela duração média dos casos para tornar comparações entre logs possíveis.,"“for each log, we divide the average MAE values … by the mean case duration for that log.”  "
Standard Deviation of Normalized MAE,Dispersão da MAE normalizada
column2: ilustrada na Figura 9(b).,“Figure 9(b) … standard deviation of normalized MAE across case lifetime.”

column1: Mean Ranking,Posição média de cada método na comparação global
column2: usada como indicador de desempenho relativo.,“we plot their mean rankings achieved across all datasets in Figure 8.”

column1: 95% Confidence Interval,"Intervalo de confiança associado ao mean ranking, indicando incerteza da métrica.",“Error bars indicate the 95% confidence interval.”
p-value,Valor de significância estatística do teste de Friedman
column2: indica se diferenças de desempenho são relevantes.,“The complete set of experiments indicate statistically significant differences according to this test ( p=6.914×10−8).”

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Indicadores que os gestores precisam monitorar para apoiar a reestruturação de processos de negócio,“...desenvolver um framework para … monitorar key performance indicators (KPIs) enquanto melhora as práticas de reestruturação de processos de negócio.”

Service quality,Indicador de qualidade do serviço a ser monitorado,Mesmo trecho acima.

Cross-organisational performance,Desempenho conjunto entre organizações afetado pela falta de visibilidade das redes,Mesmo trecho acima.

column1: Média da fila de espera (average waiting queue),Complementa o tempo de espera para medir quantidade média de chamados pendentes

column1: Disparidade máxima na média do tempo de espera,Mede aderência do modelo à realidade após implantação
column2: usada para avaliar precisão da simulação.,“Maximum disparities in average problem wait time … have been 8%.”

column1: Disparidade máxima na média do comprimento da fila,Outro indicador de aderência entre simulação e operação real.,“Maximum disparities in … average queue length have been 8%.”

Amplitude de incerteza/intervalo de confiança (90 % confidence interval),Quantifica erro amostral das saídas do modelo e define comprimento mínimo de corrida da simulação.,“Run lengths of 90 work-days … produced results significant at the 10 % level (90 % confidence intervals). Uncertainties at this confidence level were small …”

Choi et al. 2013 - Simulation-based operation management of outpatient departments in university hospitals.pdf
Performance Measure,How it is used in the text,Evidence in the text
Waiting time (general),"Main indicator of service quality
column2: long waits trigger distrust, stress and pressure
column3: system aims to predict and reduce it.","“long waiting times for patients”, “…informs patients of their expected waiting time in order to lower the workload and pressure on clinic staff…”  "

column1: Micro waiting time,Specific sub-type: time from patient arrival until called by doctor

column1: Macro waiting time,Specific sub-type: delay between referral and actual specialist visit
column2: over-booking used to mitigate it.,“…the macro waiting time of the delay between the referral date … and the actual date of the specialist treatment. The macro waiting time tends to be longer…”

column2: system tries to minimise it.,“…has led to long waiting times for patients and overtime work for clinic staff.”
column3: “…overtime sessions are becoming increasingly common and even normal.”

column1: Congestion (waiting room / clinic),Measure of crowding

column4: “…already overloaded session becoming more congested…”

column1: Patient distrust,"Outcome measure of poor performance (long waits, invisibility).",“…patients’ distrust of the procedures for treating outpatients increases…”

column1: Doctor pressure (to shorten treatment time),Human-factor measure

column1: Quality of service,Global performance criterion maximised by the approach

column3: “…improving the quality of service regarding the waiting time and congestion.”

Barba et al. 2013 - Automatic generation of optimized business process models from constraint-based specifications.pdf
PerformanceMeasure,HowItIsUsed,TextualEvidence

Overall Completion Time (OCT),Principal objective-function to be minimised when generating the enactment plan and later reported in the evaluation tables.,"“…minimizing the overall completion time (OCT), i.e. time needed to complete all process instances which were planned for a certain period” (p. 4)  /  “OCT for the generated optimised enactment plan.” (Table 3, p. 40)"
Completion Time (generic),General temporal measure that is aimed to be minimised for individual enactment plans.,"“…minimization of completion time.” (Abstract, p. 1)"

Cycle Time,Example of a temporal performance measure that can be optimised for a single instance.,“…how well different performance objective functions … like minimizing cycle time can be achieved.” (p. 9)

Response Time,Travel-agency case uses the end-time of the Client-Report activity as response-time to be minimised.,“…the travel agency wants to minimise the response time for the clients (end time of the client-report activity).” (p. 31)
Resource Busy Percentage %BusyA,Average utilisation of resources of role A during the plan horizon
column2: used as response variable in evaluation.,"“%BusyA Average percentage of use of resources of role A, regarding the OCT.” (Table 3, p. 40)"

column1: Resource Busy Percentage %BusyB,Average utilisation of resources of role B during the plan horizon
column2: used as response variable in evaluation.,"“%BusyB Average percentage of use of resources of role B, regarding the OCT.” (Table 3, p. 40)"

column1: CP/DP(s1+s2),Indicator showing whether the best solution for a problem instance was found by the Constraint-Programming search (CP) or by Dynamic-Programming combination (DP)
column2: used as performance discriminator in the experiment.,"“CP/DP(s1+s2) The way in which the best solution is found …” (Table 3 description, p. 40)"

column1: Time (dimension),Listed as one of the high-level quality dimensions considered when designing processes.,"“…different quality dimensions like time, cost, flexibility and quality …” (p. 3)"
Cost (dimension),Part of the multi-dimensional quality space to be traded-off in process design.,"“…different quality dimensions like time, cost, flexibility and quality …” (p. 3)"
Flexibility (dimension),Quality dimension that can be balanced against others during process (re)design.,"“…different quality dimensions like time, cost, flexibility and quality …” (p. 3)"
Quality (dimension),Overall qualitative dimension mentioned among possible optimisation targets.,"“…different quality dimensions like time, cost, flexibility and quality …” (p. 3)"

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Conceito-guarda-chuva para medir se os objetivos de negócio estão sendo atendidos
column2: no GPI é usado para avaliar o alinhamento entre processos e metas antes da execução (design-time).,"“On top of that, we propose a new systematic way of using KPIs that helps evaluate business models alignment before performing them…”  "

column1: Average response time,Mede a rapidez do atendimento ao cliente
column2: satisfaz a meta ‘Meet the customers quickly’ quando a média de tempo das assistências é menor ou igual ao limite definido.,"“The first goal has the indicator ‘Average response time’ that calculates the average time of assistances. If the average is less or equal to the established time as ‘quickly’, this goal is considered satisficed.”  "

column1: Percentage of unsuccessful attendance,Mede a taxa de atendimentos malsucedidos
column2: satisfaz a meta ‘Unsuccessful assistances be less than 10%’ quando a porcentagem é ≤ 10 %.,“To verify the satisfaction of the hardgoal ‘Unsuccessful assistances be less than 10%’ the indicator is ‘Percentage of unsuccessful attendance’. The goal is met if the number of assistances is less or equal to 10% considering all the assistances registered.”

column2: workload concentration,"""whose systems accounted for over fifty percent of the data center’s activities""  "

column1: Service Level,Quality of IT service delivered to users/customers,"""To maintain acceptable service levels, the divisional IT unit had to …""  "
Lines of Code (LOC) written,Programmer productivity metric,"""especially if his or her performance is measured in lines of code written""  "

Sales-target Achievement,Extent to which sales objectives are met (business performance),"""each quarter after the system is implemented, the client/business unit achieves sales targets more easily than expected""  "

Major Releases per Year,Frequency of major system enhancement deliveries,"""4 to 6 major system enhancement releases per year and several smaller incremental releases""  "
Executable Load Modules (#),Size/complexity of software system,"""monolithic CASE-based system comprising over 140 executable load module components""  "
Load Modules Affected per Change,Scope/impact of a code modification,"""a simple one-line code change could impact 60 or 70 load modules""  "

column1: latency,Golden signal / Application Metric,one of the four canonical application performance measures,"“Golden signals : latency, error, saturation, and traffic … help understand the application performance” (Sec 2.2)  "

saturation,Golden signal / Application Metric,indicates resource utilisation / capacity,same excerpt as above

processed_order_amount,Derived Feature,aggregate of event attribute used as KPI/metric,same sentence as above
number_of_active_business_users,Derived Feature,resource-perspective feature for workload/throughput,same sentence as above

Recall,Evaluation Metric,evaluates completeness of detected causal links,same excerpt as above
F1-score,Evaluation Metric,harmonic mean of precision and recall for causal discovery,same excerpt as above

Throughput,Key Performance Indicator (KPI) used in the 1st iteration to quantify how many process instances are completed per unit of time,"“In this iteration throughput (i.e., processes executed/time unit) is used as KPI.”  "

Utilization,Additional KPI planned for 2nd iteration
column2: reflects resource usage efficiency,"“More KPIs measured in order to better address the new types of tests (e.g., latency, utilization, etc.) [16].”  "

Memory utilisation,Measured in the baseline test of a related benchmark (Sliver) and considered an important metric,“The benchmark performs a baseline test that measures the latency and the memory utilisation of two open source WfEs.”

CPU usage,System-level metric collected during BenchFlow executions to detect external interferences,"“BenchFlow collects system performance metrics from every environment … such as CPU, memory and bandwidth usage…”  "

Memory usage,System-level metric collected during BenchFlow executions to detect external interferences,"“BenchFlow collects system performance metrics from every environment … such as CPU, memory and bandwidth usage…”  "

Bandwidth usage,System-level metric collected during BenchFlow executions to detect external interferences,"“BenchFlow collects system performance metrics from every environment … such as CPU, memory and bandwidth usage…”  "

Raw performance metrics,Base measurements gathered and later aggregated into KPIs in the 3rd iteration,“the type of performance tests that will observe a broader spectrum of raw performance metrics and aggregate them into meaningful KPIs.”

Aggregate KPIs,Derived indicators obtained by composing raw metrics to give higher-level insights (planned for 3rd iteration),“the type of performance tests that will observe a broader spectrum of raw performance metrics and aggregate them into meaningful KPIs.”

column1: Number of remaining steps,Count of activities still to be executed
column2: predicted together with remaining time.,Table I row [7]: “Remaining Processing Time and Steps.”

column1: Waiting time,Idle time before activities start
column2: analysed in context-aware performance models.,"Table I row [9]: “Waiting Times, Throughput Times, and Utilization Rates.”"

column1: Throughput time,End-to-end duration of a case
column2: analysed together with waiting time and utilisation.,"Table I row [9]: “Waiting Times, Throughput Times, and Utilization Rates.”"

column1: Utilization rate,Percentage of resource usage
column2: evaluated in context-aware performance analysis.,"Table I row [9]: “Waiting Times, Throughput Times, and Utilization Rates.”"

column1: Delay,Amount of lateness with respect to a planned schedule

column1: Potential deadline violation,Binary/quantitative indicator of whether a deadline will be missed

column1: number of generated explicit events,numerator of the throughput metric
column2: fixed to 20 000 in the experiments,"“…20,000 explicit events were generated…” – §6.1  "

column1: explicit events/sec (deterministic system – D),throughput of the reference deterministic system re-used for comparison (values appear in Table 4),Table 4 first data row: “Explicit Events/sec (D) 72887 57406 6060 804”
explicit events/sec (probabilistic system – P),throughput of the proposed probabilistic solution for several confidence widths β
column2: used to evaluate scalability vs. deterministic baseline,Table 4 rows: “Explicit Events/sec (P) β = 0.05 … β = 0.2 …”

column1: β (confidence-width / required precision),"target half-width of the confidence interval for probability estimation
column2: varied (0.05, 0.1, 0.15, 0.2) to study impact on performance","control-parameter column in Table 3: “Precision (β) 0.05, 0.1, 0.15, 0.2”
column3: §6.3: “the required precision obviously has an impact on the performance.”  "

column1: sample size m,number of Monte-Carlo samples that have to be drawn so that estimates meet the desired confidence
column2: formula given and discussed,“…one would need  (Zα σ̂ / β)²  samples…” – §5 (exact formula printed in the text)

column1: expected interval (β),theoretical confidence interval used as accuracy target
column2: compared with the realised (“true”) interval,Table 5 column: “Exp. interval” shows value 0.05 for every row
column3: §6.4: “…comparing expected vs. true intervals…”

column1: true interval,empirically observed confidence interval that actually contains 95 % of the sampled results
column2: used to assess accuracy of the sampler,Table 5 columns: “True Interval Avg / Min / Max”
column3: §6.4: “The results show the true interval to be significantly smaller than the expected interval.”

Pichler and Edre 2019 - Towards Look-Ahead Strategies for Work Item Selection.pdf
PerformanceIndicator,UsageInText,EvidenceExcerpt
Turn-around time (cycle time),"Used as a key figure to evaluate how fast processes are completed
column2: compared between FIFO, WTR, EDF, DWTR.","“Time-related process performance can be measured with various performance key figures, e.g., the turn-around time …”  /  “For FIFO versus WTR we focused on the performance indicators ‘turnaround time (cycle time)’ …”"

column1: Throughput,Measures the amount of work completed (number of finished processes)
column2: employed to compare strategies.,“…time-related process performance can be measured with … the throughput …”  /  “we logged run-time information … throughput (number of finished processes) …”

column1: Number of deadline violations (overall),Counts how many processes miss their deadlines
column2: major criterion in EDF vs DWTR study and in examples.,“…time-related process performance can be measured with … the number of deadline violations.”  /  “we focused on the performance indicator ‘number of deadline violation’.”

column1: Number of deadline violations of finished processes,Specific derivative focusing on completed instances
column2: recorded during simulation.,“we logged run-time information … number of deadline violations of finished processes …”

column1: Number of deadline violations of still active processes,Derivative focusing on running (possibly starving) instances that are already late
column2: recorded during simulation.,“we logged run-time information … number of deadline violations of still active (possibly starving) processes …”

column1: Average resource utilization,Indicates how busy or idle agents are
column2: collected to judge load balance and efficiency.,“we logged run-time information … average resource utilization (how busy or idle were agents) …”

column1: Number of started processes,Counts total instances launched
column2: used to observe system load and strategy impact.,“we logged run-time information … number of started processes …”

column1: Tardiness,Measures degree by which deadlines are exceeded (severity of lateness)
column2: calculated in simulations.,“we logged run-time information … and the tardiness (degree of deadline exceeding).”

column1: Deadline-violation probability,Probability that a work item will finish after its deadline
column2: computed by MPDV and used to prioritise in DWTR.,"“DWTR … takes the probability of an upcoming deadline violation into account, which we can determine by applying the most-probable-deadline-violation algorithm (MPDV) …”"

PPI-1,RFCs cancelled out of RFCs registered,Indicador derivado que mede a percentagem de RFCs canceladas sobre o total de RFCs registadas,Table 1 – “PPI1 RFCs cancelled out of RFCs registered … 4 %”

a,Número de RFCs aprovadas do tipo correctivo,Numerador no PPI-3,Table A4 – “a is the sum of approved RFC that … type of change = corrective”
b,Número de RFCs aprovadas,Denominador em PPI-3 e PPI-4,Table A4 – “b is the number of approved RFCs”
PPI-4,Perfective RFCs out of approved RFCs,Percentagem de RFCs perfectivas entre as aprovadas,Table 1 – “PPI4 Perfective … RFCs 4 %”
a’,Número de RFCs aprovadas do tipo perfectivo,Numerador no PPI-4,Table A5 – “a is the sum of approved RFC that … type of change = perfective”
PPI-5,Average time of RFC analysis,Média da duração da actividade ‘Analyse RFC’,Table 1 – “PPI5 Average time of RFC analysis 2 working days”
tARFC,Duração da actividade ‘Analyse RFC’,Medida de tempo base usada para PPI-5,Table A6 – “average of the duration of activity Analyse RFC”
PPI-6,Number of RFCs under analysis,Contagem de instâncias da actividade ‘Analyse RFC’ em estado activo,Table 1 – “PPI6 Number of RFCs under analysis 2 RFCs”
PPI-7,Number of RFCs per type of change,Contagem de RFCs registadas agrupadas pelo atributo ‘type of change’,Table 1 – “PPI7 Number of RFCs per type of change”
count_type_change,Número de RFCs registadas (por tipo),Medida de contagem agrupada usada em PPI-7,Table A10 – “grouped by type of change of RFC”
PPI-8,Number of RFCs per project,Contagem de RFCs registadas agrupadas por projecto,Table 1 – “PPI8 Number of RFCs per project”
count_project,Número de RFCs registadas (por projecto),Medida de contagem agrupada usada em PPI-8,Table A11 – “grouped by project of RFC”

lifetime_RFC,Duração do ciclo de vida de uma RFC,Medida base de tempo usada em PPI-9,Table A12 – “duration between … ‘Receive RFC’ … and … process … completed”

PPI-2a,Average of the duration of activity RFC analysis (cíclica),Exemplo de medida temporal cíclica agregada na Sec. 4.1,Sec. 4.1 – “the average duration between the pairs of … activity RFC analysis becomes active … completed”
duration_process,Duração do processo ‘RFC management’,Medida de tempo abreviada citada como exemplo,Table 10 – exemplo de L-Pattern abreviado “the duration of RFC management process”
on_time_install,Verificação de actividade terminada no prazo,Medida condicional derivada (a<=b) para ‘Software Installation’,Sec. 8.3 – descrição do SLA e L-Pattern abreviado para on-time delivery

Low et al. 2007 - Symbiotic simulation for business process re-engineering in high-tech manufacturing and service networks.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
FillRate Percentage (fillRate),Indicador-chave para avaliar o desempenho da logística de componentes
column2: mede a porcentagem de voos que apresentaram falha em um componente e ainda conseguiram cumprir o horário seguinte. É monitorado em tempo real pelo Business Monitor e usado para acionar otimizações sempre que cai abaixo de um nível aceitável.,"“Thus, a performance indicator ‘FillRate Percentage’ is defined to measure the percentage of flights which develop component failures and can still meet the schedule for the next flight.” / “the fillRate performance indicator has to be constantly monitored so that prompt action can be taken to fine-tune the business process if the fillRate drops below an acceptable level.” / Tabelas 1-3: coluna “fillRate (%)”."

column1: # of Faults,Contador de falhas ocorridas em cada aeroporto
column2: serve de entrada para calcular o FillRate e para caracterizar a demanda por peças de reposição.,Tabelas 1-3: coluna “# of Faults”.

column1: # of Filled,Contador de falhas que foram efetivamente atendidas (peça de reposição encontrada e entregue a tempo)
column2: usado junto com ‘# of Faults’ para derivar o FillRate.,Tabelas 1-3: coluna “# of Filled”.

column1: MTBUR (Mean Time Between Unscheduled Removal),Métrica de confiabilidade de componentes aeronáuticos utilizada como parâmetro de entrada nos experimentos de simulação (define a frequência esperada de falhas).,“MTBUR is an accepted industry standard for reporting the reliability of a component and is defined as the total unit flying hours during a time period divided by the number of unscheduled removals of the component that occurred during the same period.”

Tempo de processo (Time),Identificado como medida que pode ser rastreada pelo WebSphere Business Monitor para avaliar desempenho de processos de negócio.,"“This can be used to track time, cost, and resources used in processes.”"
Custo (Cost),Outra medida sugerida para acompanhamento contínuo via Business Monitor a fim de comparar cenários de processo.,"“This can be used to track time, cost, and resources used in processes.”"

Recursos Utilizados (Resources used),Indicador de consumo de recursos operacionais que o Business Monitor pode coletar e exibir para apoiar melhorias de processo.,"“This can be used to track time, cost, and resources used in processes.”"
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),"Conjunto genérico de métricas definidas no desenho do negócio e acompanhadas pelo Business Monitor para avaliar o desempenho global
column2: engloba indicadores como FillRate, tempo, custo etc.","“visualizing the performance of a business, based on the key performance indicators that are identified in a business design.”"

column1: Stojanović et al. 2019 - BPM Adoption in Serbian Companies.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Process Performance Index (PPI),Índice principal utilizado para avaliar o nível de adoção de BPM nas empresas sérvias
column2: é calculado somando as pontuações dos 10 critérios.,"“Process Performance Index (PPI)… making it suitable as BPM adoption measuring instrument.” / “For each company, total PPI score is calculated, as a sum of ratings by criteria.”"

column1: Valor do PPI,Medida quantitativa (variação de 10 a 50) usada para classificar o sucesso da adoção de BPM.,“The PPI values range from 10 to 50 for each company. PPI value can be considered moderate (mostly between 30 and 38).”
Alinhamento com a estratégia,Critério do PPI
column2: avaliado para verificar o quanto os processos estão alinhados à estratégia organizacional.,"“PPI consists of 10 criteria: Alignment with strategy…” / “Holistic approach, Process management, and Alignment with strategy have relatively low standard deviation…”"

column1: Abordagem holística,"Critério do PPI
column2: recebeu a pontuação média mais alta entre os critérios, indicando visão sistêmica dos processos.",“PPI criteria with highest average scores are Holistic approach (3.97)….”

column1: Consciência de processos por gerentes e funcionários,Critério do PPI que mede o grau de conscientização sobre processos
column2: apresentou alta dispersão nas respostas.,“Process awareness by management and employees have relatively high standard deviation.”

column1: Portfólio de iniciativas de gestão de processos,Critério do PPI
column2: avalia existência de um conjunto estruturado de iniciativas
column3: teve uma das menores médias.,“criteria with lowest average scores are… Portfolio of process management initiatives (3.25).”

column1: Metodologia de BPI,Critério do PPI que avalia a existência de metodologia formal de melhoria
column2: baixa média e alta dispersão.,"“criteria with lowest average scores are… BPI methodology (3.38).” / “Customer focus, and BPI methodology have relatively high standard deviation.”"

column1: Métricas de processo,"Critério do PPI
column2: segunda maior média, indicando uso de indicadores nos processos.",“PPI criteria with highest average scores are… Process metrics (3.67).”

column1: Foco no cliente,"Critério do PPI
column2: uma das menores pontuações, apesar de ser apontado como driver importante.",“criteria with lowest average scores are Customer focus (3.44)….”

column1: Gestão de processos,"Critério do PPI
column2: apresentou baixa dispersão, sugerindo consenso sobre sua prática.","“Holistic approach, Process management, and Alignment with strategy have relatively low standard deviation.”"

column1: Sistemas de informação,Critério do PPI que examina suporte de TI aos processos
column2: listado entre os 10 critérios.,“PPI consists of 10 criteria… Information systems…”

column1: Gestão da mudança,Critério do PPI que analisa práticas de change management
column2: faz parte do conjunto de 10 critérios.,“PPI consists of 10 criteria… Change management.”

column1: Média (average score),Medida derivada usada para comparar o desempenho médio de cada critério do PPI.,“PPI criteria with highest average scores are Holistic approach (3.97)….”

Desvio-padrão,Medida derivada usada para indicar a dispersão das pontuações de cada critério.,"“Holistic approach, Process management, and Alignment with strategy have relatively low standard deviation, while… BPI methodology have relatively high standard deviation.”"
Estatística t (t-test),Usada para comparar o PPI entre grupos de empresas e identificar diferenças significativas.,"“t(59) = −2.157, p = 0.035” / “t(59) = −2.780, p = 0.007”…"
Diferença de médias (MD),Medida derivada do t-test que quantifica a diferença absoluta entre médias de PPI.,“The magnitude of differences in means (MD = −5.196 95% CI: −10.017 to −0.376)….”
Intervalo de confiança (95% CI),Faixa na qual a diferença de médias é esperada com 95 % de confiança.,“95% CI: −10.017 to −0.376”
Tamanho de efeito (η²),Medida derivada que indica a proporção da variância explicada pela diferença entre grupos.,“η² = .07” / “η² = .12”
Estatística U (Mann-Whitney),Teste não-paramétrico usado para comparar grupos quando a variável não é normal.,"“U = 195.000, z = −2.699, p = 0.00, r = 0.35”"
Estatística z,"Valor padronizado associado ao teste U, usado para avaliar significância.",“z = −2.699”
Coeficiente r (efeito para U),Medida de tamanho de efeito para o teste de Mann-Whitney.,“r = 0.35”
Valor de p (p-value),Nível de significância estatística utilizado em todos os testes para decidir sobre diferenças.,“p = 0.035” / “p = 0.007” / “p = 0.00”
Yoon et al. 2009 - 3rd Event-Driven Business Process Management Workshop (edBPM).pdf
Medidor_de_Performance,Uso_no_Texto,Evidência_no_Texto

Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR),"Usado para quantificar o crescimento previsto do mercado de BI e BAM, funcionando como métrica de desempenho de mercado para justificar investimentos em EDBPM.","""...market for business intelligence (BI) and business activity monitoring (BAM) will have a compound annual growth rate of 7 to 8% by 2012..."""
ROI (Return on Investment),Indicador explícito proposto para avaliar economicamente a adoção de BPM orientado a eventos.,"""Evaluation and ROI of event-driven BPM"""

SLA (Service Level Agreement),"Utilizado como métrica de qualidade de serviço, mencionado na correlação de eventos com impacto ao cliente e no monitoramento baseado em eventos.","""mapping event incidents to customer SLA..."" / ""Event-driven SLA monitoring"""

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Indicador chave de desempenho citado em conjunto com SLA para medir o impacto de eventos e identificar problemas críticos ao negócio.,"""mapping event incidents to customer SLA and KPI that are crucial for identifying any escalating problems critical to the business"""
Responsiveness,Apresentado como benefício mensurável: tempo de resposta imediato dos processos a eventos oriundos de qualquer fonte.,"""Responsiveness: Events can occur at any time from any source
column2: processes respond to them immediately, whenever and wherever they happen."""

column1: Agility,"Métrica de rapidez para modelar, implementar e otimizar novos processos em resposta a mudanças de requisitos de negócio.","""Agility: New processes can be modeled, implemented, deployed and optimized more quickly in response to changing business requirements..."""

Flexibility,Usada para medir a capacidade do processo de operar em plataformas heterogêneas e suportar mudanças sem quebrar o modelo.,"""Flexibility: Processes can span heterogeneous platforms and programming languages
column2: participating applications can be upgraded or changed without breaking the process model."""

column1: Event Severity,"Referida como nível de criticidade de eventos, demonstrando limitação atual de métricas de impacto e a necessidade de correlação mais sofisticada.","""there has been little understanding of service impact beyond event severity and root-cause of business events."""

Volume de Eventos (72 quadrillion events/day),Quantidade de eventos diários citada para medir a escala de processamento necessária e o desafio de desempenho.,"""IBM reports that 72 quadrillion unique business events are generated worldwide each day."""
Pourshahid et al. 2011 - Toward a goal-oriented, business intelligence decision-making framework.pdf
Indicator,How it is used in the text,Evidence snippet

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Term used for any measurable variable that is linked to goals and evaluated within GRL strategies.,“…allows the aggregation of Key Performance Indicators and their integration to goal models…”
Staffing cost,Concrete KPI example
column2: has target/threshold/worst values
column3: can be drilled-down by Date and Location dimensions to analyse labour expenses.,"“For example, a Staffing cost KPI … could have a target value of $1000, a threshold value of $1500, and a worst value of $2500.”"

column1: Marketing cost,Component of the ‘reduce costs’ option
column2: treated as a measurable cost driver that can be monitored and compared with other cost elements.,“…Reducing costs … can be decomposed into two … options: reducing the marketing cost or reducing the staffing budget.”

column1: Staffing budget / Staff cost,Cost element affected by the decision option ‘reduce staffing budget’
column2: feeds the higher-level cost KPI and influences profit.,“…the reduction of the staffing budget is selected… This strategy eventually leads to … ‘Increased profits’…”

column1: Profit,KPI calculated from other KPIs (Revenue – Costs – Stolen*50)
column2: its normalised value drives goal satisfaction for ‘Increase profits’.,“the current value of Profit is computed as Revenue − Costs − Stolen * 50 … The satisfaction of the Profit KPI is based on the normalisation of its computed current value.”

column1: Revenue,Input KPI used in the Profit formula and monitored by store managers as a high-level performance measure.,“revenue – costs – stolen*50 …”  /  “…store managers … focused on increasing revenues…”
Costs,"Input KPI to Profit
column2: includes Marketing cost, Staffing cost and other expenses
column3: monitored to evaluate profitability.",“Profit is computed as Revenue − Costs − Stolen*50”

column1: Stolen (items),"Quantity of items lost
column2: multiplied by an estimated unit cost in the Profit formula, therefore acting as a risk-related KPI.",“Profit is computed as Revenue − Costs − Stolen * 50 (the first two are in dollars and the third is a number of items).”

column1: Number of items sold,Operational KPI used by store managers to gauge sales performance and growth.,“…store managers were … focused on increasing revenues and the number of items sold in their stores.”

Online business investment,New KPI added in the third iteration to track the amount invested in the e-commerce channel and its impact on total costs and risk.,"“There is one new risk factor … associated with the investment in the online business. Furthermore, there is also a new KPI used to monitor the investment made in the online business and its impact on the costs.”"

Company value,Indicador de valor gerado para a empresa que a PEP pretende maximizar,“the focus is on overall costs and company value.”
