column2: its value is produced from three lower-level metrics and feeds the CRT computation.,“The PI ‘Current change request processing speed’ can be transformed to one measure from the composition function after being measured by 3 metrics.”

column1: Average Cycle Time (ACT),Metric / PI,One of the three basic metrics used in C_CRT
column2: also has a goal value ACT’ when improvement is measured.,"“… the variables … Average cycle time (ACT) … are declared.”  –  “For the example… goal variables ACT’, SD’, FaultRate’, and PMSatisfaction’ are respectively declared.”"

column1: Standard Deviation (SD),Metric / PI,Second basic metric for C_CRT
column2: also paired with target SD’ for improvement tracking.,Same quotation as ACT plus: “… Standard deviation (SD) … are declared.”

column1: FaultRate,Metric / PI,Third basic metric for C_CRT
column2: paired with target FaultRate’ in improvement measurement.,Same quotation as ACT plus: “… FaultRate … are declared.”

column1: PMSatisfaction,Subjective PI,Subjective indicator (project-manager satisfaction) included in C_CRT
column2: PMSatisfaction’ used for goals.,"“… and PMSatisfaction are declared … In the case of PMSatisfaction, … the project manager determines its value by a subjective evaluation.”"

column1: CRTAchievement,Derived KPI,"Measures how much the current CRT value has progressed toward its target
column2: computed from δ(ACT), δ(SD)… etc.",“… variable CRTAchievement for Value achievement of CRT is declared and its value is defined as shown in Fig. 10.”

column1: CustomerSatisfaction,Business Value,Chosen by A-Homeshopping as a strategic business value
column2: decomposed into sub-values for measurement.,“A-Homeshopping has chosen CustomerSatisfaction and CustomerBenefit as business Values to pursue.”

column1: CustomerBenefit,Business Value,Parallel high-level value selected by the company
column2: not further decomposed in the running example.,Same quotation as above.

column1: OnTimeDelivery,Sub-value / Composite PI,"Child of CustomerSatisfaction
column2: later decomposed into two KPIs (AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate, GuaranteedQuickDelivery).",“We decomposed the Value CustomerSatisfaction into the subvalues OnTimeDelivery …”

column1: OnTimeCommunication,Sub-value / PI,Second child of CustomerSatisfaction
column2: mapped to business processes but details omitted in text.,Same quotation as above (“… and OnTimeCommunication.”)

column1: AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate,KPI,One of the two KPIs derived from OnTimeDelivery
column2: calculated through the ‘Evaluate ATP Date Adherence’ activity.,“The KPIs … AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate can be calculated as shown in Fig. 15.”  –  “Evaluate ATP Date Adherence … measures AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate.”

column1: GuaranteedQuickDelivery,KPI,Second KPI derived from OnTimeDelivery
column2: measured through ‘Evaluate ASN Adherence’.,Same sentence as above plus: “Evaluate ASN Adherence … measures GuaranteedQuickDelivery.”

column1: ASN Adherence,Operational PI / Metric,Measured in the activity ‘Evaluate ASN Adherence’
column2: feeds the KPI GuaranteedQuickDelivery.,“Evaluate ASN Adherence” (Fig. 17) – introduced as a measuring activity “which measure GuaranteedQuickDelivery …”

column1: ATP Date Adherence,Operational PI / Metric,Measured in the activity ‘Evaluate ATP Date Adherence’
column2: feeds the KPI AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate.,“Evaluate ATP Date Adherence … which measure … AccuracyOfDeliveryEstimate.”

column1: OnTimeDelivery Composite Function (C5.1),Aggregation Function,Function that composes KPI values into the OnTimeDelivery score.,“The composition function used was defined in Fig. 15 as C5.1.”
Weigand and Van Den Heuvel 2007 - The Challenge of Self-adaptive Systems for E-commerce.pdf

Performance;Meta de qualidade não-funcional que a auto-adaptação procura otimizar;"…ability to adapt themselves, particularly on non-functional properties such as performance," fault-tolerance and security.""  "

FaultTolerance;Meta de qualidade não-funcional a ser monitorada/otimizada;"…ability to adapt themselves, particularly on non-functional properties such as performance," fault-tolerance and security.""  "
Security
column2: Meta de qualidade não-funcional a ser monitorada/otimizada
column3: “…ability to adapt themselves, particularly on non-functional properties such as performance, fault-tolerance and security.”

column1: Baffoe et al. 2013 - Inferring state for real-time monitoring of care processes.pdf
medidor,como é usado no texto,evidência no texto
Patient wait time,Tempo que o doente passa aguardando um próximo serviço
column2: usado como um dos “key performance measures” gerais do processo assistencial e para detectar gargalos.," ""“Patient wait times … are key performance measures for care processes in hospitals.”""  "

column1: Care service time,Tempo que um serviço clínico efetivamente dura
column2: outro “key performance measure” principal citado para avaliar a qualidade do processo.," ""“Patient wait times and care service times are key performance measures for care processes in hospitals.”""  "

column1: Duração de cada estado do processo (State duration),"Cada estado (ex.: TRIAGED, WAIT FOR BED etc.) tem seu início e fim monitorados
column2: a diferença de tempo é exibida em tempo-real no dashboard e comparada com metas.",“Figure 1 is a sample real-time report of each patient’s state and duration along with the defined target duration for that state.”

column1: Tempo porta-balão (Door-to-balloon time),Duração total do triagem até a intervenção cardíaca
column2: indicador de desempenho crítico para pacientes com síndrome coronariana aguda.,“A key performance measure for the hospital is the overall duration of the process from triage until procedure completion. This duration is usually referred to as the time from door-to-balloon.”

column1: Tempo do estado WAIT FOR BED,Espera até surgir um leito
column2: usado para identificar gargalos de leitos e acionar decisões de alocação de recursos.,“long ED patient wait durations for a bed in the cardiology ward (CW) could be because cardiac patients in the wards are waiting to be discharged.”

column1: Tempo do estado WAIT FOR TRANSPORT,Espera pelo transporte do paciente até o próximo local
column2: monitorado e sinalizado em verde/amarelo/vermelho conforme ultrapassa metas.,“there was an unusually long wait for someone to come to transport the patient to the bed.”

column1: Tempo do estado WAIT FOR DISCHARGE,"Espera até o paciente receber alta
column2: seu excesso impacta disponibilidade de leitos e, portanto, outras esperas.","“If this were the case, we should find that the Wait for Discharge state is flagged red in the average wait-time report.”  "

column1: Tempo médio de espera dos pacientes atuais,Média do tempo de espera que todos os pacientes cardíacos estão experimentando em tempo-real
column2: permite distinguir problemas individuais de problemas sistêmicos.,“there is another similar looking real-time report which computes the average wait-time that all cardiac patients are currently experiencing.”

column1: Percentual do alvo de duração (Actual ÷ Target),"Comparação da duração real de um estado com a meta (verde < ⅔ alvo, amarelo entre ⅔ e alvo, vermelho > alvo)
column2: usado para alertas visuais em tempo-real.",“Rows are flagged yellow where the actual duration is near the limit … and red where the actual duration exceeds the target.”

column1: Tempo Triaged → In Procedure (<90 min),Meta operacional derivada (subconjunto do Door-to-balloon) que exige que a sequência completa até o procedimento ocorra em menos de 90 min.,“cardiac patients require care within a short window of time … must be completed within 90 minutes of the event.”
Sokolowski et al. 2022 - Change is the only constant - dynamic updates for workflows.pdf
Metric,Usage/Definition in the Paper,Evidence Extracted from the Text

Updatability,"Total amount of time during which a component satisfies the update condition – i.e., time windows in which an update can be performed safely.","""Updatability is the overall time in which the update condition is met at the components (i.e., when updating is safe)."" (Sec 7.2)  "
Update time,Elapsed time between an update request and the moment the component finishes being replaced
column2: composed of two sub-metrics (update timeliness and update duration).,"""The update time measures the timespan from triggering to completing a component update."" (Sec 7.2)  "

column1: Update timeliness,Part of the update time: interval from the update request until the instant the update condition is reached.,"""…split into the update timeliness (until the update condition is met)…"" (Sec 7.2)  "

Update duration,Part of the update time: interval from the moment the update condition is satisfied until the component replacement finishes.,"""…and the update duration (after the update condition is met)."" (Sec 7.2)  "

Workflow duration,"Execution time of a workflow instance, measured from its start to its completion.","""The workflow duration is the timespan between workflow instance start and completion."" (Sec 7.2)  "

Workflow delay,Difference between the start time of a workflow instance in an update scenario and its start time in the baseline (no-update) run.,"""The workflow delay is the difference of the workflow instances’ start to its start in the baseline."" (Sec 7.2)  "
Workflow interruption,Overall impact of an update on a workflow instance’s completion time
column2: calculated as the sum of its start delay and any additional execution time.,"""…the workflow interruption is the difference of the instances’ completion times, measured by the sum of the instances’ delay and duration differences."" (Sec 7.2)  "

column1: Timeliness (general),Quality attribute used to characterise reaching strategies
column2: length of the interval between triggering an update and the beginning of the component exchange.,"""Timeliness is the length of the interval between requesting the update and the beginning of the component exchange…"" (Sec 4.3)  "

column1: Interruption (general),Quality attribute used to characterise reaching strategies
column2: amount of extra time added to a workflow instance’s completion because of an update.,"""Interruption is how long a workflow instance’s completion is delayed due to the update."" (Sec 4.3)  "

column1: Deadlocked workflow instances (%),Percentage of workflow instances that cannot finish because the chosen strategy causes a deadlock
column2: used as a negative performance indicator.,"""…the only simulation with deadlocked workflow instances (47.2 %), preventing their completion."" (Sec 7.2)"

column1: Corsi et al. 2011 - Is the polarization index a valid measure of loyalty for evaluating changes over time.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Purchase Frequency (PF),Um dos Brand Performance Measures (BPM) utilizados para estimar o grau de lealdade comportamental a um produto/atributo em um único período de tempo.,"“Three BPM… provide information on the degree of loyalty consumers devote to specific products or brands: the purchase frequency (PF)… (Ehrenberg et al., 2004…)”  "
Share of Category Requirements (SCR),Outro BPM
column2: mede a participação da marca dentro das compras totais da categoria realizadas por quem comprou a marca.,"“…the share of category requirements (SCR)…” / “represents the market share of a brand among all the consumers who purchased the brand at least once during a specific period (Jung et al., 2010).”  "

column1: Repeat Purchase Rate (r),BPM que expressa a probabilidade de repetir a compra da mesma alternativa
column2: calculado a partir de MS e w.,“r is defined as ‘the probability of choosing alternative i conditional on a previous purchase of the same alternative i’… r = MS + w² MS · w (Eq. 3).”

column1: Market Share (MS),Medidor de desempenho usado como base/controle para os demais BPM
column2: altera-se com tamanho de mercado e pode enviesar interpretações de lealdade.,"“products or brands with higher market share (MS) tend also to have a higher PF, a higher SCR and a higher r… However, this association does not always hold true… therefore, the evaluation of the loyalty levels based on these measures may not correspond to reality.”  "

column1: Polarization Index (w),Índice proposto como medida de lealdade independente de MS
column2: adequado para comparar mudanças ao longo do tempo.,“researchers developed an index able to provide a measure of loyalty independent of the MS: the polarization index (w)… provides a valid and useful analysis of the ways in which loyalty evolves over time.”

column1: Category Polarization Index (wc ou DMD value),Valor-benchmark de lealdade para a categoria
column2: calculado via Distribuição Dirichlet-Multinomial
column3: serve de referência para comparar BBD.,"“Before estimating all the marginal w, the benchmark value – also called category polarization index (wc) or DMD value – needs to be calculated.”  "

column1: Marginal Polarization (BBD value),Valor de w calculado para cada marca/nível de atributo em relação a todas as demais
column2: indica excesso ou falta de lealdade em comparação ao wc.,“it is possible to identify as many w values – also called in literature marginal w or BBD values – as the number of brands… These values express the loyalty level of consumers in the marginal choice between each brand… and all the other brands.”

column1: Schwaiger and Abmayer 2013 - Accounting and Management Information Systems - A Semantic Integration.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual
Preço,Valor monetário atribuído a um recurso econômico e usado como referência de política ou validação.,"“… e.g., the price of any bottle of Chanel No. 5 is $75.”  "
Salário,Remuneração do colaborador utilizada em regras de validação.,“The salary for an employee should be validated against the salary range defined for his or her employee type …”
Faixa salarial,"Limite inferior e superior admissível para o salário, servindo como critério de controle preventivo.","“… such as ‘A staff member should earn between $25,000 and $40,000.’”  "

Padrão (standard),Benchmark técnico ou de engenharia contra o qual a realização é comparada.,"“Standards often refer to engineering information, for example: ‘How much raw material does it take to manufacture a bike?’”  "

Orçamento (budget),"Meta quantitativa para um período futuro, utilizada no planejamento.",“Budgets provide quantified performance measures … ‘How many cars do we expect to sell in the second quarter of 2006?’”
Objetivo,Valor-alvo fixado no planejamento gerencial e depois monitorado.,“the objectives are set in the planning activities”
Padrão de desempenho,Referência usada no ciclo Plan-Do-Check-Act para comparar resultados.,“… the measured results are compared with the standard of performance.”
Realização (desempenho real),Resultado efetivamente medido de um processo de negócio.,“the performance of the business process executions is periodically measured”
Desvio (variance),Diferença entre realização e padrão
column2: gatilho para ações corretivas.,“If the Check-activity shows significant deviations these are used in the Act-activities …”

column1: Variância controlável,"Parcela do desvio atribuída a fatores gerenciáveis, analisada para correção.",“… the thereby derived controllable … variance are analyzed …”
Variância de volume,"Parcela do desvio atribuída à variação de volume, analisada para correção.",“… and volume variance are analyzed …”
Custos planejados,Valor orçado de custos determinado no início do período.,“… where the costs are planned at the beginning of the budgeting period …”
Custos reais,"Valor efetivamente incorrido, comparado aos custos alvo.",“… the actual costs are compared to the targeted costs at the end of the period.”
Volume de produção planejado,"Quantidade a ser produzida em cada período futuro, definida como objetivo.",“the objectives are the planned production volumes for the future periods.”
Variável de estado,Medida que descreve a situação corrente do sistema e condiciona previsões.,“… the state which occurred by then and that is measured by the state variable.”
Probabilidade,Mede a chance de ocorrência de eventos futuros
column2: usada em expectativas e risco.,“Due to the probabilistic nature of the tree each node has a probability for its occurrence.”

column1: Limite de risco,Valor máximo aceitável para uma medida de risco
column2: monitorado no controle.,“… comparing the observed values with the postulated risk limits …”

column1: Expectativa condicional,"Valor esperado condicionado ao estado, usado em planejamento racional.",“… rational plans … are set equal to the mathematical conditional expectations.”
Previsão condicional,Forecast atualizado conforme a informação revelada
column2: serve para avaliar desempenho futuro.,“… allows the formation of conditional forecasts which are updated on the information revealed over time.”

column1: Li and Zhu 2008 - Generalized Stochastic Workflow net-based quantitative analysis of business process performance.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence in the text
Mean flow time (T) / Mean throughout time / Average flow time,Primary time-performance indicator of the whole workflow
column2: computed with Little’s rule (T = N / λ)
column3: formula derived for GSWN and validated in the case study.,"“One of the important time performance measures of business process model is its mean flow time T, that is, the mean throughout time of all workflow instances.” / “The mean flow time of the GSWN is calculated by …” / “Then the computational formula of the average flow time of workflow is deduced.”  "

column1: Throughput time,Alternative time-performance measure previously tackled by other authors
column2: cited as target of quantitative computation.,“Zerguini et al. [7] combined Stochastic Petri Net and Laplace Transformation to compute the throughput time of workflow.”

column1: Time constraints,Listed as a category of dynamic performance information that must be analysed in BPM.,"“There are three types of dynamic running process information need to be collected and analyzed, which are the time constraints, the utilization efficiency of the resources and the time performance [2].”  "
Utilization efficiency of the resources,Another category of performance information to be analysed in BPM.,Same sentence as above.
Time performance (generic),Overall label for temporal behaviour that must be quantified
column2: motivates the whole study.,“…the quantitative analysis of the time performance measure is pivotal to guarantee the validity of process model…”

column1: Average token number (N),Intermediate measure used in Little’s rule to obtain mean flow time
column2: represents mean number of tokens in the Petri-net system at steady state.,“N is the average token number of the Petri net system in its stabile state.”

column1: Arrival rate of tokens (λ = ϕ),Intermediate measure in Little’s rule
column2: represents mean number of tokens entering the system per time-unit.,“ϕ is the mean number of tokens entering into the net system in every unit time.”

column1: Mean residence / sojourning time of a marking (mi),Local performance measure
column2: time the system stays in tangible marking Mi
column3: used to compute steady-state probabilities and finally T.,“The mean residence time of Mi is denoted as mi …”

column1: Mean firing time F(M,t) (or firing speed λt),Task-level performance parameter: stochastic processing time of transition t in marking M
column2: forms the basis for all higher-level measures.,"“F(M, t) is the interval that the transition t in the marking state of M spend in firing.”  "

column1: Stability probability of a marking (πi),Steady-state probability that the system is in marking Mi
column2: used together with mi to compute global metrics.,“The stability probability of Mi in the marking process is πi such that …”

column1: Relative visit ratio of a marking (yi),Derivative indicator: proportion of times the marking process passes through Mi
column2: required to solve the steady-state probabilities.,“yi is the ratio that the marking process passes the marking Mi …”

column1: Kandil and El-Deeb 2016 - Exploration of application migration to cloud environment.pdf
Metric,Como é usado/descrição no texto,Evidência extraída do texto
Total Throughput (bytes),Quantidade total de dados recebidos do servidor durante o teste de carga.,“Total Throughput (bytes): Displays the amount of data received from the server.”
Total Hits,Número total de requisições enviadas ao servidor durante o teste de carga.,“Total Hits: Displays the number of requests sent to the server during the load test.”

Average Transaction Response Time,Tempo médio para executar as transações a cada segundo do teste de carga.,“Average Transaction Response Time: Displays the average time to perform transactions during each second of the load test.”

Average Throughput (bytes/second),Quantidade média de dados recebidos do servidor por segundo.,“Average Throughput (bytes / second): Displays the amount of data received from the server at any given second.”

Average Hits per Second,Quantidade média de requisições enviadas ao servidor por segundo.,“Average Hits per second: Displays the number of requests per second sent to the server during the load test.”

CPU used by this session,Tempo de CPU (em décimos de milissegundos) consumido por uma sessão entre o início e o fim da chamada do usuário.,“CPU used by this session: is the amount of CPU time (in 10s of milliseconds) used by a session between when a user call started and ended”

DB time,Tempo decorrido (em microssegundos) gasto em chamadas de nível de usuário no banco de dados.,“DB time:  is the amount of elapsed time (in microseconds) spent performing Database user-level calls.”
Bytes received via SQL*Net from client,Total de bytes recebidos do cliente via SQL*Net.,“Bytes received via SQL*Net from client: is the total number of bytes received from the client over SQL*Net.”

Bytes sent via SQL*Net to client,Total de bytes enviados ao cliente pelos processos foreground via SQL*Net.,“Bytes sent via SQL*Net to client: is the total number of bytes sent to the client from the foreground processes”
Average Response Time (derivado),Métrica mencionada nos resultados comparativos
column2: refere-se ao tempo médio de resposta obtido nos cenários testados.,"“Sc#1 on public cloud has least Average response time 0.45 seconds , while Sc#2 on premise has highest Average response time with 8.597 seconds.”  "

column1: Average Throughput (derivado nos resultados),Valor médio de throughput reportado nas comparações entre ambientes.,“Figure 6: AVERAGE THROUGHPUT” (título e gráfico com valores médios de throughput)
Average Hits (derivado nos resultados),Métrica derivada apresentada nos resultados como 'AVG HITS PER SECOND'.,Tabelas 1-3: coluna “AVG HITS PER SECOND”
Sulis et al. 2020 - Risk-aware business process modeling - a comparison of discrete event and agent-based approaches.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal extraída do artigo
Número de solicitações por ano,Quantifica a carga de trabalho (throughput) do departamento,"“The number of requests managed each year by this hospital department is about 125,000.”"
Erros reportados (Reported),Avalia a quantidade de falhas identificadas pela equipe
column2: usado para comparar segurança entre áreas,“Figure 2: Errors reported by BB staff (Reported)….”

column1: Erros detectados (Detected),Estimativa de erros captados pela gerência
column2: usado em análise de risco,“Figure 2: … errors estimated by managers (Detected)….”

column1: Erros não detectados / Reclamações (Claims),Mede falhas que chegaram ao paciente
column2: indicador de risco residual,“Figure 2: … errors not detected (Claims).”

column1: Probabilidade de erro por transação,Parâmetro de simulação para gerar falhas conforme distribuição histórica,“every transactions arriving in the process may have some errors accordingly to the real distribution based on the statistical analysis of previous years.”
Probabilidade de interceptação de erro pela atividade de controle,Indica eficiência dos pontos de checagem
column2: usado no modelo DES,“Every control activity can intercept errors depending on a predeﬁned probability.”

column1: Duração de cada atividade,Define tempo de execução das tarefas
column2: base para tempo de ciclo e filas,"“Each activity is modeled as an object, including some variables (e.g. the duration …).”"

column1: Número de trabalhadores na atividade,Recurso disponível que afeta capacidade e tempo de processamento,"“Each activity is modeled as an object, including some variables (e.g. … the number of workers …).”"
Duração média do deslocamento entre nós,Mede logística interna
column2: afeta lead-time total no modelo ABM,“the weight of the arc includes the average duration of the walk between the two nodes.”

column1: Bottlenecks / Comprimento de filas,Indicador visual de congestionamentos no fluxo de pacientes,“improves the understand[ing] of the detection of bottlenecks and queues of patients in the activity flow.”
Nível de atenção dos agentes,Variável comportamental que afeta chance de erro
column2: proposta no ABM,“agent level of attention can be modeled as a variable decreasing with respect to the number of time and working hours…”

column1: Time to build the model,Mede esforço para desenvolver o modelo em cada abordagem,“Time to build the model. We investigate how long does it take to manage the process from the initial conception to the modeling conclusion.”
General impression (facilidade de entendimento),Avalia quão intuitivo é o modelo para stakeholders,“General impression. This aspect concerns the ease of understanding of the model.”
Output results readability,Indica clareza dos resultados gerados pela simulação,“Output results. The focus here is on the readability of the resulting model.”

KPIs of the process (inclusão/interpretação),Mede a facilidade de inserir e interpretar indicadores no modelo,“KPIs of the process. This aspect relates to the introduction of performance indicators in the model.”

Modifying flow setting (facilidade de alteração),Avalia quão rápido se ajusta parâmetros/fluxo na ferramenta,“Modifying ﬂow setting. We investigate how the process ﬂow is easy to manipulate and how immediate is to change parameters in the model.”

Integrating detection of failures,Mede esforço para acoplar métodos como FMEA à simulação,“Integrating the detection of failures. We analyse what would be the effort to integrate in the model traditional methods as Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (FMEA)….”
Adding behaviour,Indica flexibilidade para inserir novas variáveis/mudanças de agentes,“Adding behaviour. This topic deﬁne how it is possible to change the model accordingly to new input/variables.”

Process mining suitability,Verifica aderência do modelo à leitura automática de event logs,“Process mining. This topic refers to how the approach is suitable to be addressed by recent advances in reading event logs for process discovery.”
Toh et al. 2022 - Improving Operation Efficiency through Predicting Credit Card Application Turnaround Time with Index-based Encoding.pdf
metric,como_é_usado,evidência_no_texto
Turnaround Time (TAT),Variável-alvo a ser prevista
column2: indicador de eficiência do processo.,“The objective of the model is to predict the turnaround time of credit card applications.”

column1: Predicted Turnaround Time,Saída do modelo
column2: usada para calcular o remaining time e para alertar processos com atraso.,“…the trained XGBoost model is then used to predict turnaround time of in progress applications…”

column1: Predicted Remaining Time,Indicador derivado (Predicted TAT – time taken so far) para priorizar intervenções proativas.,“Predicted remaining time is derived by subtracting time taken so far… from the predicted Turnaround time.”
Average Turnaround Time,Média histórica usada para analisar tendências sazonais e definir pesos de amostra.,“Figure 1 shows the trend of average turnaround time with unit in days.”
Variance da Average TAT,"Medida de dispersão (≈0,33 dia) utilizada para caracterizar a variabilidade da média.",“…with a variance of about 0.33 days.”
Mean Absolute Error (MAE),Principal métrica de avaliação dos modelos em treino e teste
column2: comparada entre experimentos.,“Mean absolute error (MAE) is used as the performance metric for the prediction of turnaround time.”

column1: Median Absolute Error,Métrica complementar para avaliar impacto de distribuição assimétrica (long tail).,“The median absolute error for the train and test data sets are 0.23 days and 0.35 days respectively…”
Absolute Error,Erro ponto-a-ponto
column2: distribuído para investigar causas do long tail.,"“Distribution of the absolute error, which has a long tail, is shown in Figure 3.”"

column1: Prediction Error,Usado em gráfico para validar que o erro diminui à medida que mais updates são recebidos.,"“Figure 4, which shows a plot of prediction error against the number of updates with a clear downwards trend.”"
Feature Importance,Mede contribuição relativa das variáveis no modelo
column2: usada para insights de processo.,“The most important features from the XGBoost model is:”

column1: Shapley Values,Métrica de explicabilidade que quantifica contribuição positiva/negativa de cada variável.,“Shapley values are used to make sense of the model prediction… contribution of each variable to the prediction can be quantified…”
Seiger et al. 2019 - Toward a framework for self-adaptive workflows in cyber-physical systems.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (textual excerpt)

Iterations – Monitor phase,Counts how many monitoring cycles were executed during one feedback-loop execution to detect symptoms,“From this monitoring data 64 sensor updates were analyzed” (Table 1 shows 64 iterations for the M phase
column2: Table 2 shows 107)

column1: Iterations – Analyze phase,Number of analysis cycles that evaluated symptoms against objectives,"“64 sensor updates were analyzed, 7 of which led to the execution of the planning phase” (Table 1: 64 A-iterations
column2: Table 2: 107)  "

column1: Iterations – Plan phase,How many compensation searches were performed in one loop execution,“7 of which led to the execution of the planning phase … After 7 repetitions … the feedback service fulfilled the goal” (Table 1: 7 P-iterations
column2: Table 2: 12)

column1: Iterations – Execute phase,How many compensation actions were actually executed,Table 1 and Table 2 list 7 and 12 iterations respectively for the E phase (one per compensation attempt)
Iterations – Whole Feedback Service,Overall number of MAPE-K loop executions for a process step instance,Both tables contain one ‘FB-service’ iteration showing one complete loop per inconsistency
Average duration – Analyze phase (ms),Mean processing time of one Analyse cycle
column2: measures computational cost,Table 1: 4 ms
column3: Table 2: 3 ms – “Duration (ø in ms)” column

column1: Average duration – Plan phase (ms),Mean time needed to find a compensation
column2: indicates planning overhead,"Table 1: 1 699 ms
column3: text adds “planning phase (taking about 1,7 s on average)”
column4: Table 2: 12 ms (cached query)  "

column1: Average duration – Execute phase (ms),Mean time required to run a compensation command,Table 1: 8 ms
column2: Table 2: 2 ms

column1: Average duration – Whole Feedback Service (ms),Total wall-clock time the loop needed to restore consistency or report failure,Table 1: 29 925 ms (≈30 s)
column2: Table 2: 38 100 ms (≈38 s)

column1: Number of sensor updates analysed,Workload indicator for the Analyse component,“64 sensor updates were analyzed” (MAPE-K+)
column2: “107 Analyse phases” (MAPE-K++)

column1: Process-step execution time (<10 ms),Shows negligible overhead of individual REST activities
column2: baseline for comparison,“Execution of active process steps … usually takes less than 10 ms”

column1: Time to reach balance – Baseline (s),Elapsed time until light level stabilised without feedback,“…reach a stable state … after approx. 9 s.”
Time to reach balance – with Feedback (s),Elapsed time until goal was satisfied using MAPE-K,“…reaching a state of balance … approx. 33 s after the process started.”
Feedback-service compensation duration (s),Wall-clock time from inconsistency detection until goal satisfaction,“…after 7 repetitions … and 30 s in total the feedback service fulfilled the goal.”
Human-task handling time (s),Measures end-user interaction latency when automatic compensation fails,“…human task … taking about 7 s.”

Tasks Monitoring / Tasks List

column1: Venero et al. 2019 - Towards a metamodel for supporting decisions in knowledge-intensive processes.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Metric,Definido como uma medida quantificável para acompanhar e avaliar o status de um objetivo
column2: é associado a Objectives e medido durante ou após a execução.,"“A metric is a quantifiable measure used to track and assess the status of an objective, such as key performance indicators (KPI) or key risk indicators (KRI). The metrics help the detection of deviations and unexpected process evolution, and give a view of the achieved progress in reaching an objective.”  "

column1: Key Performance Indicator (KPI),"Exemplo de métrica citada para avaliar o alcance de Objectives e, consequentemente, o progresso da estratégia.",“…such as key performance indicators (KPI) or key risk indicators (KRI).”
Key Risk Indicator (KRI),Outro exemplo de métrica para monitorar riscos ligados aos Objectives.,“…such as key performance indicators (KPI) or key risk indicators (KRI).”

Vital Signs,Conjunto de medidas fisiológicas (ex.: temperatura) usadas como Status do caso e monitoradas para identificar desvios e disparar situações.,"“The status of a case can be seen as a set of critical values related to attributes of the artifacts… These attributes are defined prior the case instantiation.” / “In this example, it was inserted the attributes ‘temperature’ … inside the item ‘Vitals Signs’ …”  "
Body Temperature,Valor específico do conjunto de Vital Signs
column2: utilizado como métrica para detectar desvio (febre) e gerar Issue IS001.,“He was febrile at 38◦C.” / “Data Rule: Normal body temperature rate → 36.5◦C – 37.5◦C.”

column1: ME001,Identificador de métrica concreta associada ao Objective OBJ150 para avaliar seu cumprimento.,“The goal S001G1 is realizable through the objective OBJ150 and tactic TAC150 which has seven activities. … fulfilment of objective OBJ150 is evaluated through the metric ME001.”
Rimini and Roberti 2008 - Business process monitoring - BT Italy case study.pdf
Indicador de Performance (KPI),Como é usado no texto / Finalidade,Evidência textual (trecho entre aspas)
Order to Bill time (lead time fim-a-fim),Mede o tempo total do pedido até a cobrança
column2: permite quebrar o lead time por atividades e monitorar desempenho de ponta a ponta.,“Time and quality classes are calculated for all completed order … In this way it is possible to break an end-to-end lead time into the lead time of the activities which compose them.” / Tabela 1: “Order to Bill time”

column1: Order to Delivery time,Mede o tempo do pedido até a entrega
column2: utilizado como indicador específico de tempo dentro do processo.,Tabela 1: “Order to delivery time”

column1: % of delivered-on-time orders,Indicador de pontualidade
column2: mostra a proporção de pedidos concluídos dentro do prazo.,Tabela 1: “% of delivered-on-time orders”

column1: % of delivered orders without de-validation,Indicador de qualidade
column2: avalia entregas sem necessidade de retrabalho (de-validação).,Tabela 1: “% of delivered orders without de-validation”

column1: # of de-validations,"Conta ocorrências de retrabalho/revalidação, refletindo falhas de qualidade.",Tabela 1: “# of de-validations”
# of undeliverable orders,"Mede quantidade de pedidos impossíveis de entregar, sinalizando problemas de qualidade ou viabilidade.",Tabela 1: “# undeliverable orders”
# of work-in-progress (WIP) orders,Volume de pedidos em andamento
column2: usado para carga de trabalho e gargalos.,Tabela 1: “# of work-in-progress orders”

column1: # of work-in-progress-and-late orders,Volume de WIP que já está em atraso
column2: foca na parcela crítica a ser tratada.,Tabela 1: “# of work-in-progress-and-late orders”

column1: Total Revenues on the Fiscal Year (FY),Indicador econômico agregado
column2: permite priorizar ações pelo valor financeiro.,Tabela 1: “Total Revenues on the fiscal year”

column1: Total Revenues on the FY on process X,"Mesma lógica anterior, mas segmentado por processo, permitindo foco financeiro específico.",Tabela 1: “Total revenues on the FY on process X”
Revenues immobilized in work-in-progress orders,Mostra quanto de receita está “presa” em pedidos não concluídos
column2: auxilia priorização de pedidos de maior valor.,"“By knowing the revenues on the fiscal year of these orders, the Top Management can better prioritize actions. Such as, pushing orders that worth the most.” "

column1: Aging of late orders (ex.: >90 days),Sub-métrica derivada usada para análise de atraso
column2: segmenta WIP por faixas de idade.,“users can … analyze orders that are more than 90 days late”

column1: Lead time of each activity,Derivação do lead time geral
column2: permite atribuir responsabilidades a estruturas organizacionais específicas.,“Each activity is uniquely associated to an organizational structure. In this way it is possible to measure each process player’s contribution to the overall process performance.”

column1: Volume share por sub-processo (pie chart de WIP),Percentual de WIP em cada sub-processo usado para identificar sobrecarga (“overloaded sub-process”).,“volumes of work-in-progress orders are represented trough a pie chart… In this way user can immediately understand which the overloaded sub-process is.”
Hernaus et al. 2012 - Influence of strategic approach to BPM on financial and non-financial performance.pdf
Performance Metric,How It Is Used / Described in the Text,Evidence / Citation from the Article
Return on Assets (ROA),Presented as a traditional financial KPI
column2: later used as one of the survey items to benchmark financial performance against industry average.,1) “Most generally used financial measures include return on assets (ROA) …”  2) Survey item FP2: “Return on assets (ROA) of the firm is significantly higher than industry average.”

column1: Return on Equity (ROE),Cited among classical accounting-based indicators of organisational performance.,"“Most generally used financial measures include return on assets (ROA), return on equity (ROE) …”"
Return on Investment (ROI),Listed as a conventional financial performance measure that dominated early research.,“Most generally used financial measures include … return on investment (ROI) …”
Profit Margin,Named as a widely adopted financial measure in traditional performance systems.,“Most generally used financial measures include … profit margin …”
Earnings per Share,Mentioned as another traditional shareholder-oriented indicator.,“… earnings per share …”
Value per Employee,Highlighted as a people-oriented financial indicator (later operationalised as ‘value added per employee’).,“… value per employee …”
Value Added per Employee,Used in the survey to compare labour productivity with industry peers.,Survey item FP3: “Value added per employee is significantly higher than industry average.”
Profitability Increase,Used as a relative financial outcome variable in the survey (growth vs. industry).,Survey item FP1: “Profitability of the firm increases faster compared to industry average.”

Sales per Employee,Quoted as a productivity-type metric that showed correlation with BPM adoption in an earlier study.,“Introducing BPM practices seems to be correlated with the productivity measure sales by employees …”
Revenue,Identified as a potential positive output of effective process measurement.,“… potentially leads to significant financial and non-financial improvements (e.g. increased revenue …)”
Cost Reduction,Listed among typical economic gains expected from PPM.,“… potentially leads to significant financial and non-financial improvements (e.g. … cost reduction …)”
Cycle-time Improvement,Cited as a process-level efficiency metric enabled by PPM.,“… potential gains include … cycle-time improvement …”
Customer Satisfaction,Referenced as a key non-financial outcome
column2: also part of the broader ‘external stakeholder’ construct.,“… increased customer satisfaction …”
column3: ESM3: “Reputation of our company in eyes of the customers has improved.”

column1: Customer Retention,Operationalised directly in the questionnaire as keeping existing clients and attracting new ones.,ESM1: “We retain existing clients and manage to attract new-ones.”
Number of Customer Complaints,Used inversely to gauge service quality within the non-financial block.,ESM2: “The number of customer complaints within the last period has increased strongly.”
Response Time to Customer Complaints,Process-effectiveness indicator captured in the BPM dimension.,BPM1: “Response time to customer complaints is well above industry average.”
Service Error / Waste Level,Quality-oriented process defect metric benchmarked against competitors.,BPM2: “Service error level (waste level) is much lower than our competitors’.”
Product / Service Quality,Assessed comparatively versus industry
column2: part of external stakeholder measures.,ESM6: “Quality of our products is well above the industry average.”

column1: Reputation,Used as a perception-based external stakeholder metric.,ESM3: “Reputation of our company in eyes of the customers has improved.”
Relations with Suppliers,Broader relationship-quality indicator
column2: treated in survey as a non-financial outcome.,ESM4: “We consider our relations with suppliers to be excellent because we maintain genuine partnerships with them.”

column1: Mutual Trust with Suppliers,Specific relational capital measure between firm and suppliers.,ESM5: “There is a mutual trust between our company and our suppliers.”
Employee Productivity,Explicitly benchmarked against industry inside the HRM block.,HRM2: “Productivity of employees is much higher than industry average.”
Employee Turnover / Net Fluctuation,Negative HR metric signalling retention problems.,HRM1: “The net fluctuation of employees is very high within our company.”
Employee Commitment,Soft HR attitude indicator (absence denotes potential risk).,HRM3: “Employees do not feel special commitment to the organization.”
Absenteeism,HR health / engagement proxy compared to competitors.,HRM4: “Absenteeism is in our company (relative to competition) very high.”
Employee Satisfaction,Mentioned generally as a possible PPM benefit (not directly surveyed).,“… potential gains include … employee satisfaction …”
Added Value,Named among broad improvements that PPM can yield.,"“… increased revenue, cost reduction, cycle-time improvement, increased customer satisfaction, added value …”"
Better Collaboration,Cited as an organisational benefit stemming from process focus.,"“… increased customer satisfaction, added value, employee satisfaction, better collaboration …”"

Number of New Products Developed,"Included in literature review as a modern, non-financial indicator.",“… organisations started to implement increasingly non-financial performance measures such as … number of new products developed.”
Tsirukis and Reklaitis 1993 - Feature extraction algorithms for constrained global optimization II. Batch process scheduling application.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal do texto
Makespan,Objetivo principal de otimização
column2: minimizado para avaliar a qualidade de um cronograma ou solução.,"""Cost = max{Tp}""
column3: ""The objective of the scheduling efforts is to minimize the makespan.""  "

column1: Average makespan,Medida computada para caracterizar cada hiperr-retângulo
column2: usada na classificação de sub-espaços e na escolha de quais regiões refinar ou descartar.,"""each hyper-rectangle is represented by a data point … with the x-coordinate corresponding to the average makespan (characterization measure)""  "

column1: Locally optimal makespan,Medida absoluta (y-axis nos diagramas) utilizada para aferir a qualidade real de cada hiperr-retângulo e calibrar a classificação.,"""and the y-coordinate representing the locally optimal makespan (objective quality measure)""  "
Correlação (correlation coefficient),Indicador de acurácia da classificação
column2: avalia a relação entre média calculada e valor real da métrica-objetivo.,"""The correlation coefficient of 0.79 indicates that the computed performance measure is correlated with the objective measure.""
column3: """"The correlation coefficient of the augmented data set is 0.9""""""  "

column1: Número de classes na distribuição,Usado para detectar degenerescência da classificação
column2: mais classes distintas indicam melhor discriminação entre regiões.,"""distributed them into 50 classes … If the classification is degenerate, then the decision subspaces are distributed into a limited number of classes.""  "

column1: Número de hiperr-retângulos por classe,Serve como métrica de degenerescência
column2: grande concentração em poucas classes indica perda de informação.,"""Notice that 60 percent of the partition members are accumulated in a single class.""  "

column1: Cardinalidade do conjunto-cobertura (cover set),"Parâmetro-chave do algoritmo de refinamento
column2: influencia memória, tempo e qualidade das soluções.","""The cardinality of the covering set is kept below a prespecified limit.""
column3: tabelas 15–16 usam """"Cover set cardinality""""  "

column1: Número de iterações,Mede o esforço do algoritmo de refinamento ou de GA até se obter determinada solução.,"""Table 15 … along with the corresponding number of iterations.""  "
Tempo de CPU,Mede eficiência computacional dos métodos comparados.,"""One thousand iterations of the 4-moment algorithm require 720 cpu seconds on a SUN SPARCstation I""
column2: fig. 14 usa eixo """"CPU mins""""  "

column1: Fitness da string (função Ft(Sθ)),Métrica global no GA que combina valor médio da função-objetivo e penalidade de inviabilidade.,"""FtS(θ) = f(θ) + R Σ(1 – pi(θ))""  "
Medida de inviabilidade (Σ(1 – pi(θ))),Componente da fitness que quantifica o grau em que uma solução viola restrições
column2: controla evolução para regiões factíveis.,"""Small changes in the string feasibility result in significant change in the global optimality measure (23).""  "

column1: Probabilidade de tarefa limitante (Pr[TA > t]),Indicador probabilístico de desempenho de operação individual
column2: usado para demonstrar vantagem da abordagem multi-momentos.,"""The probability that task A is cycle-time limiting is: … 0.6""
column3: ""Task B is cycle-time limiting with 84 percent probability.""  "

column1: Tempo médio de processamento (E[TA]),Usado como estimativa da duração de uma tarefa e como insumo na comparação entre métodos de estimativa.,"""the average processing time of task A is equal to 0.25 … using the maximum entropy method the average processing time is E[TA] = 0.142""  "
Tempo de ciclo (cycle time) e Tempo de conclusão (completion time),Variáveis de desempenho do cronograma
column2: compõem o cálculo do makespan e a avaliação de gargalos.,"""The batch processing time … The group cycle time … determines the production line cycle time""
column3: ""The completion time of product p is computed as follows …"""

column1: Panfilov et al. 2021 - Digital Ecosystem-Based KPI-Driven Railway Communication Network Reporting System.pdf
Indicador,Uso no texto,Evidência textual

KPI (Key Performance Indicator) genérico,Usado como conceito central para medir o desempenho dos processos e da rede de comunicação ferroviária.,“…design and development of the KPI-Driven Railway Communication Network Reporting System …” (resumo)

KPI operacional,Indicadores para acompanhamento de curto prazo (“operacionais”) da rede.,“…model the KPIs data preparation process for operational and analytical KPIs in the Railway Communication Network.” (Introdução)
KPI analítico,Indicadores voltados a análise e decisão estratégica (“analytical”).,“…methodology for operational and analytical KPI data processing.” (Conclusão)

Número de incidentes (Incidents count),Metrifica falhas/ocorrências na rede e é a base dos KPIs testados no protótipo.,"“KPIs data … included all incidents, occurred in the railway communication network in a week period.” (Resumo)"

Indicadores compostos (Composite indicators),Derivados de KPIs e demais métricas para benchmarking de desempenho.,“…used for generating composite indicators to be used in performance benchmarking with the best in industry…” (Metodologia)
Benchmarking de desempenho (Performance benchmarking),Comparar os KPIs/indicadores da companhia com os melhores do setor.,“…performance benchmarking with the best in industry…” (Metodologia)
Retorno sobre o investimento (Return on investments),Medidor derivado para verificar se os investimentos entregam resultado.,“…besides verifying the return on investments.” (Metodologia)

Progresso em metas estratégicas e operacionais,Usado para avaliar avanço da empresa em seus objetivos.,“KPIs are used to determine a progress in achieving strategic and operational goals of a company…” (Metodologia)
Indicadores de desempenho (Performance indicators),Termo geral para quaisquer métricas monitoradas na solução.,“…monitor performance indicators with a minimum time lag…” (Metodologia)
Tempestividade (Timeliness / time-lag),Medida de quão rápido os dados chegam ao usuário
column2: afeta a tomada de decisão.,“Industry specifics dictate the need to monitor performance indicators with a minimum time lag in order to respond to changes in a timely manner.” (Metodologia)

column1: Confiabilidade (Reliability),Indicador citado em contexto de otimização da rede ferroviária.,Título de referência citada: “Reliability Optimization of a Railway Network.” (Referências)

Risco e resiliência (Risk and resilience),Indicadores para avaliar robustez da rede ferroviária.,Título de referência citada: “A Risk and Resilience Assessment Approach for Railway Networks.” (Referências)
Velásquez et al. 2024 - A Systematic Literature Review of the Analysis of Costs and Other Dimensions in Process Mining and Related Disciplines.pdf
Performance_Indicator,How_it_is_used_in_the_text,Evidence_from_the_text
Activity cost (fixed amount),Used as a performance indicator representing a constant cost for the execution of an activity.,“activity costs can be described either as a fixed amount”

Activity cost (variable – resource based),Indicator where the cost of an activity varies according to the type of resource that performs it.,“activity costs can be described … or one that depends on variables such as the type of resource”

Activity cost (variable – duration based),Indicator where the cost of an activity varies with its execution time.,“activity costs can be described … or one that depends on variables such as … the activity duration”
Aggregated cost,Metric that sums the costs already incurred along the executed part of a case or process.,“visualization of either aggregated … costs in a process model”
Remaining cost,Metric that shows the costs still expected for the unfinished part of a case or process.,“visualization of either aggregated or remaining costs in a process model”
Sum cost per activity,"Total cost accumulated for each activity across all cases, used for comparison.","“showing metrics, such as the sum … costs, per activity”"
Average cost per activity,"Mean (average) cost of executing an activity, used to benchmark typical performance.","“showing metrics, such as the … average … costs, per activity”"
Minimum cost per activity,"Lowest observed cost for an activity, used to identify best-case performance.","“showing metrics, such as the … min … costs, per activity”"
Maximum cost per activity,"Highest observed cost for an activity, used to detect costly outliers.","“showing metrics, such as the … max costs, per activity”"
Cost estimation,Task of predicting the costs that a process will incur.,“Cost estimation: the proposed method is concerned with the estimation of costs associated to the process.”
Cost reporting,Producing systematic reports that describe cost-related performance of a process.,“cost reporting and cost prediction”
Cost prediction,Forecasting future costs based on historical event-log data.,“cost reporting and cost prediction”

Cost-benefit analysis,Comparing expected benefits with costs to decide the optimal course of action.,“a cost-benefit analysis strategy that uses performance indicators to find the optimal benefit is proposed”
Hourly cost rate,Indicator that expresses the cost incurred per hour of work or resource usage.,“Calculating hourly cost rates in project-based industries—Part 2”
Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE),"Composite KPI that measures availability, performance and quality of equipment
column2: used to evaluate manufacturing effectiveness.",reference [55] mentions “overall equipment effectiveness”

column1: Efficiency,Dimension/indicator used together with cost and time to evaluate process performance.,"“one of the uncommon dimensions is efficiency, which was utilised jointly with cost and time dimensions”"

Productivity,Indicator considered together with cost and quality to guide process improvement.,"“second uncommon dimension included in the literature is productivity, which was used in conjunction with the cost and quality dimensions”"
Time,"Core performance dimension measuring duration, throughput or speed of a process.","“Three main dimensions can be identified: time, cost, and quality.”"
Quality,Dimension evaluating conformance or defect level of process outputs.,"“Three main dimensions can be identified: time, cost, and quality.”"

Flexibility,Dimension assessing the ability of a process to cope with variation and change.,"“devil’s quadrangle (DQ) depicts the process performance according to four dimensions: time, cost, quality and flexibility”"
Resource utilisation,Perspective focusing on allocation and consumption of resources during a process.,“resources could be allocated while considering the costs associated to these allocations”

Performance indicators (generic),Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) used to compare ideal and empirical values for any dimension.,“These indicators allow the performance of a process to be analyzed by comparing ideal values with empirical values”

Devil’s Quadrangle (DQ) composite measure,"Framework that evaluates process performance simultaneously on time, cost, quality and flexibility dimensions.","“the devil’s quadrangle (DQ) depicts the process performance according to four dimensions: time, cost, quality and flexibility”"
Chen et al. 2009 - An integrated framework for service engineering - a case study in the financial services industry.pdf
Performance Metric,How it is Used in the Text,Evidence / Citation

Business-IT Scorecard: LTA relevance & project alignment,Used as a governance KPI to judge if Living Target Architectures (LTAs) are relevant to the business and if technology projects follow the architectural roadmap.,"“…one of the scorecard measures was ‘LTA’s are relevant to the business and clearly state so via their roadmaps, and technology projects are aligned to the roadmaps’.”"
Business-IT Scorecard: Business satisfaction with IT services,Collected regularly to measure how well IT services meet business expectations
column2: part of the balanced-scorecard approach.,“BFE used a scorecard approach [14] to measuring business satisfaction with IT services and performance.”

column1: Availability target – 99.9 % (system-wide),Quality-attribute requirement (SLA) set by the business for the overall solution.,“…the business defined availability targets at 99.9 % for the entire system.”
Availability constraint – 99.7 % (network),Lower-level availability limit coming from infrastructure
column2: drives architectural trade-offs.,“…architects identified a constraint that the network infrastructure was only available at 99.7 %…”

column1: Component-level availability %,Legacy SLA metric that counted how many technical components met their availability goals.,“…SLA reports generated on a component-by-component basis might show superb performance against SLAs for 19 out of 20 components…”

Business-function availability %,Re-designed SLA metric that measures the percentage of key business functions (Layer-2 processes) actually available to users.,“…the practice now reports not on what percent of components were available but on what percent of key business functions were available.”
Weekly SLA report on high-value functions,Operational report that tracks availability of 34 critical Layer-2 processes
column2: feeds service-support activities.,“…weekly SLA reports were developed which reflected availability of the high value business functions at the Layer 1 process level.”

column1: Service Level Management (SLM) scorecard for SLM reporting usefulness,Measures the degree to which business units feel SLM reporting supports business functions.,“…specific scorecard measures were used to reflect the degree to which the business units felt the SLM reporting and performance supported business functions.”
Time-to-market: 3-month deployment,Measures delivery speed
column2: cited as evidence of SOA agility (2000 users in 3 months).,"“…new services… were deployed quickly (e.g., to over 2000 users in 3 months), greatly improving the end user and customer experience…”"

column1: Number of users served (2 000+),Scale metric demonstrating reach/ adoption of the new service release.,"“…deployed quickly (e.g., to over 2000 users in 3 months)…”"

Double-digit profit / annual growth rate,Financial performance indicator for overall enterprise benefit across the 3-year study window.,“BFE has had a double digit profit and annual growth rate during the three-year period of the study…”
Customer satisfaction index,Business outcome KPI linked to earlier communication of closing-cost variation and improved workflows.,“…these improvements have led to increased customer satisfaction…”

Cross-sell rate to existing customers,Revenue-related KPI correlated to customer-satisfaction gains enabled by new services.,“…increased customer satisfaction which in turn correlates to increased cross-sell of financial products /services to existing customers.”

Workflow efficiency (queue management),Process-efficiency indicator gained from end-to-end workflow visibility and single data source.,"“…greatly improved efficiency, for example, by managing end-to-end workflows so that participants… manage their workload queues more efficiently.”"
Adams et al. 2025 - Addressing the Contemporary Challenges of Business Process Compliance - The Case for Process Mining in the Banking Industry.pdf
Metric,Use in Text,Evidence (exact text fragment)
Detailed violation metrics,Measure number / type of rule breaches and support compliance reporting,"“Detailed violation metrics are regarded as a key BPC requirement [RS10, RS12, RS20] …”  "

Fuzzy violation metric,Alternative compliance measure that expresses degree rather than binary result,"“… with a range of metrics, e.g., ‘fuzzy’ metrics, measuring compliance and conformance is not always straightforward [RS1, RS12, RS31].”  "
Frequency metric (F2.7),Counts occurrences of events / activities in the log,“pre-defined metrics covering frequency (F2.7) … will allow users to satisfy this BPCC.”
Love and Holt 2000 - Construction business performance measurement - The SPM alternative.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho ou parágrafo onde aparece)
Eficiência,Exemplo de métrica financeira/tradicional empregada por empresas de construção.,"“…performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”"
Return on capital employed,Idem: medida financeira tradicional.,"“…performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”"
Lucratividade / Profitability,Idem: foco no ‘bottom-line’.,"“…performance measures, such as efficiency, return on capital employed, and profitability.”"
Aspectos financeiros em geral,Criticados por serem excessivamente utilizados como indicadores únicos.,"“over-rely on financial aspects (Clarke and Clegg, 1999)
Qualidade,Indicador não-financeiro frequentemente negligenciado.,"“lack strategic focus and fail to provide data on quality, responsiveness and flexibility (Skinner, 1974)
Responsividade / Responsiveness,Idem qualidade – faltam dados sobre essa dimensão.,"“fail to provide data on quality, responsiveness and flexibility (Skinner, 1974)
Flexibilidade,Idem qualidade – faltam dados sobre essa dimensão.,"“fail to provide data on quality, responsiveness and flexibility (Skinner, 1974)
Satisfação do cliente,Indicador de desempenho específico sugerido na literatura.,"“customer satisfaction (Berry et al., 1994)”"
Satisfação do empregado,Indicador de desempenho específico sugerido na literatura.,"“employee satisfaction (House and Price, 1991)”"
Sucesso do negócio / Business success,Dimensão de desempenho explorada por autores.,"“business success (Chakravarthy, 1988)”"

Essential Business Drivers (BD),Conjunto de fatores críticos que determinam o futuro do negócio.,“BPM should look beyond traditional financial metrics and embrace essential business drivers (BD) that determine and influence a company’s future business…”
Productivity,Determinante de sucesso competitivo e métrica de desempenho.,"“embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation, and social contribution.”"
Innovation,Determinante de sucesso competitivo.,"“embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation, and social contribution.”"
Social contribution / Contribuição social,Determinante de sucesso competitivo (stakeholder).,"“embracing quality, flexibility, productivity, innovation, and social contribution.”"
Competitive ability / Capacidade competitiva,Indicador sistêmico dentro do SPM.,"“reflected in measures of competitive ability, productivity and quality.”"
Output,Elemento do ‘bottom line’ financeiro.,"“monetary aspects (e.g. productivity, output, efficiency, profit, liquidity, asset structure)”"
Liquidez,Indicador financeiro clássico.,"“monetary aspects (e.g. productivity, output, efficiency, profit, liquidity, asset structure)”"
Estrutura de ativos / Asset structure,Indicador financeiro clássico.,"“monetary aspects (e.g. productivity, output, efficiency, profit, liquidity, asset structure)”"
Custo real por unidade / Real unit cost,Resultado utilizado para aferir estratégia.,"“financial performance, and real unit cost.”"
Captura de mercado / Market capture,Resultado de estratégia medido.,“extent of targeted market capture”

Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal extraída do texto

Tempo de processamento para 10.000 linhas,Usado como referência inicial de desempenho antes de otimizações,"“The first time we initiated a query … we had something like 10,000 rows of data … and the resulting computation ran for seven or eight hours.”  "

Tempo de processamento para 1.000.000 de linhas (primeira otimização),Mostra evolução de performance após otimizações,"“By early 2023, we were on pace to process a million rows in less than a few minutes.”  "

Tempo de processamento para 1.000.000 de linhas (2-party computation),Benchmark de produção para cálculo de dois participantes,"“with a two-party computation, we now can process a million rows in two minutes …”  "
Custo por 1.000.000 de linhas (2-party computation),Mede eficiência econômica do cálculo de dois participantes,“…process a million rows in two minutes for about a dollar.”

Tempo de processamento para 1.000.000 de linhas (cálculo cross-media),Benchmark de desempenho para cálculo multi-parte (WFA),“The cross-media calculation … currently is capable of working through a million rows in four minutes …”
Custo por 1.000.000 de linhas (cálculo cross-media),Mede custo operacional do cálculo multi-parte,“…in four minutes at a cost of about $15.”

Tempo de processamento para 1.000.000 de linhas (projeto IPA),Indica desempenho ainda a ser otimizado no caso de múltiplos navegadores,"“…a year ago, that took between 100 and 200 minutes. Now, we’re down to something between 50 and 60 minutes.”  "
Escala alvo em número de linhas,Usado como métrica de escalabilidade necessária para adoção ampla,“…what about 10 billion rows? What about 100 billion?”

Requisito de largura de banda (5G),Aponta que a disponibilidade de banda 5G é métrica crítica para viabilizar MPC móvel,“edge nodes are much more powerful and 5G networks offer enough bandwidth to handle DARPA-scale workloads.”

Melhora percentual na taxa de detecção de fraude,Serve como métrica de eficácia de modelos construídos com MPC,“…we were able to demonstrate up to a 20 percent improvement in the fraud-detection rate.”
Ogbuachi et al. 2022 - A Framework for Quantifiable Process Improvement through Method Fragments in Situational Method Engineering.pdf
metric,como é usado no texto,evidência textual
Time (duração),métrica central na definição do caminho crítico
column2: variável a ser minimizada no crashing
column3: medida exibida no gráfico de redução cumulativa de tempo,“minimizing … while also minimizing process duration”
column4: Fig. 4 “Cumulative time reduction … (Time (weeks))”

column1: Cost (custo total),utilizada em conjunto com tempo no problema de crashing
column2: aumento de custo avaliado após otimização,“minimization of project crashing costs”
column3: “acceptable increase of the total project cost by 6.37 % for the added resources”

column1: Cost slope sᵢ,"coeficiente de variação custo/tempo de cada atividade, aparece na função-objetivo do LP","Eq.(1) “min ∑ sᵢ xᵢ (where sᵢ is the cost slope, determined as Δcost/Δtime)”"
Time reduction xᵢ,variável de decisão que indica quanto tempo cada atividade será reduzida,Eq.(1) “xᵢ is the amount of reduction”
Start time yᵢ,"variável que marca o instante de início de cada atividade, usada nas restrições de precedência",Eq.(1) “yᵢ is the starting time (yᵢ+1 … yf inal)”
Maximum time reduction uᵢ,limite superior permitido para redução de cada atividade,Eq.(1) “xᵢ ≤ uᵢ”
Normal duration dᵢ,"duração original (não crashada) de cada atividade, usada nas restrições temporais",Eq.(1) “dᵢ is the normal duration”
Desired finishing time T,meta de término do projeto imposta como restrição,Eq.(1) “yf inal ≤ T (desired finishing time)”
Project duration (y_final),"duração global resultante, monitorada para atender às restrições de prazo",Eq.(1) “yf inal …”
column2: texto “reducing the time of completion of a project (identified by the critical path)”

column1: Quality,incluída como variável adicional no modelo ILP citado para evitar falhas de projeto,"“incorporated time, cost, quality and safety as variables in the optimization”"
Safety,outra variável do modelo ILP para avaliação de risco/segurança,idem acima

Generalized cost (peso de caminho),combinação linear de métricas que permite atribuir peso a cada caminho do processo,"“paths in a PS … can be weighed based, for instance, on a linear composition of the aforementioned metrics (which practically constitute the ‘generalized costs’ of the nodes)”"

Personnel allocation,métrica derivada do contexto usada para otimizar distribuição de recursos humanos,"“managing the allocation of personnel … can also be tackled. This type of information, while being considered as a metric … derives from the situational context”"
Operational speed,indicador de desempenho melhorado através de maior coordenação de pessoal,“improving the coordination of highly skilled personnel … increased the overall operational speed”

Technological stack performance,métrica implícita (testes estatísticos sobre modelos ML) para avaliar melhorias tecnológicas,“inclusion of statistical testing tools to perform more thorough comparisons of different ML inference models”
Cumulative time reduction,medida gráfica do ganho total de tempo após o crashing,Fig. 4 mostra curvas “Initial Process Time” vs “Crushed Process Time”
Additional project cost (%),"percentual de aumento de custo após otimização, usado para aferir viabilidade",“acceptable increase of the total project cost by 6.37 %”

Redução no custo de entrega de serviços,Indicador de eficiência financeira associado ao projeto WMS.,“Reduction in the cost of service delivery for government and better allocation of resources…”

Performance metrics de entrega de programas,Conjunto de métricas que subsidiam análise de desempenho de programas.,“Performance metrics support analysis of program delivery performance”
Uso de Process Design focado no cliente,Mede aumento qualitativo na adoção de design de processos centrados no cliente.,“Increased usage of customer focussed Process Design.”

Respostas a consultas sobre visão de processos,Indicador quantitativo de engajamento dos usuários internos com modelos de processo.,“Number of responses to enquiries in relation to process views of services.”
Nº de participantes em treinamentos & % de feedback positivo,Avalia alcance e qualidade das ações de capacitação em BPM.,“Number of attendees and percentage of post training positive feedback…”

% de processos submetidos à QA antes da aprovação (100 %),Garante que todos os processos passem por Assurance antes de serem aprovados.,“100 percent of DHS processes required for Process Owner approval are first subjected to Quality Assurance.”

Nº de acessos (site hits) nos pontos de acesso BPM CoE,Mede utilização das plataformas de informação sobre processos.,“Number of site hits on BPM CoE access points.”
Redução de modelos que exigem intervenção manual para QA,Indicador de melhoria da qualidade automática de modelos.,“Reduction in number of models that need manual intervention for QA adherence.”

Aceitação do novo ciclo de vida da informação por ICT,Mede adesão das equipes de TI ao processo de informações de BPM.,“Greater acceptance of new streamlined process information lifecycle approach by ICT.”

BPA endossada,Verifica existência/atualização da Arquitetura de Processo aprovada.,“Endorsed BPA.”

metric_name,usage_in_text,evidence

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Generic business metric used by BAM for monitoring performance of business processes.,"“business activity monitoring (BAM) technology enables continuous, near real-time event-based monitoring of business processes based on key business metrics, also known as key performance indicators (KPI) [11].”"
Order fulfilment lead time,Measures the time from the reseller receiving the purchase order until the customer’s While loop completes
column2: presented as example of a cross-organisational process metric to be computed through event correlation.,"“consider, for example, the metric order fulfilment lead time which could be measured in our scenario from the start of the activity Receive PO in the reseller process until the While Loop completes in the customer process.”"

column1: CustomerAOrderFulfillmentTime,Concrete complex-event metric produced by the reseller
column2: calculated by subtracting timestamps of 'OrderReceived' and 'ShipmentReceived' events for Customer A and published to the customer.,"Listing 3: complexEventDefinition name=\CustomerAOrderFulfillmentTime\"" … CEP statement: “abs(b.timestamp - a.timestamp) AS metricValue”"""

column1: Order processing duration,Example metric that requires correlation of events across two participants (Receive PO ↔ Receive Shipment Acknowledgment)
column2: used to motivate need for choreography-instance identifiers.,"“Considering, for example, the calculation of the order processing duration between the activity Receive PO and Receive Shipment Acknowledgment in our scenario.”"

column1: Service availability,Named as a typical technical QoS metric governed by SLAs in cross-organisational settings.,"“Service Level Agreements (SLA) … agree on certain service QoS, typically technical characteristics such as availability and response time [6].”"
Service response time,Another typical QoS performance metric mentioned in the SLA context.,same sentence as above: “… typically technical characteristics such as availability and response time [6].”
Caldwell 2006 - Cost - Performance - A Business Discipline.pdf
metric,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto
Cost/Performance (C/P),"Medidor-síntese de eficiência corporativa
column2: razão entre baixo custo e alta performance, utilizado como disciplina para orientar investimentos, alinhar recursos e gerar valor.",“Cost / Performance is a business goal / objective that focuses on obtaining the best Cost / Performance ratio possible.”

column1: Cost/Performance Ratio,"Razão quantitativa que expressa o nível de custos versus desempenho
column2: quanto maior (baixo custo / alta performance), melhor o resultado para stakeholders.","“As a rule, the greater the Cost / Performance ratio (low cost / high performance), the more people are focused on doing the right things.”"

column1: ROI (Return on Investment),"Usado para justificar e priorizar projetos, apoiar análises de C/P e acelerar a entrega de benefícios.",“Cost / Performance supported by ROI analysis and quick delivery represents the new paradigm for business.”

Cycle Times,Mede a duração dos processos e é avaliado em conjunto com ROI para identificar oportunidades de melhoria.,"“…methodologies used to assess applications, practices, cycle times / ROI and core competencies…”"
Hidden Costs,Mensura despesas não visíveis (principalmente em pessoas e informação) que reduzem a performance
column2: sua identificação é requisito para elevar C/P.,"“Hidden costs are difficult to measure, and even harder to control. Costs are hidden in people and information (Figure 2).”"

column1: Governance & Compliance Spend (% do PIB),Indicador macro de impacto dos requisitos regulatórios na economia
column2: usado para dimensionar o problema e priorizar ações de C/P.,"“In 2005, governance and compliance practices impacted over $3.4 trillion in US spending — 28 percent of US GDP.”"

column1: Overhead Corporativo (% do PIB),Sub-métrica derivada de Hidden Costs que evidencia o peso do overhead nas empresas americanas.,“Over $1.1 trillion in US corporate expenditures (9 percent of US GDP) in 2005 was hidden in overhead.”

Activity-Based Metrics,Método de medição de custos por atividade para localizar ineficiências e sustentar decisões de C/P.,“Activity-based metrics are used to measure costs to identify deficiencies in practices.”

Stakeholder Engagement,"Indicador qualitativo que mede o grau de alinhamento e satisfação dos stakeholders, refletindo diretamente na performance corporativa.",“Stakeholder engagement is a function of understanding and satisfying collective needs and interests (Figure 3).”
Personal Bandwidth,Medida da capacidade individual de lidar com informação e tarefas
column2: valores baixos sinalizam quedas de performance.,“Personal bandwidth is at an all time low and the pace of business never slows down.”

column1: Receptivity,"Indicador comportamental usado para avaliar abertura à mudança e aprendizagem, afetando a capacidade de transformação e C/P.",“Receptivity is an important trait that is reflected in culture and adaptability characteristics.”
Proactivity (Anticipatory Practices),Mede o grau de antecipação de eventos e problemas
column2: maior proatividade eleva a agilidade e o C/P.,“Anticipatory practices help to reduce the unknown by enhancing levels of awareness.”

column1: Responsiveness,"Avalia a rapidez e precisão da resposta organizacional a mudanças, diretamente ligada ao C/P.",“Responsiveness is a function of cause and effect.”
Validation,"Métrica para comprovar a eficácia de políticas, controles e procedimentos
column2: fecha o ciclo de melhoria contínua.","“Validate and Report – How well are you performing? ... Use third-party specialists to validate the effectiveness of policies, controls and procedures.”"

column1: Sustainability Factors,Conjunto de indicadores que mede a capacidade de manter resultados de C/P ao longo do tempo.,“Cost / Performance results are based on sustainability factors and abilities to keep people engaged and focused (Figure 6).”

Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Compliance,Aderência a regras e regulamentos
column2: aumentada via RPA.,"“…auditability, security, and compliance while at the same time being easy to implement…”  "

column1: Convenience,Facilidade de uso para usuários e gestores.,"“…organizations may apply RPA for … security, convenience and compliance.”  "

Job satisfaction,Indicador de bem-estar dos funcionários após adoção de RPA.,"“…internal factors, such as … job satisfaction, process acceleration, or cost savings.”  "

Cost savings,Economia financeira resultante da automação.,"“…internal factors, such as … cost savings.”  "

Cooperation with partners and suppliers,Qualidade das relações interorganizacionais.,"“…external factors, such as customer satisfaction, cooperation with partners and suppliers…”  "
