Return on investment (ROI),Mede retorno financeiro de curto prazo da implantação de RPA.,“the apparent potential for short-term return on investment increases”
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Conjunto geral de métricas de desempenho de processo.,“help to improve process key performance indicators (KPIs)”
Khan et al. 2023 - Semantic Representation of Key Performance Indicators Categories for Prioritization.pdf
Performance_Indicator,How_Used_in_Text,Evidence_Excerpt
Short-term indicator,Measures very near-term objectives such as daily production goals,"“Short term indicators … are set for short-term goals e.g., production target for tomorrow” (Table 2).  "
Long-term indicator,Tracks strategic or enduring objectives such as product quality over time,"“Long term indicators … are selected for long-term goals e.g., product quality” (Table 2).  "
Qualitative indicator,Assesses relationship/attitudinal aspects such as customer feelings,"“Qualitative indicators … belong to the relationship e.g., customer satisfaction” (Table 2).  "
Lehnert et al. 2018 - Prioritization of Interconnected Processes.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho entre aspas)
Time,Dimensão de desempenho avaliada individualmente e integrada na priorização,"""via performance indicators (e.g., time, cost, ﬂexibility, or quality)"""
Cost,Dimensão de desempenho avaliada individualmente e integrada na priorização,"""via performance indicators (e.g., time, cost, ﬂexibility, or quality)"""
Quality,Dimensão de desempenho avaliada individualmente e integrada na priorização,"""via performance indicators (e.g., time, cost, ﬂexibility, or quality)"""
Flexibility,Dimensão de desempenho avaliada individualmente (citada no Devil’s Quadrangle),"""via performance indicators (e.g., time, cost, ﬂexibility, or quality)"""
Net Present Value (NPV),Indicador de desempenho integrado usado em abordagens existentes,"""integrated performance indicators (e.g., net present value or stakeholder service gap perception)"""

Stakeholder Service Gap Perception,Indicador de desempenho integrado usado em abordagens existentes,"""integrated performance indicators (e.g., net present value or stakeholder service gap perception)"""

Value Contribution of a Process,Indicador integrado para priorizar processos em estudos anteriores,"""examples for integrated performance indicators are the value contribution of a process (Buhl et al. 2011)"""
Return on Process Transformation,Indicador integrado para priorizar processos em estudos anteriores,"""the return on process transformation (vom Brocke and Sonnenberg 2015)"""
Aggregated Cash-Flow Deviation from Threshold,Indicador integrado para priorização de processos,"""the aggregated cash ﬂow deviation from a threshold (Manderscheid et al. 2015)"""
Business Value Score,Indicador integrado para priorização de processos,"""the business value score (Bandara et al. 2015)"""

Individual Need for Improvement Index (PNI),Mede a disfunção / necessidade de melhoria do processo em cada dimensão,"""and the processes’ individual need for improvement index (Lehnert et al. 2015)"""
Process Costs per Execution,Indicador escolhido para quantificar a dimensão Custo no cálculo do PNI,"""In the cost dimension, we choose the process costs per execution"""

Lead-time,Indicador escolhido para quantificar a dimensão Tempo no cálculo do PNI,"""As for time, we choose the lead-time, covering the total time for the completion of a process instance end-to-end"""
Error Rate,Indicador escolhido para quantificar a dimensão Qualidade no cálculo do PNI,"""As for quality, we use the error rate because it has the same polarity as process costs and lead-time"""
Difference entre Estado Atual e Alvo,Base para o cálculo do PNI e da intensidade de dependência,"""The PPR builds on the difference between the target and actual performance..."""
Amount of Executions (AE),Fator de ponderação do PNI para refletir frequência de execução,"""we multiply the difference between the actual and target states with the amount of executions AEi"""

Network-adjusted Need for Improvement Index (NPNI),Medida final usada para ranquear processos considerando interconexões,"""the PPR ranks the processes ... in line with their network-adjusted need for improvement index (NPNI)"""

Dependence Intensity (DI),Mede quão fortemente o desempenho de um processo depende de outro,"""The dependence intensity DI of a use relation indicates how strongly the performance of a using process depends on the performance of a used process"""
Number of Use Instances (NUI),Peso da relação de uso
column2: quantifica quantas vezes um processo usa outro,"""each use relation has a weight representing the number of instances a process uses another process. We refer to this weight as the number of use instances NUIij"""

column1: Number of Stand-Alone Instances (NSAI),Peso de laço próprio que indica execuções sem uso de outros processos,"""We model this number of stand-alone instances NSAI as weights of self-directed edges in the process network"""
Elhadjamor and Ghannouchi 2019 - Analyze in Depth Health Care Business Process and Key Performance Indicators using Process Mining.pdf
PerformanceIndicator,UsageInText/Efeito,Texto de Evidência

Number_of_Process_Instances,"Usado para avaliar volume de execução do processo e frequência de caminhos, possibilitando análises como “quantos casos seguem cada fluxo”.",“such as the number of instances of a business process execution”
Activity_Duration,Mede o tempo decorrido para concluir cada atividade
column2: serve para detectar gargalos (ex.: ‘consultation activity takes too much time to end’).,“the duration time of each activity”
column3: “consultation activity takes too much time to end”

column1: Activity_Frequency,Usado para identificar atividades mais executadas e caminhos principais (ex.: 67 % dos casos seguem o fluxo principal).,“the frequency of each activity”
column2: “the main process flows (67% of the log) contain 3 activities”

column1: Resource_Utilization (Who_executed_each_activity),"Indicador de carga dos recursos/atores, permitindo analisar distribuição de trabalho.","“who has executed each activity, the resources involved”"
Waiting_Time_Before_Sorting (Quanti_KPI9),Indicador quantitativo comparado a alvo (‘ok’ / ‘not ok’)

column3: “42 % … waiting time before sorting also respects the target value (ok)”

column2: avaliado em conjunto com Quanti_KPI9.,“Quali_KPI13 installation in the sorting room”
column3: “patients are satisfied to very satisfied … installation in the sorting room”

column1: Medical_Staff_Availability (Quali_KPI4),Avalia disponibilidade de médicos
column2: combinado com outros KPIs para medir impacto na experiência.,“Quali_KPI4 medical staff availability”

column1: Delayed_Emergency_Waiting_Time,Mede quanto tempo o paciente com emergência ‘retardada’ espera
column2: detectou-se excesso de tempo.,"“The process takes too much time for patients who have a delayed emergency. Especially, it takes an important waiting time before the delayed emergency starts.”"

column1: Lying_Waiting_Time,Tempo que o paciente permanece em observação (‘lying waiting’)

column1: Consultation_Duration,Duração da consulta na ‘box’

column1: Overall_Patient_Satisfaction,Mede a satisfação global do paciente no departamento de emergência

column1: Clarity_of_Doctor_Information,Indicador qualitativo sobre clareza das informações médicas
column2: apontado como ponto de insatisfação apesar de tempo adequado.,“patients are not satisfied about the clarity of information provided by doctors in this activity”

column1: Regularity_of_Doctor_Visits_in_Lying_Waiting,Indicador qualitativo que avalia frequência das visitas médicas durante observação
column2: citado como causa de insatisfação.,“Some patients are not satisfied in the lying waiting because the regularity of doctor visit is not adequate”

Metric,Usage in the text / what it measures,Evidence (exact sentence or sentence fragment from the paper)
Cost/Benefit,Suggested as a business metric for judging economic success or failure of IT systems.,“…a measure-ment for a company’s economic success or failure e.g. cost/benefit …”
Balanced Score Card-Analysis,Named as an example of a business metric for evaluating IT value.,"“…cost/benefit, Balanced Score Card-Analysis or Return on Investment calculations (ROI)…​”  "

Return on Investment (ROI),Used repeatedly to assess pay-back time of the mobile solution and cited as a KPI.,1) “…Return on Investment calculations (ROI)…​”  2) “Return on Investment was calculated as: ROI = project costs / (benefit – current costs). ROI took 1.3 years in Case Study A and 1.6 years in Case Study B.”

Service Level Agreements (SLAs),Referenced as business-critical performance agreements whose distortion indicates impact.,"“…Service Level Agreements (SLAs)…​” and “impact is a measure of business criticality, often equal to the extent to which an incident leads to distortion of agreed SLAs…”  "
Time to bill,Key performance indicator
column2: reduced about 50 % after mobile tool deployment.,“…key performance indicators (KPIs) like: time to bill…” and “Major business process improvements could be realized through the reduction of the time to bill.”

column1: Service success rate,Listed as KPI for evaluating process outcome quality.,"“…KPIs like: time to bill, service success rate, work load at the head office…”  "
Work load at the head office,KPI for internal efficiency
column2: expected to drop through autonomous information retrieval.,“…KPIs like…work load at the head office…”

column1: Paper handling time,KPI for administrative efficiency
column2: should fall when paper forms are replaced.,“…KPIs like…paper handling time…”

column1: Response time,Economic factor for business impact
column2: faster response expected through mobility.,"“…business metrics (e.g. response time, orders per day and mobile worker…)”  "

column1: Orders per day and mobile worker,Throughput metric indicating productivity of field staff.,"“…business metrics (e.g. response time, orders per day and mobile worker…)”  "
Driving time,Measured before/after deployment to show process efficiency gains.,1) “…business metrics … driving time…”  2) Table 2: “Driving time per order 45 min → 30 min”
Billing time,Named together with other economic metrics affected by mobility.,"“…business metrics (e.g. …billing time, etc.)…”  "
Communication time / effort / frequency,Process metric
column2: reduced by standardised mobile communication.,"“…communication time, communication effort and frequency…” (implied in Results section)  "

column1: Back-office calls (number of requests),Indicator of head-office workload
column2: expected to fall after mobile tool use.,Table 2: “Back office calls for in­formation retrieval 45 min → 15 min”

column1: Additional customer visits,Quality/efficiency metric caused by incomplete order data.,Table 2: “Inappropriate/Incomplete order information led to additional customer visits … 120 min → 30 min”
Working time,Part of ‘job performance data’ captured electronically for faster invoicing.,"“…job performance data access (working-, driving-time, used spare parts)…​”  "
Used spare parts (records),Accuracy of these records is a metric for inventory and billing precision.,“…job performance data access … used spare parts…”
Project costs,Element of ROI formula to compute pay-back.,“ROI = project costs / (benefit – current costs).”
Benefit,Element of ROI formula
column2: economic upside of the project.,“ROI = project costs / (benefit – current costs).”

column1: Current costs,Baseline cost used in ROI denominator.,“ROI = project costs / (benefit – current costs).”
Efficiency (productivity),Usability variable measuring ‘doing the things right’.,“They define this impact through the usability variables efficiency (e.g. productivity: doing the things right)…​”
Effectiveness (performance),Usability variable measuring ‘doing the right things’.,“…and effectiveness (e.g. performance: doing the right things).”

User satisfaction / user experience,Qualitative acceptance metrics linked to usability and participation.,"“Mayhew [35] and Nielsen [34] show the importance of the usability variables ‘user experience’, ‘user satisfaction’ and ‘user acceptance’.”  "

column2: affects ROI speed.,“…user participation … fosters tool acceptance and reduces the return on investment time.”

Severino et al. 2016 - A cross-layer QoS management framework for ZigBee cluster-tree networks.pdf
Performance Metric,How it is used in the paper,Evidence extracted from the text
Successful transmission probability,Main reliability metric
column2: TECM/TRADIF is triggered when it falls below a threshold
column3: increased up to 10 %. Defined as the number of successfully acknowledged frames divided by the traffic generated at the application layer.,“The proposed framework … improves the successful transmission probability by 10 %” (Abstract)
column4: “The successful transmission probability is calculated by the fraction between the number of successfully acknowledged frames and the traffic generated at the application layer.” (§4.1)

column1: Probability of success (per-attempt),Component of tᵢ / Tᵢ indicator
column2: used to detect collision/retransmission problems at MAC.,“the first term calculates the regular success probability metric as it is usually computed: a ratio between the number of successfully transmitted packets (c_success) and the number of packets which entered the Slotted CSMA-CA algorithm (c_success + c_fail).” (§5.3)

column1: Ratio of retransmissions,Second ratio inside tᵢ / Tᵢ
column2: detects extra attempts and energy waste.,“the second indicator takes this into consideration and shows a ratio between the number of successfully transmitted messages and the number of successfully transmitted packets. A decrease … shows that packets are not being successfully transmitted during the first attempt.” (§5.3)

column1: End-to-end delay (average),Latency metric
column2: reduced by 94 % thanks to TECM/DCS
column3: compared among scenarios.,“…reduces the end-to-end delay by 94 %.” (Abstract)
column4: “Figure 8 shows the end-to-end delays for packets … with an average end-to-end delay of 25 s … while for AM1 it is approximately 1.6 s.” (§6.2)

column1: End-to-end delay (maximum),Worst-case latency plotted in simulations in Fig. 8.,“Figure 8 presents simulation average and maximum end-to-end delays…” (§6.2)
Queue size,Memory occupation metric
column2: used in Di formula and plotted to show bottlenecks.,"“…minimizing the memory requirements per node” (Abstract)
column3: “The queue size also grows considerably, reaching the memory limit.” (§6.2)  "

column1: Queuing delay,Part of latency analysis
column2: reduced after bandwidth re-allocation.,“The largest queuing delay is by far in the Router’s queue.” (§6.2)

column1: Incoming/Outgoing traffic ratio (raw dᵢ),First part of the bandwidth indicator
column2: detects lack of bandwidth when < 1.,"“dᵢ represents the relationship between incoming and outgoing traffic, which gives a measurement of the bandwidth requirements of a node.” (§5.3)  "

column1: Smoothed bandwidth indicator (Dᵢ),"Exponential moving-average of dᵢ
column2: threshold compared (e.g., 90 %) to trigger DCS.","“To smoothen out the result … resulting in the indicator Dᵢ.” (§5.3)
column3: “As Dᵢ decreases beyond the selected threshold of 90 %, the TECM triggers the DCS/DBR…” (§6.2.1)  "

column1: Success/retransmission indicator (tᵢ),Combined (weighted) raw metric for reliability inside a window.,Equation (4) defines tᵢ with weights b and (1–b). (§5.3)
Smoothed reliability indicator (Tᵢ),Exponential moving-average of tᵢ
column2: threshold compared to trigger TRADIF.,“To smoothen out the result … resulting in the indicator Tᵢ.” (§5.3)
column3: “if Tᵢ < Threshold_TRADIF then call TRADIF-set (Inc. PS)” (Algorithm 1)

column1: Traffic rate Rᵢ,Packets delivered by NWK per sampling window
column2: used to decide when to decrease bandwidth.,“compute Rᵢ // traffic rate rᵢ ← C_NWK” (Algorithm 1)
column3: “The NWK incoming traffic rate is measured at each sampling window at the beginning of the algorithm.” (§5.4)

column1: ΔRᵢ (traffic-rate difference),Used to decide when extra bandwidth can be released.,“ΔRᵢ ← Rᵢ / DBRratios[BW] … if ΔRᵢ < Threshold_ΔR then call DCS-Set(Dec. Bandwidth)” (Algorithm 1)

Throughput,Alternative performance metric that can be requested in a TRADIF message.,“…the second indicates the metric to be affected (successful transmission probability or throughput) …” (Fig. 3 description)

Métrica,Como é usada no texto,Evidência (trecho entre aspas retirado do artigo)

Recall,"Compor métrica‐chave de qualidade de modelos descobertos, balanceada junto a outras métricas","“PD algorithms should deliver high-quality and comprehensible models … while balancing three main metrics: recall, precision, and generalization [10,13].”"
Precision,Mesma finalidade de recall
column2: medir quão exato é o modelo descoberto,"Idem citação anterior + “Precision is responsible for monitoring and assessing a correct and related event logging behavior in the discovery process (e.g., avoiding underfitting concept).”"

column1: Generalization,Avaliar capacidade do modelo aceitar novos eventos semelhantes e evitar overfitting,"Idem primeira citação + “Generalization provides the ability to find the main features of previous events … accept new similar events (e.g., avoiding overfitting concept).”"
Fitness,Mede aderência entre modelo e log
column2: valor 0 a 1,"“Fitness aims to look at the discovered model’s event log behavior (usually, a value of 0 means … while a value of 1 means perfect fitness).”"

column1: Simplicity,Critério de qualidade para manter o modelo o mais simples possível,“Simplicity is the ability to provide a model as simple as possible.”

Throughput time,"Indicador central de desempenho do processo, usado para identificar gargalos, re-trabalhos e duração de casos","Diversos trechos, p.ex.: “how is the throughput time affected by the process’s main violations?” e “Activity color emphasizes throughput time.”"

Schiefer and Seufert 2005 - Management and Controlling of Time-Sensitive Business Processes with Sense & Respond.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Process metrics,Fornecem informações de processo atuais que sustentam a tomada de decisão descentralizada e inteligente.,“- Enabling quick intelligent decentralized decision-making based on current process information and process metrics and key performance indicators.”
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),"Gerados a partir de eventos
column2: transformados, analisados e utilizados para identificar situações, exceções e apoiar decisões.","“Transformation of the captured events (raw data) into business information, such as key performance indicators, business situations and exceptions.” / “Analysis of key performance indicators and determination of root causes for business situations and exceptions.”  "

column1: Decision time,Métrica de tempo que se procura reduzir por meio de decisões automáticas baseadas em regras.,“- Reducing decision time via automated rule-based decision-making.”
Decision latency,Identificada como ponto fraco nas soluções de cadeia de suprimentos
column2: SARI visa minimizá-la.,“The least IT support in current supply chain solutions can be identified in the area of decision latency.”

column1: Response latency,Mede o tempo para iniciar e para executar/monitorar uma ação
column2: SARI distingue essas duas partes e busca reduzi-las.,“There are two kinds of response latencies: 1) the time it takes to initiate an action and 2) the time it takes to execute and monitor the action.”

column1: Production capacity,Usada junto com datas de pedido e nível de matéria-prima para calcular reposição e ajustar o plano de produção.,"“…based on the current production capacity, order dates and currently available raw materials, the optimal time and quantity for the replenishment of raw materials can be determined.”  "

Demand / Demand forecast,Serve de base para atualizar planos de produção e ajustar o bill of material após mudanças nos pedidos.,“Existing production planning systems determine the bill of material based on demand forecasts.” / “If a customer cancels a large order the demand will change accordingly and the production system is automatically adapted by SARI.”

Bill of Material,É recalculado automaticamente de acordo com a demanda atual para alinhar a produção.,"“…the required bill of material, which corresponds to the demand, will be automatically adjusted to the current level of demand.”  "

Raw material level / shortages,Monitorado para identificar faltas e acionar pedidos de reposição e alertas à gestão.,"“If SARI discovers raw material shortages, the plant management is immediately informed (Respond – Step 4).”  "

Optimal time and quantity for replenishment,Métrica calculada que indica quando e quanto material pedir para evitar faltas ou excesso.,“…the optimal time and quantity for the replenishment of raw materials can be determined.”

column1: Duan et al. 2023 - Early prediction of sepsis using double fusion of deep features and handcrafted features.pdf
metric,usage_in_text,evidence_snippet
AUC (Area Under the ROC Curve),Principal indicador de desempenho
column2: mede a capacidade do modelo de distinguir pacientes sépticos dos não-sépticos
column3: comparado entre modelos e janelas de predição
column4: apresentado nas curvas ROC.,"""The major performance indicator is the AUC score, which assesses a model’s ability to distinguish between sepsis and non-sepsis patients."""

column1: Accuracy (Acc),"Mede a proporção de predições corretas (todos os pacientes) e é calculada a partir de TP, TN, FP, FN
column2: relatada nas tabelas de resultados.","""The ability of a model to correctly identify patients is measured by its accuracy."""

column1: Sensitivity (Sens),"Capacidade do modelo identificar corretamente pacientes com sepse
column2: fixada em 0,80 para comparar especificidade
column3: fórmula apresentada.","""Sensitivity assesses a model’s ability to accurately identify patients with sepsis."""

column1: Specificity (Spec),Capacidade do modelo identificar corretamente pacientes sem sepse
column2: comparada sob sensibilidade fixa
column3: fórmula apresentada.,"""specificity assesses a model’s ability to correctly identify patients who do not have sepsis."""

column1: Positive Likelihood Ratio (LHR+),Razão entre sensibilidade e (1-especificidade)
column2: usada como métrica diagnóstica menos influenciada pela prevalência
column3: valores apresentados em gráfico.,"""LHR+ = sensitivity / (1−specificity)""
column4: """"""DFSP can provide 6.15 of LHR+ …"""""""

column1: Negative Likelihood Ratio (LHR-),Razão entre (1-sensibilidade) e especificidade
column2: também usada como métrica diagnóstica
column3: valores apresentados em gráfico.,"""LHR− = 1−sensitivity / specificity""

column1: Positive Predictive Value (PPV),Mencionada como métrica utilizada em estudos anteriores para probabilidade de diagnóstico.,"""numerous studies on sepsis prediction employed alternate metrics such as positive predictive value …"""
Negative Predictive Value (NPV),Mencionada juntamente com PPV como métrica alternativa empregada em trabalhos prévios.,"""… and negative predictive value to present the probability of diagnosis."""

Standard Deviation (SD) of AUC,Métrica derivada usada para avaliar robustez/estabilidade entre execuções na ablation study.,"""… includes four statistical indicators with the best value, worst value, average value, and standard deviation in AUC."""

Best AUC (máximo),"Valor derivado que representa o melhor desempenho obtido entre múltiplas execuções, apresentado para analisar estabilidade.","""which includes four statistical indicators with the best value … in AUC."""
Worst AUC (mínimo),"Valor derivado que representa o pior desempenho entre execuções, usado na análise de robustez.","""… worst value … in AUC."""
Mean AUC,Média dos AUCs obtidos em execuções repetidas
column2: utilizada para avaliação global de desempenho.,"""… average value … in AUC."""

column1: Vangeepuram et al. 2024 - Assessing Delivery Commitments in Supply Chains - A Matrix-Based Framework.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the paper,Evidence / excerpt from the text

On-time delivery,KPI to assess customer service level performance,"“…performance measurement metrics like on-time delivery, delivery at request date, delivery to commit date, and order fill lead time serve as KPIs for the customer service levels (Stewart 1995
column2: Gunasekaran et al. 2004).”  "

column1: Delivery at request date,KPI for customer service levels,Same excerpt as above
Delivery to commit date,KPI for customer service levels,Same excerpt as above
Order fill lead time,KPI for customer service levels,Same excerpt as above

Perfect order fulfilment,SCOR reliability KPI based on the 7 R’s principle,"“The Supply Chain Operation Reference (SCOR) model provides KPIs for reliability measures such as Perfect order fulfillment, only considering the delivery as per 7 R's principle …”  "

Delivery speed,Performance dimension examined for its impact on customer satisfaction,“…characterize delivery speed as the duration between when a customer order is received and when the final delivery is made.” (Handfield & Pannesi 1992)

Delivery Reliability (DR),Core performance construct studied across several papers,“…define Delivery Reliability (DR) as the capability to deliver goods on or before the promised scheduled due date.” (Hill 1989 cited in Handfield & Pannesi 1992)

Supplier DR at Order,Sub-metric of DR distinguished by Forslund & Mattsson,"“They classify DR into four categories: Supplier DR at Order, Supplier DR after order confirmation, Supplier DR vs. confirmed delivery date, and Supplier DR at delivery vs. wished delivery date.”  "
Supplier DR after order confirmation,Sub-metric of DR,Same excerpt as above
Supplier DR vs. confirmed delivery date,Sub-metric of DR,Same excerpt as above
Supplier DR at delivery vs. wished delivery date,Sub-metric of DR,Same excerpt as above

Alpha service level,Inventory / service-level metric mentioned for completeness,“Alpha measures the likelihood of fulfilling all customer orders from available stock within a set time frame (Tempelmeier 2000).”
Beta service level,Inventory / service-level metric,“Beta measures the percentage of total demand promptly fulfilled from available stock.”
Gamma service level,Inventory / service-level metric that combines time and quantity,“Gamma … making it a measure that combines both time and quantity aspects of service performance.”
Reliability (SCOR definition),One of the five SCOR performance attributes,“SCOR … uses the term ‘Reliability’ … defined as ‘the ability to perform tasks as expected’ (APICS 2017).”

Commit Quality (CQ),Umbrella metric proposed by this paper to evaluate delivery commitments,"“Therefore, this paper introduces the term Commitment Measurement (CQ) and develops a CQ matrix that can be used to measure the quality of delivery commitments.”  "

CQ at First Commit Date (FCD),Derived CQ measure using the first promised date,“The First Commit Date (FCD)… is the first date committed to the customer. … CQ is calculated per shipment at FCD … according to equation (4).”

CQ at Last Commit Date (LCD),Derived CQ measure using the last (most recent) promised date,"“The LCD is the most recent date committed… CQ measured at LCD (60%, 75%, 30.28%) is greater than that measured at FCD …”  "

CQ at Best Commit Date (BCD),Derived CQ measure using the earliest of the committed dates,“The Best Commit Date (BCD) is the earliest date among the committed dates… Measuring at BCD is ideal since it reflects the earliest commit date…”
CQ-Shipment (At Due Date),CQ calculated per individual shipment at the evaluation date,Equation (4) defines ‘CQ_DD_S_XCD’ which “…evaluates the CQ at the level of each shipment.”
CQ-Shipment (At Delivery),CQ calculated per shipment at the actual shipping moment,Equation (5) defines ‘CQ_Del_S_XCD’ “…measured only at Delivery dates.”
CQ-Delivered Volume,Volume-weighted CQ within a period,"Equation (6) defines ‘CQ_DD_V_XCD’ “…considers the entire order, which may consist of multiple shipments…”  "

CQ-Demand-Period,Aggregate CQ against total demand of the period,Equation (7) defines ‘CQ_DD_V_XCD’ at DEM level “…the total delivered order volume is compared against the total demand for the selected period.”

Padrões de desempenho (Performance standards),Referenciais quantificáveis estabelecidos para julgar resultados e sustentar o processo de gestão de desempenho.,"""The regulatory requirements for planning VBE actors’ performance should include the establishment of measurable, understandable, verifiable, equitable, and achievable performance standards."" Capacidades dos atores do VBE,Um dos três fatores considerados na medição de desempenho dentro do processo de Performance Management.,"""According to ECOLEAD research, three important factors should be considered when measuring performance: (1) VBE actors’ capacities...""  "

Processos executados pelos atores do VBE,Segundo fator usado como medida de desempenho para avaliar a execução das atividades pelos membros.,"""...three important factors... (2) VBE actor’s processes performed...""  "

Cost,Attribute on PDM nodes and as optimisation criterion for selecting best process alternative,“Intermediate decision steps are represented as nodes that have a cost and time attribute… the best solution with respect to a performance indicator (cost or time) can be selected automatically.”
Time,Attribute on PDM nodes and as optimisation criterion for selecting best process alternative,Same sentence as above.

Performance indicator (cost or time),Derived KPI used to automatically choose the ‘best solution’ in PBWD optimisation,“…best solution with respect to a performance indicator (cost or time) can be selected automatically.”

Perceived Ease of Use (PEOU),Variable of Moody’s Method Evaluation Model to assess usability of the three approaches,“showing that both tested variables perceived ease of use and perceived usefulness…”
Perceived Usefulness (PU),Variable of Moody’s Method Evaluation Model to assess perceived benefit of the approaches,Same sentence as above.
Cronbach’s alpha (threshold 0.7),Statistic for internal-consistency reliability of the PEOU and PU measurement scales,“…values exceeding the generally accepted threshold of 0.7 [17].”

% of participants supporting a claim,"Threshold rule to judge whether workshop participants support, reject or are neutral to a claim","“…contradicted if less than 35 %…, no consensus if support was between 35 and 65 %, … supported if at least 65 %…”"
Functionality (ISO/IEC 9126 attribute),Quality category used to classify claims about what the approaches can do,“The claims with respect to their functionality find full support in most cases…”
Usability (ISO/IEC 9126 attribute),Quality category used to classify claims about ease of understanding/using the approaches,"“across all approaches, the usability claims come off badly.”"
Efficiency (ISO/IEC 9126 attribute),"Quality category
column2: includes speed, resource consumption, re-use etc.",“…positive evaluations of functionality and efficiency claims…”

column1: Maintainability (ISO/IEC 9126 attribute),Quality category
column2: measures ease of adapting or correcting models,"“maintaining the models would be fairly difficult…, which refuted claim A9.”"

column1: Portability (ISO/IEC 9126 attribute),Quality category
column2: measures applicability in other domains,"“positive evaluations of the claims with respect to the portability of all three approaches to other domains (D11, P11, and A10).”"

column1: Understandability,Sub-attribute of Usability
column2: measured through participants’ comments on intuitiveness of models,“…participants questioned the interpretability of the abstract models for users. This contradicts claim D4…”

column1: Ease of use (User),Sub-attribute of Usability
column2: evaluated via workshop feedback and PEOU scores,“…was supposed to be intuitive… participants refuted the claim (A4).”

column1: Ease of use (Expert),Sub-attribute of Usability
column2: relates to effort for specialists to build models,“participants did indicate that the creation of a PDM is a task of a business analyst… which supports P7.”

column1: Reusability,Efficiency sub-measure
column2: reuse of lifecycles/data models as performance benefit,"“the participants identified the reusability of lifecycles and data models as one of the major contributors to the method’s efficiency, which supports D8.”"

column1: Reduction in modelling effort,Efficiency sub-measure
column2: claimed and evaluated for DDPS,“The participants agreed that the approach reduces modelling efforts… (D1).”

column1: Automated creation of process structure,Efficiency sub-measure
column2: DDPS claim evaluated by participants,“…automated creation of the workflow… supports D7.”

column1: Instantiation of different processes from same models,Efficiency sub-measure
column2: supports flexibility and reuse,“…Instantiating different data structures and generating the respective data-driven process structures (D6).”

Medidor,Como é usado / definição no texto,Evidência (citação literal do artigo)

Wo (Case Waiting Time),Tempo que um caso permanece em espera antes do próximo passo de processamento.,“We define Wo as the case waiting time or the time a case is pending before the next processing step.” (Sec. 4)
Wi
column2: min,Menor valor de Wo dentro de um lote
column3: indica início da janela de batelada.,"“On batch-level, we will also define Wi
column4: min … expressing the minimum … Wo of observations within batch i …” (Sec. 4)"

column1: Wi
column2: max,Maior valor de Wo dentro de um lote
column3: indica fim da janela de batelada.,"“… and Wi
column4: max, expressing the … maximum Wo of observations within batch i, respectively.” (Sec. 4)"

column1: Wo2b,Tempo de espera de casos que fazem parte de bateladas (nível de segmento).,"“On segment-level, we additionally define Wo2b as the waiting time of a batched case …” (Sec. 4)"
Wo<b,Tempo de espera de casos não-batelados (nível de segmento).,“… and Wo<b as the waiting time of a non-batched case.” (Sec. 4)

IBIA (Intra-Batch Inter-Arrival Time),Intervalo entre chegadas sucessivas de casos dentro de uma mesma batelada.,"“We define IBIA as the intra-batch case interarrival time, expressing the amount of time that lapses between the arrival of two successive cases within a batch.” (Sec. 4)"

IA (Case Inter-Arrival Time),Intervalo entre chegadas de dois casos considerando todas as observações do segmento.,“the case interarrival time IA measures the time between two cases considering all segment observations.” (Sec. 4)
IA2b,Inter-arrival de casos batelados (independente da batelada a que pertencem).,“We additionally define IA2b … expressing the interarrival time of batched cases …” (Sec. 4)
IA<b,Inter-arrival de casos não-batelados.,"“… and IA<b … expressing the interarrival time of … non-batched cases, respectively.” (Sec. 4)"

BI (Batch Interval),Tempo entre dois momentos/períodos consecutivos de processamento em batelada.,“We define the batch interval BI as the time lapse between two successive moments or periods of batching …” (Sec. 4)
k (Batch Size),Quantidade de observações (casos) dentro de uma batelada.,“The batch size k expresses the amount of observations in batch b.” (Sec. 4)

BF (Batching Frequency),Percentual de observações que pertencem a bateladas em um segmento.,“We define BF as the batching frequency … expressing the fraction of observations that are part of a batch out of the total amount of observations within a segment.” (Sec. 4)
ḱ (mean k),Média do tamanho das bateladas em um segmento
column2: usada para comparar segmentos.,Coluna “k” na Tabela 1 (“General performance measurements for S1-S7”) e texto: “We discover that the three segments with the highest BF … also have the largest k.” (Sec. 6)

column1: σk (std k),Desvio-padrão do tamanho das bateladas
column2: indica variabilidade do tamanho.,“This is confirmed by the high standard deviation for k in Table 1.” (Sec. 6) – coluna “k” na Tabela 1

column1: ḂI (mean BI),Média dos intervalos entre bateladas
column2: indica periodicidade.,Coluna “BI” na Tabela 1 (“General performance measurements …”).

column1: σBI (std BI),Desvio-padrão dos intervalos entre bateladas
column2: mede regularidade.,"Coluna “BI” na Tabela 1 e comentário: “relative to BI, BI is the lowest for (S6 and S7), which are also the segments for which batching shows up regularly …” (Sec. 6)"

column1: ῩWo2b (mean Wo2b),Média do tempo de espera dos casos batelados no segmento.,Coluna “Wo2b” na Tabela 1.
σWo2b (std Wo2b),Desvio-padrão do tempo de espera dos casos batelados.,Coluna “Wo2b” na Tabela 1.
ῩWo<b (mean Wo<b),Média do tempo de espera dos casos não-batelados.,Coluna “Wo<b” na Tabela 1.
σWo<b (std Wo<b),Desvio-padrão do tempo de espera dos casos não-batelados.,Coluna “Wo<b” na Tabela 1.
ῩIA (mean IA),Média do inter-arrival geral de casos no segmento.,Coluna “IA” na Tabela 2.
σIA (std IA),Desvio-padrão do inter-arrival geral.,Coluna “IA” na Tabela 2.
ῩIA2b (mean IA2b),Média do inter-arrival entre casos batelados.,Coluna “IA2b” na Tabela 2.
σIA2b (std IA2b),Desvio-padrão do inter-arrival entre casos batelados.,Coluna “IA2b” na Tabela 2.
ῩIA<b (mean IA<b),Média do inter-arrival entre casos não-batelados.,Coluna “IA<b” na Tabela 2.
σIA<b (std IA<b),Desvio-padrão do inter-arrival entre casos não-batelados.,Coluna “IA<b” na Tabela 2.
ῩIBIA (mean IBIA),Média do inter-arrival intra-batelada.,Coluna “IBIA” na Tabela 2.
σIBIA (std IBIA),Desvio-padrão do inter-arrival intra-batelada.,Coluna “IBIA” na Tabela 2.
n,Número total de observações (casos) no segmento

column2: métrica de volume de lotes.,Coluna “m” na Tabela 1.

Draheim 2011 - On the Design of IT Key Performance Indicators.pdf
Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência no texto
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Indicadores mensuráveis usados para monitorar a execução dos processos e fornecer transparência
column2: servem de base para a função de controle.,“The key performance indicators are measurable figures about defined business processes.” / “The selection of appropriate performance indicators and their negotiation among stakeholders are important components in establishing transparency in IT service management.”

column1: Steering Parameters,Acordos-meta formais entre os stakeholders de controle e de execução
column2: definidos como valores mensuráveis dos processos.,"“The steering parameters are target agreements … A steering parameter is a well-defined, measurable figure of a defined business process.”  "

column1: Informal Target Agreements,"Metas não mensuráveis formalmente, usadas para complementar os steering parameters.",“Informal target agreements are further target agreements that cannot be defined as measurable figures in terms of defined business processes.”

Additional Business Improvement Activities,"Atividades de melhoria que não se traduzem diretamente em métricas, mas que influenciam desempenho e eficácia.",“The business improvement activities are all kinds of activities other than target agreements that are intended to improve the efficiency or effectiveness of the enterprise.”

Informal Performance Reports,Relatos qualitativos que complementam os KPIs na avaliação de desempenho.,“The performance reports are further information about the performance of the enterprise that cannot be defined as measurable figures in terms of defined business processes.”

Total Cost of Ownership (TCO),"Indicador financeiro que soma todos os custos certos (hardware, software, projeto, operação) ao longo da vida útil do sistema.","“The total cost of ownership comprises costs for hardware and software, costs of the rollout project and costs for system maintenance and system administration.”  "
Direct Costs,Parte do TCO composta por despesas orçadas e mensuráveis.,“Formally … there is a distinction between so-called direct and indirect costs. Direct costs are budgeted expenses …”

Indirect Costs,"Custos não orçados (ex.: treinamento, riscos), inicialmente estimados e depois agregados ao TCO.",“…indirect costs are unbudgeted expenses. … Typical examples of indirect costs are expenses for end user training and support.”

Probabilistic Costs,"Custos associados a eventos de risco (falhas, ameaças de segurança) ponderados por sua probabilidade.",“All probabilistic costs – usually indirect costs of uncertain malfunction events – are considered separately from the total cost of ownership.”
Return on Investment (ROI),Razão entre lucro esperado e capital investido
column2: usado para avaliar economicamente iniciativas de TI.,“Return on investment (ROI) is … the ratio of expected profit to needed capital.”

column1: Total Economic Impact (TEI),Método que estende o TCO incorporando benefícios de negócio e opções estratégicas.,"“An example … is Forrester Research’s Total Economic Impact (TEI) method [17], which considers total costs of ownership, the business value and the options that are created by IT in evaluating it.”  "
Total Benefit of IT Ownership,Mede o lado dos benefícios (lucro + economia de custos) decorrentes da posse da TI.,“The total benefit of ownership is made of assessable profit and cost savings …”
Profit,Componente dos benefícios diretos usado em ROI e no modelo de impacto total.,"“Profit and cost savings together make up a kind of direct, absolute return on investment …”  "
Cost Savings,Outra componente dos benefícios diretos
column2: resultam de otimizações viabilizadas pela TI.,idem

column1: Performance,Objetivo não-funcional chave a ser atendido pelos sistemas
column2: usado como critério de avaliação.,"“Several objectives must be met … performance, scalability, availability, security, maintainability.”  "

column1: Scalability,Métrica/objetivo para verificar se o sistema suporta crescimento de carga.,idem
Availability,Indicador de tempo de serviço
column2: custos de indisponibilidade entram como custos probabilísticos.,“With respect to availability you have to estimate the costs of system downtime …”

column1: System Downtime,Medida de indisponibilidade empregada para estimar custos ligados à availability.,idem
Security,Objetivo de proteção
column2: falhas geram custos probabilísticos.,“Several objectives must be met … security …”

column1: Maintainability,Facilidade de manutenção
column2: considerado objetivo de qualidade dos sistemas.,idem

column1: Quality of Service (QoS),"Categoria agregada de métricas (availability, scalability, security) usada no modelo de impacto.",Figura 3: “Quality of Service Availability Scalability Security …”

Software Costs,Componente explícito do TCO.,“… comprises costs for hardware and software …”
Operations Costs,Custos de manutenção e administração incluídos no TCO.,“… costs for system maintenance and system administration.”

Brier score,Métrica principal para avaliar classificadores probabilísticos
column2: utilizada para comparar todos os métodos nas quatro bases e apresentada na Tabela 4.,"“O desempenho ... é o Brier score [17], que é uma medida amplamente usada para avaliar um classificador probabilístico.”"

column1: Mean squared error,É mencionado como interpretação direta do Brier score (o Brier é definido como o MSE das probabilidades previstas).,"“Intuitivamente, [o Brier score] pode ser interpretado como sendo o mean squared error of the predicted likelihoods over all symbols.”"
Accuracy,Termo genérico usado ao longo do texto para indicar quão bem um método prediz
column2: comparações de métodos de ML vs. mineração de processo são feitas em termos de ‘accuracy’.,"“Os métodos de machine learning, que geralmente não visam interpretabilidade, tendem a superar ... em termos de accuracy.”"

column1: Fitness (Recall),Usado como critério de qualidade de modelos de processos
column2: mede se o modelo permite o comportamento observado.,“...modelos devem permitir para as atividades que são observadas como próxima atividade... referido como fitness (recall).”

column1: Precision (Process Mining),Critério de qualidade
column2: penaliza modelos que permitem atividades nunca observadas após um estado dado.,“Um modelo preciso desautoriza atividades que nunca foram observadas ... referido como precision.”

column1: Generalization,Critério de qualidade de modelos em mineração de processos
column2: indica capacidade de cobrir comportamento futuro ainda não visto.,"“Há uma forte ênfase ... em fitness, precision, generalization and simplicity.”"

column1: Simplicity,"Outro critério de qualidade em descoberta de processos, visando modelos mais simples.","Idem citação anterior: “...importance of fitness, precision, generalization and simplicity in process discovery.”"

95% confidence interval,Usado para quantificar a variabilidade/consistência do Brier score entre repetições de hold-out.,“...calculamos o intervalo de confiança de 95% em torno do desempenho do modelo.”

Consistência (derivada da CI),"No resultado, a largura do IC é usada para avaliar a consistência dos métodos.",“...se o intervalo de 95% tem pequena largura ... o método foi muito consistente entre as três execuções...”
Kamrani et al. 2010 - Optimizing a Business Process Model by Using Simulation.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence in the text

Quality of output of the process,High-level measure that the authors ultimately want to maximise by choosing the best assignment of tasks to agents.,“The ultimate goal of this approach is to provide a means to estimate the quality of outcome of the process and improve this outcome without any major changes in the process model and only by reorganizing human resources within the existing organizational structure.”
Weighted sum of agents’ contributions to tasks,Proposed as the basic way to compute the contribution of one agent to one task
column2: forms the element v_il.,“The model suggests that the weighted sum of agents’ contributions to tasks constitute an indicator of the quality of a business process.”

column1: Value added by an agent to a task (v_il),Elementary performance figure that is later aggregated
column2: obtained by weighted sum of capabilities.,Equation (1):  v_il = Σ c_ij w_jl

column1: Capability matrix C,Holds the values of all individual capabilities
column2: input to compute v_il and other derived metrics.,"“Considering m agents each having n attributes, the capability matrix C=[c_ij]_(m×n) … is defined.”  "

column1: Modified capability matrix G,Version of C corrected by peripheral factors
column2: replaces C when calculating v_il in the more complete model.,"“… peripheral factors modify the capability matrix, i.e. map the C to the modified capability matrix G=[g_ij] …”  "

column1: Value-added matrix V,Collects every v_il for every agent–task pair and is the basic data for all assignment algorithms.,Equation (3):  V = G W
Number of times a task is performed (x_l),Multiplier in the aggregation formula
column2: can be deterministic or random (and assignment-dependent in the hardest case).,"“1) How many times each activity is performed, we denote this number by x_l for activity l.”  "

column1: Expected number of executions E[X] / E[x_l],Stochastic version of x_l used when the work-flow is uncertain
column2: computed analytically or via simulation.,"Equation (8):  E[X] = (1,0,0,…) (I – Q)^-1  "

column1: Adjusted value v' _il,Composite metric (x_l q_l v_il or E[x_l] q_l v_il) fed to the Hungarian algorithm so that assignment is solved as a standard cost–benefit matrix.,“v' _il = x_l q_l v_il” (deterministic case) and “v' _il = E[x_l] q_l v_il” (stochastic case).
Impact factor q_l,Weight of each task when total value u(Z) is aggregated.,“2) The impact factor of each activity on the overall performance of the process denoted by q_l.”
Total value added to the process u(Z),Objective function that must be maximised subject to assignment constraints
column2: used for all optimisation problems.,Equation (4):  u(Z)= Σ_l Σ_i x_l(Z) q_l v_il z_il

column1: Expected total value E[u],Objective when x_l is random
column2: algorithms for Markovian and non-Markovian cases try to maximise E[u].,Equation (7):  E[u] = Σ_l Σ_i E[x_l] q_l v_il z_il

column1: Cost matrix (cost_il) for Hungarian algorithm,Negative of benefit matrix
column2: allows Hungarian algorithm to find minimum cost which translates into maximum benefit.,“To find the maximum gain … one can subtract all elements of the matrix V' from a value which is greater than all of them and apply the Hungarian algorithm …”

column1: Gain (max gain / gain),Performance figure used inside Algorithms 3 and 4 to keep the best u(Z) found so far.,"Algorithm 3, line 5:  max gain ← 0   …  line 15:  gain ← u(Z_c ∪ Z_nc)"

column1: Task efficiency / Efficiency of the task

column3: “…to capture in numbers the notion, that no one could be predisposed to all variety of tasks… developing a method capturing the relationship of the personality profile to the efficiency and performance of the task.”

column1: Task performance
column2: Sub-métrica de desempenho focada na execução de tarefas

column1: Nível de melhoria planejado (Planned level of improvement),Valor base usado para comparar o que se pretendia alcançar em cada meta.,“respondents indicated the planned level of performance improvement (before reengineering) …”

Razão de cumprimento (Ratio of fulfillment),Indicador composto: melhoria real ÷ melhoria planejada
column2: utilizado como métrica objetiva de sucesso.,"“For each performance indicator, we compute a ‘ratio of fulfillment,’ which is the actual level of improvement divided by the planned level.”"

column1: Püchel et al. 2024 - On the Pivotal Role of Data in Sustainability Transformations - Challenges and Opportunities.pdf
Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência no texto

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Indicador-guarda-chuva exigido por diretrizes de reporte (NFRD/ESRS) para medir diferentes aspectos de sustentabilidade.,"“The NFRD required key-performance indicators (KPIs), the CSRD requires very detailed information aligned with the ESRS.”"
Emissões de substâncias ambientais nocivas / CO2,Mede desempenho ambiental
column2: permite comparar variação anual e orientar ações de redução.,“…the data may indicate developments in the company’s emission of environmentally harmful substances or CO2.”

column1: Consumo de energia,Usado para monitoramento e gestão interna de eficiência e redução de impactos.,"“Green IS and Green IT research have highlighted the importance of data work (e.g., monitoring energy consumption) as an integral part of organizations’ sustainability efforts.”"
Incidentes de saúde e segurança ocupacional,Indicador social que sinaliza condições de trabalho e necessidade de melhorias.,“…data may indicate changes in occupational health and safety incidents…”
Distribuição de gênero entre colaboradores,Indicador de diversidade/equidade usado em relatórios sociais.,“…data may indicate… gender distribution among employees.”
Resultados de auditorias sociais em fornecedores,Avalia cumprimento de normas sociais na cadeia de suprimentos.,“…results of social audits with suppliers.”
Fluxos de materiais e energia,Base de dados obrigatória para relatórios CSRD
column2: cobre todo o ciclo de vida dos produtos.,"“…all material and energy data flows from all value chains and product life cycles must be collected, analyzed, integrated, and verified.”"

column1: Pegada de carbono (Spend-based),"Calculada a partir do gasto financeiro
column2: usada por muitas empresas, embora crie distorções.","“Many companies currently rely on spend-based carbon reporting, a method that calculates a company’s environmental impact based on financial expenditure…”"

column1: Gastos financeiros (proxy ambiental),Valor desembolsado para materiais/energia usado como métrica indireta de impacto em abordagens spend-based.,"“…calculates a company’s environmental impact based on financial expenditure for materials, energy, and waste.”"

Pegada de carbono (Activity-based),"Atribui emissões a atividades específicas do ciclo de vida, fornecendo visão granular do impacto.",“ABR assigns carbon emissions based on specific activities within a product or service’s lifecycle.”

Dados de Avaliação de Ciclo de Vida (LCA),"Conjunto de métricas de emissões por etapa de produção, uso e descarte, integradas no ABR.","“…ABR would consider the carbon emissions of material extraction, manufacturing processes, energy consumption during use, and end-of-life disposal…”"

Custos carbono-corrigidos (CO2eq),Monetariza emissões atribuindo preço ao CO2 para orientar precificação e decisões de investimento.,“Carbon-corrected costs offer a practical example. This approach allows a company to assign a cost to a ton of CO2eq…”

Número de projetos de reflorestamento / Árvores plantadas,"Indicador de saída (output) usado para reportar esforços ambientais, embora não garanta impacto de longo prazo.","“ESG indicators on reforestation may capture the number of projects supported, or trees planted…”"
Número de treinamentos de empregados,Output social no modelo IOOI
column2: serve para medir esforço de capacitação.,“…inputs like funds and labor could be used to organize a certain number of employee trainings (outputs)…”

column1: Aumento de habilidades / auto-eficácia / bem-estar,Indicadores de outcome que capturam mudança real nos participantes.,“…leading to increases in participants’ skills and perceived self-efficacy and wellbeing (outcomes)…”
Qualidade de vida na comunidade,Indicador de impacto (societal-level) resultante de iniciativas corporativas.,"“…On a societal level, this may imply an increased quality of life in a community.”"
Número de refugiados integrados,Output social medido pela Social Bee
column2: base para avaliação de impacto.,"“…quantifying both output (i.e., number of refugees integrated)…”"

column1: Economia de impostos pela integração de refugiados,Métrica monetizada de impacto socioeconômico.,“…such as calculating how much tax money is saved through successful refugee integration.”

Bem-estar aprimorado / Estereótipos reduzidos,"Outcomes sociais decorrentes da integração de refugiados, medidos qualitativamente/quantitativamente.",“…enhanced well-being and reduced stereotypes (outcome)…”

Pontuação ESG (ESG Score),"Índice agregado amplamente usado por investidores para avaliar desempenho ambiental, social e de governança.","“Although Green IS literature has not explicitly addressed the data perspective on sustainability, data-related problems have been frequently mentioned… concerning the data on corporate environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG) performance.”"
Indicadores de mudança climática,Parte do pilar ‘E’ nos ESRS
column2: quantificam riscos e impactos climáticos.,"“For environmental matters (E), the ESRS include issues related to climate change…”"

column1: Indicadores de recursos hídricos,"Métricas sobre uso e impacto em água, exigidas pelos ESRS.",“…water resources…”
Indicadores de economia circular,"Capturam uso de recursos, reciclagem e design circular.",“…circular economy…”
Indicadores de contaminação,Medem poluição e gestão de substâncias perigosas.,“…contamination…”
Indicadores de biodiversidade,Avaliam impactos em ecossistemas e espécies.,“…and biodiversity.”
Indicadores de igualdade de oportunidades,"Parte do pilar ‘S’
column2: medem diversidade, inclusão e não discriminação.",“…they include equal opportunities…”

column1: Indicadores de questões de emprego,"Monitoram condições de trabalho, estabilidade e relações laborais.",“…employment matters…”
Indicadores de direitos humanos,Avaliam respeito a direitos humanos na operação e cadeia de suprimentos.,“…and respect for human rights.”
Indicadores de ética empresarial,Parte do pilar ‘G’
column2: avaliam cultura e conduta ética.,“…business ethics and culture…”

column1: Indicadores de controle e gestão de riscos de sustentabilidade,Métricas de governança que monitoram estruturas de gestão de riscos ESG.,“…as well as the company’s control and risk management as to sustainability risks.”

Indicadores de progresso nos ODS (SDG metrics),Usados por empresas para referenciar iniciativas a cada Objetivo de Desenvolvimento Sustentável.,“Many companies have been using SDGs as a point of reference for their sustainability initiatives and actions…”
BPM-D 2021 - Proceedings of the Best ... 2021 - BPM-D 2021 - Proceedings ... -located with 19th International Conference on Business Process [...].pdf
Performance_Metric,How_It_Is_Used_in_the_Text,Evidence_from_Text

Computational Complexity (NP-hardness),Used to characterize the inherent difficulty of solving classical planning problems that underlie several BPM tasks.,"“Though this means that classical planning, i.e., the simplest form of a planning problem, is NP-hard.”"

Exponential Scale-up,"Expresses how planning technology can generate (or verify) very large / sophisticated business processes from compact models, and vice-versa.",“Planning formalisms offer an exponential scale-up from the complexity of the representation to the complexity of the process.”

Coverage (of Process Space),Indicates the breadth of different processes that can be obtained from the same domain-independent specification.,“…coverage of a wide space of processes from the same domain-independent specification…”
Cost of Deviations,Metric minimised during trace alignment
column2: alignments with the lowest total deviation-cost are preferred.,"“…finding the most probable explanation, i.e., one of the alignments with the least expensive deviations… according to some function assigning costs to deviations.”"

column1: Probability (of Explanation),Derived metric for ranking alternative alignments
column2: the explanation with the highest probability (often inversely related to total cost) is selected.,“…one is interested in finding the most probable explanation…”

column1: Optimal Alignment,"Quality indicator for trace alignment
column2: denotes an alignment whose total deviation-cost is minimal (i.e., optimal).","“…optimal alignments, according to some function assigning costs to deviations.”"

column1: Scalability,"Evaluates the ability of an approach (e.g., planning-based alignment) to handle large process models and logs.",“Among scalable approaches to solve the alignment task…”

Performance Analysis,General term for assessing execution-time or resource-related behaviour of a process when replaying logs on models.,“Replaying History on Process Models for Conformance Checking and Performance Analysis.”
Hwang and Park 2015 - Business Process Modeling for developing performance measurement system using Internet of Things (IoT).pdf
Metric,Uso no texto,Evidência no texto
P_Ux,Probabilidade de o enlace individual estar em estado Up (opera-ção correta)
column2: usada no cálculo da disponibilidade do sub-sistema 2.,“The probability that the link connection is in Up or Down state can be found as: 𝑃_𝑈𝑥 = 𝜇𝑥 /(𝜆𝑥+𝜇𝑥)… (1)”

column1: P_Dx,Probabilidade de o enlace individual estar em estado Down (falha)
column2: complementa P_Ux.,“… 𝑃_𝐷𝑥 = 𝜆𝑥 /(𝜆𝑥+𝜇𝑥) (1)”

column1: P_US,Probabilidade de toda a estrutura em série (GC+CH) estar Up
column2: usada como disponibilidade efetiva do Grupo 2.,"“Thus, the probability that the series structure is in the Up state, denoted by 𝑃_𝑈𝑆, is equal to the product of individual probabilities that every link is in the Up state. (2)”  "

column1: λ₂,Taxa de falha equivalente do conjunto em série (links GC e CH)
column2: serve como parâmetro global de confiabilidade.,"“The equivalent failure rate λ₂ can be found as the sum of the failure rates of the two links, i.e., λ₂ = λ_gc + λ_ch (3)”  "

column1: μ₂,Taxa de recuperação equivalente do conjunto em série
column2: mede rapidez média de reparo do Grupo 2.,"“Therefore, the equivalent recovery rate μ₂ can be derived as: μ₂ = … (4)”  "

column1: r,Operability ratio dos biossensores (μ₁/λ₁)
column2: resume a relação recuperação/falha de cada sensor.,"“r = μ₁ / λ₁, (Operability ratio of biosensors) (12)”  "

column1: P(E1),Probabilidade de serviço pleno do sistema IoT.,"“Thus, the probability that the IoT system provides full service is: 𝑃(E₁)=p(0,N) (26)”  "
P(E2),Probabilidade de serviço degradado (parcial).,“The probability that the system provides degraded service is… (27)”
P(E3),Probabilidade de indisponibilidade por falha SG (sensores-gateway).,"“The probability that the system cannot provide service due to SG link failure is: 𝑃(E₃)=p(0,0) (28)”  "
P(E4),Probabilidade de indisponibilidade por falha CS (GC ou CH).,"“The probability that the system cannot provide service due to CS link failure is: 𝑃(E₄)=∑ p(1,j) (29)”  "
U,Indisponibilidade total do sistema
column2: soma de P(E3)+P(E4).,"“The IoT system unavailability, denoted by U, is the total probability that the system is down. U = P(E₃)+P(E₄) (30)”  "

column1: f_E1,Frequência de ocorrência do evento de serviço pleno.,"“f_E1 = (Nλ₁ + λ₂) p(0,N) (31)”  "
f_E2,Frequência de ocorrência do serviço degradado.,"“f_E2 = Nλ₁ p(0,N) + Nμ₁ p(0,0) (32)”  "
f_E3,Frequência de queda por falha SG.,“f_E3 = … (33)”
f_E4,Frequência de queda por falha CS.,"“f_E4 = λ₂ ∑ p(0,j) (34)”  "
d(E1),Duração média de cada período de serviço pleno.,“d(E1)= P(E1)/f_E1 = 1/(Nλ₁ + λ₂) (35)”
d(E2),Duração média de cada período de serviço degradado.,“d(E2)= … (36)”
d(E3),Duração média de indisponibilidade por falha SG.,“d(E3)= … = 1/(λ₂ + Nμ₁) (37)”
d(E4),Duração média de indisponibilidade por falha CS.,“d(E4)= … (38)”
Overview of BISE Articles Published i... 2010 - Overview of BISE Articles Published in 2009 and 2010.pdf
Metric/Indicador,Como é usado no texto,Evidência extraída (trecho ou referência à parte do texto)

Number of downloads (contagem de downloads),Mede a utilização e o crescimento da revista BISE no SpringerLink,"“In 2009, the number of downloads tracked by SpringerLink stood at 6,336 … In the first quarter of 2010 downloads … increased … 4,169 downloads.”"
Download growth rate (% de crescimento de downloads),Compara a evolução de uso em períodos sucessivos,“…an increase of more than 600 % compared to the corresponding quarter of the previous year.”

Regional share of downloads (% de solicitações por região),Avalia a internacionalização da revista,“…within its first year more than a third of BISE’s articles were requested by the Asian-Pacific area.”

Market share (quota de mercado),Usado para mensurar sucesso de estratégias de preço e entrada no mercado móvel GSM,“It turns out that it is possible to successfully enter the market … A prepaid contract … can gain market share.”

Cost savings (economia de custos),Indicador de benefício em otimização de portfólio de licenças de software,“…possible savings can be realized by combining different types of licenses in a license portfolio.”

Cash flow / Economic value (fluxo de caixa, valor econômico),Base de avaliação financeira de processos de sinistro na seguradora,“…resulting cash flows are determined … It is essential to include all consequences that can be attributed to a single process.”

Key Performance Indicators – KPIs,Usados para medir ‘standard proximity’ em sistemas SAP,“…this measurement methodology is based on key performance indicators. This measurement methodology allows for measuring the standard proximity…”
Standard proximity / Standardization degree,Índice que compara customização versus padrão em software,“…measurement of the standard proximity of adapted standard business software…”
Maturity level (nível de maturidade),Avalia estágio de processos de gestão de TI,“…we will apply this procedure model to the development of the IT Performance Measurement Maturity Model (ITPM³).”
IT Performance Measurement Maturity Model (ITPM³),Modelo que deriva níveis de desempenho em gestão de TI,“ITPM³” (todo o artigo descreve o uso do modelo como métrica de performance).
Degree of automation,Mede quanto do processo é tratado automaticamente,“…optimization of the degree of automation in insurance processes…”
Project effort,Estimativa de esforço como métrica central em engenharia de requisitos,“…Because Effort Matters! A Mapping Model for Assessing Project Effort in Requirements Engineering.”
Classification accuracy / predictive performance,Comparação de modelos de classificação em CRM
column2: indicador principal do benchmark,“…to assess the ability of several novel as well as traditional classifiers to form accurate predictions…”

column1: Consumer surplus (excedente do consumidor),Mede ganho para o consumidor com mecanismos de busca e recomendação,“…decreasing search costs … always lead to an increase in consumers surplus…”
Total sales / Sales volume,Usado para verificar impacto de busca e recomendação nas vendas do e-commerce,“…impact of search and recommendation systems on sales in electronic commerce.”
Profit increase,Indicador de benefício econômico para o varejista on-line,“…can lead to substantial profit increases for retailers.”
Utility values (valores de utilidade),Resultados do conjoint analysis para competências de TI em start-ups
column2: quantificam preferência,“…an adaptive conjoint analysis is applied to obtain utility values for single components of competence.”

column1: Centrality measures (degree, betweenness, closeness, eigenvector, PageRank),Métricas de posição estrutural usadas para identificar atores-chave em redes sociais,“…paper analyzes five centrality measures commonly discussed in literature on the basis of three simple requirements…”

Cost-benefit ratio / Cost-utility analysis,Mede viabilidade econômica na seleção de sistema de gestão acadêmica,"“…a ten-step cost-utility analysis for the selection, migration and operation of a campus management system.”"
Balanced Scorecard perspectives,Abordagem multidimensional para apoiar decisões em Enterprise Identity Management,“…decision support framework based on the Balanced Scorecard approach.”
Danov and Gotseva 2024 - Study of Basic Concepts in the Context of Process Management and Strategies Based on Big Data.pdf
Quality (Qualidade)
column2: Dimensão específica de PI usada para medir a qualidade dos resultados de um processo
column3: “Among the most important dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”

column1: Time (Tempo)
column2: Dimensão de PI para mensurar duração/velocidade do processo
column3: Mesma citação – “dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”

column1: Cost (Custo)
column2: Dimensão de PI que avalia o custo envolvido na execução do processo
column3: Mesma citação – “dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”

column1: Flexibility (Flexibilidade)
column2: Dimensão de PI que mede a capacidade de adaptação do processo a mudanças
column3: Mesma citação – “dimensions of performance indicators are quality, time, cost and flexibility.”

column1: Syamsiyah and Leemans 2020 - Process discovery using in-database minimum self distance abstractions.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence extracted from the paper
Runtime / Run time / Computation time,Empirically compared (absolute and relative) between the traditional approach and the in-database approach for 21 real-life logs
column2: run time of each discovery phase is measured and averaged over 10 runs.,"""…we applied both techniques to 21 real-life logs, measured the run time of the different stages of discovery, and averaged the time over ten runs… DB outperforms Trad for all logs.""  "

column1: Processing time per event,Measured while evaluating the trigger-based update of DF and MSD
column2: expresses the milliseconds needed to insert one event and update abstractions.,"""On average, the time needed for inserting one event and updating the corresponding abstractions was 1,2 ms.""  "

column1: Throughput (events / second),Derived from processing time per event to show how many events can be handled per unit of time.,"""In other words, in one second the database can typically handle around 833 events.""  "
Memory usage / Main-memory consumption,Compared between approaches to show that the in-database method needs far less RAM
column2: highlights ability to run with 2 GB while the traditional approach needs up to 14 GB.,"""…all logs were successfully processed by DB using only 2 GB of main memory… the Xerox(nov) log required 14 GB of memory…""  "

column1: Time-complexity (Big-O),"Theoretical performance measure of algorithms and operators (e.g., linear, O(e·log e), O(1), O(d)).","""…the native operator approach is linear in sorted logs and O(e·log(e)) in unsorted logs… the complexity of the DF update function is O(1)… the computation of αmsd uses O(d)…""  "

Fitness,"Quality metric for discovered models, calculated during 3-fold cross validation and used to compare discovery techniques.","""…evaluation (measuring fitness [20]…)… compared to IMfd, IMfw has a higher fitness for Roadfines and BPIC18-7.""  "
Precision (ETC-precision),Quality metric (precision) computed with ETC
column2: used together with fitness and simplicity to assess model quality.,"""…measuring … ETC-precision [15]… IMfw has a higher precision for Sepsis, BPIC15-3, BPIC18-1, BPIC18-2, BPIC18-5 and BPIC18-8.""  "

column1: Simplicity,Model-quality metric indicating structural complexity
column2: included in the three-dimension evaluation and in Pareto analysis.,"""…measured using fitness, ETC-precision and simplicity… the models discovered by IMfw were simpler for 14 out of the 16 logs.""  "

column1: Pareto-optimality,"Derived indicator showing whether a model is non-dominated w.r.t. fitness, precision and simplicity
column2: used to state that IMfw achieves optimal trade-offs.","""…IMfw obtained (on average) pareto-optimal results for 6 logs … measured using fitness, precision, and simplicity values."""

column1: Amor and Ghannouchi 2017 - Toward an ontology-based model of key performance indicators for business process improvement.pdf
KPI,Usage / how it is employed in the text,Evidence in the text (exact quotation)

Process Instance execution time,Basic quantitative KPI used to evaluate every single process instance,"“For example, the KPI Process Instance execution time is a basic metric which takes as input one Process Instance”"
Truong and Tôn 2019 - Augmenting a Process Model with State Machine and Business Artifacts.pdf
Cost,General KPI for measuring process performance
column2: appears explicitly in pair “time and cost”.,"“measuring its performance, e.g., time and cost [5] [6]”
column3: “BPMN meta-model could be extended to depict the performance analysis (e.g., time, cost)”  "

column1: Cycle time,Specific performance measure mentioned among classic KPIs.,"“…performance measures (e.g., quality, cost, cycle time).”  "
Quality,Listed as a performance measure alongside cost and cycle time.,"“…performance measures (e.g., quality, cost, cycle time).”  "

Latency,Derived time-based measure capturing delay between customer confirmation and provider charge.,“Latency caused by any delay in making such a confirmation by the customer could result in a ﬁnal charge…”
Surcharge,Monetary metric introduced to offset latency risk
column2: impacts cost/refund KPIs.,“Company AD puts a reasonable surcharge to cover this potential payment gap.”

column1: Cancel fees,Monetary attribute that evaluates cost of cancellation
column2: used as KPI candidate.,Attribute in BookingObject: “cancelFees”

column1: Refunds to customer,Monetary result metric reflecting difference between surcharge and real fee.,Attribute in BookingObject: “refundsToCustomer” and rule “…Refund customer (BookingObject)…”
Flight time,Duration attribute of Flight
column2: can be monitored for punctuality/performance.,Attribute in Flight: “flightTime”

column1: Booking time,Timestamp of booking event
column2: supports lead-time / cycle-time calculations.,Attribute in BookingObject: “bookingTime”

column1: PaymentTimeFromCustomer,Timestamp measuring how fast customer pays
column2: influences cash-flow KPI.,Attribute in BookingObject: “paymentTimeFromCustomer”

column1: PaymentTimeToProvider,Timestamp measuring when reseller pays airline
column2: affects settlement cycle.,Attribute in BookingObject: “paymentTimeToProvider”

column1: ConfirmationTimeFromProvider,Timestamp of airline confirmation
column2: latency between payment and confirmation can be analysed.,Attribute in BookingObject: “confirmationTimeFromProvider”

column1: TimeToRefund,Interval between payment and refund
column2: explicit KPI for customer service speed.,Attribute in BookingObject: “timeToRefund”

column1: TimeToCheckIn,Interval before departure when check-in happens
column2: operational timing KPI.,Attribute in BookingObject: “timeToCheckIn”

column1: TimeToCancel,Interval used to evaluate cancellation responsiveness and penalty windows.,Attribute in BookingObject: “timeToCancel”
TimeToReschedule,Interval measuring how quickly a booking is rescheduled
column2: central KPI in the case study.,Attribute in BookingObject: “timeToReschedule”

column1: Saha et al. 2024 - Forecasting the Impact of Anomalous Events on Business Process Performance.pdf
Metric,Usage in the paper,Evidence excerpt (translated if necessary)
CYCLE TIME,Business KPI that measures the total time to complete a process instance
column2: monitored and forecast.,“…different KPIs such as the cycle time (the time for the complete execution of the process)…”

column1: COST OF EXECUTION,Business KPI that tracks process cost
column2: mentioned as a dimension to be monitored.,“…or cost of execution are defined and measured periodically…”

column1: QUALITY,Business KPI dimension (quality of execution) tracked by process-monitoring tools.,"“Business process monitoring tools enable continuous observations of business process KPIs measuring cost, time, and quality [11].”"

AVERAGE NUMBER OF ORDERS PROCESSED PER HOUR,Example of a periodically-measured throughput KPI to be forecast.,“…business KPIs such as the average number of orders processed per hour are measured periodically…”
LOST ORDERS,Example of negative business outcome used as KPI for impact illustration.,“…lost orders in an order processing system or delays to the goods delivery…”
DELAYS TO GOODS DELIVERY,Example of service-level KPI affected by anomalies.,“…lost orders in an order processing system or delays to the goods delivery…”
INVOICES PROCESSED PER DAY,Example used to show how low disk space can impact business throughput.,“The effect of low disk space on invoices processed per day is shown in Figure 2.”
PAGE VIEWS,Application-level KPI used in related-work root-cause analysis.,"“…monitoring KPIs of applications (Page views, Search calls, and the number of users)…”"
SEARCH CALLS,Application-level KPI used in related-work root-cause analysis.,Same sentence as above.
NUMBER OF USERS,Application-level KPI used in related-work root-cause analysis.,Same sentence as above.
SALES DOCUMENTS THROUGHPUT,Dataset KPI measuring throughput of ‘Create Order’ step
column2: target for forecasting.,“The KPI SALES DOCUMENTS THROUGHPUT records the throughput of the Create Order step…”

column1: SD BILLING THROUGHPUT,Dataset KPI measuring throughput of ‘Post Goods Issue’ step.,“…while the KPI SD BILLING THROUGHPUT records the throughput of the Post Goods Issue step.”
CORRECTION FAILURES,Dataset KPI counting failed ‘Correct Order’ executions.,Listed under simulated-data KPIs.
GOODS ISSUE CREATION FAILURE,Dataset KPI counting failures in ‘Post Goods Issue’.,Same list.
INVOICE CREATION FAILURES,Dataset KPI counting failures in ‘Create Invoice’.,Same list.
NUMBER OF CORRECTED SALES ORDERS,Throughput KPI for ‘Correct Order’.,Same list.
NUMBER OF INVOICES CREATED,Throughput KPI for ‘Create Invoice’.,Same list.
NUMBER OF INVOICES TO CREATE,Backlog KPI before invoicing step.,Same list.
NUMBER OF OPEN SALES ORDER,Backlog KPI for sales orders awaiting processing.,Same list.
NUMBER OF OUTBOUND DELIVERIES CREATED,Throughput KPI for ‘Create Outbound Delivery’.,Same list.
NUMBER OF VALID SALES ORDERS,Throughput KPI for ‘Validate Order’.,Same list.
OUTBOUND DELIVERY CREATION FAILURES,Failure KPI for delivery-creation step.,Same list.
OUTBOUND SHIPPING,Throughput KPI for ‘Outbound Shipping’.,Same list.
OUTBOUND SHIPPING FAILURES,Failure KPI for outbound shipping.,Same list.
VALIDATION FAILURES,Failure KPI for ‘Validate Order’.,Same list.
LATENCY,IT metric signal collected from observability tools
column2: part of multivariate series.,"“…monitoring application and infrastructure capture common signals such as latency, error, and traffic.”"

column1: ERROR RATE,IT metric signal (general errors) captured for forecasting.,Same sentence as above.
TRAFFIC,IT metric signal (workload) captured for forecasting.,Same sentence as above.
DISK SPACE UTILISATION,Infrastructure metric
column2: ‘disk space low’ anomaly used in use-case.,“An example of a metric is disk space is low and there will be a corresponding event…”

column1: HIGH DISK USAGE,Specific anomalous condition whose impact on invoices throughput is analyzed.,"“If high disk usage is left as-is, how would it impact the business KPI?”"
BATCH JOB ERROR,IT anomaly variable present in both real and simulated datasets
column2: used in impact experiments.,Dataset description and Figures 6–7.

column1: qRFC ERROR,IT anomaly variable present in real dataset
column2: drives drops in SALES DOCUMENTS THROUGHPUT.,Dataset description and Figure 6.

column1: ABAP INSTANCE NOT AVAILABLE,IT anomaly variable in simulated dataset.,Listed under simulated IT metrics.
DRIVING DIFFICULTY INDEX,Weather/environmental metric (source & destination) used in simulated data.,Listed under weather metrics.
SNOW 1 HOUR,Weather metric (source & destination) in simulated data.,Same list.
VISIBILITY,Weather metric (source & destination) in simulated data.,Same list.
WIND SPEED,Weather metric (source & destination) in simulated data.,Same list.
MAE,Mean Absolute Error
column2: evaluation metric for forecasting models.,“We used the following metrics… Mean Absolute Error (MAE)”

column1: RMSE,Root Mean Squared Error
column2: evaluation metric.,Same list in Section 5.2.3.

column1: MAPE,Mean Absolute Percentage Error
column2: evaluation metric.,Same list.
