column1: Goni and Van Looy 2024 - Developing a framework for innovating less-structured business processes - a Delphi study.pdf
Medidor de Performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto (trecho ou referência)

Performance organizacional,Utilizado como resultado esperado do desenvolvimento da capacidade de inovação de processo (PIC).,"“… can help organizations enhance their performance, increase demands, and lower costs …”"

Produtividade,Apresentado como recurso a ser melhorado por meio das capacidades organizacionais.,“… a capability is a non-transferable organization-specific resource that is used to enhance the productivity of the organization’s other resources …”
Demanda (market demand),Citada como variável de resultado influenciada pela PIC.,"“… enhance their performance, increase demands, …”"
Custo,Mencionado como métrica a ser reduzida via inovação de processo.,"“… enhance their performance, increase demands, and lower costs …”"

Receita (revenues) / Servitização,Indicada como métrica financeira ligada à oferta de serviços ao redor de produtos.,“… large parts of revenues are generated from the services provided around products …”
Qualidade,Associada ao impacto positivo da inovação de processo sobre produto/serviço.,"“… may enhance quality, introduce new products and services …”"
Eficiência,Apontada como objetivo de processos estruturados e inovação incremental.,“… develop a process model with as much structure as possible … to enhance efficiency and standardization …”

Flexibilidade,Indicada como necessidade de resposta rápida a ambientes dinâmicos e medida de adequação dos processos.,“Organizations operating in dynamic environments need to respond to changes in a quick and flexible way …”

Tempo (speed/quickness),Usado como métrica de rapidez para identificação/execução de LSBP e como restrição (barreira).,“… LSBP tends to be faster and easier to identify …” / “Time and budget are more critical in LSBP …”
Orçamento (Budget),Tratado como restrição e recurso a ser alocado em inovação.,“Time and budget are more critical in LSBP because innovation necessitates a thorough understanding …”

Controle,Apresentado como indicador de governança e como barreira quando ausente.,“… lack of control …” / “An organization’s ability to regulate less-structured activities by establishing formalized procedures and business rules …”
Resultados (Outcomes),"Usado como métrica de impacto da inovação, difícil de mensurar em LSBP.",“It is typically more difficult to determine the impact of innovation outcomes in LSBP.”

Padronização,"Citada como grau de uniformidade (maior em SBP, menor em LSBP) e indicador de desempenho de processo.",“… SBP has a strong institutionalization with a well-defined workflow and clear measurement system.”
Taxa de resposta,Métrica de participação de especialistas nas rodadas Delphi.,"“The response rate for the first and second rounds was 77% and 90%, respectively.”"
Pontuação de satisfação geral,Indicador de qualidade do framework nas rodadas Delphi.,"“… overall score, which increased from 7.52 out of 10 in round 2 to 8.36 out of 10 in round 3.”"
Escala Likert,Instrumento de mensuração de concordância/importância utilizado nas rodadas.,“… using a 7-point Likert scale (1 = totally disagree
column2: 7 = totally agree) …”

column1: Ranking de importância,Métrica comparativa para priorizar capacidades no Delphi.,“… asked to rank the importance of each capability …”

Percentual de consenso,Critério quantitativo para decidir inclusão/exclusão de itens.,“50% of the experts must agree on the two most extreme scores … 75% must agree on the three most extreme scores …”
Intervalo interquartil (IQR),Métrica estatística usada para medir dispersão das respostas e critério de consenso.,“The interquartile range (IQR …) must be 3 or less …”
Xu et al. 2013 - Design of an ultra-compact stripline BPM receiver using microtca for LCLS-II at SLAC.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence in the text
Rayleigh length (zr),Quantifies beam divergence and is extracted from each simulated spike to model far-field size
column2: compared between design and start-to-end cases,“The average Rayleight length of 32 m is actually larger than the steady-state case… The rms variation is 4 m.” / “The Rayleigh length depends strongly on the underlying model of the simulation and shows significantly smaller values for start-end simulation.”

column1: Waist position (z0),Defines effective source point of the radiation
column2: fluctuations of z0 describe shot-to-shot pointing,“The effective waist position is in average 38 m within the undulator … and has a rms fluctuation of 4.8 m.”

column1: Waist size (w0),One of the three Gaussian beam parameters used to match simulation results
column2: corrected for higher-order modes,"“Eq. 1 has three unknown parameter – the waist size w0, the waist position z0 and Rayleigh length zr – the system is fully deterministic …”  "

column1: Radiation rms size / Spot size (Σ),Primary measure of beam cross-section in near and far field
column2: compared with coherence area,“The easiest quantities to extract from the results of FEL simulations are the rms sizes of the radiation pulse in the near and far field.” / “about five times larger than the spot size Σ.”

column1: Beam divergence,Needed for beam-line design
column2: linked to Rayleigh length and rms sizes,“In particular the divergence and beam size determine the design of apertures and target sizes.”

column1: Mutual coherence function (Γ12(τ)),Statistical measure of field correlation in space-time
column2: introduced to define coherence,"“Γ12(τ) = ⟨E(r1,t)E(r2,t+τ)⟩”  "

column1: Vukšic et al. 2017 - Social business process management - Croatian IT company case study.pdf

column1: BPM maturity level,"Classificação derivada do PPI (Initiation, Evolution, Mastery) que posiciona a organização em estágios de maturidade de gestão por processos.","""(1) process management initiation (PPI from 10 to 25 points)
column2: (2) process management evolution (PPI from 26 to 40)
column3: and (3) process management mastery (PPI from 41 to 50)."" / ""This company is at the upmost maturity level or “process management mastery” stage of BPM maturity.""  "

column1: Carroll and Wang 2011 - Service networks performance analytics - A literature review.pdf
Nome do Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Ciclo de tempo (Time cycle),Indicador de rapidez dos processos
column2: usado para avaliar melhoria de desempenho organizacional após orientação a processos.,"“...reported to improve the organisation performance in terms of faster time cycle, reduced cost, and less duplication of work across functions” (Seção 3)  "

column1: Custo (Cost),Mede a redução de gastos operacionais como parte dos resultados de desempenho.,"“...improve the organisation performance in terms of faster time cycle, reduced cost, and less duplication of work across functions” (Seção 3)  "
Duplicação de trabalho (Duplication of work),Mede retrabalho/atividades duplicadas
column2: objetivo é minimizar para melhorar desempenho.,"“...improve the organisation performance in terms of faster time cycle, reduced cost, and less duplication of work across functions” (Seção 3)  "

column1: SLA – Service Level Agreement,Métrica/contrato que governa serviços humanos e de software dentro da rede
column2: usado para controlar níveis de serviço.,“...software and human services governed by service level agreements (SLA) and Quality of Service (QoS)” (Seção 4 – Figura 2 descrita no texto)

column1: QoS – Quality of Service,Mede a qualidade/taxa de serviço entregue
column2: associada aos SLAs como critério de desempenho.,“...software and human services governed by service level agreements (SLA) and Quality of Service (QoS)” (Seção 4 – Figura 2 descrita no texto)

column1: Métricas de processo (Process metrics),Monitoram e controlam serviços atômicos
column2: servem para análise de desempenho em nível de atividade.,“...the atomic services monitored controlled by process metrics...” (Seção 4 – Figura 2 descrita no texto)

column1: Métricas de participantes (Participant metrics),Gerem o desempenho dos processos de serviço ao nível dos participantes envolvidos.,“...the service processes managed by participant metrics...” (Seção 4 – Figura 2 descrita no texto)

Indicadores-chave de desempenho da rede (Network KPIs),Acompanham o desempenho das transações de negócio em toda a rede de serviços.,“...the business transactions managed by network key performance indicators (KPIs).” (Seção 4 – Figura 2 descrita no texto)

Métricas de performance (Performance metrics – genérico),"Referência geral a indicadores quantitativos usados para prever, medir e otimizar o desempenho da rede de serviços.","Palavra-chave do artigo: “performance metrics” (Título, Resumo e Palavras-chave) – estabelece a necessidade de tais medidores ao longo do texto."
Vo et al. 2018 - Next Generation Business Intelligence and Analytics.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Response Time,Medida de rapidez de resposta de consultas/serviços
column2: relacionado a ‘maximal response time’ e necessidade de respostas quase em tempo-real.,“service level objectives like maximal response time” / “near real-time BI”

column1: Query Response Time,"Forma específica de response time para consultas OLAP, usada para avaliar rapidez das respostas sobre dados analíticos.",“fast OLAP query response time”
Throughput Rate,Quantidade de transações/consultas executadas por unidade de tempo
column2: usado para comparar alto desempenho de sistemas OLTP+OLAP.,“High throughput rates for both OLTP and OLAP”

column1: Latency,Tempo entre a chegada do dado e sua disponibilidade/uso analítico
column2: métrica central do BI operacional e situacional.,“reduce the latency between when the transaction data is acquired and when that data is available for analysis” / “low latency”

column1: Execution Time,Tempo de execução estimado ou observado de requisições
column2: dificuldade de previsão e necessidade de estimativa dinâmica.,“difficulty in predicting execution times” / “requests are first analyzed to estimate how long they would take to be performed”

column1: Space Overhead,Quantidade extra de armazenamento consumido por técnicas de cópia/snapshot
column2: usada para avaliar impacto de soluções.,“may cause additional space overhead” / “Optimum space overhead”

column1: Resource Utilization,Percentual de uso de recursos de hardware
column2: citado para mostrar impacto de contenção e sincronização.,“results in low overall resource utilization”

column1: Synchronization Overhead,Custo adicional de controle de concorrência que afeta desempenho global.,“High synchronization overhead is required to handle the resource contention”
Predictive Accuracy,Qualidade dos modelos preditivos
column2: usada para mostrar ganho de abordagens integrativas.,“results in higher accuracy” / “help to achieve a better predictive accuracy”

column1: False Prediction Rate,Taxa de previsões incorretas
column2: métrica complementar de acurácia.,“lower degree of false prediction”

column1: Mean Absolute Error (MAE),"Indicador estatístico de erro absoluto médio, usado como baseline para comparar modelos.",“Mean Absolute Error (MAE)”
Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE),"Indicador estatístico de erro percentual médio, usado para avaliar modelos de previsão.",“Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE)”
Root Mean Square Error (RMSE),"Indicador estatístico de erro quadrático médio, também usado na comparação de previsões.",“Root Mean Square Error (RMSE)”

Data Processing Set (dps(P(Q))),Meta principal de otimização
column2: número total de linhas trazidas dos fontes para executar um plano,“We introduce the notion of data processing set … as the number of rows that are read from the data sources by the EII Query Engine in order to complete the processing of AQ.”

column1: Carlo Rossa Hauck et al. 2021 - How has process assessment been automated by organizations - A systematic literature mapping.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho do texto)
KPI (Key Performance Index),Indicador usado para monitorar e avaliar a execução de processos de negócio.,“…allowing the definition and assessment of user-defined KPIs (Key Performance Indexes).”
Desempenho financeiro,Apontado como efeito/resultado a ser medido numa gestão orientada a processos.,“…positive effects of a process-oriented management … such as financial performance…”
Velocidade do processo,Indicada como resultado mensurável de melhoria de processos.,“…positive effects … increased process speed …”
Qualidade do produto,Indicada como métrica de resultado da gestão de processos.,“…positive effects … improvement product quality …”
Produtividade,Apontada como medida de desempenho obtida pela gestão de processos.,“…positive effects … productivity …”
Satisfação do cliente,Indicada como métrica de resultado da gestão de processos.,“…positive effects … customer satisfaction.”
Tempo,Usado como métrica para avaliar redução de duração das avaliações de processo.,“The main observed results … were reduction of … time …”
Esforço,Usado como métrica para avaliar redução de trabalho nas avaliações de processo.,“The main observed results … were reduction of effort …”
Complexidade,Mencionada como aspecto mensurado cuja redução é um resultado das avaliações automáticas.,“The main observed results … were reduction of … complexity …”
Nível de capacidade,Parte do framework de medição para avaliar quão capaz é o processo.,"“…defines capability and/or maturity levels, process attributes and rating criteria.”  "
Nível de maturidade,Usado para posicionar o grau de maturidade do processo/organização.,“…defines capability and/or maturity levels…”
Atributos de processo,Elementos avaliados no assessment para determinar desempenho do processo.,“…process attributes and rating criteria.”
Panda et al. 2014 - e-government procurement implementation in India - two comparative case studies from the field.pdf
Measure,Description/usage in the text,Evidence (exact or paraphrased quotation from the article)

Cost savings (percentage),Used to demonstrate financial benefit of e-procurement versus manual process,“case studies … report savings of up to 25% over the procurement carried out through traditional manual mode”
Cost savings (absolute value),Specific monetary saving achieved by GoAP implementation,“Cost savings to a tune of Rs 22000 Crore.”
Tender cycle time,Shows efficiency gain obtained through e-GP,“Tender cycle time reduced from average 90-135 days to 32 days.”
Supplier participation rate,Indicator of wider market access and competition,“Supplier participation increased from an average of 3 per tender in conventional mode to 4.5 in e-Procurement mode.”
Transaction fee versus tender fee,Cost to bidders compared with manual procedure,“Transaction fee payable by a bidder is lesser than tender fee charged in the manual tender system.”
Number of tenders processed – GoAP,Volume measure of system usage,“Total tenders: 308253 Nos.”
Value of tenders processed – GoAP,Monetary volume handled by the system,“Total value: Rs. 351529 Crore.”
Number of tenders processed – CPPP,Volume of central procurements published,“CPPP Portal: Total tenders: 1327 amounting  Rs. 2128.19 Crore.”
Number of tenders processed – GePNIC (MMP states),Usage level in states that adopted GePNIC under MMP,“States using GePNIC as MMP: Total tenders: 5727  Amounting Rs.11902 Crore.”
Number of tenders processed – GePNIC (non-MMP states),Usage level in other GePNIC states,“States using GePNIC as non-MMP: Total tenders: 7763 amounting Rs. 4410.80 Crore.”
Value of tenders processed – CPPP,Monetary value handled on CPPP,(same quotation as above – Rs 2128.19 Crore).
Value of tenders processed – GePNIC (MMP states),Monetary value in MMP states,(same quotation as above – Rs 11902 Crore).
Value of tenders processed – GePNIC (non-MMP states),Monetary value in non-MMP states,(same quotation as above – Rs 4410.80 Crore).
Number of suppliers registered,Shows size of supplier base and adoption,“No of suppliers registered on E-GP portal: 60000”
Number of public entities using system,Reflects breadth of institutional adoption,"“No of dept using: 27 Dept, 43 PSU & Corporations, 20 Universities and 135 Urban Local Bodies”"
Number of officers trained,Training performance indicator,"“Initially, 9500+ officers … trained.”"
Number of contractors/suppliers trained,Stakeholder capacity-building indicator,"“…and 20,000+ Contractors/ Suppliers trained.”"
e-Readiness ranking,Macro-level indicator used to select case and gauge ICT environment,“Andhra Pradesh figures in the leader position in e-Readiness rankings.”
Project failure probability (70%),Benchmark risk/performance figure for e-Gov projects,“E-GP project like any other e-Governance project has 70% chances of failure.”
Return on Investment (ROI),Listed as a performance metric for justification and monitoring,CSF table entry: “Return on investment (ROI)”
Total Cost of Ownership (TCO),Used as a cost-oriented performance metric in project justification,CSF table entry: “Total cost of ownership (TCO)”
Awards and recognitions,Qualitative performance signal of project success,“UN Public Service Award in 2007 and Top 20 Best Innovations in the World …”
17th International Conference on Busi... 2019 - 17th International Conference on Business Process Management, BPM 2019.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (excerpt)

Mean Topic Coherence,Indicator of internal validity when choosing the optimal number of topics in the LDA models.,"“We use mean topic coherence as an indicator of internal validity, which measures how accurately high-probability words of a topic do co-occur across documents [6].”"

Perplexity,Indicator of external validity when choosing the optimal number of topics in the LDA models.,"“Perplexity measures external validity, the capacity of the inferred word-topic distributions to capture word co-occurrences in previously unseen documents [5].”"

F-measure,"Performance measure to evaluate the quality of classification rules for removing duplicates and noise sentences, used to pick the best threshold.","“.10-threshold yielded the best F-measure (.90) in detecting duplicates…”
column2: “A .50-threshold yielded the best F-measure (.82, j = .74) in detecting noise sentences”."

column1: Cohen’s kappa (reported as j),Agreement measure between human coders when validating duplicate detection and topic labeling steps.,“…detecting duplicates as classified by two researchers (Cohen’s j = .78).”
column2: “…treated a topic as noise when it addressed a theme that was obviously not domain-related (j = .93).”

column1: Straight-Through Processing Rate,Operational performance metric showing the proportion of trades processed automatically without exceptions at Goldman Sachs.,“Goldman Sachs processed more than one million trades per day with a straight-through processing rate of about 96%…”

Gap Statistic,Cluster-validation measure used to choose the optimal number of clusters in the skill-configuration analysis.,“…and validated using the gap statistic which measures the goodness of a solution relative to a randomly sampled solution of the same number of clusters [25].”

medidor_de_performance,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto

Staff saving (% e quantidades),"Redução na mão-de-obra devido à automação (RFID, WSN).",“95.24 % of saving on staff involved at the Truck Gate Out and Yard.” / Tabela 9 mostra Truck gate-out staff 6→0
column2: Yard staff 15→1.

column2: usado para localizar gargalos.,"“Fig. 5c shows the queue time at each task, which is important to determine the internal efficiency of the workflow … queuing on task2 is higher …” / “queue time generated by simulation S2 … bottlenecks.”  "

column1: Throughput (tokens completos por tempo),"Número de instâncias (tokens) concluídas ao longo do tempo, comparado entre cenários.",Fig. 5b “number of tokens completed in time… dark and light gray curves.”
Waiting tokens,Quantidade de tokens na fila em cada tarefa em determinado instante.,"Fig. 5a “…represented by an overturned triangle: 10 and 31 waiting tokens for task1 and task2, respectively.”  "
Number of tokens processing,Tokens em execução simultânea

During simulation, the simulator keeps track … thus measuring the actual costs.”  "
Arrival rate/Inter-arrival time,Taxa com que novas instâncias entram no processo

column1: Waiting time for an inpatient bed,Indicator of bed-flow efficiency and hospital congestion,"“This shortage of inpatient beds ultimately affects the flow of admitted patients: patients who are forced to wait until beds become available (Eitel et al., 2010).”"

Number of out-of-stock items,Existing KPI in the bulk-procurement process to track medicine availability,"“The prior bulk procurement process had three measures in place (number of out of stock items, number of payments made outside of 30 days and value of expired stock).”"

Number of payments made outside 30 days,Existing KPI monitoring financial efficiency in bulk procurement,“The prior bulk procurement process had three measures in place (… number of payments made outside of 30 days …).”
Value of expired stock,Existing KPI monitoring waste and inventory quality,“The prior bulk procurement process had three measures in place (… and value of expired stock).”

Supplier delivery timeliness / late deliveries,Proposed KPI to pre-empt stock-outs by tracking supplier performance,"“It was also noted that supplier orders were not recorded. Hence, late deliveries could not be pre-empted leading to stock-outs.”"

Current stock levels,Proposed KPI to trigger timely ordering and reduce expiries,“better key performance indicators (KPIs) were recommended to monitor current stock enabling the timely ordering of new stock”

Completeness of ICD-10 coding (count of incomplete or missing codes),Operational metric for data quality and revenue protection,“The report indicates incomplete and missing codes on specified dates for each floor (A–H) of the hospital.”

Process time for ward discharge,Target metric for redesign to shorten overall discharge cycle,"“The proposed recommendations could allow the activities in the discharge process to happen in parallel, which will reduce the total process time …”"
Patient satisfaction,Outcome metric linked to waiting times and discharge efficiency,“low patient satisfaction with a potential risk of official complaints and legal actions against the hospital”
Patient turnover rate (during the day),Throughput metric affected by discharge delays,“…low patient turnover during the day with resultant overcrowded intake wards and emergency departments …”
Ali et al. 2020 - Deep Analysis of Process Model Matching Techniques.pdf
Metric,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual

Precision,É utilizado para medir o grau de exatidão dos pares de atividades identificados. Calcula-se como a razão entre os pares verdadeiros-positivos e a soma de verdadeiros-positivos com falsos-positivos
column2: é apresentado como valor global por conjunto de dados e discutido nos resultados.,"""…a efetividade dessas técnicas de matching tem sido avaliada usando três medidas de desempenho amplamente utilizadas, Precision, Recall e F1 score."" (Resumo)
column3: """"""Precision é a razão entre pares verdadeiros-positivos e pares verdadeiros-positivos e falsos-positivos [22]"""""" (Sec. IV-A)  "

column1: Recall,"Serve para medir a abrangência (cobertura) dos pares corretos recuperados. Calcula-se como a razão entre verdadeiros-positivos e a soma de verdadeiros-positivos com falsos-negativos
column2: é reportado tanto de forma global quanto separado por tipo de par (VB, MC, HR).","""…a efetividade dessas técnicas de matching tem sido avaliada usando três medidas de desempenho amplamente utilizadas, Precision, Recall e F1 score."" (Resumo)
column3: """"""Recall é a razão entre pares verdadeiros-positivos e pares verdadeiros-positivos e falsos-negativos"""""" (Sec. IV-A)  "

column1: F1 score,É usado como métrica única de efetividade global
column2: corresponde à média harmônica de Precision e Recall e é calculado para cada técnica e para cada conjunto de dados.,"""…a efetividade dessas técnicas de matching tem sido avaliada usando três medidas de desempenho amplamente utilizadas, Precision, Recall e F1 score."" (Resumo)
column3: """"""F1 score é a média harmônica de Precision e Recall."""""" (Sec. IV-A)  "

column1: Harmonic Mean (of Precision and Recall),"Mencionada explicitamente para definir o F1 score
column2: indica que a F1 é derivada da média harmônica desses dois indicadores, podendo ser vista também como um indicador de desempenho.","""F1 score é a média harmônica de precision e recall."" (Sec. IV-A)"

column1: Borges et al. 2018 - Monitoring of Business Processes_ non Functional Requirements based on Quality of Service.pdf
medidor,como_usado,evidencia_textual
KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Indicador de desempenho de nível estratégico
column2: serve de fonte para derivar BLAs
column3: pretende-se incluí-lo no monitoramento em tempo real dos dashboards,"“KPI2BLA : apoia o mapeamento de metas estratégicas organizacionais, representadas por Indicadores Chave de Desempenho (KPI)… ”
column4: “A flecha dupla cinza tracejada indica ainda uma intenção futura de incluir também o monitoramento dos KPIs que foram usados na criação dos BLAs”"

column1: BLA (Business Level Agreement),Acordo de nível de processo usado para especificar requisitos não funcionais no modelo BPMN
column2: é monitorado pelo StrAli-BAM
column3: cada BLA é mapeado para um conjunto de SLAs,“Um BLA pode ser associado a um subprocesso e ser posteriormente mapeado hierarquicamente para um conjunto de SLAs”
column4: “StrAli-BAM monitora os mesmos requisitos não funcionais em nível de negócio…”

column1: SLA (Service Level Agreement),Acordo de nível de serviço que define os atributos e níveis de QoS dos serviços Web
column2: base para o monitoramento técnico
column3: violações geram penalidades,“SLAs são tipicamente acordados entre fornecedores e consumidores… podem ser usados para monitorar se a entrega real do serviço está em conformidade com os termos acordados”

column1: SLO (Service Level Objective),"Elemento interno de um SLA que contém o atributo de QoS e o nível contratado
column2: cada SLO é registrado, coletado e comparado durante a execução","“Atributos e níveis de QoS de um SLA são comumente chamados de Objetivos de Nível de Serviço (SLO)”
column3: “Para cada SLO existente dentro de um SLA, é gerado um identificador único… armazenado no banco de dados”"

column1: Atributo de QoS (Quality of Service),Categoria geral dos requisitos não funcionais que podem ser medidos
column2: servem de base tanto para SLAs como para o cálculo dos BLAs,“StrAli-BAM monitora os mesmos requisitos não funcionais… com base nos mesmos atributos de QoS dos respectivos serviços web”

column1: Tempo de resposta,Atributo de QoS usado como exemplo de requisito crítico
column2: aparece em BLA (60 s) e nos SLAs correspondentes (30 s + 10 s tolerância),“assume-se que área de negócio considere crítico o tempo de resposta da atividade Aprovar Pagamento… BLA… meta de até 60 segundos… SLA de tempo de resposta tem meta de até 30 segundos com 10 segundos de tolerância”

column1: Segurança,Atributo de QoS monitorado por um SLA que deve retornar TRUE até 3 tentativas
column2: influencia o BLA de tempo de resposta no exemplo,“O SLA de segurança tem meta de retorno ‘TRUE’… com um máximo de três tentativas… ambos os SLAs tempo de resposta e segurança… influenciam o BLA tempo de resposta”

column1: Disponibilidade,Atributo de QoS citado como exemplo de SLA com meta mínima de 99 %,"“Um SLA pode incluir, por exemplo, um atributo de QoS referente à ‘disponibilidade’ de um serviço web, para o qual foi contratado o nível mínimo de 99 %”"

Throughput,Atributo de QoS mencionado entre os possíveis requisitos não funcionais a serem monitorados,"“QoSAttribute – tipo do requisito não funcional a ser monitorado, tais como, tempo de resposta, disponibilidade, throughput etc”"

Paralelismo,Requisito não funcional citado como exemplo de característica a ser monitorada em processos de negócio,"“Outros tipos de requisitos não funcionais tipicamente associados a partes de processos de negócio são relacionados a segurança, disponibilidade, paralelismo, custo, entre outros”"
Custo,Requisito não funcional citado como exemplo para processos de negócio,"“… relacionados a segurança, disponibilidade, paralelismo, custo, entre outros”"
Usabilidade,Requisito não funcional listado como exemplo de atributo de software a ser considerado,"“Exemplos desses requisitos são: desempenho, usabilidade, disponibilidade, segurança…”"
Desempenho,Requisito não funcional genérico (performance) citado como exemplo e como métrica de avaliação de processos,"“Exemplos desses requisitos são: desempenho, usabilidade, disponibilidade…”"
Bandaranayake et al. 2024 - Analysing cross-border logistics operations ... ormance improvement - development and validation of a reference model.pdf
Lead time
column2: Indicador de rapidez/confiabilidade do fluxo," cujo alongamento e variação prejudicam embarcadores e consignatários.
column3: …problems faced by shippers and consignees due to unreliable and long lead times…""  "

column1: Período de armazenagem (dwell time)
column2: Mostra quanto tempo os contêineres ficam parados no terminal antes do embarque," refletindo ineficiência.
column3: …buffering of containers at ports well in advance of vessel departure leading to long storage periods.""  "

column1: Estoque de segurança (safety stock)
column2: Nível de inventário mantido pelos consignatários como reação a atrasos
column3: quanto maior," pior o desempenho logístico.
column4: …have led consignees to build excessive safety stocks…""  "

column1: Di Salle et al. 2024 - Waste Management Through Digital Twins and Business Process Modeling.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (exact fragment or paraphrase from the paper)

Total cost of cleaning up litter,Economic KPI used to underline the financial impact of littering and the need for cost-effective solutions,“the total cost of cleaning up litter on the land throughout the EU is in the range of €10-13 billion [10]”

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),General set of metrics proposed to monitor the effectiveness of the disposal processes and feed public dashboards,“Proper key performance indicators (KPIs) and publicly accessible dashboards must be designed.”
Ranks produced by the gamification logic,Gamified performance measure used to reward/compare citizens and administrations,“a dashboard … to visualize the ranks generated by the gamification logic”

Indexes derived from collected data,Aggregated indicators that administrations can use to show the impact of their actions and their progress towards the SDGs,“the indexes derived from the collected data could be used by administrations to demonstrate the impact of actions … in the context of the SDGs4.”

Service quality KPI,Quality-of-service indicator balanced against costs in prior work and cited as an innovative KPI,“find a compromise between costs and quality of services … an innovative key performance indicator to measure service quality.”

Benchmarks,Reference performance values generated by a digital twin to compare municipalities and guide improvements,“The digital twin provides benchmarks for implementing similar systems in other municipalities …”

Frequency of abandoned sites,Spatial/temporal rate used by decision-makers to identify ‘hot areas’ and deploy enforcement resources,"“a hot area with a high frequency of abandoned sites may be targeted by local police, etc.”  "

Ability of administrations to keep areas clean (cleanliness rate),"Competitive KPI for public bodies, derived from citizen reports",“Administrations will compete on their ability to keep areas clean based on citizens’ reports.”

Percentage (or count) of abandoned waste eventually disposed,Process-correctness KPI checked by analysis routines to ensure every reported waste item is removed,“analysis routines to check that … every abandoned waste will eventually be disposed of.”
Medjahed and Atif 2006 - Context-based matching for Web service composition.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Tmatch,Tempo médio total do processo de matching
column2: calculado como média entre tempo mínimo e máximo,"“We compute the average matching time Tmatch. Thus, Tmatch is equal to ( Tmin_match + Tmax_match )/2 …”  "

column1: Tmin_match,"Tempo mínimo total de matching
column2: soma dos tempos mínimos de polling 1, polling 2 e decisão",“Tmin_match = Tmin_Poll1 + Tmin_Poll2 + Tmin_dec”

column1: Tmax_match,"Tempo máximo total de matching
column2: soma do pior caso dos tempos de polling 1, polling 2 e decisão",“Tmax_match = Tmax_Poll1 + Ncom × Tmax_Poll2 + Tmax_dec”

column1: Tpoll,Tempo gasto na fase de polling (coleta de informações),“the global matching time Tmatch includes a polling time Tpoll and decision time Tdec (Tmatch = Tpoll + Tdec).”
Tdec,Tempo gasto na fase de decisão (consolidação das respostas),Mesmo excerto acima
Tpoll1,Tempo gasto pelo CME para decompor a requisição e invocar comunidades,“Tpoll is composed of the time Tpoll1 spent by CME to decompose requests and invoke community services …”
Tpoll2,Tempo gasto por cada comunidade para processar seu sub-pedido,“… and the time Tpoll2 spent by each involved community to process the its sub-request.”
Tmin_poll,Tempo mínimo total de polling,“Tmin_poll = Tmin_poll1 + Tmin_poll2”
Tmax_poll,Tempo máximo total de polling,“Tmax_poll = Tmax_poll1 + Ncom × Tmax_poll2”
Tmin_poll1,Menor tempo para buscar políticas e enviá-las (1 política),“Tmin_poll1 = TP−one + TXML + TNet”
Tmax_poll1,Maior tempo para buscar políticas e enviá-las (todas as políticas),“Tmax_poll1 = TP−all + Ncom × (TXML + TNet)”
Tmin_poll2,Menor tempo de processamento dentro de uma comunidade,“Tmin_poll2 = 2 × TP−one + TCxRB + 2 × TCS + 4 × TXML + TMCR”
Tmax_poll2,Maior tempo de processamento dentro de uma comunidade,“Tmax_poll2 = TP−one + NCS × (TXML + TCxRB + NS × (TP−one + TXML + 2 × TCS + NR−t × (2 × TXML + TMCR)))”
Tmin_dec,Tempo mínimo de decisão (uma resposta),"“In the best case scenario, Tmin_dec = TNet + Trep …”  "
Tmax_dec,Tempo máximo de decisão (Ncom respostas sequenciais),“Tmax_dec = Ncom × (TNet + Trep)”
Ncom,Número de comunidades envolvidas (parâmetro de contagem usado nos cálculos de tempo),Tabela 3: “Ncom Number of communities”
Np,Número de políticas por serviço,Tabela 3
NCS,Número de especificações de contexto por política,Tabela 3
Nmemb,Número de membros por comunidade,Tabela 3
NR−t,Número de regras por tipo t,Tabela 3
NS,Número de serviços no repositório,Tabela 3
TP−all,Tempo para buscar todas as políticas de um serviço no registro,Tabela 3: “TP−all Time to fetch all policies of a service from the registry”
TP−one,Tempo para buscar uma política de um serviço,Tabela 3
TCS,Tempo para obter uma especificação de contexto,Tabela 3
TXML,Tempo para parsear uma descrição de serviço,Tabela 3
TNet,Atraso de transmissão na rede,Tabela 3
TCxRB,Tempo para buscar regras na base CxRB,Tabela 3
TMCR,Tempo para executar a função matchContextProperty dentro de uma regra,Tabela 3
Trep,Tempo gasto pelo CME para avaliar a resposta de uma comunidade,Tabela 3
Mezouar and El Afia 2018 - Performance analysis model for service supply chains - Case of the retirement supply chain.pdf

Eggers et al. 2021 - No Longer Out of Sight, No Longer Out of Mind - How ... ss Mining-Induced Transparency to Achieve Increased Process Awareness.pdf
Performance_Measure,Description_of_Usage,Evidence_from_Text
On-Time Delivery (OTD),Standardised KPI at ManuCorp and DistriCorp
column2: monitored with process-mining dashboards to compare divisions/departments and trigger improvements.,"""…every division was now required to use process mining to monitor their sub-processes, such as local warehousing and sales processes, in terms of OTD.""  /  ""The expert team decided on KPIs, such as automation rates and OTD…"""

column1: OTD Deviation / Late Deliveries,Used as a derivative of OTD to identify causes of delayed customer deliveries and cross-divisional issues.,"""…the reason for late customer deliveries was unnecessary price coordination between some divisions involved in the process."""

Warehouse Throughput Time,Measured at DistriCorp to evaluate efficiency of warehousing process and detect stagnation.,"""…warehouse throughput times had been optimized to the limit, but we did not know why we were still losing time before shipping orders."""

Automation Rate,KPI at DistriCorp to monitor how far activities are executed automatically inside procurement & warehouse processes.,"""The expert team decided on KPIs, such as automation rates and OTD…"""

Process KPIs (generic),Several departments relied on individually calculated KPIs whose definitions had to be harmonised.,"""…responsibility for process design and optimization remained with each division…the KPI definition varied from department to department."""
Number of Price Changes,Count of unnecessary price changes in sales department
column2: used to explain production delays.,"""…sales department became aware of their high rates of unnecessary price changes, which caused subsequent production delays…"""

column1: Rework Rate (Paint Shop / Assembly),Measured at AutoCorp to show quality problems and inefficiencies between production stages.,"""…production department analysed sensor data from assembly to find the root causes for high rework rates in the paint shop."""

Rework Effort in Pension Claims,Measured time and repetitions in processing pension claims exceeding promised service level.,"""…pension department discovered…they regularly required more time than promised to the customer to process pension claims due to unnecessary rework."""

Call Volume to Customer Service,Used by PensionCorp to assess customer reaction to annual information documents.,"""…process analysis revealed that a high volume of customer calls occurred once a year after information documents had been sent out to customers."""

Adoption Rate of Self-Service Channels,Measured by ICT department at PensionCorp to evaluate success of online portals.,"""…ICT department explored why customers were not adopting the self-service channels they provided, such as online forms and websites."""

Supplier Reliability (Early / Late Deliveries),Analysed at DistriCorp by comparing supplier promised vs. actual delivery dates to improve cooperation.,"""…procurement analysed the reliability of their suppliers and found out that some suppliers ‘deliver the goods a few days early…’"""

Missing Order Confirmation Rate,Alert in DistriCorp ‘control function’ when delivery date is near but supplier confirmation is missing.,"""…employees were alerted that ‘the delivery date is due, but we have not received any order confirmation from the supplier…’"""
Number of Workflows for Change Requests,"Count of Workflow Variants (3,000) in AutoCorp change management
column2: used to streamline process.","""…change management department revealed through process mining that they carried out 3,000 different workflows to process change requests."""

column1: Implementation Rate of Change Requests,Measured misalignment between development requests and production implementation at AutoCorp.,"""…how many change requests our [development] project teams submitted…and how often they ended up not being implemented in production."""

Compliance Indicators (unnamed),Detected by PensionCorp in registration sub-process to reveal compliance problems.,"""…initial analysis of the pension registration sub-process, the team found compliance problems…"""

Communication Pattern Metrics,"Used in several cases (e.g., PensionCorp, AutoCorp) to reveal inefficient or missing interactions.","""…identified inefficient communication patterns between the development and change management departments that delayed the end-to-end process…"""
Bevacqua et al. 2014 - A data-driven prediction framework for analyzing and monitoring business process performances.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Remaining processing time (μRT),Medida-alvo do modelo preditivo
column2: estimada para prever quanto tempo falta para terminar a instância em execução,"“we will focus hereinafter on two particular instances of such a function, where the performance measure corresponds to the remaining time (denoted by μRT)…​”  "

column1: Remaining processing steps (μRS),Medida-alvo do modelo
column2: estima quantas atividades faltam para o término da instância,“…​or the remaining steps (denoted by μRS) … the number of remaining steps is ˆμRS(τ(i]) = len(τ) – i”

column1: Total processing time,Utilizado em modelos de SLA para definir o tempo máximo permitido para uma instância completa,"“we next focus on a speciﬁc kind of SLA violations, corresponding to the overcoming of maximal threshold M on the total processing time.”  "
Berrocal et al. 2010 - Lean management of software processes and factories using business process modeling techniques.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal (trecho do artigo)
Costs (Custos),Servem como KPI para que gerentes da empresa acompanhem gastos dos projetos e da organização.,“Company managers can see KPIs on costs…”
Profits (Lucros),KPI mostrado a gerentes da empresa para avaliar retorno financeiro.,“Company managers can see KPIs on … profits…”
Company efficiency (Eficiência da empresa),Indicador global para avaliar quão bem a empresa utiliza seus recursos.,“Company managers can see KPIs on … company efficiency…”

Average level of occupation of each factory (Nível médio de ocupação de cada fábrica),Mede a utilização da mão-de-obra em cada centro de desenvolvimento.,“…and the average level of occupation of each factory.”
Productivity of the factory overall (Produtividade da fábrica),Permite que gerentes de fábrica avaliem sua eficiência.,“Factory managers can evaluate the productivity of the factory overall…”
Productivity of each employee (Produtividade de cada empregado),Usado por gerentes de fábrica para medir desempenho individual.,“…or of each employee in particular…”

Contribution of each project to the factory's workload (Contribuição de cada projeto para a carga da fábrica),Ajuda a balancear carga entre projetos e fábricas.,“…and view the contribution of each project to the factory's workload.”
Progress of a project (Progresso do projeto),Mostrado a líderes de projeto para acompanhar avanço.,“Project leaders can view statistics about the progress of a project…”
Averages of resources assigned (Média de recursos alocados),KPI para comparar alocação planejada com uso real.,“…the averages of resources assigned and actually used…”
Averages of resources actually used (Média de recursos usados),Usado junto com recursos alocados para detectar desvios.,“…the averages of resources assigned and actually used…”
Gaps in the estimates (Desvios das estimativas),Mostra diferença entre esforço estimado e real.,“…and gaps in the estimates.”
Metrics about the tasks undertaken (Métricas das tarefas executadas),Usadas por líderes de equipe para controlar execução.,“Team leaders can view metrics about the tasks undertaken…”
Work done by each resource (Trabalho realizado por recurso),Permite avaliar desempenho individual em tarefas.,“…or the work done by each resource.”

Quality of processes (Qualidade dos processos),Indicador definido por gerentes de qualidade para avaliar aderência e eficiência do processo.,“Quality managers can set up controls to evaluate the quality of processes…”
Efficiency of developers (Eficiência dos desenvolvedores),KPI de qualidade que mede produtividade individual/coletiva.,“…the efficiency of developers…”
Bug count / Bugs in the products (Número de defeitos),Usado por gerentes de qualidade para medir qualidade do produto.,“…or bugs in the products.”

Compliance with company objectives and rules (Conformidade com objetivos e regras),Índice gerado para verificar aderência às metas corporativas.,“capacity to generate indices to evaluate compliance with the company's objectives and rules.”

Project / process deviation (Desvios de projeto/processo),Avaliação constante para reação rápida a problemas.,"“Constant evaluation of projects and processes, with rapid reaction to any deviations detected.”"
Developer workload (Carga de trabalho do desenvolvedor),Mede horas reservadas/ usadas por cada membro da equipe.,“…facility of monitoring each developer's workload.”
Use of manpower / Manpower utilization (Uso da mão-de-obra),Indicador de quanto do tempo disponível é realmente utilizado
column2: mencionado aumento de 25-50%.,“better use of manpower and increased productivity (some reports described a 25% to 50% increase in the use of manpower)”

column1: Reserved hours vs actual hours used (Horas reservadas x horas usadas),Comparação citada como KPI para detectar reservas excessivas ou subutilização.,“…statistics comparing the reserved hours and the actual hours used…”
Estimated effort per task (Esforço estimado),Registrado e comparado com esforço real para cálculo de desvios.,“…the estimated effort for each task and the actual effort finally to it…”
Actual effort per task (Esforço real),"Mede horas efetivamente gastas, base para vários KPIs (gaps, produtividade).",“…and the actual effort finally to it…”
Time reserved for each resource (Horas reservadas),Informação capturada para planejar carga de cada desenvolvedor.,“…the time reserved for each resource and the actual time used…”
Actual time used by each resource (Tempo efetivo usado),Base para cálculo de utilização e eficiência.,“…and the actual time used…”
Pika et al. 2017 - Mining Resource Profiles from Event Logs.pdf
PerformanceMeasure,Category,Description/Usage,EvidenceText

DistinctActivities (RBI 1.1),Skills,Number of different activities a resource completed in a time-slot – used to see whether a resource learns new skills/gets involved in more tasks over time.,“RBI 1.1 Distinct activities: The number of distinct activities completed by a given resource … This RBI is relevant in those working environments where resources learn new skills and get involved in more tasks over time.”

CaseTypes (RBI 1.2),Skills,Fraction of completed cases of a given type in which the resource participated – used to discover specialisation or change of portfolio.,"“RBI 1.2 Case types: The fraction of cases with a given value, p, of case attribute case type … managers can discover … that the resource is only processing cases related to a speciﬁc product or that it is getting involved in more complex cases over time.”  "

ActivityFrequency (RBI 1.3),Skills,Share of an activity’s executions performed by the resource – shows the tasks in which the resource is more/less experienced.,"“RBI 1.3 Activity frequency: … managers can discover, for example, those activities which a resource frequently executes … and those that it executes only occasionally.”  "
#DistinctTasksCompleted,Skills,Absolute count of distinct tasks executed by the resource (generic variant mentioned).,“… include: the number of distinct tasks completed by a resource …”

FractionDistinctTasks,Skills,Share of distinct tasks completed by the resource w.r.t. all distinct tasks in the log (generic variant).,“… the fraction of distinct tasks completed by a resource with respect to the total number of distinct tasks completed …”

CompletionsOfActivityWithProperty,Skills,"Count of activity completions with a given property (e.g., ‘urgent’) by the resource.",“… the number of completions of an activity with a given property by a resource …”
FractionCompletionsActivityWithProperty,Skills,Share of such completions w.r.t. total completions of that activity (generic).,“… the fraction of completions of the activity with the given property …”

CaseCompletionsWithProperty,Skills,Number of case completions with a given property handled by the resource.,“… the number of case completions with a given property in which a resource was involved …”
FractionCaseCompletionsWithProperty,Skills,Share of these cases w.r.t. all cases with that property.,“… the fraction of case completions with a given property …”

FractionActivityTypeByResource,Skills,Share of a given activity among all activity completions of the resource.,“… the fraction of completions of a given activity by a resource with respect to the total number of activity completions by the resource.”

ActivityCompletions (RBI 2.1),Utilisation,Count of activity instances a resource finishes in a time-slot – raw throughput.,“RBI 2.1 Activity completions: The number of activity instances completed by a given resource during a given time slot.”

CaseCompletionsNumber (RBI 2.2),Utilisation,Number of completed cases in which the resource participated during the slot.,“RBI 2.2 Number of case completions: The number of cases completed during a given time slot in which a given resource was involved.”

CaseCompletionsFraction (RBI 2.3),Utilisation,Fraction of all completed cases that involved the resource.,“RBI 2.3 Fraction of case completions … with respect to the total number of cases completed during the time slot.”

AverageWorkload (RBI 2.4),Utilisation,Average number of unfinished tasks the resource has open – proxy for load.,“RBI 2.4 Average workload: The average number of activities started by a given resource but not completed at a moment in time.”

#FractionActivityCompletions,Utilisation,Share of activity completions by the resource w.r.t. global total (generic).,“… the fraction of activity instances completed by a resource with respect to the total number of activity instances completed …”
#CompletionsOfGivenActivity,Utilisation,Count of executions of a specific activity by the resource (generic).,“… the number of completions of a given activity by a resource …”

#ActiveCases,Utilisation,Number of cases active for the resource in the slot (used later as DEA input).,“… the number of cases active during a given time slot (it should be considered as input if the number of active cases varies …)”

Multitasking (RBI 3.1),Preferences,Share of active time the resource has >1 concurrent tasks – indicates multitasking tendency.,“RBI 3.1 Multi-tasking: The fraction of active time during which a given resource is involved in more than one activity …”

NewAttributeValues (RBI 3.2),Preferences,"Count of task completions where an attribute value (e.g., amount) never seen before – proxy for risk-taking.",“RBI 3.2 New attribute values … This RBI reﬂects the resource’s propensity to execute new and hence risky tasks.”

ActivityReassignments (RBI 3.3),Preferences,Number of times a task started by the resource is completed by somebody else – shows delegation/ drop-outs.,“RBI 3.3 Activity reassignments: The number of times when an activity started by a given resource … was later completed by a different resource.”
#WeekdayWorkingPattern,Preferences,(Mentioned generically) Distribution of work over weekdays – detects preferred working days.,“… or perform more work during certain weekdays …”

InTimeActivities (RBI 4.1),Productivity,Fraction of the resource’s activity completions whose duration < threshold – timeliness quality.,"“For activity duration, the RBI can be formalised as follows: InTime Activities …”  "

SatisfactoryCases (RBI 4.2),Productivity,"Fraction of cases with satisfactory outcome (e.g., customer rating ≥ cf) involving the resource.","“RBI 4.2 Case outcomes: … This RBI requires a case outcome attribute to be recorded, for example feedback …”  "
AverageActivityDuration (RBI 4.3),Productivity,Average duration of a specific activity when executed by the resource – speed indicator.,“RBI 4.3 Average duration of a given activity …”
AverageCaseDuration (RBI 4.4),Productivity,Average throughput time of cases the resource worked on – global speed measure.,“RBI 4.4 Average case duration …”
AverageCustomerFeedback (RBI 4.5),Productivity,Mean customer feedback score over the resource’s completed cases – quality indicator.,“RBI 4.5 Average customer feedback …”

#RepeatActivityCount,Productivity,Number of times a task had to be repeated after the resource completed it (generic).,“… and the number of times when a given activity was repeated when completed by a resource.”
InteractionsBetweenResources (RBI 5.1),Collaboration,Number of completed cases jointly handled by two specified resources – dyadic cooperation.,“RBI 5.1 Interactions between two given resources: …”

SocialPosition (RBI 5.2),Collaboration,Fraction of active co-workers who share cases with the resource – network centrality proxy.,“RBI 5.2 Social position: The fraction of resources involved in the same cases with a given resource …”

Delegations (RBI 5.3),Collaboration,Number of tasks the resource creates/assigns that are executed by others – leadership indicator.,“RBI 5.3 Delegations: The number of times when a resource … assigns a task to another resource …”
#HandoversFromResource,Collaboration,Generic measure: count of handovers from/to a resource.,“… e.g. the number of handovers from/to a given resource …”

ProductivityScore (DEA),Overall Productivity,DEA-based efﬁciency value (0-1) comparing resource’s input/output mix to best practice frontier.,"“The productivity score for a given resource … is a value from 0 to 1 … If a resource’s productivity score … is 1, this means that the combination of the resource’s inputs and outputs … belongs to the efﬁcient frontier.”  "
OptimalRevenueOutput (DEA derivative),Overall Productivity,DEA result – maximum achievable weighted output for the resource’s observed input
column2: used to compute ProductivityScore.,“… DEA also allows us to assign costs to inputs and outputs … and to calculate optimal revenue output …”

column1: Celino et al. 2007 - Semantic business process analysis.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Goal reachability,Serve para avaliar se um modelo de processo garante que a execução sempre atingirá o objetivo pretendido.,“the state-based supports an analysis of goal reachability” e “as long as the enacted process can always reach its goal”
Process validity,É definido como o critério que confirma o alcance do objetivo sob determinados eventos externos.,“A process whose design ensures its goal will always be achieved … is termed valid”
Logical errors,Indicador negativo de desempenho
column2: englobam problemas como deadlocks e falta de sincronização.,"“splitting and merging structures are major sources of logical errors in process models (e.g., deadlocks and lack of synchronization)”  "

column1: Deadlocks,Erro específico citado como falha de desempenho em modelos de processo.,"“logical errors in process models (e.g., deadlocks …)”  "
Lack of synchronization,Outro erro específico que demonstra desempenho inadequado do fluxo de controle.,"“…logical errors in process models (e.g., … lack of synchronization)”  "
Completeness,Critério para verificar se o conjunto de padrões cobre todos os casos necessários.,“no way exists yet to assure that a particular set of patterns is complete and non-redundant”
Non-redundancy,Critério complementar à completude
column2: mede a ausência de duplicidades nos padrões.,“no way exists yet to assure that a particular set of patterns is complete and non-redundant”

column1: Expressiveness,Mede o quão bem a notação consegue representar e distinguir diferentes comportamentos de processo.,“the available notation for splitting and merging is usually not expressive enough for representing and distinguishing the different cases of possible process behaviors”
Ontological meaning,Indicador da adequação semântica dos construtos de modelagem
column2: a falta dele é apontada como problema.,“they often do not convey a well-defined ontological meaning”

column1: Quality of designed processes,Resultado global de desempenho esperado ao aplicar o framework proposto.,“may lead to an improved quality of designed processes”
Carmo et al. 2017 - An analysis of strategic goals and non-functional requirements in business process management.pdf
Medidor de Performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Empregado como técnica principal para modelar metas estratégicas e para monitorar/medir o desempenho de processos e a consecução das metas.,"“KPIs can model quantitative indicators, which are measurable and useful for monitoring the progress and success of strategic goals (Parmenter, 2015).”"
Customer satisfaction (99 %),Exemplo de meta estratégica quantitativa que será monitorada por indicadores de desempenho.,“increasing customer satisfaction to 99% by 2020”
Project execution time (-25 %),Exemplo de meta estratégica de redução de tempo que deve ser acompanhada por indicadores de desempenho.,“reducing project execution time by 25% over the next two years”
Order approval time (≤3 days),Exemplo de meta operacional/KPI derivada que mede eficiência de processo.,“order approval time up to three days”

Processing time,Citado como métrica de processo que influencia os KPIs associados.,"“metrics varying during process execution can influence KPIs, and IT services can influence these metrics (e.g., ‘processing time’…”"
Results accuracy,Citado como métrica de qualidade que pode compor ou influenciar KPIs.,"“…metrics varying during process execution can influence KPIs… (e.g., ‘results accuracy’…”"
Services availability,Citado como métrica de disponibilidade que pode compor KPIs de processo.,"“…metrics varying during process execution can influence KPIs… (e.g., ‘services availability’…”"

Real-time KPI scores (BAM),"Usados para avaliar, em tempo real, o desempenho de atividades de processo via Business Activity Monitoring.",“Extending BPMN for Business Activity Monitoring… incorporate BAM concepts which aims to represent KPIs’ real-time scores for process activities.”

Performance measures specified in KPIs (rule-based optimisation),Medidas de desempenho derivadas de KPIs que orientam regras de negócio para otimização de processos.,“It breaks down business goals into subgoals so that the desired performance measures specified in KPIs are met in business rules.”

Pre-defined KPIs for operational performance (BPSim),Conjunto de indicadores (quatro KPIs) usados para quantificar variações de desempenho operacional em simulação de processos.,“The method allows testing of process designs and quantified measurement of variations in operational performance through four pre-defined KPIs.”
Candiello et al. 2012 - Quality and impact monitoring for local eGovernment services.pdf

Indicadores de impacto social/econômico,Avaliar efeitos sociais e econômicos dos serviços on-line (eGovernment Intelligence).,…to compose a useful picture of several local social and economical indicators and their correlations with the availability of advanced eGovernment services.
Indicadores de inovação,Verificar impacto dos serviços em ‘specific innovation indicators’.,…a positive impact of the offered services towards specific innovation indicators.

KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) de sistema,"Conjunto de medidas de operação, desempenho e uso coletadas pelo eMon.",…monitor and reporting a wide set of key technical usage and performance-related indicators…
KPIs de rede,Parte dos KPIs técnicos de baixo nível acompanhados pelo eMon.,"system-, network- and software-level key performance indicators."
KPIs de software,"Outro subconjunto de KPIs técnicos (ex.: tempo de resposta, erros).","system-, network- and software-level key performance indicators."
Métrica ciclomática,Métrica estática de complexidade para processos XPDL.,…static metrics to be used … like the cyclomatic metrics…
Outras métricas estáticas de processo,Qualquer métrica de complexidade similar aplicada a processos.,"static process metrics, like cyclomatic or similar complexity measures…"
Tempo das transações,Indicador dinâmico de eficácia do processo.,"dynamic indicators, mainly time of transactions…"
Taxa de conclusão bem-sucedida,Percentual de processos terminados com sucesso.,"dynamic indicators, mainly … successful completion of inspected processes."
Atrasos entre fases do processo,Mede latência interna para fins de QoS e SLA.,…monitoring eventual time delays between process phases…
Número de execuções do processo,Indicador quantitativo de carga e popularidade.,Quantitative indicators (like the number of times a process is executed…)
Número de funcionários envolvidos,Mede recursos humanos consumidos pelo processo.,…or the number of staff members assigned to it.
Responsividade,Mede o tempo de resposta percebido pelo usuário final.,…verify services scalability and application user responsivity.

Escalabilidade da aplicação,Avaliar capacidade de atender aumento de carga (módulo Performance/Jamon).,…to identify possible execution bottlenecks and to verify services scalability and application user responsivity.

Estatísticas de log,Contagem/qualificação de eventos registrados (log4j).,"Operation area, to maintain information about the state of the services. In addition to other lower-level interfaces, the OS tool log4j…"
Exceções,Total ou taxa de exceções capturadas nos logs.,"…log statistics, exceptions, errors."
Erros,Número/tipo de erros observados nos logs de aplicação.,"…log statistics, exceptions, errors."

Monitoramento de execução,Medidas detalhadas de tempo de execução de métodos/processos (Jamon).,"Performance area, to maintain information about the performance in production, to identify possible execution bottlenecks…"
Perfil de usuários,Caracterização dos tipos de usuários que acessam o portal.,Use metrics: users profiling…
Estatísticas de uso,Dados agregados sobre uso geral do portal (AWStats).,…usage statistics…
Hits,Número bruto de requisições HTTP contabilizadas.,"…hits, views, robots and worm accesses…"
Views (page views),Total de páginas efetivamente visualizadas.,"…hits, views, robots and worm accesses…"
Acessos de robôs,Contagem de visitas de spiders/robots.,"…hits, views, robots and worm accesses…"
Acessos de worms,Detecção/contagem de worms ou ataques automatizados.,"…hits, views, robots and worm accesses…"
Palavras-chave de busca,Termos usados para encontrar o portal
column2: indicam interesses do usuário.,…search keywords to reach the sites.

column1: Indicadores estatísticos/dinâmicos gerais,Conjunto de métricas usadas para controle de eficácia e eficiência.,…static metrics and dynamic indicators control.
Kang and Han 2008 - A Business Activity Monitoring System Supporting Real-Time Business Performance Management.pdf
Metric,Usage_in_Text,Evidence

Monthly of Supply (MOS),"KPI usado para avaliar, em tempo (quase) real, a eficiência operacional diária de vendas e a adequação do estoque de vendas.",“the ‘Monthly of Supply (MOS)’ KPI showing the level of the current sales inventory is important because this KPI indicates the daily operational efficiency of sales and the properness of sales inventory.”
Present Sales Inventory,Componente do cálculo do MOS
column2: indica a quantidade atual em estoque para vendas.,“MOS is the ratio of the present sales inventory with the average sales by month as follows: MOS = Present Sales Inventory / Average Sales by Month”

column1: Average Sales per Month,Componente do cálculo do MOS
column2: volume médio de vendas mensais usado como denominador do indicador.,“MOS is the ratio of the present sales inventory with the average sales by month as follows: MOS = Present Sales Inventory / Average Sales by Month”

column1: MOS Value Thresholds,"Faixas de valor (verde/amarelo/vermelho) usadas para sinalizar condição normal, limítrofe ou anormal do MOS no painel.","“If the MOS value is less than 3.5, then the indicator is presented in green… if the value is more than 3.5 and less than 4.0, then … yellow… if the value is more than 4.0, then … red.”"
Current Inventory by Region,Apresenta o nível absoluto de estoque de cada região
column2: possibilita comparação direta com o MOS.,"“On the right lower part, the current inventories of each region are presented by vertical bar chart.”"

column1: Number of Equipment Problems (Overall),Quantidade total de problemas cadastrado no processo de gestão de falhas de equipamentos.,(inferido do conjunto de contagens descritas nos painéis
column2: base para segmentações posteriores)

column1: Number of Equipment Problems by Department,"Mede e exibe a quantidade de problemas por departamento (press, body, paint, assembly, engine shop).","“the numbers of equipment problems by department such as press, body, paint, assembly, and engine shop are displayed by the pie chart.”"

Number of Equipment Problems by Plant,Mede e exibe a quantidade de problemas por planta fabril.,"“On the left below part, the numbers of equipment problems by plant are presented by the vertical bar chart.”"

Number of In-process Problems per Activity,"Conta quantos problemas estão em andamento em cada atividade do fluxo (Registration, Reason Input, etc.).","“On the middle upper part, the numbers of the in-process problems of each activity are presented by the vertical bar chart.”"
Delay Activities (<48 h),Medidor de atividades não concluídas até 48 h após seu início
column2: usado para alerta de atraso.,“An uncompleted activity within 48 hours after the start time is categorized as a delay activity.”

column1: Alert Processes (Overdue),"Conta processos não finalizados até a data planejada, sinalizando atraso crítico.",“And a process that is not completed until the planed finished date is classified to an alert process.”
Total Process Execution Time,Tempo total gasto para completar o processo de gestão de problemas
column2: objetiva ser reduzido via monitoramento.,“the total time for execution of this process can be reduced.”

column1: Laumer et al. 2015 - The impact of business process management and appli ... acking systems on recruiting process performance - an empirical study.pdf
Performance Measure,Use / Definition in the Paper,Evidence / Excerpt from the Text
Process cycle time,General duration of the whole recruiting process
column2: used to evaluate efficiency improvements.,"“Specifically, the cycle time of the recruiting process can be shortened significantly through business process controlling and process analysis…”"

column1: Time-to-hire,Time between identifying a vacancy and the final hiring decision
column2: key time-based KPI.,"“…process time, which is defined as the period of time between identifying and filling an open position (Hirzel 2008). Process time is also widely known as time-to-hire.”"

column1: Time-to-publish-ad,Time between identifying a vacancy and posting a job advertisement.,“…cycle times of single process steps include the time span between the identifying an open position and posting a job ad…”

Time-to-interview,Time between identifying a vacancy and holding the first job interview.,“…and the time between identifying a vacancy and holding the first job interviews in recent years.” (item in measurement model)
Time-to-first-application,Time between posting a job ad and receiving the first applications
column2: used to detect bottlenecks.,“…cycle times of single process steps include the time span between posting a job ad and receiving the first applications…”

column1: Internal applicant-tracking time,Duration of the internal ATS processing steps.,“…and the time spent on the internal applicant tracking process (Münstermann et al. 2010a
column2: Eckhardt and Laumer 2009).”

column1: Total recruiting process cost,Aggregate cost to hire a new employee.,"“…process cost, which is defined as the aggregate cost incurred in hiring a new employee.”"
Cost-per-hire,Average cost per filled vacancy
column2: central efficiency indicator.,“The total process cost in recruiting is sometimes referred to as cost-per-hire.”

column1: Cost-per-application / Cost per tracked application,Average internal cost to process one application.,"“…the cost per application, the cost per hire, and the cost of managing applications can be reduced.”"

Cost of internal applicant tracking,Specific cost block for running and staffing applicant-tracking activities.,“…We have been able to reduce the costs for the internal applicant tracking in recent years.” (item in measurement model)

Cost of job postings (offline vs. online),Used to compare/optimise channel spend.,"“…companies frequently trace the cost of and calculate the cost advantage of online job ads compared to offline job ads (e.g., in newspapers).”"

Cost of open positions not filled,Opportunity cost metric for vacancies that remain open.,“…companies might gather information on the cost of open positions not filled as well as on the cost of each individual process step.”
Sunk cost of unsuccessful hires,Cost lost when a candidate declines or leaves early
column2: ties to candidate experience.,“…This avoids or reduces sunk costs for unsuccessful hires.”

column1: Quality of hired candidates,Assessment of how well hired employees fit requirements
column2: part of process quality.,“…process quality typically refers both to the quality of the applicant as well as to how satisfied stakeholders are with the newly hired candidate…”

column1: Quality of applicant data,Completeness/accuracy of information provided by candidates.,“…an increase in the quality of applicant data (e.g. the information provided in an application) (Münstermann et al. 2010a
column2: Eckhardt et al. 2012).”

column1: Overall recruiting process quality,Composite view of quality across the whole process.,“The general quality of the process can be improved through business process controlling…”

Stakeholder satisfaction (overall),"Satisfaction of hiring managers, HR managers, applicants, top management, etc.","“…Another quality-related performance dimension is stakeholder satisfaction with the overall recruiting process. Stakeholders include company employees, applicants, operating departments, HR executives and top management (Hirzel 2008).”"
Hiring-manager satisfaction,Sub-facet of stakeholder satisfaction
column2: measured directly in survey.,“The operating departments are very satisfied with our recruiting process” (item in measurement model)

column1: HR-manager satisfaction,Sub-facet of stakeholder satisfaction.,“Our HR managers are very satisfied with our recruiting process” (item in measurement model)
Applicant satisfaction,Sub-facet of stakeholder satisfaction.,“Our applicants are very satisfied with our recruiting process” (item in measurement model)
Top-management satisfaction,Sub-facet of stakeholder satisfaction.,“Our managing directors are very satisfied with our recruiting process” (item in measurement model)
Talent-on-time,KPI proposed for business-process controlling
column2: measures punctual delivery of talent.,"“Such key performance indicators include ‘talent-on-time’, ‘brand strength’, ‘offer acceptance’ and ‘quality of new hires’ (Eckhardt et al. 2012).”"

column1: Brand strength (employer brand),KPI to track employer-branding effectiveness.,Same citation as above.
Offer acceptance rate,Share of offers accepted by candidates
column2: effectiveness/quality indicator.,Same citation as above.

column1: Quality of new hires,Post-hire success metric
column2: feeds back into process quality.,Same citation as above.

column1: Job-ad page visits,Volume metric for employer-branding / attraction step.,“…the number of the job ad page visits and the number of online applications filled out completely by applicants can be monitored.”
Completed online applications,Conversion metric from visits to applications.,Same citation as above.
Views-per-application ratio,Efficiency of attraction channel
column2: average views needed per completed application.,“…helps the company to calculate the average number of views needed per filled-out application for each media channel.”

column1: Applications per channel,Volume metric to evaluate source effectiveness.,“…indicators can be established to control for what media channels candidates are attracted to and how many applications are submitted (Lee 2007
Candidate experience rating,Qualitative metric collected during/after process to guide improvements.,“…companies might also evaluate the candidate experience at individual process steps.”

Reasons for offer rejection,Diagnostic metric to reduce future declines and sunk cost.,“…ask candidates for reasons why they rejected a contract offer as a basis for making changes to increase future applicants’ general satisfaction…”
Vacancy-to-budget approval time,Part of workflow time tracking within ATS.,Described in ATS section: requisition forwarded and submitted to budget responsible for approval.

Impressions per job ad,Reach metric used in the case example for personnel marketing value.,“…value potential in personnel marketing. The number of visitors to the career website and the impressions per job ad increased significantly (see Fig. 4 bottom).”
Visitors to career website,Traffic KPI used to assess employer-branding effectiveness.,Same excerpt as above.
Wagner 2017 - Introduction to information and process modeling for simulation.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual

Percentage of lost sales,É o principal indicador de desempenho que se quer calcular na simulação do sistema de gestão de estoque.,"“The purpose of the simulation is to compute the percentage of lost sales, which is an important performance indicator.”  "

Total number of ordered items,Usado como parcela do denominador e para calcular o número de vendas perdidas.,“… compute the percentage of lost sales –- as the difference between the total number of ordered items and the total number of sold items divided by the total number of ordered items …”

Total number of sold items,"Entra no cálculo do numerador (itens vendidos) para determinar o número de vendas perdidas e, consequentemente, o percentual de perdas.",“… as the difference between the total number of ordered items and the total number of sold items …”

Number of lost sales (total ordered – total sold),"Métrica derivada que representa diretamente a quantidade absoluta de vendas perdidas, base para o indicador percentual.",“… the difference between the total number of ordered items and the total number of sold items …”

Ullah and Lai 2013 - A Systematic Review of Business and Information Technology Alignment.pdf
Medidor de performance,Uso no texto,Evidência (trecho original)
Grau de Alinhamento Negócio-TI,Indica o quanto as estratégias/processos de negócio e de TI estão em sintonia
column2: usado em todo o artigo como métrica central para avaliar sucesso.,"“Alignment is the degree of fit and integration between business strategy, information technology strategy, business infrastructure, and information technology infrastructure.” (Table IV – Henderson & Venkatraman 1993)"

column1: Alinhamento Estratégico,Sub-tipo do alinhamento geral que foca exclusivamente na aderência entre as estratégias de negócio e de TI.,“Strategic alignment is the process that helps business organizations understand their goals … through the development of a reasonable IT strategy.” (Table IV – Xiang et al. 2008)

Alinhamento Estrutural,Mede compatibilidade entre a estrutura organizacional de negócio e a estrutura de TI.,“Compatible organizational structure and strong strategy ownership is important for successful alignment.” (Table VI – Broadbent & Weill 1993)

Alinhamento Cultural,"Mede o grau de compatibilidade de valores, crenças e práticas entre áreas de negócio e TI.","“The support of senior management is necessary to establish the organizational culture… achieving alignment is evolutionary and dynamic, requiring a strong cultural relationship.” (Table VII – Luftman et al. 1999)"

Alinhamento Social,Mede a partilha de conhecimento e relacionamento interpessoal entre executivos de negócio e TI.,"“The social dimension of alignment is defined as ‘the state in which business and IT executives understand each part of the business organization and are committed to the business and IT mission, objectives, and plans.’” (Table VIII – Reich & Benbasat 2000)"

Maturidade de Alinhamento,Índice que quantifica o nível de evolução do alinhamento ao longo do tempo.,“The model is intended to measure strategic alignment in the health sector.” (Table IX – Khanfar & Zualkernan 2010) e “Business–IT alignment maturity… Companies with strong alignment show stronger business performance.” (Table IX – Chen 2010)

Maturidade de Comunicação,Sub-métrica de maturidade que avalia qualidade da comunicação entre negócio e TI.,“Communications maturity… The measurement and maintenance of alignment may result in better business performance.” (Table VII – Chen 2010)

Maturidade de Governança,Avalia o quão estabelecidas estão as práticas de governança que suportam o alinhamento.,Idem citação anterior: “Governance” aparece na lista de fatores de maturidade de Chen 2010 (Table VII).
Maturidade de Parceria,Mede intensidade da parceria entre unidades de negócio e TI como suporte ao alinhamento.,Também na lista de fatores de maturidade em Chen 2010: “Partnership” (Table VII).

Maturidade de Competências (Skill maturity),Avalia o grau de capacitação/competência de pessoal para suportar o alinhamento.,“Skill maturity” listado entre os fatores de maturidade por Chen 2010 (Table VII).

Desempenho do Negócio,Usado como variável dependente para testar impacto do alinhamento ou da TI.,“How to use IT to enhance business performance and stakeholder satisfaction.” (Table III – item ranqueado)  e “Alignment can positively influence business performance.” (Table IX – Sabherwal & Chan 2001)
Desempenho Organizacional,"Similar ao anterior, mas em nível de organização
column2: associado a investimento em TI.",“The authors identify how an understanding of IT investment results in better organizational performance.” (Table V – Schwarz et al. 2010)

column1: Desempenho da Empresa (Firm performance),Mede resultados financeiros/mercado
column2: relacionado a adoção de tecnologia.,“They found a strong association between the adoption of quick response and firm performance…” (Table V – Palmer & Markus 2000)

column1: Desempenho no Trabalho (Job performance),Avalia performance individual em relação ao uso de sistemas de informação.,“examining … two factors of information behavior … in regard to the individual’s job performance” (Table XII – Yujong et al. 2010)
Satisfação das Partes Interessadas,Métrica complementar de performance ligada à percepção dos stakeholders.,“How to use IT to enhance business performance and stakeholder satisfaction.” (Table III)

Orçamento de TI (IT Budget),Usado como indicador de disponibilidade de recursos e eficiência da TI.,"Listado como 2º, 3º e 5º maior problema de gestão: “IT Budget (resource allocation for IT departments).” (Table III)"

Investimento em TI (IT investment),"Quantifica recursos aplicados em TI, usado para verificar efeito sobre performance.",“Business strategy — IT investment — IT resources — Business performance” (Table V – Schwarz et al. 2010)
Recursos de TI (IT resources),Complementa ‘investimento’ ao indicar capacidade instalada de TI.,Mesmo trecho anterior (Table V) cita “IT resources”.

Conhecimento de Domínio Compartilhado,Usado como proxy social para prever alinhamento de longo prazo.,“only shared domain knowledge was found to influence long-term alignment.” (Table VIII – Reich & Benbasat 2000)
