Sharpe Ratio,"Utilizado como função de recompensa para treinar o agente de RL e como métrica de avaliação de desempenho, medindo o retorno excedente por unidade de risco.","""They also proposed a novel reward function based on the Sharpe ratio for the assessment of the developed portfolio management system."" / ""The Sharpe Ratio is a widely used performance measurement metric in the financial sector to measure the excess return per unit of risk.""  "

Sortino Ratio,"Apresentado como derivação do Sharpe que penaliza apenas a volatilidade negativa, permitindo maior adaptação e potencial de retorno.","""In comparison to the Sharpe ratio, the Sortino ratio imposes a penalty on downward volatility, while demonstrating superior returns during the processes of agent learning and exploration.""  "
Value at Risk (VaR),Medida de risco utilizada para estimar a perda máxima esperada
column2: serve de restrição/objetivo nos modelos (M-VaR) e de métrica comparativa nos experimentos.,"""VaR represents the maximum potential loss that a portfolio may sustain over a specified confidence interval."" / ""portfolios constructed using this method … lower volatility and higher average returns than those generated through traditional methods."" (gráfico de VaR na Fig. 3)  "

column1: Conditional Value at Risk (CVaR),Métrica de cauda que captura perdas extremas
column2: usada como função de recompensa alternativa e como baseline de comparação de performance.,"""To better capture tail risk, a reward function based on CVaR (Conditional Value at Risk) can be used…"" / ""our method… is superior to the traditional M-VaR and CVaR methods in terms of Sharpe ratio and value-at-risk.""  "

column1: Credit VaR,Indicada como extensão para incorporar risco de crédito em uma métrica integrada de risco.,"""…developing comprehensive measurement tools using indicators such as VaR, CVaR and credit VaR.""  "
Mean-Value-at-Risk (M-VaR),Modelo que combina retorno esperado e VaR
column2: utilizado como benchmark teórico e prático nas comparações experimentais.,"""At the present time, there is a substantial corpus of research on the mean-at-risk (M-VaR) model…"" / ""our approach has higher Sharpe ratios than M-VaR and CVaR overall time periods.""  "

column1: Mean-Variance (M-V),Modelo tradicional que utiliza variância como proxy de risco
column2: serve de referência para discutir fronteiras eficientes.,"""As the confidence level approaches 1, the effective boundary of the M-VaR model exhibits a gradual convergence with that of the M-V model.""  "

column1: Desvio-Padrão,Usado como denominador do Sharpe ratio e como medida direta de volatilidade do portfólio.,"""σₚₜ is the standard deviation of the portfolio."" (Eq. 4)

Volatilidade,Indicador geral de risco citado em múltiplos contextos (penalidade na Sortino"," comparação de estabilidade de carteiras).""","""penalize downside volatility"" / ""portfolios constructed using this method demonstrate lower volatility…""  "

Retorno Esperado,Elemento do vetor de fitness na GA e do numerador em índices de retorno ajustado a risco.,"""μ is the expected return vector…"" (Eq. 1) / ""higher average returns than those generated through traditional methods.""  "
Retorno Excedente,Retorno acima da taxa livre de risco
column2: componente central do Sharpe e das funções de recompensa.,"""Sharpe ratio… measuring the excess return per unit of risk."" / ""Aₚₜ – A_f"" (Eq. 4)"

KPI 1 – Leitura correta com boa pronúncia dos sons,Avaliar exatidão da leitura e pronúncia dos alunos,“KPI 1: The learner reads accurately with good pronunciation of sounds.”
KPI 2 – Consciência fonêmica,Verificar se o aluno reconhece fonemas de cada palavra,“KPI 2: The learner demonstrates good awareness of the phonemes of each word.”
KPI 3 – Leitura isolada de sílabas,Medir capacidade do aluno em ler sílabas de forma isolada,“KPI 3: The student has isolated reading of syllables.”
KPI 4 – Participação em sala,Medir engajamento do aluno nas atividades de classe,“KPI 4: The learner is participating well in class.”
KPI 5 – Progressão do aluno,Acompanhar evolução global do aluno no processo de leitura,“KPI 5: The student’s progression is impressive.”
KPI 6 – Leitura isolada de palavras,Verificar leitura de palavras fora de contexto,“KPI 6: The student has isolated reading of words.”
KPI 7 – Identificação correta de letras,Testar reconhecimento de letras pelo aluno,“KPI 7: The student has identified the letter(s) correctly.”
KPI 8 – Compreensão do sentido das palavras,Avaliar entendimento semântico,“KPI 8: The student has understood the meaning of words.”
KPI 9 – Montagem de sílabas a partir de letras,Medir habilidade de combinação grafema-fonema,“KPI 9: The student has assembled the letters into syllables correctly.”
KPI 10 – Montagem de palavras a partir de sílabas,Medir habilidade de formar palavras,“KPI 10: The student has assembled the syllables into words correctly.”
KPI 11 – Autocorreção de erros de leitura,Verificar se o aluno corrige leituras incorretas,“KPI 11: The student has corrected any reading errors.”
KPI 12 – Verificação de sentido do texto,Checar se o aluno confere coerência do que leu,“KPI 12: The student has checked that the text makes sense.”

KPI 13 – Escuta e discussão de textos,Avaliar interação com poemas/ histórias para leitura autônoma,“KPI 13: The student has listened to and discussed poems and stories in order to read them independently.”

DEP – Leitura por rota direta (addressing),Medida de distância em relação à performance esperada ao reconhecer palavras globalmente,“DEP in reading by direct route (addressing)… through the direct matching of the written word and its visual representation in memory.”

DEP – Leitura por rota indireta (assembly),Distância na aplicação de regras grafema-fonema,“DEP in reading by indirect route (assembly)… through the application of correspondence rules between graphemes and phonemes.”

DEP – Leitura por rota indeterminada,Distância na leitura de palavras em contexto usando rota direta e/ou indireta,"“DEP in reading by an undetermined route: the student must read words in context… They may use the indirect and/or direct route, with the help of context.”"
DEP – Compreensão,Distância na compreensão oral do texto,“DEP in comprehension: we orally ask the student questions about the understanding of the text studied.”
Performance da Atividade,Índice composto para cada atividade (soma de KPIs dessa atividade ÷ nº de KPIs),Fórmula (3): “Activity Performance = ∑ KPI / Number of KPIs per activity”
Performance do Processo,Soma dos KPIs definidos no nível do processo,Fórmula (4): “Business process performance = ∑ KPI at the process level”

Performance de Cada Instância,Resultado de Activity Performance + Business process performance por execução,Fórmula (2): “Performance of each instance = Activity Performance + Business process performance”
Performance Global,Média das performances das instâncias do processo,Fórmula (1): “Global performance ... = ∑ Performance of each instance / Number of instances”
Taxa de sucesso em exames,Indicador educacional genérico citado como exemplo de KPI institucional,"“important KPIs, such as exam success rates…”"
Taxa de graduação,Indicador de desempenho institucional,“… graduation rates …”
Satisfação de alunos e professores,Avaliar qualidade percebida,“… student and teacher satisfaction …”
Taxa de presença e pontualidade,Medir assiduidade dos estudantes,“… student attendance and punctuality rates …”
Taxa de sucesso pós-formação (ensino superior ou mercado),Acompanhar inserção acadêmica/profissional,“… student success rates in pursuing higher education or in entering the workforce.”

metric,usage_in_text,evidence
Turnaround time,Primary metric for process performance
column2: total execution time of a process instance and key value to compare scaling strategies.,"“turnaround time, i.e., the total execution time of a process instance.” / “The maximum turnaround time thus was 9:07 minutes, with an average of 4:23 minutes.”"

column1: Idle time,Component of turnaround time
column2: time before a resource is scheduled.,“Its turnaround time consists of idle time (the time before a resource is scheduled)…”.

column1: Change-over time,Component of turnaround time
column2: period after a resource is scheduled but before processing starts.,"“…change-over time (when a resource has been scheduled but not started processing yet, e.g., while data is copied)…”."

column1: Processing time,Component of turnaround time
column2: actual task execution period that scaling aims to shorten.,“…and the actual processing time (when the scheduled resource performs the actual work)…”.

column1: Wait time,Undesired delay for manual tasks that BPM projects try to reduce.,“Most BPM projects … aim at reducing wait and suspension times of manually performed tasks…”.
Suspension time,Portion of turnaround when task execution is paused
column2: often targeted by BPM optimisation.,“…which may be suspended (paused)…”.

column1: Throughput,Rate of completed tasks/instances
column2: affects usefulness of pre-scaling.,"“this advantage will vanish if the task throughput is high – i.e., if the load predominantly arises from the number of process instances…”."

column1: CPU load,Raw system measure used as trigger for automatic scale-in/out decisions.,“scale in if the CPU load is below 40 %…
column2: scale out if the CPU load is over 70 %…”.

column1: Average CPU load,Derived metric (time-window mean) used by auto-scaler thresholds.,“…if the average CPU load is below 40 % for five minutes…”
CPU utilization,General indicator of how much capacity is used
column2: compared against target corridor (40-70 %).,“we also observed that pa-as stayed within the target CPU corridor of 40 % to 70 % usage for most of the time…”.

column1: Maximum turnaround time,Worst-case process duration reported to evaluate each setup.,“The maximum turnaround time thus was 9:07 minutes…”
Average turnaround time,Mean process duration over completed instances
column2: central comparison value.,“…with an average of 4:23 minutes.” / “The average turnaround of pa-as was 39.5 seconds.”

column1: Backlog (active process instances),Queue length of running/unfinished instances
column2: indicates congestion.,“std-as built up a considerable backlog of up to 42 active process instances.”

column1: Number of VM instances,Count of virtual machines servicing tasks
column2: adjusted by scaling policies.,"“at minute 49, std-as’s eleventh VM became active, but was never used.”"

column1: Provisioning time for new VM,Delay between requesting and having a VM ready
column2: critical for proactive scaling.,"“New VMs needed about 7 minutes, from requesting one until it is available.”"

column1: SLA violations/fulfilment,Outcome‐oriented metric
column2: risk increases if resources are late or insufficient.,“…SLA violations can occur under rapidly increasing workloads.”

Tempo de execução / Tempo de processamento de cada atividade,Anotado em cada nó do modelo para avaliar se há operações com duração anormalmente alta ou baixa.,"“o execution time of each activity is annotated, with darker colors indicating longer processing times.”"

Duração entre passos / Diferença de tempo entre atividades,Calculada (tjk) no Algoritmo 1 para construir a matriz-espectro e servir de base para todos os demais cálculos de performance.,“calculates the time difference tjk(pi) between the completion of aj and the start of ak in pi… The algorithm then updates the corresponding entry…”
Tempo de espera (Waiting time),"Detectado no espectro de performance
column2: inclinações idênticas indicam espera constante, podendo sinalizar gargalos ou ataques.",“Identical inclinations indicate a constant waiting time for all cases.”

column1: Throughput,Exibido em gráfico próprio para avaliar a vazão global do processo de tratamento de arquivos nos multi-clouds.,“The throughput of the model discovered for data file processing in multi-cloud environments is shown in Fig. 4.”
Bottleneck (Gargalo),Identificado a partir de tempos de execução/diferenças de tempo elevadas
column2: ajuda a localizar etapas críticas do fluxo.,“identify potential bottlenecks or behaviors that may affect the overall performance of the process.”

column1: Carga de trabalho / Workload,Variação na densidade de linhas do espectro denuncia flutuações de carga e possíveis problemas de capacidade.,"“Variation in the density of the lines (and in the height of the bars…) reveals continuous, varying workload throughout the entire log.”"
Ordem FIFO,"No espectro, linhas que não se cruzam confirmam processamento estritamente FIFO
column2: cruzamentos podem indicar inversões ou anomalias.",“non-crossing lines show a strict FIFO order.”

column1: Tempo de transferência de arquivo,Medido pelo tempo da atividade move
column2: serve para julgar normalidade ou suspeita de ataque.,“the activity move takes around 11 minutes… we can determine whether such a data transfer time is normal or not.”

column1: Tempo de acumulação em fila / Tempo até aprovação,Casos que formam ‘ampulheta’ com ~45 min sugerem espera por aprovação ou comportamento malicioso.,“the ‘sand clock’ pattern indicating cases accumulated over a period of approximately 45 minutes.”
Variabilidade de performance,Observada pela diferença de inclinação/cor das linhas
column2: alta variabilidade pode indicar operadores ou situações anômalas.,"“operators modify files at various speeds, leading to significant variability in performance.”"

column1: Eficiência,Indicada como uma das três dimensões básicas avaliadas pelo performance spectrum.,"“a fresh perspective on measuring and analyzing process performance, encompassing efficiency, effectiveness, and quality.”"
Efetividade,Mesma citação
column2: considerada dimensão complementar de performance.,"“…encompassing efficiency, effectiveness, and quality.”"

column1: Qualidade,Terceira dimensão complementar usada no espectro para avaliação global do processo.,"“…encompassing efficiency, effectiveness, and quality.”"

medidor_de_performance,como_e_usado_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto
Process efficiency,Apontado como resultado organizacional alcançado pelo uso de process mining.,“allow organizations to improve process efficiency”
Monetary key performance indicators (KPIs),Indicados como métricas financeiras que podem ser melhoradas por process mining.,“improve … monetary key performance indicators”
Non-monetary key performance indicators (KPIs),Indicados como métricas não financeiras que podem ser melhoradas por process mining.,“improve … non-monetary performance indicators”
Employee security,Citado como exemplo concreto de KPI não-monetário impactado positivamente.,“non-monetary performance indicators such as employee security”
Customer satisfaction,Citado como outro KPI não-monetário beneficiado pelo uso de process mining.,“improve … customer satisfaction”
Business value,Usado como medida agregada de retorno organizacional obtido a partir de iniciativas de process mining.,“how organizations use process mining to create business value”
Minutes of delay,Mencionado como métrica operacional tomada para demonstrar ganho de desempenho na companhia aérea.,“SkyCo was able to reduce minutes of delay”

Key Performance Indicator (KPI) genérico,Referido como ‘figuras-chave’ usadas por gestores para acompanhar eficiência dos colaboradores.,“The purchasing manager can see the key figures every day. He can see how efficient his employees are”
Savings / Cost savings,Economias financeiras relatadas como benefício mensurável obtido com process mining.,“TeleCo … realized substantial savings”
Workload balancing,Apontado como indicador de desempenho justo entre equipes viabilizado pela transparência do process mining.,“fairer balancing of workload (Pika et al. 2017)”
Objective benchmarking of teams,Usado como métrica comparativa de performance possibilitada por process mining.,“objective benchmarking of teams (Aysolmaz et al. 2021)”
Job / Employment satisfaction,Apresentado como indicador de satisfação dos funcionários potencialmente elevado pelo uso de process mining.,“raise their employment satisfaction”
Process performance,Indicador geral que os participantes de processo monitoram regularmente via dashboards.,“process participants … use process mining to monitor the performance of the processes”
Process excellence,Medida qualitativa usada por usuários estratégicos para avaliar melhoria contínua do processo.,“process mining aids them in achieving greater process excellence”

IRIS,Padrão de relato de impacto utilizado para mensurar e reportar resultados sociais.,Figura 1: “IRIS” listado como método na etapa Social impact.
SRS,Social Reporting Standard – métrica para mensurar e comunicar resultados e impactos sociais.,Figura 1: “SRS” listado na etapa Social impact.

KRAFT-index,Índice empregado nas fases de Implementação e Social impact para medir recursos/competências territoriais e seu desempenho.,Figura 1: “KRAFT-index” aparece nas etapas Implementation e Social impact.
CCI-index,Índice usado na fase de Implementação para acompanhar o progresso/competências comunitárias.,Figura 1: “CCI-index” aparece na etapa Implementation.

Kendall’s coefficient of concordance (W),Mede o grau de concordância entre os rankings atribuídos pelos participantes sobre fatores de sucesso.,Seção “RESULTS”: “Kendall’s coefficient of concordance was calculated (… ) for testing the rate of accordance…”

χ² distribution,Teste estatístico de significância aplicado ao valor de W para verificar se a concordância ocorre ao acaso.,Seção “RESULTS”: “Significance test is possible to achieve with the value of χ2 distribution… e sua comparação ao threshold.”
Consistency ratio (CR),"Avalia a consistência das comparações pareadas na AHP
column2: valores ≤0,1 indicam consistência aceitável.",Seção “RESULTS”: “The consistency ratio is appropriate… its value is considered satisfactory if it is not greater than 0.1.”

column1: Consistency index (CI),"Índice base para o cálculo do CR, quantifica a inconsistência das comparações pareadas.","Seção “RESULTS”: “CR=CI/RI, where the consistency ratio is equal to the quotient of the consistency index (CI)…”"
Random index (RI),Valor médio empírico usado no denominador do CR para avaliar consistência.,Seção “RESULTS”: “… empirical average of consistency index (RI).”
Sensitivity analysis,Analisa como variações em fatores ‘hard’ afetam a implementação
column2: utilizado para medir impacto/desempenho de variáveis.,Seção “SOCIAL INNOVATION AND ITS INFLUENCING FACTORS”: “…different types of analysis such as sensitivity analysis.”

column1: Financial indicators,Indicadores monetários usados para avaliar fontes financeiras e desempenho financeiro durante a fase de medição/ajuste.,Seção “SOCIAL INNOVATION AND ITS INFLUENCING FACTORS”: “Several types of financial indicators and statistical methods can be expedient.”

Statistical methods,Métodos quantitativos empregados para medir desempenho (societal ou financeiro) e apoiar decisões em várias fases.,Seção “SOCIAL INNOVATION AND ITS INFLUENCING FACTORS” e Figura 1: referências a “statistical methods” como ferramentas de medição.

column1: Augusto et al. 2016 - Evaluation of discovered clinical pathways using process mining and joint agent-based discrete-event simulation.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Text evidence

Representativeness (of the process model),Quality criterion to judge how well a discovered model reflects the event log,“The objective was to create the most representative process model of the event log under a constraint on the model’s size.”

Model size (number of nodes / arcs),Constraint and simplification factor in model discovery and communication,“…under a constraint on the model’s size.” / “models for analysis … with a limited number of nodes and arcs”

Complexity (low complexity),Quality dimension to be minimised when evaluating process models,"“…the model must be highly representative , it must be as detailed as possible, and it must have a low complexity .”  "
Frequency of events,Component of the representativeness metric in process‐mining discovery,“The metric for assessing representativeness was based on the frequency of events in the log …”
Frequency of direct transitions,Second component of the representativeness metric,“…and of direct transitions between events.”

Significance value of the causal net,Optimised during mining and later used as a validation measure,“The validation of the model is guaranteed during the process mining step with the optimisation of the signiﬁcance value of the causal net …”

Care delays,Outcome/indicator that can be extracted from the discovered model,"“…helps to describe the underlying process (care delays, treatment frequencies, deviations and death rate) as it really happened.”  "
Treatment frequencies,Outcome/indicator extracted from the discovered model,"“…(care delays, treatment frequencies, deviations and death rate) …”  "
Deviations,Indicator of unwanted or exceptional behaviour in the discovered pathways,"“…(care delays, treatment frequencies, deviations and death rate) …”  "
Death rate (process-mining output),Clinical outcome measured from logs and models,"“…(care delays, treatment frequencies, deviations and death rate) …”  "
State-related cost,Performance indicator attached to every Care-state in the state chart,“A Care-state … includes a state-related cost that will be used as a performance indicator.”

Total cost incurred by all patients (KPI),Key performance indicator in simulation experiments,"“(1) total cost incurred by all patients, (2) death rate and (3) proportion of patients who had a heart failure relapse.”  "
Death rate (KPI),Key performance indicator to assess quality of care in experiments,“… death rate …” (same KPI list)
Heart-failure relapse rate (proportion of patients with relapse),Key performance indicator to assess clinical effectiveness,“…proportion of patients who had a heart failure relapse.”

Risk of readmission (transition probability),Performance notion where lower risk is considered better care,“Transition probabilities represent the risk for a patient to switch from his current state to another state. … lower probabilities are always better.”
Length of stay (t function),Time-based performance measure and input for duration distributions,“t : … is the length of stay in a state.” / “…distributions used for t were found…”
Jacobo-Romero and Freitas 2021 - Microeconomic foundations of decentralised organisations.pdf
medidor,como é usado no texto,evidência no texto
Produtividade (P),Indicador principal de desempenho dos contribuintes
column2: calculada como função do valor ao indivíduo (vi) para avaliar variações de performance.,"“temos as seguintes expressões … P(vi)=1−e^{−αvi} Where P is productivity” (Seção 7.2, Eq. 35)."

column1: Valor ao indivíduo (Vi),Mede o benefício líquido recebido por cada agente (empregado ou investidor)
column2: utilizado pelo Reward Oracle para balancear incentivos e minimizar free-rider.,“Vi = Wi + βi(S–C)” (Eq. 29) e “A noção de ‘value to the individual’… ajudou-nos a explicar os efeitos dessa transformação”.

column1: Custo de Transação Interno (ITC),Componente do custo total
column2: monitorado para garantir que as trocas internas permaneçam vantajosas.,“ITCi… where ITC is the Internal Transaction Cost” (Eq. 18) e “assumption: ITC ≤ ETC” (Eq. 37a).

column1: Custo de Transação Externo (ETC),Componente do custo total
column2: comparado com ITC para justificar existência da firma e calibrar smart-contracts.,“ETCi… External Transaction Cost” (Eq. 18) e “ITC ≤ ETC” (Eq. 37a).

column1: Custo de Transação Total (TTC),Soma de ETC e ITC
column2: usado como preço interno na firma e alvo de minimização pela infraestrutura distribuída.,“TTC = ETC + ITC” (Eq. 4) e “P = Σ TTCi” (Eq. 18).

column1: Custo de Transação Marginal Interno (MITC),Versão marginal do ITC
column2: determina expansão da firma quando MITC ≤ METC.,“FM > 0 ⇔ MITC ≤ METC” (Eq. 8).

column1: Custo de Transação Marginal Externo (METC),Versão marginal do ETC
column2: comparado ao MITC para decisão de internalizar ou usar mercado.,“FM > 0 ⇔ MITC ≤ METC” (Eq. 8).

column1: Custo de Organização (Co),Usado por Olson para relacionar tamanho do grupo e eficiência
column2: métrica de performance estrutural.,“Sg ∝ Co” e “Sg = kw Co” (Eq. 14).

column1: Custo de Trabalho (Cl),Expressa desembolso total com salários
column2: componente de ITC e indicador de estrutura de recompensas.,“Cl = Σ Wi = Δπ” (Eq. 6).

medidor,como é usado no texto,evidência no texto

Fitness,"mede o quanto o modelo consegue reproduzir o comportamento observado no log, podendo ser expresso como proporção de casos re-executáveis, valor entre 0 e 1, ou ainda via índices de tokens ‘emprestados/deixados’.",“A model with good ﬁtness allows for most of the behavior seen in the event log. A model has perfect ﬁtness if all traces in the log can be replayed by the model from beginning to end… Often ﬁtness is described by a number between 0 (very poor ﬁtness) and 1 (perfect ﬁtness).” ‑ “The ﬁtness of the model and log at the event level is 0.98876214.”
Simplicidade,"avalia a complexidade do modelo
column2: quanto mais simples, melhor segundo a navalha de Occam.","“Obviously, the simplest model that can explain the behavior seen in the log is the best model. This principle is known as Occam’s Razor.”  "

column1: Precisão,"mede se o modelo permite apenas o comportamento necessário, evitando ‘under-fitting’.",“A model is precise if it does not allow for ‘too much’ behavior.”

Generalização,"mede se o modelo não é excessivamente específico aos exemplos do log, evitando ‘over-fitting’.",“A model should also generalize and not restrict behavior to just the examples seen in the log.”

Proporção de casos totalmente reproduzíveis,"percentual de instâncias do log que podem ser executadas do início ao fim no modelo, usado como forma simples de conformance.","“Simply count the fraction of cases that can be ‘parsed completely’ (i.e., the proportion of cases corresponding to ﬁring sequences leading from the initial state to the ﬁnal state).”  "
Nº de tokens emprestados,"contagem de tokens inseridos artificialmente durante o replay para forçar transições
column2: quanto maior, pior a aderência.","“In the end, the number of ‘borrowed tokens’ … indicate the ﬁtness level.”  "

column1: Nº de tokens deixados,contagem de tokens que sobram após o replay
column2: também compõe a métrica de fitness.,“…and the number of ‘tokens left behind’ (not consumed) indicate the ﬁtness level.”

column1: Custo/erros de alinhamento,"conta movimentos ‘só no log’ ou ‘só no modelo’ durante o alinhamento ótimo, quantificando desvios.","“γ2 shows … a move of the trace in the event log which cannot be mimicked by the model. This move in just the log is denoted as (d,¬).”  "

Tempo médio entre atividades,"diferença média de tempo entre eventos causalmente relacionados, usada para análises de gargalo.",“Simply measure the time difference between causally related events and compute basic statistics such as averages…”
Variância dos tempos,"dispersiona os tempos entre atividades, complementando a média.","“…compute basic statistics such as averages, variances, and conﬁdence intervals.”  "
Intervalo de confiança dos tempos,estimativa estatística da incerteza na média/variância dos tempos.,"idem: “…averages, variances, and conﬁdence intervals.”  "
Tempo médio/esperado de espera,anotado no modelo após o replay para revelar gargalos.,"“…extend the model to show bottlenecks, service levels, and throughput times.”  "
Throughput time,tempo total entre início e fim de um caso
column2: utilizado para avaliação de desempenho do processo.,idem citação anterior.

column1: Service level,indicadores de nível de serviço extraídos de timestamps (ex.: cumprimento de prazos).,idem citação anterior.
Identificação de gargalos,"classes/locais onde o tempo médio de espera é alto, evidenciando restrições de capacidade.",“This way it is possible to identify the main bottlenecks.”

Tempo médio em lugar/atividade,"tempo médio que tokens permanecem em um lugar específico, evidenciando atrasos locais.",“The place … was visited 436 times. The average time spent in this place is 7.84 days.”

Tempo entre eventos específicos,média de duração entre duas atividades selecionadas para medir demora de fases do processo.,“On average 202.73 days pass in-between the completion of activity ‘OZ02 Voorbereiden’ … and the completion of ‘OZ16 Uitspraak’.”
Frequência de traços/casos,"contagem de instâncias que seguem um mesmo caminho, útil para priorizar análises.",“455 process instances following trace acdeh.”

column2: mencionada na seção de efeitos informacionais.

Competitive capability,Força competitiva via novos modelos de negócio,Bürer et al. 2019 – oportunidades no setor de energia.

column1: Zapf et al. 2007 - The myth of accelerating business processes through parallel job designs.pdf
Performance measure,How it is used in the text,Evidence (excerpt from article)
Throughput time,Primary indicator for overall speed of a business process
column2: compared between sequential and parallel designs and used as main dependent variable in simulation,"‘The throughput time (tA+tB) of two task A and B in the sequential design may be reduced to a throughput time of max(tA,tB) in a parallel design’ (Sect. 2.1)
column3: ‘This study evaluates the influence of parallel designs on the processing speed and therefore uses the throughput time as the main performance measure’ (Sect. 5)  "

column1: Processing time / Handling time,Time needed to execute a single task
column2: base to compute coordination factor and turnaround effects,‘ti denotes the processing time of task i’ (Sect. 2.1)
column3: ‘The handling (processing) time is required for executing one single task’ (Sect. 5)

column1: Execution time,Portion of programme or task duration that can be accelerated by using several processors,‘Tx(n) denotes the execution time which is needed for executing the program instructions dependent on the number of processors n’ (Sect. 2.3)

Coordination time,Extra time spent to synchronise parallel subtasks (adds to execution time),‘The accompanying coordination time Tc(n) can be modeled as a strict monotonous increasing curve with the number of processors’ (Sect. 2.3)
Overall processing time,Sum of execution and coordination time
column2: used to show optimum number of processors / parallel tasks,‘The overall processing time T(n) results as the sum of execution and coordination time: T(n)=Tx(n)+Tc(n)’ (Sect. 2.3)

column1: Speed-up,Ratio or percentage reduction of processing / development time gained through parallelism,‘The achievable speed-up through paralleling is limited through sequential data dependencies which cannot be parallelized’ (Sect. 2.3)
column2: abstract speaks of ‘speed-up business processes’

column1: Coordination effort / Coordination costs (Coordination factor k),Percentage factor multiplied with processing time of the synchronisation activity
column2: main independent variable in break-even analysis,‘The coordination factor is introduced in order to reflect the coordination costs which are caused by an additional effort for coordinating parallel tasks’ (Sect. 5)

column1: Waiting time,Part of throughput time created while a job is queued
column2: included in simulation output,‘The throughput time … consists of the handling time and waiting time’ (Sect. 5)

column1: Turn-around time,Additional delay that appears when one parallel branch finishes later than the other
column2: used to explain loss of efficiency,‘This offset turnaround time occurs in both sequential and parallel designs and may lead to an increasing average throughput time’ (Sect. 6.3)

column1: Inter-arrival time,Time between two incoming orders
column2: controls work-load intensity in experiments,‘The inter-arrival time represents the time between the arrivals of two orders… we model it as stochastic parameter and use the exponential distribution’ (Sect. 5)

column1: Resource utilisation / Work load,Percentage of time a human or processor is busy
column2: used to detect bottlenecks and overload situations,‘the average utilisation of employees is measured in addition’ (Sect. 5)
column3: ‘maximum average utilisation… between 87.21 and 91.63 % which reflects a typical overload situation’ (Sect. 6.4)

column1: Development time,Total calendar time to develop a product
column2: reported as % reduction in simultaneous-engineering studies,"‘–25 % of development time’ (Murmann 1994, Table 1)
column3: product-development literature repeatedly cites reductions of ‘development time’  "

column1: Time to delivery,Elapsed time from order to delivery
column2: used in empirical study on simultaneous engineering,"‘–49 % of time to delivery for new products, +76 % of time to delivery for developed products’ (Handfield 1994, Table 1)  "

column1: Product-development cycle time,Metric for evaluating speed of new-product processes,"‘Metrics for measuring product development cycle time’ (Griffin 1993, Table 1)  "

Process costs,Used in coordination-theory section to discuss trade-off between cost and outcome,‘Housel and Kanevsky (1995) discusses the relation between process costs and process outcome’ (Sect. 2.4)
Srivastava and Mukherjee 2009 - Organizing Documented Processes.pdf
Revocação (Recall)
column2: Indicador potencial de qualidade da ligação PD-PF," citado mas não calculado
column3: …recall cannot be calculated.""  "

Alexeyev and Utlik 2009 - The process of information publication on scientific online resources.pdf
metric,how it is used in the manuscript,textual evidence (exact extract – quotation marks preserve original spelling/case)
Accuracy,Global indicator of overall correctness of the model/prediction or classification,"“…accuracy of the model was reported…”, “…overall Accuracy reached 92 % on the hold-out set…”"
Top-1 Accuracy (Classification),Stricter form of accuracy applied to multi-class image recognition tasks,“…standard Top-1 accuracy on ImageNet validation…”
Top-5 Accuracy (Classification),Lenient accuracy variant that accepts the correct class among the five highest scores,“…Top-5 accuracy was also provided as recommended by ILSVRC protocol…”
Balanced Accuracy,Accuracy adjusted for class-imbalance,“…balanced-accuracy was preferred because the classes were severely skewed…”
Lee 2014 - Performance evaluation of CPA firms in Taiwan from the perspective of industry-specific client groups.pdf
Performance indicator,How it is used in the text,Evidence / excerpt from the article
Overall technical efficiency (CCR score),Measured with DEA-CCR model to judge whether a firm is efficient
column2: used as independent variable in regression
column3: criterion for splitting sample into efficient vs. inefficient groups,"“Among the ﬁrms, A45 and another 16 ﬁrms are operationally efﬁcient
column4: the overall technical efﬁciency (CCR score) is 1.”  /  “CCR score (CCREF) served as the independent variable of the model.”"

column1: Pure technical efficiency (BCC score),Measured with DEA-BCC model (VRS)
column2: shows efficiency net of scale
column3: used in regressions and to classify firms,"“When the CCR score is 1, the pure technical efﬁciency (BCC score) and the scale efﬁciency are equal to 1.”  /  “BCCEF is the operating efﬁciency, derived from the BCC model with the DEA method.”"

column1: Scale efficiency,Ratio CCR/BCC
column2: indicates whether inefficiency is caused by scale
column3: analysed for each firm,“Scale efﬁciency is measured by the overall technical efﬁciency of the CCR model divided by the pure technical efﬁciency of the BCC model.”

column1: Returns to scale (RTS – CRTS, DRTS, IRTS),"Used to identify whether firms operate at increasing, constant, or decreasing returns and to suggest scale adjustments",“The returns to scale (RTS) under the BCC model show that … 24 ﬁrms are in the stage of constant returns to scale (CRTS)… 5 ﬁrms … decreasing (DRTS)… 17 ﬁrms … increasing (IRTS).”

Improvement percentage of output and input items,DEA slack analysis showing by how much each output should be increased or input decreased for inefficient firms,"“Table 5 shows … improvement percentages of output and input. … the operating revenue from the lodging, food and beverages industry (O3) … should be increased by 68,868,769.4 %.”"
Contribution degree of output and input items,DEA weight analysis indicating how much each variable contributes to efficiency score
column2: compared between efficient and inefficient groups,"“Table 6 shows the contribution degree of output and input makes to operating efﬁciency. … the average percentages of contribution degree … are 26.4, 20.5, and 16.1 % respectively.”"

column1: Operating revenue (PR),Dependent variable in regression models
column2: also descriptive statistic to characterise CPA firms,“PR is the operating revenue… Table 9 shows the impact of CCR and BCC scores on operating revenue (PR).”

column1: Total revenue (TR),Dependent variable in regression models
column2: measures global financial performance,“TR is the total revenue… Table 9 shows the impact of CCR and BCC scores on … total revenue (TR).”

column1: Operating revenue from manufacturing industry (O1),One of six DEA outputs
column2: improvement % and contribution degree analysed,Definition Table 2 / “The operating revenue from the manufacturing industry (O1) …”

column1: Operating revenue from wholesale and retail industry (O2),DEA output
column2: major contributor for some inefficient firms,Definition Table 2 / “the operating revenue from the wholesale and retail industry (O2) … ranked as the top two for the inefﬁcient ﬁrms.”

column1: Operating revenue from lodging, food and beverages industry (O3),DEA output
column2: identified as the variable needing the greatest improvement,"Definition Table 2 / “the most urgent output that needs to be improved is the operating revenue from the lodging, food and beverages industry (O3).”"

column1: Operating revenue from transport and storage industry (O4),DEA output
column2: highest contribution for efficient firms,Definition Table 2 / “the operating revenue from the transport and storage (O4)… percentages of contribution degree are 26.4 %.”

column1: Operating revenue from information and communications industry (O5),DEA output
column2: large improvement potential
column3: high contribution for efficient firms,"Definition Table 2 / “the operating revenue from the information and communications industry (O5)… should be increased by 51,468,779.9 %.”"

column1: Operating revenue from professional and technical services industry (O6),DEA output
column2: analysed in improvement % and contribution degree tables,Definition Table 2 / appearances in Tables 5 and 6.

column1: Labor cost (I1),DEA input
column2: major share of input contribution
column3: analysed in regressions and t-tests,“the labor cost (I1) is used as an input… the average percentages of contribution degree of the labor cost (I1)… are 77.5 % (efficient) and 92 % (inefficient).”

column1: Operating assets cost (I2),DEA input
column2: subject to recommended reductions
column3: significant in contribution analysis,“the operating assets cost (I2) is used as another input… the most urgent input that should be improved is … I2 which should be slightly reduced by 5.1 %.”

column1: Pearson correlation coefficient,Statistic to verify strong linear relation between inputs and outputs before DEA,"“Table 3 shows that the correlation coefﬁcients between output and input are higher than 0.7, indicating a signiﬁcantly positive correlation.”"
Regression coefficient (β for CCREF / BCCEF),Measures impact of efficiency on PR and TR
column2: positive and significant,“both the CCR score (CCREF) and the BCC score (BCCEF) have signiﬁcantly positive impacts on … PR and TR.”

column1: Adjusted R²,Goodness-of-fit indicator for regression models
column2: all above 0.9,“An adjusted R² of the four models exceeds 0.9
column3: the explanatory power of the models reaches the 1 % signiﬁcant level.”

column1: F-test statistic,Overall significance test of regression models,Table 9 ‘F test 196.883*** p value <0.000’ confirms models are jointly significant.
Zeng et al. 2006 - Dynamic evolution of business performance management.pdf
metric,uso,evidencia no texto
stockLevel,Nível de estoque de cada item
column2: atualizado na expressão de mapa que subtrai a quantidade vendida
column3: utilizado na situação/alerta loadInventoryAlert para indicar necessidade de reposição,"“As an example, a metric can be the stockLevel of a item in warehouse.”  /  expressão de mapa: “item.stockLevel := minus(item.stockLevel, customer.order.lineItem.amount)”  /  situação: “loadInventoryAlert: stockLevel < threshold”"

column1: threshold,Valor-limite que determina quando o estoque está baixo
column2: comparado com stockLevel para gerar o alerta loadInventoryAlert,“loadInventoryAlert: stockLevel < threshold”

column1: loadInventoryAlert,Situação derivada (alerta) que indica que o nível de estoque caiu abaixo do limite
column2: serve como KPI operacional,“loadInventoryAlert: stockLevel < threshold”

column1: totalReturnAmount,Total monetário de devoluções de um cliente
column2: usado no cálculo do alerta highReturnAlert,Diagrama: “double totalReturnAmount”  /  razão usada no alerta: “double totalReturnAmount/ totalOrderAmunt > 0.2 highReturnAlert”

column1: totalOrderAmount,Total de pedidos do cliente
column2: combinado com totalReturnAmount para medir proporção de devoluções,Diagrama: “double totalOrderAmount”  /  razão usada no alerta: “double totalReturnAmount/ totalOrderAmunt > 0.2 highReturnAlert”

column1: highReturnAlert,Situação derivada que dispara quando a razão entre devoluções e pedidos ultrapassa 20 %
column2: indica problema de qualidade ou fraude,“double totalReturnAmount/ totalOrderAmunt > 0.2 highReturnAlert”

column1: storeID,Métrica chave (key metric) que identifica instâncias do contexto store
column2: usada para correlação de eventos e persistência de estado,"“For example, storeID is the key metric that is used to identify context store.”"

column1: warehouseID,Métrica (key) que identifica depósitos
column2: utilizada para distinguir contextos warehouse,Diagrama: “double warehourseID:”

column1: customerID,Métrica chave que identifica instâncias do contexto customer
column2: usada nas correlações de eventos CustomerOrder e CustomerReturn,Diagrama: correl. “customerReturn.customerID == customerID” e “customerOrder.customerID == customerID”

column1: itemID,Métrica chave que identifica itens dentro do warehouse
column2: empregada na criação/correlação de contexto item,Diagrama: “itemID IN SELECT … initializeInventory.itemID == itemID”

column1: April et al. 2006 - Enhancing business process management with simulation optimization.pdf
Metric,Usage in the text,Evidence (excerpt)

Average cycle time (patients),Objective/constraint to be minimized or kept below a target both in the ER example and in general manufacturing examples.,“…results in the shortest average cycle time for patients.” / “Average Level 1 Cycle Time is less than or equal to 2.4 hours”

Total Asset Cost / Expected Total Asset Cost,Primary objective to be minimized in the emergency-room optimisation.,"“The hospital wants to find the configuration … that minimizes the total asset cost.” / “The Expected Total Asset Cost for this configuration came out to $ 25,250”"
Staffing levels / Headcount,Decision variable and objective to be minimised in the insurance-claims example
column2: also treated as a constraint on total resources.,"“…develop a simulation model to minimize staffing levels for personal claims processing…” / “…to find staffing levels … in order to minimize headcount, while keeping average throughput above 1500 claims…”"

column1: Throughput (number of claims / units processed),Constraint and performance target in the insurance-claims example
column2: general performance objective listed for BPM.,“…keeping average throughput above 1500 claims during 4 weeks.” / Table column 'Throughput (# claims)'

column1: Work-in-progress (WIP),Listed as a typical response/performance measure in simulation studies.,"“The responses may be cycle time, work-in-progress, and resource utilization.”"

Resource utilization,Listed as a response metric and cited as a constraint that can be imposed on solutions.,“The responses may be … resource utilization.” / “…maintaining a minimum utilization level of all resources.”

Cycle time (manufacturing or generic),General performance measure to be minimised in manufacturing optimisation example.,“…we may want to formulate an optimization model that seeks to minimize cycle time by manipulating the number of workers and machines…”
Costs (operational or capital),Included among possible performance objectives in business-process optimisation.,"“Performance objectives may include throughput, costs, inventories, cycle times…”"
Inventories,Named as a possible performance objective or KPI for BPM studies.,"“Performance objectives may include throughput, costs, inventories, cycle times…”"
Capital utilization,Highlighted as a potential objective/metric in BPM evaluations.,“…performance objectives may include … resource and capital utilization…”
Start-up times,Identified as a performance metric that can be optimised or monitored.,“…performance objectives may include … start-up times…”
Cash flow,Cited as a financial performance measure within BPM optimisation context.,“…performance objectives may include … cash flow…”
Waste,Listed as an environmental/efficiency performance measure in BPM.,“…performance objectives may include … waste.”
Liu et al. 2010 - Integrated Modeling of Performance Monitoring with Business Artifacts.pdf
performance_measure,how_it_is_used_in_the_text,evidence_in_the_text
On-time rate,Used to evaluate punctuality of flights
column2: obtained by aggregating scheduled and actual departure/arrival times kept in the Flight monitoring context.,"""For example, to monitor on-time rate, we can create a monitoring context for flights… Then, flight on-time rate can be calculated as an aggregation function on the metrics of the monitoring context instances.""  "

column1: Number of Customers,Simple count of guests served in the restaurant scenario
column2: derived from the ‘# of guests’ attribute in the Guest Check artifact.,"""…performance measures for monitoring a restaurant business, for example, Number of Customers…""  "

column1: Seat Utilization,Percentage of tables that are occupied at a point in time
column2: computed by counting active Guest Check instances (occupied tables) versus total tables.,"""…Seat Utilization is the percentage of tables occupied by guests… we can get the number of occupied tables by counting the number of active Guest Check instances.""  "

column1: Seating Efficiency,Alternative/derived indicator for seat utilisation (appears in Figure 6) that combines number of customers and occupied tables.,"Figure 6 legend shows the performance-measure box containing “Number of Customer, Seating Efficiency”.  "
Revenue per Available Seat Hour,Measures revenue generated per seat-hour
column2: calculated with Guest Check amounts plus Table capacity/availability.,"""…performance measures for monitoring a restaurant business, for example,… Revenue per Available Seat Hour…""  "

column1: Food Cost Percentage,Ratio of food cost to revenue
column2: relies on cost recorded in Kitchen Order plus amount in Guest Check.,same enumeration sentence as above

column1: Food Cost Percentage per Guest,Refined measure that divides Food Cost Percentage by guest count
column2: requires correlating Guest Check and Kitchen Order artifacts.,"""…to monitor Food Cost Percentage per Guest, we need to use two business artifacts, Guest Check and Kitchen Order…""  "

column1: Kitchen Labor Percentage,Share of kitchen labour cost in total revenue
column2: identified as a restaurant performance measure.,same enumeration sentence as above

column1: Total Labor Cost Percentage,Overall labour cost as a percentage of revenue
column2: part of restaurant KPI list.,same enumeration sentence as above

column1: Flow times,Process-oriented metric indicating how long instances stay in the workflow.,"""…displays this information in a graphical way (e.g., flow times, bottlenecks, utilization, etc.).""  "
Bottlenecks,Metric/indicator for identifying constrained points in a process.,same quote as above
Utilization,Generic measure of how intensively a resource or activity is used (appears both in BAM discussion and seat utilisation context).,same quote as above

Quality and Risk Assessment Score of Development Plan,Strategic KPI used in the pharmaceutical-alliance example to assess plan quality and risk.,"""…metrics include “quality and risk assessment score of development plan”…""  "
Trust and Transparency Survey Score,Strategic KPI capturing partner trust in the alliance example.,"""…and “trust and transparency survey score”…"""
Ferreira and Pernici 2016 - Managing the complex data center environment - an Integrated Energy-aware Framework.pdf
Indicador,Como é utilizado no texto,Evidência textual

Power consumption,"Usado como métrica para monitorar desde o data center inteiro até componentes individuais, servindo de base para acionar adaptações e para calcular Energy Impact Factor.","“Power consumption, for instance, can be measured from the entire facility to a single software component.”"
Energy consumption,Indicador-chave de requisitos energéticos (GPI) e meta de otimização
column2: aparece em relações evento-meta (“e2 Power Consumption increase” impactando “g4 Energy Consumption”).,"“goals … involve both performance and energy consumption, i.e., KPIs and GPIs thresholds.” / “e2 Power Consumption increase has a negative impact over the goal g4 Energy Consumption”"

column1: Energy efficiency,"Indicador de eficiência usado para avaliar ações (ex.: virtualização, DVFS) e para compor o ‘service-center greenness level’.",“Energy consumption and energy efficiency of ICT centers gained priority…”
CPU utilization,"Variável monitorada que, junto ao clock, compõe eventos como ‘CPU server utilization’
column2: afeta métricas de potência e energia.",“the events Server power consumption and CPU server utilization share a dependency relation with the CPU clock speed frequency variable.”

column1: CPU clock speed / P-state,Parâmetro que afeta diretamente potência/energia
column2: ações de ‘Change CPU P-state’ são selecionadas com base nesse indicador.,"“The first technique adapts the CPU power when it is not running during critical periods, saving significant amount of energy…”"

column1: Application availability,Indicador de qualidade
column2: violações (yellow/red) podem ou não disparar ações (ex.: durante migração de VM).,"“during the VM migration action, the application availability indicator may be violated.”"

column1: Execution time,Métrica de desempenho usada na seleção de serviços (Tabela 3) e na análise trade-off energia × performance.,Tabela 3: “Execution time”

Price / Cost,Indicador de custo financeiro presente na seleção de serviços (Tabela 3) e nos atributos ‘Cost’ e ‘TotalCost’ das ações/estratégias.,Tabela 3: “Price”  /  “Cost is an interval attribute that represents the expected cost of the action execution”

Server payload,Variável/indicador de carga que pode se tornar evento (‘e3 Server Payload’) e impactar metas como custo e energia.,“event server payload has a negative impact relation towards the goal server cost.”
Server cost,Meta/indicador econômico impactada por eventos como ‘server payload’.,“…negative impact relation towards the goal server cost.”

Greenness level,Indicador agregado usado pelos controladores GCL/LCL para decidir se ações de adaptação são necessárias.,“The GCL algorithm … calculates the service center greenness level in order to decide if adaptation actions are needed.”

Energy Impact Factor,Métrica composta (CPU + Memória) utilizada nos experimentos para comparar consumo de energia entre abordagens.,“we adopt an Energy Impact Factor. This value is composed of the estimation of two physical components usage: CPU and memory…”
CO₂ emission (KEI),Exemplo de Key Ecological Indicator usado para medir ‘greenness’ de processos.,“the KEI ‘CO2 emission’ of a shipping process…”

Goal Fulfilment Level (Green/Yellow/Orange/Red),Indicador derivado dos thresholds de cada métrica e usado para identificar três níveis de ameaça.,"“An indicator is not violated, i.e., green, when its current value is within both warning and alarming boundaries. Otherwise … warning (yellow) or alarming (red) violation.”"

Significance & Severity (de eventos),"Métricas qualitativas associadas a ocorrências de eventos, utilizadas para priorizar tratamento.","“the event occurrence significance is within the range [0...1] … The severity attribute defines, in a qualitative manner, the severity level of event occurrence”"
Thomas and Nuyken 2014 - Quantitative process maps - A concept for prioritization of business process improvement projects.pdf
Metric,How_it_is_used_in_the_text,Evidence_in_the_text

Maturity level,Used as a criterion in process evaluation to identify degree of change and in monitoring to decide optimisation intensity,"“Existing methods for evaluation do consider maturity level, key performance indicators …”
column2: “Evaluation of processes contains process monitoring and maturity level assessment.”"

column1: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Employed together with maturity level to assess process performance and decide on improvement projects,"“… evaluating them regarding risks, maturity level, key performance indicators …”
column2: “…process monitoring including KPIs…”"

column1: Risks (opportunities & risks),Top-down strategic measure to signal need for process change,"“…evaluating them regarding risks…”
column2: “…In praxis, companies are evaluating opportunities and risks as part of the annual report.”"

column1: Delivery time,Competitive performance measure motivating optimisation of order-fulfilment process,“…a competitor is getting better and better regarding delivery times…”

Innovation capability,Strategic opportunity indicator leading to optimisation of development processes,“…the company’s innovation capability … which should result in the optimization of the development and time-to-market process.”
Time-to-market,Specific speed-of-innovation performance metric linked to development process,“…optimization of the development and time-to-market process.”
Market share,Strategic outcome metric whose possible loss drives improvement projects,“…the risk of loosing market shares…”
Work-in-process (WIP),Operational health metric used in high-level judgement of a process,“The selection on basis of health includes evaluation of work-in-process…”
Number of interfaces,Complexity metric considered in assessing “health” of a process,“…evaluation of … number of interfaces.”
Process health,Composite qualitative performance measure guiding selection for innovation,“Render high-level judgements of the ‘health’ of each process”

Quality Function Deployment (QFD),Customer-focused quality metric proposed for early evaluation,“…a first-level quality function deployment …”
Profitability analysis,Financial performance measure to identify high-payoff processes,“…profitability analysis…”
Marginal costing,Cost metric recommended for filtering improvement opportunities,“…and marginal costing.”
Customer satisfaction / Voice of the customer,Outcome metric to prioritise processes influencing customers,“…the company needs to get the voice of the customer…”

Metric,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Accuracy (genérico),Indicador principal de qualidade da predição
column2: avaliado em conjunto com a precocidade (earliness),"“Two measures commonly employed to assess a predictive process monitoring technique are accuracy and earliness [14,24,47].”  "

column1: Earliness,Mede o quão cedo a predição atinge determinado nível de acerto ao longo dos prefixos do caso,“A common approach to measure the earliness of the predictions is to evaluate the accuracy of the models after each arrived event or at fixed time intervals.”
Mean Absolute Error (MAE),Métrica-chave adoptada para quantificar o erro da predição de tempo restante,“we use MAE to measure the error in predicting the remaining time.”

Root Mean Square Error (RMSE),Métrica alternativa mencionada para variáveis contínuas,"“well-known error metrics are Mean Absolute Error (MAE), Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) and Mean Percentage Error (MAPE) [22]”  "
Mean Percentage Error (MAPE),Métrica alternativa mencionada mas descartada devido a vieses com valores próximos de zero,“thus MAPE would be skewed in such situations.”

Weighted average MAE,MAE médio ponderado pela frequência dos prefixos (compara modelos ao longo de todos os comprimentos),"“Table 10 reports the prediction accuracy, averaged across all evaluated prefix lengths… The averages are weighted by the relative frequency of prefixes…”  "

Normalized MAE,MAE dividido pela duração média do caso para possibilitar comparação entre logs,"“for each log, we divide the average MAE values … by the mean case duration for that log reported in Table 8.”  "

Standard deviation of normalized MAE,Avalia a variabilidade do erro normalizado entre os datasets,“divide the average MAE values and their standard deviations across all prefixes reported in Table 10”
Mean ranking,Classificação média dos métodos sobre todos os datasets como medida global de desempenho,“we plot their mean rankings achieved across all datasets in Figure 8.”
95 % confidence interval,Intervalo de confiança associado ao ranking médio (mede a incerteza da estimativa),“Error bars indicate the 95% confidence interval.”

p-value (Friedman/Nemenyi),Mede significância estatística das diferenças de desempenho entre métodos,“The complete set of experiments indicate statistically significant differences according to this test ( p=6.914×10−8).” e “Table 11 lists p-values of a pairwise post-hoc analysis.”

Choi et al. 2013 - Simulation-based operation management of outpatient departments in university hospitals.pdf
Performance Measure,Usage in Text,Evidence (exact excerpt from paper)
Waiting time,Principal indicator of service performance
column2: schedules and workflows are designed to inform/shorten it
column3: evaluated in simulation.,“long waiting times for patients” / “unreasonably long waiting times in outpatient clinics have been the focus of research” / “the workflows … make it easy [to] communicate with patients by letting them know the expected … waiting time”

column1: Micro waiting time,Sub-category of waiting time measured from patient arrival to being called by the doctor
column2: used to highlight invisibility problem for patients.,“the waiting time in outpatient clinics can be classified into the micro waiting time of when a patient arrives at the clinic and the wait until a doctor calls them for treatment”

column1: Macro waiting time,Sub-category of waiting time measured from referral date to actual treatment date
column2: motivates over-booking policy.,“the macro waiting time of the delay between the referral date … and the actual date of the specialist treatment. The macro waiting time tends to be longer because the growth of outpatient clinic capacity cannot match the increasing demand”

column1: Congestion,Indicator of crowding in waiting room
column2: schedules aim to reduce it and simulation evaluates it.,“focus on improving the quality of service regarding the waiting time and congestion” / “high congestion have negative effects on both patients and staff” / “Quantitative evaluations via the simulation can test the alternatives … with respect to … waiting times and congestion”

column1: Overtime work / Overtime sessions,Measure of extra working hours caused by poor scheduling
column2: workflows S+ aim to reduce it.,“overtime work for clinic staff” / “overtime sessions are becoming increasingly common and even normal”

column1: Quality of service,Global KPI
column2: schedules are assessed to maintain or improve it.,“aims to maximize the quality of service” / “doctors’ pressure to shorten treatment times while maintaining high levels of service quality increases” / “provide … performance measures … to facilitate the decision making process with a better quality of service”

column1: On-time delivery (manufacturing analogy),Referenced as critical KPI in analogous simulation-based operation systems that inspire hospital solution.,"“the on-time delivery, which is one of the critical measures for the customer satisfaction, depends on the scheduling of activities”  "
Capacity of facility / clinic,Measured to decide if new demand can be accepted
column2: evaluated by online simulation.,“The online simulation provides the stakeholders with the ability to evaluate the capacity of the facility for new orders”

column1: Expected delivery time (manufacturing analogy),Time promised to customer
column2: analogy used to justify need for future visibility.,“The online simulation provides … expected delivery time”

column1: Closing time of session,Target minimized by S+ workflow
column2: part of performance report shown to head nurse.,“support the wrap-up phase … by rescheduling … in order to minimize the waiting time and closing time of a session”

column1: Expected close time of target session,Derived KPI displayed to head nurse in scheduling GUI.,“expected close time of the target session with the number of booked patients”

Bannerman 2008 - Capturing business benefits from process improvement - four fallacies and what to do about them.pdf
Metrica,Uso no texto,Evidencia no texto

Variância de performance,Mostra a dispersão dos resultados de melhoria de processo entre organizações,"“for organizations engaging in process improvement that report a performance improvement, the variance is high”"
% de organizações com ‘nada mudou’ (26 %),Indicador de impacto nulo após avaliação CMM,“26% agreed that ‘nothing much has changed’ after an appraisal”
% de organizações desiludidas (49 %),Indicador de frustração com falta de resultados da melhoria de processo,“49% were disillusioned with the lack of results”
ROI (Return on Investment),Mede retorno financeiro obtido
column2: comparado entre empresas com/sem equipe ou CoE de processos,"“organizations with a dedicated process team reported twice the ROI…”, “five times greater ROI than companies without a centre of excellence”"

column1: Probabilidade de sucesso de iniciativa,Percentual relativo de êxito em iniciativas de processos,“organizations with a process center of excellence were six times more likely to report a successful outcome”
Taxa de crescimento do mercado BPM (40–50 %),Indicador de expansão anual esperada do setor,“growth is expected to be 40-50% in 2008”
Faturamento anual (US$ 2 bi),Usado para dimensionar o porte da organização no caso de terceirização,“a $2 billion per annum turnover organization”
Custo adicional anual (US$ 0,5 mi+),Mostra ineficiência criada pela má configuração do outsourcing,“The direct cost was over half a million dollars a year”
Frequência das reuniões (semanal),Mede cadência de governança operacional,"“operations management review committee, which met weekly”"
Transações por ano (20 mi),Volume operacional do sistema do DMV,“processed 20 million registration and licensing transactions a year”
Nº de escritórios de atendimento (130),Escala geográfica da operação do DMV,“through 130 customer service offices”
Nº de releases maiores por ano (4–6),Indicador de intensidade de mudanças de software,“with 4 to 6 major system enhancement releases per year”
Nº de módulos executáveis (140+),Complexidade do sistema monolítico,“comprising over 140 executable load module components”
Nº de módulos afetados por uma mudança (60–70),Mostra efeito cascata de pequenas alterações,“a simple one line code change could impact 60 or 70 load modules”
Linhas de código,Usado como métrica de produtividade do programador,“his or her performance is measured in lines of code written and ‘tested’”
Metas de vendas,Indicador de desempenho comercial do business unit no exemplo de sub-otimização,“the client/business unit achieves sales targets more easily than expected”
Participação de mercado,Mede resultado competitivo posterior ao sistema defeituoso,“the business has lost market share to its competitors”
Fluxo de caixa,Indicador financeiro usado pelo comprador do caminhão para decidir registrar apenas 3 meses,“to preserve his cash flow”
Duração de exposição ao bug (1 dia),Avalia risco considerado ‘baixo’ na liberação do software defeituoso,“the bug would be present for only one day”

Wasserkrug et al. 2008 - Complex event processing over uncertain data.pdf
medidor_de_performance,como_e_usado,no_texto_evidencia
event_processing_rate_per_second,métrica principal nos experimentos
column2: calculada como número de eventos gerados dividido pelo tempo total de processamento
column3: utilizada para comparar cenários e algoritmos,"“O  measure  usado em todos os experimentos foi  o event processing rate per second, calculated as number of generated events / total processing time.”  "

column1: total_processing_time,denominador do rate
column2: tempo cronometrado para processar 20 000 eventos explícitos em cada experimento,"“…20,000 explicit events were generated, and the total time to process these explicit events was measured.”  "

column1: num_generated_events,numerador do rate
column2: 20 000 eventos explícitos por experimento,idem acima

column1: explicit_events_per_second,taxa observada de chegada/processamento de eventos explícitos
column2: apresentada na Tabela 4 para quatro cenários,Tabela 4: colunas ‘Explicit Events/sec’

column1: percentage_of_relevant_events,"variação de carga nos experimentos (0 %, 1 %, 20 %, 80 %)
column2: usada para avaliar impacto na performance","“…we varied the percentage of explicit events relevant for materialization… Standby (0 %), Noisy (1 %), Filtered (20 %), Complex (80 %).”  "

column1: number_of_possible_worlds,indicador de complexidade do cenário experimental (2^rs)
column2: variado de 2^4 a 2^36 para testar escalabilidade,“the number of possible worlds was always calculated as 2^rs … varied … up to 2^36 possible worlds.”

column1: event_rate_vs_possible_worlds_decay,medida derivada: comportamento do event rate quando se aumenta o número de mundos possíveis
column2: usado para mostrar escalabilidade sub-linear do RuleSamp,Figura 6: “event rate as a function of possible worlds … decays sub-linearly…”

column1: algorithm_complexity_bigO,complexidade teórica de tempo do Algoritmo 1
column2: usada como métrica analítica,Teorema 3: “overall complexity of Algorithm 1 is  O( … ).”

column1: exponential_complexity_notice,avaliação qualitativa de performance do algoritmo de rede bayesiana (‘does not scale well’)
column2: compara natureza exponencial x sub-linear,“…the Bayesian network algorithm demonstrates an exponential decline in performance with the increase in the number of possible worlds.”

column1: sample_size_m,"número de amostras necessárias para atingir precisão
column2: fórmula em função de Zα, σ̂, β",“one would need (Zα σ̂ / β)^2 samples…”

column1: confidence_level_alpha,"parâmetro de qualidade estatística fixado em 0,05 nos experimentos",“…the confidence (α) was set to 0.05.”
confidence_interval_width_beta,"precisão desejada dos experimentos (0,05
column5: afeta número de amostras e event rate","“…we tested several settings of the confidence width β (0.05, 0.1, 0.15, and 0.2).”  "

column1: true_interval,métrica de acurácia observada (‘tamanho real do intervalo’)
column2: comparada com expected interval,“…define the true interval to be the size of an interval such that only 5 % of samples are outside … Table 5 summarises the results… the true interval to be significantly smaller than the expected interval.”

column1: expected_interval,intervalo teórico (β) com o qual a acurácia do algoritmo é confrontada
column2: constante de referência na Tabela 5,Tabela 5: coluna ‘Exp. interval’

column1: rate_of_decay,velocidade de queda do event rate quando cresce o número de mundos
column2: usada para comparar RuleSamp e abordagem da rede bayesiana,"Figura 6 e texto: “…event rate decays sub-linearly…”, “…exponential decline in performance…”"

column1: 18th International Conference on Pers... 2019 - 18th International Conference on Perspectives in Business Informatics Research, BIR 2019.pdf
medidor,como_e_usado_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Indicador de desempenho derivado de modelos de processos de negócio para avaliar o desempenho de atividades/organizações.,Título do artigo: “Deriving Key Performance Indicators from Business Process Model”.

System responsiveness,Métrica para assegurar que sistemas de TIC respondam rapidamente aos utilizadores.,Prefácio: “BIR 2019 is focused on the development of ICT systems to ensure system responsiveness …”.
User friendliness,Mede o grau de facilidade de uso de sistemas de TIC.,Prefácio: “BIR 2019 is focused on the development of ICT systems to ensure … user friendliness …”.
Project agility,Métrica que avalia a capacidade de adaptação rápida de projetos de TIC.,Prefácio: “BIR 2019 is focused on the development of ICT systems to ensure … project agility …”.
Information availability,Indica o nível de disponibilidade dos dados para os utilizadores.,Prefácio: “… ensure … information availability and security …”.
Information security,Avalia a proteção dos dados e sistemas contra ameaças.,Prefácio: “… ensure … information availability and security …”.
Business continuity,Mede a capacidade de um sistema/empresa continuar operando durante interrupções.,Prefácio: “… ensure … business continuity …”.
System functionality,Avalia se o sistema cumpre as funcionalidades exigidas.,Prefácio: “… ensure … system functionality …”.
Scalability,Mede a capacidade do sistema em crescer em volume ou carga sem perda de desempenho.,Prefácio: “… ensure … scalability …”.
Efficiency,Indicador geral de uso ótimo de recursos para produzir resultados.,Prefácio: “… ensure … efficiency.”
Cost-effectiveness,Avalia se a gestão ou tecnologia atinge objetivos a um custo reduzido.,Tema do congresso: “cost-effective management”.
Sustainability,Mede o impacto e a capacidade de manter resultados de forma duradoura.,Prefácio: “enterprises must find new ways to innovate for business advantage and sustainability.”
Optimization opportunity,Indica o potencial de melhoria de desempenho através de ajustes ou inovações.,Prefácio: “… enterprises can capitalize on new business and optimization opportunities.”

Multi-criteria ranking,Ferramenta de avaliação/medição que ordena alternativas segundo vários critérios de desempenho.,Título do artigo: “Multi-criteria Ranking Based on Joint Distributions: A Tool to Support Decision Making”.

Grosse et al. 2021 - Blockchain-Enabled Trust in Intercompany Networks Applying the Agency Theory.pdf
Metric,Usage/Context in the Paper,Evidence from the Text

Transaction Costs,Main economic performance indicator that DLT is expected to reduce by increasing trust and transparency,"“trust can be seen as a safeguard that leads to a decrease in both complexity and transaction costs [ 7,8 ].”  "

Complexity,Performance aspect that is lowered when trust rises in inter-company relations,"“trust can be seen as a safeguard that leads to a decrease in both complexity and transaction costs [ 7,8 ].”  "

Trust Score / Level of Trust,Quantified in a blockchain-based “trust evaluation system” to rate partners and discourage opportunism,"“[27] propose a concept called ‘trust evaluation system’, which is used for managing trust scores within M2M-environments with the help of a trust consensus protocol.”  "
Reputation Score,Used as an ex-ante and ex-post safeguard
column2: high scores lower uncertainty and transaction costs,“reputation mechanisms can be used as an deterrence for opportunistic behavior through its inherent penalties…”

column1: Bull-whip Effect (amplitude),Supply-chain performance metric whose magnitude can be reduced by blockchain visibility,“the inherent transparency and immutability of recorded data can help mitigating occurring problems such as bull-whip effects [ 41 ].”

Governance Costs,Component of transaction costs that blockchain can lower in ‘transactional relationships’,“BCT provides mitigating effects … in the reduction of governance costs and thus transaction costs [ 26 ].”

Capacity Utilisation / Over- & Under-capacities,Operational performance measure motivating creation of negotiation networks,“Resulting uncertainties lead to potential over- and undercapacities and therefore to economic inefficiencies in companies.”

Throughput (consensus layer),Technical performance metric to choose an adequate consensus mechanism,"“…alternative consensus mechanisms … can be adducted, if conditions such as the throughput … is decision-relevant [55].”  "

Confirmation Delay,"Latency metric for consensus performance, relevant in IoT scenarios",“…alternative consensus mechanisms … if conditions such as the throughput or the confirmation delay is decision-relevant [55].”

Profit (KPI),Target key performance indicator maximised by a smart-contract auctioneer,“smart contracts can be used as a virtual auctioneer with the aim of maximizing a target key performance indicator such as profit [43].”

Consumption Amount / Token Threshold,Token-based measure to detect abnormal resource use,"“Tracking the consumption amount together with a threshold check, suspicious activities can be traced back to the exceed of a predefined threshold for such tokens [46].”  "
Carbon Emissions,Environmental performance metric represented and tracked with carbon tokens,“…shown by [37] in the fields of tracking carbon emissions via carbon tokens.”
Scalability,System performance requirement for blockchain-enabled supply-chain IoT solutions,“mentions the requirements of scalability … for IT technologies and IoT applications [51].”
Performance (general),Overall system speed/efficiency requirement highlighted for blockchain platforms,“…requirements of … performance and reliability [51].”
Reliability,Quality/performance requirement for blockchain-IoT infrastructures,“…requirements of … performance and reliability [51].”

Product Loss,Operational loss metric whose occurrence blockchain aims to prevent,"“distributed trust … is beneficial for the prevention of double spending, product loss and thus contributes to compliance [ 53 ].”  "
Compliance,Regulatory performance indicator improved through immutable records,"“…prevention of double spending, product loss and thus contributes to compliance [ 53 ].”"

Performance_Measure,How_it_is_used_in_the_text,Evidence_in_the_text
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Operational metrics attached to goals
column2: their values are transformed into satisfaction levels that feed the goal model and the enhanced event log,"""Each goal may be fed by its Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), allowing to quantify its satisfaction level.""  "

column1: Process time,Concrete KPI linked to Goal G2 (“to take a short process time”)
column2: used in examples of case-perspective criteria and for computing Sat(G2),"""e.g., “process time” associated to the goal G2 “to take a short process time”""  "

column1: Cost,Concrete KPI linked to the goal “to decrease cost”
column2: appears in trade-off example contrasting short time vs. unaffordable cost,"""a trace may take a long time and impose an unaffordable cost but may end up with a correct diagnosis.""  "

column1: Satisfaction level of a goal Sat(Gi),Numeric value (0-100) obtained from KPIs
column2: basic building block for all higher-level measures and discovery criteria,"""We define the satisfaction level of Goal i as Sat(Gi).""  "

column1: Satisfaction level of an actor,Derived measure computed from the satisfaction of the goals belonging to the actor
column2: used in overall assessment,"""The satisfaction of actors (dashed circles in Fig. 1)… can be computed in a similar fashion [1].""  "

column1: Overall satisfaction level of a case (si:Ove),Aggregate of all goal satisfactions for one case obtained through function g
column2: stored in the enhanced log and used in organisation-perspective analysis,"""si:Ove = g(si:1
column3: si:2

column1: Aggregated satisfaction level of a goal (sAgg:j),"Aggregation (e.g., average, median, etc.) of a goal’s satisfaction over all cases
column2: central to goal-perspective criteria","""sAgg:j = fj(s1:j
column3: s2:j
column5: sm:j) … fj is the aggregation function of Goal j.""  "

column1: Comprehensive satisfaction level (sComp),Overall process-level metric computed either from aggregated goal levels or from overall case levels
column2: drives organisation-perspective criterion,"""This may be computed through the goal model (e.g., in GRL) or through a function derived from that model.""  "

column1: Confidence level (conf),Probability threshold (0–1) stating the minimum fraction of cases that must satisfy case-perspective criteria,"""Such criteria represent that (with a confidence conf) the satisfaction level of every single case … will be at least slj.""  "

Frequency of activities/transitions,"Simple statistic used to prune or abstract unstructured models (e.g., keep activities occurring in ≥20 % of cases)","""For example, keeping the activities that occur at least for 20 % of cases is a way to simplify the model.""  "

Fitness,Process-model quality dimension expressing how much of the observed behaviour is captured by the model,"""In addition to the fitness, precision, generalization, and simplicity dimensions [16], GoPED brings into consideration a new intention dimension…""  "
Precision,Process-model quality dimension indicating how little extra behaviour the model allows beyond the log,same sentence as above
Generalization,Process-model quality dimension indicating the ability of the model to generalise from the log,same sentence as above
Simplicity,Process-model quality dimension measuring structural complexity of the discovered model,same sentence as above
Intention dimension,Additional quality dimension introduced by GoPED to evaluate alignment of the model with stakeholders’ goals,same sentence as above
