Low et al. 2007 - Symbiotic simulation for business process re-engineering in high-tech manufacturing and service networks.pdf
PerformanceMeasure,HowItIsUsedInTheText,TextEvidence
Speed of Response (Company’s response time),Presented as a critical competitive factor
column2: the proposed symbiotic simulation system is meant to improve this speed by enabling rapid business-process re-engineering.,"“In today’s highly competitive business environment, the speed with which a company responds to changes in its business environment by adapting and enhancing its own business processes is vital to its survival.”"

column1: Availability of Spare Components,Identified as a critical KPI for flight safety and punctuality
column2: resource-management workflow must keep availability high.,"“In the aerospace industry, the availability of spare components is a critical issue for ensuring safety and punctuality of flights.”"

column1: Punctuality of Flights,Tied to availability of spares
column2: delays (or the absence thereof) reflect performance of the logistics process.,“…critical issue for ensuring safety and punctuality of flights.”

column1: Service Level,Overall qualitative KPI
column2: maintaining an adequate service level is a motivation for continuous inventory optimisation and re-balancing.,"“To ensure adequate service level, the number of spare components across all airports has to be continuously optimized and re-balanced during actual operation.”"

column1: Number of Spare Components (inventory level),Used as a decision variable that must be optimised and re-balanced to achieve target service levels.,“…the number of spare components across all airports has to be continuously optimized and re-balanced…”
FillRate Percentage,Main quantitative KPI monitored on-line
column2: defined as the percentage of flights with failures that still depart on schedule.,"“Thus, a performance indicator ‘FillRate Percentage’ is defined to measure the percentage of flights which develop component failures and can still meet the schedule for the next flight.”"

column1: Time Taken to Provide Replacement Component,Determines success or failure of each servicing cycle
column2: directly affects FillRate.,“The success or failure of each fault servicing cycle is determined by the time taken for the replacement component to be made available. If this exceeds the departure time of the flight… the servicing has failed.”

column1: Number of Faults,Reported per airport in experiment tables

column1: Number of Filled Requests,Reported per airport
column2: successful replacements
column3: numerator for FillRate.,Table 1/2/3 headings: ‘# of Filled’

Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual

column2: Grover et al. 2018).”"

column2: Shim et al. 2015).”"

column1: Marketing cost,Opção de redução de custos e driver possível de lucro

column1: Revenue,Usado na fórmula que calcula o KPI Profit.,“the current value of Profit is computed as Revenue − Costs − Stolen ∗ 50”

Stolen (itens furtados),Entrada da fórmula de Profit

column1: Profit,KPI derivado que mede resultado financeiro

column1: Popescu and Popescu 2014 - Theoretical contributions concerning performance-The way to achieve excellence.pdf
Medidor_de_Performance,Como_é_usado,Evidência_no_Texto
Performance excellence,Meta geral de desempenho que o PEP quer atingir para a área de compras.,"“Purchasing EmPowerment (PEP), helps purchasing to reach performance excellence.”"

Mais altos padrões de performance,Referência à meta estratégica que a organização busca alcançar por meio da função de compras.,“...permitting purchasing to move away from being a cost-cutting function to becoming a strategic entity that helps companies achieve the highest performance standards.”
Custos totais (overall costs),Indicador central do PEP
column2: o foco passa de corte de preço pontual para redução sustentável do custo total.,"“...hones in on long-term sustainable improvements along the process chain. In this strategic approach, the focus is on overall costs and company value.”"

column1: Valor da empresa (company value),Medido em conjunto com os custos totais para avaliar o impacto estratégico das compras.,“...the focus is on overall costs and company value.”

Custo em dinheiro total (total cash cost),Base de cálculo na qual a área de compras impacta >50 % dos dispêndios da empresa.,“Procurement influences more than 50 percent of a company’s total cash cost...”
Economia (% de saving),Percentual de redução de custo que o projeto pode gerar
column2: citado exemplo de até 70 %.,“...PEP can achieve savings up to 70 percent of important commodity or category groups.”

column1: Gaps de performance,Diferença entre performance atual e benchmark
column2: utilizado para planejar a evolução da área.,“...enables a company to gauge its performance gaps.”

column1: Spend em commodities/fornecedores/recursos,Volume de gastos analisado para priorizar ações de melhoria.,"“...consider how much they spend on commodities, suppliers, and resources.”"
Unidade de custo (unit costs),Medida focal do primeiro passo do PEP (gestão estratégica de commodities).,“The initial step – managing commodities strategically – focuses on unit costs.”

Custos de processo (process costs),Medida focal do segundo passo do PEP (otimização de processos de compras).,“The second step – optimizing purchasing organization processes – deals with process costs.”

Melhoria quantitativa da cadeia de suprimentos,Indicador de resultado do terceiro passo (gestão de fornecedores) em termos numéricos.,“Strategic supplier management improves the supply chain in both quantitative and qualitative terms.”

Melhoria qualitativa da cadeia de suprimentos,Indicador de resultado do terceiro passo (gestão de fornecedores) em termos qualitativos.,“Strategic supplier management improves the supply chain in both quantitative and qualitative terms.”
Competitividade,Resultado global obtido após aplicar os três passos
column2: usada como proxy de desempenho da empresa no mercado.,“Companies that work through all three steps tend to be more competitive than their counterparts.”

column1: Impacto no negócio (business impact),Eixo de segmentação da matriz de commodities
column2: mede a importância do item para o negócio.,“Each commodity or category is then assessed in terms of business impact and supply market challenge...”

column1: Desafio do mercado de suprimento (supply market challenge),Outro eixo da matriz de commodities
column2: mede a dificuldade de obtenção do item no mercado.,“...assessed in terms of business impact and supply market challenge...”

KPI – Key Performance Indicator,Indicador central de desempenho usado para monitorar e gerir performance organizacional,“Key performance indicators (KPI) are all catchy”

Indicadores de performance operacionais,Medições no nível de departamento/indivíduo que sustentam a estratégia,“operational performance indicators at the department/individual level”

Manufatura,Indicador operacional para processos produtivos,"“operations (such as supply chain, human resources, manufacturing)”"
Relacionamento com Fornecedores,KPI de processo de negócios,"“related business processes (such as supplier relations, Customer relationships…)”"
Relacionamento com Clientes,KPI de processo de negócios voltado ao cliente,"“related business processes (such as supplier relations, Customer relationships…)”"

Benchmarking,Comparação de métricas com padrões de referência,“ratio indicators compared to benchmarking reporting”

Comportamento de Condução,Indicador de segurança/eficiência ao dirigir,"“analyze driving behavior, fuel consumption, credit card and other information”"

Medidor de performance (KPI/Métrica),Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual (trecho entre aspas)

Deadline Adherence,Indica o percentual de objetos de negócio concluídos dentro do prazo (pontualidade do processo).,“Deadline Adherence %100 Objects Business finished all of Number on time Objects Business finished of Number ×” (Fig. 2) e “KPI Computation Expression  Deadline Adherence …” (Fig. 5)

Process Duration,Mede o tempo que o processo demora entre dois pontos (eficiência temporal).,“Process Duration  Objects Business finished all of Number Objects Business finished all of )date start  - date (finish ∑” (Fig. 2) e “Process Duration  Avg (ShipmentAckEvent.timestamp – ReceiveOrderEvent.timestamp)” (Fig. 5)

Percentual de pedidos de compra entregues com sucesso e no prazo,Exemplo de KPI de aderência a prazo aplicado ao processo de pedidos de compra.,“percentage of purchase orders which were delivered successfully and on time” (Seção 1)

Percentual de pedidos de compra processados no prazo,Versão derivada usada para ilustrar a fórmula de KPI na modelagem.,“percentage of purchase orders that were processed in time in the last 3 months should be greater than 90%” (Seção 3)

Número de pedidos de compra processados com sucesso e no prazo,Métrica agregada (contagem) usada no cálculo do KPI de aderência.,“an aggregate metric which sums up the instance metrics which evaluate to ‘true’” (Seção 3.2)

Duration Metric,Mede a duração entre dois eventos de execução (métrica de instância).,“The duration metric measures the time between two activities by simply subtracting the ‘timestamp’ attribute values of two execution events.” (Seção 3.1)

State Metric,Avalia uma condição lógica sobre o estado de uma instância do processo em um ponto específico.,“A state metric references an execution event and specifies a logical expression which formulates a condition on the state of the process instance at that point in time.” (Seção 3.1)
Instance Metric,Mede desempenho de uma única instância de processo
column2: base para agregações.,“An instance metric calculates metrics for one single process instance of a process model.” (Seção 3.1)

column1: Aggregate Metric,Aggrega valores de métricas de instância para avaliar o processo em um período de análise.,"“Aggregate metrics aggregate values of instance metrics using operators ‘max’, ‘min’, ‘average’, and ‘sum’.” (Seção 3.1)  "

Return on Investment (ROI),Exemplo de KPI financeiro citado como fora do escopo mas mencionado como métrica de desempenho.,"“Other KPIs, e.g. financial metrics such as Return on Investment (ROI) are not directly measurable … and thus are out of the scope of this paper.” (Seção 3)  "
KPIs baseados em custo do processo,Mencionado como extensão futura para medir custos dos processos.,“extend the KPI ontology by adding the possibility to specify process cost based KPIs” (Seção 6)

Taxa média de consumo de energia,Derivada calculada dividindo energia acumulada pela duração da atividade

Probabilidade de ocorrência de transições,Utilizada para atribuir pesos a transições imediatas no PN,“For Immediate Transitions – Determine the probability of occurrence for each related event by dividing the count of specific event occurrences by the total count of total related events.”
Vazão (Throughput),KPI de desempenho da linha de produção extraído dos modelos multi-flow,“We measure KPIs such as throughput and output for the production line.”
Saída (Output),Indicador de quantidade produzida avaliado nos cenários ‘what-if’,“We measure KPIs such as throughput and output for the production line.”
Taxa de mudança por unidade de tempo,Métrica genérica sugerida para dimensões não temporais quando aplicável,“Calculate the average rate of change per unit of time for each related activity.”

Medidor de Performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal extraída do artigo

Confiabilidade (Reliability),Característica não-funcional a ser medida na avaliação de arquiteturas de software.,"“...medindo atributos de qualidade específicos. Estes incluem características não-funcionais do sistema, tais como reliability, maintainability or flexibility.”"

Manutenibilidade (Maintainability),Característica não-funcional considerada na avaliação de desempenho da arquitetura.,"“...medindo atributos de qualidade específicos. Estes incluem características não-funcionais do sistema, tais como reliability, maintainability or flexibility.”"

Flexibilidade (Flexibility),Característica não-funcional usada como critério de avaliação de desempenho.,"“...medindo atributos de qualidade específicos. Estes incluem características não-funcionais do sistema, tais como reliability, maintainability or flexibility.”"

Acoplamento entre classes de objeto (Coupling Between Object Classes),Métrica formal derivada para avaliar desenhos orientados a objeto.,“object-oriented designs can be evaluated in terms of a number of formally derived metrics (such as the ‘coupling between object classes’ ...).”

Falta de coesão em métodos (Lack of Cohesion in Methods),Métrica formal derivada indicada para medir qualidade de projeto OO.,“...formally derived metrics (such as the ‘coupling between object classes’ or the ‘lack of cohesion in methods’).”

Qualidade de software (Software Quality),Atributo de alto nível que pode ser previsto a partir de métricas derivadas.,“Derived metrics can help predict attributes such as software quality (Basili and Briand 1996) ...”

Segurança (Security),Atributo de desempenho cujo valor pode ser estimado via métricas de código.,“Derived metrics can help predict attributes such as software quality ... or security (Chowdhury and Zulkernine 2011).”

Colaboração da equipe (Team Collaboration),Indicador qualitativo de desempenho melhorado pelo uso da GSDP.,“...showing that the model driven workflow and toolset improved communication and collaboration between designers and developers ...”

Comunicação entre stakeholders,Medidor qualitativo de desempenho relacionado à troca de requisitos.,“...demonstrating improved communication and collaboration between participants in the software engineering process.”

Produtividade do desenvolvedor (Developer Productivity),Indicador de desempenho analisado durante a avaliação dos pilotos.,“How did the GSDP IDE affect in developer productivity and development time?”
Tempo de desenvolvimento (Development Time),Parte da produtividade
column2: comparado com métodos tradicionais.,"“The improved communication of requirements did not significantly affect the number of faults. Also, actual development time was not shorter compared to traditional methods.”"

column1: Qualidade do código (Code Quality),Indicador avaliado para mensurar impactos da abordagem.,“How did the GSDP IDE affect the quality of the code produced?”
Time-to-Market,Indicador de desempenho do processo de desenvolvimento de serviços.,“...the ability for prototyping and reducing ‘time-to-market’ is essential (Van Riel and Lievens 2004
column2: Mietinnen et al. 2012).”

column1: Rastreabilidade (Traceability),Contribui para mensurar desempenho do processo através da documentação e da possibilidade de auditoria.,“...the use of formal modelling supports the documentation and traceability of the development process.”

Medidor_de_Performance,Uso_no_Texto,Evidencia_no_Texto
Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Elemento central para medir o atingimento de objetivos estratégicos
column2: integra modelos de estratégia e de monitoramento.,"""Selecting the right key performance indicator set is a crucial aspect."" / ""The modeling classes <Success Factor>, <Goal> and <KPI> (Key Performance Indicator) are the linkage to the E-Strategy Model."" "

column1: Indicator,Termo genérico usado para qualquer métrica de desempenho aplicada aos objetivos definidos na Balanced Scorecard.,"""…perspectives, success factors, goals, indicators and initiatives to set targets…"""
Success Factor,Fator crítico monitorado para avaliar o desempenho em relação à estratégia.,"""The modeling classes <Success Factor>, <Goal> and <KPI>…"""
Goal,Meta quantitativa ou qualitativa que é monitorada por KPIs e valores de alvo.,"""The modeling classes <Success Factor>, <Goal> and <KPI>…"""
Target Value,Valor de referência pretendido para um indicador ou KPI.,"""Target Value"" (na Figura 2, metamodelo)."
As-Is Value,"Valor atual observado do indicador, comparado com o Target Value.","""As-Is Value"" (na Figura 2, metamodelo)."
Basic KPI,Indicador elementar calculado diretamente a partir de dados brutos de monitoramento.,"""Basic KPI"" (na Figura 2, metamodelo)."
Aggregated KPI,Indicador composto obtido pela agregação ou cálculo sobre vários Basic KPIs.,"""Agreggated KPI"" (na Figura 2, metamodelo)."
Availability,Métrica técnica usada na gestão de serviços de TI para monitorar tempo de funcionamento.,"""…mostly technical metrics are used such as availability, throughput and response time…"""
Throughput,Métrica técnica que avalia a capacidade de processamento de um serviço ou sistema.,"""…mostly technical metrics are used such as availability, throughput and response time…"""
Response Time,Métrica técnica que mede o tempo de resposta de um serviço ou aplicação.,"""…mostly technical metrics are used such as availability, throughput and response time…"""

Cost-Benefit/Feasibility,Indicador que avalia a relação custo-benefício ao coletar ou usar um KPI.,"""Cost-Benefit/Feasibility: The ratio between the cost and the benefit of getting and using the indicator should be acceptable."""
Relevance,Critério/indicador qualitativo que verifica a pertinência do KPI para o público-alvo.,"""Relevance: The indicator should be relevant for the addressee."""
Expressiveness,Critério que mede o quanto o indicador é claro e não gera ambiguidades.,"""Expressiveness: The meaning for the people using the indicator should be clear and not misleading."""
Reliability,Critério que avalia se medições repetidas produzem sempre o mesmo resultado.,"""Reliability: Repeated measures of the same indicator always deliver the same result."""
Sensitiveness,Critério que mede a capacidade do indicador de reagir fortemente a mudanças.,"""Sensitiveness: The indicator should react strongly on changes."""

Metric,How it is used in the paper,Evidence excerpt

Turn-around time,Used as a KPI to illustrate an (undesired) effect of redesign in the motivating example,“…the EB improved their loan approval process by cutting its turnaround time down from one week to a few hours…”
Process Instance Duration (overall cycle time),"Main PPI for simulation, reward design and AB-tests
column2: compared across versions (mean, median, quantiles).",“…we compare duration of process versions V2 and V3 with V1 through AB tests.”

column1: Activity Duration,Captured in the TST
column2: sampled during simulation to build complete traces.,"“The metric collection contains raw data … such as cost, duration, and waiting time.”"

column1: Waiting Time,Stored in the TST and added to activity duration when per-event timestamps are incomplete.,"“…we summarised the execution time and the waiting time in a single metric, which we refer to as duration…”"

Execution Time,Used for simulation in the BPIC15 study and for performance comparison.,“…we computed the duration of every activity as the difference between the timestamp of its completion and the preceding completion timestamp.”
Cost,Taken from domain data in the Helicopter Licensing (HL) example
column2: compared between versions.,Table 4: ‘Cost model of the activities’ …
column3: “…Version B is cheaper overall…”

column1: User Satisfaction (score 1-5),"Synthetic PPI in HL case
column2: reward to the bandit algorithm
column3: derived from cost, completion time and outcome.","“…we simulate the user satisfaction, here calculated as a combination of cost, completion time, and result of the process execution.”"

column1: Reward,"Scalar value fed into the multi-armed-bandit router
column2: built from one or several PPIs (e.g., quantile-based duration mapping).",“…the reward design that can cater for the specifics of business-process execution.”  – Sect. 3.3.4

column1: Success Rate,Domain metric in HL scenario influencing expected re-execution and therefore cost/time.,Table 4: column ‘Success Rate’
Median Duration,Reported to characterise distribution of PPI values in evaluation tables
column2: used to justify routing decisions.,Table 6 & Table 9 show ‘Median duration’ for each version.

column1: Mean Duration,Same purpose as median
column2: falls under ‘duration’ family but explicitly reported.,Table 9: column ‘Mean duration’

column1: Median Cost,Derived cost statistic used to compare process versions in HL AB-test.,Table 6: row ‘Median cost’
Number of Requests per Version,Used as throughput indicator and to show traffic shift caused by the router.,"Figures 7, 11, 12, 13: “Requests per version”"
Delay to Reward,Considered in algorithm design since long-running processes postpone PPI observation.,“…long delays before rewards. Long delays are inherent to long-running processes…”

Grade,Nota global dada pelo simulador

column1: Score,"Forma gamificada da grade, usada para motivar o aluno e permitir melhoria contínua.",“the overall grade can be calculated in the form of a score summarizing the evaluation of student’s efforts …”

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),Conjunto de indicadores usados para compor a nota e para adaptar a dificuldade do cenário.,“… calculated on the basis of a number of key performance indicators (KPI) …”
Human Body Damage,Indicador intrínseco de quanto dano o aluno causa ao corpo simulado.,“… KPI characterizing intrinsic factors like human body damage …”
Blood Loss,Indicador intrínseco de perda sanguínea durante a intervenção.,“… KPI characterizing intrinsic factors like … blood loss …”

Efficiency Metric,"Indicador composto avaliado a partir de agilidade, trajeto do instrumento e duração da intervenção.","“… efficiency metric, which is evaluated on the basis of agility, length of the instruments’ movement track and intervention duration.”"
Agility,Sub-indicador de eficiência
column2: mede rapidez/habilidade dos movimentos.,“… evaluated on the basis of agility …”

column1: Length of Instruments’ Movement Track,Sub-indicador de eficiência

column1: Intervention Duration,Sub-indicador de eficiência

column1: Total Deviation in Time (Equação 3),Novo KPI proposto que mede a diferença temporal entre ações esperadas e realizadas.,“statement (3) allows calculating the total deviation in time between the moments of expected actions and the moments of factual actions executed by the student.”

Time Spent on Each Action,Usado para detectar inexperiência e ajustar a dificuldade em tempo real.,"“he will spend much time on each action, even in case he is good in theory … The system will identify it and simplify the case …”"

Deviation (of Learning Time),Controla a variação aceitável do tempo médio de aprendizagem.,“minimum average learning time with limited deviation …”

High Grades Estimation,Forma de expressar os resultados médios desejados (‘notas altas’).,“… good average evaluation results (high grades estimation) …”
Bleeding Rate,Parâmetro numérico que pode ser capturado pelo sistema para quantificar sangramento (potencial KPI clínico).,"código: m.params[\bleeding_rate\""] = 255.0f"""
Cardoso 2013 - Challenges in performance analysis in enterprise architectures.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência literal do texto
Number of evaluations of refund benefit KPI,KPI de quantidade para medir a eficiência do processo de reembolso
column2: conta quantas avaliações de benefício são realizadas.,“…efficiency can be conceived in two different ways: it can characterize performance in terms of quantity (thus we create the Number of evaluations of refund benefit KPI)”

column1: Average time spent in the refund benefit process KPI,KPI de tempo para medir a eficiência
column2: calcula o tempo médio gasto na execução do processo de reembolso.,“…or in terms of time (Average time spent in the refund benefit process  KPI).”

column1: Base measure (instance measure),Mede um atributo em apenas uma instância de processo.,“A base measure (or instance measure) is the measure obtained executing a certain measurement method over a single process instance”

Aggregated measure,Agrega valores de várias instâncias de processo para calcular o KPI.,“whereas an aggregated measure … uses a set of process instances to calculate the KPI’s values (aggregating single process instances).”

Derived measure,Medida calculada a partir de outras medidas (base ou agregadas).,“derived measure … corresponds to measures defined on the basis of other measures (either base or aggregated measures).”
Time measure,Mede a duração entre dois instantes de tempo referentes a elementos do processo.,“A time measure … measures the duration of time between two time instants”

Linear measure,Tipo de time measure que considera apenas a primeira e a última ocorrência dentro de um loop.,“The linear measure  is defined as a measure that takes into account the first occurrence of a given time instant condition and the last occurrence of the other time instant condition.”
Cyclic measure,Tipo de time measure que soma a duração de todas as iterações de um loop.,“The cyclic measure takes into account pairs of time instant conditions that are located in a loop.”
Count measure,Conta o número de ocorrências de um evento ou mudança de estado.,“A count measure … measures the number of times something happens”

Condition measure,Verifica se determinada condição é satisfeita em instâncias em execução ou finalizadas.,“whereas a condition measure … measures the fulfillment of certain condition in running or finished process instance.”
Data measure,Mede o valor (ou estado) de parte de um objeto de dados.,"“Finally, a data measure … measures the value of a certain part of a data object.”"
Human resource measure,Avalia o desempenho de um papel ou agente humano.,“A human resource measure [7] describes the performance of a role or agent.”
Number of evaluation measure (exemplo detalhado),Contagem de avaliações iniciadas no processo
column2: combinada com data/condition measure para filtrar clientes <60 anos e agregada em 2 meses.,"“Therefore, the number of evaluation  measure may correspond to all requests submitted in a period interval of 1 month… we stipulate that the number of evaluation should be collected for a given set of instances in a period of 2 months (analysis period)”"

column1: Average number of evaluations (valor agregado),"Valor agregado resultante do Number of evaluation measure, calculado como média em 2 meses.",“the number of evaluations is the average number of evaluations obtained in the time interval of 2 months.”

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),"Termo genérico para os indicadores que monitoram desempenho no SOVO, base dos três níveis da pirâmide de performance.","“Before introducing a framework for performance measurement, we need to identify the different categories of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for SOVO.”  "
Service Layer KPIs,Indicadores de desempenho dos serviços individuais fornecidos por cada parceiro
column2: usados para avaliar cumprimento de tarefas no nível operacional.,“The bottom-level performance indicators in a SOVO will be used to assess the performance of services provided by a specific partner… These indicators are mostly domain specific…”

column1: Collaboration Performance (indicadores),Indicadores que medem a eficácia e eficiência da interação entre parceiros
column2: nível intermediário (estratégico) da pirâmide.,“The mid-level performance indicator is Collaboration Performance which is used to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of the independent partners’ interaction.”

column1: Measurable Organizational Values (MOVs),Indicadores estratégicos que avaliam o sucesso global e o valor criado pelo SOVO
column2: topo da pirâmide de performance.,“the criteria indicating the success of SOVO at this level are measureable organizational values (MOVs).”

column1: Service Level Agreement (SLA) targets,Metas e limites de desempenho formalizados que vinculam fornecedor e usuários
column2: derivados dos KPIs de camada de serviço.,"“The SLA describes the Service, documents service level targets, and specifies the responsibilities of the IT service provider and the users.”  "

column1: Service Level Requirement (SLR),"Especificações de desempenho desejado para cada serviço, base para negociação de SLAs.","“The service level requirement (SLR) is a set of specifications and requirements for a service, based on the business objectives.”  "

Operational Level Agreement (OLA),"Acordo interno de suporte operacional que define metas de desempenho para equipes internas, alimentando SLAs.",“OLA is an agreement on operational support between service provider and its users.”

Service level targets/objectives,Metas quantitativas derivadas dos SLRs/OLAs que formam a base dos SLAs e dos KPIs de serviço.,"“Service level management… responsible for defining and negotiating service level targets, objectives and agreements which ensure the performance of overall VO services and operations.”  "

Return on Investment (ROI),Indicador financeiro de retorno utilizado para justificar SOA como abordagem de negócio.,“SOA is a journey that promises to… maximize Return on Investment (ROI) in both application and technology resources…”

Performance_Measure,How_it_is_used_in_the_text,Evidence_in_the_text

Forecasting accuracy,Planning KPI that transformation projects try to raise in order to run the chain more efficiently.,"“Clients usually take transformation actions to improve their forecasting accuracy, reduce warehousing costs, improve on-time delivery, etc.”"

Warehousing costs,Cost KPI that should be reduced as part of a transformation effort.,"“Clients usually take transformation actions to improve their forecasting accuracy, reduce warehousing costs, improve on-time delivery, etc.”"
On-time delivery / On-time delivery rate,Reliability KPI
column2: defined as the percentage of orders delivered within the predefined target cycle time
column3: analysed against different inventory policies.,"“The second performance measure is on time delivery rate representing a supply chain’s reliability. It is defined as the percentage of orders that were fulfilled on time, i.e. products delivered within the predefined target cycle time.”"

column1: Order fulfillment cycle time,Responsiveness KPI
column2: elapsed time between the release of a PO and the delivery of the corresponding products
column3: simulated for different base-stock levels.,"“The first performance measure is order fulfillment cycle time, representing a supply chain’s responsiveness. For each individual order in this study, the cycle time is calculated as the elapsed time between the release of a PO and the delivery of the corresponding products.”"

column1: Order cycle time,Generic service-level metric that customers monitor
column2: cited as one of the key measures demanded by clients.,"“clients are more and more demanding about service level measures such as order cycle time, on-time delivery rate, etc.”"

column1: Profitability,High-level financial KPI expected to rise in the short/medium/long term after transformation.,"“Obviously, all transformation initiatives are finally expected to help increase profitability in a short/medium/long term.”"
Inventory carrying cost,Cost KPI that can be lowered through better inventory policies.,“…may help reduce its inventory carrying cost and improve its customer service level considerably…”
Inventory holding cost,Specific cost that grows with larger average inventories
column2: used when discussing the trade-off created by higher base-stock levels.,"“…when the average raw material stock level increases, it will bring additional costs related to inventory holding, management cost, etc.”"

column1: Average raw material inventory level,Operational/cost KPI
column2: computed over the simulation horizon to quantify inventory holding
column3: plotted against base-stock levels.,"“The third measure is the average raw material inventory level, an indicator to supply chain cost. It could be calculated by the following formula …”"

column1: Average RM stock level,Same KPI shown in figures to visualise the cost impact of different policies.,“Figure 7: Relationship between Base Stock Level and Average RM Stock Level”
Customer service level,Service KPI affected by inventory policies and delivery performance.,“…may help reduce its inventory carrying cost and improve its customer service level considerably…”
Order-to-delivery lead time,Lead-time metric for raw materials/products
column2: its length drives the need for buffers and affects responsiveness.,“Blade has a much longer order-to-delivery lead time compared to the other two types.”

column1: Target cycle time,Benchmark used to judge whether an order is counted as ‘on-time’
column2: directly linked to on-time delivery rate.,“products delivered within the predefined target cycle time.”

column1: Additional cost for urgent delivery,Cost KPI triggered when late orders have to be expedited via express transportation.,“…additional cost for urgent delivery because of the usage of expensive express transportation.”

Supply chain cost,Aggregate cost dimension to which average inventory level is tied in the SCOR scorecard discussion.,"“The third measure is the average raw material inventory level, an indicator to supply chain cost.”"

Performance Measure,Usage Context (descrição de como é utilizado no texto),Evidence snippet (original entre aspas)

Indicator (genérico),"Usado como termo-guarda-chuva para qualquer observação que represente o comportamento de um fenómeno e para monitorar, analisar ou prever desempenho.",“An indicator is a series of observations … believed to represent the behavior of some specific occurrence [4].”

Composite Indicator / Aggregated Measure,Soma ponderada dos valores de vários indicadores para fins de comparação.,“the results are summed over all indicators to yield an aggregated measure for comparison [8].”

Index Number,"Medidor que expressa o valor de uma entidade (ex.: preço, PIB) relativamente a um período-base igual a 100.",“An index number can be formally defined as a number expressing the value of some entity … related to a base period which is arbitrary set equal to 100 [4].”
Measure,Valor quantitativo básico que pode ser convertido noutros medidores.,“Measure – A quantifying value” (Tabela 1)

Metric,"Coloca uma Measure num contexto (unidade, referência) e serve como medidor de desempenho.",“Metric – A metric puts a measure into a certain context… It defines a unit of measure and a reference unit” (Tabela 1)

Performance Indicator (PI),Indicador auxiliar que reflete parcialmente o desempenho de uma unidade organizacional.,“PI – A performance indicator is an auxiliary metric that partially reflects the performance of an organizational unit” (Tabela 1)

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Conjunto de indicadores críticos previamente acordados para acompanhar se a organização está ‘on-track’.,“Key performance indicators (KPIs) provide the most important performance information that enables organizations … to understand whether the organization is on track or not [9].”

Key Result Indicator (KRI),Indica como a organização se saiu em determinado fator crítico de sucesso.,“key result indicators (KRIs) tell you how you have done in a perspective or critical success factor
Result Indicator (RI),Mostra o que foi realizado.,“result indicators (RIs) tell you what you have done
Performance Indicator (PI – tipo de Parementer),Indica o que deve ser feito (ação) para melhorar desempenho.,"“performance indicators (PIs) tell you what to do,”  "
Performance Attribute PA 1.1 (Process performance),Mede se o processo atinge seu propósito – nível de capacidade 1.,“1 – Performed process (performance attribute (PA) 1.1 process performance)
Performance Attribute PA 2.1 (Performance management),Avalia gestão de desempenho como parte do nível de capacidade 2.,“2 – Managed process (PA 2.1 performance management …)
Performance Attribute PA 2.2 (Work product management),Verifica gestão dos produtos de trabalho – nível de capacidade 2.,“2 – Managed process … PA 2.2 work product management)
Performance Attribute PA 3.1 (Process definition),Avalia definição formal do processo – nível de capacidade 3.,“3 – Established process (PA 3.1 process definition …)
Performance Attribute PA 3.2 (Process deployment),Mede implementação/implantação do processo – nível 3.,“3 – Established process … PA 3.2 process deployment)
Performance Attribute PA 4.1 (Process management),Avalia gestão quantitativa/preditiva do processo – nível 4.,“4 – Predictable process (PA 4.1 process management …)
Performance Attribute PA 4.2 (Process control),Mede controlo de processo – nível 4.,“4 – Predictable process … PA 4.2 process control)
Performance Attribute PA 5.1 (Process innovation),Avalia inovação do processo – nível 5.,“5 – Optimizing process (PA 5.1 process innovation …)
Performance Attribute PA 5.2 (Process optimization),Mede otimização contínua do processo – nível 5.,“5 – Optimizing process … PA 5.2 process optimization).”

Capability Level 0-5 (COBIT Process Capability),Níveis utilizados como métrica para qualificar a capacidade do processo.,“There are six levels of capability that a process can achieve… 0 – Incomplete process
column2: 1 – Performed process … 5 – Optimizing process.”

Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence excerpt from the paper

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Priority subset of metrics that set performance expectations and are actively managed to trace results from strategy through operations and IT.,"“These priority metrics are called Key Performance Indicators… While every KPI is a metric, not all metrics are KPIs.”"

Agility Indicators,Part of the metric set that helps gauge the organisation’s ability to adapt and respond quickly.,"“Metrics are key performance, agility and risk indicators, service levels and industry measures that provide guidance on what to measure in an organization to ensure that business goals and objectives are being met…”"

Risk Indicators,Measure exposure and help manage organisational risk alongside other performance measures.,"“Metrics are key performance, agility and risk indicators, service levels and industry measures…”"

Service Levels (SLAs),Used as measurable targets for the quality and reliability of services delivered by IT and operations.,"“Metrics are key performance, agility and risk indicators, service levels and industry measures…”"

Industry Measures,External or standardised measures that allow performance comparison within an industry.,"“Metrics are key performance, agility and risk indicators, service levels and industry measures…”"
Benchmarks / Benchmarking Data,Reference values gathered from many enterprises
column2: enable comparison and target-setting when applying metrics.,"“The IBM Benchmark Program leverages APQC’s Open Standards Benchmarking Collaborative (OSBC) that has data from over 18,000 organization entities worldwide…”"

column1: Resource Costs,Cost metric used to assess financial impact of transformation initiatives when models are augmented with cost factors.,"“Costing: The ability to persist and augment models with cost factors, such as resource costs… so that the financial impact of identified transformation and innovation initiatives can be assessed.”"

System / Component Service Costs,"Specific cost metric for IT services and components, used alongside resource costs to evaluate initiatives.","“Costing: The ability to persist and augment models with cost factors, such as resource costs, and system/component service costs, so that the financial impact of identified transformation and innovation initiatives can be assessed.”"

column1: Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Indicador geral de desempenho

column1: Contribution index,"Medida (escala 1-3) da contribuição de um KPI para outro KPI de nível igual ou superior, utilizada na macro-análise.","“The contribution index, which is a measure of the contribution of a specific KPI to another or higher level KPI, is determined in the KPI model.”"

Influence index,"Medida (escala 1-3) da influência de um processo (ou sub-processo) sobre um KPI, usada para selecionar processos críticos.","“The influence index, which is a measure of the influence of a business process on a specific KPI is determined in the K-P model.”"

Performance Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (exact fragment from the paper)
Quality of Service (QoS),"General measure of service quality
column2: basis for prediction and adaptation decisions, especially to avoid SLA violations and to choose adaptation mechanisms across layers.","“The identification of adaptation needs is based on quality of service prediction, which uses assumptions on the characteristics of the running execution context.”"

column1: Service Level Agreement (SLA) violation rate,Indicator of whether agreed service levels are met
column2: prevention of violations drives cross-layer monitoring and adaptation.,“The novelty of the approach is the exploitation of all SBS layers for the prevention of Service Level Agreement (SLA) violations.”

column1: Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Concrete measurable attribute linked to process quality
column2: analysed to decide adaptation strategies that improve negatively affected metrics.,"“The work in [14] analyzes the dependencies of key performance indicators (KPIs) on process quality factors from different functional levels of a SBS, and then an adaptation strategy is decided to improve all the negatively affected quality metrics in the SBS.”"

column1: Key Goal Indicator (KGI),High-level goal-oriented metric included in SLA contracts to monitor goal satisfaction across layers.,"“The proposed SLA contract model includes parameters of KPI, key goal indicators (KGI) and IT infrastructure type.”"
Response time,Most common cross-layer metric
column2: monitored/predicted from user to infrastructure to support adaptation.,“The use of response time as a common metric from monitoring and prediction techniques is one example that clarifies the need for more sophisticated cross-layer techniques also able to consider network aspects.”

column1: Network latency,Component of response time
column2: must be monitored both inside provider infrastructures and across the Internet.,"“the response time would include: processing time and network latency inside each service provider and service integration infrastructures, and network latency (e.g., within the Internet) among service provider, service integrator, and end user.”"

column1: Processing time,Server-side component of response time
column2: considered in end-to-end QoS prediction.,“the response time would include: processing time and network latency inside each service provider and service integration infrastructures…”

column1: Availability,Runtime evidence used in assurance arguments
column2: monitored to maintain system resilience.,"“…other sources of evidence that play a key role in maintaining resilience throughout the system’s execution (e.g., service availability) are only available through direct monitoring of the system at runtime.”"

column1: Reliability,"Quality attribute whose improvement (e.g., choosing more reliable services) guides user-driven adaptation and is analysed together with network data.",“…it can also be used to better understand the reliability of such systems.”
End-to-end QoS,"Aggregate quality perceived by the end user
column2: predicted using combined service, infrastructure and network data.",“In the case of predicting the end-to-end QoS of a service-oriented system (considering the end user perspective)…”

column1: Rosemann et al. 2011 - BISE – Call for Papers Issue 5 - 2012 - Business Process Management.pdf
medidor_de_performance,como_eh_usado_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto
Operational efficiency,Apontado como alvo de melhoria e portanto métrica de desempenho dos processos,“ongoing pressure to improve operational efficiency”
Predictability,Indicada como resultado mensurável desejado do BPM para o comportamento organizacional,“interest in making organizational behavior more predictable”
Risk awareness,Mencionada como atributo a ser elevado e consequentemente indicador de desempenho,“interest in making organizational behavior more … risk-aware”
BPM maturity level,Usado como avaliação-padrão para aferir a capacidade de gestão de processos,“process standards such as widely accepted BPM maturity assessments”
Process performance measurement,Citado explicitamente como área dedicada à medição e análise do desempenho de processos,“Process performance measurement and analytics”
Value of BPM initiatives,Reconhecido como critério para avaliar o sucesso de iniciativas de BPM,"“Value, successes and failures of BPM initiatives”"
Success rate of BPM initiatives,Empregado para aferir a efetividade dos projetos de BPM,“successes … of BPM initiatives”
Failure rate of BPM initiatives,Utilizado para identificar deficiências dos projetos de BPM,“failures of BPM initiatives”
Adoption rate of BPM,Considerado questão de pesquisa para mensurar quão amplamente o BPM é implantado,"“address the adoption, use … of BPM approaches”"
Usage level of BPM,Visto como outra medida de penetração e intensidade de uso do BPM,Idem à citação acima
BPM maturity management,Apresentado como tópico que implica acompanhamento contínuo do nível de maturidade,“BPM maturity management”
Process innovation,Nominado como tema que pode ser avaliado em termos de grau de inovação alcançada,“Process innovation”
Cuzzocrea et al. 2018 - A Predictive Learning Framework for Monitoring Aggregated Performance Indicators over Business Process Events.pdf
Medidor,Uso no texto,Evidência textual

PPI (Process Performance Indicator),Indicador genérico para avaliar medidas de performance e suas restrições em processos de negócio.,“A Process Performance Indicator (PPI) … is a special form of KPI that is meant to support the evaluation of performance measures and associated constraints … over a business process’ executions.”
S-PPI (single-instance PPI),PPI aplicado ao nível de uma única instância do processo
column2: usado para verificar a conformidade de cada instância individual.,“PPIs can be of two kinds … single-instance PPI (S-PPI) … defined at the levels of single process instances.”

column1: A-PPI (aggregate PPI),PPI aplicado a conjuntos de instâncias (“windows”) para avaliar desempenho agregado.,"“PPIs can be of two kinds … aggregate PPI (A-PPI) … defined at the levels … of process instances’ sets, respectively.”"

µI,"Métrica de instância única que devolve um valor de desempenho (p.ex., duração, custo).",“A p-instance metric for P is a function µI: IP→R≥0 that maps any p-instance ι of P to a performance value.”

σI,Índice de violação associado a µI que mede quanto o valor de desempenho se afasta do requisito.,“A violation index for a p-instance metric µI is a function σI:R≥0→R that expresses how much a performance value deviates from some predefined performance requirements.”
ϕ (genérico),"S-PPI definido como par ϕ=⟨µI,σI⟩.","“A single-instance process performance indicator (S-PPI) … is a pair ϕ=⟨µI,σI⟩.”"

µA,Métrica agregada que combina os resultados obtidos por ϕ sobre um conjunto de instâncias.,“An aggregate metric over ϕ is a function … µA:2IP→R≥0 that maps any set X of p-instances … to a single numeric performance value.”
σA,Índice de violação associado a µA usado para verificar se o valor agregado infringe o limite.,"“An aggregate PPI … is a pair Φ=⟨µA,σA⟩, … σA:R≥0→R is an associated violation index.”"
Φ (genérico),"A-PPI definido como par Φ=⟨µA,σA⟩
column2: retorna 1 ou −1 consoante haja ou não violação.","“Finally, let us regard an A-PPI as a function mapping any p-instance set X to a number in {−1,1} such that Φ(X)=1 … iff X is positive …”"

column1: µCS_I,Valor de ‘Customer Satisfaction’ atribuído a cada ticket
column2: métrica de instância única.,"“Each p-instance … is eventually assigned a Customer Satisfaction (CS) level, denoted as µCS_I(ι) and representing a sort of performance measurement.”"

column1: σCS≥8,Índice de violação que calcula quanto o CS fica abaixo de 8.,“σCS≥8(x)=8−x for any real performance value x.”
ϕCS≥8,S-PPI que verifica se o nível de CS da instância é >=8.,“… using some suitable S-PPI ϕCS≥8 focusing on the single-instance performance value µCS_I(ι).”
µCSViol#_A,Métrica agregada que conta quantas instâncias violam ϕCS≥8 em um conjunto.,“the aggregate metric that maps any set X … to the number of p-instances of X that are positive w.r.t. ϕCS≥8.”
σCSViol#≤5,Índice de violação para µCSViol#_A que compara o total de violações com o limite 5.,“σCSV iol #≤5_A(x)=x−5 for any aggregate performance value x.”
ΦCSViol#≤5,A-PPI que exige no máximo 5 tickets com CS<8 por semana.,"“Then, we can define ΦCSV iol #≤5 =⟨µCSV iol #_A,σCSV iol #≤5_A⟩.”"

λ,Função alvo (desconhecida) que mapeia cada traço (possivelmente parcial) para o valor de desempenho final da instância.,“The target of such predictive analysis hence is the (unknown) function λ:T →R that virtually assigns a performance value λ(τ)=µI(case(τ)) to any (possibly partial) trace τ.”
Y,"Série temporal alvo que armazena, por slot, os valores de µA
column2: usada para prever desempenho futuro.",“let us denote hereinafter this target time series as Y … storing context-oriented aggregate data for each slot.”

column1: X,Série temporal auxiliar contendo dados de contexto agregados por slot
column2: usada como preditor para Y.,“… another (possibly multidimensional) auxiliary time series X can be computed that stores context-oriented aggregate data for each slot … exploited to better predict future values of the target one Y.”

column1: ω,Medida de agregação de eventos (workload) que mapeia um conjunto de eventos para um valor numérico resumido.,“An event aggregation measure … is a function ω:2E→R≥0 that maps any subset s of E to a numeric value ω(s).”

Ctx,"Medida de agregação multidimensional ⟨ω1,…,ωv⟩ que produz vetores de valores resumidos por slot.","“… a ‘multidimensional’ event aggregation measure Ctx(·)=⟨ω1(·),…,ωv(·)⟩ can be defined to map each slot s to the tuple Ctx(s)=⟨ω1(s),…,ωv(s)⟩ of numerical aggregate values.”"
Pertsas and Constantopoulos 2017 - Scholarly Ontology - modelling scholarly practices.pdf
Metric,Usage in Text,Evidence in Text

Effectiveness,"Citada como uma das dimensões de avaliação usadas para medir o desempenho de bibliotecas digitais, servindo como indicador de performance em processos de pesquisa.","“…with key aspects modelled as evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence …”"

Performance measurement,"Mencionada explicitamente como dimensão (e, portanto, medidor) usada na avaliação de desempenho de bibliotecas digitais.","“…with key aspects modelled as evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence …”"

Service quality,Apresentada como dimensão de avaliação que mede a qualidade do serviço prestado por bibliotecas digitais – derivada que também funciona como indicador de performance.,"“…with key aspects modelled as evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence …”"

Outcomes assessment,"Indicador utilizado para medir os resultados (outcomes) de sistemas ou processos, citado como parte do conjunto de dimensões de avaliação de performance.","“…with key aspects modelled as evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence …”"

Technical excellence,"Listada como dimensão de avaliação enfocando a excelência técnica de sistemas, servindo como métrica de performance.","“…with key aspects modelled as evaluation dimensions comprising, effectiveness, performance measurement, service quality, outcomes assessment and technical excellence …”"
Koetter and Kochanowski 2013 - A model-driven approach for event-based business process monitoring.pdf
Medidor,Tipo,Uso/descrição,Evidência no texto
RequestID,Parâmetro (ID),"Identifica unicamente cada instância do processo
column2: usado para correlacionar medições dos diferentes pontos de medição (MP1, MP2, MP3, MP4, …).","""First, the support request is opened and the request is given a RequestID , a parameter of type ID, measured in a measuring point called MP1."""

column1: timestamp,Parâmetro (Timestamp),Marca o instante de tempo de cada medição
column2: obrigatoriamente presente em todos os measuring-points.,"""Additionally MP1 containsthe registered timestamp of the measurement, indicated by the reservedword timestamp."" "

column1: Resolved,Parâmetro (Boolean),Indica se o pedido de suporte foi resolvido em determinado nível.,"""In the first level support process, the parameter Resolved marks if the request has been resolved at this stage."" "
TotalCost,Parâmetro (Double),Custo acumulado até o ponto de medição
column2: usado para calcular custo do 2º nível.,"""The total cost TotalCost of the process is also available at MP2."" "

column1: Level,Parâmetro (Enumeration),Indica o nível (1º ou 2º) em que o chamado foi resolvido
column2: usado na derivação de Resolved_Level.,"""monitoring when and at what level the support request was resolved."" "

column1: Duration_secondlevel,KPI,Duração do 2º nível de suporte
column2: calculada como MP3.timestamp – MP2.timestamp para cada instância.,"""the duration of the second level is measured as Duration_secondlevel. This is derived from MP3.timestamp - MP2.timestamp"" "

column1: Cost_second_level,KPI / KPI agregado,Custo do 2º nível
column2: calculado como MP5.TotalCost – MP2.TotalCost
column3: posteriormente agregado (AVG) em janela de 100 instâncias.,"""calculating the cost of the process at the end, subtracting the cost of the first level support (MP5.TotalCost - MP2.TotalCost)"" "

column1: Resolved_Level,KPI,"Indica em que nível o chamado foi resolvido (1, 2 ou Other)
column2: derivado de Level e Resolved.","""CASE WHEN (MP4.Level=""1"") THEN ""1"" WHEN (MP4.Resolved) THEN ""2"" ELSE ""Other"" END AS Resolved_Level"" "

column1: Duration_average,KPI agregado,Média da duração total do processo sobre janela de 100 instâncias
column2: calculada via AVG(MP4.timestamp – MP1.timestamp).,"""SELECT (AVG(MP4___timestamp - MP1___timestamp))/3600000 AS Duration_average FROM ‘OUTUseCase‘.win:length(100)"" "

column1: Duration_below_5_days,Meta de tempo (Timing Goal),Objetivo de que cada chamado seja fechado em até 5 dias
column2: gera alerta caso o limite seja ultrapassado ou o evento de fechamento não ocorra.,"""timing goal called Duration_below_5_days in order to ensure that all support requests are closed within this timespan."" "

column1: Duration_average_below_2_days,Meta (Goal sobre KPI agregado),Objetivo de que a média de duração seja < 2 dias
column2: avaliado sobre o KPI agregado Duration_average.,"""there is a goal for the averageduration Duration_averagetobe below2days Duration_average_below_2_days."" "

column1: OUTDuration_below_5_daysAlerts,Alerta (evento derivado),Evento gerado quando Duration_below_5_days é violado.,"""INSERT INTO ‘OUTDuration_below_5_daysAlerts‘ … timer:interval(5 day) …"""
Kauffman et al. 2018 - A metrics suite of cloud computing adoption readiness.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence in the text (trecho extraído)

Economic Value Added (EVA),"Exemplo de métrica financeira tradicional usada para avaliar criação de valor e risco em decisões de investimento, inspirando a ideia de uma ‘suite de métricas’.",“various metrics such as Stern Stewart’s economic value added (EVA)… help senior managers to evaluate financial risk and make better investment decisions.”
Value at Risk (VaR),Métrica‐síntese para risco financeiro que ilustra como diferentes áreas de gestão usam suites de métricas
column2: serve de analogia para necessidade de métricas na adoção de cloud.,“various metrics such as… RiskMetrics’ value-at-risk (VaR) help senior managers to evaluate financial risk and make better investment decisions.”

column1: Balanced Scorecard,Suite de métricas multidimensionais que combina medidas financeiras e não-financeiras
column2: citada como inspiração para a construção de uma suite para cloud readiness.,“The Harvard Business School’s ‘Balanced Scorecard’ … is the most successful metrics suite in performance management.”

column1: Weighted Methods per Class,Dimensão de produtividade/qualidade em engenharia de software
column2: mostra como suites de métricas podem capturar aspectos complexos de desempenho.,"“Chidamber and Kemerer (1994) proposed a six-dimension model, including weighted methods per class…”"

column1: Depth of Inheritance Tree,Idem acima – métrica de design OO.,"“…including weighted methods per class, depth of inheritance tree…”"
Number of Children,Idem acima – métrica de design OO.,"“…depth of inheritance tree, number of children…”"
Coupling Between Object Classes,Idem acima – métrica de design OO.,"“…number of children, coupling between object classes…”"
Response for a Class,Idem acima – métrica de design OO.,"“…coupling between object classes, response for a class…”"
Lack of Cohesion in Methods,Idem acima – métrica de design OO.,"“…response for a class, and lack of cohesion in methods.”"
Service Measurement Index (SMI),"Exemplo de framework externo que define indicadores de qualidade de serviço em cloud
column2: fornece base teórica para métricas de segurança, disponibilidade e escalabilidade.",Referência “CSMIC 2012” ao descrever três medidas críticas de qualidade.

column1: Security,"Mede riscos de confidencialidade, integridade e falhas
column2: parte da sub-categoria ‘Expected Service Quality’.","“The indicators of security risks include contractual loopholes, confidentiality, information security, and service outages.”"

column1: Availability,% de tempo de serviço acessível
column2: usada para avaliar risco de indisponibilidade na adoção.,"“Clients expect high availability, based on the percentage of time they can access the services (Garg et al. 2013).”"

column1: Scalability,Capacidade de crescer ou reduzir recursos conforme demanda
column2: indicador chave de qualidade percebida.,“And scalability measures clients’ needs for services that scale to the organization’s demand for them (Venters and Whitley 2012).”

column1: Network Access,Verifica latência/largura de banda indispensável para cloud
column2: parte de ‘Perceived Compatibility’.,“Cloud computing requires high-quality network access … and minimal latency (Vouk 2008).”

column1: Virtualization Preparedness,"Avalia experiência prévia da empresa com virtualização, reduzindo custos/risco na migração.",“Experience with virtualization will also reduce the expected costs and uncertainties associated with cloud migration (Jamshidi et al. 2013).”

Executive Support,"Indica comprometimento da alta gestão, factor crítico para readiness organizacional.",“Executive support is critical for creating a supportive climate… for cloud adoption (Low et al. 2011).”
Organizational Innovativeness,Mede disposição da empresa para adotar inovações tecnológicas.,“Organizational innovativeness affects a firm’s intention to adopt new ITs (Barczak et al. 2007).”
Perceived Strategic Value,Avalia se a gestão enxerga vantagem competitiva no cloud
column2: influencia decisão.,“perceptions of strategic value and competitive advantage matter too (Hsu et al. 2014).”

column1: Absorptive Capacity for the Cloud,Capacidade de adquirir e aplicar conhecimento externo
column2: influencia aptidão para adoção.,“We assessed… organizational absorptive capacity (Liao et al. 2003).”

column1: Vendor Management Capacity,Mede habilidade de governança contratual e relacional com provedores.,“…vendor management capacity … contractual and relational governance (Poppo and Zenger 2002).”

Vendor Service Terms,"Examina flexibilidade de preços (usage-based, subscription) e condições contratuais.","“Vendor’s service terms: … whether the vendor will offer flexibility (usage-based fees, subscription fees, and hybrid pricing).”"
Estimated Cost-Benefit,Comparação esperada entre custos totais (explícitos e ocultos) e benefícios
column2: base para ROI.,“cost-benefit estimation in cloud computing is likely to be complicated… hidden costs for IT interoperability need be considered.”

column1: Experience with Cloud Contracts,"Histórico da empresa em negociar cláusulas (p.ex., saída antecipada) reduz risco.","“…organization’s experience with cloud contracts, especially how to achieve contract flexibility…”"

Ability to Leverage Cloud Market Maturity,Avalia se mercado tem padrões e transparência suficientes para reduzir incerteza.,"“standards, transparency, and reliability for vendor performance are basic market stabilizers (Hauff et al. 2014
Stability of Available Market Supply,Mede quantidade de fornecedores alternativos
column2: reduz risco de lock-in.,“A healthy cloud market will have a sufficient number of alternative services and vendors (ISACA 2012).”

column1: Vendor Financial Stability Assessment,Cheque de solvência e escala do provedor para mitigar risco de continuidade.,"“vendor stability, scale, and reputation are critical for estimating the risk involved in adoption (Pauley 2010).”"

Vendor Technical Capacity Assessment,"Avalia maturidade de processos, histórico de falhas, capacidade técnica do provedor.","“related factors are process maturity, security breaches and outage news.”"

Technology Uncertainty,Risco ligado a mudanças rápidas de padrões e soluções tecnológicas.,"“…technology uncertainty, pressure from competitors and pressures in alliances all seem to be issues that create risk…”"
Pressure from Competitors,Força institucional/competitiva que pode acelerar (ou inibir) adoção.,“pressure from competitors … create uncertainties for whether firm is adoption-ready…”
Pressure from Alliances,Dependência de parceiros na cadeia de valor para adoção conjunta.,“…require co-adoption of new cloud computing practices.”

Regulatory Considerations for the Firm,"Conjunto de restrições legais (privacidade, soberania de dados) que afetam decisão.",“…laws requiring cloud providers to keep client data and copyrighted material within national boundaries (Armbrust et al. 2010).”
Return on Investment (ROI),Indicador financeiro usado para medir ganhos pós-adoção
column2: citado no caso JetBlue.,"“After the implementation… JetBlue reported a 140 % ROI, with 8 months to pay-back of its investment.”"

column1: Lauras et al. 2011 - A business process oriented method to design supply chain performance measurement systems.pdf
Performance_Indicator,Usage_in_Text,Evidence_Snippet
Service,Customer-oriented KPI used to measure how well the chain satisfies demand,"“Three categories of KPI are proposed … customers (service, flexibility, effectiveness-swiftness)”"
Flexibility,Customer KPI that evaluates the chain’s ability to adapt to changes,"“customers (service, flexibility, effectiveness-swiftness)”"
Effectiveness-Swiftness,Customer KPI that captures rapid and accurate response capability,"“customers (service, flexibility, effectiveness-swiftness)”"
Costs,Internal-process KPI to monitor expenditure of operations,“internal processes (costs and efficiencies)”
Efficiencies,Internal KPI that gauges the ratio outputs / inputs in processes,“internal processes (costs and efficiencies)”
Profitability,Share-holder KPI to check economic returns,"“shareholders (profitability, return on investments)”"
Return on Investments,Share-holder KPI that links gain to invested capital,"“shareholders (profitability, return on investments)”"
Cost of the Activity,Result indicator that tracks absolute manufacturing cost,Figure 9 list: “Cost of the activity”
Relative Cost Deviation,Ambition POV indicator comparing real cost vs. target,Figure 9 list: “Relative cost deviation”
Productivity,Reality POV indicator (units/day) showing output rate,Figure 9 list: “Productivity” and text “productivity in made units/day”
Subcontracting Rate,Determinant indicator reflecting external capacity usage,Figure 9 list: “Subcontracting rate”
Stock-out Rate,Result & Reality indicator measuring service failures,Figure 9 list: “Stockout rate” and text “stock out rate (measure of the service quality)”
Cp Inventory Rotation,Facility indicator for component stock turns,Figure 9 list: “Cp inventory rotation”
Cp Rotation Deviation,Ambition indicator comparing actual vs. target turn of components,Figure 9 list: “Cp rotation deviation”
Utilisation Rate,Facility indicator showing percentage use of technical resources,Figure 9 list: “Utilization rate”
Temporary Employment,Facility indicator revealing extra human resource needs,Figure 9 list: “Temporary employment”
FP Inventory Rotation,Facility indicator for finished-product stock turns,Figure 9 list: “FP inventory rotation”
FP Rotation Deviation,Ambition indicator – gap on finished-product turns,Figure 9 list: “FP rotation deviation”
Obsolescence Rate,Reality indicator assessing ageing/obsolete stock,Figure 9 list: “Obsolescence rate” and text “obsolete units/total units”
Breakdown Rate,Facility indicator showing machine reliability,Figure 9 list: “Breakdown rate”
Cycle Time,Result indicator capturing total manufacturing lead time,Figure 9 list: “Cycle time”
Cycle Time Deviation,Ambition indicator – gap between planned and real lead time,Figure 9 list: “Cycle time deviation”
Scrap Rate,Reality indicator for waste generated during production,Figure 9 list: “Scrap rate”
Non-Quality Rate,Reality indicator for defects / returns,Figure 9 list: “Non-Quality rate” and text “returned units/total units”

Complete Orders Delivered On Time (OTIF),Reality indicator linking determinants and results for service,Text: “complete orders delivered on time … associated with the determinant ‘adaptability of the resources’”
Returned Units per Total Units,Reality indicator of customer returns / quality failure,Text: “returned units/total units”
Hours Effectively Used per Hours Available,Facility indicator checking adequacy of capacity,Text: “hours effectively used/hours available”
Product Flows (No. Units by Plant),Result indicator for total production volume,Text: “product flows are followed-up both in term of number of units by plant (measure of the total activity)”
Inventory Cover,Ambition indicator (rotation expressed in days of supply),Text: “covers of inventory rotation” (used in ambition POV to compare cost target)

column1: Percentage of Non-Conforming Clients (PCI),NCI / CE x 100 – mede o percentual de clientes insatisfeitos,“Percentage of non-conforming clients (PCI)= NCI / CE x100… NCI is the number of non-conforming clients and CE is the number of clients surveyed” (Tabela 2)

column2: “O3 … 7.03 h/falha → 37.28 h/falha” (Tabela 6)

column3: “increase their OEE … to 75 %” (Seção 2.2)

Total annual recruiting cost,Reference value to motivate improvement potential (≈ 11.6 m €),“…generating and managing about 29 000 applications per year would thus result in 11.6 m € total cost…”

column1: Number of process instances (applications),Driver for total cost

Cycle time (complete process),High-level PIO

column1: Cycle time ‘interview → job offer’ (weeks),Metric analysed with box-plot and logistic regression
column2: target ≤ 2 weeks,“…duration between interviews and job offers… a 1-week delay can … increase the probability … by 16 %.”

column1: Ketykó et al. 2022 - What averages do not tell - predicting real life processes with sequential deep learning.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Damerau-Levenstein distance (DL),Mede a dissimilaridade entre sufixo previsto e real para avaliação da predição de atividades,“To evaluate the performance of suffix prediction … we use Damerau-Levenstein distance (DL).”
DL normalizado,DL é normalizado antes de ser invertido para gerar DLS
column2: pode ser usado como métrica própria,“We normalise it and take the inverse of it to end up with Damerau-Levenstein Similarity (DLS) score.”

column1: Damerau-Levenstein Similarity (DLS),Similaridade (inversa do DL normalizado) usada como principal métrica de qualidade do sufixo,Mesma citação acima + “…and take the inverse … DLS score.”
Average DLS (DLS médio),Média do DLS sobre todos os prefixos/casos para comparar modelos,“Solely reporting the average DLS for suffix prediction seems to be inadequate …”

Absolute Error,Erro absoluto entre tempo restante real e previsto para cada sufixo,“we compute the absolute error between the ground truth remaining time and the predicted remaining time for each predicted and ground truth suffixes.”
Mean Absolute Error (MAE),Média dos erros absolutos para medir precisão da previsão de tempo restante,"“Next, we average these numbers … and report Mean Absolute Error (MAE).”  "
Categorical Cross-Entropy Loss,Função-perda usada no treino para variáveis categóricas (atividades),“Learning for the categorical features is via the categorical cross-entropy loss …”
Squared Error (SE),Função-perda usada no treino para variáveis contínuas (tempos),“Learning for the continuous features is via the squared error …”
Final Loss (soma ponderada),Combina cross-entropy e squared error em uma única perda otimizada,“The final loss is a weighted sum of the individual losses.”

Performance Metric,How it is Used in the Paper,Evidence (exact sentence / fragment from the text)
Total supply-chain cost / Supply-chain cost,Principal objective function and KPI
column2: minimized in the optimization model and reported in simulation output.,“The objective is to minimize the total supply chain cost…”  / “…statistics information on KPIs like supply chain cost…”

column1: Procurement cost,Cost component inside the objective function of the optimization model.,"“…total cost function is composed of procurement cost, transportation cost…”"

Transportation cost,Cost component of the objective function and one of the logistics cost categories analysed.,"“…total cost function is composed of … transportation cost…”  / “…contained the warehousing, transportation costs, shipping related costs …”"
Assembly cost,Cost component inside the objective function.,“…total cost function is composed of … assembly cost…”
Operation cost,Cost component inside the objective function.,“…total cost function is composed of … operation cost…”
Facility fixed cost,Cost component inside the objective function (cost of keeping an existing site open).,“…total cost function is composed of … facility fixed cost …”
Facility investment cost,Cost component inside the objective function (cost of opening a new site).,“…total cost function is composed of … facility investment cost …”
Inventory carrying cost,Cost component inside the objective function
column2: relates to inventory performance.,“…total cost function is composed of … inventory carrying cost …”

column1: Tax,Cost component inside the objective function
column2: affects total cost KPI.,“…total cost function is composed of … and tax.”

column1: Order fill-rate,Key performance indicator reported by the simulation to measure customer-order satisfaction.,"“…statistics information on KPIs like supply chain cost, order fill-rate, stock out rate, etc.”"

Stock-out rate,Key performance indicator reported by the simulation to measure inventory service level failures.,"“…statistics information on KPIs like supply chain cost, order fill-rate, stock out rate, etc.”"

Warehousing cost (part of logistics spending),Illustrative macro-level logistics cost mentioned to underline the importance of SCM performance.,"“…spent $910 billion… on business logistics systems…, which contained the warehousing, transportation costs, shipping related costs …”"
Shipping-related cost,Illustrative logistics cost category framing the motivation for cost performance.,"“…business logistics systems…, which contained … shipping related costs …”"
Logistics administration cost,Illustrative logistics cost category framing the motivation for cost performance.,"“…business logistics systems…, which contained … logistic administration costs.”"
Loos et al. 2011 - Green IT - A Matter of Business and Information Systems Engineering.pdf
metric,how_metric_is_used_in_the_text,evidence_excerpt
CO2 emission / Carbon footprint,Parameter to evaluate whether IT or a business process is environmentally sustainable
column2: reduction target for logistics systems and as KPI in Green BPM,"“As an example, CO2 emission (carbon footprint) is used as a parameter to measure if information technology is applied in a sustainable manner.” | “an example of a new challenge in logistics systems is how information technology can be applied to reduce CO2 emission.” | “Exemplary ecological key performance indicators … include carbon emissions…”"

column1: Energy consumption,"Core variable that has to be reduced
column2: measured globally, per data-centre, per governmental IT
column3: forms basis for %-saving statements",“There is a strong increase of energy consumption caused by information technologies…” | “The energy consumption of ICT itself is – with 17 % annually – rising much faster than that of other industries.” | “commitment … to reduce the energy consumption of governmental IT operations of 40 % by 2013.”

column1: Energy efficiency,Performance ratio that should be increased
column2: used to compare solutions and infrastructures,“The energy efficiency of IT is one of the three challenges of the IT industry.” | “…dynamic adaptive load management can obtain energy savings of 20 % to 40 %.”

column1: Processing power,Denominator in efficiency calculations (share of input energy really used for computing),“Only a small percentage of the energy is transformed into processing power…”
Server / capacity utilisation,Indicator for how much of a server’s capacity is actually used
column2: raising it is linked to large energy savings,“Since the degree of capacity utilization has only a minor influence on energy consumption of servers…” | “It is inefficient to use only about 20 % of the active servers on average.” | “Even a tripling of the average utilisation … could potentially reduce the energy needs of a data centre with the same computing power by 66.6 %.”

column1: Primary-energy efficiency,Percentage of primary energy that finally reaches the IT equipment,“the efficiency of the chain from primary energy via the power plant and the pipeline network to the data center is only about 33 %.”

Cooling / UPS share,Portion of the consumed energy that is spent on infrastructure instead of computing,“50 % of this remaining energy is often used within the data center for the operation of a UPS and air conditioning.”
Energy losses / wasted energy,% of input energy that does not reach processors
column2: used to argue for optimisation,"“More than 90 % are wasted due to losses in energy transmission, conversion, uninterruptible power supply (UPS), and in the infrastructure…”"

column1: Renewable-energy share,"KPI for greener electricity supply, enabled by smart grids and monitored in BPM",“the introduction of the smart grid to increase the share of renewable energy can be mentioned as examples here.” | “…key performance indicators … include … renewable energy consumption.”
Material savings,Explicit sustainability objective alongside energy savings,“The main goals of green IT are energy and material savings…”

Electricity rate,Variable used in cross-data-centre load management decisions,"“…load management … enables the use of environmental conditions varying from region to region or in time, such as climate or electricity rates…”"
Habba et al. 2017 - Towards an operational alignment approach for organizations.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (exact quotation)

Percentage of Business Elements Supported,Used in Aversano et al. [5] to quantify how much of the business model is implemented by the software system.,“five metrics are calculated to measure the percentage of business elements supported by the software systems”

Degree of Adequacy of Automatic Support,Used in Aversano et al. [5] to express how well the implemented software functionalities fit the business needs.,“four others to specify the degree of adequacy offered by the automatic support to the business entities”
Key Performance Indicators (KPI),"Proposed by Sousa & Julio [10] as part of the GPI approach to merge goals, processes and indicators
column2: KPIs act as quantitative measures of performance.","“They propose the GPI (Goals, Process, and Indicators) proposal which aims to merge i*, BPMN, and KPI (Key Performance Indicators).”  "

column1: Service Level Agreements (SLA),Used by Frankova et al. [11] to capture measurable quality constraints for business processes.,“Business Processes with Service Level Agreements (BP&SLA) methodology”
Alignment Degree (AD),Introduced in the authors’ own pattern system to provide an overall numeric indicator of alignment after verification and evaluation.,“Identify the degree of alignment (AD)”

Generic Alignment Metrics,"Mentioned in Doumi et al. [12] to quantify the degree of alignment between goal models, business processes and information systems.","“Then, a set of metrics are proposed to evaluate the degree of alignment.”  "

Unnamed Metrics for Alignment Evaluation,Referred to in the proposed guideline (patterns Evaluation & Amelioration) as the quantitative basis for deciding whether improvement is needed.,“Calculate the metrics to evaluate alignment between M1 and M2”

Throughput,Citado como dado de performance geral a ser consultado no banco

column3: “latency, signal strength, and throughput” (Seção 4)
column4: Tabela 2 – Q2/Q4: “upstream throughput, and downstream throughput”."

column1: Downstream throughput,Derivado de Throughput

column3: Tabela 2 – Q1/Q3/Q4: “v_gateways.latency”.

column1: Signal,Valor de potência de sinal em dB

column1: Noise,Valor de ruído em dB

column2: aparece como métrica de performance.,Fig. 5: lista inclui “transmit rate 58”.
