Signal-strength,Potência de sinal
column2: citada como métrica coletada.,"“...latency, signal strength, and throughput...” (Seção 4)."

column1: Gupta et al. 2024 - Relation between digital innovation and industry 4.0 - existing themes and emerging research trends.pdf
metric,usage_in_text,evidence_excerpt

Automation,Measure of process automation to reduce human effort and raise throughput,"“Industry 4.0 trends towards automation, machine-to-machine communication, and cyber-physical systems to reduce human involvement and increase productivity [80].”"

Integration,Extent to which systems/processes are digitally connected and interoperable,"“These digital technologies equip organizations to progress toward Industry 4.0 by enhancing automation, transparency, integration, traceability, flexibility, safety, and security …”"
Traceability,Capability to track products/materials across the chain,"“…improve parameters such as automation, transparency, integration, traceability, flexibility, safety, and security…” (Abstract)"

Flexibility,Ability to adapt quickly to new or personalised demand,"“Industry 4.0 marks the fourth industrial revolution, distinguished by … control of the product life-cycle to accommodate increasingly personalized customer demands [117].”"
Safety,Level of occupational or process safety attained,"“Predictive analytics foresee and mitigate risks, improving workplace safety.”"
Security,Protection against cyber-threats and data breaches,"“Cloud computing … adaptable to the organization’s needs, addressing the increasing risk of cyber theft and technological change [154].”"

Speed,Process/response speed delivered by digital tools,"“Digitally innovated technologies enhance organizational functions by achieving speed, accuracy, integrity, transparency, accessibility, flexibility, and security.”"
Accuracy,Precision of operations/decisions,"Same sentence as above – ‘achieving speed, accuracy, integrity…’"
Integrity,Data/process integrity maintained,Same sentence as above – ‘achieving … integrity…’
Transparency,Visibility of information for stakeholders,Same sentence as above – ‘achieving … transparency…’
Accessibility,Stakeholder ease-of-access to information/services,Same sentence as above – ‘achieving … accessibility…’
Waste reduction,Amount of material or resource wasted,"“…promoting sustainable development through reduced waste, operational costs, and time …” (Abstract)"
Operational cost,Monetary cost of running operations,Same excerpt – ‘reduced … operational costs …’
Time savings,Reduction in processing or lead time,Same excerpt – ‘reduced … time …’
Resource utilisation,Effectiveness of using physical/financial resources,“…optimum resource utilization.” (Abstract)
Productivity,Output produced per unit input,"“Industry 4.0 … boost​ed productivity, revenue, job creation, and investments.”"
Revenue,Sales or monetary income generated,Same sentence – ‘boosted … revenue …’
Job creation,Number of jobs generated,Same sentence – ‘boosted … job creation …’
Investments,Capital invested in plants/technology,Same sentence – ‘boosted … investments.’
Energy efficiency,Energy consumed per unit output,"“Characteristics include … energy efficiency [55, 106].”"
Overall efficiency,General operational efficiency improvement,"“…enhancing overall efficiency, performance, and productivity.”"
Customer experience,Quality of end-user experience delivered,“Businesses can enhance consumer experiences by creating tailored products and services [1].”
Competitive advantage,Relative market advantage gained,"“Digital innovation helps companies gain a competitive edge … [34, 43, 84, 90, 108, 120, 138].”"
Agility,Organisational responsiveness to change,"Same citation line – ‘ensuring strategic fit, and enhancing agility …’"
Quality,Conformity/performance quality of outputs,"“… boosts manufacturing efficiency and quality [72, 156].”"
Risk mitigation,Ability to foresee and reduce risks,"“Predictive analytics foresee and mitigate risks, improving workplace safety.”"
Real-time availability,Access to live data for decision making,“…real-time monitoring and autonomous control of manufacturing processes.”
Han et al. 2010 - Business activity monitoring system design framework integrated with process-based performance measurement model.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no artigo,Evidência literal do texto
Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Medir quantitativamente o desempenho contra os Critical Success Factors (CSFs)
column2: cascata de metas por toda a organização
column3: comparação do desempenho real com alvo.,"""Define performance measures for each CSF – i.e. key performance indicators (KPI)."" / ""Measure performance against organizational KPIs, and compare to target performance."""

column1: Critical Success Factor (CSF),Fatores limitados que determinam o sucesso organizacional
column2: base para definição de KPIs.,"""Critical success factors (CSF) are ‘the limited number of areas in which results, if they are satisfactory, will ensure successful competitive performance for the organization’[7]."""

column1: Process measure,Monitorar as atividades do processo e motivar as pessoas dentro do processo.,"""Process measures ‘monitor the activities of a process and motivate people within a process’[8]."""

Output measure,"Relatar resultados do processo, muitas vezes para a gerência, e controlar recursos.","""Output measures ‘report the results of a process, often to management, and are used to control resources’[8]."""

Input measure,Avaliar as entradas recebidas de fornecedores (internos ou externos) para um processo.,"""It is suggested that process performance measures should include measures of inputs, process and outputs."""
Meta/Target,Nível de desempenho desejado previamente estabelecido para cada medida
column2: serve de referência para comparação e ações de melhoria.,"""A target can be defined as the predetermined desired level of performance against each measure."" / ""Set targets for each KPI."""

column1: Balanced Scorecard,Estrutura para medir desempenho em múltiplas dimensões semelhantes às medidas organizacionais.,"""…using some kind of balanced scorecard approach…"""

Leading Indicator,Fornecer sinalização antecipada sobre desempenho futuro e explicar resultados nos KPIs organizacionais.,"""provide leading indicators and explain performance against organizational KPIs."""

Non-financial performance measure,"Medir desempenho (em todos os níveis) sem usar indicadores financeiros, com foco em melhoria contínua.","""Total quality-based performance measurement can be defined as the measurement of non-financial performance at all levels within the organization…"""
Financial performance (externo),Resultado decorrente do desempenho nos KPIs não-financeiros
column2: usado apenas para reporte externo.,"""It should be noted that financial performance for external reporting purposes is seen as a result of performance against non-financial KPIs…"""

column1: Budgetary process,"Único indicador financeiro desdobrado pela organização
column2: atua como restrição, não como medida de melhoria.","""The only aspect of financial performance which is cascaded throughout the organization is the budgetary process, which acts as a constraint rather than a performance improvement measure…"""

column1: Quality costing / Cost of quality,Técnica de break-point assessment interna para identificar custos associados à qualidade e motivar melhorias.,"""Techniques identified … include
column2: quality costing…"""

column1: Activity-Based Costing (ABC),Técnica de avaliação interna/externa que mede custos das atividades
column2: usada para identificar oportunidades de melhoria.,"""Techniques identified … include
column3: … activity-based costing (ABC)…"""

column1: Self-assessment (Baldrige/EQA),Avaliação interna comparando práticas da organização com critérios de excelência
column2: identifica lacunas de desempenho.,"""Techniques identified … include
column3: … self-assessment (against Baldrige or European Quality Award criteria)…"""

column1: Internal benchmarking,Comparar desempenho entre unidades/processos internos para detectar melhores práticas.,"""Techniques identified … include
column2: … internal benchmarking…"""

column1: Competitive/External benchmarking,Comparar desempenho com concorrentes ou organizações líderes para estabelecer metas mais agressivas.,"""Techniques identified … include
column2: … benchmarking (internal or external)…"" / """"competitive benchmarking"""""

column1: Customer satisfaction survey,Medir a percepção do cliente para identificar lacunas entre requisitos e desempenho entregado.,"""Techniques identified … include
column2: … customer satisfaction surveys…"""

column1: Quality Function Deployment (QFD),Traduzir requisitos dos clientes em metas de performance e especificações de processo/produto.,"""Techniques identified … include
column2: … quality function deployment (QFD)…"""

column1: Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) como técnica de avaliação,Revisão radical de processos com base em medições que indicam performance insuficiente.,"""Techniques identified … include
column2: … business process re-engineering…"""

column1: Process capability analysis,Avaliar a capacidade do processo atender especificações
column2: técnica de break-point para identificar necessidade de melhoria.,"""…internal break-point assessment techniques more widely than non-TQ organizations, particularly quality costing, self-assessment, business process re-engineering, and process capability analysis."""

column1: Performance appraisal,Avaliar formalmente o desempenho individual em um período finito usando medidas definidas.,"""Performance appraisal is ‘the process by which organizations establish measures and evaluate individual employees’ behaviour and accomplishments for a finite period of time’[10]."""

Performance management,Gerenciar continuamente indivíduos/equipes usando feedback de medidas para maximizar desempenho.,"""performance management is ‘a systematic, data-oriented approach to managing people at work that relies on positive reinforcement as the major way to maximize performance’[9]."""

Personal performance measure,"Indicadores específicos para avaliar esforço, realização e desenvolvimento de cada colaborador.","""Translate process goals and action plans and personal training and development requirements into personal performance measures."""
Process capability (como medida),Comparar capacidade do processo com requisitos do cliente
column2: base para definição de metas e ações.,"""At the end of each year compare process capability to customer requirements against all measures…"""

column1: reconhecimento e recompensa,Consequências financeiras ou não-financeiras concedidas por desempenho superior medido.,"""Reward and recognition are the financial and non-financial consequences given as a result of superior performance[6]."""
Hasan et al. 2020 - Current landscape and influence of big data on finance.pdf
medidor_de_performance,como é usado no texto,evidência_no_texto
Predição de retorno de mercado,Utilizado para antecipar o desempenho futuro dos preços dos ativos,“big data … influences financial markets through return predictions”
Previsão de volatilidade,Empregada para estimar a variabilidade futura dos preços e riscos,“volatility forecasts”
Valuation de mercado,Serve para avaliar o valor/consolidação de ativos ou empresas,“market valuations”
Volume excessivo de negociação,Monitorado como sinal de movimentos anômalos e líquidez,“excess trading volumes”
Análise de risco,Indicador-chave para medir e controlar incerteza financeira,"“risk analyses”, “Big data are becoming more important for risk analysis”  "
Gestão de portfólio,Usada para acompanhar e otimizar a performance de carteiras,“portfolio management”
Desempenho de índices,Empregado para comparar resultados com benchmarks,“index performance”
Co-movimentação de mercados,Medida para captar correlações e inter-influências entre bolsas,“co-movement”
Precificação de opções,Indicador de valor justo e risco de derivativos,“option pricing”
Volatilidade idiossincrática,Mede risco específico de cada ativo,“idiosyncratic volatility”
Trading algorítmico,Métrica de eficiência/executação automática de ordens,“algorithmic trading”
Custo de capital,Usado para avaliar a atratividade de investimentos e impacto do big data,"“More data processing lowers uncertainty, which reduces risk premia and the cost of capital”  "
Incerteza sobre retornos,Medida de risco que diminui com uso de big data,“reduce uncertainty about investment outcomes”

Risco de crédito,Empregado por bancos/FinTechs para classificar mutuários,"“helps to reduce the risks for financial companies in predicting a client’s loan repayment ability”, “credit risk prediction”  "
Detecção de fraude,Indicador de ocorrências como lavagem de dinheiro/cartões,"“detecting fraud… money laundering, credit card fraud”  "
Risco sistêmico,Mede inter-relações entre instituições e estabilidade do sistema,“systemic risk modelling as one of the most important areas of financial risk management”
Retorno anormal de ações,Usado para captar ganhos ou perdas fora do padrão,“abnormal stock returns”
Volume anormal de negociações,Indicador de atividade incomum ligada a informação,“trading volume to become abnormally high”
Índice de sentimento,Derivado de textos/redes para antecipar movimentos de mercado,"“creating new finance sentiment indexes from social networks”, “Twitter mood predicts the stock market”  "
Lucro & Prejuízo (P&L),Métrica central de desempenho operacional/financeiro,“fueling the finance industry toward digitalization … bolster profit and loss”
Receita,Indicador de crescimento e impacto comercial,“influencing by increasing revenue”
Satisfação do cliente,Mede qualidade e aceitação dos serviços,“increasing … customer satisfaction”
Crescimento da empresa,Usado para avaliar expansão e escala,“making investments more attractive… enabling large firms to grow larger”
Desempenho financeiro geral,Resumo de resultados econômicos analisados com big data,“analyze financial performance”
Arigliano et al. 2008 - Business metrics discovery by business rules.pdf
Nome do Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Contagem de Violações,Usada como critério simples de medição de performance
column2: cada instância que viola um requisito é contabilizada para avaliar a conformidade do processo.,"“A typical method adopted in order to implement conformance indicators is to identify a set of requirements and verify which executed instances of the process violate it… Pointing out violations, we obtain a measure of the process performance…”"

column1: Conformidade ao Modelo de Processo,Indica se a execução do processo segue o fluxo prescrito no modelo (design).,“…in the first case we evaluate if the execution conforms to the design…”

Conformidade às Diretivas Externas,"Indica se a execução do processo respeita objetivos, normas ou regulações fora do modelo.",“…in the second case we evaluate if the execution conforms to a constraint not contained in the BP model.”
Conformidade a Diretivas Alethic,Mede a existência de qualquer violação de necessidades que não podem ser infringidas
column2: deve ser sempre zero.,"“Alethic directives are used to model necessities that cannot be violated, even in principle.”"

column1: Conformidade a Diretivas Deontic,"Conta e relata violações de obrigações que ‘devem’ ser obedecidas, mas podem ser infringidas.","“Deontic directives are used to model obligations … which ought to be obeyed, but may be violated in real world scenarios.”"

Indicador de Limite Absoluto,Verifica se a ocorrência de um evento é exatamente igual ao valor fixado pela diretiva.,“A directive expressing an absolute threshold prescribes the exact occurrence of a given event.”

Indicador de Limite Relativo,"Compara a frequência de um evento com outra referência (porcentagem, razão, etc.) definida na diretiva.",“…a directive expressing a relative threshold prescribe that the occurrence of a given event must be in a relation (i.e. a percentage) with another event.”
Função de Cardinalidade f(...),Função derivada das cardinalidades dos fatos de execução
column2: seu resultado é comparado a limites para gerar o indicador de performance.,"“In particular, we generate a constraint function f of the cardinalities of the facts generated by the process flow to be used as an indicator of the process performance.”"

Change Scrutinizing Time,quantifies the time spent analysing each change request for a service,“…performance measures … identified with respect to change scrutinizing time …” (Implementation section)

Business Logic Origination Time,measures how long the system takes to locate and load the original business-logic artefacts that will be changed,“…identified with respect to … business logic origination time …” (Implementation section)

Business Logic Generation Time,measures the time required to regenerate the updated business-logic artefacts after analysis,“…identified with respect to … business logic generation time …” (Implementation section)
Change Implementation Time,measures the time used to commit the approved modifications and rebuild the service,“…identified with respect to … change implementation time.” (Implementation section)

Total Redeployment Time (sum of the four previous times),used to evaluate how fast a service can be redeployed after changes,““Also the total time is calculated for analyzing the time taken to redeploy the services after changes are done at business logic level.” (Implementation section)”

Order of Execution Measure,verifies that the workflow sequence in the business logic remains consistent after changes,“The order of execution ensures the work flow of the business logic along with the consistent updating of the logic sequence with respect to the changes.” (Change-Analyzer description)

Time Complexity Measure,estimates the computational complexity impact of a proposed change,“The Time complexity measure is used to predict the approximate complexity nature of the changes.” (Change-Analyzer description)

Schema Validation Measure,checks that schema-level modifications keep the logic consistent and understandable to business users,“Schema validation supports the changes at the schema level by providing the code abstraction to the business parties…” (Change-Analyzer description)

Mapping Function Measure,validates that business-policy constraints and rule/function reducibility are preserved after a change,“The mapping function ensures the policy constraints associated with the logic and also capable of mapping reducibility factors between the rules and functions within the business set.” (Change-Analyzer description)

Similarity Measure,compares new or modified constructs with the original ones to detect functional divergence,“The Similarity measure evaluates the changes with respect to the source construct with functionality.” (Change-Analyzer description)

Execution-Order Change Measure d(R)… (formula),quantitative indicator (derived) used to compute the impact of inserting/deleting/modifying rules in the execution order,"Table ‘Evaluation Metrics for Change Factors’, row ‘Execution Order’, column ‘Change Measure’: “d(R)[(1/U + (1/F) – (c/n))]”  "

Schema-Difference Measure (Sce – Sc …),quantitative indicator (derived) of how much a rule’s schema differs after a change,"Table ‘Evaluation Metrics for Change Factors’, row ‘Schema’, column ‘Change Measure’: “= Sce ± Sc …”  "

IT Performance Measurement (ITPM),"Instrumento geral de medição que fornece representação abrangente do desempenho de TI, acompanha a implementação da estratégia de TI, realização de projetos, uso de recursos, desempenho de processos e da própria TI","“Using ratios and ratio systems, IT Performance Measurement aims at providing a comprehensive representation of a company’s IT… it tracks and monitors the implementation of the IT strategy, the realization of projects, the use of resources, the process performance and IT performance”"

Ratios (Kennzahlen),Valores quantitativos básicos utilizados dentro do ITPM para expressar desempenho,"“Using ratios and ratio systems, IT Performance Measurement aims at providing a comprehensive representation of a company’s IT”"
Ratio Systems,"Conjunto estruturado de vários ratios que, em conjunto, medem o desempenho da TI",idem

IT Balanced Scorecard (IT-BSC),"Sistema de medição de desempenho derivado do Balanced Scorecard, citado como modelo de maturidade e instrumento de avaliação de performance de TI",“the IT Balanced Scorecard Maturity Model (Van Grembergen and Saull 2001)”

Cost-Benefit Analysis,Critério-chave dentro do ITPM3 para avaliar economicamente as iniciativas de medição de desempenho,“Further criteria are based on the maturity attributes … single criteria like cost-benefit analysis have been adapted from other maturity models”
Process Performance,Indicador do desempenho dos processos de TI considerado dentro da medição e nos modelos de maturidade,“tracks and monitors… the process performance and IT performance”
IT Performance,Resultado global de desempenho da função TI medido pelos modelos e relatórios mencionados,mesma citação acima

Costs (Cost Data),Dados de custo internos coletados por sistemas BI para compor as métricas de desempenho,“BI systems can collect internal cost and performance data… and support the IT management by supplying this information”
Efficiency (Economic Efficiency),Mede quão economicamente a TI opera
column2: aparece como objetivo de melhoria e como critério de avaliação,“The main goal here is to continually improve IT performance with regard to its economic efficiency.”

column1: Effectiveness,Avalia se os objetivos da TI são atingidos
column2: aparece na definição do processo analítico do ITPM3,“transform fragmented … data into action-oriented information about the efficiency and effectiveness of the company’s information infrastructure”

column1: Value of IT,Indicador de quanto a TI agrega de valor ao negócio
column2: considerado na medição de desempenho,“particular attention is here also given to the performance and value of IT”

Performance indicators (indicadores de performance),"Usados para monitorar continuamente o desempenho do sistema, servindo de gatilho para adaptações autônomas e para sinalizar ‘break-downs’ ao gerente do agente.",“The performance of the system is monitored under a perpetual testing strategy … in the form of performance indicators.”  /  “a breakdown signal is reported to the manager through the agent’s performance indicators.”

Performance (propriedade não-funcional),É citada como uma das qualidades que podem/Devem ser otimizadas pelo sistema auto-adaptativo.,"“… adapt themselves, particularly on non-functional properties such as performance, fault-tolerance and security.”  "
Fault-tolerance,Mesma função que ‘performance’: é monitorada/otimizada como critério de qualidade do sistema.,"“… non-functional properties such as performance, fault-tolerance and security.”  "
Security,Mesma função que ‘performance’: métrica/qualidade alvo de adaptações.,"“… non-functional properties such as performance, fault-tolerance and security.”  "
Stability,Outra propriedade de qualidade a ser otimizada pelo sistema.,"“… optimized in terms of non-functional properties such as performance, security and stability.”  "
Algedonic signal (sinal algedônico),Sinal de alarme quantitativo/qualitativo gerado por componentes quando o desempenho cai abaixo de certos limiares

metric,usage_in_text,evidence

Patient wait times,Identified as one of the two “key performance measures” for hospital care processes and continuously monitored to detect bottlenecks,Patient wait times and care service times are key performance measures for care processes in hospitals.
Care service times,Second of the two cited key performance indicators
column2: durations of active care activities are measured and compared with targets,Patient wait times and care service times are key performance measures for care processes in hospitals.

column1: Duration of each care-process state,All states (wait or service) are time-stamped so that their individual durations can be compared with targets and summed for overall performance,A key objective of the monitoring application is to measure the durations of these low level process states and identify where bottlenecks are occurring.
Door-to-balloon time (overall duration from triage to procedure completion),Used as the principal end-to-end performance metric for ACS patients
column2: hospital goal is to keep it under 90 minutes,A key performance measure for the hospital is the overall duration of the process from triage until procedure completion. This duration is usually referred to as the time from door-to-balloon.

column1: Target duration for each state,Hospital sets expected (target) times for every step
column2: real-time system compares actual against these targets,The hospital has target duration times for each step in the process from when the patient enters the emergency room to when the procedure is performed until when the patient is discharged.

column1: Sokolowski et al. 2022 - Change is the only constant - dynamic updates for workflows.pdf
metric,how it is used / definition,evidence excerpt from text

Updatability,"Overall time window in which the update condition is met (i.e., period when a component could safely be updated). Used as a primary performance indicator in the evaluation (Table 5 and Fig. 5) and for calculating percentage improvements (e.g., “8.0 % higher updatability”).","“Updatability is the overall time in which the update condition is met at the components (i.e., when updating is safe).” (Sec 7.2)"

Update time,Total elapsed time from the instant an update is triggered until the component update completes. Split into ‘update timeliness’ and ‘update duration’. Reported in Table 5 and discussed when comparing approaches (“21.2 % less update time”).,“The update time measures the time-span from triggering to completing a component update. It is split into the update timeliness … and the update duration …” (Sec 7.2)

Update timeliness,First part of update time: time from the update request until the safe-update condition is reached. Appears in Table 5/Fig. 5 and in the discussion of reaching strategies (“Waiting heavily delays updates”).,“… update timeliness (until the update condition is met) …” (Sec 7.2)

Update duration,Second part of update time: time from reaching the safe-update condition until the new component version is fully deployed. Reported in Table 5/Fig. 5.,“… update duration (after the update condition is met).” (Sec 7.2)
Workflow duration,Elapsed time of a workflow instance from its start to its completion. Used to study the influence of DSU on business-process length
column2: shown in Table 5/Fig. 5.,“The workflow duration is the time-span between workflow instance start and completion.” (Sec 7.2)

column1: Workflow delay,Difference between the start time of a workflow instance and the baseline (no-update) start time
column2: measures how much an instance is postponed by DSU. Column ‘Delay’ in Table 5.,“The workflow delay is the difference of the workflow instances’ start to its start in the baseline.” (Sec 7.2)

column1: Workflow interruption,"End-to-end impact of DSU on a workflow instance: sum of start delay and any execution slow-down (duration diff.). Used to compare approaches (e.g., “47.8 % less workflow interruption”).","“… the workflow interruption is the difference of the instances’ completion times, measured by the sum of the instances’ delay and duration differences.” (Sec 7.2)"

Interruption,Generic metric (not confined to workflows) denoting how long running transactions are blocked by an update. Defined conceptually in Sec 4.3 to compare reaching strategies.,“Interruption is how long a workflow instance’s completion is delayed due to the update.” (Sec 4.3)

Timeliness,Generic metric for the time it takes to start an update after it is requested. Defined in Sec 4.3 and used when analysing reaching strategies.,“Timeliness is the length of the interval between requesting the update and the beginning of the component exchange…” (Sec 4.3)
Performance overhead / impact,"Qualitative/relative metric capturing additional cost (time, resources) introduced by DSU
column2: used throughout to justify the need for Essential Safety (“significant overhead”, “reduces the delay … by 47.8 %”).","e.g., “Unfortunately, existing safe DSU approaches introduce significant performance overhead.” (Abstract)
column3: “Essential Safety reduces the delay of workflow completions, on average, by 47.8 % compared to the state of the art.” (Abstract)"

column1: Deadlocked workflow instances (%),Share of workflow instances that cannot finish because reaching strategy causes a deadlock
column2: reported to highlight safety/performance problems of Tranquility+Blocking Tasks.,"“… the only simulation with deadlocked workflow instances (47.2 %), preventing their completion.” (Sec 7.2)"

column1: Safe-update intervals,Count/percentage of time intervals during which a component can be updated safely
column2: visualised in Table 1 and Fig. 4 to compare theoretical guarantees of the approaches.,“Essential Safety provides the highest number of safe update intervals.” (Sec 6.4)

column1: Share of non-essential changes,Proportion of updates that do not change component semantics
column2: varied (0 %–100 %) to study ES performance sensitivity (Fig. 6) and measured in monorepos (“at least 60 % and often more than 90 %”).,“…90 % of the updates are non-essential changes.” (Sec 7.1)
column3: “at least 60 % and often more than 90 % of the component updates are non-essential changes.” (Sec 7.4)

medidor,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto

Purchase Frequency (PF),"Usado como um Brand Performance Measure (BPM) para indicar o número médio de compras de um produto/ marca dentro de um período e, portanto, inferir lealdade comportamental.","“The PF is defined as the number of times a shopper made a purchase of a brand/product within a specified period, and it is often expressed as an average purchasing rate across all those who have bought the brand at least once within the specified period (Uncles et al., 2010).”"

Share of Category Requirements (SCR),"BPM que mostra a participação da marca no total de compras feitas pelos próprios compradores da marca, sendo indicador de lealdade.","“The SCR represents the market share of a brand among all the consumers who purchased the brand at least once during a specific period (Jung et al., 2010).”"
Repeat Purchase Rate (r),BPM que mede a probabilidade de o consumidor repetir a compra da mesma alternativa depois de uma compra anterior
column2: derivado de MS e w.,"“r is defined as ‘the probability of choosing alternative i conditional on a previous purchase of the same alternative i’ (Jarvis et al., 2007a, p. 495).”  e  “Equation (3) states that the r … is function of the MS and the w…”"

column1: Market Share (MS),"Usado como variável de desempenho e também insumo para calcular r
column2: fortemente correlacionado com PF, SCR e r.","“Models have been developed for the relationships between the BPM, finding that products or brands with higher market share (MS) tend also to have a higher PF, a higher SCR and a higher r (Goodhardt et al., 1984…).”"

column1: Polarization Index (w),Índice desenvolvido para medir lealdade de forma independente do MS e avaliado como medida mais válida para analisar mudanças de lealdade ao longo do tempo.,"“In order to resolve this issue, researchers developed an index able to provide a measure of loyalty independent of the MS: the polarization index (w) (Sabavala and Morrison, 1977
column2: Rungie, 2000).”"

column1: Category Polarization Index (wc) / DMD value,Valor-referência (benchmark) da polarização para toda a categoria obtido a partir da Dirichlet Multinomial Distribution
column2: serve de comparação para os w marginais.,“the benchmark value – also called category polarization index (wc) or DMD value – needs to be calculated.”

column1: Marginal Polarization Index (w) / BBD value,Valores de w calculados marginalmente (para cada marca ou nível de atributo) via Beta Binomial Distribution
column2: permitem identificar excesso ou déficit de lealdade em relação ao wc.,“it is possible to identify as many w values – also called in literature marginal w or BBD values – as the number of brands (or levels of the attribute) in a category.”

column1: Han et al. 2009 - Two-stage process analysis using the process-based performance measurement framework and business process simulation.pdf
Performance Metric,Usage in the text,Evidence from the article

internal process lead-time,Strategic-level KPI (SLK) that is analysed for its contribution to another SLK (‘productivity’).,"“For example, ‘internal process lead-time’ SLK contributes to ‘productivity’ SLK by normal scale (2).”  "

productivity,Strategic-level KPI that receives contributions from other SLKs and is the focus of macro analysis.,“‘internal process lead-time’ SLK contributes to ‘productivity’ SLK by normal scale (2).”

output quantity,Tactical-level KPI (TLK) that is strongly influenced by the ‘Production’ process and is used to trace which process should be improved.,"“For example, ‘Production’ process has a major influence on ‘output quantity’ TLK.”  "
building lead-time,Operational-level KPI (OLK) that contributes to the TLK ‘output quantity’
column2: used to locate the critical sub-process needing improvement.,“the major contributing OLK to the ‘output quantity’ TLK is the ‘building lead-time’ OLK in the KPI model”

column1: cost,Strategic-level KPI that is chosen as a target to be reduced in the case study.,“we addressed the problem of which sub-process we have to improve for reducing the ‘cost’ SLK.”

inventory cost,Tactical-level KPI that makes a major contribution to the SLK ‘cost’ and guides the choice of process to analyse.,"“Firstly, the ‘inventory cost’ is identified as a major contributing TLK to the ‘cost’ SLK.”  "

throughput time(s),General performance metric evaluated during micro process analysis and simulation.,"“... focuses on evaluating the ability to meet performance requirements with respect to throughput times, service levels, and resource utilizations, etc.”  "

service level(s),Performance metric considered in micro process analysis to judge the redesigned process.,"“... evaluating the ability to meet performance requirements with respect to throughput times, service levels, and resource utilizations, etc.”  "

resource utilization(s),Performance metric measured during simulation to assess efficiency of resources in the redesigned process.,"“... evaluating the ability to meet performance requirements with respect to throughput times, service levels, and resource utilizations, etc.”  "

processing time,Simulation parameter (and potential performance measure) prepared for each activity when building the micro-level model.,"“Next, simulation parameters such as processing time and other experimental data for each activity of the business process are prepared...”  "
average throughput time,Concrete simulation result used to judge the redesigned ‘placing purchase order’ sub-process.,“The average throughput time for each POR from various departments is 46.4 h.”
average resource utilization,Concrete simulation result showing efficiency of the labour pool in the redesigned process.,“The average resource utilization of the labor pool is 88%.”

contribution index,Derived measure used to quantify how much one KPI contributes to another within the KPI model.,"“To define the relationships between SLKs and TLKs and those between TLKs and OLKs, the contribution index is introduced.”  "

influence index,Derived measure that quantifies how strongly a process or sub-process affects a KPI in the K–P model.,"“To show the degree of alignment between KPI and business processes, the influence index, which is a measure of the influence of a business process on a specific KPI, is determined in the K–P model.”"
Delgado-Santos et al. 2022 - A Survey of Privacy Vulnerabilities of Mobile Device Sensors.pdf
Métrica,Como é usada no texto,Evidência extraída do texto

Accuracy,Avaliar a taxa de acertos de classificadores ou sistemas antes/depois da aplicação de métodos de privacidade ou na extração de atributos sensíveis.,"“They achieved an accuracy of 80% using…”, “…achieving an accuracy of 97% with a Convolutional Neural Network”, “F1-score SA before = 72.58% (accuracy report)”"
Equal Error Rate (EER),Usada para medir simultaneamente Falsos Aceites e Falsas Rejeições em sistemas biométricos
column2: comparada antes/depois da sanitização.,"“EER before ≈ 1 %  EER after ≈ 28 %” (Osia et al.), “EER SA after = 20 %”"

column1: Area Under the ROC Curve (AUROC),"Avalia a capacidade discriminatória de classificadores
column2: utilizada para saúde, emoção e privacidade.","“achieving an AUROC of 0.88 on this problem”, “mean AUROC of 81 %”"

column1: F1-score,Métrica harmônica entre precisão e revocação para avaliar desempenho de classificação antes/depois de proteção.,“F1-score SA before = 72.58 %   F1-score SA after = 52.99 %”
Kullback-Leibler Score/Distance,Usada para comparar trajetórias estimadas vs. reais em rastreamento de localização.,“obtaining a Kullback-Leibler distance of 0.00057 in the case of a taxi journey”
False Acceptance Rate (FAR),Taxa de falsos aceites
column2: empregada em biometria para expressar risco residual após sanitização.,“0.45 % probability of success @ FAR = 10 %”

column1: Probability of Success @ FAR,Probabilidade de invasão com uma dada FAR
column2: quantifica efetividade da proteção de templates.,“0.45 % probability of success @ FAR = 10 %” (Sadhya & Singh)

column1: Task Assignment Success Rate (TASR),Medidor de sucesso em crowdsensing protegido por differential privacy.,“TASR ≈ 80 %” (Yang et al.)
Hiding Failure (HF),Percentual de padrões sensíveis ainda visíveis após sanitização.,“HF = 0/3 attribute disclosure”
COCR (Correct Overall Classification Rate),Taxa global de acerto de um classificador
column2: monitorada antes/depois de remover variáveis sensíveis.,“COCR before = 94.7 %   COCR after = 64.7 %”

column1: Confidence Interval Width,Métrica conceitual para quantificar privacidade via amplitude dos intervalos de confiança (maior = mais privacidade).,“The confidence interval width indicates the amount of privacy…”
Chan and Reich 2007 - IT Alignment - An Annotated Bibliography.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência extraída do texto

Alignment Index (AI),"índice que compara, de forma percentual, o quanto as atividades de SI suportam os objetivos de negócio","“Alignment Index (AI) – … assign a percentage value based on a scale of 1 to 100 that represents the subjective evaluation of how well aligned each activity is with the business objective it supposedly serves.” (Day, 1996)"

Effectiveness Acid Test (EAT),"teste que compara a proporção dos gastos de SI com a proporção de atividade gerada, para avaliar eficiência/eficácia do SI","“Effectiveness Acid Test (EAT) – A direct comparison between the proportion of IS expenditures devoted to specific P&L line activities and the volume of each activity expressed as a percentage of sales.” (Day, 1996)"

Revenue per employee,indicador de desempenho financeiro usado para verificar o efeito moderador do alinhamento entre investimento em TI e desempenho da firma,"“Strategic alignment … created additional positive effects on revenue per employee above and beyond the use of IT investment…” (Byrd, Lewis & Bryan, 2006)"

Profits,utilizado para mostrar que o alinhamento potencializa o ganho financeiro sem aumento de investimento em TI,"“…firms with poor alignment can increase profits … by better aligning business and IT strategies.” (Byrd, Lewis & Bryan, 2006)"

Revenues,"idem ao anterior, associado a lucros no estudo sobre influência do alinhamento","“…firms with poor alignment can increase profits and revenues without investing more in IT…” (Byrd, Lewis & Bryan, 2006)"
Profitability,métrica-chave no varejo para avaliar adoção de tecnologia Quick Response (QR),"“…significant positive associations between QR use and profitability…” (Palmer & Markus, 2000)"
Net profitability,indicador financeiro listado como medida para avaliar retorno do alinhamento TI-negócio,"“…financial measurements of alignment impact… include … net profitability…” (Papp, 1999)"
Return on Assets (ROA),usado para testar impacto de TI e estratégia competitiva no desempenho financeiro,"“…IT has direct effects on ROA.” (Floyd & Wooldridge, 1990)"
Sales growth,métrica de crescimento de vendas ligada à adoção de QR e a avaliação de desempenho,"“…profitability, sales growth, sales per employee…” (Palmer & Markus, 2000)"
Comparable store sales,indicador de desempenho operacional em varejo avaliado no estudo sobre QR,"“…positive associations between QR use and … comparable store sales…” (Palmer & Markus, 2000)"
Sales per square foot,usado como métrica de produtividade de loja no estudo QR,"“…QR use and … sales per square foot…” (Palmer & Markus, 2000)"
Sales per employee,produtividade de força de trabalho
column2: testada mas não correlacionada no estudo QR,"“…but not sales per employee.” (Palmer & Markus, 2000)"

column1: Stock returns,métrica de mercado incluída na cesta de indicadores de desempenho em varejo,"“…sales per square foot and stock returns.” (Palmer & Markus, 2000)"
Stock turns,indicador de rotação de estoque correlacionado positivamente ao uso de QR,"“…positive associations between QR use and … stock turns…” (Palmer & Markus, 2000)"
Liquidity,listada como métrica financeira para relacionar alinhamento a desempenho,"“…financial measurements … include … liquidity…” (Papp, 1999)"
Income,"idem, incluída como variável de resultado financeiro","“…include … income…” (Papp, 1999)"
Earnings,métrica financeira na bateria de indicadores de Papp (1999),"“…include … earning…” (Papp, 1999)"
Growth,usado como indicador global de desempenho organizacional ligado a alinhamento,"“…measurements … include … growth…” (Papp, 1999)"
Debt-to-equity ratio,indicador de estrutura de capital usado para avaliar impacto do alinhamento,"“…include … debt-to-equity.” (Papp, 1999)"
Quality of information product,medida de resultado de TI associada a performance financeira,"“The quality of the information product is clearly linked to financial performance.” (Chan, 2001)"
IS effectiveness,métrica de sucesso de sistemas de informação relacionada ao grau de alinhamento,"“IS strategic alignment is consistently related to perceived IS effectiveness…” (Chan & Huff, 1993)"

Perceived IT success,variável dependente no estudo de Sabherwal & Kirs para testar alinhamento CSF–capacidade de TI,"“…alignment … was positively associated with both perceived IT success and organizational performance.” (Sabherwal & Kirs, 1994)"
Business performance,resultado organizacional geral associado positivamente ao alinhamento estratégico,"“…alignment was linked to IS effectiveness and business performance.” (Chan et al., 1997)"

Organizational performance,"utilizada em vários estudos (e.g., Raymond et al.) para medir efeito do uso de TI/alinhamento","“IT usage is positively related to organizational performance…” (Raymond, Paré & Bergeron, 1995)"
Company innovation,"indicador não-financeiro de desempenho, ligado à performance de SI e alinhamento","“…strong link … between IS performance and company innovation…” (Chan, 2001)"
Company reputation,outro indicador não-financeiro associado à performance de SI e alinhamento,"“…strong link … between IS performance and … company reputation.” (Chan, 2001)"

Financial performance,termo-guarda-chuva para os resultados monetários examinados em diversos estudos,"“…alignment was positively related to innovation, financial performance, and market growth…” (Chan & Huff, 1993)"

Christiaanse et al. 2015 - Reliability of electronic evidence - an application for model-based auditing.pdf
Performance Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (literal excerpt)
Sufficiency (quantity of audit evidence),Defines how much evidence the auditor needs
column2: linked to sampling in substantive testing.,"""Sufficiency refers to the quantity of audit evidence. This is used in the context of substantive testing, where auditors typically take samples to represent the behaviour of an entire population.""  "

column1: Appropriateness (quality of audit evidence),Overall quality indicator
column2: split into relevance and reliability.,"""Appropriateness refers to the quality of audit evidence. It involves both relevance and reliability.""  "

column1: Materiality (error-size threshold),Limit above which a misstatement is judged important.,"""A misstatement or error is called material, when it would affect any auditor’s judgement. In practice, materiality is often interpreted as a threshold on the size of an error, to affect judgement.""  "

Confidence level (in sampling),Input for calculating required sample size.,"""…the minimally required size of a sample, given the size of the population, the required confidence level or detection risk…""  "
Detection risk,Together with confidence level determines sample size.,same excerpt as above
Minimum required sample size,"Result of formulas that balance population size, confidence level, detection risk and materiality.",same excerpt as above
Monetary Unit Sampling,Specific sampling technique
column2: population made of individual monetary units.,"""Well-known methods are random sampling and monetary unit sampling, where the population is made up of the individual Euros or Dollars involved in the items to be tested.""  "

column1: Accuracy,Component of reliability (statements correspond to reality).,"""Reliability breaks down into accuracy or correctness …""  "
Completeness,Component of reliability (all relevant facts recorded).,same sentence as above
Timeliness,Often mentioned sub-metric of reliability.,"""Many also mention timeliness…""  "
Quantity of goods sold,Variable in audit equation
column2: cross-verified with inventory outflow.,"""…revenues = quantity of goods sold * price of goods, where price is fixed. Quantity of goods sold can be derived from the outflow from inventory…""  "

column1: Price of goods,Factor in revenue equation.,same excerpt as above
Revenues,Outcome of audit equation
column2: checked against independent sources.,same excerpt as above

column1: Inventory movement / Outflow,Independent indicator used to test reported revenues.,same excerpt as above
Value jump,Net monetary increase produced by one tour in a value net.,"""…the value jump is 180$ for 20 pairs.""  "
Occupied vehicle kilometres,Planned capacity indicator for each route.,"""…this gives the number of occupied vehicle kilometres (Dutch: beladen kilometers).""  "
Occupied vehicle hours,Planned billing unit and driver of revenue.,"""For each route, this gives the occupied vehicle hours (Dutch: beladen uren), priced at a certain tariff…""  "
Revenue per route,Contractual billing measure (price × occupied vehicle hours).,"""revenue per route = price * occupied vehicle hours.""  "
Number of pupils per route,Part of derived revenue model in factored tour.,"""…number of pupils planned on that route…""  "
Planned route duration per pupil,Standard benchmark (≈10 minutes) used in capacity calculations.,"""…converts into 600 pupil seconds, i.e. 10 minutes.""  "

Actual route duration / actual occupied minutes,"Observed performance, compared with plan and invoice.","Table 1 column “actual” and narrative: ""The transport provider now claims… the actual trip duration per pupil is longer than the 10 minutes planned.""  "
Invoiced occupied minutes,Baseline from which differences are measured.,Table 1 column “invoiced”

Difference (actual – invoiced minutes or hours),Key derived performance gap on which surcharge claim is based.,"Table 1 column “act–inv” and text: ""…transport provider has reason to overstate the difference (+)…""  "
Percent difference,Relative size of difference
column2: supports materiality discussion.,Table 1 column “% diff”

column1: Capacity utilisation factor,Composite unit linking planned transport seconds to pupils.,"""…with a capacity utilization factor of 6, converts into 600 pupil seconds…""  "
Capacity utilisation degree,Seats filled ÷ vehicle capacity
column2: indicates operational efficiency.,"""Taxi-buses have on average a maximum capacity of 8, so in this example the capacity utilization degree is 75%.\""

column1: T-test significance,Statistical test to decide if morning/afternoon differences are meaningful.""","""For the morning routes the zero-hypothesis could be rejected: the differences are significant. For the afternoon the differences are not significant.""  "
Extra hours attributable to congestion,Target metric for possible surcharge
column2: requires tracing actual vs planned times.,"""…parties could not get reasonable assurance whether the differences are due to traffic congestion… the number of extra hours attributable to congestion."""

column1: Miers 2006 - Best Practice (BPM) - In business process management, finding the right tool suite is just the beginning.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência textual

Baseline metrics (métricas de referência),São coletadas no início do ciclo para que a equipe possa comprovar ganhos de desempenho após a implementação do processo.,“It is important to gather reference metrics to ensure that the team can later prove the performance improvements.”
KPIs – Key Performance Indicators,Conjunto central de medidas que o BPMS captura e disponibiliza a gestores
column2: base para análises de eficiência e eficácia do processo.,"“The BPM suite should capture all the necessary information, often referred to as KPIs (key performance indicators).”  "

column1: Cycle time (tempo de ciclo),Usado para avaliar rapidez do processo e alvo de redução em iniciativas de melhoria contínua.,Pulte Mortgage: “managers could monitor the number of hours it took to push a case through to the point of offer.” / “…information on cycle time…”
Average activity duration (duração média das atividades),Entrada típica de simulação para descobrir gargalos e prever desempenho futuro.,“Simulation … predict average activity durations…”
Queue length (tamanho de fila),Outra saída de simulação para estimar acúmulo de trabalho e necessidade de recursos.,"“…predict average activity durations, queue lengths, resource utilization…”  "
Resource utilization (utilização de recursos),Mede grau de uso de pessoas/máquinas
column2: ajuda a balancear capacidade x demanda.,"“…predict … resource utilization, etc.”  "

column1: SLA / Milestone adherence,"Sistema alerta usuários e gestores quando itens correm risco de ultrapassar marcos ou SLAs, permitindo intervenção.",“…bringing to their attention items of work that are in danger of exceeding any milestone or SLA (service-level agreement) established.”
Percentual de casos no “happy path”,Indicador de complexidade do processo
column2: mostra quanto trabalho segue o fluxo principal versus exceções.,“identify the percentage of work that follows the ‘happy path’ of the process versus the percentage spent on exceptions…”

column1: Frequência de exceções,Usado para priorizar quais exceções automatizar primeiro
column2: combinado com impacto e detectabilidade.,"“Look at each [exception] in terms of its impact, its frequency, and whether it is detectable today.”  "

column1: Impacto/Gravidade da exceção,Complementa frequência para ponderar importância de tratar cada exceção.,Mesma citação acima: “… assess each one in terms of its impact…”
Detectabilidade da exceção,Avalia se o sistema atual consegue identificar a exceção
column2: influencia priorização.,Mesma citação acima: “…and whether it is detectable today.”

column1: Número de horas até oferta (caso Pulte),Métrica de serviço ao cliente usada para acionar alavancas de negócio (ex.: alterar limiar de crédito).,“managers could monitor the number of hours it took to push a case through to the point of offer.”
Taxa/limiar de credit-scoring automático,Alavanca de controle que afeta risco x tempo de resposta
column2: ajustada conforme métrica anterior.,"“…lowering the credit-scoring threshold (where the system automatically accepts mortgage applications)… As they reduced cycle time, the financial risk would rise.”  "

column1: Relação taxas de juro × volume de pedidos,Variável de contexto usada em simulações ‘what-if’ para avaliar impacto na capacidade do processo.,"“if interest rates fell, leading to an increase in mortgage applications, what would the impact be on the ability of the company to provide the same level of customer service?”  "

Produtividade da equipe / “keeping score”,"Dashboards mostram ao time quanto trabalho precisa ser concluído em determinados prazos, servindo como marcador de produtividade.",“teams … want to ‘keep score’ of their own productivity.”
Lopez et al. 2023 - Autonomous VOs management based on industry 4.0 - a systematic literature review.pdf
metric,usage_in_text,evidence

Critical Success Factors (KSF),dimension used to evaluate partner performance within collaborative business networks,"“…identifying indicators to measure the performance of partners in a collaborative business network, such as critical success factors (KSF)…”"

Key Performance Factors (KPF),dimension used to evaluate partner performance within collaborative business networks,"“…identifying indicators to measure the performance of partners in a collaborative business network, such as … key performance factors (KPF)… ”"

Key Performance Indicators (KPI),quantitative indicators for monitoring partners or sustainability goals in VOs,“…identifying indicators to measure the performance of partners… key performance indicators (KPI).”  /  “Goals are set using KPIs measured using specific assessment techniques…”

Life Cycle Assessment (LCA),environmental-impact metric applied to evaluate sustainability of Product-Service Systems in VOs,"“…KPIs measured using specific assessment techniques (i.e., Life Cycle Assessment LCA…)”"
Life Cycle Cost Assessment (LCCA),economic-impact metric for sustainability evaluation,"“…specific assessment techniques (i.e., … Life Cycle Cost Assessment LCCA …)”"
Social Life Cycle Assessment (SLCA),social-impact metric for sustainability evaluation,"“…specific assessment techniques (i.e., … SLCA Social Life Cycle Assessment) …”"

Sustainability Assessment (SA),aggregated indicator obtained after normalising LCA/LCCA/SLCA results to analyse/optimise sustainability,“Sustainability Assessment (SA) unique allows the analysis and optimization of sustainability within the VO.”
Confidence Value,numerical value entered into TrustSEv to gauge trustworthiness of a partner/VO,“…TrustSEv system… entering confidence values … evaluate the sustainable trust value…”
Confidence Level,categorical/graded level derived from confidence value in TrustSEv,“…entering confidence values and confidence level…”
Sustainable Trust Value,computed metric representing trust sustainability over time,“…evaluate the sustainable trust value and trust level…”
Trust Level,qualitative level associated with sustainable trust value,“…evaluate the sustainable trust value and trust level …”

Loops,property of configuration life-cycle exploited during partner negotiation/performance analysis,"“Candidate partners negotiate and exploit the model’s relevant properties: loops, performance peaks, lifetime, utilization, start marks, and dead marks …”"

Performance Peaks,performance-related property considered during negotiation and evaluation of collaboration configuration,“Candidate partners negotiate and exploit the model’s relevant properties: … performance peaks …”
Lifetime,temporal metric of a configuration/VO instance used in partner negotiation and monitoring,“Candidate partners negotiate and exploit the model’s relevant properties: … lifetime …”
Utilization,resource-use metric analysed in configuration life-cycle,“Candidate partners negotiate and exploit the model’s relevant properties: … utilization …”
Start Marks,process metric used to analyse configuration life-cycle behaviour,“Candidate partners negotiate and exploit the model’s relevant properties: … start marks …”
Dead Marks,process metric indicating blocking states in configuration life-cycle,“Candidate partners negotiate and exploit the model’s relevant properties: … dead marks …”

Partner Score,aggregated score calculated by a tool for faster partner evaluation and selection,“A calculation tool is proposed for a faster member evaluation based on the criteria and score obtained.”

Longevidade do projeto,Indicador para avaliar a maturidade do projeto OSS,"""...tais como: o número de usuários, a longevidade do projeto, a documentação, etc.""  "

Brady 2001 - Analysis of manufacturing systems - computer simulation analysis of electricity rationing effects on steel mill rolling operations.pdf
Performance Measure,Usage/Role in the Text,Evidence from the Paper
Reheat furnace utilization,Key indicator of how well the collaborative loading strategy is working
column2: a ‘key factor’ in determining rolling-mill performance and explicitly named as the performance measure for that dimension.,“Reheat furnace utilization is the performance measure used to describe effectiveness along this dimension.”

column1: Tons produced per hour,Primary metric for overall rolling-mill operating performance
column2: used to evaluate the impact of electricity-rationing policies.,“Rolling mill operating performance is measured in terms of tons produced per hour.”

column1: Average tons per hour produced,Operational measurement tracked during the simulation runs
column2: basis for comparing alternative policy parameter settings.,“The operational measurement will be the average tons per hour produced by the rolling mill.”

column1: Tons-per-hour productivity rate,Objective the model tries to maximise when choosing collaboration-policy parameters.,“The selection of parameter values will be based upon a strategy of maximizing the tons per hour productivity rate.”

Current HSM productivity (% of target),"Decision trigger in the furnace-loading logic (e.g., ‘greater than 70 % of target’ vs. ‘less than 70 % of target’ determines whether slabs are loaded).",Table 2 rows: “Current HSM productivity greater than 70% of Target” / “Current HSM productivity less than 70% of Target”
Target rolling-mill productivity rate,Reference point against which actual productivity is compared
column2: one of the four key policy parameters.,"“The parameters to be determined by the model include a target rolling mill productivity rate, acceptable deviations from the target rate in positive and negative directions …”  "

column1: Acceptable positive deviation from target productivity,Upper tolerance band used in the collaboration policy to decide when electricity constraints can be accommodated without harming production.,Same sentence as above about “acceptable deviations … in positive … directions.”
Acceptable negative deviation from target productivity,Lower tolerance band used in the collaboration policy
column2: determines when policy may be relaxed to protect production.,Same sentence as above about “acceptable deviations … in … negative directions.”

column1: Production degradation,Outcome metric the utility must offset economically if collaboration reduces output
column2: highlights need to balance lost production with compensation.,"“For a collaborative electricity usage policy to be effective, any production degradation must be balanced with some type of economic adjustment from the utility.”"

column1: SSC – verificação,Sub-métrica derivada que confirma se outro profissional revisou o checklist.,“several quality indicators can be coupled to the process — like verification (Has the list been checked by somebody else?)…”

column1: Correct bills of materials,KPI logístico que verifica a exatidão dos materiais registrados/cobrados em cada cirurgia.,“…correct bills of materials…”
Correct preoperative screening,Indica se todo o rastreio pré-operatório foi realizado corretamente

column1: Direct cost of surgery,Mede custo direto associado ao ato cirúrgico

column1: Indirect cost of surgery,Custo indireto (overhead) atribuído à cirurgia

column1: Process cost per step,Custo associado a cada etapa do processo

column1: Waiting time before surgery,KPI de fluxo que mede tempo de espera do paciente até a cirurgia

column1: Duration of surgery (geral),Tempo total do procedimento
column2: indicador chave para uso de recursos e benchmarking.,“…process-oriented KPIs such as … duration of surgery…”

column1: Employee satisfaction,"Indicador qualitativo sugerido como importante, mas de coleta automatizada ainda difícil.","“…perception-based measurement of performance, like satisfaction (e.g. employee satisfaction…) were considered… important to include in a dashboard.”  "
Patient satisfaction,"Mede percepção do paciente sobre o cuidado
column2: relevância reconhecida, porém coleta automática é desafio.","“…satisfaction (e.g. employee satisfaction, patient satisfaction…)”  "

column1: PROMs (Patient Reported Outcome Measures),Resultados clínicos relatados pelo paciente

Stierle et al. 2021 - A technique for determining relevance scores of process activities using graph-based neural networks.pdf
Performance_Measure,Como_é_usado,Evidência_no_texto
Frequency,Indicador genérico para anotar atividades em modelos descobertos
column2: serve de insumo para analisar a execução mais comum do processo.,"""annotated with the number of occurrences for each activity""  "

column1: Duration,Outro indicador genérico para anotar atividades e apoiar a análise do processo.,"""annotations with metrics such as the frequency or duration of activities""  "
Ratio of Budget Violations,KPI concreto usado como meta de desempenho na história-exemplo do processo de reembolso
column2: o GRM deve indicar as atividades que impactam esse rácio.,"""observing that the KPI ratio of budget violations increases, the process analyst must understand which activities in the process should be redesigned""  "

column1: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Medida agregada de desempenho do processo que motiva a análise.,"""The effectiveness … are monitored using key performance indicators (KPIs)""  "
Process Performance Indicators (PPIs),Termo específico de BPM para KPIs de processos.,"""in the context of BPM, these are often referred to as process performance indicators (PPIs)""  "
Effectiveness,Dimensão de desempenho ligada ao valor para o cliente.,"""The effectiveness (i.e., customer value) … of a business process are monitored using KPIs""  "

Efficiency,"Dimensão de desempenho (sequência temporal, utilização de recursos) monitorada via KPIs.","""The effectiveness … and efficiency (e.g., timely, logical sequence, resource utilisation) … are monitored using key performance indicators""  "
Resource Utilisation,Exemplo de métrica dentro da dimensão eficiência.,"""efficiency (e.g., timely, logical sequence, resource utilisation)""  "
Compliance,Objetivo do processo de reembolso no exemplo
column2: mede aderência às políticas.,"""it aims for a high degree of compliance with travel policies""  "

column1: Mean Squared Error (MSE),Função de perda usada para treinar o GGNN
column2: avalia a diferença entre previsão e rótulo.,"""we apply the loss function mean squared error … and measures the penalty""  "

column1: Cost Function,Soma das perdas (MSE) em um lote
column2: usada para otimizar o modelo.,"""Additionally, a cost function calculates the sum of loss functions over the batch""  "

column1: Area Under the ROC Curve (AUCROC),Métrica principal de qualidade preditiva comparada entre GRM e baselines.,"""We measure predictive quality … using: Area under the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve (AUCROC)""  "
ROC Curve,Curva que relaciona TPR e FPR
column2: base para calcular AUCROC.,"""mapped onto the ROC curve’s horizontal and vertical axes, respectively""  "

column1: Specificity (True Negative Rate),Avalia capacidade de classificar negativos
column2: comparada nos experimentos.,"""Specificity, and Sensitivity … Specificity (true negative rate (TNR) = 1 – false positive rate (FPR))""  "

column1: Sensitivity (True Positive Rate),Avalia capacidade de classificar positivos
column2: comparada nos experimentos.,"""Sensitivity (true positive rate (TPR))""  "

column1: True Positive Rate (TPR),Derivado usado para Sensitivity e para construir a ROC.,"""true positive rate (TPR)""  "
False Positive Rate (FPR),Derivado usado no cálculo de Specificity e na ROC.,"""false positive rate (FPR)""  "

Accuracy,"Métrica mencionada como alternativa, mas descartada devido a viés em dados desbalanceados.","""other popular measures—such as the Accuracy … remains unbiased for a highly imbalanced class label distribution""  "
F1-Score,"Outra métrica mencionada como alternativa, mas não utilizada por viés.","""or F1-score (harmonic mean of Precision and Recall)""  "
Precision,"Componente do F1-Score, citado como exemplo de métrica.","""harmonic mean of Precision and Recall""  "
Recall,"Componente do F1-Score, citado como exemplo de métrica (equivalente a Sensitivity).","""harmonic mean of Precision and Recall""  "
Standard Deviation,Estatística usada para avaliar robustez das predições (desvio-padrão entre folds).,"""we evaluate the standard deviation over the ten folds for each measurement""  "

Fitness,Dimensão de qualidade de modelo de processo mencionada como possível limiar de simplificação.,"""especially for processes with many different activities, users could filter on those … instead of common threshold parameters for simplifying discovered process models such as fitness""  "
Probability,Outro limiar de simplificação de modelo citado em conjunto com fitness.,"""instead of common threshold parameters … such as fitness or probability"""

g-index;Complementa o h-index dando mais peso a artigos muito citados; também utilizado no conjunto de seis métricas para determinar PDs.;"Egghe’s g-index (Egghe," 2006) visa melhorar o h-index dando mais peso a trabalhos altamente citados.""  "

hc-index (contemporary h);Atribui maior peso a trabalhos recentes e foi incluído entre as seis métricas de classificação dos pesquisadores.;"The contemporary h-index (Sidiropoulos et al.," 2007) recompensa acadêmicos que mantêm nível constante de atividade de pesquisa...""  "

hi-index (individual h);Controla o efeito da coautoria dividindo o h-index pelo nº médio de autores; usado entre as seis métricas.;"The individual h-index (Batista et al.," 2006) reduz os efeitos de co-autoria...""  "

Maximum processing time por atividade,Maior tempo registrado para uma atividade,“… maximum processing time per process step (activity) (see figure 6)”

Process costs (Activity-Based Costing),Calcular custo real multiplicando tempo do sujeito pelo salário associado,“… measuring the processing time subjects spend on their activities and multiplying it by the wage rates … leads to realistic cost values for a process”

Average activity time (PPI),Indicador de desempenho agregado de uma atividade ao longo de um período,“Identifier Average activity time … Description Average time of a process activity within a certain period”

Overall cycle time (Purchase Order),"Medir duração total da ordem de compra, usada em regras de envio expresso",“overall cycle time (Duration) for the last 50 instances … If it is above 48 hours goods are delivered with an express shipping”

Partial cycle time (company-internal),Medir somente o trecho interno do processo e comparar com o total,"“… partial cycle-time for the company-internal part of the process, which is set into relation with the overall cycle time”"

Average overall cycle time (last 50 instances),Média usada como gatilho para ações e alerta,“overall cycle time (Duration) for the last 50 instances … Monitoring the average of the overall cycle time … leads to an alert sent to the process owner”

Average time of RFC analysis,"PPI de tempo médio para analisar ‘Request for Change’, alvo ≤1 dia útil",“PPI-001 Average time of RFC analysis … The PPI value must be slower than or equal to 1 working day”

Overall working time per subject,"Somar tempo que cada sujeito despende numa instância, usado para custos e balanceamento",“… overall time a subject … spends on working on a process instance. This is of interest for cost-related analysis (see section 2.3)”

Overall time in Send states,Medir tempo total gasto em envio de mensagens,“overall time for … sending … by process and by subject”
Overall time in Function (doing) states,Medir tempo efetivo de execução (fazer) nas funções,"“overall time for … doing, both by process and by subject”"
Sbayou et al. 2017 - DEVS modelling and simulation for healthcare process application for hospital emergency department.pdf
Metric,Use in Text (context / purpose),Evidence in the Article (exact excerpt)

Performance indicators,General term for variables adopted in BPM to assess and improve healthcare operations,“the development of performance indicators in this domain to help healthcare providers structuring the interaction of information between systems and people.”
Quality of services,Goal-variable to be maximised when managing resources and processes,“trying to give the best solutions in order to manage their resources and deliver a best quality of services.”

Healthcare service quality,Specific form of service quality for care delivery,“can be a good tool for improving the healthcare service quality by providing models in an explicit and understandable way for all participants.”

Outcome (of care),Result-oriented indicator used to judge alternative service designs,"“identify and test different potential service designs through quantitative evidence-informed analysis, which take into account quality and safety issues, as well as the cost impact.”  "
Efficiency (of care),Variable to be raised by using modelling & simulation
column2: linked to resource usage and throughput,“found to be promising for the improvement of the outcome and efficiency of care.”

column1: Cost / Cost impact,Financial performance measure considered when comparing designs or policies,"“take into account quality and safety issues, as well as the cost impact.”  "

Patient waiting time,Operational indicator employed in several cited studies and in the ED example,"“The results of simulation, based principally on patient waiting time were able to give an idea about improving resources utilization.”  "
Resource utilisation,Indicator derived from simulation outputs to judge how well human/material resources are employed,“able to give an idea about improving resources utilization.”
Physician productivity,Performance measure negatively affected by overcrowding
column2: used to justify need of simulation,“overcrowding and congestion … lead to negative effects such as decreased physician productivity.”

column1: Ambulance diversions,Operational failure indicator caused by ED congestion,“negative effects such as … ambulance diversions.”
Patient dissatisfaction / patients leaving without treatment,Quality-of-service indicator measuring unmet demand,“dissatisfaction of patients who may sometimes leave without treatment.”
Medical errors,Patient-safety performance indicator rising under poor ED conditions,“increased medical errors”
Mortality rates,Ultimate clinical outcome measure influenced by ED performance,“higher mortality rates”
Staff turnover,Human-resource performance indicator reflecting workplace conditions,“high staff turnovers.”

Product innovation speed,Avaliar a rapidez de criação de novos produtos,“the pace of innovation in traditional insurance products is slow”
Customer satisfaction,Medir satisfação do cliente após melhorias de produtos/serviços,“This data-driven pricing model… increasing customer satisfaction and loyalty.”
Claims processing cycle time,Mensurar o tempo necessário para liquidar sinistros,“significantly shortening the claims processing cycle.”
Operational efficiency,Avaliar quão eficiente é a operação interna,“to enhance operational efficiency and reduce costs.”
Accuracy of risk assessment,Medir precisão na avaliação de risco,“enhances the accuracy of risk assessment” / “enabling precise risk assessment.”
Customer loyalty,Indicador de retenção e fidelidade do cliente,“increasing customer satisfaction and loyalty.”
Customer convenience,Avaliar facilidade de acesso e uso dos serviços,“This convenient digital service greatly enhances the convenience and satisfaction of customers.”
Process transparency,Medir transparência nos processos de sinistro/contrato,“transparency in claims processes through smart contracts.”
Insurance fraud risk,Indicador de redução de fraudes,“decreases the risk of insurance fraud”
Customer trust/dependence,Avaliar nível de confiança e dependência do cliente,“thereby enhancing customer trust and dependence on insurance products.”
Real-time prediction capability,Medir capacidade de prever riscos em tempo real,"“capable of real-time prediction and alerting for natural disasters, traffic accidents, health risks, and more.”"
Probability and impact of risks,KPI de frequência e severidade de riscos,“effectively reducing the probability and impact of risks.”
Manual review time and cost,Mensurar recursos gastos em revisões manuais,“reducing the time and cost of manual review”
Market responsiveness,Medir rapidez de adaptação ao mercado,“significantly reducing operational costs and enhancing market responsiveness.”

metric,usage_in_text,evidence
process cycle time,Exemplo de métrica de processo calculada a partir de trilhas de auditoria para avaliar rapidez de execução,“Typical examples for process metrics are process cycle times …”
waiting time,Exemplo de métrica de processo para medir tempo ocioso em atividades,“Typical examples for process metrics are … waiting times …”
deviation from process target,Mede a diferença entre valores reais e metas definidas do processo,“Typical examples for process metrics are … deviations from process targets …”
rework,Indica retrabalho gerado durante a execução do processo,“Typical examples for process metrics are … rework …”
approvals,Conta ou calcula aprovações necessárias dentro do fluxo,“Typical examples for process metrics are … approvals …”
processing cost,Custos diversos decorrentes da execução do processo,“Typical examples for process metrics are … various types for processing costs.”

drop-out rate (sales),Percentual de vendas abandonadas em determinado estágio do processo de telesales,“An interesting process metric … might be a drop out rate for sales activities which indicates the percentage of unsuccessful sales that stopped at a certain stage …”
order volume,Métrica específica de processo de pedidos que mede quantidade/valor de pedidos,"“an order process will also comprise metrics … such as order volume, order costs, or on time delivery.”  "
order cost,Custo total dos pedidos processados,"“an order process will also comprise metrics … such as order volume, order costs, or on time delivery.”  "
on-time delivery (orders),Percentual de pedidos entregues no prazo,“an order process will also comprise metrics … such as … on time delivery.”

average in-transit time,Tempo médio que um envio permanece em trânsito,"“We captured metrics for shipments such as average in transit time, expedite ratio, on time delivery, transportation cost variance, and average cost per mile.”  "
expedite ratio,Relação de embarques acelerados em relação ao total,"“We captured metrics for shipments such as average in transit time, expedite ratio …”  "
on-time delivery (shipments),Percentual de entregas realizadas dentro do prazo acordado,“We captured metrics for shipments such as … on time delivery …”
transportation cost variance,Variação entre custo real e planejado do transporte,“We captured metrics for shipments such as … transportation cost variance …”
average cost per mile,Custo médio por milha percorrida em transportes,“We captured metrics for shipments such as … average cost per mile.”
tender rejection rate,Percentual de ofertas de carga rejeitadas pelos transportadores,“If more than 10% of overall tenders are rejected across all carriers in the previous month …”

process performance status,Síntese periódica (semanal/mensal) do desempenho global do processo,"“An example of a public summary is the calculation made each week, month or quarter by process analysts stating the process performance status.”"

Percentage of Completed Audits,"Indicador apresentado no dashboard Power BI para mostrar a proporção de auditorias concluídas em relação ao plano anual, permitindo avaliar o cumprimento do plano.",“KPIs identificados … tais como the percentage of completed audits”
