medidor,uso_no_texto,evidencia_textual

Quality of Service (QoS),Métricas técnicas usadas para selecionar dinamicamente provedores e expressar compromissos de qualidade em contratos e SLAs.,“...based on current processing state and required Quality of Service (QoS).” / “...SLAs between service consumers and service providers which allow ... specify the available QoS (policy contracts).”

Service Level Agreement (SLA),Documento/contrato que formaliza as metas de QoS entre consumidor e provedor.,“...service contracts with Service Level Agreements (SLAs) between service consumers and service providers...”

Key Performance Indicator (KPI),Indicadores de desempenho de processos de negócio monitorados por BAM.,“...business process-level Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The monitoring of such indicators is referred to as Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) nowadays.”
Performance,Propriedade técnica geral a ser monitorada
column2: engloba tempo de resposta e throughput.,"“...technical issues such as performance and security...” / “...degradation of specific quality attributes such as ... performance (response times, throughout)...”  "

column1: Response Time,Sub-métrica de performance usada para avaliar rapidez das respostas.,"“...performance (response times, throughout)...”  "
Throughput,Sub-métrica de performance usada para avaliar volume processado.,"“...performance (response times, throughout)...”  "
Load,Indicador operacional utilizado em políticas de roteamento (load-based routing).,"“...selected at runtime based on certain policies, e.g., content-, QoS, and load-based routing.”  "
Reliability,Propriedade de confiança do sistema afetada pelas decisões de acoplamento e comunicação assíncrona.,"“This increase in flexibility and reliability, however, comes at a price...”  "

Scalability,Atributo de qualidade citado como possívelmente degradado em abordagens tradicionais.,"“...degradation of specific quality attributes such as interoperability, performance ..., scalability, and changeability...”  "
Changeability / Maintainability,Métrica de facilidade de evolução citada como atributo de qualidade.,"“...scalability, and changeability (maintainability).”  "
Profitability,Indicador de desempenho de negócio emergente em redes de serviços.,"“...business issues including profitability, return-on-investment, and indices of value creation.”  "

Return on Investment (ROI),Métrica financeira de desempenho de negócio mencionada como propriedade emergente.,"“...business issues including profitability, return-on-investment, and indices of value creation.”  "
Indices of Value Creation,Métricas de valor de negócio associadas ao desempenho global da rede de serviços.,“...indices of value creation.”

Adaptability,Atributo de qualidade relacionado à flexibilidade e (re)composição de serviços.,“Loose coupling and late binding constitute two key principles for increasing the adaptability of service applications...”
Resilience / Robustness,Métrica de resistência do sistema destacada como desafio de pesquisa.,"“Service resilience, system level (robustness).”"

Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Total Cost of Ownership (TCO),Soma todos os custos ao longo do ciclo de vida
column2: usado para comparar portfólios de serviços e decidir se o out-tasking reduz ou não os custos totais.,"""Using the Total Cost of Ownership, out-tasking is profitable, if it serves to reduce the TCO.""  "

column1: Return on Investment (ROI),Índice de rentabilidade tradicional
column2: compara o lucro total com o capital empregado para avaliar a atratividade do out-tasking.,"""A widespread measure of this kind in practice is the Return on Investment (ROI).""  "

column1: ROI dinâmico (r_GK),Versão dinâmica do ROI calculada dentro da VOFI
column2: serve para decidir se o retorno do projeto supera o custo de capital-alvo.,"""Out-tasking is financially profitable, if rGK > kTarget.""  "

column1: Capital Costs Ratio (k_Target),Benchmark de custo de capital usado para comparar com o ROI dinâmico e decidir se o investimento é aceitável.,"""Out-tasking is financially profitable, if rGK > kTarget.""  "
Present Value,Medida clássica de orçamento de capital citada como referência
column2: VOFI é apresentada como alternativa mais transparente.,"""Compared to formulas applied by conventional methods of capital budgeting (e.g. Present Value or Annuity of an Investment Project)…""  "

column1: Annuity,Outra medida clássica de orçamento de capital mencionada como referência comparativa às planilhas VOFI.,"""…(e.g. Present Value or Annuity of an Investment Project)…""  "
Net Balance (saldo líquido do investimento),Valor do investimento atualizado periodicamente na VOFI
column2: usado para monitorar a posição financeira durante todo o ciclo de vida.,"""…the value of an investment … can be monitored during the whole life-cycle … simply by observing the net balance in each relevant period.""  "

column1: Net Funding,Resultado contábil que deve ser zero a cada período para garantir equilíbrio entre entradas e saídas
column2: funciona como verificação de desempenho financeiro do modelo.,"""As a check-up, the net funding value, which is defined as the accounting balance of all out- and in-payments, should be zero.""  "

column1: Total Monetary Profit I,"Lucro monetário após receitas irregulares, despesas regulares e depreciação
column2: etapa intermediária na apuração do desempenho financeiro.","""= Total Monetary Profit I (before Interest and Revenues by Complementary Investments)""  "

column1: Total Monetary Profit II,Lucro após incluir receitas de investimentos complementares e despesas de juros.,"""= Total Monetary Profit II (before Taxes on Income)""  "
Total Monetary Profit III,Lucro monetário após impostos
column2: usado antes de aplicar juros calculatórios.,"""= Total Monetary Profit III (after Taxes on Income)""  "

column1: Total Calculatory Profit,Lucro após considerar o juro calculatório (custo de oportunidade)
column2: valor que representa o TCO no modelo.,"""This Total Calculatory Profit finally represents the Total Costs of Ownership calculated on the basis of VOFI."""

column1: Vimala Rani and Mathirajan 2020 - Performance evaluation of due-date based dispatching rules in dynamic scheduling of diffusion furnace.pdf
performance_measure,usage_in_text,evidence_excerpt
Total Weighted Tardiness (TWT),Objetivo de otimização a ser minimizado
column2: base para modelo matemático
column3: métrica de comparação de heurísticas.,“…optimize the due-date based scheduling objectives: Total weighted tardiness…” / “The objective function presented in (1) is to minimize the TWT.”

column1: On-Time Delivery rate (OTD rate),Objetivo de otimização a ser maximizado
column2: avalia a proporção de jobs concluídos no prazo
column3: utilizado em modelos e testes.,“…on-time delivery (OTD) rate is aiming to complete maximum number of jobs on or before its due-date.” / “Constraint (17) is used to maximize the on-time delivery (OTD) rate.”

column1: Total Earliness/Lateness (TE/L),Objetivo de otimização a ser minimizado
column2: mede desvios (adiantamentos ou atrasos) em relação aos prazos.,“…total earliness/lateness (TE/L)… makes sure to avoid completing the jobs too early and too late.” / “Constraint (20) is to minimize the total earliness/lateness.”

column1: Maximum Lateness (Lmax),Objetivo de otimização a ser minimizado
column2: avalia o pior atraso individual.,"“…Minimizing the maximum lateness is in a sense equivalent to minimizing the worst performance of the schedule.” / “Constraint (22) is to minimize Lmax (that is, maximum lateness).”"

column1: Makespan (Cmax),Mencionado como objetivo baseado em tempo de conclusão na revisão de literatura.,"“completion time based objectives (Makespan, total flow time, mean flow time…)” / Tabela 2: “Lmax/Cmax/TWCT”"
Total Flow Time,Objetivo baseado em tempo de conclusão citado na revisão de literatura.,"“completion time based objectives (Makespan, total flow time, mean flow time…)”"
Mean Flow Time,Objetivo baseado em tempo de conclusão citado na revisão de literatura.,idem.
Total Weighted Completion Time (TWCT),Medidor de desempenho citado em estudos anteriores
column2: aparece em revisão/tabela comparativa.,Tabela 2: “Lmax/Cmax/TWCT”

column1: Total Tardiness (TT),Objetivo devido à data citado na revisão
column2: utilizado em estudos prévios.,Tabela 2 e texto: “…total tardiness (TT)…”

column1: Number of Tardy Jobs (NT),Contagem de jobs atrasados
column2: usada em estudo prévio e como componente de OTD.,“…number of tardy jobs…” / “…TWT/NT/OTD rate…”

column1: Weighted Tardiness of Batch (WTB),Índice de prioridade de lote
column2: deriva-se de soma de weighted tardiness e pode servir como métrica.,"“WTB rule: According to this rule, the batch-priority-index is computed as follows…”"

column1: Tardiness (Tj),"Medida básica de atraso de um job
column2: usada para calcular TWT, OTD e UPj.",“Tardiness of a job ‘j’ (Tj) can be defined as how much late the job ‘j’ is…”

column1: Weighted Tardiness of job (WTj),Tardiness ponderado individual
column2: componente de TWT.,“The weighted tardiness of the job ‘j’ (WTj) can be defined as … WTj = Wj × Tj”

column1: Earliness/Lateness de job (ELj),Desvio absoluto individual
column2: componente de TE/L.,“ELj ≥ | CTj – DDj | …”

column1: Lateness (Lj),Atraso (pode ser negativo)
column2: usado para calcular Lmax.,“Lj ≥ CTj – DDj … Lmax = max Lj”

column1: Unit Penalty (UPj),Indicador binário de atraso
column2: utilizado para calcular OTD rate.,“UPj = 1 if CTj > DDj … Constraint (18) assigns the unit penalty to each tardy job.”

column1: Relative Percentage Deviation (RPD),Métrica de desempenho relativa entre heurística e benchmark.,“we compute the relative percentage deviation (RPD) w.r.t. benchmark solution (BS) using Eq. (25).”
Average Relative Percentage Deviation (ARPD),Média de RPD sobre instâncias
column2: utilizada para comparar variantes de heurística.,“this study uses the standard performance measure: Average Relative Percentage Deviation (ARPD).”

column1: Computational Time,Tempo de CPU usado como indicador de complexidade
column2: reportado para cada instância.,Tabela 5: “computational time required to get the optimal solution…”

column1: Slack,Diferença entre folga de prazo e tempo restante
column2: indicador dentro de regras de despacho.,“…minimum slack (MS) first: This is a simple and dynamic dispatching rule. It is a measure of urgency for a given job.”

column1: Heart et al. 2008 - Harnessing information systems in healthcare - The strategic alignment perspective.pdf
Medidor de performance,Como é usado no texto,Evidência (trecho do texto)

Organisational performance,Variável-resultado utilizada para demonstrar que o alinhamento estratégico (SA) traz benefícios à organização.,“It is commonly agreed that SA is positively correlated to organisational performance.”

Company performance,Indicador de resultado corporativo avaliado em pesquisas que relacionam o alinhamento Negócio-TI com desempenho.,“…measurement of information technology (IT) business alignment and its influence on company performance.”
Business gains,Ganho de negócio tomado como indicador de sucesso
column2: usado para mostrar que melhor alinhamento nem sempre gera benefícios financeiros.,“The Alignment Paradox: It's not always the case that better IT alignment leads to business gains.”

column1: Positive returns on investments in IS/IT,Retorno positivo sobre investimentos em TI citado como medida esperada quando há alinhamento.,“…organisations will realise positive returns on their investments in IS/IT.”

Competitive position,Posicionamento competitivo da firma apresentado como possível resultado (melhora) da atuação dos gerentes médios.,“…divergent actions of MM may lead to an overall improvement in the competitive position of an organisation.”

Competitive advantage,Vantagem competitiva mencionada como objetivo/performance decorrente do alinhamento adequado.,"“…achievement of competitive advantage, and facilitate organisational agility during turbulent times.”"

Organisational agility,Capacidade de resposta/ajuste rápido do negócio citada como resultado associado ao alinhamento.,"“…achievement of competitive advantage, and facilitate organisational agility during turbulent times.”"
Performance feedback,Feedback de performance usado em pesquisa para explicar comportamentos estratégicos de gerentes médios.,“Performance Feedback and Middle Managers’ Divergent Strategic Behavior…”

Strategic Alignment Maturity Level (SA Maturity),Nível de maturidade do alinhamento utilizado como métrica para avaliar e comparar organizações.,“A Strategic Alignment Maturity Model (SAM) that ‘…provides a comprehensive vehicle for organisations to evaluate business-IT alignment…’”

Static ‘fit’ between business and IS/IT strategies,Métrica de alinhamento baseada na comparação de conteúdos das estratégias (medida de ‘fit’).,“…a single state fit is used to measure a static ‘fit’ by simply comparing contents of business strategies and IS/IT strategies.”
Zemguliene and Valukonis 2018 - Structured literature review on business process performance analysis and evaluation.pdf

Indicadores técnicos,"Medidores operacionais específicos (tempo, custo, throughput etc.) usados em conjunto com KPIs para medir a performance de processos colaborativos.",mesma passagem de Hachicha et al. (2016) que contrasta “business level performance (KPIs)” com “process performance (technical indicators)”.

Métrica de Complexidade de Fluxo-de-Controle,Número que quantifica a complexidade estrutural de um processo para apoiar análise e comparação de modelos.,“Cardoso (2008) … providing the metric to assess the control-flow complexity of business process”.

Score de Contribuição Ponderada,Pontuação que mede a contribuição de cada processo às metas estratégicas e serve para ranquear processos críticos.,“Dervitsiotis (1999) … identify critical process by its weighted contribution to strategic goals”.

Perspectivas/Indicadores do Balanced Scorecard,"Conjunto de medidores financeiros, de clientes, processos internos e aprendizagem usado para selecionar processos estratégicos, avaliar impacto de sistemas de medição e alinhar processo-negócio.","“Hanafizadeh et al. (2009) … methodol­ogy for selecting strategic processes based on the Balanced Scorecard framework”
column2: “Franceschini et al. (2013) … impact reference model, based on the balance scorecard framework”."

column1: Matriz Riggs,Escala numérica comum usada para converter diferentes medidas de desempenho antes de calcular a contribuição do processo.,“method (based on Riggs matrix) for evaluation of business process value adding contributions”.

Pontuações AHP,"Pesos/prioridades derivados do Analytic Hierarchy Process para comparar alternativas de processo, escolher indicadores ou avaliar valor dos processos.",“Khan & Wibisono (2008) … techniques of analytic hierarchy process”
column2: “Sarkis et al. (2006) … involves … analytic hierarchy process”.

column1: Gap Analysis,"Diferença entre desempenho atual e alvo em cada indicador, utilizada para sinalizar necessidade de melhoria.",“Khan and Wibisono (2008) … designing and benchmarking of measurement system which considers … gap analysis”.
Valor/Fluxo de Caixa Esperado,Indicador económico que expressa a contribuição de valor do processo
column2: usado para roteamento ótimo de instâncias.,“Bolsinger et al. (2015) … parameters that maximizes the expected cash flow of the process”.

column1: Indicador de Processo Capital,"Medida composta que inclui valor dos insumos, valor dos outputs e capacidade de gestão do processo.","“Shang, Wu (2013) suggested indicator consisting of measures of value of process capital input and output, and capability to manage process”."

Medida Composta de Processo,Índice sintético criado a partir de métricas individuais alinhadas aos objetivos do processo.,“Yen (2009) … conceptual model aimed to create composite measure of business process”.

Sistema de Rating Fuzzy para KPIs,Pontuações fuzzy atribuídas aos KPIs e otimizadas com algoritmo genético para avaliar qualidade de processos.,“Nestic et al. (2015) propose a fuzzy model … fuzzy pair-vice comparison matrices … fuzzy ratings of key performance indicators”.

TPI – Final Aggregate Normalised Environmental Consumption Score,Valor agregado que combina custos ambientais e econômicos para comparar alternativas tecnológicas/processos.,"“Final aggregate and normalized environmental consumption score (TPI), calculated for each process, define which alternative process … is more economically and environmentally sound” (Sarkis et al., 2006)."

Indicadores de Risco (Risk Level Score),Escore usado no modelo de roteamento para optar por caminhos de instância com menor risco.,“Bolsinger et al. (2015) … scoring system for the estimation of risk level”.

Score de Incerteza do Processo,Pontuação agregada que reflete riscos e oportunidades inerentes a alternativas de implantação de processo.,“Helquist et al. (2012) … process deployment alternatives measured by aggregated scores in regard to inherent risks and opportunities”.

Índice de Capabilidade/Esforço,Função de regressão que relaciona a capacidade de melhoria da organização ao ganho de desempenho pós-BPI.,“Nichlods & Mo (2016) … regression function of current organization’s improvement capability”.

Indicadores a partir de Audit Trail/Web Logs,"Métricas (ex.: tempo de clique, hits, taxa de erros) extraídas de audit trails, web-server logs e stress tests para compor KPIs de processos web-enabled.","“Pun et al. (2012) … key performance indicators evaluated according to audit trail data, web server logs and stress testing logs”."

Indicador de Valor do Processo (Value Indicator via AHP),"Valor composto calculado para processos de engenharia de produto e produção, baseado em hierarquia de critérios de valor.",“Bosch-Mauchand et al. (2013) … value indicator based on the principles of value chain and on the methods of knowledge management”.

Pontuação de Competência Percebida,Escala de motivação que mede a percepção de competência dos participantes do processo em função da configuração do trabalho.,“Torres & Sidorova (2015) … work setting effect on employees motivation through the effect of perceived competence”.

KPIs de Supply Chain,"Indicadores de desempenho aplicados à cadeia de suprimentos (estrutura, velocidade, saliência).",“Morgan (2004) highlights the preconditions of effective performance measurement from the supply chain perspective”.
Barat et al. 2020 - Towards effective design and adaptation of csp using modelling and simulation based digital twin approach.pdf

column3: “ …steady customer base, net promoter score (NPS) and loyalty.” (Seção 2)"

Medidor,Uso_no_texto,Evidencia_no_texto

Eficiência,"Indicador de melhoria de desempenho dos DSS/IDSS, ligado à rapidez e economia no processo decisório.",“not only for improvement of the efﬁciency and effectiveness of the decisions” (Introdução).
Eficácia,Usado em conjunto com eficiência para medir a qualidade dos resultados das decisões.,“not only for improvement of the efﬁciency and effectiveness of the decisions” (Introdução).
Qualidade da decisão,Resultado esperado dos IDSS: produzir decisões melhores.,“with the expectation of both better decisions and improved decision making processes.” (Resumo).
Carga cognitiva,Medida de esforço mental exigido ao decisor
column2: o objetivo da integração de apresentação é reduzi-la.,“increasing complexity of the decision situations which puts enormous cognitive workload on decision makers” (Introdução) e “Presentation integration aims at reducing user’s cognitive load” (§2.5).

column1: Consistência de dados/informações,Critério de integração de dados
column2: garante que todos os componentes usem informação coerente.,“The goal of data and information integration is to obtain consistent information for consistent decisions” (§2.1).

column1: Não-redundância de dados,Evitar duplicação ou derivação desnecessária de dados entre componentes.,Tabela 1 – propriedade ‘Non-redundancy’: “Data/info. managed by one component can be duplicated or derived from others”.
Interoperabilidade,Capacidade dos componentes de utilizarem mutuamente dados/serviços
column2: métrica central da integração.,Tabela 1 – propriedade ‘Interoperability’: “Little work is required for components to be able to use each other’s data/info.”

column1: Sincronização,Nível de atualização simultânea entre componentes quando um dado muda.,Tabela 1 – propriedade ‘Synchronisation’: “All the changes to all shared non-persistent data/info… are communicated to others”.

Flexibilidade,Facilidade de adaptação do sistema/modelos a diferentes problemas e manutenção.,"“a DSS should create multiple models rather than a single larger model for the benefit of DSS implementation, maintenance and flexibility.” (§2.2)."

Adaptabilidade,Capacidade dos modelos se ajustarem a necessidades organizacionais em mudança.,“Another challenge for model integration is the adaptability of the models… to organisational needs for changes” (§4.1).
Escalabilidade,Possibilidade de crescimento do sistema em ambientes distribuídos.,“Web … can be more scalable and interoperable in network-based business environment” (§3.4).
Abertura,Uso de tecnologias Web/serviços para permitir acesso amplo e integração externa.,Mesmo trecho: “Web … can be more scalable and interoperable in network-based business environment” (§3.4).
Atividade (activeness),Grau em que o DSS interage proativamente com o usuário
column2: melhor desempenho de suporte.,“The need for active decision support was ﬁrst asserted by Keen…” (§3.3).

column1: Autonomia,Capacidade de agentes executarem tarefas sem intervenção humana.,"“Typical characteristics of intelligent agents include: intelligence, autonomy, pro-activeness…” (§3.3)."
Robustez,Resistência dos agentes/sistemas a falhas e ambientes dinâmicos.,"“…shifted … to multi-agent systems (MASs) … to make them more autonomous, robust and mobile for IDSS.” (§3.3)."
Qualidade de serviço,Melhoria percebida pelos usuários quando o conhecimento especializado está embutido.,“enhancing the quality of services by having an ‘expert’ readily available to users” (§3.1).

Economia/custos,Retorno financeiro e redução de custos obtidos com IDSS.,“The beneﬁts of IDSS have been clearly manifested through tangible returns to investment and cost savings in organisations” (§3).

Qualidade do conhecimento,Critério para avaliar resultados de data mining usados nas decisões.,"“…provide better decision support—knowledge with quality, business relevance and understood by users…” (§3.2)."

Facilidade de aprendizado,"Avalia quão rapidamente o usuário transfere experiência entre componentes, ligada à interface comum.","“…if a user’s experience with and expectations of one can be applied to the others.” (§2.5, aparência e comportamento)."

column2: mede a fração de pedidos totalmente tratados pela IA
column3: serve para avaliar impactos de melhorias e para comparação entre sessões.,“These metrics include automation rate (the fraction of orders that are handled entirely by the AI)”

column1: Dialog efficiency,KPI que mensura a rapidez com que a IA conclui pedidos ajustada pela complexidade
column2: citado como indicador a ser otimizado.,"“These metrics include … dialog efficiency (the rate at which the AI can take orders, adjusted for order complexity)”"

column1: Customer satisfaction,KPI qualitativo citado como resultado-chave desejado pelas melhorias do sistema.,“These metrics include … customer satisfaction.”

column2: mede escalonamentos iniciados pela equipe

column1: Heuristic escalation rate,Submétrica derivada
column2: refere-se a escalonamentos disparados automaticamente por watchdogs heurísticos
column3: usada para medir impacto de diferenças entre modelos.,“along with 4.1 times higher rates in the ‘heuristic’ category”

column1: Customer escalation rate,Submétrica derivada
column2: refere-se a escalonamentos provocados pelo cliente
column3: também empregada na análise de impacto dos erros.,“and 2.9 times higher rates in the ‘customer’ escalation category”

Economic performance (aggregate),Economic Performance,Higher-order construct evaluated through five items EcP1-EcP5,…economic performance was measured with the scale developed by Daugherty et al. (2005).

Operational performance (aggregate),Operational Performance,Higher-order construct evaluated through five items OpP1-OpP5,Operational performance items were originally developed by Green et al. (2012) and Lee et al. (2012).

Environmental performance (aggregate),Environmental Performance,Higher-order construct evaluated through five items EnP1-EnP5,The measurement of environmental performance was based on Gholami et al. (2013) and Chiou et al. (2011) instruments.

Social performance (aggregate),Social Performance,Higher-order construct evaluated through three items SoP1-SoP3,Social performance was captured with items adapted from Albinger and Freeman’s (2000) and Greening and Turban’s (2000) studies.

Competitive advantage (long-term),Economic/Sustainability outcome,Discussed as a potential result of GSCM and GIS initiatives,…gain long-term competitive advantage through the integration of supply chains.

Efficiency enhancement,Operational/Economic outcome,Discussed as a benefit stemming from GIS & GSCM practices,…inter-firm collaboration for efficiency enhancement and waste reduction in the whole supply chain.
Waste reduction,Environmental/Operational outcome,Discussed as a direct environmental performance effect,…leading to waste/emission reduction and energy conservation.
Energy conservation,Environmental outcome,Discussed as direct environmental improvement target,…leading to waste/emission reduction and energy conservation.
Emission reduction,Environmental outcome,Discussed as direct environmental improvement target,…can be used to facilitate…emission auditing) play critical roles in controlling environmental impacts.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),Variáveis-alvo que devem ser minimizadas ou maximizadas na abordagem de controle prescritivo.,“…to minimize or maximize certain key performance indicators.” (Abstract)
Cost Savings,Apresentado como um dos ganhos esperados com o uso de análises preditivas e controle prescritivo.,“…would contribute to cost savings…” (Seção 1.2)
Productivity,Mencionada como meta de melhoria ao aplicar a abordagem proposta.,“…productivity and product quality improvements…” (Seção 1.2)

Product Quality (Quality Units – QU),Qualidade mínima dos produtos finais e intermediários utilizada para decidir rotas de produção.,“…final products of type D with a quality of at least 90 quality units (QU) …” (Seção 3.1)
Defect Discovery Time / Timely Discovery of Defects,Velocidade com que defeitos são identificados
column2: usada como argumento para adoção de predição.,“…timely discovery of defects within process executions.” (Seção 1.2)

column1: Cycle Time,Tempo total de execução de uma instância ou de etapas
column2: previsto para apoiar decisões.,“When will this process instance end?” (Seção 3.2 – exemplo de pergunta sobre ciclo)

column1: Resource Consumption,Indicador a ser minimizado na escolha da sequência ótima de processo.,“…minimize the overall resource consumption?” (Seção 3.2)
Time Consumption (KPI a),Usado como variável de decisão entre caminhos de processo (‘D’ vs ‘E’).,“…KPI a (time consumption)…” (Seção 3.3.3)

Material Requirements / Material Consumption,Citado como métrica impactada quando se escolhe rota alternativa de produção.,“…increased material requirements… could be scheduled earlier…” (Seção 3.1.2)
Personnel Utilization,Indicador de uso de mão-de-obra considerado no replanejamento proativo.,“…personnel … utilisation could be scheduled earlier…” (Seção 3.1.2)
Equipment Utilization,Indicador de uso de máquinas/equipamentos a ser otimizado no replanejamento.,“…equipment utilisation could be scheduled earlier…” (Seção 3.1.2)

Scrap/Waste Ratio,"Percentual de sucata gerada no processo, usado como motivação para controle preditivo.","“…334 million tons were discarded as waste, which is a ratio of one to three.” (Seção 4.2)  "

Surface Defect Rate,Taxa/ocorrência de defeitos superficiais detectados por sensores ópticos.,“…optical surface test sensors that can continuously provide real-time data for the detection of surface defects…” (Seção 4.4)

Mendoza et al. 2022 - On the effectiveness of data balancing techniques in the context of ML-based test case prioritization.pdf
Metric,How it is (explicitly) used in the paper,Evidence extracted from the text (verbatim or almost-verbatim citation)
Cost-cognizant Average Percentage of Faults Detected (APFD_C),Primary effectiveness indicator to compare TCP techniques
column2: all experimental results (Tables 3–5) are reported in terms of APFD_C
column3: also the 90 %–effectiveness threshold is expressed with this metric.,"“even the best reported ML-based TCP techniques can reach 90 % or higher effectiveness in terms of Cost-cognizant Average Percentage of Faults Detected (APFD𝐶) …” (Abstract) – “In this work, similar to many TCP studies … we use APFD𝐶 as the evaluation metric to measure the effectiveness of prioritization techniques.” (Section 4.3)  "

column1: Average Percentage of Faults Detected (APFD),"Original, cost–unaware precursor of APFD_C
column2: introduced to motivate why APFD_C is preferred.","“APFD only measures the extent to which a certain ranking reveals faults early, and does not take the execution time of test cases into account, which is important, especially in a CI context.” (Section 4.3)  "

column1: Relative Performance Index (RPI),Derived indicator used to decide which configuration is the ‘best’ for a subject
column2: counts how many other configurations are significantly worse.,"“We determine the best configurations by calculating the Relative Performance Index ( RPI) for each configuration, which indicates the number of configurations with a significantly lower average in terms of APFD𝐶.” (Section 4.5.1)  "

column1: p-value,Statistical metric returned by Welch’s ANOVA / Games–Howell tests to decide if performance differences are significant.,"“The significance level is set to 0.05, and therefore any difference with p-value ≤ 0.05 is considered significant.” (Section 4.5.1) – Columns ‘p-val’ in Table 5 report these values.  "

Common Language Effect Size (CLE),Effect-size metric used to quantify the magnitude of performance differences between configurations.,“the CLE estimates the probability of a randomly sampled score from one population being greater than a randomly sampled score from another population.” (Section 4.5.1) – Column ‘CLE’ in Table 4 shows the computed values.
Oberdorf et al. 2023 - Predictive End-to-End Enterprise Process Network Monitoring.pdf
metric,context_or_use,evidence_in_text

Accuracy,General metric for classification tasks and used for model evaluation,"For classification tasks, accuracy is a very commonly applied metric. It measures the ratio between the number of correctly predicted target labels and the total number of predictions."
Balanced Accuracy,Recommended metric for imbalanced class data
column2: used as BMACC in experiments,"The accuracy metric is only designed for tasks considering all classes as equally important… the preferable metrics are balanced accuracy…
column3: ""Table 3 … reports BMACC (Balanced Multi-class Accuracy)."""

column1: Precision,Part of the confusion-matrix based metrics reported in experimental results,Table 3 … columns “Prec” list the precision obtained by every algorithm.
Recall,Part of the confusion-matrix based metrics reported in experimental results,Table 3 … columns “Rec” list the recall obtained by every algorithm.
F1-score / F-Measure (incl. weighted F1),Suggested for imbalanced data and reported in experiments,"…the preferable metrics are … the weighted F1-score…
column2: ""Table 3 … column “F1”."""

column1: Matthews Correlation Coefficient,Alternative metric for imbalanced classification tasks,"…the preferable metrics are balanced accuracy, the weighted F1-score, or the Matthews correlation coefficient."
Mean Absolute Error (MAE),Standard metric for regression tasks,The most common metrics for evaluating predictive regression tasks are mean absolute error (MAE)…
Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE),Provides relational/percentage insight for regression evaluation,…to provide relational insights … the mean absolute percentage error (MAPE) is useful.
Mean Squared Error (MSE),Standard metric for regression tasks,…or the mean squared error (MSE).
Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE),Listed among regression metrics in the method overview,"Figure 3 (Regression metrics box) lists ‘RMSE’ together with MAE, MAPE, MSE."
Validation Loss,Used to compare deep-learning models during training,"For the tuned FC, CNN, and multi-headed (MH) models, we first compare the validation loss (Fig. 5)…"
Learning Curves,Checked to ensure robust model after tuning,"Finally, the tuned models are tested and the learning curves evaluated, to ensure a robust model…"

Prediction Error Costs (cerr),Business-oriented cost metric derived from prediction accuracy,We follow the approach … and evaluate the prediction error costs (c_err)… Table 3 lists ‘c_err’ … increasing accuracy results in decreasing … costs.
Training Time (t_train),Runtime performance indicator reported in experiments,Table 3 … column ‘tTrain (s)’ gives the training duration for each algorithm.
Prediction Time (t_pred),Runtime performance indicator for on-line use,Table 3 … column ‘tPred (s)’ gives the duration for predictions.

Runtime Performance (general),Considered when deploying models for live use,…its predictive power is significantly higher than the considered baselines. While the DL model … exhibits somewhat higher computational costs… runtime performance becomes particularly relevant during model deployment.

Running time,Exemplo de atributo de QoS que deve ser previsto/monitorado.,“QoS attributes – such as running time …”

Availability,Exemplo de atributo de QoS monitorado.,“QoS attributes – such as … availability – are crucial …”

Price,Métrica de custo usada como QoS em composições de serviços.,"“… response time, price, shipment time …”"
Shipment time,Métrica logística incluída nas avaliações de QoS.,"“… response time, price, shipment time …”"

column2: detecção de violações é usada como gatilho de adaptação.,"“adaptation triggers – analysis results, on-line testing and prediction of Key Performance Indicator (KPI) violations”"

KPIs de Risk,Indicadores de risco que podem disparar adaptação.,“KPIs for … risk …”

Key Ecological Indicator (KEI),Métrica composta de caráter ambiental que deriva de métricas de QoS.,"“Examples include the so-called Key Ecological Indicators (KEI), which are composite characteristics on the business process level, based on QoS …”"
Greenness,Atributo de qualidade emergente a ser incorporado em padrões de adaptação.,"“quality attributes with emerging importance, such as greenness, trustworthiness, risk, value, etc.”"
Trustworthiness,Atributo de confiança citado como métrica emergente para adaptação.,idem
Risk,Atributo de risco apontado como métrica de qualidade e KPI.,idem e “KPIs for … risk …”
Value,Métrica de valor de transação/rede de serviços
column2: usada para avaliar SNs.,"“value, etc.” e “overall value of the SN”"

column1: Transparent Deployment,"Atributo de qualidade do estilo arquitetural ‘liquid’, indicando capacidade de ser implantado em qualquer infraestrutura.",“Liquid Web services feature the following quality attributes: 1) Transparent Deployment …”

Composability,Atributo que mede capacidade de composição de serviços líquidos com outros serviços.,“… 3) Composability.”

Tamanho dos dados de entrada,Métrica derivada usada para melhorar predição de QoS sensível a dados.,"“taking into account a measure of data (such as its size, in some suitable metric) can significantly improve precision of QoS measurement and prediction.”"

Complexity / Computational cost function,Função derivada (custo computacional) usada para estimar consumo de recursos e tempo.,“… infering the complexity functions based on an abstraction of input data size”
Average-based QoS prediction,Predição de desempenho baseada no valor médio
column2: indicador derivado.,"“data-insensitive, average-based QoS descriptions (top left)”"

column1: Range-based QoS prediction,Predição que fornece intervalo de valores
column2: métrica derivada para precisão.,“range-based predictions (bottom left)”

column1: Interval-based, data-sensitive QoS,Combina sensibilidade a dados e intervalo
column2: métrica derivada para monitorar/predizer qualidade.,"“Both can be combined … in interval-based, data-sensitive predictions.”"

Performance_Indicator,Usage_in_Text,Evidence_in_Text

Critical Performance Indicators,Provide real-time access that helps improve speed and effectiveness of operations.,“... provides real-time access to critical performance indicators to improve the speed and effectiveness of business operations.”
Key Performance Indicators (KPIs),"Core metrics monitored by BAM
column2: basis for aggregations, alerts and decision making.","“Business Activity Monitoring (BAM) is a collection of tools that allow you to manage aggregations, alerts, and profiles to monitor relevant business metrics (Key Performance Indicators - KPIs).”"

column1: Business Metrics,Generic measurable items supervised through BAM together with KPIs.,"“... manage aggregations, alerts, and profiles to monitor relevant business metrics (Key Performance Indicators - KPIs).”"

Business Indicators,Performance-related values followed by event-notification packages.,"“... event notification packages track business indicators, yet there’s been little focus on merging data in real-time ...”"

Aggregations (KPI Aggregates),Summarised KPIs that can be browsed to evaluate overall performance.,“Browse aggregations (which are key performance indicators) around all the business activities that are currently being processed or have already happened.”
Milestones,Defined checkpoints in a process that measure progress of each BAM activity.,“... each one has a defined set of milestones and business data.”
Per-Product Sales Trends,Example KPI displayed in BAM views for analysis and decision support.,“A BAM view might provide graphical depictions of per-product sales trends ...”
Current Inventory Levels,Example KPI displayed in BAM views to track stock status.,“... or current inventory levels or other key performance indicators.”

Aggregate Alert,Performance alert type that compares aggregated KPI values with threshold data over a time frame.,"“There are two types of alerts, aggregate and instance. An aggregate alert allows specifying threshold data across a time frame ...”"
Instance Alert,Performance alert type triggered by specific KPI values for a single process instance.,“... whereas an instance alert is based on specific qualifying data points.”
Threshold Data,Numerical limits used inside alerts to flag performance deviations.,“An aggregate alert allows specifying threshold data across a time frame ...”

Status and Results of Operations,Information set that offers insight into operational performance.,"“... providing accurate information about the status and results of various operations, processes, and transactions ...”"
Hull et al. 2013 - Data management perspectives on business process management - tutorial overview.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto

Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s),"Apresentados como o principal instrumento de interpretação de dados em Business Intelligence, agregando informações sobre eventos de negócio para avaliar o desempenho geral dos processos.","“A central construct for data interpretation is that of Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s), which are aggregates that focus on the frequency, distribution and relationships between specified business-relevant events.”  "

Frequency of specified business-relevant events,Métrica derivada usada dentro dos KPI’s para indicar quantas vezes determinados eventos ocorrem ao longo das execuções de processo.,"“…aggregates that focus on the frequency, distribution and relationships between specified business-relevant events.”  "

Distribution of specified business-relevant events,"Métrica derivada usada nos KPI’s para mostrar a distribuição (por exemplo, ao longo do tempo ou por categoria) dos eventos de negócio.","“…aggregates that focus on the frequency, distribution and relationships between specified business-relevant events.”  "
Relationships between specified business-relevant events,Métrica derivada que analisa correlações/associações entre eventos de negócio
column2: faz parte do conjunto de indicadores considerados pelos KPI’s.,"“…aggregates that focus on the frequency, distribution and relationships between specified business-relevant events.”  "

column1: Metrics (model-driven, integradas ao modelo de artefatos),"Indicadores quantitativos ou qualitativos que, junto com os KPI’s, são modelados de forma integrada aos artefatos de negócio para permitir monitoramento em tempo real.",“…a model-driven approach based on business artifacts in which KPI’s and metrics are modeled in an integrated manner as part of the business artifact models [19].”

Performance monitoring,Extensão do process mining que observa continuamente os dados de execução para avaliar o desempenho e identificar problemas.,"“Further, extensions such as performance monitoring and techniques for predicting the bottlenecks have been studied.”  "

Techniques for predicting bottlenecks,"Métricas/algoritmos que utilizam dados de execução para antecipar pontos de estrangulamento e, assim, melhorar o desempenho do processo.","“Further, extensions such as performance monitoring and techniques for predicting the bottlenecks have been studied.”"
Estrada-Torres 2017 - Improve performance management in flexible business processes.pdf

Process Performance Indicator (PPI),Métrica central para avaliar desempenho de processos
column2: todo o trabalho propõe melhorá-las e estendê-las,“Process performance indicators (PPIs) are quantifiable metrics that allow the evaluation of efficiency and effectiveness of business processes…”

column1: Performance index,Conjunto de indicadores citado como alternativa para avaliar processos (inclusive KIPs),"“a classification of performance indexes to evaluate processes is exposed, where a subset of these indexes are dedicated to KIPs”  "

Time (dimensão/medida),Usada como dimensão de desempenho e como medida genérica suportada pelo PPINOT,"1) “Different performance dimensions, time, cost or compliance for example, can be addressed…”  2) “it provides a set of general measures (time, count, state and data)”  3) “indexes are sub classified depending on their orientation |time, value, quantity and quality|”  "
Cost,Dimensão de desempenho citada como exemplo a ser medida,"“Different performance dimensions, time, cost or compliance for example, can be addressed…”  "
Compliance,Outra dimensão de desempenho citada como exemplo,"“Different performance dimensions, time, cost or compliance for example, can be addressed…”  "
Count,Medida genérica oferecida pelo PPINOT para cálculo de PPIs,"“it provides a set of general measures (time, count, state and data)”  "
State,Medida genérica para PPIs disponível no PPINOT,"“it provides a set of general measures (time, count, state and data)”  "
Data,Medida genérica (baseada em dados) suportada pelo PPINOT,"“it provides a set of general measures (time, count, state and data)”  "
Value,Orientação de índice de desempenho em trabalhos anteriores,"“indexes are sub classified depending on their orientation |time, value, quantity and quality|”  "
Quantity,Outra orientação de índice de desempenho,"“indexes are sub classified depending on their orientation |time, value, quantity and quality|”  "
Quality,Orientação de índice de desempenho voltada à qualidade,"“indexes are sub classified depending on their orientation |time, value, quantity and quality|”  "
Lead indicator,Indicador proativo usado na metodologia proposta para KIPs,“on the concepts of lead and lag indicators was proposed to provide process participants with actionable guidelines…”
Lag indicator,Indicador reativo/com resultado final usado em KIPs,“on the concepts of lead and lag indicators was proposed to provide process participants with actionable guidelines…”
Trianita et al. 2019 - A System Analysis and Design of Marketing Strategy for Improving Pineapple Agritourism.pdf
Metric,How it is used in the text,Evidence (exact excerpt from the paper)
Bond,ARM quality measure calculated to evaluate association rules,“1. Calculate the bond value”
Support,Frequency measure for itemsets/rules
column2: threshold fixed for rule selection,“2. Calculate the support value”
column3: “minimum support count 85%”

column1: Support count,Concrete support threshold adopted when selecting top rules,“The 10 best combinations of facilities in minimum support count 85%…”
Confidence,Reliability measure for association rules
column2: rules kept with > 90 % confidence,“3. Calculate the confidence value”
column3: “confidence more than 90%”

column1: Lift,Association-rule measure to judge independence gain,“4. Calculate the lift value”
Conviction,Association-rule measure to judge implication strength,“5. Calculate the conviction value”
Leverage,Association-rule measure for added probability above chance,“6. Calculate the leverage value”
Weight,RELIEF-F attribute weight used to score facility importance,“Attribute  Weight  Rank”
column2: “…we obtained the rank of facilities… Attribute Weight”

column1: Rank,Ordering produced from RELIEF-F weights to prioritise facilities,“Rank 1 is the most interesting facility and rank 13 is the least interesting facility”

KPI (Key Performance Indicator),High-level performance measure for marketing success (visitor target),“…determine the KPI of the marketing strategy… marketing KPI could be determined by measuring the achievement of the number of visitors from the target.”
Errors,Verification metric for BPMN model correctness,“BPMN resulted in 0 error(s)…”
Warnings,Additional verification metric for BPMN model correctness,"“BPMN resulted in 0 error(s), 0 warning(s).”"
De Sá Sousa et al. 2017 - Using process indicators to help the verification of goal fulfillment.pdf
indicador,uso_no_texto,evidencia_no_texto
Adequacy and level of plan attendance,KPI usado para verificar o objetivo 'Ensure efficiency in attending SPP demands'
column2: mede a adequação e o nível de profundidade do plano de atendimento definidos pelo gerente.,"“The indicator 'Adequacy and level of plan attendance' can be calculated based on the information of adequacy and level of depth, generated by the activity 'Plan demand implementation'.”"

column1: Time spent with planning,KPI que mede o tempo gasto com planejamento em relação ao esforço estimado
column2: base para o cálculo de TEMPL.,“The indicator 'Time spent with planning' can be calculated based on the information of the time spent with the activity 'Plan demand implementation' and on the information of the estimation effort generated in the activity 'Estimate demand.'”

column1: TEMPL,Métrica derivada do KPI 'Time spent with planning'
column2: fórmula (Planning Time / Estimated effort) * 100.,“Time spent with planning TEMPL = (Planning Time / Estimated effort) * 100”

column1: Compliance with effort estimates,KPI que verifica a conformidade entre esforço real e esforço estimado na execução da demanda.,"“The 'Compliance with effort estimates' can be calculated based on the information of the estimation effort... and real effort, after the 'Run demand tasks' activity.”"
EFFest-HH,Métrica derivada do KPI de esforço
column2: calcula o desvio percentual entre esforço real e estimado.,“Compliance with effort estimates EFFest-HH = (Real effort – Estimated effort) / (Estimated effort) * 100”

column1: Compliance with data estimates,KPI que avalia a conformidade entre datas planejadas e reais de execução da demanda.,“The 'Compliance with data estimates' can be calculated based on the information of estimated start date and estimated end date... and the information of the real start date and real end date...”
DATAest-T,Métrica derivada do KPI de datas
column2: percentual de desvio entre tempo real e estimado.,“DATAest-T = (REAL_TIME – ESTIMATED_TIME) / ESTIMATED_TIME * 100”

column1: ESTIMATED_TIME,Métrica auxiliar (duração planejada) utilizada no cálculo de DATAest-T.,“ESTIMATED_TIME = Estimated end date – Estimated start date”
REAL_TIME,Métrica auxiliar (duração real) utilizada no cálculo de DATAest-T.,“REAL_TIME = Real end date – Real start date”

Key Process Indicator (KPI),Termo genérico para medidores de desempenho associados a metas de processo.,“make use of key process indicator (KPI) in a process design method to annotate processes/activities with proper information.”

Process Performance Indicator (PPI),Termo genérico citado como base do metamodelo PPINOT para ligar indicadores a elementos de processo.,“PPINOT metamodel that is based on Process Performance Indicators (PPI) which are linked to process elements.”
KPI 1,Indicador de exemplo vinculado ao Goal 1 no estudo didático
column2: usado para demonstrar alinhamento completo.,“All necessary information to calculate KPI 1 is in the process.”

column1: KPI 2,Indicador de exemplo vinculado ao Goal 2 no estudo didático
column2: usado para demonstrar ausência de dados e desalinhamento.,“KPI 2 cannot be calculated because information 9 and 10 are not being produced by process 1.”

column1: Molka et al. 2015 - Diversity Guided Evolutionary Mining of Hierarchical Process Models.pdf
Medidor,Como é usado no texto,Evidência no texto
Trace fitness (recall),Avaliar quanto do comportamento do log é reproduzido pelo modelo
column2: usado como métrica‐chave de qualidade,“trace fitness (a measure of recall) …”

column1: Precision,Indicar quanto do comportamento permitido pelo modelo é suportado pelo log,“precision indicates how much of the behaviour exhibited by the model is supported by the event log.”
